name: Stylish 2BR East End Flat Next To Regents Canal
summary: Very central property located close to fabulous transport links, restaurants, Olympic Park, Canary Wharf, open green spaces and Shoreditch. The flat is located in a historical warehouse in a conservation area, with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and a lovely open kitchen, dining and living room. A perfect place for up to 4 people looking to stay on a quiet street, still just minutes to the centre of London and surrounding areas. Perfect for families and business travellers alike, with access to the City.
space: Only available this Summer, our Scandi flat has recently been refurbished to a high standard which will guarantee a happy and comfortable stay.  It is located on the 3rd floor which is accessible via the lift or stairs. The flat has direct and uninterrupted views across the park to Canary Wharf, which is a really nice London view.  This Art Deco Warehouse has a lot of historical significance. It remained standing during the Blitz in World War 2 and Princess Diana’s wedding veil was made in the building by the Emanuels. Original features can still be seen in the flat such as the windows and the exposed brick work.  The flat has a completely open outlook, which is rare in Central London, where most properties are overlooked by neighbours! CORRIDOR You walk through a safe security front door, to enter into an unfussy corridor, with large cupboard, where you could store coats and suitcases.  The slate floor has underfloor heating and this extends through to the kitchen.  All the rooms of t
description: Very central property located close to fabulous transport links, restaurants, Olympic Park, Canary Wharf, open green spaces and Shoreditch. The flat is located in a historical warehouse in a conservation area, with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and a lovely open kitchen, dining and living room. A perfect place for up to 4 people looking to stay on a quiet street, still just minutes to the centre of London and surrounding areas. Perfect for families and business travellers alike, with access to the City. This Art Deco Warehouse has a lot of historical significance. It remained standing during the Blitz in World War 2 and Princess Diana’s wedding veil was made in the bu
neighborhood_overview: This flat is located next to Mile End Park and the Regent's Canal. There are lovely places to go on a warm sunny day to relax, take a walk and have a picnic.  There are many coffee shops and restaurants in the area, as well as supermarkets.   Everything is within walking distance.   The area is steeped in history, and the Ragged School Museum, the original Barnardo School, is very close by and it was one of the 3 buildings still standing on this street after the Blitz  (including ours)!  The famous Whitechapel Gallery is a 7 minute journey away on District Line and exhibits contemporary art from around the world. There is also a cafe and bookshop here. The V&A Museum of Childhood is a 15 minute bus ride away. It’s the UK’s National Museum of Childhood, the largest institution of its kind in the world. Its mission is to hold in trust the nation’s childhood collections and to be an international leader in engaging audiences in the material culture and experiences of childhood. Canary Wha
notes: Please note: our standard check in times are between 3pm - 10pm. Check out is by 10am. If you wish to check in or check out outside these hours please let us know. This is subject to availability, but we are very flexible.
transit: This stylish flat is in a fabulous location in terms of being able to get around London quickly and easily.  Mile End: 8 minute walk ( Central line, District and Hammersmith and City lines) Oxford Circus is 15 mins away by tube, and Liverpool St station just 4 mins away, again by tube.  We used to work in Canary Wharf and Liverpool St, and we used to walk to work every day, so this is the perfect location for business travellers.  Queen Mary University is literally a 5 minute walk up the Canal. Central Line runs throughout the night every weekend, and it takes you to Holborn, British Museum, in 12 minutes.  Oxford Circus being 15 minutes away.  Hyde Park is a couple of stops further. District Line will take you to the famous Exhibition Road just off South Kensington in 29 minutes, or you could get off a stop earlier at Sloane Square for King's Road.  Or a quick walk up to Harrods.   A quick walk down the canal will take you to Limehouse DLR, from where you can get to London City Airpor
access: Guests have complete access to the flat. The cleaning and laundry is provided by a professional company, so it is done to a hotel standard.  We are on hand to provide any further assistance, as we live very locally.  Full details will be provided at check-in.
interaction: When I’m not there, you will be hosted by a professional hospitality company who I’ve engaged to look after you in my absence. They are on call to attend to your every need, as I would be.
house_rules: - Please note our house rules:  - -All guests are required to present their passport or drivers license in person as part of the check in process - -There must be at least one adult over the age of 21 in your group - -You may not have the majority of people in your group under the age of 21 (dependant children excepted)
host_about: We have lived in the East End for nearly two decades, but travel frequently to Scandinavia, where the Mrs is from as well as to Spain and Italy.  We tend to either stay with family and/or friends, as this is far more personal and sociable.  We have also enjoyed staying in Airbnb properties ourselves, especially since we have become parents.  The extra space, as well as access to a washing machine do come in handy.

summary: Spacious, luxury flat situated in great location overlooking the beautiful Victoria Park. Few minutes walk to thriving Hackney Wick and canalside bars/ bistros and Olympic Village. Also Hackney Overground- Stratford Underground/ Westfield Shopping Centre. Walking distance to Shoreditch, Bethnal Green, Broadway Market, Hoxton, Columbia Rd Flower Market, Museum of Childhood. Fantastic views, outdoor space, and a great ambiance of surrounding areas. Excellent for couples and families (with kids).

name: Bright double room in period house
summary: Our home is placed within 5 min walk to Crofton Park National Rail (serving central London in 18 minutes)also a 15min walk from Honour Oak, and a 5 min walk from Crofton Park high street, both of which have amazing, independent restaurants and great atmospheres. It is surrounded by green spaces (Hilly Fields, Blythe Hill, Ladywell Fields).  It is a very peaceful, pleasant and quiet area, but still within a quick train journey to central London - giving you the best of both worlds!
space: A modern double bedroom (with a modern ensuite attached) located in a period house - best of both worlds! Although only 18mins from central London, it is surrounded by parks and green spaces.

neighborhood_overview: Close proximity to central London (18 min train) but surrounded by green spaces and independent restaurants in an area that has a real 'village' feel to it.
notes: My wife will be away on business from end of October to January and so only Tom will be living in the house during that time.
transit: Our house is a 5min walk to Crofton Park train station (direct trains to Blackfriars (18 mins) and kings cross st Pancras (25min)), a 10 min walk to catford train station with excellent direct links to London Bridge, Waterloo, Charing Cross and Cannon Street, or a 15 min walk to Honour oak train station with direct trains to Victoria, as well as also the London Overground with direct trains to Canada Water and Shoreditch.  Drop a pin on a map of London and chances are you can reach it very easily from our house!
access: My wife and I live here also (with our border terrier puppy, Milo!) but your room is at the top of the house and so very private. You will have private use of the ensuite connected to your room, as well as access to the living room, dining area, kitchen and garden.  We have shared our home on Airbnb for over 5 years and consider ourselves great hosts who are sociable and personable!
interaction: We are happy to share a glass of wine over dinner - and consider the lounge and kitchen area communal spaces while you are here - so make yourself at home. We also have a border terrier puppy called Milo who is very well behaved and he will only interact with you to the extent you want! He doesn't have access to your room.  We have quite busy work schedules so you would also have privacy if you wish.
house_rules: Please just treat our house with respect!  And use tablemats please!!
host_about:
We are a friendly and personable married couple hosting in a lovely period house. I am a lawyer and Kate works in retail at luxury jewellery . 

We like cooking and travelling, and meeting new people and sharing experiences/stories. We are house proud, and as such will ensure that your room is always clean and tidy on your arrival, and will always be available (whether by phone or in person) if you have any questions whilst staying with us.

name: Stylish 2bed 2bath w/ Amazing Terrace in E.London
summary: Welcome to my home!!  My beautifully designed modern flat, floor to ceiling windows, on the 8th floor of this glass elegant building, with a massive south-facing terrace offering amazing views across London. Just a 2 minute walk to Haggerston Station &  within 10 minutes walk of Broadway Market and London Fields. 15 minutes to trendy Shoreditch & 20 mins to OXFORD CIRCUS & KING'S CROSS.  With the whole of London at your finger tips your bound to have an amazing stay!!
space: Welcome to my home and welcome to this amazing city! This is a beautiful 2 bedroom flat.  Let me walk you through it a little more... The apartment has a really spacious and colourful living room which has a real family feel to it. There is a comfy sofa, where you can it back, relax and turn on the flat screen TV. The TV has freeview. If cooking a gourmet meal at home is more your thing, then rest assured the kitchen will have everything you need in it such as all the basic condiments, and as an added extra we make sure that there is also always plenty of tea, coffee and sugar so that you can make yourself a traditional British cuppa in the morning! There are also all the mod-cons such as toaster and dishwasher that you might expect. We really want to ensure that you have a comfortable stay here in London! There are 2 bedrooms in the house. The master bedroom has a king sized bed, bedroom number two has a double. All the bedrooms are spacious with plenty of storage space for guests to

If cooking a gourmet meal at home is more your thing, then rest assured the kitchen will have everything you need in it such as all the basic condiments, and as an added extra we make sure t
neighborhood_overview: The flat overlooks Haggerston Square, which offers a few amenities: - Pharmacy opened 9-6 Mon-Fri across the road - Fish and Chips opened 7 days a week (until 9 pm) across the road - Organic shop opened 7 days a week (until 10pm) across the road - Police station - Off-license opened 6 days a week - Laundry and Launderette opened 6 days a week - Tesco opened 7/11 every day by the station, where there is a cash point too - lovely park in front of the building (Stonebridge gardens) - Church next to the park. Regarding cafes and restaurants you will have 2 pubs at about 2 minutes walking distance (The Fox, very young and busy, or the Duke of Wellington, typical old British pub) - loads of restaurants and take away within 5 minutes walking distance. Particularly, there is a strip of Vietnamese restaurants on Kingsland road, a few places in the railway arches, several pizza places on Broadway market and loads of restaurants in Dalston and alone the canal. My favourite ones are:  1. Bella Vit
notes: There is no aircon in the flat as is the case with 99.9% of the flats in London. We don't need it here as we only get about 3 weeks of warm weather here. For warm days, we can provide a fan Guests staying for more than 30 nights will be required to pay a further £80 for a mid-stay clean. CHECKOUT PROCEDURE: LEAVE KEYS IN EXTERNAL MAILBOX
transit: Overground is a stone thrown away. Two stops from popular Shoreditch and one from Dalston. Three stops and you are either at Islington (Victoria Line), or Whitechapel (District and Circle line). The overground also connect to the DLR and the Jubilee Line. If you prefer, you can take the main buses on Kindgsland Road (149 to London Bridge, 242 to St Paul, 243 to Waterloo, 67 to Aldgate). Please note the Overground will be part of the night tube from December 2017 and some 149 works the whole night. Hackney is famous for being a trendy and bustling area of London with loads of great restaurants and exciting things to do. Here are some suggestions! The Rosemary Branch is an award-winning pub that was once a Victorian music hall and is now a local favourite, just across the road from the apartment. As well as delicious food there is a small theatre which is worth checking out. Another popular pub is the De Beauvoir Arms, located on the border of Islington and Hackney. Head here for good fo
access: The apartment is your own.  Cleaned professionally with fresh luxury linens, it's prepared for each new visitor.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away. They are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to give you a warm welcome! Hostmaker will look after you. If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.
house_rules: - Please no high heels on the wooden floor or shoes on the carpet in the bedroom. - Please just be respectful of the neighbours, and do let us know if they are not respectful of you (if there is any noise, etc). - Please, if the plants on the patio look dry, could you water them? there is a hose outside. Thanks! - Guests must present ID during check-in - Nobody under 25 years old - Please take care of my home!

name: Splendid and comfortable modern flat in Battersea
summary: My flat has been recently done. It has an open plan with a really comfortable and cool breakfast bar.  All appliances are state of the art. You can get to Central London in about 25 by an easy bus ride or tube. Two comfortable double bedrooms with original features but in the comfort of a new place.
space: It's comfortable and welcoming, everyone who has stayed or visited loves it.   The flat is superbly located for easy access to Central London, Battersea Power Station and Clapham.  It's literally on Wandsworth Road with its buzzing nature and conveniences.  All appliances are state of the art, including: - Double Oven (Grill and fan) NEFF - Microwave/Grill NEFF - Dishwasher - Toaster - Kettle and Cafetiere - Crokery and Cutlery - Garden with Cctv for your security and safety - Double glazed windows and French doors to the garden The bathroom has a rain-forest head shower and hand shower; it also includes a sensor activated heated mirror (with lighting and plug for shaving machine or electric toothbrush).

notes: Wifi included and there's a Sonos you get to use :)
transit: Very convenient public transport. Really well connected.  Nearest stations are Vauxhall and Stockwell.  Buses 77/87 and P5 leave you outside the property.
access: Usual things, on request also controlled zone parking and washing room (you need to cover the cost of permit and detergent).
interaction: As much as required by email or text.
house_rules: The House Rules: I expect guests to behave with politeness and consideration towards the host and the flat.  I expect guests to be honest and upfront about the purpose of their visit and the number of people staying in the property. Should things change before arrival, I ask my guests to communicate these promptly and without delay. Any misleading statements would result in an immediate cancellation of the booking without notice. For couples it is assumed that only one bedroom is going to be used given financial and environmental costs of laundry.  Any extra people staying from those disclosed in the booking will have to pay the additional charge. TOILET IN THE BATHROOM The one next to the walking shower is a macerator toilet.  Only flush small portions of toilet paper.  ANYTHING ELSE, such as tampons, sanitary towels, female pads, blades, caps, condoms, etc WILL BLOCK THE TOILET. SONOS You are welcome to use the sonos speaker on the kitchen counter.  To use it, please download the son
host_about: I love travelling and meeting new places and new cultures whilst also going back to those I enjoying most.

name: Double Room (Penthouse Apt with Garden Balcony)
summary: Clean, cosy and spacious room in a quiet neighbourhood - just a short distance from the centre of London. Your light & spacious room comes with a King Size Bed, a large double wardrobe & drawers, a smart TV, as well as blackout blinds, which will hopefully combine to give you a restful night's sleep in preparation for the day ahead! Bed linen, towels & toiletries will be supplied for the duration of your stay and breakfast will be available each morning.
space: The apartment has superfast WiFi Broadband with speeds up to 100 Mb and includes unlimited uploads/downloads. The kitchen is equipped with kettle, toaster, espresso machine, microwave, washing machine, tumble dryer, oven and hob. The bathroom is sleek and modern with bath, a rainfall/waterfall shower and a mist proof mirror. Towels, shampoo, shower gel, toilet paper are provided at no extra cost.

neighborhood_overview: Bow is unique in some respects being a quiet residential retreat from the hustle and bustle of London, yet is on the doorstep of the lively and vibrant areas of Stratford, Canary Wharf/Docklands and Bricklane/Shoreditch.
notes: PLEASE note that I have two cats, they are very well-behaved and will not bother you - unless you want them to play with you, in which case they'll be very happy! They are not log haired cats and do not shed, but if you have an allergy to cat hair - then this may not be the place for you. Check-in is from 6 PM on weekdays due to work commitments, but I am fully flexible at weekends.
transit: The apartment is well situated and ideal for business and leisure travellers alike with great transport links. There are two Docklands Light Railway (DLR) stations and two District Line stations approximately 5 minutes walk away, and Mile End is a 10 to 15 minute walk away, providing access to the Central Line which takes you into the centre of London inc. Liverpool Street, St Paul's and Oxford Circus, and other interchange locations. There is also access to a very extensive bus network within 5 minutes walk.
access: As a welcomed guest, you will have full access to your bedroom, the bathroom, the kitchen, the living & dining room, and also the outdoor garden balcony.  You are welcome to use the washing machine/tumble dryer and detergent & fabric softener are provided free.
interaction: My interaction with you will be on your terms - if you fancy just being left alone to come and go as you please, then that is perfectly fine - but if you would like a cup of tea/coffee and a chat about travel, London life or anything else that takes your fancy I'm only too happy to oblige.

name: Studio Flat near Hyde Park, Bayswater, Leinster B3
summary: This newly renovated studio flat is located in a small building, and includes all the basic needs for someone to have a great stay.   It is situated in the heart of London, Bayswater area, very close to Bayswater Station (3 minutes walk), Hyde Park (3 minutes walk) and the vibrant shops and coffee houses of Queensway (5 minutes walk) and Notting Hill Gate (10 minutes walk). It is close to the famous Kensington Palace and the beautiful Queensway High Street.
space: This newly renovated small size apartment is located on the basement floor of a building that has no elevator, so guests would need to take 13 steps down to get to the apartment. This apartment comes with a small open-plan kitchen that contains an electric cooker, fridge, freezer, and microwave. It also has a small folded dining table and a medium sized 32" TV. It comes with a double bed and a small sized wardrobe. The newly renovated bathroom contains a shower-room, towels, and other basic needs, such as shampoo. Since this flat is located on the basement floor, there is very little natural light coming in. However, there is an air-conditioning system to keep the flat cool in summer, and a wall mounted electric heater to keep the flat warm during winter days.

name: A Flat With Character in Portobello
summary: We recently reimagined this ground floor apartment situated off Tavistock gardens within sight of Portobello Market and walking distance to Hyde Park and Holland Park. Our flat feature a conservatory leading to a small private garden with lounge seating, hammock and awning. All of exciting, colourful Portobello on your doorstep, the beating heart of London, Notting Hill.
space: The bedroom, sitting and conservatory areas have been redecorated with vintage furniture gathered for years from around the world which helped us make this place very unique. We also like to express our passion and art for design through our handmade furnitures and home accessories. The bathroom is quirky and in its choice of fittings, tiles and mirror, artistic. The garden also features our artworks including a barbecue sculpted by a former resident.

host_about:
I am an artist and an interior designer. I love my work, love to travel, good music, my friends and family, and enjoying to share my house with them and lovely guests.
I'm also happy to meet people from around the globe and make new friends.

We offer a large, bright and beautiful self contained 4 double bedroom floor with 2 luxury bathrooms, 2 washing machines and fully equipped kitchen. Uniquely designed and newly decorated with all natural materials such as wood, stone, gorgeous ceramic tiles and original art works. The rooms are functioning not only as bedrooms but also have study and dining capabilities. All of them are looking over charming gardens and one of the gardens is directly accessible. The largest room has a balcony and could be easily transformed from a bedroom/studio into a practical office or reception room as the double bed easily folds into a sofa. We live and work on the second floor so we can be handy if our guests need some help with more or less anything. The second floor is also a showroom of my artworks, it's a truly impressive space and is available for visits by appointment. We are linked with easy and fast transport to central London. 

Minimum term - 3 days

name: LOWER GROUND FLOOR FLAT / FASHIONABLE VIBRANT AREA
summary: Vibrant fashionable central location. Close to great restaurants, pubs, local shops and Green spaces. 10 minutes walk hip and happening Dalston, or 15 minutes to high end Islington. fantastic transport links all over London, from Southbank (30 minutes) to the West end (30 minutes) and 15 minutes to Kings Cross for Eurostar to France. You’ll love my place because of the cosiness and the location. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and furry friends (pets).
space: This is a lovely little flat on the lower ground floor which means that despite being on a vibrant road full of shops and restaurants it has a sense of peace and calm once inside. the bedroom is at the back and there is a small enclosed patio area (not pictured) where meals can be eaten in the Summer months. the flat has wooden floors throughout and its own private entrance with space under the outside steps for a bicycle. The flat is bright and airy and the kitchen forms part of the main living area with a small breakfast bar that acts as a room division. There is a television in the main living area and wifi throughout. The kitchen is fully equipped and there is a gas hob and an electric oven, fridge, washing machine and microwave, all crockery, cutlery, pots and pans are available for you.

The flat is bright and airy and the kitchen forms part of the main living area
neighborhood_overview: This is a fabulous neighbourhood and has been my home for 14 years, during which time there has been a lot of change, all for the better. The immediate vicinity of Newington Green is awash with good eateries, Belle Epoque, The Newington Table, the hotly anticipated Perilla due to open at the start of November, Tarangalin for Tapas, The Leconfield & The Lady Mildmay for a great Sunday Roast and several really superb turkish restaurants who cook on the open grill, the one directly opposite the house is a family favourite. We also have several good pubs, the aforementioned Sunday Roast venues are equally good for a glass of wine or a pint, as are The Cellars and The Winnicott. Newington Green is steeped in history, the area became home of English Dissenters during the 17th century including Daniel Defoe. Arguably the most important resident of the Green was the early feminist Mary Wollstonecraft who moved her fledgling school for girls from Islington to Newington Green.  Stoke Newington i
transit: The property is equidistance to Angel Islington underground on the Northern line and Manor House on the Piccadilly line you would hop on a bus 5 minutes to get to either of these stations. Canonbury is the closest station and is a 5 minute walk away, from here you can get a train directly to Westfield shopping centre in Stratford, also home to the Olympic Park and the Orb, well worth a visit. there are so many buses that run through Newington Green: 73 goes past Kings Cross where you can get the Eurostar to France, then on to the west end for shopping and theatres then all the way to Victoria. The 341 goes to the Southbank Waterloo , it stops right outside the London Eye 141 to London Bridge and Borough Market a foodie haven. 476 to Euston Everything is literally on your doorstep all accessible in less that 40 minutes door to door. The area is incredibly safe, and because the house is on a main road with lots of shops and restaurants open late it is always busy even if you are coming h
access: You will have full sole access to the space at all times.
interaction: I live in the flat upstairs so will be available should you need me, however I will not be hovering around or invading your space at any time. I use Air BnB a lot myself for business and leisure, and I have tried to create the type of space that I like to stay in when I travel.
house_rules: - You can smoke outside in the small yard area. Please leave the space as you found it
host_about: Own business, full time Mum.

name: Hyde Park, Queensway Amazing Location 2 Bed WiFi
summary: This spacious 2 Bedroom apartment is on buzzing Queensway, right across from Bayswater station and just a short distance from Hyde Park as well as trendy Notting Hill.  Queensway station for the short ride to Marble Arch and Oxford Street is 2 minutes away.  Paddington station for the Heathrow Express and the Elizabeth Line is 10 minutes’ walk or 1 stop from Bayswater. There is garage car parking (paid) moments from your apartment.  This lively area has a huge range of restaurants, coffee shops.
space: Your good sized 2 Bedroom apartment has just (April 2018) been refreshed by our interior designer with a number of great homely touches to ensure that your London apartment feels like a home from home.  Located on the 1st floor (1 flight of stairs) on lively Queensway, Bayswater, just across from Bayswater Station this is an amazing location with so much of central London in easy walking distance.  The Princess Diana Memorial Fountain and the rest of Hyde Park are just 3 minutes’ walk from your apartment, straight up Queensway.  Enjoy a stroll through the park to the Serpentine where you can go paddle boating or simply enjoy a drink overlooking this beautiful spot. Trendy Notting Hill is a similar distance with Portobello Market – a great draw for visitors – just 10 minutes’ walk from your apartment.  Marble Arch, at the beginning of Oxford Street – central London’s busiest and best-known shopping street – is 15 minutes’ walk or a short ride on the tube from Queensway station, itself j
description: This spacious 2 Bedroom apartment is on buzzing Queensway, right across from Bayswater station and just a short distance from Hyde Park as well as trendy Notting Hill.  Queensway station for the short ride to Marble Arch and Oxford Street is 2 minutes away.  Paddington station for the Heathrow Express and the Elizabeth Line is 10 minutes’ walk or 1 stop from Bayswater. There is garage car parking (paid) moments from your apartment.  This lively area has a huge range of restaurants, coffee shops. Your good sized 2 Bedroom apartment has just (April 2018) been refreshed by our interior designer with a number of great homely touches to ensure that your London apartment feels like a home from home.  Located on the 1st floor (1 flight of stairs) on lively Queensway, Bayswater, just across from Bayswater Station this is an amazing location with so much of central London in easy walking distance.  The Princess Diana Memorial Fountain and the rest of Hyde Park are just 3 minutes’ walk from your
neighborhood_overview: Queensway, and Bayswater generally, is a very lively area of central London well-known to many tourists because of the high number of hotels in the immediate area, as well as in adjoining areas such as Notting Hill and Paddington.  Once strong residential areas, many of the period buildings have been converted to small hotels and apartments, whilst many larger hotels have been built in their place.  This has the benefit of meaning that the area is well geared up to looking after visitors to London whatever their reason for being here. Having so many shops, restaurants and coffee shops close by, makes this an appealing location in any event but having Hyde Park and Notting Hill, including Portobello Market, on your doorstep with easy travel from the 2 tubes stations in Queensway to marble Arch and along the full length of Oxford Street makes the area especially appealing.
notes: Check-In is from 2.00 p.m. Check Out is up to 11.00 a.m. We provide a full Meet and Greet Service - a member of the team will meet you on arrival at your apartment.  after you make your reservation, we will liaise with you over your arrival time and to arrange an airport transfer quotation for you, if needed. Please note that there is a flat Late Check In Fee of GBP 50.00 payable on arrival, if you  are arriving after 9.00 p.m. A security deposit of GBP 500.00 is secured by AirBnB and will only be claimed against if there are any damages in the apartment during your stay.
transit: Bayswater tube station (Circle and District Lines) is literally just across the road from your apartment and provides direct routes to Paddington, Baker Street and much more in one direction and to Notting Hill and High Street Kensington, South Kensington and on to Westminster and Tower Hill in the other direction. Queensway tube station (Central Line) is 2 minutes’ walk from your apartment at the top of Queensway takes you to Notting Hill in one direction and to Marble Arch and then a number of stops along Oxford Street and through to the City of London (for St. Paul’s Cathedral) in the other. Paddington Station is 10 minutes’ walk from your apartment (or 1 stop on the tube from Bayswater) for the Heathrow Express, trains to Oxford and the west of England and for the new Elizabeth Line, opening in late 2018, which will also provide direct connection to Heathrow in the west and to stops in Oxford Street and along to Canary Wharf and Stratford in the east.
access: Everything you need for your stay is provided: - Spacious Lounge - Large Flat screen TV in the Lounge - Freeview channels - Free WiFi and cable Internet - Quality linen and duvet covers - Ample drawer space - Fully equipped kitchen with:     - Oven     - 4-ring gas Hob     - Microwave     - Large fridge/freezer     - Toaster     - Kettle     - Washing machine     - Dishwasher     - Cutlery     - Crockery     - Glasses     - Cooking Utensils     - Saucepans - Modern bathroom with shower - Iron and Ironing Board Do you need a transfer from the airport?  Just let us know in good time and we will arrange it for you (cost, depending on airport and type of vehicle needed).
interaction: London Lifestyle Apartments take pride in ensuring that your whole experience matches the luxury of your apartment and the importance your visit to London has to you.  So, we will liaise closely with you very shortly after receiving your reservation to  arrange a transfer from the airport (if you need it) and ensure that a member of our team is on hand to welcome you to your apartment, show you around and answer any question you may have, as well as to share any tips on how to get the best out of your stay in London.  Once we have checked you in, you will have a 24 hour contact for any concerns you may have, which we will respond to promptly. We want you to think of your apartment as your London 'home from home' and for you to keep coming back and recommending us to your friends and family.  So, we will pull out all the stops to make sure that your stay in London is as special as we can make it.
house_rules: - On check in, we require the photo ID of the person who paid for the reservation and sight of the card used for the stay.  If this person is not a guest, their photo ID must be e-mailed to us ahead of arrival and the photo ID of the lead guest must also be shown. - Your apartment is shared with other residents and guests.  Please be very considerate of them. - No Parties permitted - The whole building is strictly Non-Smoking - No pets allowed under any circumstances - Refuse may not be placed outside the apartment except on specified collection days
host_about: My whole life has been built around travel, so it's a real pleasure to be able to share some of those opportunities with you.  I have had a long career in hotels and serviced apartments in the UK but now I just enjoy what I have always loved: travel.  Favourite destinations include Koh Samui, Thailand; Palawan, Philippines; Luang Prabang, Laos; Dambulla, Sri Lanka and many, many more.  My favourite food choices pretty much reflect where I love to go.  As I am not always in London, I have some friends from the industry who look after my guests and my properties for me.  Coming from the hospitality industry, quality of service is very, very important - especially with my luxury apartments - so we will take excellent care of you from the moment you first come into contact with us to the moment you leave London.

name: Cosy Room w/ Shared Kitchen in Bethnal Green!
summary: Based in high quality student accommodation, our property is located in the heart of Bethnal Green, known for its vibrant culture, diverse cuisine and bustling bars!  You'll benefit from a range of common areas, including a games room (with ping pong & pool), TV area and an incredible roof terrace. Just 3 minutes from Bethnal Green Station, you'll have access to Central London in moments.  Nearby, theres plenty of green space, with both Bethnal Green Gardens & Museum Gardens seconds away!
space: What To Expect: * Beautiful 12 sqm flat with modern furnishings and dedicated workspace * Ensuite bathroom * Spacious communal kitchen space, fully equipped with appliances and utensils (Kitchen spaces may vary) * Amazing communal areas: Common Room (with TV, ping pong, pool) work area and ample rooftop space. * A pay-to-use laundry room * 1 small double bed with hotel standard bedding * A 24 hour reception desk will check you in on arrival  * The apartment will be professionally cleaned before you arrive * An amazing location, within walking distance of Victoria Park! * Minutes from Bethnal Green Underground Station, served by the Central line. From here it’s only:   -22 mins to Notting Hill Gate  -5 mins to Westfield Shopping Centre, Stratford   -13 mins to Oxford Circus

neighborhood_overview: Bethnal Green is a true East End gem. While it has developed considerably in recent years, it still retains an authentic East End feel. You're sure to feel right at home here, with a plethora of trendy bars, high street shops and restaurants, along with nearby Shoreditch, Columbia Road Flower Market and the green open spaces of Victoria Park. Its no wonder people love Bethnal Green so much!
notes: • Do you have free WiFi? Yes we have super fast reliable WiFi ! We will give you WiFi instructions when you check in. • Do you provide linen and towels? Yes all fresh, pressed bed linen and double size towels are provided.  • Is there a private bathroom? You will have access to a private en suite bathroom.  • Are children able to stay at the property? No, unfortunately we are not able to accommodate anyone under 18 at this property!  • Is there washing and drying facilities? There is a paid laundry room in the building, once you download the Circuit app on your phone you can pay via card/ (Hidden by Airbnb) .  • Is smoking allowed? Strictly NO smoking in the apartments and all ancillary terraces and/or common parts. If you want to smoke, you must completely leave the building. You will automatically forfeit your deposit if you are found smoking on the premises.  • Is there parking? Unfortunately, there is no parking available for this apartment. • Please note we will check the passport
transit: Bethnal Green Underground Station provides  services on the Central Line. From here its only: -13 mins to Oxford Circus  -22 mins to Notting Hill Gate  -5 mins to Westfield Shopping Centre, Stratford  Nearby, Cambridge Heath Station provides services on the Overground. However, if you prefer the scenic route, theres a number of bus routes that can get you in and around central London!
access: You will enjoy your own private room with an en suite bathroom. However, you'll also have access to a shared kitchen within your apartment block and the rest of the communal areas in the building (Common Room, Laundry Room, Outdoor Rooftop Area).
interaction: There is a reception area that can help you with anything you need!

name: Trendy London 2bed/2bath 1mins to tube&supermarket
summary: Welcome to my home! My modern 2 bedroom apartment, in South London, near Canary Wharf and London Bridge, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re under a minute’s walk away from the nearest tube station which is Canada Water. The Jubilee line here takes you to Bond Street, Baker Street, Mayfair, London Bridge & Canary Wharf within 5-15 minutes!  You can take in the spectacular views of the city from the balcony & the location is unbeatable!
space: My stylish 2 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Canada Water and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the sofa, hang out, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. Head out onto the sheltered balcony to enjoy the views of the city. If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the stylish, open-plan kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! The master bedroom has a super comfortable UK King-sized bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you need for a good night’s sleep? You don’t have to live out of your suitcase; plenty of storage room means you can get unpacking and start feeling at home right away. The secon

It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. Head out onto the sheltered balcony to enjoy the views of t
neighborhood_overview: Canada Water is a freshwater lake and wildlife refuge in Rotherhithe in the Docklands, South East London. It is an exciting part of London with a friendly feel to it and plenty to explore nearby.  If you’re interested in the history of the area, it might be worth trying one of Paul Talling’s Grand Surrey Canal walking tours; they track the long lost waterway through Surrey Quays. These sell out in advance so definitely book ahead of time.  The Captain Kidd is a terrific pub overlooking the Thames - a great place to stop for a drink. Or go for a wander in Southwark Park where they also have a cafe and a gallery. The Narrow restaurant is a local favourite. It is in Limehouse and has a terrace that looks out over the River Thames. Great food and a lovely atmosphere. To experience food from all over the world, head to Maltby Street Market (open on weekends) where you can spend hours getting full from various food trucks. Boisdale in nearby Canary Wharf is a restaurant bar where you can enj
notes: The normal check in time is 3pm - 6pm. If you would like to check in early, please speak to me and I will try my best to fit your time. For the late check in, please speak to me before booking the apartment as extra charge might be required.
transit: You are just a minute away from Canada Water station where you'll have access to both the Overground and the Underground. Canada Water is on the Jubilee Line, so you can get to Westminster in 17 minutes, London Bridge in 9 and  Waterloo in just 8 minutes! You are so well-connected here; exploring London will be easy.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property.
interaction: Please get in touch with me via Airbnb messenger

name: Spacious 2BR Flat w/Balcony and Hammock
summary: My stylish and colorful two-bedrooms apartment is located the vibrant South-East London and is perfect for four guests. It is a two-minute walk from Warwick Gardens and near to all the best bits of Peckham. The property is fully equipped with all the amenities you may need to ensure you a perfect stay, and it boast a lovely balcony with hammock and plants. For quick and easy transit around London, the trains at Peckham Rye Station are the best way to go, only 9 minute walk from the flat.
space: If you are looking for an authentic London experience, my bright and stylish 2-bedroom flat is just perfect for you. You will stay in a tasteful and comfortable apartment with all the amenities you might need to ensure you enjoy a perfect stay. Located in the heart of South-East London, my flat provides complete amenities and is surrounded by the wide assortment of food & retail establishments of the popular Rye Lane in Peckham.  In the large open plan kitchen/living room you will find a huge corner sofa where you can relax after a long day outside, and watch some TV, Netflix and Amazon Prime. The lounge is also decorated with loads of beautiful plants and books, just pick one from the huge wall book shelves! The modern kitchen is fully equipped with oven, hob, microwave, washing machine, fridge with freezer compartment, kettle and toaster. The two bedrooms have a comy double bed to ensure you a good night sleep, and the bathroom includes a bathtub with shower above. Last but not least

In the large open plan kitchen/living room you will find a huge corner so
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in the heart of Peckham, and will be an ideal home away from home for your trip to London. Nearby attractions include Imperial War Museum and Horniman Museum & Gardens, as well as green spaces like Peckham Rye Park, and Ruskin Park. Attractions like the London Eye, Sea Life London Aquarium, Big Ben, and the Museum of London are also very easily accessible via tube or bus. Bellenden Road, Peckham Rye and Choumert Road have plenty of restaurants to choose from, and supermarkets, delis and bakeries are just around the corner.
notes: Check-in time is after 3pm and check-out time is before 11am.  Please note that you will be charged £100 for lost keys, so please be careful with them.
transit: You can take trains from Peckham Rye Station (Overground line-Orange), only 9 minutes on foot from the flat. Otherwise, you can take one of the many well-connected bus routes serving the area, many of which run 24-hours.
access: Guests will have access to the entire apartment.
interaction: My property management team and I will be available 24/7 via Airbnb, email, or phone to provide any assistance you may need.
house_rules: - No parties please - No extra guests - Please respect the neighbours and keep the noise down - No noise after 10pm  - Indoor shoes/slippers preferred - Treat the flat as if it were your own - When leaving the property please make sure you lock the door and all the windows

name: Quiet and comfortable double bedroom with ensuite
summary: Cheerful, bright, cosy and quiet room on the top floor of a grand Victorian house, overlooking the garden.  Very comfortable double bed, Victorian desk, chair, carpeting, underfloor heating, private ensuite bathroom. Would suit a solo traveller or a couple visiting relatives in the area or wanting to explore the sites of London or Crouch End itself. Dedicated kitchen for use only by Airbnb guests, so you can roll out of bed, throw on a dressing gown and make yourself a cup of tea/coffee!
space: This is one of three different rooms we have just specially converted for Airbnb in our newly renovated grand Victorian house in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End.  The room is cosy and bright and newly furnished with a very comfortable double bed and a private ensuite bathroom.  You will love it because it has all been architect-designed with high ceilings, views to the garden and great access to Crouch End and Finsbury Park. There is underfloor heating throughout the house, and your bathroom has heated mirrors to avoid misting up, as well as a heated towel rail and Hansgrohe shower. We have been very successfully hosting Airbnb guests in our former house over the last year - please see reviews by clicking on me as the host!
description: Cheerful, bright, cosy and quiet room on the top floor of a grand Victorian house, overlooking the garden.  Very comfortable double bed, Victorian desk, chair, carpeting, underfloor heating, private ensuite bathroom. Would suit a solo traveller or a couple visiting relatives in the area or wanting to explore the sites of London or Crouch End itself. Dedicated kitchen for use only by Airbnb guests, so you can roll out of bed, throw on a dressing gown and make yourself a cup of tea/coffee! This is one of three different rooms we have just specially converted for Airbnb in our newly renovated grand Victorian house in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End.  The room is cosy and bright and newly furnished with a very comfortable double bed and a private ensuite bathroom.  You will love it because it has all been architect-designed with high ceilings, views to the garden and great access to Crouch End and Finsbury Park. There is underfloor heating throughout the house, and your bathroom has he
neighborhood_overview: Crouch End is a wonderful mix of urban and rural London. Crouch End is very much connected to London, but has the feel of a village.  We are one minute from a fabulous running/walking route, the Parkland Walk for those feeling the need for some exercise! It may also be possible to arrange trial memberships to one of the local gyms while you are here.  There are many fabulous independent cafes, bars and restaurants both in Crouch End, and increasingly in Stroud Green (nearer Finsbury Park).
notes: Crouch End is a great location, only 8 minutes from Finsbury Park station. Crouch End is very much connected to London, but is also a haven for independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.
transit: Our house is 8 minutes by bus from Finsbury Park station (Victoria and Picadilly lines, plus overground trains).  There are also buses to Archway and Kings Cross directly from Crouch End, and a train line from Crouch Hill which connects to the Overground line at Highbury & Islington.
access: You have a private room and bathroom, and shared use of a dedicated Airbnb kitchen on the same floor, so you can pop out in the morning in your dressing grown to make your coffee/tea, have your breakfast, or even cook a meal if you're so inclined! We provide everything you need for breakfast, as well as essential cooking and washing supplies.
interaction: We live on a separate floor in the house with a separate kitchen, so you will have plenty of privacy and independence. I am more than happy to provide whatever support or advice you need to make sure you enjoy your stay in London! I also operate a pop-up restaurant downstairs once a month, so you can book to attend that if your dates coincide.
house_rules: You will be staying as guests in our home, and we ask that you are tidy, considerate and are sensitive to the others who live or are staying in the house.  Therefore please no noise after 11:00, and please don't disturb others who may be sleeping. We operate three Airbnb rooms which all share the same kitchen. We ask that you use the kitchen and common areas respectively, keeping everything clean and tidy, and that you are considerate about noise levels when other guests are sleeping.   Please note that we have a strictly enforced no smoking policy and smoking is not allowed anywhere on the premises.  Sorry for the inconvenience, but we've had problems with guests in the past. Thanks!
host_about: I am a self-employed marketing professional whose motto is Carpe Diem! I love travelling, hiking, entertaining, cooking and helping to build iconic brands. I love independence and challenges, so these guide my holiday choices. I love meeting new people which is one of the reasons for becoming and Airbnb host!

name: Quiet , garden flat , Islington

neighborhood_overview: Things to Do: Details of some local and famous London attractions below to get there from Dongola Rd. Take a beautiful walk up or down Regents Canal (you can also cycle it as well). As you come out of the front door, turn right and keep walking past the restored black legs of the old gas works for 100M, you will then come to the canal. Walk over the bridge to the right and go down the stone steps on the other side. If you then go under the bridge you will be walking south to the Thames (you will see the ‘skyscrapers’ of Canary Wharf), or north to Victoria Park.  South: This is a 15 minute walk until you come to Limehouse Basin. There you will see many boats moored up and also you can sample brunch in two celebrity owned venues (The Narrow – Gordon Ramsey, or The Grapes – Sir Ian Mckellen). There are 11,000 bikes to hire in London and Dongola Rd has four docking stations just 3 mins walk away Harford St, Rhodeswell Rd, Aston St & White Horse Lane.
notes: While this is a quite a large place, it is definitely not suitable for parties (other than dinner parties) and the neighbours either side of the apartment are both friends of mine, so I would not want them to be disturbed unnecessarily. Also, the courtyard is regularly patrolled by security staff, so any noisy parties will be stopped in their tracks immediately. Safety: There is a first Aid kit in the apartment (located in the kitchen bottom drawer under the hob). For any emergency services call 999 when urgent. Call 111 for non-urgent calls. Nearest Supermarkets: Sainsbury’s: Excellent small supermarket and good range of fresh food – at the end of Harford St on the corner of Mile End Rd – ATM here as well (5 mins).Cooperative: Excellent small supermarket next to Stepney Green station on Mile End Rd . Things to note for smokers: Please do not smoke inside the property however ashtrays are provided on the table on the patio please use those to dispose of any cigarette butts. There are f
access: You will have complete privacy through doing self check-in. You will be sent the access code to key safe at the property via SMS & Email before your arrival. interaction: I live very near to the property so can be available anytime if their are any problems. If i am not available, I can arrange for a friend or relative to assist.
host_about: Hi - Craig here - I have done lots of travelling and this is why i think AirBnB is brilliant.  I  really want you guys to have a great time in my place and as I'm a bit of a clean freak, then I hope you think my apartment brings all the best things of a 5* hotel and all the best things of hanging out in a really cool apartment.  Any problems please call me on my mobile that I will provide with every booking

name: Victorian house/gorgeous garden, C. London 25 min
summary: Bright and beautiful restored Victorian house decorated in warm Mediterranean colours; friendly Spanish, Irish, English,German and American household.
space: Lovingly restored house, 132 years old, original fireplaces and ceiling roses. Extensive library, friendly housemates, 3 cats (two of them stay mostly in housemate's room). Recently landscaped stunning garden-you can hear Big Ben chiming at night. A short bus ride to Parliament, Westminster Abbey, the National Gallery, London Eye and the National Theatre/Royal Festival Hall/British Film Institute complex (Southbank Centre). Camberwell, where we are located, is on the verge of gentrification, so still retains a neighbourhood feel without too many chain stores/franchises. Greek, Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Indian, Turkish, Italian, Lebanese, Modern British cuisine and 3 highly recommended gastro/craft beer pubs all within walking distance. Gym within 3 minutes, pool within 7.
description: Bright and beautiful restored Victorian house decorated in warm Mediterranean colours; friendly Spanish, Irish, English,German and American household. Lovingly restored house, 132 years old, original fireplaces and ceiling roses. Extensive library, friendly housemates, 3 cats (two of them stay mostly in housemate's room). Gym within 3 minutes, pool within 7. Garden, living room/library, kitchen Happy to socialise with guests
neighborhood_overview: Many pubs and restaurants as described above.  Beautiful park, Myatt's Fields, just a block away.
notes: I am a dog lover, and my beloved Jack Russell Ria died in the summer of 2014. I was devastated but 6 months later a skinny very young pregnant cat turned up outside a neighbour's garden door on a dark and rainy January night. Her name is Lucy and she has gone a long way to filling the hole in my heart. All the kittens went to good homes; however there are two other cats which belong to housemate David but largely remain in his room (Precious occasionally ventures out). If cats give you the creeps probably not a good match.
transit: Many buses within 5 minute walk which go to Parliament Square, Piccadilly, Oxford Street, St Paul's/the City. A 12 minute walk to Oval on the Northern  Line.  Denmark Hill overground rail also 12 minutes away. Parking restrictions Monday-Friday 8-630, free at weekends.
access: Garden, living room/library, kitchen
interaction: Happy to socialise with guests and enjoy a drink in the garden-or leave you alone if you prefer! Available to answer questions too!
house_rules: - Be nice to LucyCat
host_about: Californian transplant who has been in Britain for 30 years.  I love history and literature and am knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Scotland, Ireland and Wales as well as London!  Our home is a warm and happy one (a kind of British version of Tales of the City).  Once you stay here you will always cherish your memory of your visit as we have an eclectic and interesting circle of creative, eccentric and diverse friends!  I often describe myself as a 'refugee from Baywatch'.  This is about as different from Southern California as you can get, but i do miss the weather!  My life motto: You begin  to die the day you become silent about the things that matter. (MLK)

neighborhood_overview: West Kensington straddles the border between the boroughs of Hammersmith & Fulham and Kensington & Chelsea and it is primarily a residential area consisting mainly of Victorian terraced houses. It is best known as home to the Olympia Exhibition Centre and the Queen's Club.  The Hammersmith Apollo theatre and Westfield shopping mall London are nearby. Pubs & Restaurants suggested are: -Casa Bardotti  -Famous 3 Kings In the end, if you are meat lovers is highly recommended to visit HG Walter (51 Palliser Rd) the best local Butcher, the short 5 minutes walk it is worth it!
notes: LUGGAGE DROP We have the option to drop luggage from 10:00am which will be stored in our office on site. You would then need to collect this by 6:00pm as it will close.   CHECK IN IS FROM 3PM We are unable to organize early check ins. SELF CHECK IN/OUT is also available. AIRPORTS private licensed vehicles transfers are also available at additional price.
transit: -West Kensington Station (District Line branch) 5 minutes walking distance. -Barons Court Station (District and Piccadilly Lines) 7 minute walking distance.  Piccadilly line trains connect to Heatrow ariport and takes approximately 50 minutes. -Kensington Olympia is 17 minutes walking distance or approximately 20 minutes via Buses and the bus stop is a minute away to the Property. -Earl's Court Station is 20 minutes walking distance or 11 by Underground (District line). -Oxford Circus is 27 and Piccadilly 22 minutes by Underground. *times are estimated with Citymapper app  Few green areas are nearby, also available Pay&Display parking spaces just off the building (FREE Saturday/Sunday and from 5pm-9am monday to friday).
access: Guests have private access to the entire apartment.  One sets of keys will be provided at check-in. Everything located within the apartment is available for the guests to use.
interaction: At the property there is an office (10am-6pm) where you will be welcomed by me or my team trying to be always available to help and support you in every phase of the booking process and during your whole stay, providing immediate help and care.

name: ANGEL PENTHOUSE w/ panoramic terrace view, parking
summary: A modern and truly unique top-floor penthouse apartment in the heart of London, featuring an incredible private roof terrace with views over the city's beautiful canals and beyond.  Enjoy secure private parking, superfast WiFi and contemporary open-plan living and dining areas, within a 5 minute walk of Angel Tube Station.

neighborhood_overview: Located in Islington with its eclectic range of eating places, bars and boutiques, the apartment and its improbably large terrace overlook the green oasis of the Regents Canal. It is conveniently situated close to Angel and Old Street tube stations - with Shoreditch and the City within walking distance.
notes: EXTRA COSTS:  Late check-in fee (if you arrive later than 1 hour after the agreed check-in time): £10/hour for waiting Check-in after 8pm: £30  Check-out after 11am: £10/hour Check-out after 11am is only possible if there’s no early guest check-in on the same day. For luggage storage information please see below.      Beddings and towels for sofa bed: £20 Please send the extra payment to us via Airbnb after you have paid for your reservation. To do this, go to INBOX ￫ message thread between you and us ￫ click SEND MONEY button at the top of the message page.  LUGGAGE STORAGE: Find nearby luggage storage locations and receive 10% off with this link (Website hidden by Airbnb)   PARCEL DELIVERY: We are unable to receive any parcel delivery to the property on your behalf before your arrival. You’ll find many parcel store services such as Amazon Locker, Collectplus, Doddle, Parcelly, InPost.  KEYS: When we hand the keys to you, we will take a photo of you with the keys for our record and fo
transit: Private parking is available at the property, free of charge. Angel and Old Street Underground stations are both within a 5-10 minute walk.
access: Guests will have the whole apartment, terrace and balcony to themselves. The apartment is on the 8th floor, accessible via lift.  The secure private parking facilities are located underground. There is a designated space for the guest.  A concierge will also be available in the lobby during normal hours, Monday - Saturday.
interaction: Happyguest London will take care of you from enquiry to check-out. We will send you a house manual and check-in instruction after booking is confirmed. Upon your arrival, a Happyguest cohost will meet and greet you at the flat. We will hand over the keys and show you round, demystifying any queries you may have about your stay in London.
house_rules: - No smoking inside the property or building. NO cigarette bud disposal in indoor bins (fire hazard)  - No pets in the property or building - No parties, events or large group gatherings - No overnight visitors or extra guests without prior booking - Minimal noise before 9am or after 10pm from talking, TV, music - No shoes or scratching on furniture surfaces - Lock entry door, terrace/balcony doors, windows with keys when going in & out of the property. Turn off all lights - Turn off all cooking & electrical appliances after use - Respect our things & our neighbours' peace and quiet - Other guestiquettes:  - Take shoes off inside the property - No shoes on carpet, sofa, beds - Not use white towels for wiping make-up or floor  - Use the bins provided for rubbish
host_about:
I’m a travel and food lover, working in the charity sector in London. 

I love cooking and discovering new, exciting places to eat at home and abroad. I regularly host dinner parties for my friends and family, serving dishes inspired by my travels and local discoveries. 

I love telling people the best local places to eat, drink and relax; and sharing the best London has to offer! 

When not cooking (or travelling!) I enjoy running, and am training for my first triathlon - eek!

name: Charming Victorian 1 bed + courtyard - Islington
summary: Conveniently nestled in a quiet Finsbury Park side-street, our flat is 15 mins by tube from Central London and within easy reach of everything that North & East  has to offer.   There are many coffee shops, eateries and conveniences in the nearby area  so you'll find everything you need just a short walk away.  Stoke Newington and Angel are also around the corner. This ground floor flat has a private courtyard and is a well positioned base for exploring London.
description: Conveniently nestled in a quiet Finsbury Park side-street, our flat is 15 mins by tube from Central London and within easy reach of everything that North & East  has to offer.   There are many coffee shops, eateries and conveniences in the nearby area  so you'll find everything you need just a short walk away.  Stoke Newington and Angel are also around the corner. This ground floor flat has a private courtyard and is a well positioned base for exploring London. There's lots close by, including a great Japanese, a cute Italian coffee shop/deli and a superb international supermarket, all at the end of the road. With too many pubs and restaurants to list, we'll recommend our local favourites when you stay. Our kitchen is fully equipped should you want to cook and eat in instead. Finsbury Park station is very well connected to the rest of London via the Victoria and Piccadilly lines, and there are many bus routes. To help plan your journey you can visit the TFL website or use the CityMappe

notes: Although you'll probably want to be out and about, you'll have Netflix, iPlayer and other catch-up tv at your disposal. The flat is all yours, but this is our home so many of our belongings will remain here.  We'll clear enough space for your stay.

name: Westminster Bedroom Close to Big Ben
summary: A spacious bright lit bedroom with a double bed. 6 min walk to Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace and Victoria Station. Free and Unlimited WiFi is available in the flat.
space: A beautiful cozy room with a double bed, a cupboard to hang your clothes. A window with substantial amount of natural light flooding in and a decent view.  It is situated on the fourth floor and ONLY accessible by stairs, so if you don't mind walking the steps you can be free to enjoy your stay here. This is a non smoking room so for the smokers please head to the balcony to smoke. 2 min walk to a great food market, open during lunch hours on weekdays with a wide variety of world foods. 6 min walk to Big Ben. Free and Unlimited WiFi is available in the flat. (At the moment there is scaffolding and construction happening around the building and is likely to finish by the end of 2018) Apologies for this.
description: A spacious bright lit bedroom with a double bed. 6 min walk to Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace and Victoria Station. Free and Unlimited WiFi is available in the flat. A beautiful cozy room with a double bed, a cupboard to hang your clothes. A window with substantial amount of natural light flooding in and a decent view.  It is situated on the fourth floor and ONLY accessible by stairs, so if you don't mind walking the steps you can be free to enjoy your stay here. This is a non smoking room so for the smokers please head to the balcony to smoke. 2 min walk to a great food market, open during lunch hours on weekdays with a wide variety of world foods. 6 min walk to Big Ben. Free and Unlimited WiFi is available in the flat. (At the moment there is scaffolding and construction happening around the building and is likely to finish by the end of 2018) Apologies for this. You'll be renting a private room which only you the guest will have access to. The bathroom and kitchen wil
neighborhood_overview: Neighbourhood is quiet, safe. Near to a fantastic food market during lunch time in the week. With a wide selection of world foods, also the best English breakfast place in London (Regency Café) as rated on TripAdvisor is just downstairs.
notes: Also please respect the neighbours and neighbourhood  when entering and leaving the apartment as it is a quiet and respectable area, Thank you Oh.. and PLEASE ENJOY YOUR STAY !!!
transit: There is Big Ben 6 min down the road. Also Buckingham Palace 10 min away. Bus stops 1 min walk away heading in may different directions and a lot of taxis passing nearby. Nearest tube station is St James Park which is 4 min walking distance. Tesco and Sainsburys supermarkets are just 2 minutes walk.
access: You'll be renting a private room which only you the guest will have access to. The bathroom and kitchen will be shared between you (the guest) and Sam who lives in the property, who will be happy to help you make your stay that much more enjoyable.
interaction: Yes there is always someone to help you whether it is friendly Sam who lives in the property or me who will always be available to answer any queries through here or contacting me directly on my phone.
house_rules: - Please keep the noise to a minimal as it a quiet and respectable neighbourhood
host_about:
Hello Airbnb World !!!!

I like to travel, go to the gym, jog, cycle and dance. I live in London. 

I like to learn about different cultures, speak different languages, try different foods, experience different ways of living and meeting people from different walks of life.

I speak English and Chinese

transit: Transport: Central London is easily accessible with transport links from Forest Gate & Stratford nearby. Forest Gate Station - Liverpool Street - 15 mins Forest Gate Station - Stratford - 4 mins Upton Park - Tower Hill - 18 mins Upton Park - Victoria - 33 mins House to Forest Gate Station by Bus - 10 mins (alternatively walking takes 15mins) House to Upton Park Station by Bus - 10 mins (alternatively walking takes 15mins) House to Stratford by Bus - 15/20 mins
interaction: We live in the flat downstairs and will say hello and give advice!  Otherwise if we are out we will be contactable via email or telephone during your stay.

host_about:
Myself and my Husband live in our lovely new renovated Victorian terrace house in East London.
We love eating out, theatre (when we can! you always take it for granted being so close and never go!) seeing friends, watching netflix and working.
Im a Fashion Designer and my partner is a Quantity Surveyor, we've both lived in London for 5 years and always lived East (so we know it pretty well!) 
I know all the best sample sales, love shopping and London events.
We love to travel, we do love a city break , mainly European and the big holidays are for outside of Europe. 
Last year we went on a 8 week excursion from San Fransisco to Vegas then across to Boston , Washington DC and NYC.
We do love and adventure and use Air BnB for it :D

We've learnt from our Air BnB ventures and want to offer up what we would like out of an Air BnB and what we would be comfortable with. We look forward to having you as our guests.

name: Double room in Georgian house in Highgate
summary: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and furry friends (pets).  Light breakfast, tea/coffee included.  Highgate is a great part of london with Hampstead Heath, Waterlow Park, Kenwood House, Highgate Wood, and world famous Highgate Cemetery are all near. Lots of charming pubs (one every few yards it seems), cafes, and local amenities nearby. 10 mins walk to nearest tube. Highgate is one stop outside zone 2 on Northern Line. Easy access to West End.
space: For the summer, the courtyard is a real sun trap and can get very hot.  The bathroom has a power shower. your room has a HD tv, a DAB radio, fan, reading material such as travel books, and a desk in the room. There is a large wardrobe and plenty of storage. The bed is a futon bed. There are both summer and winter quilts available as you prefer.  The living room has a wood burner. You are welcome to use all the house. All fresh linen and towels included.  There is a fold out bed for little people if needed.
description: My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and furry friends (pets).  Light breakfast, tea/coffee included.  Highgate is a great part of london with Hampstead Heath, Waterlow Park, Kenwood House, Highgate Wood, and world famous Highgate Cemetery are all near. Lots of charming pubs (one every few yards it seems), cafes, and local amenities nearby. 10 mins walk to nearest tube. Highgate is one stop outside zone 2 on Northern Line. Easy access to West End. For the summer, the courtyard is a real sun trap and can get very hot.  The bathroom has a power shower. your room has a HD tv, a DAB radio, fan, reading material such as travel books, and a desk in the room. There is a large wardrobe and plenty of storage. The bed is a futon bed. There are both summer and winter quilts available as you prefer.  The living room has a wood burner. You are welcome to use all the house. All fresh linen and towels included.  There is a fold out bed for little people if needed. Ther
neighborhood_overview: Highgate is noted for its Georgian architecture and charm. It has always felt safe and I have had no problems. the local pubs are historic and have great beers and food. The village has good shops, especially the grocer's and butchers. Lots of parks and woods including Hampstead Heath, Kenwood House, Parkland Walk, Highgate Wood, Waterlow Park, all in easy walking distance. The house is on a tree lined road noted for its varied architecture. Parking 10-12, Mon-Friday is restricted, but I can supply parking vouchers as required, for a small fee, otherwise no restrictions. There is a parking bay a few yards from the house.
notes: I ask that the house is for your use only. Check in time is between 3 and 5pm, and check out is by 11am, but I will do my best to accommodate times according to your needs  just let me know in advance so I am not hanging around for hours. Please note, I do not charge a 'cleaning fee' or other on-costs. What you see is what you pay, one guest or two. I am always available for advice and support.
transit: 10 mins walk to tube on Northern Line. The house is one stop outside zone 2. Buses 2 mins from front door, and more buses in the village. Four local buses go into central London. Easy access to West End.
access: There are 2 bedrooms at the house. The front bedroom is for guests. The guest bathroom is on the ground floor. This is exclusively for your use. A light is on all night to guide so not to worry. You can help yourself to tea/coffee as you wish. There is also a light, self service breakfast ( cereals, toast, drinks) included. Towels, toiletries also included. You are welcome to use the kitchen, living, dining, and outside space as you wish. The courtyard is a real sun trap and is a pleasure to sit in.
interaction: Please let me know if I can help in any way. I will try my best to make you comfortable and your stay enjoyable.
house_rules: The house is for guests only, please arrange to meet family/friends away from the house, thanks. Double lock the front door at all times, when you enter and leave the house. I don't smoke, but do not mind smoking in the living area or outside, but please not in the bedroom. Please respect the house as my home. Of course you can come and go as you please, but be considerate after 10.30pm by keeping noise down for me and my neighbours.  Please check in between 3 and 5pm or at another agreed time. I will do my best to accommodate.Thanks. This house is pet friendly, but note that you will need to discuss this with me beforehand.
host_about:
Hello, I am a 50 odd retired health worker. I used to work in disability services. I'm single, live on my own, and like to meet anyone from any walks of life, hence my listing.
I live to travel and my current pasion is to explore Australia and hopefully move there one day. I love cycling, keep fit, good music, and enjoy all types of food. I also spend my time working on my house where I have lived for six years. I have lived in London since 1990.
With me is a small dog, a tiny beagle who is very friendly, welcoming and great fun. If you are concerned he goes into his den at night. Never a problem.

name: Spacious,self contained flat. In North London.
summary: Spacious, airy flat within 5 mins walk of Oakwood station (Piccadilly line) and 30 minutes tube journey of central London. Southgate tube station and town centre is a 15 minute walk with a number of supermarkets, restaurants and stores. The flat itself is clean and bright, but communal areas and entry to the flat can look a little dated and shabby. Hence the low price. Sleeps 4 with an additional sofa bed if needed.
space: There are 2 bedrooms with own use of lounge, compact kitchen and bathroom.. The flat is on the second floor and accessed via stairs and there is free on street parking which we never have a problem finding.

neighborhood_overview: Sometimes on a Saturday we like to wander along the high street, peruse the second hand shops for some good books and then have a coffee in Harris and Hoole (although there are lots!) before taking a walk around Oakwood park and the surrounding leafy streets.  There are a number of good restaurants including a really nice Turkish place called Kervan Sofresi and an Italian we like called Fantozzi. There are also a couple of chains- Pizza express and Nandos and the usual fast food options.  If you have a car we have plenty of cinemas (Enfield, Finchley, Barnet) and shopping centres- Enfield Town, Wood Green, Brent Cross.
access: own use of kitchen bathroom and lounge and two double bedrooms.
interaction: INVENTORY. microwave, T.V, Dyson upright cleaner., kettle,   waffle maker, toaster. Washing machine, fridge freezer.Electric Iron & Ironing board. Hair dryer.
house_rules: Please clear bins and rubbish and empty outside in the big metal bins which is located next to the car park.

name: Cosy Bedroom In Cultural Household
summary: A light-filled small bedroom next to a large bathroom, in a beautifully presented classic Victorian terraced house. Perfect for people looking for a bijoux base from which to explore London; you are close to good transport links. The home is comfortable, filled with books and sewing, a small dog and a warm welcome. Even when you're not catching a tube into Central London you're a 10-minute walk from gin bars, pizza restaurants, local breweries, Epping Forest, and the buzz of Walthamstow village.
space: A Victorian mid-terrace house, perfect for the authentic London experience. Your room is a small single, 6x10 feet (1.8x3 metres).

Bathroom, kitchen I largely work from home so shall be around to help guests with questions and advice. I ask that I have the living room to myself in the evenings. Welcome to one of the best parts of London! Walthamstow has been on the rise and rise for several years and is a buzzing cultural mix of restaurants, bars, galleries, cinemas and markets. neighborhood_overview: Welcome to one of the best parts of London! Walthamstow has been on the rise and rise for several years and is a buzzing cultural mix of restaurants, bars, galleries, cinemas and markets. You're five minutes away from Epping Forest if you want to get back to nature, but if gin and local brews are your thing, you should definitely check out God's Own Junkyard - a five-minute walk away.
notes: I own an affectionate miniature schnauzer, Ella, so if you're a dog-lover you'll be very happy indeed. There are parking restrictions on my road, but I have parking tickets you can use.
transit: We are a seven-minute walk from Wood Street overland station, that takes you direct into Liverpool Street (or you can hop off after one stop to hook up with the Victoria line). The end of the Victoria Line is one stop away on the overland or a 20-minute walk away through the gorgeous Walthamstow village. From there, you can be in Central London within 20 minutes. This is one of the best-connected areas in Zone 3.
access: Bathroom, kitchen
interaction: I largely work from home so shall be around to help guests with questions and advice. I ask that I have the living room to myself in the evenings.
house_rules: I am happy for you to prepare light meals and snacks in the kitchen, but no meal cooking. I ask that I have the living room to myself in the evenings. Please don't bring anyone home with you from a night out.

notes: Please note that the flat is shared (3 bed) therefore there are a few other people along with myself who live here...and then there's the guest room :) All rooms are closely connected, so footsteps at night cannot be completely prevented. Another thing to note is that use of the kitchen is not for use for guests. I would also like to say that although this is fairly quiet in terms of night time noise compared to other locations in London, it is very central - therefore some noise at night is inevitable.

house_rules: Hi there,  Please read all of this before booking.  I offer guests a room only, without the use of the kitchen. --Female guests only please! It’s simply just because it’s me and another all female guest room. - Check in is from 1pm to 4pm on weekdays, and 3pm onwards on weekends.  -Please read check in times before booking, as I work after 4pm on weekdays so it's strict. Check out BEFORE 10am is STRICT, please don’t ask me if you can come earlier as I'm very busy, I have guests back to back and also host another air bnb guest room so need the time to prep the rooms etc. I look forward to meeting you :-) Sofiya xx
