name: Modern 1-Bed in Shoreditch
summary: Modern one bedroom flat in trendy Shoreditch. The flat has an open plan living room and kitchen and a large double bedroom making my place good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. The location of the property means it has easy transport links and is in walking distance from some London attractions, not mention the numerous bars and restaurants in Shoreditch.
space: The flat is on the first floor and is handicap accessible due to the lifts in the building.  The flat has a bright and airy open plan living room and kitchen, equipped with modern appliances. The bedroom is a large double with an extra comfy bed, ensuring a good night's sleep. My cleaners place fresh, hotel quality linen and towels on your bed prior to arrival.

The neighborhood’s industrial warehouses and dingy side streets offer plenty of
neighborhood_overview: In Shoreditch, empty walls are future murals. The neighborhood’s industrial warehouses and dingy side streets offer plenty of potential space waiting to be reimagined. Old brick warehouses have transformed into interactive art galleries, and countless buildings have served as Banksy’s canvases. Shoreditch’s appeal as a creative playground stems (at least, in part) from an urban, gritty underbelly, but clean-cut treasures aren’t in short supply—Shoreditch’s design sensibilities also influence its trendy pubs and cafes.
transit: The apartment is located six minutes walk from Old Street tube station (Northern line). The London Eye: 30 minutes by tube  The Tower of London: 20 minutes on the bus Heathrow Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 15 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 30 minutes by tube
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.

name: Clean & spacious room in South West London
summary: A clean, spacious, sunny double bedroom overlooking a garden in Worcester Park-suburb of southwest London (close to Wimbledon, Kingston-Upon-Thames, Sutton and Morden).  We have a direct express bus X26 to & from Terminal 3 Bus Station Heathrow.  We are 20-25 minute train journey into Waterloo, Vauxhall, Clapham Junction & 10 mins to Wimbledon with a frequent service. This space would suit a solo adventurer and/or business traveller. This is a non-smoking house & it's not suitable for smokers.
space: We have a warm and welcoming home, set in a leafy residential street with a vibrant high street with cafes, bars & restaurants, Waitrose & Sainsbury's supermarkets and banks. We are within easy access to Heathrow and Gatwick, so if you plan to travel abroad or travelling into London, our home is within commutable distance. We can help guide you with your travel plans into London if you need it and we are within easy reach into Surrey, Sussex and Hampshire countryside and towns. We have off street parking and can store a bicycle in our garage.

notes: Please note there is a NO Smoking policy in our home and immediate vicinity (our drive & garden)

There are local bus travelling to Sutton, Epsom to Kingston Upon Thames & an Express bus service to Heathrow Airport.  Our street has free car parking and we have an off street drive to park as well.

name: Dan's Shoreditch Studio 9A - 2nd floor rear
summary: Modern clean studio apartment in the heart of highly sought after Shoreditch Triangle, London.  Located on Curtain Road this studio offers a perfect opportunity for anyone wanting to experience Central London city life.  On the doorstep of some of London's best nightlife, it has been newly refurbished throughout with Superfast WIFI, ambient lighting, stained oak wooden floors, new fully tiled shower room, high gloss white fitted private kitchen and available partially furnished including LCD TV.
space: Being in the heart of trendy Shoreditch, please note there are some evenings when you may be able to hear the buzzing nightlife outside (and it can get particularly noisy over some weekends).

neighborhood_overview: Stay here if you want a perfect Location in the heart of Shoreditch... London's popular, exciting and very trendy area! Enjoy the galleries, pubs, clubs, vintage shops and street markets in a newly refurbished studio flat. Close to many stations and easy access to all over London.
notes: New Memory Foam Orthopaedic Mattress now in this Studio (April 17). Baby/toddler cot possibly obtainable subject to availability and advance booking. Please note that I have a few Studios in this building but this particular one is one of the very few without a washing machine AND a dryer - it is just a washing machine - so if the dryer function is something you need please book one of my alternative studios.... interaction: Many thanks for considering staying at this Studio. I am sure you will have a great time in Shoreditch and I hope that I am able to make your stay as comfortable as possible. name: Beautiful Hackney Home
summary: The house is very light, bright and airy with lots of space.  There is a large kitchen, with a dining table and a utility room for any washing needs. There is a south facing garden which means the house has a wonderful light. Beautiful period features including shutters make this a unique property and such a special place to stay. It's located in the heart of Hackney, but the street itself is very quiet.
description: The house is very light, bright and airy with lots of space.  There is a large kitchen, with a dining table and a utility room for any washing needs. There is a south facing garden which means the house has a wonderful light. Beautiful period features including shutters make this a unique property and such a special place to stay. It's located in the heart of Hackney, but the street itself is very quiet.
host_about:
We live in Hackney and what we love most is to discover all the various restaurants, culture and parks whenever we have a moment.  It's a great diverse neighbourhood with so much on offer - independent music venues, wonderfully interesting shops, unique galleries, local markets and lots of green spaces.

Having lived in the USA, Spain and India - we have had our fair share of Airbnb experiences; both on the hosting front and as guests.  Travelling is one of our favourite things and we make time for exploring new places as much as we can.

We hope you will enjoy staying, whilst you discover all that London has to offer.

summary: Close to Canonbury and Highbury & Islington Stations, we're in the heart of charming Islington, a short stroll to Upper Street's shops cafe's and bars, and also in close proximity of The City of London. space: Welcome to our home! Our maisonette is located in a Victorian converted property, renovated to create a beautiful, light and airy space with a boutique feel to it. Both Olivia and I have lived in the area for many years and have lots of favourite spots that we can recommend nearby. The city of London, and Islington Angel are within close reach, as well as Canonbury station (a brisk 5 minute walk) and Highbury and Islington Station (a 17 minute walk through beautiful Highbury fields).

summary: This unique space is close to Greenwich, Blackheath, The 02, Canary Wharf, City Airport and with a quick train journey to central London. You'll love the studio because of the location, the views, the garden and the privacy. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers and families with young kids
space: Private guest suite which can be accessed via own entrance situated within a beautiful family home in a quiet road in Greenwich/Blackheath. Garden has spectacular views over Canary Wharf and the 02. Kitchenette facilities, own bathroom, sofa area, desk area and very comfy bed. You may use the garden to relax in, take your evening meal or just to sip wine and enjoy the view. The kitchenette has a toaster, kettle, fridge and sink but not facilities to cook. It is a great space to prepare your breakfast or any snacks during your stay. A parking space is available to use upon request or we have free parking just a few houses away. I can provide secure storage for any bikes you wish to bring. A selection of cereals are available for your stay. You are also provided with a selection of teas, coffee, hot chocolate, sugar, milk, bread, butter and biscuits. In the bathroom there is shampoo, conditioner and shower gel should you require. The studio is ideally suited to 1 or 2 people sharing a do

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich is a royal borough and is very beautiful attracting hoards of tourists every year. There are many things to see and do. We are also extremely close to the 02, in fact it is part of our garden's view. We have loads of very varied restaurant to choose from. You will not be bored in Greenwich and you are linked by many forms of transport to the rest of London. Train, underground, DLR, cross rail, The Thames clipper and the Emirates Air Line cable car.
notes: Late or early check-in is possible - just ask
transit: 3 mins to Westcombe Park station which has direct links into London Bridge, Canon Street and Charing Cross. Bus links to North Greenwich tube station which would get you to Canary Wharf door to door within the half hour. 30 mins walk to 02! Links via DLR from Greenwich. Links via Thames Clipper from North Greenwich or Greenwich. Close links City Airport via DLR. Emirates Air Line cable car crosses the River Thames between North Greenwich Peninsula and the Royal Docks to the ExCel Centre, just five minutes from the O2 . Cabins arrive every 30 seconds and flights are approximately 10 minutes each way.
access: Private Entrance with key Not suitable I'm afraid for wheelchairs or people on crutches as the stairs might prove too much.
interaction: As the guest suite can be accessed via its own entrance you are separated from the main house and your stay can be a very private one although if needed I am on hand to offer advice and information about the local area, central London, restaurants, transport issues or just to order you a cab.
house_rules: No parties No extra guests No smoking
host_about:
I'm an easy going, friendly type, very approachable so ask me anything. I grew up in a B&B farmhouse in the Brecon Beacons, Wales and hence have experience with different personalities and watched my Mum deal pleasantly with anything thrown at her.
I live in the main house with my husband Frank, 3 children (Scarlett, Miles, Arthur) a ginger dog called Blue and a ginger Tom cat called Wotsit.

The flat is spacious, receives great amount of sun-light, in a modern condo building.

name: Heaver Estate, Tooting Bec - Cosy 1 bed flat
summary: My place is 50 yards from the amazing Tooting Common and it's lovely green spaces, tennis courts, lido (the largest outdoor swimming pool in Europe!), playground, cafe etc.  We are also a really short walk (5mins) to Tooting Bec tube station (Northern line - 25 mins direct into either the West End or the City).   over 700ft of accommodation (it is a big space), a large double bed, dining table, huge sofa (bed), super high speed fibre broadband, and a large flat screen TV with all sky channels.
space: Our flat is really cosy, warm in the Winter and cool in the Summer (it is a basement).  It was recently renovated so everything is good condition.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is in the famous Heaver Estate, a large late-Victorian development of family houses which is now a conservation area.  We have lovely neighbours, and a real sense of community.  Tooting Bec for those unfamiliar with it, is next to Balham and South of Clapham Common.  Between Tooting Bec, Balham and Clapham there are many great pubs, a huge array of restaurants, and you are 20 ins in a taxi from Stamford Bridge (if you happen to be a football fan!). In the past ten years the area has seen loads of great bars and restaurants open, with something for everyone!
transit: Tooting Bec is incredibly well located. We are a 5 minute walk from Tooting Bec tube station, which is on the Northern Line - trains direct to the West End (Leicester Sq) or if you in London on business direct to London Bridge & Bank - about 20-25 minutes on the tube to both.
access: You will have access to the whole basement flat via a separate front door.  I will make the arrangements for you to pick up the key on arrival (we live above the flat).
interaction: We (me and my family) live in the house upstairs, if you ever have a query, or want to ask about local restaurants, bars I am happy to help!

You can enjoy Edgware Road's cornucopia of Middle-Eastern restaurants, cafes and juice bars. Perfect for breakfast and great cup of coffee is Gails Artisan Bakery just two minutes walking distance. On the same street Seymour Place you can find plenty of good restaurants - typical English pub, healthy option with The Mae Deli, Vinoteka, Italian restaurant, good pizza and many more.
transit: Marble arch and Bond Street station, which are on the Central and Jubilee line should you need to use the tube to visit anywhere in London.
access: The whole apartment is available for guests for their private use. Walking distance to Soho, Carnaby Street, Oxford Street, Bond Street, Piccadilly Circus, Hyde Park, Regent's Park, Selfridges, Harrods and museums.
interaction: The guests may contact the owner for any information, suggestion, help that they may need.

name: 2 Bedroom Flat in Bayswater, Hyde Park, London, F3
summary: This newly renovated two bedroom flat is located in a well maintained building, and includes all the basic needs for someone to have a great stay.   It is situated in the heart of London, Bayswater area, very close to Bayswater Station (3 minutes walk), Hyde Park (3 minutes walk) and the vibrant shops and coffee houses of Queensway (5 minutes walk) and Notting Hill Gate (10 minutes walk). It is close to the famous Kensington Palace and the beautiful Kensington High Street.
space: This apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a Victorian building, with an available elevator in the building. It comes with a good sized open-plan kitchen that contains an electric cooker, fridge, freezer, and microwave. It also has a good sized living area with a sofa bed, small dining table and fairly medium sized TV. This flat has 2 bedrooms; the first comes with a double bed and a good sized wardrobe, and the second bedroom comes with a double bed, a single bed and a good sized wardrobe. There is two newly renovated bathrooms, one of them is en-suit. They both contain a shower-room, towels, and other basic needs, such as shampoo. Although Flat does contain Air-conditioners, please note that it is only available on Guests request at an extra charge (please contact me if you do require that)...

notes: For the guests' comfort, parties or loud music are not allowed in this apartment to eliminate noise. For the guests' comfort, smoking is not allowed in this apartment to eliminate air pollution.
interaction: We highly encourage our guests to contact us if they need anything before or during their stay. We are very responsive and our gusts' comfort is our priority.
house_rules: Key Collection Rules: Keys must be collected from our office. Our office is located in Bayswater, and it is about 5 minutes walk to this property. Our check-in times are between 2:00 pm - 7:00 pm on Mondays - Fridays. If you are arriving outside those hours, please get in touch with us to check for special key collection arrangement.  For guests security, every guest must provide original Photographed ID prior to key collection. PLEASE NOTE THAT KEYS WILL NOT BE PROVIDED FOR THOSE WHO DO NOT PROVIDE PHOTOGRAPHED ID AND PROPERTY ACCESS MAY BE DENIED IF THIS REQUIREMENT IS NOT MET.
host_about: I am the Managing Director of Inverness Properties Ltd; an independent Estate Agency that operates in Central London, Zone 1. My team and I are highly knowledgeable and specialised in various areas of the property industry. We are professional, passionate, compassionate and understanding with our clients. We know our market and finding the right property is what we are best at. Our clients come mainly from recommendation or a word of mouth, as a result of customer satisfaction.

name: Big Ben cosy apartment
summary: Located at the heart of Westminster yet in a safe and quiet neighbourhood. Big Ben is around one corner and Tate Britain Gallery around another, all within 10 min walk. Victoria Station is also within a walking distance, great for traveling from and to airport.  Our apartment is small but cozy and it has all you need for a comfortable stay. Perfect for a real London experience. You will find shops, pubs and restaurants close by.
space: Your room has a double bed, a table with two chairs, armchair, drawers, bookshelves, cabinet and tv.  All the essentials like towels, bedding, hair dryer, iron, fan and adapter are provided. It is a private room with a lock and a key.  The kitchen is well equipped with microwave, sandwich maker, coffee machine and fridge. There is a washing machine that you can use.  The bathroom has shower and a bath. Soap, shampoo and dental hygiene are also provided.
description: Located at the heart of Westminster yet in a safe and quiet neighbourhood. Big Ben is around one corner and Tate Britain Gallery around another, all within 10 min walk. Victoria Station is also within a walking distance, great for traveling from and to airport.  Our apartment is small but cozy and it has all you need for a comfortable stay. Perfect for a real London experience. You will find shops, pubs and restaurants close by. Your room has a double bed, a table with two chairs, armchair, drawers, bookshelves, cabinet and tv.  All the essentials like towels, bedding, hair dryer, iron, fan and adapter are provided. It is a private room with a lock and a key.  The kitchen is well equipped with microwave, sandwich maker, coffee machine and fridge. There is a washing machine that you can use.  The bathroom has shower and a bath. Soap, shampoo and dental hygiene are also provided. Guests will have access to fully equipped kitchen, bathroom and a separate toilet.  They will have private lo
neighborhood_overview: Although close to the main attractions it is quiet and safe with lots of restaurants and pubs near by.
notes: We don't mind smokers although we don't smoke. But please smoke only in the kitchen. Ashtray provided. Please note that we can check in only after 5pm during the week.  We are flexible on the weekends.
transit: There is a bus stop just next to us with buses 88 with a route from Camden to Clapham Common and C10 with route from Victoria to Canada Water. Piccadilly tube station with Victoria line is 10 min walk away and Saint James Park tube station with Circle and District lines is 15 min away.
access: Guests will have access to fully equipped kitchen, bathroom and a separate toilet.  They will have private lockable room and will only share kitchen, bathroom and wc with me and my partner.
interaction: It is up to the guests. We can give you advice about the area and London. If you want your privacy we will give you space. Otherwise we are happy to chat and socialise. We'll probably be around in the evenings. We speak English, Slovenian, Czech, Polish and Serbo-Croatian.
house_rules: This room is stricly for one or two people. Be friendly, clean after the usage of kitchen and bathroom and please obey the noise level, it is a quiet neighbourhood. Strictly no parties or overnight visitors. Please state full name of additional guest when booking the total days of stay.  Also please send the arrival time with your request. Thank you!

name: Entire guestsuite, own bathroom, wifi, Side access
summary: Entire place. Located 10-15 mins walk to S. Woodford tube & to Epping Forest. You’ll love my place it's a garden retreat all to yourself, you'll wake up in London but feel like you're in the country!  The cabin is perfect for couples, solo adventurers & business travellers. There’s a very comfortable double sofa bed, fridge, microwave, snacks, everything you need to make tea & coffee, Sky TV, wifi & your own private bathroom & rear courtyard. Access via a side gate.  Contact me for 1 night stays
space: It's a sole use, private Cedar clad garden room/cabin that is located in a mature garden, meaning you will wake up with a lovely view in a peaceful setting. You have your own private shower room along with a fridge, microwave and everything you need to make tea or coffee. There are no shared facilities, it is basically an entire place. You also have access to Sky TV and wifi. Access is via a side gate with a key code. Its about a 10/15 minute walk to the tube station (South Woodford zone 4, Central line) and we have lots of restaurants, cafes and shops within walking distance. There is a small private courtyard at the back of the garden room that you have exclusive access to and where you won't be disturbed. Access to the garden room is via the side gate so you can come and go as you please, you will not disturb us if you want to come home late at night. The garden room is cosy and very comfortable.  Please check out the reviews for comments where you will see that everybody enjoys the
description: Entire place. Located 10-15 mins walk to S. Woodford tube & to Epping Forest. You’ll love my place it's a garden retreat all to yourself, you'll wake up in London but feel like you're in the country!  The cabin is perfect for couples, solo adventurers & business travellers. There’s a very comfortable double sofa bed, fridge, microwave, snacks, everything you need to make tea & coffee, Sky TV, wifi & your own private bathroom & rear courtyard. Access via a side gate.  Contact me for 1 night stays It's a sole use, private Cedar clad garden room/cabin that is located in a mature garden, meaning you will wake up with a lovely view in a peaceful setting. You have your own private shower room along with a fridge, microwave and everything you need to make tea or coffee. There are no shared facilities, it is basically an entire place. You also have access to Sky TV and wifi. Access is via a side gate with a key code. Its about a 10/15 minute walk to the tube station (South Woodford zone 4, Cen
neighborhood_overview: I love the fact that we have so many things on our doorstep such as cafes, pubs, restaurants (Italian, Turkish, Indian, Mexican, pub food, Thai, Chinese and more) shops, supermarkets (Waitrose, Marks & Spencer's, Sainsbury's & Tesco's), a library and even a cinema 10 mins walk away.  South Woodford is a leafy suburb and its a safe neighbourhood to come back to after a night out. I can recommend the lovely new coffee shop on the corner, which is a great place for breakfast, lunch or just coffee and cake. We also have the benefit of being in TFL London Underground Zone 4 with easy access via the Central line to the City of London and West End - around 20 mins to St Paul's and 30 minutes to Oxford Circus. Not far from Central line but a nice and quiet area to stay. If you like shopping Westfield shopping centre is only a few stops away on the Central line at Stratford. A huge plus is that we also have acres of green space close by -  Epping Forest.  We know the local and wider area well,
notes: Access is via a side gate with a code so you have direct access to the garden and can come and go as you please. As access is along a garden path which is sometimes wet, please remove your shoes once inside. So you have your own entire space, no shared facilities. This is basically an entire place rather than a private room. No Smoking Please do not bring other people to the garden room who have not booked to stay. If you have friends or family who would like to stop by please just check with me first please. If you accumulate lots of rubbish you can put it into the recycling bins/general dustbins which are on the front drive, thank you. They are spare bin liners in the bottom of the bin. If you plan to be out all day it would be good if you can turn the heater thermostat down to about 5, it will heat up quickly when you turn it up again, thank you.
transit: If you are arriving by car we have free off road parking for your car. If you are arriving by public transport we are 10-15 minute walk from South Woodford tube station (0.8 mile) which is on the central line. You can be in Central London in about 25 minutes. If you take the Central line make sure you take a train marked Epping or Loughton as the line splits before it gets to South Woodford. We are also a 15-20 minute walk to Higham's Park station which is on the London Overground and is a 25 minute journey to Liverpool Street, and can provide a useful alternative if ever there is a problem with the tube.  A cab to Walthamstow Central which is on the Victoria Line and London Overground will cost around £7.  There is also a bus stop at end each of my road, providing easy access to services to Loughton, Wanstead, Ilford and other destinations including the tube station if you don't want to walk  Access from the London Area airports London City - this is the closest airport and is only ab
access: You have exclusive access to the small courtyard behind the garden room. There is also a small deck to the front of the garden room which the sun hits in the late afternoon, making this the perfect spot for relaxing with a book or a glass of wine. Where possible I can be flexible with check in/check out times and usually its possible to drop your bags earlier on check in day and/or store them till later on check out day.
interaction: If I am home I will try my best to be available to provide any assistance you need or you can text/call me  and I will do my best to help. If I am not home one of my teenage sons is often around during the evenings.  We enjoy meeting our guests and having a chat but if you would prefer to keep interaction to a minimum then that's no problem and we will always respect your privacy either way.
house_rules: - As access is along a garden path so I would appreciate it if you took your shoes off once inside. Don't leave your shoes outside overnight as we sometimes get foxes in the garden who like to chew shoes. No smoking  Please do not bring  people to the garden room who have not booked to stay. If you have friends that want to stop by please just ask me first. When you go out please ensure that the door is closed and locked and the alarm is set. Thanks
host_about:
I grew up in East London and after working for a couple of years in the City I went to work in a ski resort in France. I then continued with my travels and spent time in Crete, New York (met my husband), Luxembourg,Tokyo (had my first son), Geneva and then after being away for 10 years I moved back to London and had my second son. I like cooking but my main passion is baking so you may get to sample some homemade cakes. I live with my husband Neill and my boys who are now 14 and 16
I still really enjoy travelling and over the last few years we had some amazing family holidays to Sri Lanka, last year we spent 3 weeks on the coast of Costa de la Luz which was stunning and we have just returned from 3 weeks travelling around NZ which is our new favourite place. I am rather partial to a glass of NZ sauvignon blanc and going to the gym when I have a free moment. I think I am a very hospitable host and am known for making people feel very welcome.
I have already hosted over 90 bookings so far  and I am really enjoying it. I really enjoy being hospitable and I think the effort I put in with welcome drinks, snacks and home made cakes has paid off with the lovely reviews guests have left. I hope to have many more guests. Unfortunately the London Mayor has imposed a limit of 90 nights per year for entire places and mine falls between an entire place and private room so once hosts have to list as private rooms it is harder to find as many good places. Thank you for looking at my place and please contact me with any questions you may have.

name: Stylish Two Bedroom Apartment in Southfields
summary: A two double bedroom spacious apartment in Southfields, a safe and quiet area of South West London. It is just 1 min walk from Southfields tube station, which gets you into central London in less than 25 mins. Bedroom 1 has a huge super king bed with luxurious linen. Bedroom 2 has a very comfortable double bed and both bedrooms have ample wardrobe and drawer space. The kitchen is fully equipped and the comfy living room has two sofas, HiFi and large TV with full Sky package. Fast WiFi.
space: Bedroom 1: Huge super king bed with luxurious linen. Wardrobe and chest of drawers. Large widescreen TV with full Sky package. Two bedside tables. Roberts digital radio. Bedroom 2: Very comfortable double bed. Wardrobe and chest of drawers. Bedside table. Living Room: Two sofas, HiFi, large flatscreen TV with full Sky package (sports and films).  Kitchen: Cooker (over, grill and hob), fridge, freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer, Nespresso coffee maker, toaster and kettle.  Bathroom: Bath, shower, basin and toilet.
description: A two double bedroom spacious apartment in Southfields, a safe and quiet area of South West London. It is just 1 min walk from Southfields tube station, which gets you into central London in less than 25 mins. Bedroom 1 has a huge super king bed with luxurious linen. Bedroom 2 has a very comfortable double bed and both bedrooms have ample wardrobe and drawer space. The kitchen is fully equipped and the comfy living room has two sofas, HiFi and large TV with full Sky package. Fast WiFi. Bedroom 1: Huge super king bed with luxurious linen. Wardrobe and chest of drawers. Large widescreen TV with full Sky package. Two bedside tables. Roberts digital radio. Bedroom 2: Very comfortable double bed. Wardrobe and chest of drawers. Bedside table. Living Room: Two sofas, HiFi, large flatscreen TV with full Sky package (sports and films).  Kitchen: Cooker (over, grill and hob), fridge, freezer, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer, Nespresso coffee maker, toaster and kettle.  Bathroom: Bath,
neighborhood_overview: The flat is in the heart of Southfields which has a unique villagey feel for London. Southfields tube station (1 minute walk away) connects directly to all the sites of central London. Wimbledon Park is a 5 minute walk away, Wimbledon Common a 10 minute walk and Richmond Park a 10 minute cycle ride.
notes: The bathroom is not on the same level as the bedrooms. The bathroom is on the first level (along with the hallway, living room and kitchen). Bedroom 1 is on level 2 and bedroom 2 on level 3. To access the first level of the flat you need to climb two stairs (one external staircase and one in the entrance hall). These are not difficult stairs at all but the apartment is not recommended for people with limited mobility.  Towels, bed linen, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel provided.
transit: Southfields Tube station is less then 1 minutes walk away. It's on the Wimbledon branch of the District Line making journeys to central London easy (e.g South Kensington: 20 minutes, Victoria 25 minutes, Oxford Circus: 30 mins). The Bus stop is also less then a 1 minutes walk away. The 39 bus goes to Clapham Junction (approx. 10-15 mins). From Clapham there are frequent trains to Gatwick Airport (25 minutes).
access: Guest have the flat to themselves. This includes 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchen, bathroom and hallway.
interaction: You will have the place to yourself. No one else will be staying there!
house_rules: - No shoes in the house please

name: Large Room in Notting Hill Flat with Roof Terrace
summary: Located in minutes from Portobello Road we are situated on the top floor of a charming Victorian building that captures stunning views overlooking the Grand Central Canal from a spacious decked terrace. 15 minutes to Central London 3 min walk to Underground 5 min walk to Portobello Road 10 min walk to the hustle and bustle of Notting Hill and Little Venice  10 minutes from Paddington Train Station 24-Hour buses into Central London from your doorstep
space: Let us welcome you to our gorgeous, spacious and bright flat.  Split over three floors of a Victorian building, and overlooking the grand central canal from our large decked terrace with skylights and bay windows that allow the flat to fill with natural light.  The perfect home away from home for your London vacation. The flat itself is a beautiful, bright and sun-filled maisonette spread over two floors with the entire top floor being a massive living room leading onto a large south facing, a sunny decked terrace that overlooks Notting Hill and the Grand Central Canal. This clean and spacious apartment is spread over two floors with each room containing super high ceilings, wood floors, floor to ceiling bay window in the reception room, skylights, separate fully fitted kitchen complete with washing machine and dish washer, three gorgeous double bedrooms and a bathroom with both a fully fitted bath and shower.
description: Located in minutes from Portobello Road we are situated on the top floor of a charming Victorian building that captures stunning views overlooking the Grand Central Canal from a spacious decked terrace. 15 minutes to Central London 3 min walk to Underground 5 min walk to Portobello Road 10 min walk to the hustle and bustle of Notting Hill and Little Venice  10 minutes from Paddington Train Station 24-Hour buses into Central London from your doorstep Let us welcome you to our gorgeous, spacious and bright flat.  Split over three floors of a Victorian building, and overlooking the grand central canal from our large decked terrace with skylights and bay windows that allow the flat to fill with natural light.  The perfect home away from home for your London vacation. The flat itself is a beautiful, bright and sun-filled maisonette spread over two floors with the entire top floor being a massive living room leading onto a large south facing, a sunny decked terrace that overlooks Notting Hil
neighborhood_overview: With Portobello Road, Notting Hill, and Little Venice literally at your door step, you will never get bored. A ten minute stroll along the canal takes you to the quaint cafes and famous shops of Portobello Market and Notting Hill. A few minute walk in the opposite direction takes you to the broad avenues of Little Venice and Maida Vale with their own array of chic boutiques and restaurants.
notes: There is a late night check in fee of £10.00 per booking for any Guests arriving outside of the normal check in hours.
transit: Transportation could not get any easier with the underground station only three minutes away which will whisk you into the heart of the city in just 15 minutes.   24 Hour bus routes from the end of the street make traveling anywhere in London safe and easy. Only 10 minutes from Paddington train station for overground trains to sites outside of London like Stonehenge or the English Sea Side.
access: Guests are encouraged to make themselves at home and enjoy all common areas of the flat.  This includes kitchen, bathroom, lounge, dining area, large south facing decked terrace with fantastic views over Notting Hill and the Grand Central Canal.
interaction: I would be so happy to welcome you to London.  I will do all I can to make your trip special and provide you with any information you require throughout your stay.  I am reachable by phone anytime and am happy to help save you time and money with top tips on travel, and local insight on the best tourist spots, bars and restaurants this city has to offer.
house_rules: We ask kindly for our guests to remove their outdoor shoes while in the house.  The floors are all wood so you may bring indoor shoes, slippers or flip flops to wear while in the flat. Please do not show up earlier than the agreed check in time.  Guests showing up early will not be permitted access. There is STRICTLY no loitering or waiting outside the building prior to check in.  Please note that by doing so will cancel your reservation.  There are no additional guests permitted inside the property at any time.  All guests must be register and approved through the air bnb booking system.   Smoking is ONLY permitted on the terrace and never indoors We ask our guests to kindly clean after themselves when using common areas Late check must be requested prior to booking.  Fees may apply and we may not be able to accommodate.

neighborhood_overview: It’s immediately clear that the East End – more than anywhere else in London – is an irresistible mix of old and new. On one hand, it’s home to a flower market established way back in 1869 and, on the other, it’s where you can slide down a work of art, traverse the Thames at a great height, be an animal at one of the top city farms in London and dive into the best pop-ups and club nights in town. Cast your Shoreditch assumptions aside, and go explore the best bits that east London has to offer.
notes: We have a new TV in the lounge now- it is a Smart TV so you can logon to your Netflix etc, or access free BBC iPlayer.  I have also brought in 4 new chairs for the property so there are now plenty of chairs for all!
transit: The apartment is located eight minutes walk from Upton Park tube station (District line). The London Eye: 40 minutes by tube  The Tower of London: 25 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport:  80 minutes by tube and train Gatwick Airport:  85 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 45  minutes on the tube National Gallery: 45 minutes by tube
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay

If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.
host_about:
Photographer and Designer

 I've renovated a genuine open plan commercial loft check out the pictures, 3 blocks from the L train, it's a large space, with 2 double beds, great for photographers or artists,

I also have renovated a large stone house in the South of France, close to Perpignan and the Mediterranean sea.

I travel a lot  internationally with work (photography),and am happy for people to stay on a daily or weekly basis,please email me to discuss. 

The loft is 1 block from the first New York Loft Hostel, and the amazing Roberto's pizza bar/restaurant, MOMO sushi, TuTu s Bar, 24hr Deli..
It's a 3 minute walk to the L train, Morgan Ave, 7 minutes to Williamsburg, and 15 minutes to Union Square, Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview: Maida Vale is one of London's prime residential areas, and it is also known for its shops and restaurants, as well as the Canal Cafe Theatre , the Puppet Theatre Barge , the Waterside Café and the Warwick Castle pub. A regular waterbus service operates from Little Venice eastwards around Regent's Park , calling at London Zoo and on towards Camden Town .  Maida Vale Studios  is a complex of seven BBC studios (of which five in regular use) on Delaware Road, Maida Vale, London. It has been used to record thousands of classical music, popular music and drama sessions for BBC Radio 1, BBC Radio 2, BBC Radio 3 and BBC Radio 4 from 1946 to the present. On Octob(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), BBC Radio 1 celebrated 75 Years of Maida Vale by exclusively playing 75 tracks recorded at the studios over the years.  There are many public transport connections such as tube (With Bakerloo line) trains,  buses and overground, between Maida Vale and rest of London. In addition, there are many several bus routes

There is a late check in fee of £40 for check ins after 20:00 and until 22:00.  Check- ins after 22:00 are not possible. Thank you for very much for understanding !

name: Modern 2bed 2bath flat in Kensington/Holland Park
summary: Nicely furnished and decorated large 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment, situated in one of the best areas of London (Holland Park and High Street Kensington). Olympia Exhibition Centre is just a 3 miutes walk. There are excellent transport links nearby making it is easy to reach London main attractions. The new Design Museum is just a few minutes walk from the flat. There are a lot of shops, restaurants, bars and supermarkets nearby. There are blackout curtains in the bedrooms and a private garden.
space: The flat is spacious, especially the living area where there is a big and comfy sofa (if the booking is for 5 people a person  can sleep here comfortably). There is plenty of space in the bedrooms too and space to hang and keep your clothes and belongings. I provided clean towels and linen at the beginning of each stay.  The kitchen is very modern and all the appliances are new: there is an oven, extractor and hobs to cook your meals. There is basic crockery and cutlery, a few pots and a pan.  There is also a washing machine and a dishwasher (there is no a dryer but there is a drying racket to air dry your clothes). There is also an iron and ironing board. There is a hairdryer too.  During the winter the patio can have some leaves but we try to keep it clean during the summer so you can enjoy having breakfast or relaxing outside. The patio is perfect for families with kids too as the kids can play here. If the booking is for 5 people, the 5th person can sleep in the sofa (it is not a s

neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in one of the best areas in London, to live and to explore the city. It is situated between High Street Kensington and Holland Park.  High street Kensington is a popular place for shopping. There are also great restaurants, bars and places to go out at night. If you prefer to cook at home, there is a Whole Foods Market or other supermarkets nearby.  The area is safe and London main attractions are only a stone's throw away. The location is especially convenient for those with little time in London as the mains attractions are very close by and there are great transport links from the flat. Olympia exhibition centre is just 2 minutes away from the flat, perfect if you are attending a convention or exhibition here.  Westfields Shopping Centre is at the end of the street in Sheperhd Bush.It is one of the biggest malls in London with plenty of shops, supermarkets, boutiques and restaurants.  If you want to go out there are cocktail bars and exclusive clubs nearby: The R

summary: This fantastic apartment is located in the upmarket neighbourhood of Kensington in a beautiful Victorian terrace building. The apartment has 2 bedrooms, a modern bathroom and lovely open plan kitchen/ dining and seating area. This would be the perfect property for up to four people looking for a luxurious place to stay in a quieter neighbourhood but still extremely easily accessible to Central London.
space: This apartment is beautifully decorated and spacious. It is located in a quintessentially British Victorian terrace building. There is a lovely open plan kitchen, living and dining room, luxurious bathroom, 2 bedrooms, 1 with a set of bunk beds and the other with a double bed. If you are a group of 5, there is a single fold-up bed available for use.  Please let us know if you would like use of this bed since it is a fold away bed and would be made up for you on your arrival.  LIVING AREA / KITCHEN / DINING AREA The open plan living area is a lovely light and airy room due to the two large windows and high ceilings. neighborhood_overview: Kensington is an affluent district within the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea in West London. Kensington is inundated with bars, restaurants and high end shops. Holland Park is just a 7 minute walk away. This is a great place to take an afternoon walk on a sunny day. In Holland Park there is the famous Japanese style Kyoto Gardens.  Kensington is home to some of the best museums and galleries that London has to offer. This includes the Natural History Museum and The Victoria and Albert Museum. These museums have plenty of different displays and exhibitions on all year round, so there will always be something that will take your fancy.
notes: - Please note that last-minute reservations being made within 24 hours from the arrival date are subject to a change in check-in time of 6 P.M instead of 3 P.M.  - The property will only accept the number of adults booked as per the booking confirmation. Any additional guests not confirmed on the booking will not be accepted. - Each guest will be asked to present a form of identification once the reservation has been created and upon check-in.  - This property will not accommodate hen, stag or similar parties. - This property is located in a residential area and guests are asked to refrain from excessive noise. - Guests must leave the property in the same state as when they checked-in. Should the above policies are not respected, a penalty fee would therefore apply to the guest(s) for any damages caused to the property.
transit: The apartment is in an fantastic location in terms of being able to get around London quickly and easily. The closest tube station is Kensington Olympia, which is a short 5 minute walk away. Kensington Olympia has connections to the London Overground network and also the District line on weekends and some public holidays. However there is also a number of other tube stations within walking distance. Including Shepard’s Bush (14 minute walk away), High Street Kensington (15 minute walk away), Earls Court (18 minute walk away).  If you don’t fancy taking the tube there are a number of different bus stops on Holland Rd and Kensington High Street. From these bus stops you will be able to catch a bus into Central London and surrounding areas.
access: You will have access to the whole property. Linen, bed sheets, body lotion and shampoo will be provided.
interaction: My friends at City Relay are looking after my home while I am away. They're a management service team of Londoners who are hosts themselves. I trust them to give you a warm welcome! City Relay will look after you.  We would like to mention the 3 methods for check-in:  1. You can meet us at our Central London Reception Desk in Earl's Court - next to Earl's Court Underground Station where we will provide a folder with all flat instructions, how to get there, tube maps, etc. and the keys to your apartment (The reception desk is open every day from 9am until 9pm).  2. You can book a Car Service through us. In this case, the driver will have the keys to your booked apartment and will take you there directly  3. We can arrange a check-in in-person at the flat. For a check-in after 8pm, a fee of £50 is applicable. Please let us know the most convenient way for you to do your check-in, so we can make your first day in London a good start!
house_rules: Please note our house rules:  -All guests are required to present their passport or drivers license in person as part of the check in process -There must be at least one adult over the age of 21 in your group -You may not have the majority of people in your group under the age of 21" - As you may be aware, London has a 90 day policy on Short Term Holiday Lets.  In order to allow me to continue sharing my home with guests like yourself, sometimes I allow people to rent my property for longer periods at certain times of the year.  This means that from time to time, people ask to view the property in advance.  Although this is rare, if you do make a booking with me (and I’d love for you to stay!), please bear in mind that a viewing may take place, but I promise to let you know and it will be very short!
host_about:

I ski very badly, speak ropey French and have a Danish partner and beautiful 3 year old son.
...hope this helps

Bisous

With Barons Court and West Kensington Tube Stations are less than 10 minutes away from the apartment visit any part of London with a blink of an eye. space: Beautifully presented and spacious 2 bedroom split-level property situated in the vibrant and cosmopolitan West Kensington area of London.  With its open plan living area and kitchen, comfortable bedrooms and plenty of outdoor space, this property is absolutely perfect for small families or groups of friends that wish to stay in a stylish & modern property that provides excellent value for money.  The property is conveniently located just 5 minutes’ walk from West Kensington underground station on the district line, and at about 10 minutes of walking from Barons Court underground station on Piccadilly line which runs 24h on Friday and Saturday, so it’s a perfect spot for you, your family and friends to conveniently explore all the wonders that London has to offer. The interior of the property is located on a total of three levels, providing plenty of space for you and your party to enjoy. neighborhood_overview: The local area of West Kensington is vibrant and cosmopolitan, with plenty of shops, local supermarkets, cafes and restaurants close by, serving an array of food from all over the world. The property is situated in a well-maintained state-managed estate that’s just 5 minutes’ walk from West Kensington underground station, from which you can travel to many of London’s most treasured attractions within a matter of minutes.  South Kensington is just 3 stops on the underground and is home to the Natural History musuem, the science museum, Victoria and Albert Museum.  If you travel just slightly further for Victoria you’ll be in the home of Buckingham Palace, St James’s Park and the Embankment, where you may alight for Theatreland and the West End with all of its magnificent shops, bars, restaurants and attractions As well at the underground many local buses serve the area too. This is a wonderful opportunity to stay in a charming, spacious property that’s conveniently located right next to
notes: Linen, towels and bathroom essentials are all provided, as is a hairdryer. There is WiFi throughout the whole flat. If there is anything that has been missed out or if you have any questions at all please don't hesitate to get in touch!
transit: Sloane Square is also a very short journey away, and is probably one of London’s best streets for shopping, as well as home to the Saatchi gallery West Kensington also provides a direct link to Tower Hill – home to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. Central London can be reached in 30 minutes via Tube from Barons Court station, which is a 10-minute walk away from the apartment. A direct train to Heathrow Airport can also be taken from Barons Court and takes just 40 minutes. A variety of grocery stores are within a 10-minute walk of the property As well at the underground many local buses serve the area too.

If the heating is excessive, i.e. over £100 per month, you will be expected to cover this cost *Please note that once the booking is confirmed we will arrange a check-in time. space: The flat has been completely refurbished to very high standards featuring beautiful wooden floor on living room and fitted carpets for all the other rooms and the hall. It has a modern kitchen and two bathrooms. The massive living room offers a nice living space with a nice city viewing from 3 large windows. It features 2,  3 seaters sofa and a large dining table for up to 6 people. Very cosy and warm. One large master bedroom with a double size bed and ensuite modern bathroom. The second bedroom also has a double size bed. The second bathroom also with modern features and a modern standing shower. Please feel free to ask any questions, happy to help!

neighborhood_overview: I live in downstairs, you can ask me anything about the area and London as I feel I am really familiar with most of the things in London :)
notes: Archway is a hidden gem. This a real neighborhood yet minutes away by tube to Camden Town, Leicester Square and major tourist attractions. There are great parks. My favorite is Waterlow - 5 minutes away. Or try Hampstead Heath and hob nob with London's aristocrats. Picnic on the lawn of the stately Kenwood House. There are great restaurants: Check out St John's Tavern, one of London's best English gastropubs with a superb selection of cask ales, or Cinquecento (500) an amazing family run Italian Trattoria. Our friend Fiona does a delicious weekend brunch and homemade cakes at the Gate. Her vegetarian chili, eggs benedict and Irish breakfast are wonderful. I also recommend Hot Wok Kitchen for their Thai dishes, Harman Turkish Grill and the authentic English fish and chips experience at the King Fisher. If you'd rather cook, shopping is easy at the local farmer's market on Holloway Road or at one of the many supermarkets and local green grocers. To work it all off there's the Archway Lei
transit: My apartment is located in Central London across the street from Archway tube station (Northern Line) Excellent transport connections for speedy travel anywhere . Walk to Archway Tube station in 4-5 minutes to: - Camden Town (3 stops) - Angel (5 stops) -Oxford Circus (6 stops) -Notting Hill (10 Stops) Walk to Upper Holloway Overground station in 5 minutes to: - Hampstead Heath / Kenwood House: 2 train stops. - Highbury / Islington (5 stops) - Hackney (8 stops) There are 10 buses with stops within 3 minutes to take you anywhere in London, for example - Highgate Village: 2 bus stops (4 min) - Hornsey, London Bridge, Notting Hill Gate AIRPORT ARRIVALS From Luton, take a train to Kentish Town and then the Northern Line (2 stops). From Stansted, take a train to Tottenham Hale and then one stop on the Victoria line to Blackhorse Road and then the Overground (5 stops). From Heathrow, Gatwick and City airports, make your way to Euston or King's Cross tube station from where the Northern Line t

name: Modern and Spacious 2-Bedroom Flat In Old Street
summary: This beautiful and spacious flat boasts a large open plan living room with balcony access, and two cosy bedrooms.  Just off Old Street and under 5 minutes walk from the station, you couldn't imagine a better Central London location. There are many great restaurants in the area, and enviable transport links by bus or trains, meaning getting around London for meetings or sightseeing couldn't be easier.  With everything you need, this is the perfect home away from home for business travellers.
space: Come home through a private security gate, and into the delightful flat. The two bedrooms span off the hallway, with ensuite in the master bedroom which has a double bed, and a family bathroom for the twin room. My cleaners place fresh, hotel quality linen on the bed just before your arrival. At the end of the hall is the open plan living room, with the modern and fully equipped kitchen wrapping along one side, with a dining table and chairs. The large sofa invites you to sink in and relax at the end of busy days exploring London, and there's direct access from here to a private balcony. Even though you're just around the corner from the hustle and bustle of Old Street, the noise melts away creating a peaceful space to enjoy.

The large sofa invites you to sink in and relax at the en
neighborhood_overview: In Shoreditch, empty walls are future murals. The neighborhood’s industrial warehouses and dingy side streets offer plenty of potential space waiting to be reimagined. Old brick warehouses have transformed into interactive art galleries, and countless buildings have served as Banksy’s canvases. Shoreditch’s appeal as a creative playground stems (at least, in part) from an urban, gritty underbelly, but clean-cut treasures aren’t in short supply—Shoreditch’s design sensibilities also influence its trendy pubs and cafes.
transit: Old Street (Northern Line) is just a 5 minute walk away.  Liverpool Street (Central, Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan Lines) and Shoreditch High Street station (Overground) are about a 15 minute walk away.  The London Eye: 30 minutes on the tube and bus  The Tower of London: 20 minutes on the tube  Heathrow Airport: 65 minutes on the train and tube  Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by train  Kings Cross: 15 minutes on the tube  National Gallery: 30 minutes on the tube

notes: All Guests, including Children and Infants must be included in the reservation. *** FAQ's *** Q - Is the area safe? A - Yes, There are always lots of people around and it has a very 20s-40s vibe about it. Q - What Time is Check in?  A - 3:00pm - you will collect your key from Bell Boi coffee shop, 104 Sclater Street, E1 6HR  Q - Can I check in early?  A - Unfortunately not. Often there is a guest the night before and we can't kick them out early.  Q - Can I drop my bags there early?  A - No, but you can store your luggage at Bell Boi for £5 per locker, per day. Q - Do I have to walk up stairs A - Yes, to the 2nd floor Q- Can I check in Late. A- Yes we have a self check in system after 10pm, however we may not be able to assist you after 12am midnight. Q - What Time is Check Out? A - 11:00 am Q - Can I Check out late? A - No, Sorry Q- Is it completely Private A- Yes Q - Do I have the whole apartment? A - Yes Q - Can I have 6 single beds, i don't wont to share. A - No Q - Can I have 6 si
transit: We are situated in ZONE 1 which is the centre of the city. Near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. This is the City Centre officially. However, we are in the East End, NOT the West End as most tourists think (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st). It is still zone 1 but you will have to catch a short train or bus ride to the West End.  The Closest Transport is  UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Liverpool St Station & Aldgate East Station OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station BUS #25 & #23 just a few minutes away, takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) PARKING We don't have a private car spot for you. There is a paid parking lot 1 minute away, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. Most Parking is free on Saturdays and Sundays. There are free and paid spots around you just may need to search a little.
access: You have access to the whole apartment. house_rules: STRICT NO PARTY RULE! UK Residents PLEASE NOTE. Our listings are intended for tourist and business travellers only! Whilst we allow our listings to be used by UK residents for the intention of getting ready and sleeping after a night out in London we do not allow parties or any gatherings more than the total amount of guests allowed on the listing. If you are not a genuine tourist or business traveller please do not book with us. Any bookings from UK citizens will be monitored.  If you are deemed to be a UK resident that we believe has the intention of breaking our no party rule then you will be required to meet with us to receive your keys between the hours of 3pm and 10 pm. You will be required to provide Photo ID that matches your profile and you will be required to leave a £500 cash deposit. The deposit will be returned only after we have checked the listing. 1. Strictly No Smoking 2. No more than the 6 people to reside 3. No more than 6 people to be in the apartment at one time 4.

name: Bedsit-style bedroom w/ ensuite in Stoke Newington
summary: This bright double bedsit style room has an ensuite bathroom.  It is in a Victorian conversion set on a quiet residential street in Stoke Newington.
space: The accommodation is a bed-sit style double room, with basic kitchen facilities (see below for details) and a bathroom.  The bathroom has a modern shower, sink and toilet. A baby cot can be provided on request. The accommodation shares a front door with our private home but is self-contained and entirely separate from this.  The accommodation is private to guests and has its own lockable door. There is a digital television with DVD player, as well as wireless internet. Pets are in principle allowed on request but please provide full details when making the booking enquiry.  There is a green (Stoke Newington Common) at the end of the road which is suitable for dog toileting and many beautiful green spaces for dog walking nearby, such as Abney Park Cemetery, Clissold Park, Hackney Downs, the River Lea and Hackney and Walthamstow Marshes.
description: This bright double bedsit style room has an ensuite bathroom.  It is in a Victorian conversion set on a quiet residential street in Stoke Newington. The accommodation is a bed-sit style double room, with basic kitchen facilities (see below for details) and a bathroom.  The bathroom has a modern shower, sink and toilet. A baby cot can be provided on request. The accommodation shares a front door with our private home but is self-contained and entirely separate from this.  The accommodation is private to guests and has its own lockable door. There is a digital television with DVD player, as well as wireless internet. Pets are in principle allowed on request but please provide full details when making the booking enquiry.  There is a green (Stoke Newington Common) at the end of the road which is suitable for dog toileting and many beautiful green spaces for dog walking nearby, such as Abney Park Cemetery, Clissold Park, Hackney Downs, the River Lea and Hackney and Walthamstow Marshes. Kit
neighborhood_overview: There are a multitude of restaurants, bars, pubs within walking distance. We would be happy to provide recommendations and suggestions.
notes: The accommodation is roughly a 6 minutes walk to Stoke Newington High Street and 8 minutes to Stoke Newington Church Street.
transit: Rectory Road Overground Station is a 5 minutes walk; this provides direct access to London Fields, Bethnal Green, London Liverpool Street (which has a direct train line to London Southend Airport), Seven Sisters Station (Victoria Line tube access). There are otherwise a multitude of buses that provide access to Kings Cross, Euston, Dalston, Hoxton, Finsbury Park, Kentish Town. Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations are a short bus ride or roughly 25 minutes walk and provide access to stations such as Highbury and Islington, Camden Road, Hampstead Heath and Richmond. We are happy to provide parking permits upon request - this will be an additional fee to be paid for upon receipt.
access: Kitchen - please note that the bedsit does not have a full kitchen. It is equipped with a kettle, toaster, microwave and small fridge, along with general kitchen equipment such as cutlery, utensils, bottle opener etc. On request additional equipment may be available.  A variety of teas, coffee, milk, bread, butter and jams will be provided for a simple breakfast. Laundry - please note that there is not a washing machine in the bedsit, however clothes washing and hanging out can be done for a fee of £10 per wash on request depending on availability. Keys - please note that if the keys to the property are lost then we will need to charge £20 for replacements.  This is because the front door key is a security key provided by a specialist company.
interaction: We will greet you to provide keys to the property and will be generally available to provide any assistance or advice needed.  As we live in the accommodation attached to the bedsit help should be close at hand but otherwise your privacy will be respected!
house_rules: - Any damage will be charged to guests - Quiet hours: 11pm to 7am. Please note that the property is situated in a Victorian house which means that noise easily travels during quiet hours. There are families living in the properties either side, below and above, that can be disturbed during these times from such things as loud talking or loud television. We kindly ask that people up late at night or coming back from a night out are conscientious of the same. Thank you.

name: Awesome Double Room in London (BR5-I)
summary: I have a very comfortable double room waiting for you in NW London. Located in a quiet street, there is quick access to central London on the Jubilee line (which operates 24 hours throughout Friday and Saturday night) and 24 hours bus service. You can also access free street parking between 6:30 pm to 8:30 am. The room is available for short or long-term letting. This listing is very heavily booked but it may be worth looking at my other listing.
space: My home is beautiful and my visitors say it has a lovely tranquil feel to it. The kitchen is fully equipped, it’s bright. There is broadband wi-fi throughout the house. The bedroom is lovely and bright, and there is a desk, 4 chairs, a sofa, fresh towels and bed linen. I give my guests their own room key during their stay. Please be aware that you will be sharing the property with the owner or with other guests. The bedroom has lockable doors for security.

My guests have access to the bedroom they are staying in kitchen and bathroom. I also pr
neighborhood_overview: London is a multicultural melting pot that has built up a reputation as the most cosmopolitan city on Earth. Time permitting, you can expect to come across more than 300 languages and more than 270 nationalities. The area is full of great bars, restaurants, cafes and pubs. Notting Hill and Portobello Road are 3 miles from the house and the massive Westfield Shopping Centre and cinema is one stop away on the Overground from Willesden Junction. Note from my girlfriend: to those girls who haven’t ever been to a Westfield mall before: it is a life-changing experience. There are great sports facilities very close to the house. We are 10 to 15 min bus ride to Kensal Rise, Queens Park, Nothing Hill Gate and Shepherds Bush, where we have some lovely restaurants, bars, cinemas, pubs, parks and shops. We are also near the famous Portobello Road Market, where you will find the book shop in the film "Notting Hill” and World famous Alice’s antique shop featured in the Paddington Bear movie. We are
notes: The house is located in London’s zone 3 ( zone 6 being the furthest away from central London). If you are looking for a room under the Big Ben please keep looking. Please note that the zones do not apply to bus travel. You can travel by bus all over London (zones 1-6) with any Travelcard. You are staying in a friendly house, not a hotel. Please treat the house as you would treat your own home.
transit: Dollis Hill underground station is a 5-minute walk away, it takes 15-20 min. to get to the city centre (5 min. to Wembley Stadium and the SSE Arena, Wembley in the opposite direction) The Jubilee line operates 24 hours throughout Friday and Saturday night. Willesden Bus Garage is only a 2 minute’s walk from the house and there is also a wide selection of bus routes and 24 hours buses that run from Trafalgar Square, Russell Square and London Victoria Station.
access: My guests have access to the bedroom they are staying in kitchen and bathroom. I also provide free fiber optic internet access. All of these things are shared except the bedroom.
interaction: I love chatting with my guests over a cup of tea or coffee, although I’m also mindful of their privacy. Due to my very busy schedule, I don’t always have the chance to meet all my guests face to face. If you need to see me personally, please let me know. I have lived in London for the past 14 years and I thoroughly enjoy helping with first-hand advice about the city and suggesting itineraries.
house_rules: Registered guests only - strictly no visitors allowed. This house is for family trips, business trips, (decent) couple trips and tourism trips.  No smoking inside the house please, although it's ok to smoke outside in the garden. All windows need to be closed before guests go out. Please be considerate of other guests.
host_about:
My name is Julian and I’m an architect who loves to meet people and travel the world. Over the last few few years, my entrepreneurial spirit has led me to become an Airbnb Host and I’ve already hosted thousands of travellers from all over the world in my properties. I also run an online language school called Languages at Home where we help people of all backgrounds to learn and improve their language skills with live tuition with qualified native speakers.  
Before booking with me, please make sure you read the reviews of my previous guests and feel free to contact me if you have any questions about my listings.

name: Private Studio with Own Entrance and Garden
summary: This is  a self-contained studio apartment with its own private entrance and a beautifully arranged private garden with roof covered outside eating area . It is great for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and a young family with a toddler. I provide a free cot. There is a free parking on site.
space: Very conveniently located for travelling to London Centre (20 minutes drive to the famous Regent Street in West End and fabulous Regent Park), 4 stops to Kings Cross & St Pancrass for connection to Paris by Eurostar, 5 minute drive to The Royal Air Force Museum, Welsh Harp Reservoir and Boating Club, 5 minutes drive to Brent Cross Shopping Centre (the biggest shopping Centre in North London) with free parking, 15 minute drive to the Harry Potter Studio. Yet, when you get through the door into my garden studio you feel like you have just stepped into an English countryside cottage. It is private, peaceful and very quiet. I love travelling myself and travel a great deal. Wherever I am I always compare the place I stay at with mine and always look for ways to improve my place to enhance my guests experience of staying with me.

notes: Strictly no smoking anywhere on the premises. For fire safety please, no real flame candle burning. I provide battery powered candles.
transit: Hendon Station (main line Zone 3) is about 15 minute walk. Hendon Central is about 20 minute walk. Bus 32 to Paddington is 2 minute walk.
access: You will have an entire place with your own private entrance and a beautiful garden to yourself, a kitchenette and your own dining room, beautiful private bathroom with WC and a utility area with a washing machine.
interaction: Please don't hesitate to text me if you have questions or need assistance. I will try to reply to you as soon as I can and if I am at home you can approach me with your questions. Whether you need to book a taxi to the airport, or need an explanation on how to load the washing machine, I am here to help.
host_about:
I am a Londoner raised in New York and Russia.
I am a cosmetic dermatologist and an acupuncturist. 
I love travelling and often travel with my daughter all over the world for holidays and to attend training events and  science conferences relevant to my continuing  profession development.

name: Stylish apartment in Wembley Park
summary: Nice sized double room in new build apartment. Courtyard facing so no traffic noise. Right next to the London designer outlet. Wembley stadium a couple of minutes walk away.
space: The room is a good sized double with comfy bed and ample wardrobe space to hang your clothes. We also provide fresh towels and bedding to make your stay more comfortable.
description: Nice sized double room in new build apartment. Courtyard facing so no traffic noise. Right next to the London designer outlet. Wembley stadium a couple of minutes walk away. The room is a good sized double with comfy bed and ample wardrobe space to hang your clothes. We also provide fresh towels and bedding to make your stay more comfortable. Full use of entire apartment (except our bedroom of course!). There is a large kitchen with hob, oven, dishwasher, washer-dryer and large fridge freezer. Help yourself to tea and coffee! We also have a dining table and lounge with large TV which you're welcome to use. And why not have a drink on the balcony before your evening out in London. I'm Dermot and I'm from Dublin and Sid is from India. Between us we've lived in London for over 12 years. notes: We have a cat, she is very friendly and rather shy of visitors and mostly remains in our room when new people are around.

name: Saffron Hill Serviced Apartment 01 Bed 01 Bath
summary: Situated just a stone's throw from all of the bars and restaurants that Farringdon has to offer, Saffron Hill is Ideally located for those looking for easy transport around London. 03rd guest at £35 per night. Early Check-in / Late Check-in & Late Check-out basis availability and on payment of extra charges in advance. The apartment doesn't have a fixed reception. Our standard Check-in time is 3-8 PM.
space: Built moments away from Farringdon station, the location of this apartment means that most areas of London are within easy reach via public transport. Local supermarkets, bars and restaurants are all within easy access, making this the ideal property from someone looking to stay in London for a lengthy period of time. St. Pauls' Cathedral, The Thames and the South Bank all are within walking distance, so it is perfect for those looking to see the sights while staying the capital.

neighborhood_overview: Farringdon is a good-looking residential square of North London within walking distance of many of our favourite parts of the city, with Bank and the financial district are 20-minutes away on foot. You’re 5-minutes away from the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City tube lines as well as Farringdon train station with direct lines to Gatwick & Luton airports and St. Pancras International train station for the Eurostar. And while the financial giants remain in the City, much of the creative sector and smaller start-ups have preferred to extend out into Farringdon and Old Street. Both areas full of history and historically residential are becoming mini-cities with quirky work spaces for smaller businesses and dining options and watering-holes to meet the needs of their employees.
notes: Please share your exact scheduled time of arrival at the apartment for key handover. We have multiple units in the building which are similar in size and specs.
transit: Tube Farringdon 0.1 miles Chancery Lane 0.4 Miles Airports London City Airport 7.5 miles Heathrow Airport 17.7 miles Gatwick Airport 26.9 miles Luton Airport 31.1 miles Train Stations Farringdon 0.1 miles Moorgate 1.1 miles Buses A number of buses can be found in close proximity of the apartment
interaction: Available on e-mails, phone calls and Airbnb messaging - 24*7
host_about: We are part of a Serviced Apartments & Hotel's Company based in London. We manage and operate a portfolio of high quality serviced Apartments in London. Our clientele are mostly professionals relocating to London, or Business and Leisure Individuals & families visiting the city for a short break. We have an on-site Manager, several Front Desk Professionals and professional housekeeping staff. Our Reservations desk works around the clock to answer your queries expeditiously.

name: Modern London Penthouse with city views
summary: A modern penthouse apartment with a wrap-around balcony to take in the sky & city views. Bright, spacious & tastefully decorated with natural themes & greenery; a welcome calm amidst London's hustle & bustle. Enjoy it in our absence for a minimum stay of 5 days. Stay in London's historic East End, close to trendy Shoreditch, Brick Lane & Liverpool Street whilst enjoying the scenic beauty of Victoria Park & Regents Canal on your doorstep. 10 mins walk to the metro which runs 24 hours at weekends
space: Our modern but personable apartment is yours to enjoy when we're away travelling. 9th floor penthouse apartment with lift/elevator, easy 10 minute walk to the Underground/Metro. 2 bedrooms - 1 with queen bed, another with king bed, desk & wide screen monitor to connect your laptop to.  Egyptian cotton linens, wardrobe space & hangers, towels and hairdryers provided. Large bathroom with shower and bath. Fresh coffee at the press of a button and light breakfast goodies (cereal, oats, granola, toast, fresh fruits) and tea included. Fully eqyipped kitchen with dishwasher if you want to prepare a meal at home or places to eat within easy walking distance if you'd rather take it easy!

Egyptian cotton linens, wardrobe space & hangers, towels and hairdryers provided. Large bathroom with shower and bath. Fresh coffee at the press of a button and light breakfast goodies (cereal, oats, granola, toas
neighborhood_overview: East London is known for its great cultural diversity, buzzing markets, street art, bars and restaurants.  Our apartment is set back from Regents Canal & surrounded by several large parks. A 10 minute walk along the canal or through leafy Mile End Ecological Park gets you to Mile End underground station (central & district lines into the city) and a range of shops, cafes and restaurants.  You can see the Shard & Gherkin buildings from our balcony so you know you're within easy reach of the city. A short bus trip or leisurely walk to buzzing Shoreditch and Brick Lane, for amazing street art, weekend markets, bars and restaurants as well as the famous Columbia Road flower market on Sundays - not to be missed! Tower of London & London Bridge is 3 or 4 stops on the underground (district line) and carry on to Westminster Abbey, Big Ben etc.  For amazing shopping Westfield Shopping Centre Stratford (along with Olympic Park & the Arc Orbittal - Europe's highest slide) is 2 or 3 stops along on
transit: GETTING HERE: 10 minutes walk along the canal from Mile End Underground Station (Central and District lines) or 15 mins by Uber/cab from Liverpool Street station.  The Stanstead Express bus to/from the airport stops at Mile End station.  GETTING AROUND: There are bus stops at the end of our road or for the more active/adventurous, cycling is a great way to avoid London traffic and take in the sights. Bike hire docks are also at the end of our street. PUBLIC TRANSPORT TRAVEL TIMES Shoreditch/Brick Lane: 15 min Westfield Stratford (shopping): 20min Tower Bridge: 30 min Oxford Street: 30 min  Trafalgar Square/Covent Garden: 30min Westminster/Big Ben/Houses of Parliament: 35 min
access: Our apartment is yours! Please make yourself at home and enjoy it as we do. Fully equipped kitchen with coffee machine and dishwasher. Help yourself to fresh coffee each morning and a light breakfast from the guest cupboard (cereal, granola, oats, toast), and use whatever appliances, crockery, cutlery you need. A guest cupboard is available for your convenience in the kitchen along with space in the fridge. A lovely organic grocer, Simply Fresh, is just around the corner on Roman Road, 5 mins walk or make the most of the farmers market in Victoria park on a Sunday. Smoking is only permitted on the balcony.
interaction: Our whole apartment is only available to rent at times when we will be traveling so whilst we won't be around in person we are available by email/ (Hidden by Airbnb) for any questions you may have during your stay. Once your booking is confirmed, I can offer suggestions on the best options for getting here depending on which airport/station you're arriving into. Self check-in allows for complete flexibility 24/7. Check out is also flexible. Please drop me a message to discuss your trip to London.
house_rules: - Lost keys and door fobs will incur a charge of £50. - Smoking is only allowed on the balcony. (Not out of windows.) - No parties
host_about: My partner and I (French and South African respectively) are avid travelers and have enjoyed the Airbnb experience as guests for a number of years whilst chasing the sun or seeing new cities. We recently decided to take it one step further and become Airbnb hosts too. Now we can delight in sharing vibrant London with other lovely, adventurous spirits!
