host_about:
Hi all,

We are originally a Spain couple living in London since 2009 who loves bringing people together with good food and selective wine in a beautiful setting. Having rented properties for almost 4 years now,  which inspired us to use Airbnb as an option for travellers to provide accommodation and improving little things that make a place special to enjoy your visiting a new place.

One of the best things we really love about living in London is exploring delicious food, culture and diversity, interesting people so we got familiar with almost everything  you should know about this cosmopolitan city.

No problem with late check-in and early check-out  as we live locally.

Come and enjoy our lovely place any season of the year.

We look forward to meeting you!

name: Beautiful Gatehouse in Central London-Zone 2
summary: This charming and stylishly decorated, single storey, two bedroom cottage is situated in the leafy Zone 2 suburb of Putney. It is light and airy with high ceilings and exposed beams in the large reception room. With its good sized bedrooms, comfy double beds and crisp, luxury linen, it makes an ideal bolthole for those who like a little peace and quiet whilst also being close to London's main attractions. Transport links are only a 5-10 mins walk away. Suitability: Couples, Singles, Families.
space: Set in a peaceful, quiet courtyard just 3 minutes walk from the bustling shops and restaurants of Putney High Street.  The property is light and airy with a large reception room that boasts high pointed ceilings, exposed beams and working gas fire, perfect for those chillier evenings. The compact kitchen has everything you need to cook up your favourite dish whilst both bedrooms are a good size, with comfy double beds in each. Both rooms are warm and inviting and have lovely, luxury linen from the White Company. The bathroom has a combined bath and shower along with a single sink and toilet.  N.B- We also have a fold out single bed on request (this is a good option for young children as it is slightly lower to the ground, obviously it's still suitable for adults). We can either set this up in the main bedroom or in the living area.

neighborhood_overview: Local Supermarkets- Waitrose - Putney Exchange Shopping Centre, Putney High Street (5 mins walk) Marks and Spencer - 59 Putney High St (5 mins walk) Sainsbury’s- 2-6 Werter Road (6 mins walk) Butchers Parson's Nose Food Shop - 88 Lower Richmond Rd (Obviously you can get all your meat at the supermarket but if you want something a little special then head here) Bakery Lazaro Artisan Bakery - 232 Upper Richmond Rd, London SW15 6TG (If you fancy something freshly baked that day head here) Local restaurants You will find lots of places in Putney many of which are located on Putney High Street or on the Lower or Upper Richmond Road but here are some places I quite like. Burgers For a good burger Five Guys is great, however it is more of a quick bite kind of place alternatively head to Byron which is more of a restaurant/diner and serves other things other than burgers. Has a good kids menu. Both Located on Putney High Street. Pizza Pizza Express 144 Upper Richmond Rd, London SW15 2SW.  This
transit: The Tube is only a 5-10 mins walk away and you can either go to Putney Bridge Station or East Putney Station both are serviced by the District line. There's a fast overland service that has trains to Waterloo and Clapham Junction, which depart every 5-10 mins, this is situated in Putney High Street, only a 5 mins walk away from the property. There's numerous buses that you can catch into Central London or out to Wimbledon, Richmond and Kingston. Bus stops can be found on Putney High Street, Putney Bridge and the Upper and Lower Richmond Road. There's a River Boat Bus service which you can pick up at Putney Pier. Please check times and destinations before travel.  You can also hire bikes all over London just look out for the docking stations, there is one on the Lower Richmond Road only a 5 mins walk from the property.  Taxis- you should be able to hail a black cab from Putney High street. There is a black taxi rank right outside the overland train station at the top of Putney High stre
access: Guests can access all parts of the property.
interaction: I will do my best to help you with anything or give advice on places to go. When I can, I will check guests in personally but for added flexibility, there is a key safe to allow for self check-in.
house_rules: Under 21's must have an adult staying in the property. Only named guests can stay at the property. You must leave the property as you found it. There is limited parking onsite, therefore I can not promise a parking space but if you let me know in advance I will do my very best to try and secure you one. Please respect the neighbours.

name: Spacious double private room with own bathroom/WC
summary: Bright spacious double room in detached Edwardian home. The room provides a double bed and two seater sofa and a freeview TV.  An iron ironing board and airer are also provided together with ample wardrobe and drawer space. There is  an adjacent private shower room with WC. Both rooms are located on their own floor.
space: We are located in South Croydon very close to Sanderstead station (4 mins walk) and Purley Oaks station (7 mins walk) with frequent rail services to East Croydon, London Victoria, London Bridge, Gatwick airport.

name: Unique large bedroom in Victorian home
summary: Stop scrolling! If you're looking for somewhere to explore London from then you've found it.  My Victorian home has a spare double bedroom that's waiting for you. It's the best room in the flat with a beautiful large window and a comfortable bed. Perfect for however long you need somewhere in this beautiful city.  Just down the road you'll find lots of buses to take you in and out of London throughout the day and night. Get in touch if you have any questions.
space: "If Victorian England met Denmark". That's how my flat been described. I bought this lovely place last year and have spent the year fixing it all up. The building is over 100 years old but everything in it is new and my style is inspired by the best of London and my time in Germany many years ago. The bedroom is very quiet and in the mornings you'll either see a fox sleeping in the neighbour's garden or hear a cockerel welcoming you to a new day. Perfect!

neighborhood_overview: Peckham is a very up-and-coming area of London and is constantly changing. There are plenty of lovely cafes in the area and the hidden gem of Southwark Park is not too far. From there you can enjoy a walk along the river too.
transit: There are 4 bus routes that run throughout the day to take you straight into central London in 30 minutes or less. There are also night buses and because it's so close an Uber isn't very expensive either.
access: You're welcome to use the living room and the bathroom too.
interaction: I'll be available to let you in and make sure you're settled. I imagine if you're visiting that you'd rather be out exploring London but just as happy to enjoy a chat and a drink. I'll be staying in the flat (it has two bedrooms).
house_rules: - No shoes in the house
host_about:
Born in London to parents who made the journey across from India. I love the city and love travel in equal amounts. I lived in Germany for a while and now make a living working in PR. I am also a writer and love getting to know new people. 

I'm a laid back traveller - prefer to get out and about to see new places and experience new things. Don't usually have many things so don't make too much of a mess!

A returnable key will be given to you upon your arrival to feel free to come and g
neighborhood_overview: Free street parking 5pm to 9am , free off street available when needed. Free on Sundays
notes: Remember Airbnb is like internet dating for Accommodation so  Please read the Profile first otherwise you will get a shock when you discover that there is no Television and that you have to have the pleasure of Bathing in an old style Bathtub ( with a shower cable ), Please look at the Photos first and see if you will be a suitable guest  Removal of shoes Helpful once inside and  Please be mindful of excessive noise caused opening and closing doors , Moving suitcases upstairs etc . Gratitude in Advance
transit: From Heathrow Terminals 123 Central bus Station you have the option to take the London red buses  number's 140 and 285 and 111 and 105  and the 555 , It's within the free Heathrow travel zone and ask the Driver to let you know which Stop will be the Marriot Hotel , Bath Rd  and i am on  New Road which is about 25 metres away to the left just before the bus stop .
access: Entrance is From the Main Front door of the house which opens into a small private Hallway at the Bottom of the stairs , at the top of the stairs the Bathroom is on the left hand side and the Guest Bedroom is straight ahead. A returnable key will be given to you upon your arrival to feel free to come and go as you please .
interaction: I can offer flexible check-in and check-outs time as long as it does not effect other bookings So Send Enquiry first before booking Please to see if i can accomodate You at your preferred Check in time ( there will be an extra charge for this and depends on your expected arrival time at the property)
house_rules: To keep my costs down please be mindful of electricity and water wastage  during your stay but more importantly the strain it puts on the planet as a whole .
host_about:
Hi I'm Gary , People would say that i am Easy Going , Friendly and very Helpful 
I worked for an Airline (29 years)and recently decided to simplify my life and be more creative ,I am into my Fitness , wellbeing, surfing, yoga and mountain biking seem to be favourites .
I like to spend time in Nature ,whether it be at the Ocean or in the mountains 
while in my Campervan .

name: Lovely double room in trendy East London.
summary: Large double room in four bedroom flat in London Fields, in trendy East London, near Shoreditch and Dalston. The property consists of a bathroom and a separate toilet, all kept clean and tidy. The room has plenty of space, there is one double bed, two large wardrobes, a table, a chair. 5 min walk from Hoxton Station, Overground. 10 min walk from Bethnal Green Station, Central Line. 1 min walk from buses to Liverpool Street (15 min), Shoredict (10 min), Oxford Street (25 min), Stratford (15 min).
space: The room is very bright and overlooks the internal communal area of the building. It is generally quiet at any time as there are strict silence rules in the neighbourhood. For your comfort, you'll have a built-in wardrobe with a large full-length mirror, a large table and a chair in your room.
description: Large double room in four bedroom flat in London Fields, in trendy East London, near Shoreditch and Dalston. The property consists of a bathroom and a separate toilet, all kept clean and tidy. The room has plenty of space, there is one double bed, two large wardrobes, a table, a chair. 5 min walk from Hoxton Station, Overground. 10 min walk from Bethnal Green Station, Central Line. 1 min walk from buses to Liverpool Street (15 min), Shoredict (10 min), Oxford Street (25 min), Stratford (15 min). The room is very bright and overlooks the internal communal area of the building. It is generally quiet at any time as there are strict silence rules in the neighbourhood. For your comfort, you'll have a built-in wardrobe with a large full-length mirror, a large table and a chair in your room. The room is very bright and faces the communal garden with trees, flowers, and squirrels playing all the time. It is generally quiet at any time as there are strict silence rules in the neighbourhood. Als
neighborhood_overview: The property is located in London Fields, the coolest area of London. This area has been named the most trendy neighborhoods across Europe so you will be crossing path with hipsters, artists, designers, and mostly edgy characters. It is a really good location with Broadway market and Columbia Road Flower market just few minutes away (see photos). Brick lane and Shoreditch are also only 15 minutes away. There are many pubs, bars and clubs in the area, the area is very safe and the atmosphere is really friendly! You will surely have an exciting time.
notes: If you will be arriving very early, or very late, please let me know in advance. If keys are lost there will be a £25 charge to replace them and guest will be responsible for all locksmith costs.
transit: Several tube stations and bus stops are close by the flat. Only 5 min walk to Hoxton Station (Overground); 5 min walk to Cambridge Heath Station (Overground); 10 min walk to Bethnal Green Station (Central Line); 1 min walk to buses 23 and 48 to Liverpool Street (15 min), bus 55 to Shoredict (10 min) and Oxford Street (25 min), bus 388 to Stratford (15 min).
access: The room is very bright and faces the communal garden with trees, flowers, and squirrels playing all the time. It is generally quiet at any time as there are strict silence rules in the neighbourhood. Also, I will provide one large towel for each guest and a hairdrier.
interaction: I will be at the Airbnb to greet you and check you in, and during your stay i will be available and contactable by email or phone whenever you may need.
house_rules: Please note the following rules are set to give you the best quality experience throughout your stay at my Airbnb. I thank you in advance for your understanding. 1) Please respect quiet hours so from 22:00 to 10:00am no loud noise please no music in the room, no chat in the corridor/shared hallway, and don’t slam doors. 2) The use of the kitchen is limited and you can only use the fridge, the microwave, and the toaster. 3) Also the use the washing machine is not permitted, but if you need to wash your clothes there is a laundrette few minutes away or a pick-up service online. 3) Smoking is not allowed anywhere in the flat nor in the rooms, but you are welcome to smoke downstairs in the inner courtyard. 4) Please do not open drawers and cabinets, and please do not take/eat food or stuff that do not belong to you. 5) As some space is shared, please be tidy and clean after yourself: don’t leave your belongings around, rinse the bath after you shower, clean the toilet after you use it. 6)

Kindly also make sure to have a clear profile picture of yourself, as per Airbnb rules. - We reserve the right to ask all guests about their full names, date of birth, nationality, email and phone numbers, social media profiles ( (Hidden by Airbnb) or linkedin) for verification and insurance purposes after booking and before arrival, and also ask for passport or national ID upon arrival - No smoking, no vaping, and no drugs whatsoever - No parties or loud music at all. this is a residential block with other residents - Kindly take off your shoes every time you enter the flat. - Please leave the flat in the same condition you found it - please wipe surfaces in kitchen and bathroom and put all litter in the trash bin - The person who booked the place needs to be present at checkin. If you are booking on someone else's be
host_about:
Finance professional turned tech-entrepreneur. I have lived in Hong Kong, Paris and been in London for over six years. An avid-traveller myself. I love food, dancing a bit of salsa every now and then and playing my guitar. Have an engineering major and an economics minor - studied in University of Michigan, Ann Arbor.
 
 I love exploring London - and still feel like so many areas in London, so many nice restaurants, bars and cafes are left unexplored. Would not mind giving my advice to explore the best bits of London to my guests

host_about:
Myself, I am Shah Islam settled and have family, living in London, United Kingdom  since 1976. I have been educated in London from the age of 14 years and studied at  college and achieve diploma in Health and social care. I had various job and businesses. I  have recently started hosting my own property in the city of London through Airbnb and I am very much looking forward to give services and take care of my guests. 

When I travel as a Airbnb guest:
I always fell lik to have a comfortable stays and to achieve that  I have to prepare my self and for that I always organise everything in advance i.e. where I am staying, looking at the place, locations, instructions and information from Airbnb listing and directly from the host. Following the instructions is vital to be aware of the House Rules. Under any circumstances, I would contact the host for helping me or resolving any issues. I would be careful of not disturbing anyone. And all the time I am a guest in any where, I gets wonderful stays and not only that, but  reviews I get is 5 star and host become as one more of my family member. 

As being a host, I like to give my guest a 5 Star services and do what ever possible and necessary to make their trip and stays are enjoyable in London. My aim is to provide a hygienic clean place for my guests comfortable stays in my place and I have the knowledge and experience in letting properties as I used run my own estate agent for 15 years as well as  customer care service in catering industry which I had managed my own restaurant.

name: Spacious, modern London apartment
summary: A brand new, luxury, first floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with sunny balcony and secure parking in North West London. WiFi, two TVs.  Central location, easy access to Southbank, West End, Notting Hill, Camden, close to everything.
space: Apartment Description This modern, spacious, bright, exceptionally well equipped and stylish first floor apartment was built in 2017 and provides fantastic accommodation for 4 people in the heart of London, with excellent transport links to London and the south and west of England. The apartment comprises approx 98 square metres of living space, which is furnished with utmost attention to detail, new beds and bed linen, plenty of towels, fully equipped kitchen and outdoor space to relax on the balcony overlooking communal gardens. In addition, there is a secure parking space in the garage below the flat, and a lift. A baby cot and baby chair are provided on request.  Accommodation From the spacious, private hallway you enter the open plan living room/dining and kitchen area. A comfortable three seater sofa and additional seating are arranged around the TV (with  Sky Q HD standard channels and Sky sports channels). The dining table sits 6 people and the kitchen is equipped with a fridge
description: A brand new, luxury, first floor 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment with sunny balcony and secure parking in North West London. WiFi, two TVs.  Central location, easy access to Southbank, West End, Notting Hill, Camden, close to everything. Apartment Description This modern, spacious, bright, exceptionally well equipped and stylish first floor apartment was built in 2017 and provides fantastic accommodation for 4 people in the heart of London, with excellent transport links to London and the south and west of England. The apartment comprises approx 98 square metres of living space, which is furnished with utmost attention to detail, new beds and bed linen, plenty of towels, fully equipped kitchen and outdoor space to relax on the balcony overlooking communal gardens. In addition, there is a secure parking space in the garage below the flat, and a lift. A baby cot and baby chair are provided on request.  Accommodation From the spacious, private hallway you enter the open plan living room/d
neighborhood_overview: Maida Vale is one of London's prime residential locations next to Little venice and Saint John's Wood with its world famous Abbey Road Studios. Beautiful Paddington Recreation Ground park is 1 minute walk (with it's own nice caffe, rosarium, various sport facilities), Regent's Park with London Zoo, Notting hill, Hyde Park are all about half an hour walk. London canals in Little Venice are in 5-10 mins walk: the beautiful path from Little Venice to Camden town through canals is considered one of the best walking tours in London: the 5 km Regent’s Canal Walk starts at the picturesque Little Venice and takes in the scenic Regent’s Canal, Regent’s Park, Primrose Hill before arriving at Camden Lock. Also you can easily and quickly get to the beautiful Hampstead Village by bus, and enjoy a breath of fresh air walking in the unique Hampstead Heath park. Alternatively, the trendy bars and restaurants of Notting Hill and Camden are all within easy reach. The Maida Vale area itself is full of va
transit: A five minute walk to Kilburn Park and less than ten minutes to Maida Vale tube station and Kilburn High Road overground. Access to 24h buses on the doorstep. Short distance to Oxford St, Baker St, Paddington/Heathrow express: The location is easy accessible from London airports, with Paddington station serving Heathrow airport in 15 min via Express train; getting to Victoria station and Gatwick. Kilburn Park station on the Bakerloo tube line provides easy access to main central tourist places, theatres and shopping.  It is a single bus ride to Oxford street, Camden Town, Hyde Park, Notting Hill, Portobello Market, Hampstead, and other London areas. Easy access by car to/from M40 motorway - Windsor (55 minutes), Oxford (80 minutes) and Birmingham (2 hours).
house_rules: This is our home so we ask that our guests respect our neighbours and our belongings. In particular: 1. no loud noise in the flat before 8am and after 9pm; 2. please do not take or use items from the cupboards marked "private"; 3. no additional guests. Please note: The second bedroom (with the second bed) will only be made available for bookings of three or more guests. For bookings of one or two guests, guests will not have access to the second bedroom (or the second bed).

name: Sophisticated, Luxurious Apartment with Smarthome by the O2 Arena
summary: Relax in luxury on the rooftop terrace of this executive property overlooking London's financial district and the Thames. Enjoy features like state-of-the-art appliances, premium sound system, and Italian crystal wine glasses and champagne flutes.
space: •  Elegant & Sophisticated Apartment •  Balcony chairs and Foliage  •  Imported Japanese glass & Elm wood dining room table •  Bang & Olafson Soundsystem  •  State-of-the-art integrated appliances •  Kitchen Island with imported Danish bar stools •  Philips Hue - Multicolour Siri voice activated Smart Lights  •  Nespresso Machine & milk froth •  Super Fast Fiber 1 Gigabit WiFi •  Dyson hair dryer •  Apple TV with USA add free TV subscriptions to HBO, Hulu, ShowTime, Netflix & Starz •  Large workspace with 30" Apple Cinema Display   •  Bose speaker in workspace •  Raymon Blanc & Le Creuset Cookware •  Italian handmade crystal Wine Glasses, Champagne Flutes and Cocktail Glasses
description: Relax in luxury on the rooftop terrace of this executive property overlooking London's financial district and the Thames. Enjoy features like state-of-the-art appliances, premium sound system, and Italian crystal wine glasses and champagne flutes.
neighborhood_overview: Admire the views down by the Greenwich Meridian Line, surrounded by boutiques, bars, and restaurants. Waterfront living at it's most glorious, it's just minutes from Westminster by Tube or Greenwich by boat in a quiet neighbourhood.
notes: Complimentary continental breakfast comprising a selection of cereals & Nespresso flavors from around the world, Reminder Garden Café opening soon 24/7 Security team throughout the entire luxury development along with surveillance cameras.
transit: The Apartment Is located right next to 4 transport methods  Land, Air, Water and the Undergrond  1.)   The Jubilee Line Tube - Subway Station 2.)  The Thames Clipper - High-Speed Commuter River Boat 3.)  Emirates Air Line - Cable Car 4.)  Bus transport hub - Bus All 4 transport methods accept London's Oyster Card. London Airport is a 14 minute subway trip away
access: •  Residence Lounge •  Roof Top Terrace •  Roof Top Indoor Parlor •  1st Flor Communal Gardens •  Gym - free to use for guests  •  Spa - additional fees apply depending on Spa treatment •  Reminder Gardens courtyard See Pictures for details of each space
interaction: We are super friendly and would love to have a coffee with you and talk about the area from a local's perspective at check in, there are tons of great things to eat and fun things to do in London.
house_rules: As a standard request, we ask guests to verify their accounts with Airbnb before their arrival.
host_about:
Born in Surrey, England and educated at boarding school in the United States, I currently hold a UK Masters Degree in Business Management and work experience in Europe, North America and the Far East allowing me to see the world in a wider context which in turn provides me with an invaluable perspective on international business.

I am a very progressive and pragmatic person, I love investigating the possibilities surrounding new ideas and the economic potential they can hold. Business has always been an interest of mine since a very young age through developing and implementing entrepreneurial ideas to facilitate gaps in the market. 

Coming from a technology background I have been following a multiplicity of tech and disruptive companies evolution from both the financial and technical perspectives. I am always looking at the future for new ideas, looking not so much at the market size today but rather the potential market, who is the concept targeting and are there sufficiently compelling reasons to create engagement and revenue generation.

I have extensive Project Management experience for both clients and C level managers across Corporate Strategy, Management Consultancy, Marketing Communications with a particular an emphasis on how these techniques are used to visually communicate corporate and commercial messages clearly and succinctly.

Alain Garner

name: Hyde Park Penthouse
summary: Bright and airy top floor lateral appartment with large balcony overlooking a private garden. Less than 5 min walk to Hyde Park and short walk to tube stations: Lancaster gate (central line) / Paddington (Hammerthmith /Circle /Distric line)
space: Set within a beautiful stucco-fronted period building on a secure and peacfull street, the flat is a short walk away from great local restaurants, shops and bars as well as transport links. The open plan living and kitchen area is fully equiped.  The bedroom has a king size bed with high quality memory foam mattress. We hope you enjoy your stay as much as we have enjoyed living in the flat over the last 6 years!

summary: the flat is the latest Apartment in St George Wharf. Comfort: we are ONLY host given King size beds( Luxury Memory form Mattress) in rooms (most hosts used double beds. space: A fantastic place to stay for families, group of friends, business travellers or individuals requiring luxury and space. notes: I will get clear instruction, Please see check in Guide at airbnb.  The cleaning cost covers cleaning from one of our professionals. Sofa bed for 5th & 6th guest. There is a fee per night per guest after the 4th guest. This apartment holds two king beds 5ft UK King size (158cm x 212cm / 5' x 6'6") and king size duvets.
transit: From Gatwick airport, you can take express to Clapham Junction and change to Vauxhall (1 stop, 40 mins total), From Heathrow, take Piccadilly line and change Victoria line to Vauxhall, From Stansted airport, you can take train and change to Vauxhall Train station. If you have more than 4 people, please contact from taxi number. It might work out cheaper and quicker.
access: 10nd floor apartment with stairs/elevator access. Underground parking at St George Wharf, Parking charges:Up to 1 hour £3.70 hours £35 pounds per day. Gym facility next door for 5 gbp day. Food: There is a Tesco downstairs, about 30 secs away. Then if you cross the road to the station, u will find a Waitrose and a Sainsbury which open from 7am-11pm. The waterside restaurant and bar is good place for you to relax beside the thames River
interaction: For our guest convenience we offer a Golden Keys Concierge service 24 hours, that will assist you with all your London plans. Concierge is right at the front of the apartment. We will forward check in details after booking is confirmed. We will meet and greet all guest with a full orientation of the apartment. We are always a phone a call away for anything. Apartment will be attended if needed.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house -  We offer flexible check-in & check-out times, however where we have guests coming or leaving the same day we may apply usual check-in times after 15:00 and check-out times before 12:00. If you stay beyond your agreed check-out time you will be liable to pay for an extra night at your average nightly price. This property will not accommodate hen, stag or similar parties. This property is located in a residential area and guests are asked to refrain from excessive noise and you are required to keep the place reasonably clean & tidy - no dirty dishes left over please. There is strictly no smoking policy inside the accommodation No pets are allowed Lost keys or getting locked out will incur a charge starting from £50 for replacement depending on the type of key or getting you back in the property if you have locked yourself out.
host_about: Happy mother of 3 and running a small hostel business as profession that allow me to have full time to take care my children

name: Chilled, quiet, clean double room in Kings Cross
summary: Offering convenience with style, this well-equipped, clean and comfortable room is ideal for both personal and business travelers looking for a well situated base for a short stay.
space: Located on the ground floor of a typical 1960's London apartment building set on a quiet tree-lined street, and accessed  through a lush urban garden, the property is a short distance from the lively Kings Cross & St. Pancras transport hub. Bike hire is available nearby. The apartment is recently renovated with modern clean decor and has its own front door leading to the street. The room is well equipped and has many facilities for the modern traveler, including a coffee maker, silent fridge, WiFi, multi-channel HD TV/monitor, phone charger, euro adapter, as well as an iron & mini-board and hairdryer. The furniture includes a desk and chair, wardrobe and large double bed. The separate toilet and bathroom are shared with other guests.
description: Offering convenience with style, this well-equipped, clean and comfortable room is ideal for both personal and business travelers looking for a well situated base for a short stay. Located on the ground floor of a typical 1960's London apartment building set on a quiet tree-lined street, and accessed  through a lush urban garden, the property is a short distance from the lively Kings Cross & St. Pancras transport hub. Bike hire is available nearby. The apartment is recently renovated with modern clean decor and has its own front door leading to the street. The room is well equipped and has many facilities for the modern traveler, including a coffee maker, silent fridge, WiFi, multi-channel HD TV/monitor, phone charger, euro adapter, as well as an iron & mini-board and hairdryer. The furniture includes a desk and chair, wardrobe and large double bed. The separate toilet and bathroom are shared with other guests. Guests have access to the front patio with table and chairs in addition to
neighborhood_overview: Kings Cross boasts an abundance of cafe’s, food shops, bars, restaurants, pubs, supermarkets and convenience stores both independent and chains to suit all tastes and budgets. Some are open 24 hours to cater for hungry travelers. There is even an outdoor food market outside  Kings Cross station on certain days.  Nearby attractions include Granary Square, Exmouth Market, and Angel Islington with its street and antiques markets, designer shops and restaurants is also walking distance away.  In addition nearby picturesque canal walks will take you to Camden Town with its vibrant shops and markets, and further to impressive Regents Park, and trendy Little Venice.
notes: A hot-drink station and silent mini-fridge is provided in the room.  Your keys are waiting at a 24 hr pick up point very close to the property. They need to be returned to the same place after check-out and full details will be emailed after you book. The apartment is shared with other guests and has one bathroom and one separate toilet for all. Depending on the length of your stay, we may service your room during your visit. Please lock the windows when you leave the room.  Please also lock your room and the front door when you leave.
transit: The four minute walk to Kings Cross underground and St Pancras stations makes this location highly accessible.  Euston station is only a few minutes further away.
access: Guests have access to the front patio with table and chairs in addition to their bedroom and the shared  toilet and bathroom.
interaction: I work nearby and I will be happy to chat and give recommendations when I’m home.
house_rules: -The lower front door lock must be locked both after entering and after leaving the property. Please always check the door is locked after both entering and leaving. -Please be aware that other guests may be sleeping in adjoining rooms. -Please ensure the bathroom and the toilet is left clean after use as they are shared with me and the other guests. -Please be respectful of neighbours when using the patio. -Please do not leave your keys in the room when checking out.  Check out is completed by returning your keys to the nearby key depository.  Failure to return the keys will trigger loss of deposit. -The WiFi connection may be only used for legal purposes and may not be used not for illegal uploading, downloading, or any other illegal or anti-social activities.  Usage must be consistent with normal personal use and within fair usage parameters. -Occupancy is for one guest only unless a second guest is specified at time of booking.  No other guests or visitors may enter the premises. -
host_about:
Born and bred in London, I love to travel, cook, eat, cycle and have a good old boogie. 
My motto in life is, if you can't see the silver lining, look harder! :))

name: Soho - Perfect Location, Location, Location..!
summary: A large quiet self-contained studio with kitchen and bathroom and own entry in a large townhouse in Soho right in the heart of London's West End and only meters away from Oxford Street.  Soho is the beating heart of central London full of bars, cafes, restaurants, shopping, galleries, museums, cinemas, theatres and clubs. The apartment has natural light and is very quiet despite its location. The apartment is served by tube stations and bus routes but everything is in walking distance.
space: This self-contained studio apartment is a large and quiet studio space with natural light on the first floor and at the rear of a privately owned townhouse. It has one king size bed built in to the wall for two guests. There is a separate put-you-up double bed for a further two guests. PLEASE NOTE: All 4 guests would be sharing the same large room.   There is a washer-dryer, microwave oven, fridge and oven in the kitchen and a walk-in shower in the bathroom. I am a massage therapist, a yoga and Pilates teacher and a Personal Trainer and so there is yoga and Pilates equipment, gym equipment and a massage table you are welcome to use during your stay or I will pack them away if you don't.
description: A large quiet self-contained studio with kitchen and bathroom and own entry in a large townhouse in Soho right in the heart of London's West End and only meters away from Oxford Street.  Soho is the beating heart of central London full of bars, cafes, restaurants, shopping, galleries, museums, cinemas, theatres and clubs. The apartment has natural light and is very quiet despite its location. The apartment is served by tube stations and bus routes but everything is in walking distance. This self-contained studio apartment is a large and quiet studio space with natural light on the first floor and at the rear of a privately owned townhouse. It has one king size bed built in to the wall for two guests. There is a separate put-you-up double bed for a further two guests. PLEASE NOTE: All 4 guests would be sharing the same large room.   There is a washer-dryer, microwave oven, fridge and oven in the kitchen and a walk-in shower in the bathroom. I am a massage therapist, a yoga and Pilates t
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location... Soho is situated in the heart of London's West End. The area covers roughly one square mile (2.6 square kilometres), so it's easy to explore on foot. Soho is bordered by Oxford Street, Regent Street, Leicester Square and Charing Cross Road. Soho in Central London is a great place to find live entertainment, interesting food and pulsing nightlife. Browse the boutique shops, relax in Soho Square, or treat yourself to a West End show, a meal and a delicious cocktail. Soho is also known for its risqué vibe. This is where you’ll find many of London’s sex shops, burlesque shows and gay and lesbian bars. Other interesting London areas within walking distance of Soho include Chinatown, Covent Garden, Piccadilly Circus and Mayfair. No visit to the capital would be complete without a Soho shopping day. Some of London's most interesting boutiques can be found along Berwick Street, Carnaby Street and in Kingly Court. For flagship fashion and electronics stores in So
notes: I have now added a television and cable television access (as of 29 March 2017)
transit: Soho is accessed by underground stations at Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines), Piccadilly Circus (Piccadilly, Bakerloo lines), Tottenham Court Road (Northern and Central lines) and Oxford Circus (Central, Victoria and Bakerloo lines).  All major bus routes in London start from or end in the immediate area. Black Cabs and Uber are reliable ways of moving around the city. Push Bikes can be hired across central London as part of a bike scheme. Several of the tube lines now run 24-hours a day at weekends. If you're going to be in London for more than a day, it's worth buying a Visitor Oyster Card in advance. The Visitor Oyster Card is delivered to your home before you arrive in London or they can be bought at stations whe you arrive. It is one of the easiest ways to get around London.
access: Guests will have full access to their own self-contained studio within a Soho Townhouse comprising a large living space which at night has a Kingsize bed and a double-sized bed. The space has its own exclusive fully equipped kitchen and bathroom with walk in shower. All towels and bed linens are provided. You will have your own entry to the apartment throughout your stay.
interaction: I will be available during your stay. I am happy to help with itineraries or information about the neighborhood or London more generally.
house_rules: - Guests are advised that there should be no noise between 23.00-07.00 that can be heard by neighbours. This is a residential building. Loud noises during these hours are likely to attract complaints to Westminster Council. - There is no smoking on the premises under any circumstances. - Check in is anytime from 15.00 and check out is by 10.00 midday. Please do not book this property if you expect to be able to do an early check-in or late check-out. It simply isn't possible.
host_about: I am a Yoga and Pilates Teacher, a Sports Massage Therapist and a Personal Trainer. I also study at the National Centre for Circus Arts. I travel a great deal. I like people, cultures and languages. I am passionate about film and theatre and am perfectly located to indulge in both. I am looking forward to being part of the wider AirBnB family.

Push Bikes can be hired across central London as part of a bike scheme. Several of the tube lines now run 24-hours a day at weekends. If you're going to be in London for more than a day, it's worth buying a Visitor Oyster Card in advance. The Visitor Oyster Card is delivered to your home before you arrive in London or they can be bought at stations whe you arrive. It is one of the easiest ways to get around London.
access: Guests will have full access to their own self-contained studio within a Soho Townhouse comprising a large living space which at night has a Kingsize bed and a double-sized bed. The space has its own exclusive fully equipped kitchen and bathroom with walk in shower. All towels and bed linens are provided. You will have your own entry to the apartment throughout your stay.
interaction: I will be available during your stay. I am happy to help with itineraries or information about the neighborhood or London more generally.
house_rules: - Guests are advised that there should be no noise between 23.00-07.00 that can be heard by neighbours. This is a residential building. Loud noises during these hours are likely to attract complaints to Westminster Council. - There is no smoking on the premises under any circumstances. - Check in is anytime from 15.00 and check out is by 10.00 midday. Please do not book this property if you expect to be able to do an early check-in or late check-out. It simply isn't possible.
host_about: I am a Yoga and Pilates Teacher, a Sports Massage Therapist and a Personal Trainer. I also study at the National Centre for Circus Arts. I travel a great deal. I like people, cultures and languages. I am passionate about film and theatre and am perfectly located to indulge in both. I am looking forward to being part of the wider AirBnB family.

neighborhood_overview: My home is in a very quiet neighbourhood with several local parks, Cinemas and restaurants. The main shopping areas are Enfield Town, Edmonton Green and Woodgreen. There are a parade of shops at the end of my road- butchers, post office, cash machine, kebab shop, Indian restaurant, 2 grocery, nail and barber shops. Free off street parking.
notes: I do not accept guest who are arriving on late night flight arrivals and wish to check in after 10pm but if you would like me to consider a later arrival please discuss with me before placing the booking -please note there will be an extra charge Please note my kitchen is NOT available for cooking meals. Microwave is available to heat ready made meals. Kitchen can be used between 7-10am for breakfast and in the evening between 6-8pm to eat pre cooked meals.  I can cook a meal for you if booked in advance-cost £6-£8 Washing machine is available for use cost £5 per wash Basic  breakfast provided , toast, cereal, tea or coffee cost -£1.50 If you wish to print boarding passes etc.. there is a small charge per copy. As my home is a family home I  do not accept anyone who is coming to London to be out at late night parties/clubs or drinking to early hours of the morning. If this is your intent please do not make an enquiry. No outdoor shoes to be worn in my home - Please remove your shoes wh
transit: My home is located in zone 3 with easy access into central London. The bus stop is 2 mins walk. The buses 217 or 231  go to Turnpike Lane underground station (15min) which is on the Piccadilly line. Once on the train It takes approx. 15-20 min into central London.  Total time approx 40 mins  This area has great transport links. We have many taxi services locally if you need this service.  The other great thing about the Piccadilly line it goes directly  to Heathrow Airport -all terminals. Gatwick airport is approx. 2 hrs away from My home - take train from Gatwick to Victoria station change and take victoria line to Finsbury  park station then change to Piccadilly line to Turnpike Lane station  Heathrow approx.   1.45 hrs away if you are travelling by London transport. Take Piccadilly line direct to Turnpike lane station  Stansted airport is approx. 1.5 hrs away or less. Take Stansted express to Tottenham Hale then take a mini cab - cost approx £12-14 or take Victoria  line to Finsbury
access: Kitchen & dinning area and garden

name: Lovely modern 1 bed - Shoreditch/Brick Lane
summary: Fantastic apartment on the 2nd floor of this popular development in the heart of Shoreditch. 5 mins walk from Brick Lane and Shoreditch High Street station. Quiet street, close to amenities, restaurants and great public transport connections. A perfect base for your stay in London!
space: The apartment is on Cheshire street in the centre of a super vibrant area right next to Brick Lane and in the heart of Shoreditch. This is a fully self contained one double bedroom apartment with all mod cons. The kitchen is just off the lounge fully equipped with cooking utensils, toaster, kettle, cooker, oven and everything you will need if you wish to prepare a snack, meal or cup of tea. The bedroom is a double room with a double bed wardrobe and plenty of space to put down your bags. The apartment is ideal for two to share and can host up to 4 people. The sleeping arrangements are, 2 people in the bedroom and 2 people in the lounge on the sofa bed and an airbed. Bedding / duvets, sheets, pillows and towels are provided.

neighborhood_overview: A vibrant and centrally located area with lots of personality.  On the edge of Shoreditch which is known to be a trendy part of town. Close by you will find many coffee shops, bars and restaurants. Brick Lane is also famous for it's curry houses. The famous markets Brick Lane, Spitalfields, Broadway Market and Columbia Road flower market are within walking distance and great fun to look around, you will get a real feel of London. The streets and alleys in the area are covered with street art. The area has got so much that you can see and enjoy from art, museums, clubs, street markets, vintage shops and much more. Staying here give you a true local London experience. You can jump on the tube and in 15 mins be in central London or if you have done that before you can explore the real culture of London within a mile radius and walking distance of 10-15 minutes. If your visit is for business you are close to the tube and the City is less than a 15 minuets walk. There are shops and supermar
transit: In the local area you are surrounded by bars, clubs, vintage shops, cute independent shops and very well served by transport. The apartment only 5 minutes walking to Shoreditch High street station and 12 minutes to Liverpool street station on the Central, Circle, Hammersmith and City and District lines. From Liverpool Street station: 2 stops to St.Pauls,  4 stops to the West End,  6 stops to Oxford Circus,  7 stops to Bond Street (Selfridges)  11 stops to Notting Hill & Portobello Road from the apartment walking: 1 minute walk to Brick Lane,  10 minutes walk to Spitalfields Market,  10 minutes walk to Columbia Road Flower market,  20 minutes walk to Broadway Market  2 mins to no.8 bus stop (direct to Oxford Street, runs 24 hours)
access: It's all yours, you will have full and sole access to the whole apartment.

summary: A bright, modern, ground floor apartment backing onto leafy gardens in the arty neighbourhood of Battersea, located just south of the river within minutes of the iconic King's Road.  The room offers a king or twin beds and a private bathroom with rainfall shower. Healthy continental breakfast included.  Excellent local transport links - a bus stop 100m away has buses running direct to Chelsea, South Kensington, Knightsbridge and Notting Hill.  Wide selection of local restaurants and bars.

name: Super Luxury Modern 2BD Flat Canning Town
summary: Stunning refurnished 2 bed, 2 bathroom apartment in a superb modern development with its own restaurant, Pizzeria & supermarket (deli & coffee shop). Private balcony leading from the open living room and main bedroom with spectacular views. Beautiful high end interiors, built in storage, separate kitchen and dining. Amazing location in the heart of canning town, with excellent transport links to the whole of London. Great choice for families, business travellers, and tourists!
space: Amazing premium flat situated in the sough after area once the home of the Olympics. Two large bedrooms offering hotel grade bed linen and luxury mattresses. Double bedrooms, family bathroom and an ensuite to the master bedroom. Fully equipped white high gloss kitchen and separate dining area offers a great place to relax with lots of light. Two spacious bathrooms with separate bath and shower. Fresh linen and towelling provided.

Within immediate access to Canning Town station.
transit: Located two minutes walk from Canning Town station.  This can get you to the O2 in 2mins, Canary Wharf or the Excel in 4 mins.  City airport in 7 mins and into the heart of London Leicester square in 18 mins. With the DLR and Jubilee Line within walking distance you're only a short distance travel into the City and Canary Wharf, City Airport, furthermore the location boasts close landmarks such the upcoming Cross rail and Emirate Cable Cars, and the A406, A12 and A13 roads are all easily accessible by car. Late check-in needs to be pre-arranged and confirmed with us at least 3 days before arrival and they are subject to the following charges for arrival between these times: From 19:00 to 22:00 - £40 From 22:00 to 00:00 - £65 From 00:00 to 7:00 - £100 *These prices may differ during public holidays (e.g. Christmas time) These fees need to be paid in advance and cannot be paid at the property. host_about:
I moved to London to follow my love who is a Londoner, I have a 4 years old daughter and two cats. we live in a beautiful house surrounded by parks and trees in Muswell Hill.

The Airbnb experience has been very positive and from that experience I set up a company called HelloGuest to provide excellent hassle-free Airbnb management services for short stay rental properties in London advertised on Airbnb.

Our services cover everything from full property management (guest communication, check-in & out, cleaning & laundry, manage the listing, 24/7 support service, etc) to partly managed or individual services depending on your needs.

Our aim is to provide professional services for high quality properties to deliver an excellent guest experience.

We are here to help, so please get in touch with any questions you have.

name: Modern Apt in the Heart of East London
summary: The perfect London getaway spot. The flat is bright, clean and comfortable with modern amenities in good condition. The location is ideal for anyone looking to be in the centre of an area filled with hip cafes, wine bars, interesting shops and east end markets. It's within two minutes walk from both Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland stations - connecting to the rest of London in virtually any direction. We look forward to hosting you!
space: The apartment is on the 5th floor of a modern building based on New York’s Flat Iron, with access to a rooftop garden. It’s modern, clean and well looked after, with an elevator, book swap section in the lobby and a dry cleaning service inside the building. The entire flat faces onto Ridley Road, a great market street for cheap groceries from around the world, and in the other direction, an amazing view of the City’s skyscrapers from the hallway. The windows face away from the main street so the apartment is nice and quiet at night.  The apartment is the perfect size for a couple. In the living room there’s a comfy three-seat sofa, dining table and armchair. There’s also a desk space and seat, for anyone looking to get a bit of work done. The bathroom is clean and well kept, and the kitchen is equipped with plenty of space to prepare food, a huge fridge freezer and a washer/dryer. The bedroom is warm, quiet and cosy, with a comfortable double bed.

neighborhood_overview: The flat is surrounded by great places to eat and drink - so we’d be very happy to give you recommendations. Anyone staying here is spoilt for choice - it’s tough to think of a more fun and vibrant place to stay in London!
transit: Two minutes walk from both Dalston Junction station and Dalston Kingsland - connecting to the rest of London in virtually any direction. Areas such as Shoreditch, Islington and Old Street are nearby, as well as London Fields and Stoke Newington within short walking distance.
access: There's a rooftop garden/terrace, which guests have full access to. There is a bike shed on each floor, parking available underground and a rubbish collection within the building. There is a large shopping centre nearby with a huge supermarket, clothes stores and general stores.
interaction: We travel regularly but also have another place to stay in hackney if need be, so are free to host whenever it suits you :) If we are not around to hand over keys personally we will arrange a friend to do so.

host_about: Hello, I'm Nina! I'm a designer who grew up in London. I work within the creative team at Soho House & co. Looking forward to hosting you!

name: Great luxury flat in Central London
summary: My place is close to Old Street Tube Station, Silicon Roundabout, Shoreditch Grind, Hoxton Square, Shoreditch Park, City of London, Hackney, Geffrye Museum, and lots of very cool shops, bars, cafes, and restaurants You’ll love my place because of the light, the neighbourhood, the kitchen, the comfy beds, the large bedrooms, the large living area, the sunset from the balcony, the great location .  My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: The Spectrum Buildings is a residential development in Shoreditch, right on the edge of the City, just minutes from Old Street Roundabout in N1.  The development combines contemporary design with clever technology, both externally and internally, to deliver a scheme that is both striking and stylish.  The open-plan apartment was designed specifically to offer a contemporary interior and high end specification in a hip London location. The eye-catching exterior creates a new landmark for Old Street, with its stunning exterior silver shutters which clad the facade, allowing residents to make their own adjustments for privacy, light, and shade.  The apartment offers a spacious open-plan kitchen/dining/living area which feature high gloss kitchen cabinets with stone worktops. Other features include underfloor heating throughout, comfort cooling, a full house ventilation system allowing for fresh filtered air 24 hours a day.  The best thing about this apartment is the very large living / di

My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids). The development combines contemporary design with clever technology, both externally and internally, to deliver a scheme that is both striking and stylish.  The open-plan apartment was designed specifically to offer a contemporary interior and high end specification in a hip London location. The eye-catching exterior creates a new landmark for Old Street, w
neighborhood_overview: Twenty years ago, this was rough-and-ready Hackney heartland, where cockneys mixed uneasily with newer arrivals, and seedy strip bars proliferated. Then London's artists moved in and now it is the trendiest place in the capital, a Mecca for skinny jeans, checked shirts, ironic haircuts, edgy art galleries and hip bars that play music that will only become fashionable in about six months time.  Keep an eye on the walls, as well, for many of the artists don't feel the need to obey the law when creating work and the graffiti is impressively weird and witty. Hoxton Square and Jay Jopling's White Cube gallery are where it all started and remain the heart of the area, while on a Friday night, the bars and clubs of Old Street are a strange place where the pinstripes and ties of the City mingle with the extravagant fashions of the avant-garde.
transit: The flat is about 5 minutes walk from Old Street station and right on the bus routes that take you to Covent Garden, the West End, and the City.
access: The entire apartment will be accessible.
interaction: When the flat is being rented I will not be in the home, I will usually be on holidays. However, I leave a key with my neighbour who is available should anything come up.
host_about:
I am a 38 year-old Canada who has been living in London for the past 13 years. I work in the City and enjoy taking long-weekend trips in Europe and one or two longer trips a year. 

I am pretty low key and low maintenance to host and take the same approach to hosting in my flat. 

My partner and I have made a nice home together and we look forward to hosting people from around the world.

name: Alluring Double Room - 'home away from home'
summary: Double room in a well maintained, clean and newly decorated 5 bedroom house! All nationalities welcome
space: The double room is on the first floor and the single room is a loft conversion located on the second floor via a full flight of stairs. Both rooms have wardrobes, central heating and wi-fi. There is a fairly large kitchen for your use. The bathroom which has a tub and power shower will be shared with me. The double room is large and the bed is comfortable and always with fresh linen. The advertised rates for the room is for one person. If two people are sharing the room, the rate for a second person applies. Where there is a 3rd person requiring a separate room, I will extend the extra person rate to the separate room. This is subject to the single room being available so please check with me first before confirming a booking.
description: Double room in a well maintained, clean and newly decorated 5 bedroom house! All nationalities welcome The double room is on the first floor and the single room is a loft conversion located on the second floor via a full flight of stairs. Both rooms have wardrobes, central heating and wi-fi. There is a fairly large kitchen for your use. The bathroom which has a tub and power shower will be shared with me. The double room is large and the bed is comfortable and always with fresh linen. The advertised rates for the room is for one person. If two people are sharing the room, the rate for a second person applies. Where there is a 3rd person requiring a separate room, I will extend the extra person rate to the separate room. This is subject to the single room being available so please check with me first before confirming a booking. The house is terraced and deceptively large with 5 bedrooms. However, it's very quite as I'm often away at work. You'll be sharing the house with me (Melvin) an
notes: The neighborhood is quiet with several transport options (buses, train, tube, Riverboat and DLR) for connections to the main attractions of London such as The O2 Millenium Village, Greenwich Maritime Museum, Cutty Sark, Stratford Shopping Centre, Southbank, Waterloo, the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben and Tower Bridge. You can also get to the cool and trendy areas of Shoreditch and Old street very quickly. There are several convenience stores in Plumstead including Iceland and Tesco express. There is a big Tesco, Lidl, Sainsburys, Wilkins etc in Woolwich which is ten minutes away by bus.  Please be respectful of the home, there is no smoking indoors, no pets and no loud music. Check in is from 3 pm but if you are arriving in London early, please do let me know as I'm happy for you to check in earlier if it's possible! I will happily make arrangements for you to receive keys so you don't wait around for me.
transit: Free parking, 3-5 min buses, 10 min walk to Plumstead train station. 20 min to London City Airport via DLR, 25 min Canary Wharf via DLR and Jubilee line, 29 min Central London/ West end by overground train. 15 min to Greenwich park where time literally begins.
access: The house is terraced and deceptively large with 5 bedrooms. However, it's very quite as I'm often away at work. You'll be sharing the house with me (Melvin) and one or two other guests.  You'll have full access to the kitchen where you can make yourself a lovely coffee or tea. There's a large fridge, microwave, oven and cooker which you can use.
interaction: I am often away from home due to work so you may not see me for a night or two. However, I am around some evenings and reachable. I'm happy to tell you about the area and to assist with directions of how to get to the house or around London. Please be sure to ask as I'm always happy to help.
house_rules: Please do  - remove shoes before going up the stairs, it helps with hygiene and keeping a pleasant environment for you and others. - smoke in the back garden and use the ashtray that is provided.
host_about: I'm a graduate with a background in aviation management and working as a pilot. I have traveled the world and appreciate the need for clean but affordable accommodation for fellow travelers hence I decided to enroll on AirBnB. I'm very easy going and socially savvy and you are welcome to share my space. I will be happy to assist with advice and information on where to visit and other fun things to do.

summary: You are welcome to stay in our single Room within a Guest House  -	Great Location. 4 minutes walking distance from Goodge Street Station -	Cooking and kitchen equipment available -	Share Bathrooms -      Communal Areas
space: We will be happy to host you in our Guest House in Fitzrovia.  The flat has all you need to enjoy a great stay in central London. The Guest House offers an extensive range of services for people on holidays, relocating to UK or Junior professionals. The Single Room is offered for short or long term basis and is located in a great house a few steps away from Goodge Street Station.  The guest has free access to a communal kitchen, provided with cooking equipment, and to share bathrooms.  Also, you will find all amenities you need for working or studying or if you are just looking for an ideal place to relax.  This innovative private room house concept gives you the privacy of your own space but with access to all services that a hotel offers.  Towels and beddings are provided too. We are waiting for you!

neighborhood_overview: Located in Fitzrovia, London’s most cosmopolitan area, a few minutes’ walk from University College London (UCL), University College Hospital (UCH), Oxford Street, Piccadilly, Regent Street and Trafalgar Square. The convenient location means that the apartments offer easy access to all West End theatres, the bars of Soho and restaurants of China Town as well as all major London rail stations (Kings Cross, Euston, London Bridge, Paddington and Victoria). This is our guests' favorite part of London, according to independent reviews. In this area you can shop 'til you drop for popular brands like Cartier, Hermès, H&M, Zara, Nike. This ApartHotel offers the homely atmosphere of an apartment with the benefits of a hotel.
notes: Please, let us know the time of your arriving and we make your check-in day as smooth as possible.  Check in Time: 15:00 - 20:00 / Please keep in mind that check-ins before 20:00h will be free charged but between 20:00-01:00h will cost £10.00 Check out time before 11:00 am
transit: The apartment is a 4-minute walk to Goodge Street Station (Northern Line) and 9 minutes to Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern Lines) and 12 to Oxford Circus stations (Bakerloo, Central and Victoria Lines).  It is the perfect location to enjoy London on foot! Here are different walking distances to famous places:  Oxford Street (10min) Soho (10min)  Regents Park (12min) Leicester Square (17min) British Museum (15min) Regent Street (15min) Covent Garden (20min) National Gallery (20min) Trafalgar Square (20min) Hyde Park (23min) Big Ben (30min) Buckingham Palace (35min) Westminster Abbey (35min) London Eye (40min) St Pauls Cathedral (43min) Tower of London (60min)

name: Beautiful, clean and comfy 1 bed flat (+ sofa bed)
summary: My flat is tastefully decorated, cosy and very relaxing to be in! I have recently done it up, so everything is modern and works perfectly, within a Victorian period building. You’ll love it because of the calm - a peaceful night's sleep is guaranteed. It's only 10 min walk to Willesden Junction station on the Bakerloo line & the Overground. Transport links are great: Westfield (10 mins) East London (30 mins) Oxford Circus (25 mins). With many nice places nearby, my place is great for everybody!
space: You will have access to the entirety of the flat, which comprises a double room and a very comfy brand new sofa bed in the living room.
description: My flat is tastefully decorated, cosy and very relaxing to be in! I have recently done it up, so everything is modern and works perfectly, within a Victorian period building. You’ll love it because of the calm - a peaceful night's sleep is guaranteed. It's only 10 min walk to Willesden Junction station on the Bakerloo line & the Overground. Transport links are great: Westfield (10 mins) East London (30 mins) Oxford Circus (25 mins). With many nice places nearby, my place is great for everybody! You will have access to the entirety of the flat, which comprises a double room and a very comfy brand new sofa bed in the living room. I am more than happy to book your car in for residents' parking for an extra £5/ day. I am not making any profit here, this is how much I buy the parking permits for, but it is certainly cheaper than you paying on a meter!   Otherwise, it's a 17 mins train journey to Euston or to Paddington, and Clapham Junction is 25 mins also by train. I will be away, either a
neighborhood_overview: Harlesden is a vibrant community, with many people from Brazil and Ethiopia. You will find some lovely local shops, as well as a delicious Swedish bakery (Alma's), divine Italian (Rubio's) and a couple of great pubs ( The Royal Oak, Le Junction + The Picture House) within 5 mins walk. There is also the beautiful Roundwood Park, located 15 mins away.
transit: My flat is located 10mins walk from Willesden Junction which has the Bakerloo line and Overground. You can get to Oxford Circus in 25 mins, Euston in 15 mins, Paddington in 12 mins etc. It's very easy to get to most places in London!
access: I am more than happy to book your car in for residents' parking for an extra £5/ day. I am not making any profit here, this is how much I buy the parking permits for, but it is certainly cheaper than you paying on a meter!   Otherwise, it's a 17 mins train journey to Euston or to Paddington, and Clapham Junction is 25 mins also by train.
interaction: I will be away, either abroad or UK, but naturally will be on call if you have any queries. Also, my neighbour is always available to help as is my friend Steve lives just round the corner and will be able to help you with anything (contact details are in the guest book). The keys will be left in a key safe outside my front door, for which I will give you the code on the morning of your arrival.
host_about:
I am a Languages teacher (French and Spanish), I adore travelling, Art, culture, reading, music, and a keen foodie! 
Vous pouvez me contacter en francais. 
Pueden contactarme en español.

name: Stunning, Dbl En Suite in Grade II Georgian Home
summary: Built in 1697, our lovely Georgian Home is right next to Putney Bridge. Located on the first floor, a modern and contemporary room perfect for couples and the single traveller. We have lived in London for many years and love passing on our favourite local gems to all our guests  We also do not charge a cleaning fee! Our prices include breakfast (cooked included) We also have another two rooms, on the floor above, which can be booked by the same party/family.
space: As an interior designer, the house is tastefully decorated. This particular room is lovely, modern and contemporary space with its own En-Suite, walk in shower and comes with complimentary toiletries. There is also crisp bed linen, large towels and dressing gowns, supplied.
description: Built in 1697, our lovely Georgian Home is right next to Putney Bridge. Located on the first floor, a modern and contemporary room perfect for couples and the single traveller. We have lived in London for many years and love passing on our favourite local gems to all our guests  We also do not charge a cleaning fee! Our prices include breakfast (cooked included) We also have another two rooms, on the floor above, which can be booked by the same party/family. As an interior designer, the house is tastefully decorated. This particular room is lovely, modern and contemporary space with its own En-Suite, walk in shower and comes with complimentary toiletries. There is also crisp bed linen, large towels and dressing gowns, supplied. The smoking area is located in the garden. All guests are free to come and go as they please, there is no curfew. We are always available should our guests need any help or advice. We always meet and greet our guests in person, show them around, when they first
neighborhood_overview: Fulham & Putney great local hangouts. There is an exciting food and drink scene, with farmer's market on the weekends and lots of local events - the boat race in particular!  The wonderfully green Bishops Park and Fulham Palace are within 2 minutes walk from the flat. We are also a stone's throw from the New Kings Road and Chelsea.  Ideal for couples and the single traveller coming to London for work, pleasure or business.
notes: There is garage parking available on request, however, it is £10 per night. Please let us know in advance if this service you wish to book. We understand that guests may arrive early and you are more than welcome to do a luggage drop, prior to check-in. There is also a resident Cockerpoo - Stanley! He is very friendly
transit: Putney Bridge Station (District Line) is no more than 5 minutes walk, with 15 minutes you will be in Zone 1 and all that central London has to offer.  There is a tonne of buses, which run 24-hour. So you are always able to get back to flat from anywhere in London.  The closest train station is Putney, with direct lines to Waterloo and the South West of England.
access: The smoking area is located in the garden. All guests are free to come and go as they please, there is no curfew.
interaction: We are always available should our guests need any help or advice. We always meet and greet our guests in person, show them around, when they first arrive. Otherwise, we leave you to enjoy the room and surrounding area.
house_rules: - Smoking is permitted in the Garden Only! - Rooms are cleaned between 11am-2pm, Daily
host_about: Happily married to Andrew, love Interior design and traveling,  spent the past years renovating our Georgian house which we love.

name: Light and quiet double bedroom in house in Fulham
summary: Light and comfortable double room with basin near Fulham Broadway.
space: I live in a lovely, very quiet London terraced house near Fulham Broadway with my dog (she is a poodle, so doesn't moult and is hypo allergenic). There is both a bathroom and a separate shower room for you to use. The room has a basin and a hairdryer, as well as coffee/tea making facilities and a radio. Fibre broadband is available. The kitchen can be used for breakfast only.
description: Light and comfortable double room with basin near Fulham Broadway. I live in a lovely, very quiet London terraced house near Fulham Broadway with my dog (she is a poodle, so doesn't moult and is hypo allergenic). There is both a bathroom and a separate shower room for you to use. The room has a basin and a hairdryer, as well as coffee/tea making facilities and a radio. Fibre broadband is available. The kitchen can be used for breakfast only. Please note guest access to the house. The kitchen is ONLY available to make breakfast between 7-9.30am. If it is sunny you are welcome to sit in the garden - it is a sun trap. The washing machine and tumble dryer can also be used - within reason! As I work from home, the sitting room and kitchen are NOT available for guest use, although of course you can keep things in the fridge. I work from home, so if I am not in (Hidden by Airbnb) meetings I would be delighted to answer any questions you may have. Fulham Broadway is a diverse and vibrant area
neighborhood_overview: Fulham Broadway is a diverse and vibrant area of London, offering easy access to the city. There are many excellent pubs and restaurants nearby, including the newly opened Market Halls, Whole Foods, the Malthouse pub, and the superb Manuka Kitchen. There is a nine screen cinema at Fulham Broadway and Waitrose/Marks and Spencer/ Sainsbury’s are all within 6-7 minutes from the house. It is also very close to Chelsea Football Ground at Stamford Bridge.
notes: No additional guests allowed other than those booked.
transit: The house is only 6 minute walk from the underground station - it is on the District Line and it takes around 20 minutes to get to central London. There are many bus routes close by - the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and more. You can walk to Chelsea in twenty minutes, the museums of South Kensington in thirty minutes, and Knightsbridge and Hyde Park in 40 minutes. The house is very near to Stamford Bridge, home of Chelsea Football club, and not far from the river.
access: Please note guest access to the house. The kitchen is ONLY available to make breakfast between 7-9.30am. If it is sunny you are welcome to sit in the garden - it is a sun trap. The washing machine and tumble dryer can also be used - within reason! As I work from home, the sitting room and kitchen are NOT available for guest use, although of course you can keep things in the fridge.
interaction: I work from home, so if I am not in (Hidden by Airbnb) meetings I would be delighted to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: Just to use common sense!
host_about: Dedicated traveller, extremely friendly, a trustworthy and respectful guest who will look after your property with care and utter delight to be in it. I also host guests in my comfortable and cosy house in Fulham, West London.

name: Family Friendly 4 bed Apartment by Battersea Park
summary: Wonderful family-friendly 4 bedroom property with spacious basement, overlooking Battersea Park and just minutes from Chelsea! My place is close to Battersea Park and Chelsea, and is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: LIVING AREAS Once inside the flat, you will find a charming and tidy play area on the right with all types of children’s toys and some comfortable seating.  In sharp contrast is the sophisticated drawing room next door; with its stylish furnishings, glass coffee table, a tidy log fireplace. There is a TV and also a wooden study desk in one corner with a lamp for the studious guest.  Further on from the kitchen is a pretty blue nursery room with a cot and chest of draws. KITCHEN You will find a lovely open plan kitchen within the apartment as well which has all the latest fittings including a little breakfast bar with stools, a large fridge freezer and a dishwasher for convenience. The units are clean white with a sleek black worktop.  DINING AREA The dining area is situated near the kitchen and has a lovely wooden table with seating for up to 8. Plenty of light streams in through the glass walls of the beautiful garden. GARDEN A groomed garden which is made up with outdoor seating and

The units are clean white with a sleek black
neighborhood_overview: This property is a real unique gem and located in arguably one of the best areas in London, right opposite one of the city's most famous parks with a large play ground area, sports grounds, perfect routes for a run or a stroll and plenty of wild life to enjoy! The park also has a brand new Adventure playground which is just a 3 minute walk away and ideal for active kids! The Kings Road is a short walk from the property and takes you into the heart of Chelsea and Kensington with superb restaurants, boutiques and the fabulous Natural History, V&A, and Science museums of South Kensington - perfect for a family day out!
notes: "The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old". Normal check in time is between 3 pm and 9 pm. All overtimes may incur an additional fee" No pets, parties or smoking please.
transit: Battersea Park train station is just under a 15 minute walk away where you can easily catch connections to all areas of the city.
house_rules: - The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. This is for insurance purposes to say that the guests will look after the property and not smoke or have parties - Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old - Normal check in time is between 3pm and 9pm. Any time outside of this period may incur an additional fee - No pets, no parties or smoking, please
host_about:
Greetings from London and Paris! 
 
My name is Tom and I work for Veeve, the largest short term property rental in London, created in 2011. We manage this collection of hand-picked apartments and houses for their individual owners while they are away. Each property is carefully selected and offers a stylish living experience and excellent value. 

As a lifelong Londoner I love having the opportunity to share these spaces, my knowledge and personal recommendations about this great city with those visiting for both short and long term stays. 

All our guests will be greeted personally at the property by a member of our hospitality team, and guest assistance is also provided by our professional customer service team between 8am - 8pm 7 days a week, should any issues arise during your stay. Please note that once a booking is made, the customer service team will be the point of contact thereafter.

Please be aware that viewings are not possible for stays of less than 1 month.
  
If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me and I will be sure to answer them promptly.

name: Light and Airy Chelsea 1 Bed Flat
summary: Enjoy a simple and functional 1 bed flat in the heart of Chelsea. The perfect place for 2, with plenty to do at your door step. a great place to spend time in London and feel at home.
space: This wonderful apartment is located on the 6th floor with lift access, has a bright living room, a charmingly petit kitchen and a king size bedroom. It also suits couples or friends looking for the go-to central location. Comfortable and spacious, yet right in the middle of the centre for some urban adventures. You can walk to shops, bars, restaurants and cafe`s onto Fulham Road in mere minutes. It takes 5 mins walking to The Famous Kings Road. 5 min by bus or taxi to Gloucester Road tube, - Piccadilly, Circle and District line. Notting Hill, Knightsbridge & Oxford street are within walking distance. The audaciously spacious living room is ideal for you to relax after a long day of sightseeing in this great City. This typical London flat is equipped with all modern amenities such as a TV and a comfortable sofa. The dining area is in to the living room, which can sit 2 people. The flat also benefits of fantastic views over the communal garden area. The kitchen is very modern and clean a
