neighborhood_overview: If you want to find a place to eat and share a nice moment with your friends or family, we highly recommend you the Surprise, a bright gastropub with great cuisine or The Ivy Chelsea Garden, a glamorous british restaurant! Otherwise, after a long day of sightseeing, it is the great time to enjoy local bars with Londoners. This is why we suggest you to go to the Phene, a great pub with a unique atsmophere! To discover London heritage, you can also visit several museums like Science Museum, Leighton House Museum and Victoria & Albert Museum which are located very close to the apartment. You can also spend some great time at Princess Victoria or Hyde Park, which is also a great place to organize a picnic with friends or family! This property will provide you a good start to discover all of London’s main attractions.
transit: Situated in the heart of Chelsea, this fine flat is ideally located few minutes away from South Kensington Underground Station. On this station you could use the Circle, District and Piccadilly lines which will allow you to reach London most chic areas (Notting Hill, Chelsea) and the city centre very quickly.
host_about:
When not in London you will likely find me in the countryside herding sheep and working on other projects. I love meeting new people from different walks of life, but as a host I give my guests all the space they want.
I will always try to meet your expectation and even go beyond the expectation of your stay. If you have suggestions for me, please let me know!
Some great features I have are due to the inspirations of other guests that stayed with me and had interesting ideas. So please don't hesitate to let me know your thoughts. Feel free to communicate with me!
Hope to see you soon, Will

name: Bright double room in Wandsworth
summary: The room is in 2 bedroom flat on a first floor of small block. The freshly decorated room has a standard double bed with a comfortable mattress, table to work from and a wardrobe. You will have access to your room, kitchen and a shared bathroom. Free WiFi. Free car parking in the private grounds (first come). We (my husband and I) live in the flat and are available if you have any questions.
space: There is an excellent choice of public transport options into central London which is reachable in 15 mins by frequent local buses including a 24 hour bus service between our area and Hammersmith. Our place is 10 minute walk to Wandsworth Town train station that has regular trains into Waterloo station (15 minutes). The nearest underground is East Putney (10 mins walk). It is also ten minutes from the river bus where you can go both up and down the river.  The apartment is situated near a big shopping centre, massive cinema and a big Sainsbury's and Waitrose. There are lots of restaurants, bars/pubs close by. It is minutes walk from the river front where the race boat between Cambridge and Oxford takes place. There are three bike hire docking stations within a few minutes of our place. It is ideal for cycling along the Thames to Putney, Richmond park, Kingston and Hampton Court. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

name: Spacious studio in large penthouse
summary: Come and join us in our beautiful apartment in stunning Broadway Market/London Fields
space: Hello! We are two musicians & actors + two Egyptian Mau cats living in a beautiful penthouse overlooking London Fields and the city skyline.  You will have access to one of two of our studio guest bedrooms on the lower floor with a double bed a sofa/pull out bed, TV, Fridge and your own Tea/Coffee and mineral water supply.
description: Come and join us in our beautiful apartment in stunning Broadway Market/London Fields Hello! We are two musicians & actors + two Egyptian Mau cats living in a beautiful penthouse overlooking London Fields and the city skyline.  You will have access to one of two of our studio guest bedrooms on the lower floor with a double bed a sofa/pull out bed, TV, Fridge and your own Tea/Coffee and mineral water supply. Private room with separate private bathroom and bath. We live in the property upstairs, and try to keep a level of privacy for ourselves in this area. Mostly because we are busy creatives and cannot promise our floor will be immaculate! However, we will be around to help during your stay, and there is enough space to probably not see us at all should you wish to keep to yourselves. Your room and entrance are on the first floor and next to our second guest bedroom. I will be available on phone/txt to help you throughout your stay. Where to start! We live in the heart of Hackney at Br
neighborhood_overview: Where to start! We live in the heart of Hackney at Broadway Market which is equal parts tourist destination as it is hub for young creatives. Huge parks, beautiful canal walks and some of the best bars, clubs and pubs in London are all within a 10 minute walk. Columbia Road, Shoreditch and the Sunday flower market are 15 minutes walk from us, and Broadway Market itself is beautiful and exciting every single day. Obviously market day on Saturday is extra special and people flock from all over the city to spend a day there and in the park - especially on sunny days! All the bars & restaurants serve incredible food (we have an Argentinian, Spanish, Italian, Georgian, Japanese amongst bounds of brilliant cafes and pub food). All have pavement dining and there is an Oyster bar at the fresh fish shop most days. In the evening the butchers opens up as a restaurant and we have one of the best Jazz clubs in the city with Kansas Smitty's. You can bbq in the park and there is a real festival atmo
notes: We live with two very friendly & inquistive Egyptian Mau cats. They do not have access to the guest bedrooms but there is a little bit to read on them on arrival - they are not your usual type of cat! Broadway Market is a vibrant & lively area so please bear this in mind when booking. We are closest to the UK version of Brooklyn/Williamsburg in NYC in comparison. There is always lots going on and we live next to the overground railway track and a nursery school. Trains do not run throughout the whole night but they do start early in the morning and run late. If the windows are left open this may be a disturbance to you so if you are a light sleeper and wish to sleep in late, we leave lots of very comfortable earplugs in the room, which sort noise issues out instantly. Your room is next door to our second guest bedroom so please be mindful to eachother and us with your noise levels around the house. We ask that you do not slam our doors and walk and talk quietly around the house. Please
transit: Download the CityMapper app, or go to the website and enter our postcode which is E8 3RP to plan routes to your destinations around London.  5 minutes walk from London Fields overground which is one 5 minute stop from Liverpool St station. 15 minute walk/5 minute bus ride from Bethnal Green station which is on the Central line. Oxford Circus is about 25 minutes door to door.
access: Private room with separate private bathroom and bath.
interaction: We live in the property upstairs, and try to keep a level of privacy for ourselves in this area. Mostly because we are busy creatives and cannot promise our floor will be immaculate! However, we will be around to help during your stay, and there is enough space to probably not see us at all should you wish to keep to yourselves. Your room and entrance are on the first floor and next to our second guest bedroom. I will be available on phone/txt to help you throughout your stay.
house_rules: - Please respect that you are staying in our home and other guests may also be with us at the same time. Both guest rooms are next to each-other and the walls are not thick! Please do not slam doors, or talk loudly around the house in consideration to our living and workspace. - Smoking is strictly prohibited. - Noise must be kept to a minimum after 11pm especially. - Please make sure you read our house booklet on arrival with information about the house.  - Sets of keys are registered with Delta security and need to be looked after with great care as they are not cuttable without alerting them that they have been lost. If keys go missing, it poses a threat to the entire building and Delta will have to change the locks which is very expensive. Guests will be liable for this cost so please look after your keys!

name: Modern 1 bedroom near Kings Cross
summary: A beautiful modern newly built 10 minutes walk away from the heart of King's Cross.
space: This is a modern 1 bed flat 10-15 min walk from King’s Cross/St Pancras station. There is a balcony that  stretches the length of the flat, a double bedroom with a built in wardrobe, open plan kitchen/living room and a bath room with a bath/shower. There is double glazing in the kitchen and triple glazing in the living room meaning once the balcony door is shut there is no outside noise at all. The flat is 10 minutes’ walk from Granary Square which has lots of nice restaurants, an Everyman cinema, large Waitrose and of course, Regent’s Canal.  Please note that this is my home and does have my personal belongings in it including photos/books/unopened bottles of wine.

name: Amazing Newly Built 1BD Apartment in Mile End!
summary: Beautiful, newly built 1 bedroom apartment in the buzzing area of Mile End. The apartment is part of a newly built complex, so the apartment is modern, well-equipped and beautifully decorated. With a double bed in the bedroom, and a double sofa bed in the living room for any extra guests, you will be sure to have a very comfortable stay! The apartment boasts its own balcony that you will have access to, and Mile End station is just a 5 minute walk away!
space: The apartment is fully equipped with everything you will need for a short, or long, stay in London. The apartment is modern, light and cosy with all amenities including WiFi, TV, dishwasher, washing machine and central heating. The bedroom has a lovely double bed for guests to relax in, and a double sofa bed in the living room for accommodate for any extra guests. For that added bit of comfort, our cleaners make up the beds with hotel quality linens and place fresh, fluffy towels on the bed just before your arrival. A perfect space for guests to unwind in after a busy day in the city! With a fully equipped kitchen, you will have the utensils you need to cook up some tasty treats. That said, you're in one the best cities for eating out with cuisine from all over the world.

neighborhood_overview: Mile End It is unpretentious, lively, multi-ethnic and has lots of new bars, gastropubs, coffee shops and eateries, even a new on-site gin distillery at Bow Wharf. Down-to-earth Roman Road street market is another attraction, while there are well-kept pockets of green space, and Mile End Park forms a green “boulevard” to the Thames at Limehouse. The bustling Bow Road has an industrial feel, while a 10-minute walk will bring you to Victoria Park, with the pretty canal running alongside. Roman Road is a real gem of a high street with a good mix of independent shops and a palpable community spirit. It’s also a hive of activity, with a market on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays offering clothes, accessories, furniture and food.  Gentrification is very much under way here, which is good news if you like nice pubs and a steadily improving café scene. Slightly further out is Bow, but tucked away en route to Vicky Park is Roman Road, a real gem of a high street with a good mix of independent
transit: The apartment is located a 5 minute walk from Mile End Underground station, which offers the Central Line, Hammersmith & City and District Lines.  There are plenty of bus routes surrounding the apartment that will get you to numerous places around London. There are also Santander Bike Stations surrounding the property if you feel like a cycle around the city. Check out the TFL Santander Cycles website for locations and information.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: My support team or I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm - No parties - Please wash all dishes before you check out - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply.  - Please leave the spare key in the specified location, otherwise you will be charged.
host_about: Professional splitting my time between the North and London.  Loves to get away and see what other places has to offer.  Friendly and social person and also a big sports fan, both watching and playing.

name: Terrific Notting Hill Studio*
summary: This studio on the top floor in a beautiful house, in the heart of Notting Hill. This studio has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in a temporary style with white walls, and a wooden floor. It has a TV and wifi.
description: This studio on the top floor in a beautiful house, in the heart of Notting Hill. This studio has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in a temporary style with white walls, and a wooden floor. It has a TV and wifi. During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you. Please note that there is no elevator in the building. The keys are to be collected from a lockbox by the front door of the building. The washer/dryer is communal and situated in the basement of the building.  There are hours within which it cannot be used, these are clearly signed on the door.

host_about:
My wife and I decided to start using Airbnb to rent out our serviced apartments, it's a much nicer community than the usual holiday booking sites!  We have 21 studios in our building and we encourage a family vibe with communal break-out spaces, on site cleaner and handyman whom you'll no doubt meet when you check-in.

Billie and I are based locally and are on hand if you have questions, and can always be reached by phone or e-mail.   We also have two amazing team members called Joanna and Anna (funny enough) who helps us organise the building. 

We look forward to welcoming you to London!

summary: Beautiful and Stylish garden flat, with one double bedroom and wonderful, bright integrated kitchen and sitting room leading onto a small garden. The flat benefits from it's own front door. The flat is also in easy walking distance of Westfield shopping centre. This would be a perfect place for  2 (or 3 if you use the sofa)people looking to stay in a quieter more residential neighbourhood, which is still easily accessible to Central London.
space: Delightful 1 double  bedroom garden flat in the heart of Shepherds Bush on a quiet and friendly residential street. LIVING/ KITCHEN/DINING The kitchen has everything that you would need during your stay if you fancy staying in one night and cooking a delicious meal. There are a range of cooking utensils, pots and pans, plates, cutlery and glasses. The wooden dining table seats 4 people. On a warm sunny day it is lovely to be able to open the doors leading to the garden and let the fresh air in.  The living area has a comfortable sofa and chair which are perfect for relaxing after a long day out exploring what London has to offer.  BATHROOM The bathroom has a bath with a shower attachment, toilet and basin. Large fluffy white towels and toiletries will be provided for every guest. neighborhood_overview: Shepherds Bush is ideally situated in the heart of West London. The Uxbridge road has lots of great food shops and pubs. The flat is a 10 minute walk to the Westfield Shopping Centre which offers all the best of the high street and designer stores as well as a fabulous selection of international restaurants. Or for something with more local charm, trawl through the characterful Shepherds Bush market.

Shepherds Bush green is serviced by many major bus routes offering quick access to Portobello road, Nottinghill gate and Kensington.

name: Bright & airy ensuite double bedroom in Crouch End
summary: Spacious, light and airy ensuite room at the top of a beautiful grand Victorian house.  Located in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End, just 8 minutes by bus from Finsbury Park station.  Recently converted, architect-designed with high ceilings, lots of natural light and convenient location surrounded by trees, yet only five minutes walk to Crouch End Broadway.  There's an exceptionally comfortable king size bed perfect for couples or solo travellers. Access to a dedicated well-equipped kitchen.
space: This is one of three different rooms we have just specially converted for Airbnb in our newly renovated grand Victorian house in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End.  The room is light and spacious and all newly furnished with a king size bed with Tempur Pedic mattress and a private ensuite bathroom.  You will love it because it has all been architect-designed with high ceilings, flooded with light and great access to Crouch End and Finsbury Park. There is underfloor heating throughout the house, and your bathroom has heated mirrors to avoid misting up, as well as a heated towel rail and Hansgrohe shower. We have been very successfully hosting Airbnb guests in our former house over the last year - please see reviews by clicking on me as the host!
description: Spacious, light and airy ensuite room at the top of a beautiful grand Victorian house.  Located in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End, just 8 minutes by bus from Finsbury Park station.  Recently converted, architect-designed with high ceilings, lots of natural light and convenient location surrounded by trees, yet only five minutes walk to Crouch End Broadway.  There's an exceptionally comfortable king size bed perfect for couples or solo travellers. Access to a dedicated well-equipped kitchen. This is one of three different rooms we have just specially converted for Airbnb in our newly renovated grand Victorian house in the wonderful enclave of Crouch End.  The room is light and spacious and all newly furnished with a king size bed with Tempur Pedic mattress and a private ensuite bathroom.  You will love it because it has all been architect-designed with high ceilings, flooded with light and great access to Crouch End and Finsbury Park. There is underfloor heating throughout the hous
neighborhood_overview: Crouch End is a wonderful mix of urban and rural London. Crouch End is very much connected to London, but has the feel of a village.  We are one minute from a fabulous running/walking route, the Parkland Walk for those feeling the need for some exercise! It may also be possible to arrange trial memberships to one of the local gyms while you are here.  There are many fabulous independent cafes, bars and restaurants both in Crouch End, and increasingly in Stroud Green (nearer Finsbury Park).
notes: Crouch End is a great location, only 8 minutes from Finsbury Park station. Crouch End is very much connected to London, but is also a haven for independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants
transit: Our house is 8 minutes by bus from Finsbury Park station (Victoria and Picadilly lines, plus overground trains).  There are also buses to Archway and Kings Cross directly from Crouch End, and a train line from Crouch Hill which connects to the Overground line at Highbury & Islington.
access: You have a private room and bathroom, and shared use of a dedicated Airbnb kitchen on the same floor, so you can pop out in the morning in your dressing grown to make your coffee/tea, have your breakfast, or even cook a meal if you're so inclined!
interaction: We live on a separate floor in the house with a separate kitchen, so you will have plenty of privacy and independence. I am more than happy to provide whatever support or advice you need to make sure you enjoy your stay in London! I also operate a pop-up restaurant downstairs once a month, so you can book to attend that if your dates coincide.
house_rules: You will be staying as guests in our home, and we ask that you are tidy, considerate and are sensitive to the others who live or are staying in the house.  Therefore please no noise after 11:00, and please don't disturb others who may be sleeping. We operate three Airbnb rooms which all share the same kitchen. We ask that you use the kitchen and common areas respectfully, keeping everything clean and tidy, and that you are considerate about noise levels when other guests are sleeping. Guests are responsible for maintaining the kitchen themselves (e.g. running and emptying the dishwasher) Please note that we have a strictly enforced no smoking policy and smoking is not allowed anywhere on the premises.  Sorry for the inconvenience, but we've had problems with guests in the past. Thanks!
host_about: I am a self-employed marketing professional whose motto is Carpe Diem! I love travelling, hiking, entertaining, cooking and helping to build iconic brands. I love independence and challenges, so these guide my holiday choices. I love meeting new people which is one of the reasons for becoming and Airbnb host!

My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and families. It's walking distance to get bus and train links. This area is a hive of activity, food and boutiques!
space: This apartment is located on the ground floor of an apartment building on Brick Lane.  A 10 minute walk to Shoreditch High Street, Liverpool st and Aldgate East Stations. Found right in the heart of Shoreditch, you will enjoy local cafes, bars, design studios, galleries, cute shops and restaurants all at your doorstep. It can easily fit a small family. It comfortably sleeps 2 guests, but can sleep up to 4 guests using the sofa beds in the living room. As this is a basement apartment, there are no windows.

neighborhood_overview: Londoners and Tourists flock to Shoreditch for its Street Art, Street Food and Galleries. It has great night life, cafes and boutiques. Every Sunday is Brick Lane Market, and Columbia Road Flower Market. Box park and Spitalfields Market are just minutes away.
notes: We consider infants to be guests, so please include them as 'children' when making a booking. *** FAQ's *** Q - Is the area safe? A - Yes, There are always lots of people around and it has a very 20s-40s vibe about it. Q - What Time is Check in?  A - 3:00pm - you will collect your key from Bell Boi coffee shop, 104 Sclater Street, E1 6HR Q - Will the apartment be ready to check in at 3pm? A - If you have not provided an approximate arrival time, we cannot guarantee that the apartment will be ready by 3pm. We will have it ready for the time you have specified that you are arriving. Q - Can I check in early? A - Unfortunately not. Often there is a guest the night before and we can't kick them out early. Q - Can I drop my bags there early?  A - No, but you can store your luggage at Bell Boi for £5 per locker, per day. Q - Do I have to walk up stairs A - Yes, is it a basement apartment. Q- Can I check in Late. A- Yes we have a self check in system after 10pm, however we may not be able to
transit: We are situated in ZONE 1 which is the centre of the city. Near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. This is the City Centre officially. However, we are in the East End, NOT the West End as most tourists think (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st). It is still zone 1 but you will have to catch a short train or bus ride to the West End. The Closest Transport is  UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Liverpool St Station & Aldgate East Station OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station BUS #25 & #23 just a few minutes away, takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) PARKING We don't have a private car spot for you. There is a paid parking lot 1 minute away, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. Most Parking is free on Saturdays and Sundays. There are free and paid spots around you just may need to search a little.
access: It has a double bed, a bathroom, a double fold out sofa bed and a kitchenette with a small fridge/freezer, plates, cups, utensils, toaster, kettle. However there's no oven. - TV and Free wifi  - We provide 1 Towel per guest  - Bedding for the sofa beds will be provided upon request or for bookings with 2+ guests.  - A hairdryer, Iron & Ironing Board are provided.
interaction: We do not live there, we live 10 minutes away and are always in the area. Check In: You will collect your keys from a local cafe (7 minutes walk from the apartment)
house_rules: 1. We have a strict NO PARTY rule, if you have booked for a hen's, stag or birthday, you need to do all the celebrating outside the apartment. We will know if you are having a party and you will be instantly asked to leave. We will retain all the deposit if you have not been truthful about the purpose of your stay. 2. No more than the 4 people to reside 3. No more than 4 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use on the premises 5. People seen to be uncontrollably intoxicated may be asked to leave. 6. All breakages will be noted and may be withdrawn from your deposit. 7. Please do not give out our address to others. 8. Please do not get any mail sent to this address. 9. Please be considerate with our towels, linen and sofa. If you mark these with make-up, food or drinks, please endeavour to remove it when it occurs, as replacing these items drives up the cost of our service. 10. If a guest reduces the number of nights on the reservation; we consider it a cancellat

name: Double Room with Private Bathroom, Camden Town
summary: Located 5 minutes from Camden Town tube station and 10 from King's Cross St Pancras International, the house has excellent transport connections to anywhere you need to get to in London. The buzz of Camden Market is right on our doorstep and, for peace and quiet, there's Regents Park and Primrose Hill up the road. The house is light and spacious with a large high ceilinged living room and the guest-room, tucked away at the top of the house, has a great view and its own private bathroom.
space: We have 3 floors of a large 4 storey terraced house. Our living room/kitchen is spacious with high ceilings and large windows that let in a lot of light. The guest room (which we let out) is on the top floor and has its own private bathroom next door so guests get a lot of privacy. The house is recently decorated (including a brand new kitchen and floor) and kept clean at all times.
description: Located 5 minutes from Camden Town tube station and 10 from King's Cross St Pancras International, the house has excellent transport connections to anywhere you need to get to in London. The buzz of Camden Market is right on our doorstep and, for peace and quiet, there's Regents Park and Primrose Hill up the road. The house is light and spacious with a large high ceilinged living room and the guest-room, tucked away at the top of the house, has a great view and its own private bathroom. We have 3 floors of a large 4 storey terraced house. Our living room/kitchen is spacious with high ceilings and large windows that let in a lot of light. The guest room (which we let out) is on the top floor and has its own private bathroom next door so guests get a lot of privacy. The house is recently decorated (including a brand new kitchen and floor) and kept clean at all times. Besides your own room and bathroom, you're free to relax in the living room and use the kitchen to cook basic meals. My pa
neighborhood_overview: We're just around the corner from Camden Town, which is a historic centre of alternative culture in London. It has a great reputation for live music (there's practically a gig venue on every corner) and for its flea market, which is internationally renowned and full of cool clothes and trinkets. Our house is close enough to the action but on a residential street, so we don't get the noise at night that you'd expect from living in such a busy area. Primrose Hill, which 10-15 up the road, is a beautiful residential area with lovely Georgian houses and pretty pubs. It has one of the best views of London too! Even closer, we have Regent's Park and London Zoo, which are definitely worth a visit.
transit: Camden is one of the main transport hubs of North London. We're 5 minutes from Camden Town Tube and 10 from King's Cross St Pancras International. By tube or bus, we're only about 15 away from Oxford Street and 20 from Covent Garden (so very central!)
access: Besides your own room and bathroom, you're free to relax in the living room and use the kitchen to cook basic meals.
interaction: My partner, Veronique, and I live in the house so are around to offer help and advice about things to do in London most of the time. I work from home three days a week but have my own study so will stay out of your hair!
host_about: I'm a lecturer in American Literature as well as a musician from Camden, North London. Both professions involve quite a bit of travelling and I find Airbnb the perfect way of meeting local people from the different places I visit. Rest assured I'm a friendly, neat and respectful houseguest to have around!

name: Lovely 2 bedroom flat in South East London
summary: Right in the heart of Forest Hill, SE23, our flat is above the beautiful shop Stag & Bow. The Horniman Museum & Gardens are a 5 minute walk, Forest Hill Pools, cafes, restaurants, pubs and independent shops minutes from the door. Forest Hill is in South East London, well serviced by public transport it takes 15 minutes to London Bridge, 18 minutes to Shoreditch, 27 minutes to Oxford st (central London). Forest Hill station is across the road. We are business, family and traveller friendly.
space: Our thoughtfully renovated flat is a comfortable light and quiet space despite the main road. The flat feels light and airy with its high ceilings and big windows.
description: Right in the heart of Forest Hill, SE23, our flat is above the beautiful shop Stag & Bow. The Horniman Museum & Gardens are a 5 minute walk, Forest Hill Pools, cafes, restaurants, pubs and independent shops minutes from the door. Forest Hill is in South East London, well serviced by public transport it takes 15 minutes to London Bridge, 18 minutes to Shoreditch, 27 minutes to Oxford st (central London). Forest Hill station is across the road. We are business, family and traveller friendly. Our thoughtfully renovated flat is a comfortable light and quiet space despite the main road. The flat feels light and airy with its high ceilings and big windows. Guests have full use of the flat as their own to enjoy. There is wifi and a terrestrial TVs and DVD player. There is a DVD shop just up the road which the flat has membership for. We work in the shops below and next to the flat so we are always available if there are any questions you need answering. So many things to love about our neighb
neighborhood_overview: So many things to love about our neighbourhood! The horniman museum and gardens is a five minute walk away. Brilliant independent cafes and shops minutes from the door. A sainsburys supermarket around the corner. A fantastic real butchers opposite sainsburys that sells the very best quality meat. We have a fresh fish van that comes every Thursday from Hastings that parks up outside the station. All the local amenities you would need, post office, swimming pool, gym, delicatessens, great pubs and fantastic transport links.
notes: Best coffee shop is St Davids on Davids road.  Best delicatessen is Aga's little deli on Dartmouth Road. Best pubs are The Dartmouth Arms, The Sylvan Post & The Signal. The coffee shop and gallery The Montage on Dartmouth Road is a lovely place to relax and also had a children's playroom, Great Pizza from Bona across the road.
transit: Forest Hill Station is across the road from the flat. You can get to oxford street in 30 minutes, shoreditch in 18, London Victoria in 30, London Bridge in 12. Easy commute to and from Gatwick airport of around 30 - 45 minutes. Excellent bus connections just minutes from the door, central London, camberwell, dulwich, lewisham, Catford, Brixton, beckenham, Sydenham, honor oak park....
access: Guests have full use of the flat as their own to enjoy. There is wifi and a terrestrial TVs and DVD player. There is a DVD shop just up the road which the flat has membership for.
interaction: We work in the shops below and next to the flat so we are always available if there are any questions you need answering.
house_rules: Our only request is that you please don't pour fat down the sink. Leave to cool and bin it! Thanks.
host_about: My partner Cyrus and I grew up in south east London, we both lived in different countries for extended periods but found our way back home, to lay our roots and grow our family. We are both creatives, and craftsmanship is our driver. We own the beautiful shops  'Stag & Bow' and 'The Framing Salon' next door.

name: Bright And Comfy 2BD Apartment In Haggerston
summary: My light and beautiful two bedroom apartment is conveniently located around the corner from Haggerston station which has great connections to central London, and only a short stroll from Shoreditch, known for it's boutique shops, fantastic restaurants, trendy bars, and art culture.  It is situated in the heart of an area surrounded by things to do, and provides easy access to the city and all the amazing sights!
space: This beautiful 2 bedroom flat has been a great home for several years. Pretty and spacious, it’s conveniently nestled around the corner from Haggerston station with easy access to the rest of London.  Both bedrooms, one king-size and one double, are lovely and bright. Each comes with extra comfy mattresses for you to recharge after a day spent exploring the city. My cleaner places fresh, hotel quality linen and towels on the beds prior to your arrival.  The lounge is smart and classy; several pieces of classically styled furniture adding a touch of character to this space. Feel free to grab a book (there’s a great selection) from one of the shelves, kick back, and enjoy an hour of ‘me-time’. Alternatively, the cable TV has a great selection of channels for you to indulge in.  My kitchen is clean and comes fully equipped with a range of utensils and appliances - I’m sure it’ll be enough for you cook up a wholesome meal with friends and share some of your experiences from throughout the

neighborhood_overview: Haggerston’s endearingly worn-in atmosphere can be attributed to its motely mix of progressively designed flat complexes, orderly cafe counters, and meticulously boarded up windows. Sharing the same offbeat attitude as nearby Shoreditch, artists and students often congregate in Haggerston—a neighbourhood known for its laissez-faire attitude where unpredictability is expected. High-end neighbourhood hunters take note: this northeast London locale is better suited to those who appreciate a graffiti-friendly aesthetic and an everyday, multicultural community.
transit: The nearest stations are Haggerston (Overground line) and Dalston Junction (Overground line) which are both a 5 minute walk. The London Eye: 40 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 30 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 40 minutes on the tube Kings Cross: 30 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: I will be contactable prior to your stay. I use an agency to manage the property whilst I am away so you will have access to 24/7 help on the phone should you require it. I have used this agency before and found them extremely reliable.
house_rules: Please treat the home as you would your own.  Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.
host_about:
Hello,

I'm a children's doctor and have lived in London for the past 5 years with my husband, Rob. We're originally from Yorkshire but can't get enough of all that London has to offer.  

We love to travel and after a great 4 months in South America will be embarking on a few holidays this year during which we'll be letting out our home. While we are away you can count on a top class service from the agency we employ.

We both host and use Air BnB on our own trips so we hope we can give you a really great experience and although we will not meet we will supply you with all the local knowledge you need to enjoy our neighbourhood.

name: Large, modern 1 Bedroom Flat with Balcony
summary: 2nd floor apartment in a brand new building, with large balcony, all mod cons and a large living area. Very close to Acton Tube Station giving you super fast links to Central London and London Heathrow.
space: The development is less than a year old so its all brand new and works perfectly!  There is outside space in the form of a large balcony/terrace and also a shared garden space for all to use.  The rooms are bright and airy, clean and functional and the apartment offers everything you need.  Fully functioning kitchen with fridge/freezer, microwave, combi oven/microwave, full sized dishwasher, oven and full sets of crockery and cooking essentials. The bathroom is large, and has a bath and shower (with excellent water pressure). Plenty of fresh, clean towels are provided. The bedroom has a large double bed, and a chest of drawers for storage of your belongings. Carpeted, with blackout blinds to ensure a good nights sleep. The building is based off the main road so is very quiet too!

A larger supermarket is located a 7 minute walk away. The area is comprised of young professionals and some families. Lots of greenery and plenty of transport links too.
transit: Acton Gardens is a new development, with excellent transport links to Central London and Heathrow Airport on the Piccadilly Line (purple line) as well South Acton offers Overground (orange line) links to all of London. Acton Town is also serviced by the District Line (green line)
access: You'll be able to access all parts of the apartment, apart from one storage cupboard in the hall where I will keep my own belongings.
host_about: I'm a partner in a recruitment firm in South Kensington. I love to travel (the flat has excellent links to London Heathrow. Cooking and food feature greatly in my life as does sport and fitness, and FUN! I'm new to this airbnb but with such a great apartment, brand new, I know any of my guests will be very happy there.

The former Ministry of Pensions building, Bromyard House, was built in the early 1920s to accommodate 6,000 staff. During the Second World War the 540ft-long building served as headquarters for the Canadian military and was visited by King George VI. Later the Royal Air Force Police took it over, organising protection for all VIP flights, including those of the King, Winston Churchill and Field Marshal Montgomery. During the Second World War the 540ft-long building served as headquarters for the Canadian military and was visited by King George VI. Later the Royal Air Force Police took it over, organising protection for all VIP flights, including those of the King, Winston Churchill and Field Marshal Montgomery.
notes: The bed mattress is steam cleaned during every cleaning. There is a mattress topper on top  of a mattress that is frequently replaced. Studio is equipped to high standards. Cot bed is available upon request. it is steam cleaned after every use and lined with a memory foam mattress toper for your child's comfort. everything is clean and neat.

name: 2 Double Bedrooms, Stunning Flat, Great location
summary: My place is very close to The Horniman Museum and Gardens, East Dulwich, Honor Oak Park and Peckham. You’ll love my place because of the interiors, the location and the views. My place is good for couples and families. London Zone 3 only 12 minutes by train to central London (London Bridge) or direct to Shoreditch in 20 minutes or 10mins to the tube at Canada Water, the transport links are excellent by the way. The Flat is a 5 - 10 minute walk to the station depending on walking pace!
space: Newly refurbished to a very high standard with fantastic open plan kitchen and living area with breakfast bar and all the mod-cons including 50 inch Sony 4K TV with Netflix etc, high end speakers for TV or MP3 players. 42 inch Plasma TV also in the second bedroom. Designer bathroom with high pressure large shower head and many attractive/interesting features throughout the apartment such as window into the hallway area.  Wonderful views over leafy south London with breathtaking sunrises most clear mornings.

There is ample free parking directly outside the apartment building and on the entire street. Note there is no 'off street' parking.
notes: Drop me a note if the check in and out times are not suitable as I will do my best to be flexible and accommodate your needs. Note: There is ample free parking directly outside the apartment building and on the entire street. There is no 'off street' parking. The apartment is a top floor flat on the 2nd floor. Note that there is no lift and so guests must be able to climb the 2 flights of stairs.
transit: London Zone 3 only 12 minutes by train to central London (London Bridge) or direct to Shoreditch in 20 minutes or 10mins to the tube at Canada Water, the transport links are excellent by the way. The Flat is a 5 - 10 minute walk to the station depending on walking pace! Honor Oak Park and Forest Hill Stations are the closest. 0.5 miles away. Bus stop is just 50 metres away outside the flat to Dulwich, Brixton and Lewisham. However for central/city I normally always walk to train station as really takes no time at all.
house_rules: - Lock flat front door behind you with the key as it doesn't self lock - Please turn off lights, heating and all appliances each and every time you leave the flat - Please do not wear shoes in the bedrooms and if at all dirty please take off at the front door so not to stain or damage the carpets. Many thanks!

name: Beautiful double room in Clapham.
summary: For your stay is a lovely spacious double room in Clapham. 3 minutes walk from Clapham North tube station. The place is close to bars and restaurants of Clapham high street and 10 min tube ride into central London.
space: Guests will love staying here due to the proximity to the tube station along with the hustle and bustle of Clapham High Street. Comfortable room to relax in after a long day around london.
description: For your stay is a lovely spacious double room in Clapham. 3 minutes walk from Clapham North tube station. The place is close to bars and restaurants of Clapham high street and 10 min tube ride into central London. Guests will love staying here due to the proximity to the tube station along with the hustle and bustle of Clapham High Street. Comfortable room to relax in after a long day around london. The bedroom, toilet, bathroom and kitchen. Also free to join us in the living room. We are always around and available to help/ answer any question you have about London, places to visit, places to eat. Feel free to join us in the living room for chats and feel at home. Clapham is a great area to live. Full of friendly and welcoming people, comes to life at night with its extensive bars and restaurants. It also has a public leisure centre for swimming, gym and jacuzzi. The beautiful Clapham Common is not far from the flat about 10 minute walk, filled with sun worshippers and people wanting
neighborhood_overview: Clapham is a great area to live. Full of friendly and welcoming people, comes to life at night with its extensive bars and restaurants. It also has a public leisure centre for swimming, gym and jacuzzi. The beautiful Clapham Common is not far from the flat about 10 minute walk, filled with sun worshippers and people wanting to chill after a hard days work! The flat is a short tube ride to all the museums London has to offer, shopping in Oxford Street, Harrods and more. The room offers a comfortable space to relax, with wardrobe space, draws and a tv with Netflix to watch films in the evening.
notes: We have a daughter and a cat.
transit: We are based on the Northern line (black). You can get to us straight from Euston or Kings Cross. There is also Clapham High street overground 5 mins walk from the flat. Plenty of buses covering central London, Camden, Kensington and beyond.
access: The bedroom, toilet, bathroom and kitchen. Also free to join us in the living room.
interaction: We are always around and available to help/ answer any question you have about London, places to visit, places to eat. Feel free to join us in the living room for chats and feel at home.
host_about: I enjoying travelling the world, cooking and cycling. Renting on Airbnb has enabled me to stay at many beautiful places with the comfort of being at home.

name: Newly Refurbished Large Family Home-6 min to Tube
summary: My house is a newly refurbished, luxury 6 bedroom holiday home set in the heart of Turnpike Lane – just 6 mins from Turnpike Lane Tube Station and 15 minutes into Central London by Tube. *House is now ready to welcome you and your family to come and Enjoy London. 6 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, large open plan kitchen/dining / Separate living area, parking available, TV and fibre broadband, it really is a wonderful spacious home for families and groups of people to explore this beautiful city.
space: Newly Refurbished Large Family Home, 6 minutes from Turnpike Lane. Interiors are my passion and this house won't disappoint. 6 bedrooms, 1 receptions room, Kitchen/Diner. Welcome Breakfast and Drinks Provided with a Costa Coffee with press of a Bosh Tassimo machine, a great new kitchen/Diner, opening onto garden where you will only hear Birds, this house is perfect for a anyone who wants to get-away or for those who love to be entertained in our wonderful London City. The House has just finished going though complete renovations and it now boasts 2 Double Room in the Loft with 1 ensuite. 1st floor has 2 nice size Double bed and 1 single with separate very large luxury bathroom. Downstairs there is a large Double Bedroom, separate toilet/Sink under the stairs, small utility room leads into the newly built luxury kitchen with Granite worktop and spacious Dining area. neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood - it's vibrant and full of character. The house is a stone's throw from Wood Green and Green Lanes, where you can get some of the best Turkish food in London as well as Shopping Mall with various shops to choose from, 2 Cinema. There are also great local cafes to choose from as well as Hornsey and Crouch End few minutes away, and lots of lovely parks including the Historic Alexandra Place. I will be happy to make any recommendations in Planning your Stay in London, help with booking your favourite site-seeing, Theatres if you're interested.
notes: We offer Additional Service and facility: * Airport Pick up/Drop * Guided Tour of London/United Kingdom or drive you anywhere in Europe * Home made Indian Lunch/Dinner can be provided on request  * Private Car Hire with Driver Available  * Chauffeur driven facility available  *  Please email us with any request outside this options or any wish and we     will endeavour to make it happen. * Shopping trips can be organised to Largest shopping malls i.e. Brent Cross, Choice of 2 Westfield in London or Lakeside Or Bluewater outside London in Kent * Day trip can be arranged to Zoo, Tourists spots, Stonehenge and so many more. What every may be your wish just ask and I will try to accommodate
transit: Our house is very well situated for public transport links. You can walk to Turnpike Lane tube (6 mins, zone 3). There are also lots of bus routes into Central London and around London.
access: Feel free to use the house as your own home, if I can add anything extra pleas feel free to ask.
interaction: The whole house will be yours, as we only let the whole house whilst we live minute away in our own house. We will ensure we meet you, checked in properly, feel at home and will be contactable during your stay if you need us. Also on hand if assistance is required with traveling into London, Booking tickets to theatre, Provide any kind of help, just ask, Can provide ideas where to shop or go, Can help with private car hire or drop to airport or pick up Happy to listen and help in any way.
house_rules: Please Note house is in a safer neighbourhood area where everyone knows each other, please smoke where it does not offend your local's. Smoking generally is fine but do not throw butts in the grass. Any stains on Carpets or bedding/towels will be chargeable  Window shutters throughout the house, they are not to be used for drying laundry please, it will get damaged and expensive to repair, thank you

name: Large bright room, 10 min walk to London Eye
summary: Large and bright private room with three single beds above traditional pub. Use of a shared kitchen and two shared bathrooms.  Great central location. Short walk from Imperial War Museum, London Eye, Southbank and Houses of Parliament. Short walk from Lambeth North Underground and Waterloo Station, as well as several bus stops.
space: The location is perfect for sight-seeing and exploring London, with all the major attractions and sights easily accessible from the room. It is also located above a traditional pub, so an ideal place to start for a few drinks and food if heading out on the town! Pub website:  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  ***We are now taking bookings for Christmas and New Year's. We are located in the heart of the city- Christmas markets and Hyde Park's Winter Wonderland only a short bus/tube ride away & the only a 10 minute walk from the famous London NYE fireworks. Staying above The Pineapple, you will easily be able to get there nice and early to get a good spot, but please note that this is a ticketed event (see link below)***  (Website hidden by Airbnb)

neighborhood_overview: The Lambeth North/Waterloo area is a very central London location with fantastic transport links. It is a wonderfully diverse and safe community, with plenty of bars, restaurants, coffee shops etc. Several major attractions are within walking distance (London Eye, Houses of Parliament, Westminster Abbey), as well as South Bank and the trendy Lower Marsh.
notes: Please note that the stairs that guests use to exit/enter the pub after check in are spiral and quite narrow, so not suitable for young children or those with mobility issues. Please message Emma if you have any concerns and we will allow access through the pub where possible. Also note that the room is located directly above a pub so there may be noise from the pub in the evenings, but this is usually not a problem past 11pm on week days and midnight on Fridays and weekends.
transit: - Waterloo Rail Station/ Underground: 10 min walk - Lambeth North Underground: 2 min walk - Several buses stop nearby
access: The room is located above a traditional pub called The Pineapple.  The room is private and you will be given a set of keys for the room. Usually you will be taken up to the room through the pub but guests will then have a separate entrance/exit through the back of the pub, so you will not need to go through the pub to get to your room throughout your visit. *** The back route involves an outdoor spiral staircase, so please let us know if you have any large luggage or mobility issues and we will do our best to assist *** Guests have access to a small but well-equipped kitchen, three toilets and two shower rooms (all communal). The room itself, the kitchen and one toilet are located on the same floor (directly above the pub), and the two shower rooms with toilets are located on the floor above. *** Guests will have to walk one flight of stairs to access the room and then another flight of stairs to access the shower rooms *** Guests are more than welcome to eat and drink downstairs in Th
interaction: As the Air Bnb hosts, we are father (Sean) and daughter (Emma). One of us are usually around to help out if needed, but we will give you space. Alternatively, you can speak to Emma on the Air Bnb App or speak to Ted behind the bar.
host_about:
Hello,
I am a 25 year old female, who works in mental health, and runs two air bnb rooms with my Dad (Sean) above our family pub. 
We love hosting guests at our place.

neighborhood_overview: Close to London City Airport, Stratford Olympic Park, Canary Wharf, Greenwich, O2 Arena and only 30 minutes from Big Ben and City Center.
notes: WiFi: Fiber optic technology - provides the highest possible speed of Internet connection. Washing machine available for £5 fee per 7kg wash (to cover costs of washing powder, electricity and water bills). To be handled cash prior use.
transit: 3 minutes walk from Caning Town tube station where you can take the Jubilee line and the DLR.
interaction: Always available if you require help or recommendations but will not be intrusive.
house_rules: - Check-in before 8pm (flexible Sunday to Thursday evenings, on demand). - Check-out strictly before 11am as room has to be cleaned and ready for guests arriving the same day from 3pm - £20 per started hour will be asked if check-out is done later. - Quiet time between 10pm and 8am. - Smoking is forbidden in the guest's room but allowed on the balcony in the shared area (therefore some very light smoke smell could be detected by more sensitive people...).
host_about:
Hi there, welcome to our home!

We are a French couple who enjoy meeting people from all over the world and enjoy showing others why we love living in London. All the museums and art galleries are just few minutes by tube away from us. We know a lot about London as we have been living here over 12 years. 

We adore traveling when possible and are pleased to offer our spare room for others to enjoy London, one of the best cities in Europe. 

Come and stay with us and enjoy all that London has to offer!

Perfect for families or groups, the room has a queen size and single bed, a couch, chair and plenty of storage space. The shared kitchen/dining room and bathroom are upstairs. name: Belsize Park - great location, quality, price
summary: This private self-contained double studio flat is set in the heart of beautiful Belsize Park.  Within the flat there is a double bed, private shower room, fully equipped kitchen with all main utensils provided, as well as a desk/workspace and television. The flat is supplied with a full set of clean bed linen and towels.
description: This private self-contained double studio flat is set in the heart of beautiful Belsize Park.  Within the flat there is a double bed, private shower room, fully equipped kitchen with all main utensils provided, as well as a desk/workspace and television. The flat is supplied with a full set of clean bed linen and towels. Belsize Park is a beautiful area and this flat is located just a few minutes walk from the many coffee shops, delicious restaurants, mini supermarkets and shops on Haverstock Hill. There's even an Everyman Cinema! Why not explore nearby areas such as Hampstead and Camden? Or even walk to the top of Primrose Hill for (in my opinion) the best view in London. Want to see more - Belsize Park Underground Station (Northern Line, Zone 2) and Swiss Cottage Underground Station (Jubilee Line) are located just a few minutes walk from this flat and provide excellent access to this exciting city! There is no lift/ elevator in the building. Please note in the kitchen all basic cooki

host_about: Enjoy spending time with friends and going to all the deliciously good food pop ups in London.

name: Double Room near Canada Water tube station
summary: Cosy private room in a clean 4 bedroom townhouse away from the main road and traffic. 13 mins walk or 3 mins bus ride to Canada Water for the great links on Jubilee line - London Bridge and Canary Wharf 3 mins, Waterloo 7 mins, Westminster 9 mins. The vibrant Shoreditch is 4 stops on the Overground. Surrounded by parks and the Thames overlooking Canary Wharf. Short walk to historic pubs, cinema, supermarket. Please check with me before booking if you need parking as only 1 space is available.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential green docklands area surrounded by the Thames on three sides with parks and pleasant walking paths. Situated between Canary Wharf across the river to the east and Tower Bridge to the west. The house is in 2 mins walk from Russia Dock Woodland which takes you to the Stave Hill Ecological Park to the right or Greenland Docks to the left. Enjoy your long walks by the Thames overlooking Canary Wharf and the Isle of Dogs. The Royal Observatory and Cutty Sark is within a very easy reach too.
notes: No shoes allowed on the top floor with carpets, where all the bedrooms are. Please check with me before booking if you need parking. Only 1 space is available in front of the house and it may be taken prior your booking by guests staying in other rooms.
transit: 13 mins walk or 3 mins ride on a bus to Canada Water tube station for the Jubilee line and Overground trains. Surrey Quays Overground station is also within 10 mins walk. Busses C10 and 381 also night bus services in 2 mins walk from the house. Easy access from Canada Water station to the city and the main touristic attractions: London Bridge or Canary Wharf 3 mins Greenwich 5 mins Westminster 9 mins Tower Bridge, Liverpool Street or Shoreditch 12 mins
access: Kitchen with diner, washing machine and all the basic utensils Bathroom with shower and toilet

Minimum interaction but I’m available most of the time should you have any issue, emergency or questions. Airbnb messaging is preferred but you can also use (Hidden by Airbnb) , Viber or text. Call in emergency is ok too.

Cooking is allowed within a reasonably limited time  - please be considerate of others' needs to use the kitchen. name: Central London, Bright Spacious flat, well linked
summary: New, bright & spacious flat in Zone 1 central London. Transport links across London - perfect for exploring!  Trendy area with good bars, restaurants, markets & shops. Famous markets within walking distance: Mercato Metropolitano - 3 mins, Borough Market at London Bridge - 10 mins I will love to meet & greet you on arrival & make sure you have everything for a perfect stay. If you need any ideas for things to do & see in London just let me know Early or late check in/out available on request
space: Newly refurbished bright and spacious apartment. Very clean and tidy. No shoe household. I love my apartment and I hope you will enjoy your stay too :) Kitchen is fully equipped if you need to cook or just microwave! I will also provide a variety of cereals, porridge oats and a small breakfast buffet, including tea, coffee, hot chocolate and biscuits.   Sitting room has cable TV, two sofas (including a double sofabed) and a dining area.  We also provide free WiFi access. Master Bedroom has its own ensuite shower and toilet. name: Scandinavian flat in the heart of Stoke Newington
summary: Modern bright Scandinavian flat, located on a quiet street in the heart of Stoke Newington in North London. Supermarkets, cafe's, restaurants and pubs are all on your doorstep. The flat is situated 5 mins walk from the overground and 2 mins walk to buses that take you to Kings Cross in less than 30 mins. A truly amazing place to enjoy local life in London.
space: New, bright and quite place with cafe's, pubs and great transportation options only a few minutes away.

host_about:
Hi,

We're a Scandinavian couple who both work with online marketing in London since early 2016. Although we love our cozy little base here in London we also highly enjoy traveling and visiting our family and friends back home, which is why we'd like to share our local London life with other globetrotters and rent out our flat while we travel. Looking forward to hear from you if you are interested in accommodating our flat while we are away.   

Kind regards,
Celine & Johan

GENERAL RULES: All linens and towels are provided and included in the price. Standard iPhone, USB cables and travel adapters are available to use free of charge. No parties, no overnight guests without previous approval from your host. If you want to bring outside visitors, please ask first. If you break or damage something, please inform the host. I am entrepreneur who loves being around like-minded people. I enjoy travelling, music, books, photography, cooking, good conversations.

name: Double Room + Breakfast + Garden = Bright & Comfy
summary: Our quiet and bright house has a premium location with a private garden, self-service breakfast and great amenities for your stay either for leisure or work. 5 minutes walk to train station and DLR. DLR direct to CANARY WARF, direct train to LONDON BRIDGE and LONDON VICTORIA. GREENWICH PARK is so close that you will enjoy walking there and get lost in the view.  We prepared our home for you. It is very quiet, cosy and ready to give you a COMFORTABLE LONDON EXPERIENCE.
space: A beautiful new built house in typical English brick. 2 floors with 3 bedrooms (one is ours the other is for you and the third is used as an office or extra bedroom when needed), a kitchen, big living room and dining room, and a private back garden facing south. It has a lot of light, it´s very quiet and in a friendly neighbourhood.  It is decorated in a warm and functional way with particular attention to your room, the guest room, to allow you to feel special and comfortable.

It is decorated in a warm and functional way with particular attention to your room, the guest room, to allow you to feel special and comfortable. Our guests can access the kitchen, 2 bathroo
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet and friendly neighbourhood that has all that you may need at walking distance: public transportation, street market, shopping centre, McDonald's, Costa Coffee, Tesco, Sainsbury's and Asda, just to name a few. Lovely Greenwich is within walking distance.
notes: My husband and I are the only inhabitants of our place. We love travelling and we are frequent Airbnb guests. We would like to allow other people like minded to have the same welcoming travelling experiences that we often have.
transit: Train and DLR at 5/8 minutes walking distance. Several bus stops. 14 minutes by DLR to Canary Warf. 12 minutes by train to London Bridge. 20 minutes by train to London Victoria. Walking distance from Greenwich Park, Greenwich Royal Observatory, Cutty Sark and Royal Naval College.
access: Our guests can access the kitchen, 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room and private garden. We have a washing machine that is free to be used by guests that stay over 7 nights, below that there's a fee of 5GBP.
interaction: We respect our guest's privacy. We are available to give all the help and information you may need to have a fantastic London experience (transport information, places to eat, places to visit, how to get around, what to do and see..). Your stay at our place is about you and your experience and we are here to help you make it a good one.
house_rules: - No shoes in house
host_about:
I'm Cristiana and with my husband Alex we moved from Portugal to London. We know the city both from a tourist and local inhabitant perspective and we love it! We love travelling and both being an Airbnb guest and host.
As guests, we ultimately respect our hosts' place and take care of it like my own.
As hosts, we respect our guests' privacy and comfort while facilitating a memorable experience of the city.

"Dare to be happy" :)

neighborhood_overview: We are one of the closest accommodations to Heathrow Airport.  Next to the apartment there are expensive hotels which all have luxury restaurants and bars.  If you are attending conferences at the nearby Hotels then this apartment could be perfect for you.  There is a McDonalds a few minutes walk from the apartment.  There are some small local supermarkets too which are about 2 or 4 minutes walk from the apartment.  There are a few gyms in the area. There is one gym across the road at the Renaissance hotel and there is another gym at the Park in hotel which are open to the public. There are many car rental offices nearby.  There are bus stops about 1 minute walk from the apartment. The nearest Royal Mail postbox is only 60 seconds from the front of the building. Perfect if you want to send postcards from London to your friends around the world. The nearest pub which is nice where you can get affordable food is called The Pheasant Restaurant and Pheasant Inn which is 12minutes walking f
transit: This property is within a free travel zone. The local London buses to and from Heathrow Airport are free. From Heathrow Central Bus Station is about a 6 minute journey. From the Bus Stop opposite the apartment travelling into Heathrow Airport takes approximately 3 or 4 minutes.  With a journey time of 15 minutes between the airport and London Paddington Central London, and departures every 15 minutes, Heathrow Express offers the fastest journey time. Paddington station in Central London is close to Hyde Park and Oxford Street. From Paddington you can catch trains to the West, South-West and south Wales, or take London Underground's District, Circle, Bakerloo or Hammersmith & City lines. From the apartment the local buses available are: (Bus285, Bus105, Bus111, Bus140) and N9 London Underground's Piccadilly Line provides the most cost-effective rail route between Heathrow Airport and Central London. Journey time by the Underground Tube trains is under an hour and you shouldn't have to w
access: You will have access to your double room and a shared bathroom. You will also be able to use the washing machine during the day. Most of the time you will have the apartment to yourself. We give you a set of keys to use. Access to the apartment is 24 hours. We want you to have absolute freedom and to feel comfortable while you are here.
interaction: Myself and Elmira will be available to assist you throughout your stay. If you need any guidance on anything relating to your stay, we will always offer to help you. We are very happy to give you any tourist information about London. Alex speaks a few words in many languages. Elmira speaks fluent English and Russian. When you arrive we will happily give you our contact details so that if you have any questions during your stay you can call or email us. We like to give our guests absolute privacy while you are with us. If you need time to rest, time to study, to read, to be alone with your companions or to work then we want you to feel absolutely comfortable. Once you check in and all the introductions are complete, we like to leave you to have your time to yourselves. Of course you can ask us as many questions as you like. We love to help you. We can always give you all our contact details when you check in.
house_rules: There are no rules. Our house is your house. We want you to feel very comfortable here. Only rule is that smoking is not allowed. If you want to smoke, there is a designated smoking area outside the building :)
host_about: We are super friendly and super helpful. Everyone is welcome to stay with us. Whether you are here on business or as a tourist, we will look after you during your stay in London. We are happy to provide you with tourist information about London too. If you have any questions or if you need help with anything then feel very free to contact us.

space: Newly refurbished studio apartment with en suite bathroom on the 3rd floor of a historic Grade 2 listed Victorian building situated on a leafy residential street adjacent to Hyde Park. The apartment has been tastefully decorated with real wood floorings and new furniture. The apartment sleeps 1 adult on the single bed. The En suite includes, shower, sink & WC. There is also a private kitchenette in the studio room that comes fully equipped with a fridge, 2 plate hob, Microwave, Kettle, Toaster and all the cutlery, crockery, cookware & glassware you would need. High speed WIFI Internet is provided free of charge. Essentials such as Iron, Iron Board, Hair Dryer, Fresh Bedding & Towels are also all provided for every guest. Furthermore, Self-service Laundry facilities are available on site. The apartment is a great choice for a comfortable short stay in One of London’s best locations. Ideal for solo adventurers or business travellers.

neighborhood_overview: Situated in the upmarket residential and Tourist area of Bayswater in Central London the apartment is ideally located for all the amenities of Queensway, Westbourne Grove & Notting Hill. The apartment is served by 2 large local supermarkets within 5 minutes’ walk. There is also a huge range of tourist attractions, shopping hotspots, restaurants, fast food outlets, cafes & bars all within walking distance. There are also 2 tube stations a stone’s throw away to use as a base to explore everything that London has to offer. The convenient location of this apartment simply can’t be beat.   Some of the local attractions include:- Within Walking Distance Shopping & Entertainment on Queensway 1 minute walk Hyde Park & Kensington Gardens 2 minute walk Whiteleys Shopping Centre 3 minute walk Queensway Ice Rink & Bowling 3 minute walk Westbourne Grove Restaurants & Bars 5 minute walk Kensington Palace 8 minute walk Paddington 8 Minute Walk Serpentine Lake & Princess Diana Memorial 10 minute walk
transit: Getting around London couldn’t be easier. Bayswater Station is less than 3 minutes’ walk away & Queensway station is also less than 5 minutes’ walk away. Paddington Main line station with the Heathrow Express & National rail is only 8 minutes’ walk away or 3 minutes by taxi or tube. Almost everything you would ever want to do in London will be no more than 10-15 minutes’ journey time from this amazingly located apartment.

name: New Central London double with private bathroom
summary: Brand new apartment with modern, minimalist décor in an ideal location whether you are in town for business or pleasure.  The apartment is a short walk away from London Bridge station and Tower Bridge.  It is also perfectly located to explore a number of bars and restaurants plus the amazing Maltby Street Market is only five minutes walk away.   The apartment is clean and spacious with a front terrace overlooking the Shard and a rear balcony providing amazing views of Canary Wharf.
space: The room comes with a large private bathroom containing a bath and shower. There are a number of supermarkets just a couple of minutes walk from the flat plus numerous takeaway options.

name: Modern, luxurious home with Hot Tub and Log Burner
summary: Large, modern 3 bedroom 2 bathroom detached family home recently refurbished to a high standard. Features a modern kitchen, large dining area and entertainment space, a wood burner for cold winter nights and a large garden with hot tub and ample entertainment space for sunny summer days. Local shops, 2 large supermarkets and a number of restaurants are within a 5 min drive along with 2 railway stations with quick (25 mins) and easy  access to London Victoria, London Bridge & Gatwick airport.
space: Located in South Croydon, the house has been recently refurbished to a high standard with a number of luxury features to make your stay more enjoyable. It features free wifi, Sony sound system with speakers in every room, high pressure hot water system with gas central heating and additional underfloor heating in kitchen and dining space.  Kitchen - Bosch appliances: Double oven, 4 burner gas hob, dishwasher, fridge freezer & washing machine. Plenty of cutlery, crockery, glassware and cookware for large family meals and entertaining. Nespresso machine, microwave, toaster, kettle and 6 bottle wine fridge.  Dining room - very large bright entertainment space featuring 2 remote operated skylights. 8 seater extendable dining table and 8 chairs.  Lounge - plenty of comfortable seating with a wood burner and bi-fold doors opening up to the patio area. 55 inch Sony Bravia TV with surround sound and cable TV. Double sofa bed Garden - large west facing garden with grass, patio and decked areas
description: Large, modern 3 bedroom 2 bathroom detached family home recently refurbished to a high standard. Features a modern kitchen, large dining area and entertainment space, a wood burner for cold winter nights and a large garden with hot tub and ample entertainment space for sunny summer days. Local shops, 2 large supermarkets and a number of restaurants are within a 5 min drive along with 2 railway stations with quick (25 mins) and easy  access to London Victoria, London Bridge & Gatwick airport. Located in South Croydon, the house has been recently refurbished to a high standard with a number of luxury features to make your stay more enjoyable. It features free wifi, Sony sound system with speakers in every room, high pressure hot water system with gas central heating and additional underfloor heating in kitchen and dining space.  Kitchen - Bosch appliances: Double oven, 4 burner gas hob, dishwasher, fridge freezer & washing machine. Plenty of cutlery, crockery, glassware and cookware for
neighborhood_overview: The house is situated in South Croydon and is walking distance from Sanderstead village where there are coffeeshops, hairdressers, a post office, a large waitrose supermarket and petrol station. There is good Chinese restaurant, hairdressers and beauticians. You will also find The Rectory Park (10 min walk), has a children's play ground a great area for dog walks. There is also a large sainsburys 5 mins drive away. A number of very good restaurants can be found in Warlingham, South Croydon and Purley, all within a 10 minute drive or between £6-£12 in a taxi, we would be happy to make recommendations. As we are at the start of the North Downs, there are a number of beautiful walks very close by with a number of great country pubs. We will provide more details in the information pack, but happy to answer questions before you book or before your stay commences.
notes: A detailed instruction guide will be available in the house with information on all of the appliances/equipment, rules of the house and the local area. All towels and bedding (including for the sofa bed) will be provided, but if guests are using the hot tub regularly then you may need to wash and dry the towels during your stay. A gardener will visit the house and access the garden directly, along with someone to clean and add chemicals to the hot tub, we will advise of when they are coming once you have booked. You do not need to be in when they arrive. For stays of a week or longer, a cleaner can be arranged to visit the house at an additional cost.
transit: We are located about 15 mins away from junction 8 of the M25, so we have very easy access to Gatwick, Heathrow and the South Coast. Central London is about 1 hours drive, depending on traffic. We are very close to two railway stations - Purley Oaks and Sanderstead - which have direct frequent trains into London Victoria and London Bridge. The journey is 20-30 mins depending on the time of day. Both stations are a 20 minute downhill walk away, but please bear in mind that it is uphill on the way back and it is quite a steep hill! Both stations have car parks charged at £5 per day and a taxi to the house from either station is £5.50 with a very good local taxi company. We are in zone 6 and oyster cards/contactless work at both stations. We are two stops away from Easy Croydon, which has lots of shops and restaurants itself, but its main railway station provides direct access to Brighton, Gatwick, Clapham Junction, London Blackfriars and London St Pancras.  London Heathrow is a 50 minute
access: The house is our home and we are making it available for guests to enjoy while we are travelling or out of the country with our work. We ask that guests treat the house, its furniture and our possessions with respect and report any breakages immediately. Some of our personal items will be locked away in the 4th bedroom of the house and guests will not have access to this room. We would love to be able to return the security deposit in full to you of course.
interaction: We will always be available by phone and email, but as we are likely to be out of the country during your stay, we have family that live very close by who will manage the check in and check out process and will be contactable throughout your stay if you have any questions or emergencies.
house_rules: - Smoking is only permitted outside of the property, ash trays will be provided and must be used. Any evidence of smoking inside the property or damage caused by smoking will lead to a minimum of £250 being deducted from the security deposit. - If using the hot tub, all rules in the house guide must be followed. You will be shown upon check-in how to operate it safely. The rules of use include but are not limited to: Users must not wear sun tan lotion, fake tan or body lotion when using the hot tub. Please take a shower ahead of use, as this will cause the filter to clog and impact the quality of the water, requiring it to be replaced at your expense. No glass is to be used in the tub, plastic glasses are provided. Broken glass can cause injury, damage jet pumps and will require the hot tub to be drained and serviced at your expense. The temperature must not go above 38 degrees, no settings should be changed - this can damage the heating elements and affect the operation of the tub. -
host_about:
Welcome to my profile!

I live in South Croydon with my Partner Phil and we both travel a lot for work and for pleasure. We love to experience new places, new food and meet new people. We look forward to staying in your home when we are on our travels and welcome you to our home when you are travelling to London.

Matt & Phil
