name: The front room with Wifi, kingsize bed & 24hr self
summary: My place is close to the City. The amenities, ambiance, the outdoors space, the neighbourhood, and being on the ground floor makes my home unique. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and friends. I am flexible with check in and check out time and this depends on the departure and arrival timings. The room has a king size bed and I provide clean linen towels and slippers and toiletries. Room 1 is also well lit with wide windows facing the front of the house.
space: The flat is also in a quiet upmarket in south London and it is perfect for families to rest and recover after a busy day out sightseeing  The flat is in zone 2 with various transport links from oval and Vauxhall (in zone 1) both in a walking distance of 5 minutes. It only takes 15 minutes to central London and most of the London tourists attractions can be reached in half hour. Access to full use of a kitchen with a fridge, kettle, toaster, microwave and all utensils.  Coffee, tea, sugar and milk provided.  My place is unique for its locality safety accessibility and excellent transport via Bus, train, underground/metro and National Express to all Airport.  From Gatwick drop off/pick up is located at the bus stop V on south Lambeth road /Lawn Lane. Other drop off and pick up to other airports are available around Vauxhall and Kennington. National Express to stanstead airport and Heathrow can also be used for local drop off and pick up or from Victoria. All this will save you time and s

neighborhood_overview: We are near to the oval Kia and it is 5 minutes to walk to the oval or Vauxhall stations. Bus routes to Victoria and central London are within 2 minutes.
notes: Early self checking in is available on request for guest who land early in the morning. Later collection of bags can be considered on request
transit: We are easy to find and conveniently located within 5 minutes from Oval (zone 2) and Vauxhall (zone 1) Stations. It's only one minute walk to the bus stop with easy reach to every place in central London.  All transport network can get you to all the tourists attractions including the London Eye, Buckingham Palace, theatres, Tower of London, Tower Bridge, Westminster Abbey, St Paul Cathedral, Big Ben, Globe Theatre, Hyde Park, Kensington Palace, London Dungeons, Trafalgar Square, Madam Tussauds, National Portrait Gallery, Olympic Park, Borough Market, Liverpool Street Market and Camden market.  There are 3 different buses via Victoria station to Paddington. 436, 36 and 185. Within one minute you get this bus stop. Also from oval Brixton road to get bus 159 to central London Trafalgar Square Westminster bridge Big Ben and Piccadilly Circus. Bus 133 to Liverpool Street and the City area or Bank. Bus 59 to Waterloo and Leicester Square. Taxi by Uber with a free ride when you open up an ac
access: Kitchen accessible 24 hours  and breakfast is self service.
interaction: I am accessible via phone and email. Am also on what's up on the same number.
host_about: Hi am easy going and open minded person with respect to range of people from different parts of the world. I like entertaining, food, music and please feel free to ask me about things and life in London. When you stay with me take the home as your own and feel free to come and go as yo please. No restrictions but be fair to other guests.

name: Spacious and airy flat near Maidavale
summary: My flat is a spacious, airy and comfy apartment in a modern building which was built 5 years ago. There is a living-room with kitchen opening onto a small balcony, a bathroom and a roomy bedroom. The area is very convenient for all the nice spots in West London and to visit all main areas in the city. Transport is excellent
space: This is a one bedroom flat with two very separate spaces. The living-room has a a comfy sofa bed which sleeps two comfortably. In the same room there are modern kitchen units with all utensils and a table that sits 4, as well as a large TV. The bedroom is a large double, with a comfy double bed. The bathroom is new and spacious with a washer / dryer, and a hair dryer. There is access to a private balcony with a great view
description: My flat is a spacious, airy and comfy apartment in a modern building which was built 5 years ago. There is a living-room with kitchen opening onto a small balcony, a bathroom and a roomy bedroom. The area is very convenient for all the nice spots in West London and to visit all main areas in the city. Transport is excellent This is a one bedroom flat with two very separate spaces. The living-room has a a comfy sofa bed which sleeps two comfortably. In the same room there are modern kitchen units with all utensils and a table that sits 4, as well as a large TV. The bedroom is a large double, with a comfy double bed. The bathroom is new and spacious with a washer / dryer, and a hair dryer. There is access to a private balcony with a great view The entire flat will be available for you Whenever I am away I always make sure that someone is available to help 10 minutes walk to Maidavale and Little Venice 5 minutes walk to Queen's Park 15 minutes walk to Kensal Rise / Kensal Green 20 minutes
neighborhood_overview: 10 minutes walk to Maidavale and Little Venice 5 minutes walk to Queen's Park 15 minutes walk to Kensal Rise / Kensal Green 20 minutes to Portobello and Notting Hill Perfect base to explore central London and also enjoy 3 lovely areas There are lots of good pubs and restaurants in the immediate area and nearby. Maida Vale, or ‘Little Venice’ is a mere 10-minute walk away and has many more cafés and boutiques to enjoy too. Similarly Salusbury road, the heart of Queen's Park, is just a few minutes way.  You can take a short walk (15 minutes) or bus rise to Chamberlayne Road - which was named the “hippest street in Europe” by Vogue magazine to enjoy the array of trendy boutique shops and independent bars. amily friendly Maida Vale neighbourhood has an abudance of restaurants, gastropubs, boutiques, cafes along the Regent's Canal in Little Venice and Regents Park a couple of miles away for a huge green space. Neighbouring Notting Hill is a cosmopolitan district known for its summer carniva
notes: Please note this is a quiet flat perfect for people who enjoy privacy. Access from the airports is very easy (tube or bus) but most people underestimate how big London is and how long it takes to get to and form places. So from most nieghboourhoods I would estimate 2 to 3 hours journey.
transit: Very good transport links: Tube - Bakerloo Line (Queen's Park Station), 20 minutes to Piccadilly and Oxford Circus Bus - 316 to Westfield, 6 to Oxford Circus, 31 to Camden Trains - Overground to Euston Station (15 minutes)

host_about: Hello, my name is Issa.  I have lived in London for the last 10 years and this is very much my home now. I like cooking, music and I am an Arsenal supporter. I enjoy eating out and always try to discover new places. I hope you will enjoy staying at my place even if you support Chelsea!

name: Central yet serene spacious Brixton apartment
summary: *PLEASE MESSAGE ME BEFORE BOOKING*  Welcome to my bright roomy studio with amazing views over historic houses and huge trees. Super peaceful and sunny yet minutes from lively Brixton's shopping, dining, entertainment and transport. Separate bathroom and kitchen with coffee, teas, cooking essentials and quality toiletries. Very comfortable bed and sofa bed, nice linens, desk and dining area. The communal gardens have exercise machines and permit parking for £1.50 per day.
space: Want a shorter or longer stay? Get in touch and we will see what we can do. Please note there is a 90 day limit for 'holiday' renting in London. So do make contact if you would like to discuss special pricing for rentals over 90 days.

neighborhood_overview: Brixton is a vibrant area with everything you could need. A huge range of eating and drinking options, art house cinema, large nightclubs and music venues, cosy pubs, most of the main stores and supermarkets, street markets and historic covered markets, and frequent cultural events. Not far away is lovely Brockwell Park and it's Lido. Once the locals best kept secret, airbnb has opened it up to the world.
notes: Gym: I put gym in the amenities as there are exercise machines in the garden. There is no indoor gym. Lost key charges: if keys are lost there will be a replacement charge of £19 (that's how much they cost) and a fee of £10 for the time spent having them replaced. A second set of bedding is available for the sofa bed for a third person. If you are 2 people who would like separate beds please book a third person to cover the cost of the extra linen service.
transit: My space is 5 - 10 minutes walk from loads of buses and the Victoria line tube which goes every minute and gets you to central London in 15 minutes. Daily parking permits are £1.50.
access: You will have the place to yourselves as I live on my boat. There will be sets of keys for each guest.
interaction: I will be there to greet you, then I stay on my boat on the canal, but am reachable by phone and Airbnb message. There is a key drop system for departures.  If I'm away a friend will co-host.  Where possible check in and out are flexible but if bookings are back to back 11.00 check out and 2.00 check in times are applied.
house_rules: - Parking permits are available for a fee. - No noise after midnight please. Respect the community. - Where possible check in and out are flexible but if there are back to back bookings an 11.00 check out and 2.00 check in are in place.
host_about: I've had a multicultural upbringing in New Zealand, Australia, Wales and Spain before spending the longest time in London with a 6 year stint in Thailand. Consequently I have a great familiarity with jetlag! I've had the pleasure of working in 5 Star hotels and Spas as an Acupuncturist, Aromatherapist and Yoga teacher so have a taste for elegance - on a budget. I hope to make your stay as stress free as possible and have a good knowledge of London to share.

name: Lovely Private Double Room with own small garden
summary: Lovely room in spacious ground floor flat with a small private garden.  It is 3 mins walk to Manor House station (Zone 2) with regular bus services. A reservoir is immediately across the road, it includes the Wetlands Wildlife Reserve, North London Climbing Centre, and has a cafe and sailing facilities. We are walking distance from supermarkets, restaurants, the cinema, leisure centres and the Park Theatre. Two parks are 5 mins walk and Arsenal Emirates Stadium is about 30 mins. Must love cats.
space: It is close to public transport both numerous buses including night bus services and the Picadilly and Victoria lines. The castle climbing centre, wildlife wetlands reserve, reservoir, and two parks are very nearby. Within a 30min walk are numerous restaurants an oden cinema a public swimming pool and the park theatre.
description: Lovely room in spacious ground floor flat with a small private garden.  It is 3 mins walk to Manor House station (Zone 2) with regular bus services. A reservoir is immediately across the road, it includes the Wetlands Wildlife Reserve, North London Climbing Centre, and has a cafe and sailing facilities. We are walking distance from supermarkets, restaurants, the cinema, leisure centres and the Park Theatre. Two parks are 5 mins walk and Arsenal Emirates Stadium is about 30 mins. Must love cats. It is close to public transport both numerous buses including night bus services and the Picadilly and Victoria lines. The castle climbing centre, wildlife wetlands reserve, reservoir, and two parks are very nearby. Within a 30min walk are numerous restaurants an oden cinema a public swimming pool and the park theatre. You have access to our private garden, a separate shower room, toilet and bathroom. In addition you are welcome to chill out in the sitting room, Dining area and use the kitchen.
transit: Locally walking will get you to a variety of nice places. But there is easy access to buses 141 and 341 just outside the house, others such as the 29, 279 and 259 as well as the 253 and 254 are within 4min walk. These services can take you to Wood Green, Islington, Camden, the City, London Bridge, and the West end. It is also easy to reach Heathrow terminals though takes about 1:15.
access: You have access to our private garden, a separate shower room, toilet and bathroom. In addition you are welcome to chill out in the sitting room, Dining area and use the kitchen.
interaction: We live on site so feel free to ask us any questions or contact us via text messages. I am usually pretty quick to respond. We like to chat with our guests so feel free to tell us about your travels.
house_rules: No shoes in house. Our cats are indoor pets as we are near busy roads. So please do not let them out, windows and doors should be opened only a few centimetres to allow fresh air but keep them inside. We are in central London so please close and lock windows when going out.

name: Superb modern private bedroom near Tower bridge
summary: The private bedroom is of high standard with dedicated separate bathroom in a brand new high specs apartment with balcony and courtyard view.  Mostly booked by tourists & professionals. Possibility to also have the living room sofa bed by for more than two guests. Part of new secured & quiet building with concierge. SE1 located near Tower bridge in between the vibrant Borough and Bermondsey areas. The flat is 10 & 17 min walk to Bermondsey Station and London Bridge Station/Borough Station.
space: The whole space is mostly designed for adults with modern fixtures, with spacious interior design, calm and relaxing environment closed by the city and touristy sites.  The private room can host one or two adults. It's possible to also extend the booking to include the living room sofa bed by booking for more than two guests. This would ideally suit : - Tourist and london visitors for a long weekend stay to enjoy the all the wonders while walking and cycling.  - Professionals for week stay being at 30min walk from the city and 30min journey to Canary Warf.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is not far from Bermondsey st and Maltby street market for busy pubs, trendy restaurants, parks, cafe and cinema. Free tennis courts in Tanner st. Nearby Tower Bridge and Tower of London for either a morning run or a stroll in the evening around the river. Walk, run or even cycle along the south bank and pass by Borough market, Tate Modern, London Eye, Westminster but also the City for the professionals.
notes: - For an earlier / later check-in or luggage drop? Please ask WHEN you book. I ll do what I can to help and assist. The more notice I have the better!  - Partying / noise & late returning - Have fun, yet please come and go quietly and respect those who live here by keeping it low key and chilled residential indoors.  - Extra visitors: It's cool - just be honest by asking me and directly adding number of guests in the booking.   - Need to have the sofa bed with the room, let me know and I set the bedding. - Hospitality/Breakfast/Welcome drinks/nibbles for arrival/ Transport Card/ Special gift needed?   How can I help?  - All guests must be verified - Payments for food, drinks, transport card and extra guests: Pay as you go with card, cash or smartphone - Offer a large range of tips for seeing London from it numerous sides, and getting your way around the traffic and find easy transport link.
transit: The flat is 10 & 17 min walk to Bermondsey Station and London Bridge Station/Borough Station;  Steps away from local amenities, doctor, dentist, pharmacy and a very Italian pizzeria near Bermondsey Spa Garden, then cinema, multiple trendy café restaurants, park and free tennis courts, antique market near Bermondsey Street and Square. Near direct buses to the City and Shoreditch.
access: As guests, you will have access to the common shared areas (corridor, kitchen, balcony) including shared use of kitchen appliances, washing machine, dryer, iron, printer and scanner for reasonable use.
interaction: I stay in the ensuite bedroom. I will respect your need of privacy yet will endeavour to be available when needed. Is you need the sofa bed, I would adjust to your need of privacy for my access to the shared kitchen. Mots importantly, I know London well to advise on cultural events, memorable sightseeing spots and good place to eat and drink!
house_rules: - please respect the pristine building and it local residents.  - midnight to 7am are very quiet hours,  - please no shoes in the flat, - no red wine on the carpet,  - Ideal check-in time is 3pm - 10pm, let me know if outside and I ll endeavour to help. - Ideal check out by 11am, flexible on luggage drop in and drop out as long as you let me know when you book so I can manage expectations. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- - For INSTANT BOOKING of 3 and 4 guests, all guests need to be in the booking using group booking, and at least one guest must have a prior positive review, otherwise it will result to a subsequent cancelation.
host_about:
Aside friends and family, I am pationate about food, cooking, wine, travelling, skiing, sailing...and bridges!
I endevaour to pass on my love for the city I have been living for 13 years.
I speak English, French, un poco Spanish, and very little Italian

name: Stunning 1 bed period flat in leafy Crystal Palace
summary: My place is close to Crystal Palace park, cafes and restaurants and major train stations. Crystal Palace station is 10 minutes walk, Anerley is 5. The road, Anerley Park, leads straight to the park, with the flat itself enjoying high ceilings and excellent views.  The living room is stunning and the bedroom is incredibly quiet (the quietest place I've ever lived in London).  My flat is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. Guests from all backgrounds are welcome.

host_about:
I currently work for a women's rights organisation in London, and have been living in the capital for over 7 years, since I studied my undergraduate and postgraduate degrees. Outside of work I love cooking, politics and art. 

I am more than happy to speak to anyone who's interested in staying, and please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions whatsoever.

name: Single New With Private Bath& free Travel Heathrow
summary: Our house is situated a few stops from heathrow airport. Approximately 5 to 7 minute free bus ride from the airport. We welcome gusets from all nationalities and we are a very friendly family home. All buses are free from Heathrow terminals,and run 24 hours.We are 10 minute walk from the  new Rd busstop which is connected to the free zone.Drop off /pickup may be available upon request depending on times.Charge  around £11-£15 depends on terminal  date/time.Very safe place even for solo females.

host_about:
My name is yasmin and I manage  a sheltered housing scheme  and work very closely with the elderly. I am very much a people's person and find it very rewarding  to help people and like to make a difference in people's lives.I worked for a charity organisation prior to this job helping children with special needs which was very rewarding on a daily basis. 
I believe if you are kind  to people than people will always remember you.  In my spare time I like to read and enjoy yoga swimming and walking. I absoloutley love to travel and explore different countries and learn about different cultures.

Hi my name is Freddie and I work as a  hgv driver. I am very passionate about politics and history, love reading and researching on history  and philosophy . I have done  research and studied  most religions and cultures  and love to have a healthy debate.
In my spare time I like going to the gym and also like to travel and explore different countries.

We both are very warm kind and welcoming and love meeting new people from different parts of the world.

name: Central & Spacious - Space for 12 & 24hr Check-in
summary: Enjoy all that London has to offer with this gem of a property. The property is close to Tube, bus and London Overland stations making travel round London a doddle.   The property is an ideal base for any of the major events ranging from NFL games, Marathons, Premier League games, sporting events and live music that London offers. Let us know if you have something special in mind and we can help make your trip to London one you will never forget.
space: The property mixes the grandeur of Victorian design with the modern touches we take for granted. Spacious, high ceilinged rooms combined with high speed WIFI and Netflix make this a great space for enjoying London. Ideal for large groups and families that want to explore all that London has to offer. The property also offers a large dining room which doubles as a great place to catch up with family and friends over some food or drinks. The property is situated over two floors, with the bedrooms spread over the two floors and entertaining space found on each floor. There is also a bathroom on each floor so getting ready for the day or evening out should not be too much of a challenge. The property is setup to sleep up to 10 people, but two airbeds can be provided if you need space for more people. Just let us know if you require this. The property is used purely for Airbnb so you won’t find lots of clutter or other people’s clothes scattered across the property. The property is yours fo

The property is situated over two floors, with the bedrooms spread over the two floors and entertaining space
neighborhood_overview: The surrounding area of Clapham is famous for its’s large common that is really just a large park. This space is a ideal for a walk by the boating pond and Victorian bandstand or for a relaxing drink in the sun. There is more to Clapham than just the common. There is a wide array of pubs, restaurants, cafes and shops for you to enjoy. Clapham Old Town and the Pavement close by, are a must. The traditional pubs are great on a sunny afternoon with their gardens and terraces. The Sun, Rose and Crown and the Bobbin are all worth a visit at any time of year but summer is even more fun as their outdoor spaces are always lively. Clapham Old Town also has a number of places to kick the day off with a hearty breakfast. Gails has a wide selection of items from its own bakery and Chicoco D’oro is worth a visit for its excellent coffee served by the friendliest staff in South London. We can provide many more local and further a field recommendations.
notes: There are two staircases in the property. We do not have any baby gates so parents will need to watch their small children. The home may not be appropriate for those who have mobility issues.
transit: Clapham North, Clapham Common and Stockwell Tube stations are all close by. Major London attractions can be reached from all these stations quickly and easily. The Tube is not the only way to get around and we would recommended you take at least one bus journey, as the view from the top deck of one of our famous red buses can’t be beaten. There are buses departing across London from the bottom of the road where the property is located every few minutes. The London Overland train station is less than 5 minutes away and this is the best way to get to London’s night time hub and ever changing East End. The trains from here will take you straight into Shoreditch and Hoxton to enjoy some of London’s best bars, clubs and restaurants. With air conditioned trains and quick journey times, the London Overland is one of the best ways to get round London. We recommend you install the app City Mapper and this will give up to date travel information and guidance on how to get anywhere in London. The
access: You will have complete access throughout the property. It is professionally cleaned with the little luxuries of home, and is prepared for each new visitor. Hotel quality linen and towels are provided throughout for all guests. The front door has a keycode lock so no need to worry about losing keys or having to check in at a specific time.
interaction: We can recommend plenty of things to do and see throughout London and can provide suggestions of things to see and do, restaurants to try and pubs to visit. If you need anything just let us know. We are here to make your time in London the best possible.
host_about: Love to travel and share those experiences.

house_rules: ******BEST/HIGH-END/WORTHWHILE AIRBNB AROUND! ****** ******SEE OUR LOVELY REVIEWS***** *****EXCELLENT LOCATION  (RIGHT in the HEART OF LONDON) ****EXCELLENT UNDERGROUND/BUSES LINKS  *****CLEAN/COMFY BEDS AND SPACIOUS ROOM (WITH SAFE LOCKERS) ***** FULLY EQUIPPED KITCHEN/SHOWER/LAUNDRY/LOUNGE *****FAST OPTIC BROADBAND CABLE  **** FRESHLY WASHED AND IRONED BEDSHEETS/TOWELS PROVIDED!!! **** LOCKERS FOR VALUABLES (FREE of charge) **** Rooms shared by 4 guests only (m/f)  Come stay and enjoy!
host_about:
Hi, my name is Karla and I have lived in London for over 10 years now. London is a spectacular city and this is why I decided to call it "Home" - To those of you who read this and have been here, you'll know exactly what I mean! It's just great!

I love travellers and that's why I am a travel agent here in London. I am originally from Brazil and have travelled quite a lot around the globe.  I do enjoy the travelling experience of knowing what's "out there". My first travelling experience was travelling from coast to coast in South America, we encompass a great diversity of landscapes and also time zones so not quite easy feat to do.

 I have been to most countries in Europe and some in Asia! I just love meeting new people and knowing more about their culture, life, experiences etc. I feel quite privileged to be a Travel Agent and have this contact with people, being able to direct them to some amazing locations around the globe and also welcome them to London - taking away all the hustle of travelling and providing fantastic experiences. It makes me feel good to see people enjoying themselves and also notice that, in most part, they are grateful for the service.  My motto in life is: " You always get what you give".

Karla

name: Greater London Bed & Breakfast
summary: This is a four beds house; very close to all excellent amentites and public transport.  The house features a lounge, kitchen-diner, bathroom with shower and south facing garden that the guest bedroom No. 1  & 2 looks out onto.  I have another double room in the same house so please book the separate listing if you wish to have a separate bedroom,  If unsure, please ask!  I am a native Londoner who will be happy to help you plan your trip.
space: I have two rooms;  a double room and attic double room. The room fee is £30 per night for a person per room or £40 for two people in one room with a single futon mattress on the carpet.

notes: My street is a permitted from 8am to 6.30pm on Monday to Saturday so please be aware that other nearby streets - Grove road, E17 from 10 am to 4pm, Matlock Road, E10 - from 9am to 6.30pm, Carnarvon Road, E10 - from 9am to 6 pm on Monday to Friday. Free parking on Leyton Green Road, E10 but limited spaces.

Also, Buses goes to North East London and Essex - Chingford, South Woodford, Epping, Lounghton, Debden, Ilford. 2012 Olympics Park at Stratford; 20 mins by direct bus for Europe's largest Westfield Shopping centre; over 320 shops in one roof at Stratford.  Lots of excellent transport are available at Stratford - Zone 2; Crossrail, Eurostar, Tubes, British Rail, DLR and many bus routes plus National Express coach to Stansted Airport, Cambridge.

name: East London Modern Apartment with Beautiful Views
summary: Welcome to our stylish modern family apartment in a quiet part of Hackney , overlooking Clapton Common. The apartment has two large bedrooms, two bathrooms, and an open plan kitchen / living room with floor to ceilings windows out to the balcony and beautiful views. The Hackney location is perfect for visiting the hip nearby areas of Clapton, Dalston, Shoreditch... You can also be in Central London at Oxford Circus within 35 minutes by taking the nearby seven sisters tube. Equipped for families.
space: As we have a baby, we can provide all baby equipment including a crib. baby bath, changer, high chair, play gym and toys. If you are not with a baby these will be packed away.

access: This newly renovated Studio Flat apartment is located on the basement floor of a building that has no elevator, so guests would need to take the 13 steps down to get to the apartment. This apartment comes with a small open-plan kitchen that contains an electric cooker, fridge, freezer, and microwave. It also has a small folded dining table and a medium sized 32" TV. It comes with a double bed and a small sized wardrobe. The newly renovated bathroom contains a shower-room, towels, and other basic needs, such as shampoo. Since this flat is located on the basement floor, there is very little natural light coming in. However, there is an air-conditioning system to keep the flat cool in summer, and a wall mounted electric heater to keep the flat warm during winter days. Although we are hoping for the best service within your stay and for Hygienic purposes, Please Note that I do not supply food items such as; Sugar, Salt, Coffee, Oil, Milk.....etc.
interaction: We highly encourage our guests to contact us if they need anything before or during their stay. We are very responsive and our guests' comfort is our priority.

name: Short-term Let, Willesden, Zone 2
summary: Bright and airy double bedroom on the first floor of a large 5-bed detached house, with a bathroom on the same floor & shower room on the floor above. Decorated in an attractive contemporary style as is the rest of the house, this is suitable for a short-term let. The bedroom features a comfortable double bed, a desk and storage whilst the shower room has a power shower, heated towel rail and underfloor heating.  Bed linen, towels and complimentary toiletries will be provided on arrival.
space: I'm a chef so happy to provide meals (and cookery lessons), subject to prior booking and payment.
description: Bright and airy double bedroom on the first floor of a large 5-bed detached house, with a bathroom on the same floor & shower room on the floor above. Decorated in an attractive contemporary style as is the rest of the house, this is suitable for a short-term let. The bedroom features a comfortable double bed, a desk and storage whilst the shower room has a power shower, heated towel rail and underfloor heating.  Bed linen, towels and complimentary toiletries will be provided on arrival. I'm a chef so happy to provide meals (and cookery lessons), subject to prior booking and payment. Guests are welcome to use the patio and large mature garden as well as the microwave and oven in the well-equipped kitchen. The utility room features a washing machine and a washer dryer.  In addition, there is free wifi. Please note that the property is not suitable for those with mobility problems. As I work from home, I am available to provide any help or advice which you may need. You are welcome to jo
neighborhood_overview: A short walk from the house is a small parade of shops where you can buy groceries and other essential items. There is also a dry cleaners and a chemist on the same parade. Willesden town centre has a good variety of shops, cafes, restaurants, banks and a well-stocked supermarket. The cafes and boutiques of Kensal Rise & Queens Park are also close by.  Just across the road is a gym with swimming pool and playing fields behind, perfect for a brisk walk or a jog. The local park with beautiful grounds, an aviary and a very good cafe is about 10 minutes walk away. There is a good range of public transport nearby. The nearest bus stop is about 2 minutes walk away with frequent buses to central London.
notes: Breakfast, half-board or full-board available with prior arrangement and booking.
transit: Well placed for public transport: Willesden Green and Kensal Rise stations are 10-15 minutes walk away. The tube from Willesden Green will take you to Baker Street station in less than 20 minutes. The nearest bus stop is less than 5 minutes walk away with buses taking you directly to Bond Street, Oxford Street and beyond.  If you are driving, there is free parking between 18:30 and 08:00; and at weekends. Parking permits are also available by arrangement.
access: Guests are welcome to use the patio and large mature garden as well as the microwave and oven in the well-equipped kitchen. The utility room features a washing machine and a washer dryer.  In addition, there is free wifi. Please note that the property is not suitable for those with mobility problems.
interaction: As I work from home, I am available to provide any help or advice which you may need. You are welcome to join other guests during our occasional house dinners.
house_rules: * No smoking in any part of the house apart from the garden.  * No pets allowed  * No overnight guests (host must be informed of any guests beforehand)  * Please leave the room tidy on checkout.  * Please strip the bed and leave on the floor with the towels. * Quiet time after 9PM, Sunday - Thursday * Solo Guests must be aged 18 or over

name: GG
summary: Light, comfy double bedroom (a/c optional) w private bathroom in a neat, clean, non smoking family home. Security-patrolled private residential riverside development; easy commute to Lon City A'port/Excel/Stratford /CanaryWharf/City. 0.5miles (12min walk) to DLRs King George V (1 stop to LCY)/Gallions Reach (4 stops to Prince Regent for Excel).  0.5miles from University of East London. Bus route 474 is a 5 min walk at Bargehouse Rd, servicing LCY & UEL.  0.5miles to Woolwich Ferry North Terminal
space: Check in: 6.30pm - 10pm Check out: 4.30pm (can be flexible depending on availability) Tea & coffee is provided. Charges quoted based on single occupancy (on per night basis unless otherwise specified). Additional guests at £8(adult)/£5(child)# #I will supply a double airbed which can accomodate up to 2 accompanying young children (under 10) Air conditioning & Laundry facilities available at extra charge:- Air conditioning: £8/night Laundry: £3/load (inc drying) Parking (subject to availability): £3 / night Use of kettle, toaster, microwave, fridge, washing up facilities

neighborhood_overview: The riverside is a 2-3 minute stroll from my home offering lovely views of the Thames and the Woolwich Pier; and if you are keen to explore you can follow the Thames path along the north side, or cross the river via the ferry or underground foot tunnel and explore along the south side of the river.  The leafy Royal Victoria Gardens where there is a kids' playground, small running track with exercise equipment and free tennis courts, is a 6 minute walk away along the Thames path. Or just stroll along the nearby docks and marina and enjoy the views as the planes land or take off overhead. For the hardcore fitness buffs there is a fully equipped state of the art gym and sports centre (Sportsdock) at nearby University of East London (0.5miles), or 2 stops away on the 474 bus, if you are conserving your energy for the treadmill!   We have 2 Chinese takeaways, 1 Indian restaurant, 1 kebab house, a cafe, a bakery, post office, supermarket, library, pharmacy at Pier Parade, near King George V
notes: Bedroom and bathroom are located on 1st floor (14 steps).  The bedroom and bathroom are located next to each other.  Guest has private use of bathroom. TV is located in kitchen/dining area. NO stove-top cooking facilities! You will have shared use of microwave, toaster,  kettle, fridge, washing up facilities.  All meals to be consumed in kitchen/dining area and to kindly put back to good clean order as you found it. There will be shower cream provided for your stay, kindly leave the bottles behind for next guests' use. Loss of house key will incur a £50 replacement charge per key.
transit: By car, DLR, bus, or walk ...
access: Kitchen dining laundry area.   Garden
interaction: I am a foreigner myself, but have made London my home together with my two children.  We are an active and sociable family, love good food and enjoy having friends over for a chin wag and/or a home cooked meal.   As this is our home we would greatly appreciate your kind consideration in keeping the place clean, tidy and STRICTLY smoke / drug free.  A light tipple to wind down the day is acceptable but we will not tolerate drunken or unruly behaviour. No parties. No pets.
house_rules: - Quiet hours from 10pm. - No shoes in the house - to clean / tidy up after using cutlery, dishes, eating area etc... - all meals to be consumed in kitchen / dining area - loss of house key will incur a £50 replacement fee.
host_about:
I am an outgoing mum who enjoys good food and a good laugh.  When I'm not caught up with my kids I enjoy cooking, long walks and sightseeing.  My ideal holiday would be by a beach of fine white sand overlooking a crystal blue sea. Foreign cultures fascinate me and I am always keen to learn more about things different from mine.

I have so far strongly lived by "whatever that doesn't kill you will make you stronger" and "Start by Caring..."

name: (ION-D) Private room for 2 in London
summary: Nice private room available for up to 2 people in 5 Bedroom apartment. Great location, only 5 Mins walk from Stepney Green Station. We provide fresh bed linen and towels Please note you will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom with other guests. Feel free to book.
space: Room comes with comfortable double bed, bedside table with lamp, wardrobe, big windows with lots of light, laminated floor. Kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need (fridge-freezer, cooker with 4 burners, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, cutlery, plates, glasses, mugs, pots, pans etc.…) We provide tea, coffee and sugar  There is 1 bathroom.

There is key box set up next to the apartment entrance. Once the booking is confirmed, we will provide you with the full check in information. I correspond with all my guests on Airbnb. My assistant or I wil
neighborhood_overview: It is a fairly quiet family neighbourhood with easy access to all the major attractions that visitors enjoy - its has plenty of things to do that are free and lovely walks. The house located in zone 2, in a culturally diverse area within easy reach of Canary Wharf, the City, Stratford Westfield and the West End. A supermarket, bakeries, butcher and lots of diverse shops. Everything is on your doorstep.
notes: House Rules:  We have a no smoking and No party policy in all our properties. Please obey the rules! See below a list of fees:  Smoking Fee -  £200.00  Party Fee - up to £500.00  Lost key fee – £50.00 You are welcome to check in from 4pm until 10pm free of charge, after 10pm it counts as Late check in, please see the prices below: Late check in (for rooms) £10.00 from 10pm  Late check in (for whole flat) £40.00 from 10pm  IMPORTANT! Please let us know if you arrive after midnight!  LATE CHECK OUT is unfortunately not possible.  If we find out you checked out later than 11am we will have to charge you:  (Rooms) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £10, between 1pm - 4pm is £20.00  (Whole flat) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £30, between 1pm - 4pm is £50.00 EARLY CHECK IN is unfortunately not possible. If we find out you checked out earlier than 4pm we will have to charge you:  Early check in fee (for rooms) £10.00 Early check in fee (for flats) £30.
transit: 7 min walk to Stepney green station 10 min walk to Limehouse station 10 min walk to Queen Mary Univeristy 20 min by bus to Canary Wharf 20 min by tube to Bank&City 20 min by tube to Stratford (Westfield shopping center)  15 min by tube to Tower of London

Access to kitchen including fridge / freezer, washing machine, hob and oven. All plates, cutlery and cooking essentials provided. Clean towels are included along with bedding.

Hi my name is Emran and I am very happy to be Host on Air Bnb.
I  managing properties in East and Central London in for few years and that gave me a lot of experience and knowledge to be a Good Host on this amazing website . 
Properties are my passion so whenever you are looking for short or long term stay in London ill be able to help you .

I love meeting people from all over the world and introducing them to my wonderful city. 
I hope you will find my apartments both comfortable and stimulating. 
You will find a warm welcome and a ready smile.

name: Double Bedroom in Beautiful Central London Home
summary: Double bedroom in this beautiful traditional English home based in central London. Walking distance to Big Ben, London Eye. This is my family home, I live here with my husband Ben and our cute 3 year old daughter. We both work in banking and love travelling. We have stayed in some lovely Airbnb places and met many great people that way. This has inspired us to list our home here.  我来自中国,在伦敦生活工作很多年了｡我的家在伦敦最中心一区,可步行去大本钟,伦敦眼等伦敦著名景点｡我自己很喜欢旅游,在欧洲旅游也常常通过Airbnb呆过不少地方,认识很多有趣的朋友｡欢迎来伦敦,欢迎来我家;)
space: This is a beautiful 4 story listed Victoria house with a lovely traditional kitchen. Kitchen is where we social with fun dinner party, having a chat over Chinese tea. A light breakfast is provided (tea, coffee, cereal, milk, fruit) just come down to the kitchen and help yourself!

neighborhood_overview: Even though my house is right in the centre of London, my street has a real village feel. We know our neighbours really well, you will often see us stopping in the street to chat to neighbours. We also have organised neighbourhood parties  eg summer BBQ, bonfire night which is always a good fun. If you are around, you are welcome to join us.
transit: Getting around is extremely easy. We are close to Elephant & Castle (4mins walk), Southwark, Waterloo, Lambeth North tube station (all 10-15mins walk). There are 6 different bus stops right outside our house. You can also walk to the river, the lively Southbank Centre, National Theatre, Big Ben, London Eye all within 15-20mins.
access: You are welcome to share the communal area: kitchen, living room, garden.
interaction: My husband I love travel and are very friendly people. We are always up for a chat. We have a very cute little girl who is nearly 3, she is very chatty and like to play :)  However, be sure that we respect and understand if you want your own space!
house_rules: I am flexible about check in/out time. But because I work full-time, ideally check in before 9am or after 6pm would be very helpful on week days. Weekend I am totally flexible as long as you let me know in advance:)
host_about:
Hello,你好!
I am originally from China and I now live and work in London with my partner Ben and our 3 year old daughter! So welcome to London , welcome to my home! 我热爱旅游,喜欢认识新朋友,欢迎你来我伦敦的家!

name: 4.2 Cute Double Room - Views of Piccadilly Circus
summary: Fantastic double room in the heart of London’s West End. Book this modern, clean and comfortable double bedroom with shared bathroom - you will fall in love with the location. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a mansion block with no lift.
space: NEW DOUBLE ROOM AVAILABLE IN SOHO - LOCATED OPPOSITE PICCADILLY CIRCUS UNDERGROUND STATION Due to the amazing central location, the area is very busy and therefore street noise is inevitable. Please consider this before you book. We provide earplugs in case anyone is a light sleeper. If you are very sensitive to noise then it may be best to stay outside of the city centre, although that doesn’t sound like much fun to us :) Warm and comfortable double room located at the rear of this prestigious Georgian town house with views in to a central courtyard. The Room Was Completely Renovated In 2016    *New Wooden Flooring    *New Top Of The Range Fitted Wardrobe – with plenty of storage space with lots of hangers    *New Fitted Writing And Dressing Table    *New King Size Bed With Matching Bedside Tables    *New Artwork And Framed Underground Map The Room Facilities Include    *High Speed Wi-Fi Connection    *24-inch Smart HD TV With Built In DVD And CD Player - Combining fully smart functio
description: Fantastic double room in the heart of London’s West End. Book this modern, clean and comfortable double bedroom with shared bathroom - you will fall in love with the location. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a mansion block with no lift. NEW DOUBLE ROOM AVAILABLE IN SOHO - LOCATED OPPOSITE PICCADILLY CIRCUS UNDERGROUND STATION Due to the amazing central location, the area is very busy and therefore street noise is inevitable. Please consider this before you book. We provide earplugs in case anyone is a light sleeper. If you are very sensitive to noise then it may be best to stay outside of the city centre, although that doesn’t sound like much fun to us :) Warm and comfortable double room located at the rear of this prestigious Georgian town house with views in to a central courtyard. The Room Was Completely Renovated In 2016    *New Wooden Flooring    *New Top Of The Range Fitted Wardrobe – with plenty of storage space with lots of hangers    *New Fitted Writing And Dressing Tabl
neighborhood_overview: What we love about being located opposite Piccadilly Circus is the fact that you are sandwiched between 6 fantastic 'must see' areas of central London - Soho, Westminster, The West End, Covent Garden, Mayfair, and St James's The majority of London’s most popular tourist attractions and all the major theatres are within an easy 10-minute walk – Our place is super central and you shouldn't need to take a tube or bus once you have checked in. Don't just take our word for it, here is what Airbnb has to say about the surrounding area. SOHO Like Britain’s famous agent, James Bond, this neighbourhood leads a double life: Soho’s streets are home to clean-cut record shops and fashionable galleries. Crowds flock to this edgy epicentre to experience its sultry past and trendy present. Soho’s red-light roots and beatnik bastions have steadily transformed into hip public houses, all-night coffee shops, and vintage boutiques that welcome the 24-hour clamour of this cobblestoned neighbourhood.  https
notes: INFORMATION REGARDING THE CHECK IN We will request your arrival and departure times which must be provided in advance of your stay so we can make arrangements for your check in. If we do not have this information then your check in might be delayed. CHECK IN IS FROM 3PM We are unable to organise early check ins. We operate a key box self check in service. LUGGAGE DROP BEFORE CHECK IN We have the option to drop luggage from 10:30am which will be stored in our office on site.  CHECK OUT IS BEFORE 10:30AM We are unable to arrange late check outs. We do offer a left luggage service at our on-site office for £10, this is a flat fee, no matter how much luggage you leave with us. Luggage can be dropped from 10:30am and can be collected anytime.
transit: Piccadilly Circus underground station is around a 1 minute walk from the accommodation. Local buses stop on the street outside. There are a number of underground stations that are also within a 10-minute walk of the accommodation: Leicester Square, Oxford Circus and Tottenham Court Road.  We do not recommend bringing a car into central London as the parking is very limited street parking which is also very expensive. If you are coming by car it would be best to research car parks where you can leave the car and then commute into the centre.
access: The hallway was also renovated in 2016 and we have provided an umbrella stand with complimentary umbrellas should you get caught out in the rain. In the hallway there is also a cupboard that houses the mop, dustpan, brush, etc. There is also an iron and ironing board should you need to use them. There is a newly renovated shared bathroom with top of the range bathroom suite and power shower combination. Our bathroom is kept very clean and tidy with a cleaner coming in on a regular basis to keep everything top notch.
interaction: We will be available via the phone number we provide you for any questions or queries you may have between the hours of 10:30am and 4:30pm. If you need to reach us outside of these hours you can message via Airbnb and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
house_rules: INFORMATION REGARDING THE CHECK IN We will request your arrival and departure times which must be provided in advance of your stay so we can make arrangements for your check in. If we do not have this information then your check in might be delayed. CHECK IN IS FROM 3PM We are unable to organise early check ins. We operate a key box self check in service. LUGGAGE DROP BEFORE CHECK IN We have the option to drop luggage from 10:30am which will be stored in our office on site.  CHECK OUT IS BEFORE 10:30AM We are unable to arrange late check outs. We do offer a left luggage service at our on-site office for £10, this is a flat fee, no matter how much luggage you leave with us. Luggage can be dropped from 10:30am and can be collected anytime. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OTHER RULES TO NOTE - Guests must be respectful of neighbours during unsociable hours and if returning home late please be considerate with noise levels NO G
host_about:
A BIG HELLO FROM THE SOHO TEAM!! We are Lee, Laiyan, Tina & Glenn :)

We are a small team of people who have been working together for several years providing accommodation in the heart of central London. We mainly provide accommodation for workers in the film and theatre industry, but with the growing popularity of Airbnb we have been able to offer out our places to people from all over the world. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service and over time we have come to feel like part of a family.

As hosts we prefer to allow guests to have their privacy and enjoy their time staying with us so for the most part we tend to leave them to it, but we have several means of contact if they need anything and the team will do their upmost to help out so that you can get on with the main thing which is having a fabulous time in this great city.

From collective experiences of the team we have a few favourite things to do in London. For theatre goers we have experienced some great musicals such as Wicked and Hamilton, and for those with a brave sense of humour the Book of Mormon is a must watch. We have also sampled some great places to eat such as the award winning Barrafina on Dean Street, and being so close to Chinatown we couldn't help but recommend Beijing Dumpling for some amazing culinary delights.

We hope that you will choose to stay with us here in London and we look forward to sharing our wonderful accommodation in the best location you could possibly be in.

See you soon :) The Soho Team

name: Central flat - Zone 1 - bang for buck!
summary: I'm mostly away, as I am a filmmaker and work abroad, so you will find you have the place to yourself. You'll find a bedroom with a double bed and a living room with double sofa bed. It's super central, bright airy and quiet. A lovely base from which to explore my great city!
space: What you see is what you get. By London standards this is a spacious one bedroom, the flat is 50m2 and it comfortably sleeps 4, with two on a very comfortable sofa bed. This place is a home so I think you’ll find all the furnishings comfortable and functional. You’ll find everything you need from washing powder to olive oil, a hair dryer and an ironing board (and maybe even a juice and milk in the fridge).
description: I'm mostly away, as I am a filmmaker and work abroad, so you will find you have the place to yourself. You'll find a bedroom with a double bed and a living room with double sofa bed. It's super central, bright airy and quiet. A lovely base from which to explore my great city! What you see is what you get. By London standards this is a spacious one bedroom, the flat is 50m2 and it comfortably sleeps 4, with two on a very comfortable sofa bed. This place is a home so I think you’ll find all the furnishings comfortable and functional. You’ll find everything you need from washing powder to olive oil, a hair dryer and an ironing board (and maybe even a juice and milk in the fridge). The whole flat. You will find yourselves alone, but I am always available to help if you have any problems or questions. This flat is in Zone 1. London’s official centre!  We’re located between two completely contrasting neighbourhoods: The busy Edgware Road, where you can get the freshest, best kebabs at any ti
neighborhood_overview: This flat is in Zone 1. London’s official centre!  We’re located between two completely contrasting neighbourhoods: The busy Edgware Road, where you can get the freshest, best kebabs at any time of night or shop for bargain fruit and veg, at a real London street Market and sample real street food (as opposed to expensive Hipster Street food). Walk in the opposite direction and you’ll find: Little Venice prettily perched on Regents Canal (and part of a wonderful canal walk), Little Venice is home to London’s chattering classes. This place is a wonderful crossroads and a great place to explore London from for the curious.
notes: As long as you are quiet and respectful of the flat and neighbours I think everything will be fine.
transit: TUBE / BUS / BIKE? I think a real plus point is that there is an Oysterbike stand literally 2 minutes from the flat, which means you can travel for next to nothing by bike round central London! (Oyster bike stands are only found in the centre). 3 mins away are a couple of bus stops with many, many bus routes, also a cheap way to travel though not free! But if you want to spend top dollar on your transport, but admittedly get there faster then there are 3 tube station nearby the nearest is 8 mins walk away the furthest 15, and you have 4 lines to take far and wide.
access: The whole flat.
interaction: You will find yourselves alone, but I am always available to help if you have any problems or questions.
host_about: Born and bred Londoner. Love to travel - have lived in many countries - love meeting different people and experiencing different cultures.

name: Chic private house in Central London near Big Ben
summary: The property is a stylish 2 double bedroom house with a bathrooms and 2 toilets, set over 3 floors. Easy walking distance to all major tourist attractions including Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Hyde Park, galleries and museums. Only a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station, Pimlico Underground Station, beautiful Battersea Park, fabulous restaurants, cafes, pubs, street markets, chic shops and the famous King's Road. You’ll love the neighbourhood, the peaceful street and our quirky, modern home.
space: We are excited to open our family home to fellow Airbnb travellers. The house is a modernised Victorian detatched property. It is very spacious (1200 Sq.ft) and has plenty of room for up to 6 people. There are 2 double bedrooms and a bathroom and and an additional guest toilet. We have fast 18Mbps WiFi throughout the property and all mod cons, remote controlled lighting and heating, bluetooth speakers etc. Enter the front door on street level and you are greeted with a spacious and elegantly decorated family living room with two 6ft long comfy sofas, which can be converted into single beds by removing the back cushions. The large 47" Sony television has streaming live tv and Apple TV for Netflix and DVD player. One floor down you will find the fully stocked modern white kitchen which extends to the open-plan dining area with a large table and 6 chairs. We have a cosy conservatory area with sofa, desk and laser printer to work under the skylight. There is a baby grand Yamaha piano for y

Easy walking distance to all major tourist attractions including Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Hyde Park, galleries and museums. Only a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station, Pimlico Underground Station, beautiful Battersea Park, fabulous restaurants, cafes, pubs, street markets, chic shops and the famous King's Road. You’ll love the neighbourhood, the peaceful street and our quirky, modern home. We are excited to open our family home to fellow Airbnb travellers. There are 2 double bedrooms and a bathroom and and an additional guest toilet. neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is a hidden gem in Westminster. Mostly residential with hardly any traffic, it's like a village. You can hear Big Ben chime. Restaurants, cafes, transport all on your doorstep. The Tate Britain gallery is a 10 minute walk away and is free. Many people agree Pimlico is one of the best neighbourhoods in London.
transit: Pimlico underground station is a 5 minute walk. Buses, tubes, trains and cycle hire nearby. You can be anywhere in 20 minutes! Gatwick Airport only 30 mins by train from Victoria. Heathrow Airport is 45 minutes away is cheapest by National Express coach to/from Victoria Coach Station for only £6 each. But Uber is best for Heathrow.  The Cycle Hire scheme is right outside, as are buses to Leicester Square or Waterloo. Walking is best though and St James' Park is a 15 minute walk away. Nearest Tube is Pimlico, 5 min walk. Better than Victoria (7 mins) as it’s quiet and you get a seat.  Best buses are 24 from Belgrave Road (into town) or C10 from Lupus Street (towards Waterloo).
access: The majority of the house is your own. We live in the separate basement flat with our own entrance, own kitchen and bathroom etc. The connecting door between us is closed. The house will feel like your own private space. Cleaned professionally with fresh hotel style luxury linens, it's prepared for each new guest.
house_rules: - Shoes off to prevent white floors from marking. - Neighbours must be respected so no loud noise, especially outside front door. Remember to press Home button on NowTV remote to stop stream after watching streaming TV.
host_about: I'm a real Londoner. I live with my family in Pimlico, London, England. I love travel, transport and tourism. I rent out my London home on AirBnB whilst we travel abroad - currently loving Los Angeles.

name: SH5 Stunning Shoreditch High Street Studio
summary: A newly renovated studio apartment located on Shoreditch High Street in vibrant Shoreditch filled with colourful bars and restaurants amongst art spaces and active graffiti scene. Free wifi, 1 towel per guest and linen are included. Shoreditch is lively at night so street noise is to be expected but you are situated in the heart of the action with plenty to offer right on your doorstep!
space: The apartment is completely private a bed, a bathroom, TV, free wifi and fully functional kitchen that comes complete with oven, stove top, fridge kettle, toaster, pots & pans, glassware, crockery and cutlery.  This apartment is comfortable for a couple, but can sleep a small family or groups of 4 using the double sofa bed. Please note: Infants must be included as a child when you are searching/booking as we charge per person regardless of age. In an attempt to limit our carbon footprint we provide:  - 1 towel per guest  - 1 Toilet paper provided but not replenished  - 1 Double duvet per bed/sofa bed only
description: A newly renovated studio apartment located on Shoreditch High Street in vibrant Shoreditch filled with colourful bars and restaurants amongst art spaces and active graffiti scene. Free wifi, 1 towel per guest and linen are included. Shoreditch is lively at night so street noise is to be expected but you are situated in the heart of the action with plenty to offer right on your doorstep! The apartment is completely private a bed, a bathroom, TV, free wifi and fully functional kitchen that comes complete with oven, stove top, fridge kettle, toaster, pots & pans, glassware, crockery and cutlery.  This apartment is comfortable for a couple, but can sleep a small family or groups of 4 using the double sofa bed. Please note: Infants must be included as a child when you are searching/booking as we charge per person regardless of age. In an attempt to limit our carbon footprint we provide:  - 1 towel per guest  - 1 Toilet paper provided but not replenished  - 1 Double duvet per bed/sofa bed on
neighborhood_overview: You are right in the heart of one of the most colourful, vibrant and eclectic areas of London. Famous for the Brick Lane Sunday market and interesting shops, bars and restaurants are spread across the neighbourhood for you to explore everyday.  Columbia Road Flower market is only a short walk away held on Sundays. Liverpool Street is a 14 minute walk which connects you directly to the centre of London.  Broadway Market is close by and runs every Saturday, it is worthwhile checking it out!  On the way you will pass Spitafields market which is a great way to spend a few hours. It offers clothes, jewellery, vintage stalls, pop-up food vans and cafes. We are situated in ZONE 1 which is central London but we are in the east side near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. We are not located near the West End (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st) but you will just have to catch a short train or bus ride there. London is very accessible and easy to get around. Always allow a little extra time getting anyw
notes: - Children and Infants Infants are considered as paying guests so they must be included as a Child when you book. - Parking We do not have a car space. Parking is limited with restrictions and timed bays which become expensive. There are car parks dotted around the area but during the week they are booked up quite quickly (after 4/5pm will be easier to arrive and park)  On weekends: Parking is free Otherwise perhaps booking somewhere in advance will save the hassle or expect it to take time to find free or available street parking. OTHER FAQ’S Check- in time?  - 3pm or later You will collect your key from Bell Boi Café – 104 Sclater Street E16HR Arrival time?  - Please let us know your approximate arrival time. We base our cleaning schedule on this time and if you happen to arrive earlier than we had expected we cannot guarantee it will be ready but will do our best. Early Check-in?  - No unfortunately early check-in is not possible; see bag drop-off below Late Check-in?  - Yes we can
transit: The closest train stations are:  OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station (5 minute walk) UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Old St Station (10 minute walk)  Which takes you into Central London via circle and central lines.  OR BUS #55 it takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) We do not have any parking spaces available. There are paid parking lots 1 near Brick Lane for weekdays, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. You can find free street parking on Saturdays and Sundays but you will need to be patient and spend time searching.
access: You will collect your key after 3pm from a local café located just a 9 minute walk away.  The apartment is located on Shoreditch High st on the 2nd Floor with lift access. During your stay you will have access to the entire apartment and you can come and go as you please.
interaction: We live nearby so you can message us on Airbnb if you require assistance. However it is recommended to thoroughly read your guest manual when arrive which may answer all your questions.
house_rules: 1. We have a strict NO PARTY rule, if you have booked for a hen's, stag or birthday, you need to do all the celebrating outside the apartment. We will know if you are having a party and you will be instantly asked to leave. We will retain all the deposit if you have not been truthful about the purpose of your stay. 2. No more than the 4 people to reside 3. No more than 4 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use on the premises 5. People seen to be uncontrollably intoxicated may be asked to leave. 6. All breakages will be noted and may be withdrawn from your deposit. 7. Please do not give out our address to others. 8. Please do not get any mail sent to this address. 9. Please be considerate with our towels, linen and sofa. If you mark these with make-up, food or drinks, please endeavour to remove it when it occurs, as replacing these items drives up the cost of our service. 10. If a guest reduces the number of nights on the reservation; we consider it a cancellat
host_about: I am a 68 year old Artist.

name: PRETTY HAVEN, IN GORGEOUS NORTH LONDON
summary: WARM AND WELCOMING, LOVELY FAMILY HOME, offering a LUXURY double bedroom and PRIVATE EN SUITE BATHROOM. This house is set in a tree lined street and is on one of the premier roads in Alexandra Park. Stunning, green haven in North London. This is a stylish, family home with a wealth of original features and is decorated beautifully, and colourfully throughout.
space: This bedroom is very spacious, with a fantastic bay window, making it incredibly light. It is also equipped with everything you need, including wardrobe, desk, tv, large leather chair to relax in plus a very comfortable double bed and a stylish curved wall, shower room exclusively for you.
description: WARM AND WELCOMING, LOVELY FAMILY HOME, offering a LUXURY double bedroom and PRIVATE EN SUITE BATHROOM. This house is set in a tree lined street and is on one of the premier roads in Alexandra Park. Stunning, green haven in North London. This is a stylish, family home with a wealth of original features and is decorated beautifully, and colourfully throughout. This bedroom is very spacious, with a fantastic bay window, making it incredibly light. It is also equipped with everything you need, including wardrobe, desk, tv, large leather chair to relax in plus a very comfortable double bed and a stylish curved wall, shower room exclusively for you. We really enjoy welcoming guests into our home and will be available to welcome you and offer friendly advice and guidance on local activities, recommended eateries, transport links and in fact anything we can share to help you to enjoy your stay!  We are lucky enough to live in a beautiful area and are proud to be able to share the 'gems' of li
neighborhood_overview: Alexandra Park is a stunning part of North London. It is incredibly green and pretty and there is much to see and do. Our home is a 3 to 5 minute walk to Alexandra Palace Park which is steeped in history and offers many fantastic activities, including Alexandra Palace itself - which is a fantastic exhibition centre; ice skating; a boating lake; a cafe; 'Go Ape;' a luxury spa and gym; not to mention the fabulous views of London! We have many lovely, independent local shops on our doorstep, including a delicious bakery, 'The Sweet Tree' which is a 10 minute walk from our place; a wonderful delicatessen and cafe, 'Owens' which is owned and ran by a good neighbour and strongly recommended; an organic 'supermarket - 'The Green Guro' and a small number of glorious craft and gift shops, including 'Tash & Tanya' 'Zebra' and 'Fringe.' We also have a local library, a pharmacy; hairdressers and a great local pub, called 'The Maid of Muswell,' should you need and/or want it! Everything is literall
notes: We are a family and I have my 2 sons living here with me. They are gorgeous boys and we are busy, like yourselves. We do a fair amount of coming and going and so we may not be here to answer all your queries in person, however will provide contact details so that you can always reach us whenever you need to.
transit: Getting around London from Alexandra Park is a breeze. We don't have a local tube station however our place is equidistant to Alexandra Palace overground train station and Bounds Green tube station (Piccadilly line.)  If you want to get into The City, Alexandra Palace train station will take you there directly in 22 minutes and you can access central London/Kings Cross in 15 minutes. The trains run every few minutes.  Meanwhile, you can access central or The West End via 'tube' which is the underground at Bounds Green - which will take around 20 minutes, depending on what time of day you travel. We are 1 stop into zone 3 and everything is very easy to access.
access: We really enjoy welcoming guests into our home and will be available to welcome you and offer friendly advice and guidance on local activities, recommended eateries, transport links and in fact anything we can share to help you to enjoy your stay!  We are lucky enough to live in a beautiful area and are proud to be able to share the 'gems' of living in Alexandra Park and this very pretty part of North London with you. You will have access via the front door and the bedroom and bathroom are exclusively yours. There will be tea and coffee in your room but you are also welcome to pop down to the kitchen, which is at the heart of our home and top up what you need, when you need it. The kitchen/diner is where we will welcome you for breakfast too. Muswell Hill is a pretty, green area with numerous shops, restaurants, parks and entertainment. We are a five minute walk from Alexandra Palace where concerts and exhibitions take place regularly. The centre of London is only 20 minutes away by tr
interaction: We are lucky enough to live in a beautiful area and are proud to be able to share the 'gems' of living in Alexandra Park and this very pretty part of North London with you. will have access via the front door and the bedroom and bathroom are exclusively yours. There will be tea and coffee and biscuits in your room but you are also welcome to pop down to the kitchen, which is at the heart of our home and top up what you need, when you need it. The kitchen/diner is where we will welcome you for breakfast too.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house please, thank you:)  - You are welcome to come and go as you please, but please be respectful of others and noise, thank you:)
host_about: Hi, I'm Rachael and I live in London with my family. We all have pretty busy lives and besides working, I'm Mam to two lovely boys. We spend most of our time outdoors, my eldest son is super sporty, but when we are home, we love baking, listening to music, playing games (old school  - board games that is!) and watching movies. My two sons are also my amazing travelling companions and as well as hosting via Airbnb, we have also travelled via the site. We all have an international outlook and adventurous spirit and love to explore and enjoy new places and experiences and meet new people. We very much look forward to visiting you or welcoming you to our home very soon!

The history of Chiswick, W4 refers to the 17c and 18c area and to the River Thames pathway walks from Hammersmith and Chiswick and towards Richmond which is both unique and beautiful, comprising lovely walks and the discovery of seeing old and beautiful houses and gardens, old pubs and restaurants to enjoy.  Living in Chiswick was the 18th century English painter,  William Hogarth who resided in Hogarths House (now a museum).  Chiswick House and gardens was designed and built as a neo-Palladian villa and Inigo Jones garden design and built by Richard Boyle, third Earl of Burlington. neighborhood_overview: It's the most fun place to be in London. Brick Lane has a party atmosphere every evening and this flat is just far enough away that you don't get the noise. Shoreditch is 10 minutes walk away. It has a great night life at the weekend. The most exciting restaurants, cafés and bars in London open in this neighbourhood. The area has a rich and fascinating history, which can be enjoyed through one of the walking tours available. The Jack the Ripper tour is very popular. There are many artists, galleries and artist studios nearby. One can even go on a tour of the artist Banksy's work in the area. You are also 15 minutes walk to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. These are very popular for a first time visitor to London. You can actually get a boat from there to anywhere else on the river for £6. You can also get on a historic routemaster bus from there to Trafalgar Square. The Gherkin is 15 minutes walk away. It's probably London's most iconic skyscraper. There's a lot to see and do in t

name: 3 bed stylish Stockwell apartment
summary: Welcome to my home! The apartment boasts a great location, with a trendy interior and great city views. The three spacious bedrooms and the high standard interior make the flat fit for all - sightseeing couples, families or city commuters.  The nearest tube station -Stockwell- is a 2-minute walk away and sits on the Northern and Victoria lines.  From here you can reach Oxford Circus in 10 minutes! Trendy Clapham Highstreet is 1 stop away, where a plethora of eateries and bars lie. Enjoy!
space: My apartment has a contemporary yet comfy feel.  The main living area is filled with trendy soft furnishings that give the place hotel style with a homely feel. There is a TV to relax in front of at the end of the day as well as a comfy sofa to sink into. The room also has a small dining table that accommodates up to six guests. You can enjoy the rooftop views over Stockwell and further afield from the living area - and if you're lucky you may catch a fabulous surise/sunset.  The kitchen has been refurbished with trendy tiles and new appliances. It is fully equipped with a washer, dishwasher, microwave and all the essetials. Tea, cofee, milk and sugar are also provided for your stay.  Moving onto the bedrooms - all three of them! All are double with pleaty of space for storing your belongings. neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood os Stockwell is mostly residential and the shops supply you with basic amenities. However I highly recommend you take the 10 minute walk- or 4 minute tube ride to Clapham North. Here you will find a plethora of bars, restaurants and shops - from Five Guys to Tsunami- an excellent sushi restaurant, as well as many spots for brunch. For all you sporting fans nearby Oval - one tube stop northwards- is the home of the famous Kia Oval Cricket ground.
transit: The nearest tube is Stockwell which is a two minute walk! From here you can access the rest of London easily. The Northern line takes you to places such as Camden, Shoreditch and London Bridge. The Victoria line services Oxford Circus and Victoria station. There are also great bus links to the city- where you can enjoy a more scenic view of the city.
access: The apartment is your own- come and go as you please.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away. They are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to give you a warm welcome! Hostmaker will look after you. If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.

summary: This newly renovated one studio flat is located in a well maintained building, and includes all the basic needs for someone to have a great stay.   It is situated in the heart of London, Bayswater area, very close to Bayswater Station (3 minutes walk), Hyde Park (3 minutes walk) and the vibrant shops and coffee houses of Queensway (5 minutes walk) and Notting Hill Gate (10 minutes walk). It is close to the famous Kensington Palace and the beautiful Kensington High Street.
space: This apartment is located on the basement floor of a Victorian building, with an available elevator in the building. It comes with a small open-plan kitchen that contains an electric cooker, fridge, and microwave. It also come with a very small folded dining table and a small TV. It also has 2 single beds and a small sized wardrobe. The newly renovated bathroom contains a shower-room, towels, and other basic needs, such as shampoo. Since this property is located in the basement floor, there is very little natural light coming in. However, this apartment has central heating that keeps it on a warm temperature during the cold days of winter.

name: Beautiful Stockwell B&B in Zone 2, Central London
summary: Our home is close to Oval and Stockwell tubes. You’ll love it because of of its convenient location with really good transport links. It's newly renovated so everything is sparkling, clean and light. Our rooms are good for solo adventurers and business travellers.  We have TWO single rooms in the house which are perfect for friends travelling together who don't want to share a room. https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/15007067?preview
space: The house is light, bright, spacious and newly renovated. The bedroom is on the second floor. There is a bathroom with a large shower adjacent to the bedroom.  Please be aware that you will need to climb two flights of stairs. This room is not suitable for anyone unable to manage a normal flight of stairs.  The room has plenty of storage and hanging space. There is a 2nd single bedroom which is sometimes available https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/15007067?preview
