There is a 2nd single bedroom which is sometimes available https://www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/15007067?preview You are welcome to relax/read/work in the Summer House in the garden which is heated, so it is perfe
neighborhood_overview: We have lived happily in this neighbourhood for 16 years, and in this house for the last three years.  We are on a main road in Central London SW9, in a busy urban area. We are definitely not on a quiet backstreet! You can hear the traffic when the windows are open, but we have double glazing and we are not disturbed by it. We are a 10 minute bus ride from vibrant Brixton where you can eat and drink in either Brixton Pop or Brixton Market which is filled with vintage shops, market stalls, little galleries, restaurants and bars. I feel like I am on holiday just walking through this market, it transports me to another place! Other good Brixton restaurants are The Naughty Piglets, The Clink in Brixton Prison, The White Horse Pub. 50m away is Dolcezza, a great daytime cafe for coffee and lunch (it has free wifi!) Local places to eat: The Fentiman Arms, The Canton Arms, Counter in Vauxhall, Brunswick House, Bonnington Cafe (vegetarian/vegan, quirky, cheap, relaxed), The Tea House Theatre in
notes: The bedroom is on the 2nd floor, so this room is not suitable for anyone who is unable to manage climbing 2 flights of normal stairs.  This is an entirely non-smoking property please.  Please note that self catering is not possible, there are no cooking or heating facilities for guests.
transit: We are served by both the Northern and Victoria Lines. We are an 8 minute walk from either Stockwell or Oval Tube stations. It's a 15 minute walk to Vauxhall Train Station where there is also a hub for buses going all over London.  3 stops/10 minutes to Victoria Station where you can catch the Gatwick Express. 15 minutes on the tube to reach many of the West End theatres around Leicester Square. 9 stops/30 minutes (with no tube changes) to Kings Cross St Pancras for the Eurostar.  5 stops/15 minutes to Oxford Circus for Central London shopping.  2 stops/10 minutes to Waterloo for the Southbank/London Eye.  The 155  and 333 buses stop outside our door which take you to Brixton and Clapham Common. Within a 5 minute walk to Brixton Rd, you will find bus 3,  bus 59,  bus 133,  bus 159 and 415 which will take you to Piccadilly, Trafalgar Square, Parliament Square, Regent Street, Oxford Street, Horseguards Parade, Waterloo (Southbank and London Eye), Holborn, Russell Square (British Museum),
access: You are welcome to relax/read/work in the Summer House in the garden which is heated, so it is perfectly warm, even in winter. It has double doors that open into the tiny courtyard garden and it is peaceful out there.  Breakfast is served either in the open plan kitchen/dining area, or in the Summer House for more privacy.
interaction: I try to be as flexible as possible regarding check-in times, but please don't arrive at any time without making an advance arrangement with me as I might not be here! It might often be possible to drop off bags earlier in the day even if the room is not ready yet.  Checkout is by 10am please so that I can clean the room for the next guest. Breakfast is continental, generous and varied.  On different days it will include things like granola, yoghurt, fruit, juice, porridge, toast, croissant, baguette, French Toast, scrambled egg, ham, cheese and salami.
house_rules: - Please check out by 10am - Check in from 1pm. I work irregular hours so I can usually accommodate your schedule - Please take shoes off before going upstairs on carpets. - No extra visitors in the house apart from paying guests please. - This is a family home, so please no late night party animals! - You are welcome to use the Summer House in the garden to relax/read/work. It is heated and is warm as toast even in the middle of winter. Please note that self catering is not possible.  There are no cooking or heating facilities for guests. The house has 2 single bedrooms which share a bathroom.
host_about: I've lived in London for 27 years and absolutely love being here. We love exploring  new parts of this exciting city and I would be happy to share our secrets about the places we've discovered. I cook for a living and love making people happy with my food. I live to travel and explore the world. We look forward to welcoming you in our family home.

The area is a mix of professionals, students and it has undergone extensive regeneration in recent years, making it an exciting, dynamic place to stay. (Hidden by Airbnb) ’s UK office will move to King’s Cross in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and The Guardian newspaper is already headquartered here, along with cultural hubs like the British Library, Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design, Kings Place and a wide variety of bars and restaurants. Bars and pubs in and around King’s Cross range from traditional to achingly hip, and the restaurants feature everything from British to Ethiopian cuisine. There are a host of other things to do as well, with outstanding clubs, music venues and museums nearby, much-loved green spaces, popular

name: Charming One Bedroom Flat with a Sunny Garden!
summary: Welcome to my lovely 1-bedroom flat in trendy Clapham! The home is located on a quiet street, but at the same time just minutes away from all the cosy bars and restaurants of Clapham - Clapham South station is only 7 minutes away. The home was recently refurbished and features a large open-plan living space (and a fully equipped kitchen), a double bedroom, a bathroom as well as an amazing private garden. Perfect for couples, friends and even business visitors - everyone welcome!
space: The open-plan living room is perfect for relaxing after a long day exploring London. There is a comfy sofa as well as a TV (and loads of DVD's) to keep you entertained.  Feel free to take advantage of the fully-equipped kitchen - great if you prefer to cook at home (although Clapham is famous for its world-class bars and restaurants - be sure to check the Guidebook section for some of my personal recommendations!). In the bedroom you will find a very comfortable double bed to ensure you get a good night’s sleep. My cleaners place fresh, hotel quality linen and towels on your bed prior to arrival. Finally, the flat boasts a bathroom with a good shower. Toiletries including shower gel and shampoo provided!

neighborhood_overview: Once viewed as an ordinary neighborhood “for the ordinary man,” Clapham has steadily been transforming since the 1980s. This southwest London locale is now known for its cultural contributions—overseas transplants and young graduates call Clapham home. Although it’s well-suited for commuters, Clapham is becoming a destination of its own as the neighborhood’s cafes, pubs, and wine bars attract an easygoing crowd that appreciates its no-fuss atmosphere.
transit: The flat is located just 7 minutes walk from Clapham South station so you will never have a problem getting around!

name: ★ Princess Diana Garden Historical Georgian House★
summary: This Gorgeous luxury Georgian House, carefully restored and decorated in quintessential London style, is the ideal base to discover central London being located in the heart of London. My place is close to King's Cross Station. You’ll love my place because of the location, the people, the ambiance, the outdoors space, and the neighbourhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups.
space: Measuring around 2448 sq ft this large Freehold Victorian House located on Kings Cross Road dates back to around 1841, with some interesting Royal history. The house was formerly part of a children's charity where Princess Diana was the patron. She was a frequent visitor and ceremonially planted the gardens, including the magnolia tree which is still (URL HIDDEN) is on the site of Bagnigge House , owned by Nell Gwynn, who entertained King Charles II there. The present house is spread over 5 floors and offers 5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 2 receptions, study, large open plan living and dining area which opens out to a lovely courtyard garden, and a large private roof terrace. There is wooden flooring throughout and many original features such as fireplaces, cornicing and ceilings. Close to Exmouth Market, Angel, Bloomsbury, Clerkenwell with transport links at Kings Cross and Farringdon. neighborhood_overview: Overview  In Shoreditch, empty walls are future murals. The neighborhood’s industrial warehouses and dingy side streets offer plenty of potential space waiting to be reimagined. Old brick warehouses have transformed into interactive art galleries, and countless buildings have served as Banksy’s canvases. Shoreditch’s appeal as a creative playground stems (at least, in part) from an urban, gritty underbelly, but clean-cut treasures aren’t in short supply—Shoreditch’s design sensibilities also influence its trendy pubs and cafes.

host_about:
I am a Londoner born and bred. A kind hearted guy with a love for life. I love my City and despite my travels I always hang my hat in London Town. 
Nonetheless I have a huge passion for travel and have had many affairs with other great places in the World. 
I have been in the rental property market seen 1997.  With my team of 11 professionals and my sister company further team member of 15 professionals we have been managing tenants seen 1997 and guests seen 2009. All together we hold decays of expertise and always make sure our guests are comfortable as possible. 
Airbnb allows me and others like me to enjoy "the reality" of a place. I have used Airbnb to visit all the continents in our World (Except Antartica) mixing with the locals and seeing the sights.

name: Double bedroom in Camden Town (Zone 1), London.
summary: My lovely Victorian flat in Camden, central London (Zone 1) is spacious, welcoming and is full of light. There are stunning floor to ceiling sash windows at either end of the open plan kitchen/lounge with views over my lovely walled garden at the back of the property (quite a rarity in London).
space: My home is part of a Victorian townhouse which has been converted into flats. It is close to bustling Camden Town with it's famous markets, shops, restaurants and bars. It is close enough to be a 10 minute walk from all the entertainment that Camden has to offer but that means it also has the advantage of being 10 minutes away from all the hurly-burly, and therefore has the benefit of being in a much more calm and relaxed residential area! It is also just a few minutes from a lovely public garden as well as from the Regent's Canal - which can take you on pretty walks into Camden, Islington, Kings Cross or Regent's Park. The flat itself feels more like a house, it spans two floors - with the open-plan kitchen/lounge and a utility room on the upper ground floor of the house and with the 2 bedrooms, the office/library area and the bathroom up a flight of stairs on the 1st floor. I am also lucky enough to have an attractive walled rear-garden. I share part of the garden space with the down

The flat itself feels more like a house, it spans two floors - with the open
neighborhood_overview: My flat is in Zone 1, so you have Camden Town on your doorstep - which is great. Camden is a real taste of proper London, with good restaurants and bars aplenty. The flat is also within walking distance of Tufnell Park and Kentish Town, both of which have some lovely coffee shops/restaurants and the flat is also only a 5 minute bus ride from Kings Cross - the gateway to the entire city. The Regents Canal is only 7 minutes walk from the flat and provides lovely walks into Camden, to Islington, to Kings Cross or through to the beautiful Regent's Park. You really are in a great location to explore London from here whether from North to South or from East to West. You can catch buses in all directions - they are cheap and generally very reliable - a top tip: get an Oyster Card on arrival, it makes everything cheaper and caps charges on some journeys. In terms of shops, there is a very large Sainsbury's supermarket just a 12 minute walk away. There are also smaller local supermarkets very c
notes: Please contact me before you request to book, with a little info about yourselves. Also - if you find that the dates you require don't quite match those available in my calendar then feel free to drop me a message as I can often be quite flexible with dates and I may still be able to accommodate you. Personally I absolutely love my home - but it is a fairly old building (being a Victorian property built circa 1900) and therefore it does have it's quirks! This is not a ultra modern hotel in Bloomsbury and neither is it a show home. It is, however, characterful in the right way, and I feel (and I am also told) that it is very homely and welcoming.  Also, London is London, which means it's exciting, busy and full of people. This is a flat, so we have a neighbour in the (separate) basement flat and a couple who live in a separate flat upstairs, all of whom are polite and considerate. There are also Victorian terraced houses either side of ours - this is very standard in London city living,
transit: The flat is only a 12 minute walk from Camden Town, Kentish Town and Caledonian road tube stations (or Underground stations). This means that by train it is only 20 mins away from London's bustling West End and Theatreland! We are in Zone 1 which means you can even get a bus into the West End / Covent Garden in about 25-35 minutes. The overground line is also only a 10 minute walk away which can take you to the beautiful historical greenery of Hampstead Heath in a matter of 3 stops as well as to trendy East London in less than 10 minutes.
access: You'll have access to the entire flat (except the master bedroom) as well as to my area of the back garden.
interaction: I live in the flat most of the time but I am very easy going and either myself or a friend or relative will be on hand to greet you on your arrival.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 12 midnight to 7am

neighborhood_overview: Hackney offers a combination of quirky local restaurants and bars and an unparalleled selection of local boutique shops. There's plenty of heart in Hackney, where high art and edgy innovation meet. There are flavours to savour from its lip-smacking restaurants, not to mention world-class coffees . Quirky, scruffy, sleek or hip – the area's bars and pubs suit whatever taste you're packing, as do its diversions (you're seriously spoilt for things to do). And if money's still burning a hole, Hackney's shops and the buzzing Broadway Market sell temptation by the truckload, from vintage fabrics and designer must-haves to rare meats and artisanal bread. Eating: There's an exceptional range of places to eat in Hackney, from the famous Vietnamese and Turkish restaurants on Mare Street, to newcomers such as Lardo, which serves pizza and Italian dishes. Broadway Market is also lined with popular restaurants and bars, and its busy Saturday stalls sell organic produce and offer all the latest stre
transit: We have excellent transport links around East London and straight to the centre, we are only 5 minutes walking distance from Hackney Central station and 10 minutes from Hackney Downs: Overground: It is only 20 minutes from Hackney Central to Oxford Street via the Victoria Line at Highbury and Islington, 17 minutes to Shoreditch and 27 minutes to Canary Wharf. There are also stations at Homerton, Hackney Wick, Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction.  Train: Hackney Downs is on the East Anglia Line, and this route will get you to Liverpool Street in eight minutes.  Bike: More people cycle to work here than any other place in the Capital, pleasant cycle routes via the canal and parks get you where you need to go in no time. Bus: Left over from the days when trains were scarce, Hackney is well served by bus. The (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and 48 all go towards the City and central London.  Getting away: City Airport is 35 minutes away via the Overground, while Stansted is 35 minutes a

neighborhood_overview: Marylebone is a 17th-century neighborhood in the center of London. In my opinion, it's the most beautiful one. Walking around the streets of Marylebone makes you feel like you have traveled in time, with gorgeous historical buildings, antique libraries and this unique sensation of elegance that you can only find in London.  Plus, it's right next to all the stores of Oxford and Regent Street, the dream of any shopaholic! But Marylebone is also a trendy area in London, with new modern restaurants being opened every month.  And best of all: the house is right in the heart of the neighborhood so enjoying it is as easy as get a short walk around.
transit: There are two stations very closeby: Regent's Park and Great Portland Street. They are 5 minutes walking from the house. Having two stations is truly convenient since the tube lines are different. No matter where you are in the city, going back home is always on a short ride - although most of the times you won't even need to take any transport. There are also many bus stops around and, you know, taking a 2 floors bus in London is like riding a touristic bus for only £1.50!
access: Feel like the house is yours! Our guests can make use of everything in the house. I'd say that the 55" brand new TV with Netflix and Amazon Prime included is one of the stars of the place. The house has a washing machine and a dryer that can be used at any time and our guests are welcome to cook if they want to.
interaction: We are always ready to help our guests with any question they might have about the city or their trip. Plus something cool: we both have a deep experience in the ticketing industry and we are happy to help our guests to book tickets for any musical show, concert or football game in London.
host_about: I love to travel and host. We like to respect our guests giving them a homey feeling, where they can come and go with full flexibility. In the future, we'd like to have a small boutique hotel :)

neighborhood_overview: Angel London, in North London, is one of the best places to live in the city, due to the location, brilliant restaurants and bars and cultural atmosphere. Located in Islington, on the Northern edge of central London, Angel manages to be close to all the action, but still retain its own cultural and creative identity. With an eclectic mix of city and artistic media types calling it home, Angel offers something for everyone. Upper Street (or ‘Supper Street’ as the Evening Standard have dubbed it) has a veritable smorgasbord of restaurants and bars with all types of cuisine, while the high-street shops of the N1 centre and vintage delights of Camden Passage will satisfy everyone.
notes: Please note that there is an open staircase in the home.
transit: With Angel station just a 10 minute walk away, getting to Kings Cross and Euston couldn’t be easier meaning transport routes all over London are easily accessible.  The London Eye: 40 minutes on the bus The Tower of London: 30 minutes on the tube  Heathrow Airport: 60 minutes on the train, tube and bus Gatwick Airport: 70 minutes by train and tube Kings Cross: 20 minutes on the bus National Gallery: 30 minutes on the bus

The apartment is located on the third floor (walk up) and the building does not have a lift.

You’ll love my place because of the most beautiful and safe neighborhood in London, The Regents Park, little Venice, the light, the comfy bed, and the cosiness. notes: Once booked, please read the check-in instructions to arrange a specific time to do it on the day you arrives.

house_rules: You will have your own keys to come in and out anytime. Your room has private lock to you feel safe to leave your belongs. Our super speed fibre optic broadband is free and wifi all the time. We are full time workers and will not be at home all the time. Please, YOU MOST need to arrange a SPECIFIC time at least day before you arrives to do your check in. Example:  I will do my check-in at 14:30 or 20:30...... transit: If you come by train from central london, the station is Kingsbury (Jubilee line/Grey colour) or Wembley park (Metropolitan line/Purple colour) Option 1) Take jubilee line (grey colour) northbound to Kingsbury come out of station turn right and 10 mins walk to house,  Or cross the road and take any bus 3 stops getting off at stop after traffics light and walk onto onto slough lane Or at Wembley park station you can take a taxi or 83 bus to slough lane bus stops (7 stops) and walk onto slough lane, walk to the end of road, and turn right You can also take a fast train  It's only One stop On Metropolitan line(purple colour) to Wembley Park station from Finchley Road station, just jump out of jubilee at Finchley road and the train next you on other platform will be the metropolitan line train going north, both trains go to Wembley park but jubilee line is more slow from there onwards If it sounds complicated, just stay on one line of choice Please check underground map to clarify

name: Coveted Room in Funky Flat (RC R3)
summary: Lovely room with wooden floors in a secure flat which is located in a quiet residential area in London.  Perfect for people travelling alone or as a couple.  Close to the tube and other transport links as well as shops and restaurants.
space: The flat has 5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a large kitchen.  There is a TV with a dining table and chairs as well as Sky broadband available for you to use.  The other rooms are also on airbnb, so your housemates will be airbnb guests as well.  Located in a safe area of London and only a few minutes to the bus or tube, it is the perfect spot to call home while you are in London.

house_rules: - Please remember Check in is after 2PM and Check out before 11AM.  Absolutely no gatherings or parties at all only registered guest are to stay in the flat. name: Spacious 2 Bed Flat Near Camden Town with Garden
summary: My beautiful property is located just a short walk away from Camden Town - a colourful and vibrant area with plenty to offer. It is also just a 15 minute walk from Kings Cross, so the location does not get much better than this! With excellent transport links nearby, this home is perfect for those looking to explore everything that London has to offer. You can even make use of my garden on warmer days. This is truly a wonderful place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing.
space: The apartment is very spacious, with a beautiful open plan kitchen and living room. With two double bedrooms, this property is ideal for couples or small groups looking to relax after a long day touring London. My cleaners place fresh, hotel-quality linen and towels on your bed prior to arrival.

We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay. Leather, studs, and combat boots are common apparel in Camden Town, an alternative oasis away f
neighborhood_overview: Leather, studs, and combat boots are common apparel in Camden Town, an alternative oasis away from the prestige of royalty and Parliament. More often than not, Camden Town’s building facades feature politically charged commentary and saturated hues that pay homage to Pop art. You don’t have to question authority to enjoy this north London neighborhood—Camden Town’s numerous pubs, music venues, and street markets exude invitingly creative atmospheres.
transit: The London Eye: 25 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 30 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 70 minutes on the tube Gatwick Airport: 70 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 15 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 20 minutes on the tube
access: Guests will have access to the whole property during their stay.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: -  Please treat the home as you would your own - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm - No parties - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply

name: Skyhigh Light & Spacious Apartment
summary: This is a gorgeous sky high apartment in Hackney, overlooking the marshes and canal you get beautiful green views as well as the city built up in the background. It's truly breathtaking. The flat is bright and spacious and designed to be a haven from city life. Come retreat, relax and choose from hundreds of books to read. There is space for yoga, meditation and to put your feet up.
space: This is my home and I love it. I have made it a place to escape the hecticness of the city and retreat back into yourself. I just re-decorated and refurnished the place over Christmas/Jan and so everything is new including the really soft carpet in the bedroom. I have carefully chosen everything and I go by the William Morris quote of "Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful."  I live a sustainable and healthy lifestyle and my space reflects that. It is designed to give you space to think, feel and be.  It's in an iconic high rise building that was built in the 70's - it's the only high rise in the area and so the views are spectacular from the 18th floor and you feel a peaceful detachment from the business of the city. If you are looking for a space where you can rest, do yoga, meditate and read than this is the perfect place for you! I have all the props which you are welcome to use.  The bedroom is bigger than it looks in the photos (

neighborhood_overview: Hackney is such a special part of London. I have lived in or near East London for over ten years. It's vibrant and homely. This part in particular has a great family vibe (real people living their lives) as well as the hipster vibes through all the independent cafes and shops in the area.
transit: Homerton station is about 10/15 mins walk (depending on how fast you go), and from here in two stops you can either be at Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line) or Stratford (Central & Jubilee Lines). There is also a bus the 242 which leaves from outside and goes through Shoreditch, Liverpool Street to St Pauls. It's right by the canal so if you cycle it's perfect for getting around.
access: * 24 Hour Concierge * Private Balcony * Bathtub & Shower * Own Bedroom * Space to yourself * Filtered drinking water * High speed wifi  * Yoga & Meditation space and props * Dining/work area * Reading area * Kitchen & Blender (vitamix!) * Library of books on spirituality, politics, sustainability and creativity * Ottoman that turns into extra bed in living space * Access to gym next to the lobby and a laundrette with industrial machines
interaction: I will be away but will be able to answer any questions via message, and have friends around nearby that can help if you need them. The concierge in the building  can also help out.
house_rules: - Please take your shoes off at entrance - No meat or fish in the house (eggs/dairy fine) - Respect the neighbours with noise after 10pm - Please don't watch BBC iplayer as no TV license (netflix etc fine)
host_about:
I  host a podcast and made a collaborative book called The Future Is Beautiful, which explores the weave between politics, spirituality, sustainability and creativity. It's up on itunes/spotify if you want to listen and the book is free to download from our website. I hope you find them inspiring! 

I am also a meditation & yoga teacher, writer, intuitive therapist and social entrepreneur. 

I love to travel and some of the places I have been include India, California, Iceland, Kenya, Ibiza, Portugal and Bali. I lead yoga & creativity retreats all over the world and get to spend time in these magical lands. I have always been curious as to how we can live in awareness, be present and feel energised, whilst doing our best to make the world a better place.

name: Sophisticated Room in Kensington Townhouse
summary: Soak up morning sunshine on the south-facing terrace of this elegant townhouse. Fronted by smart white pillars, the home is classic Georgian in style and includes a period fireplace and widescreen TV. The bedroom offers a personal espresso machine.
space: A stunning south facing, triple aspect, lateral apartment. The flat gets spectacular light all day long. The room is a beautiful light, clean room, beautifully appointed. Perfect for couples, business travellers, or solo travellers. Private guest bathroom, with power shower and bath tub. Also a private guest roof terrace.
description: Soak up morning sunshine on the south-facing terrace of this elegant townhouse. Fronted by smart white pillars, the home is classic Georgian in style and includes a period fireplace and widescreen TV. The bedroom offers a personal espresso machine.
neighborhood_overview: Sitting on a smart street, this townhouse is at the end of a terrace and situated at the heart of popular South Kensington, only a few minutes away from attractions like The Natural History Museum, Hyde Park, and the Royal Albert Hall.
notes: Your room & bathroom will be professionally cleaned before your arrival. There are fresh towels, dressing gowns, slippers, linen, blankets and other bedding in your room. There is also lots drawer & hanging space for your use. Guests have a Nespresso machine + extras in their room.
transit: South Kensington tube is on the Piccadilly, District & Circle lines and provides easy access to all of London. There are many bus routes serving the area also.
access: You have a private room and a private guest bathroom, both with door locks. This is your space and no-one will enter these areas while you're staying. You also have access to private guest roof terrace with outside table, chairs and parasol (as shown in the photos).  You are very welcome to use the kitchen for tea, coffee, preparing light breakfast before 9am, use of crockery, cutlery & appliances and storing food in the fridge. The kitchen is not available for lunch and dinner I would encourage guests to eat out. There are a multitude of great cafes and restaurants within walking distance from the apartment.  Weekends, you are welcome to use the lounge and dining area as much as you want. During the working week I'd request you use the dining area for breakfast before 9am, and use the lounge/dining area in the evenings; I often work from home and my small office is in the lounge/dining area, so during the working day this area is not for guest use.
interaction: I'm pretty busy with work, but I'm very happy to interact and will do my best to assist where I can. Likewise, if you value your privacy and want to be left alone, I am very happy to do so. This is my home - it'a beautiful - and you are very welcome to enjoy it. I've lived here for 16 years so know the area like the back of my hand. I can make recommendations so you enjoy your stay in the area to the maximum.
house_rules: Guests will be made SUPER welcome here (see my reviews), and I'll do my best to make sure you have an amazing stay. However, for a great stay it's important that guests understand and agree to the following house rules, Guests are expected to keep 'regular' hours while staying at my home. If you are coming to London to party, then this is NOT the apartment for you. Absolutely no heavy drinking or other substance abuse inside the apartment. Shoes to be taken off inside the apartment please. You may smoke on the back terrace ONLY. No smoking inside the apartment. Please dispose of rubbish considerately. Since I often work from home and have neighbours I expect guests not to have loud music/noise in their room. No unannounced guests in the flat please - only those booked. For safety and protection, the person checking in must be the person named in the booking. You are welcome to leave your bags here from 9am onwards. If I don't have a guest checking out the same day and the room is ready
host_about: London, entrepreneurship, technology, exercise, food!

name: Large Light Double Room in Brixton Townhouse.
summary: Come and stay in this spacious, chic double room in  our gorgeous contemporary Victorian townhouse. We have a beautiful light kitchen/breakfast room, stunning bathroom and charming garden. The exposed original wooden floors and simple decoration give a calming, earthy feel. We are situated in a quiet street moments from buzzing Brixton.
space: Come and stay in a large, contemporary designed  Victorian cottage with a beautiful garden and your own double room, situated in a quiet street moments from Brixton with its amazing cafes and bustling market. The room is large, light and newly decorated. There is a very big shared bathroom next to the room potentially shared with our guests. This is a big home with a large contemporary kitchen and dining room for your use at breakfast should you so wish. We cereals, bread and jams and teas and coffee. There is also a tea station in your room. We also have other rooms available in the house - just click on our profile to see our other listings.
description: Come and stay in this spacious, chic double room in  our gorgeous contemporary Victorian townhouse. We have a beautiful light kitchen/breakfast room, stunning bathroom and charming garden. The exposed original wooden floors and simple decoration give a calming, earthy feel. We are situated in a quiet street moments from buzzing Brixton. Come and stay in a large, contemporary designed  Victorian cottage with a beautiful garden and your own double room, situated in a quiet street moments from Brixton with its amazing cafes and bustling market. The room is large, light and newly decorated. There is a very big shared bathroom next to the room potentially shared with our guests. This is a big home with a large contemporary kitchen and dining room for your use at breakfast should you so wish. We cereals, bread and jams and teas and coffee. There is also a tea station in your room. We also have other rooms available in the house - just click on our profile to see our other listings. As well a
neighborhood_overview: We are off Brixton Hill, a leafier and more residential part of Brixton but with great pubs and cafes on our doorstep. There's Blank around the corner, an excellent cafe and the nearby White Horse pub has a brilliant atmosphere.  And of course you have Brixton village moments away - a vibrant and exciting market with a huge selection of world foods on offer. In recent years it has become a major hangout spot with its coffee shops, restaurants, boutique shops, its fantastic independent Cinema, and world famous music venues. Then theres Clapham Common almost the same distance in the other direction. Clapham is one of the best places to live in London  - it has something for everyone! A great range of shops, bars and clubs as well as  more upmarket and family oriented cafes and restaurants.
transit: We are 12 minutes walk from Brixton tube (Victoria line - 15 mins from Victoria Station) and Clapham North (Northern Line). There are dozens of frequent buses into town.
access: As well as your room, you will have access to the  kitchen, dining area and garden in the mornings.  There is plenty of space in the room for your clothes and bags, and space can be made available for you to store your breakfast things in the kitchen. It is worth noting there will probably be some other Airbnb guests staying in the other rooms. This never usually causes issues, as the house is big enough to allow space for everyone. We prefer to keep the kitchen for our own use in the day and evening but we often make exceptions - especially for those staying longer / with families etc - just check in with us first. 9pm is the absolute cut off time though, as our cohosts' room is right next to the kitchen.
interaction: Please note that there is a cat resident in the house! Jack. Hopefully you will meet him - he is a large beautiful and very friendly male cat with an almost zen like disposition! This was our family home for many years, but we have now moved part-time to the countryside, and are often travelling abroad. You may catch us - but if you don't our cohosts Leon and Georgia live in the house and will be happy to take care of you. Please don't disturb them after 9pm, other than for urgent issues. Dyana, our back up co-host, lives around the corner as well.
house_rules: Quiet time after 10am. Please leave the kitchen clean and tidy after use.
host_about:
We are a married couple who divide our time between London, Dorset and Colombia.  Ryan is a theatre and filmmaker, actor, teacher and dad. In his spare time he teaches and practices Qi Gong and meditation, takes photographs and noodles about on the piano.  Elisa is a mother, a doula and a transformational coach. She is a keen grower and when she isn't working, can normally be found on our allotment.

We have lived in and loved London for many years but while our home here is still the mothership  we are living far more of a nomadic life these days.  Since we are out of town so often, we have geared the house much more towards dedicated  guest accomodation. Over the years we have worked hard to make our house a haven from the bustle of London life - a place to step back, relax and replenish. We are really enjoying sharing it with the Airbnb community,  and hope you will enjoy it too. We might meet some of you on our London visits  but if you don't catch us you'll be well looked after by our lovely live in co-hosts Leon and Georgia, Dyana our best friend and neighbour and of course Jack the house cat!

name: Near Big Ben and the London Eye
summary: You’ll love my place because of the neighbourhood and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers and business travellers. You can hear Big Ben from outside! It is walking distance to Waterloo, Houses of Parliament, London Eye, Trafalgar Square, backs on to the Imperial War museum, is less than 10 mins from a tube station! The flat has a sofa bed on the living room. Please note that the flat is small and this is reflected on the daily rate.
description: You’ll love my place because of the neighbourhood and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers and business travellers. You can hear Big Ben from outside! It is walking distance to Waterloo, Houses of Parliament, London Eye, Trafalgar Square, backs on to the Imperial War museum, is less than 10 mins from a tube station! The flat has a sofa bed on the living room. Please note that the flat is small and this is reflected on the daily rate. The whole flat is part of the rental. There are no shared spaces, it is all yours. The place is unfortunately too small for a wheelchair. You will be renting the entire flat and we want to give you full privacy. For this reason, it is unlikely that we will meet you in person, but we can pop after work if you wish to meet one of us. 5 minutes to Lambeth North Station, 10 minutes from Waterloo, and Elephant and Castle tube stations Buses 2 minutes away Big Ben and the London Eye 10 minutes walk away Lambeth North Tube Station is close
notes: Lambeth North Tube Station is closed for repairs until early 2017

Trains can reach London Marylebone in 11 minutes with 1 train leaving approximately every 20 minutes.  From London Marylebone You can also go Direct to Birmingham in under 2 hours.  Other Local stations are Wembley Park which is a 12 Minute walk away and is on the Metropolitan & Jubilee lines which can bring you into Central London in 12 minutes also.  Airport Travel Times Heathrow Airport - 11 Miles London City Airport- 26 Miles London Luton Airport – 30 Miles London Stanstead Airport - 42 Miles London Gatwick Airport- 44 Miles

name: Relaxed & Stylish 3bed 2bath house in Victoria
summary: The property is a stylish 3 double bedroom house with two bathrooms and three toilets, set over 3 floors. Easy walking distance to all major tourist attractions including Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Hyde Park, galleries and museums. Only a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station, Pimlico Underground Station, beautiful Battersea Park, fabulous restaurants, cafes, pubs, street markets, chic shops and the famous King's Road. You’ll love the neighbourhood, the peaceful street and our quirky, modern home.
space: We are excited to open our family home to fellow Airbnb travellers. The house is a modernised Victorian detatched property. It is very spacious (1200 Sq.ft) and has plenty of room for up to 6 people. There are 3 double bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and and an additional third guest toilet. We have fast 18Mbps WiFi throughout the property and all mod cons, remote controlled lighting and heating, bluetooth speakers etc. Enter the front door on street level and you are greeted with a spacious and elegantly decorated family living room with two long comfy sofas. The large 47" Sony television has Sky Atlantic, Nat Geo, Discovery channels etc and Apple TV for Netflix plus a comprehensive DVD collection of over 500 movies! One floor down you will find the fully stocked modern white kitchen which extends to the open-plan dining area with a large table and 6 chairs. We have a cosy conservatory area with sofa, desk and laser printer to work under the skylight. There is a baby grand Yamaha piano for y
description: The property is a stylish 3 double bedroom house with two bathrooms and three toilets, set over 3 floors. Easy walking distance to all major tourist attractions including Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Hyde Park, galleries and museums. Only a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station, Pimlico Underground Station, beautiful Battersea Park, fabulous restaurants, cafes, pubs, street markets, chic shops and the famous King's Road. You’ll love the neighbourhood, the peaceful street and our quirky, modern home. We are excited to open our family home to fellow Airbnb travellers. The house is a modernised Victorian detatched property. It is very spacious (1200 Sq.ft) and has plenty of room for up to 6 people. There are 3 double bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and and an additional third guest toilet. We have fast 18Mbps WiFi throughout the property and all mod cons, remote controlled lighting and heating, bluetooth speakers etc. Enter the front door on street level and you are greeted with a spacious and elegan
neighborhood_overview: Pimlico is a hidden gem in Westminster. Mostly residential with hardly any traffic, it's like a village. You can hear Big Ben chime. Restaurants, cafes, transport all on your doorstep. The Tate Britain gallery is a 10 minute walk away and is free. Many people agree Pimlico is one of the best neighbourhoods in London.
transit: Pimlico underground station is a 5 minute walk. Buses, tubes, trains and cycle hire nearby. You can be anywhere in 20 minutes! Gatwick Airport only 30 mins by train from Victoria. Heathrow Airport is 45 minutes away is cheapest by National Express coach to/from Victoria Coach Station for only £6 each. But Uber is best for Heathrow. The Cycle Hire scheme is right outside, as are buses to Leicester Square or Waterloo. Walking is best though and St James' Park is a 15 minute walk away. Nearest Tube is Pimlico, 5 min walk. Better than Victoria (7 mins) as it’s quiet and you get a seat. Best buses are 24 from Belgrave Road (into town) or C10 from Lupus Street (towards Waterloo).
access: The entire house is your own. Cleaned professionally with fresh luxury linens, it's prepared for each new guest.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away. They are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to give you a warm welcome! Hostmaker will look after you. If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.
house_rules: - Shoes off to prevent white floors from marking. - Neighbours must be respected so no loud noise, especially outside front door.  - Remember to press Home button on NowTV remote to stop stream after watching streaming TV. - ID must be shown upon entry.
host_about: I'm originally from London and love my house which I've decorated to suit my personality. I work in fashion and travel all the time to far off places, hence offering my home to you on AirBnB. I love meeting guests and sharing stories, also offering advice on the local area. Pimlico is considered one of the best neighbourhoods in Central London.

name: CALEDONIAN VALUE
summary: Caledonian Value is primarily for guests looking for a safe clean comfy place to sleep at night as you plan to be out of the apartment most of the day.
space: The location is very strategic as it is 8 mins walk from St Pancras International or Kings Cross station and quite easy to get to  from all the international airports .  Ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. A good location, comfy bed, friendly host at a  bargain price, what else do you need on your travels to london.
description: Caledonian Value is primarily for guests looking for a safe clean comfy place to sleep at night as you plan to be out of the apartment most of the day. Ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. A good location, comfy bed, friendly host at a  bargain price, what else do you need on your travels to london. I don't live at the address but I'm available via (Hidden by Airbnb) or phone if you have questions or issues that need resolutions during your stay. Bus 91 will get you to Trafalger square, literally the heart of the city. There are 2 other guestrooms in the apartment that are used to host other airbnb guests so there is a good possibility there will be other guests during your stay. The way I see it, its an opportunity to make some new friends especially if other guests are from the same country a
notes: There are 2 other guestrooms in the apartment that are used to host other airbnb guests so there is a good possibility there will be other guests during your stay. The way I see it, its an opportunity to make some new friends especially if other guests are from the same country as you.. I try to do introductions where possible and convenient.
transit: Bus 91 will get you to Trafalger square, literally the heart of the city.
interaction: I don't live at the address but I'm available via (Hidden by Airbnb) or phone if you have questions or issues that need resolutions during your stay.
house_rules: - - CHECK IN might be possible from 1130am but will have to agree a convenient time and a 30 min window of arrival that's convenient for both.  -- There are 2 other guestrooms in the apartment that are used to host other airbnb guests so there is a good possibility there will be other guests in the apartment during your stay.
host_about:
A fun loving person that loves to treat people like I myself would like to be treated.. love travelling and my bucket list is so long it makes the empire estate building look tiny. I have just started living lol. 

I am a people person so love socialising and talking on a number of subjects from politics to films to the state of the world to philanthropy and so on. 
 Music is my thing and I love all types..

name: Double with private bath near to Forest Hill
summary: Newly renovated double bedroom with private bathroom very near to Forest Hill station, in a quiet house.
space: The room is at the top of the house, so guests have their own private floor, and a private bathroom with a freestanding bath and hand held shower.  It's only 5 mins to the overground and rail station, which is 15 mins to London Bridge and Canada Water.  We have a friendly house cat and lodgers in our guest room in addition to us, a professional couple.  The room has two windows so is bright and airy and we have just finished decorating it, so it's fresh and new.
description: Newly renovated double bedroom with private bathroom very near to Forest Hill station, in a quiet house. The room is at the top of the house, so guests have their own private floor, and a private bathroom with a freestanding bath and hand held shower.  It's only 5 mins to the overground and rail station, which is 15 mins to London Bridge and Canada Water.  We have a friendly house cat and lodgers in our guest room in addition to us, a professional couple.  The room has two windows so is bright and airy and we have just finished decorating it, so it's fresh and new. Room, bathroom, kitchen. 5 mins to Forest Hill station and close to lots of bus routes Quiet hours in the house between 1030pm and 7am especially on weekdays. No shoes in the house please.
notes: Quiet hours in the house between 1030pm and 7am especially on weekdays. No shoes in the house please.

access: Room, bathroom, kitchen.
house_rules: Quiet time after 1030pm especially after weekends. Although the house is large and the room on the top floor, noise carries and so we ask guests to be considerate about the volume of conversations, doors, etc. No shoes in the house please. name: Posh 2BR in King's Cross by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the chic decor, fully-equipped kitchen, and sliding glass doors leading onto the balcony. This apartment is in King's Cross, known for its central location, access to public transport, and post-industrial architecture.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the chic decor, fully-equipped kitchen, and sliding glass doors leading onto the balcony. This apartment is in King's Cross, known for its central location, access to public transport, and post-industrial architecture. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There’s plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Galley London or Hoxley & Porter for some of London's best dining. For shopping head to the Ridley Road Shopping Village. You can also take The Tube of TfL Rail to explore the rest of the city. King’s Cross is a post-industrial neighbourhood, with a mix of old
neighborhood_overview: There’s plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Galley London or Hoxley & Porter for some of London's best dining. For shopping head to the Ridley Road Shopping Village. You can also take The Tube of TfL Rail to explore the rest of the city. King’s Cross is a post-industrial neighbourhood, with a mix of old and new architecture. With the namesake train station, and plethora of public transport options, everything is within arm’s reach. Enjoy the parks, pubs, and cafés, or duck into the British Library and any one of the area’s museums. The neighbourhood’s cultural and literary significance and central location are sure to inspire a quintessentially London experience.
notes: This Sonder is a 2nd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator. The beds at this Sonder are shorter in length compared to regular, full-sized beds. They are 175 cm long instead of a regular 190 cm long.  This Sonder does not have air conditioning, but we'll provide fans for each of the rooms that you can use during your stay. Due to nearby trains passing, you are likely to experience some city noise late into the evening. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call.
transit: There are paid parking options nearby.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef

name: Modern apartment, stunning balcony view over water
summary: Modern apartment in a really prestige building. Stunning views over the water and Canary Wharf from the two balconies we have. You will love it. Free access to the gym with Jacuzzi and sauna. 2 min walk to DLR (part of the Underground system) and 10-15 min ride to London City. Greenwich just 10 mins in the other direction. Located in Canary Wharf with impressive buildings around, a lot of water, places to dine, big shopping mall and even a park with animals to enjoy (ask me).

neighborhood_overview: Canary wharf is a business area is which is prestige, very safe and offers a lot of activities. It was developed in the earlier docks, so area looks trendy, a lot of water, birds/wildlife and rich history. There is a big mall with all the shops you can imagine, many restaurants, right next to our building several smaller food shops which work till midnight. Cool roof top night club is located just in the next building.
transit: DLR station is just two mins ago. It goes west to City (15 min) and east to Greenwich (10 min). Can also walk 10 min to Canary Wharf metro station on Jubilee line which takes 20 min to Westminster.
access: Free access to the gym with Jacuzzi and sauna.

name: Bright two bedroom apartment in Maida Vale
summary: Our home is a lovely very bright two bedroom flat not far from central London in residential area of Maida Vale. It is located close to BBC recording studios. The flat is very welcoming with beautiful atmosphere high ceilings big windows, plenty of light and is located on raised ground floor of a period property.  The flat is suitable for 3 people. Quiet bedrooms, fully equipped kitchen, good lighting, TV in each bedroom, work space, wireless internet, excellent central heating.
space: This spacious two bedroom (about 85 sq m) has a beautiful bright atmosphere, very high ceilings,  and tall windows. Much sun on a nice day and very good lighting at night (all lights are fitted with dimmers).  It is in a pleasant tree lined street and bedrooms are quiet. Fully equipped kitchen with open plan to the main sitting room. Full size dish washer, induction stove, oven. There is a washing machine with integrated dryer and ironing equipment.

Maida Vale is a very pleasent residential area with easy acces
neighborhood_overview: Maida Vale is a very pleasent residential area with easy access to West End. It is very green and neat with great selection of cafes delicatessen pubs and restaurants and the beautiful canals of Little Venice within 10 minute walk. If you prefer to spend time out locally there is also a  nice parade of shops and cafes in Maida Vale as well as number of restaurants.
notes: For  longer stays we provide cleaning and change of linen once a week free of charge.
transit: The closest tube station is Maida Vale in Bakerloo line (6 minutes walk to the station). There are numerous bus lines, nearest bus stop is few steps away. 15 minute walk will take you to Paddington Station or the famous Portobello Road market in Notting Hill. Oxford Street Hyde Park and Regent's Park are 30-40 minute walk or 10 minute ride on the Underground (Bakerloo Line). There is also good bus connection to Piccadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square.
house_rules: Guests have to be fully verified with passport as a document.  All guest have to send a message and apply for booking approval.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is just few minutes walking from the river side where you can find very nice pubs or you can simply enjoy an amazing landscape if you want to go for a run long the river in the same location where the popular Oxford and Cambridge boat race takes place. In Fulham Palace Road and in King Street you will find many shops, restaurants, pubs and bars. Westfield Shopping centre (one of the biggest mall in London), Olympia exhibition centre and Earls Court exhibition centre are very easy to reach from here too.

host_about:
Ciao,
Sonia, Lorenzo and I (Sergio) are a young Italian family. Lorenzo is born in December 2017. We are very happy to share our guest room and the guest bathroom with the airbnb community. The guest room is on the 1st floor while our bedroom and our private bathroom  is on the 2nd floor and so we will be very independent from each other. 
We love travel and meet new people and we are very pleased to host people coming to London for tourism or business.
Hope to see you soon :)

summary: Our place is close to Angel, Islington, Bars, Restaurants, Shops, Cinema, Transport. You’ll love our place because the location is right in the middle of London yet it's quiet and peaceful. It's also very private and secure as it's in a gated property. It's also very clean and comfortable. Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.

Islington has an array of shops, restaurants, cafes, good coffee which attra
neighborhood_overview: Islington has an array of shops, restaurants, cafes, good coffee which attracts a good class of people. The weekends are abuzz with activity and it's a true "London" experience. This accommodation is close to Union Chapel, Islington Town Hall and The Business Design Centre.
transit: Transport links are immense! Kings Cross is only one stop away on the Victoria Line and there are buses out the front of our house that go all the way to Oxford Circus.
access: You can use the Living Area, Kitchen, Roof Terrace and Gym until 7PM. We frequently work from home in the evenings so require the space from 7PM onwards. Of course you can still make yourself a drink or get water from the water dispenser during that time.
interaction: We are available all day via the AirBnB app and we'll be in most evenings.
house_rules: We have a young puppy in the house from October 28th. (one that doesn't shed hair).
host_about: We're interested in a lot of things... health, fitness, meditation, photography, travel, movies, fashion, computers but sometimes it's just the simple things we enjoy the most. Like a morning spent in a cafe drinking coffee in the sunshine. An afternoon stroll through nature.

notes: JUST ONE NIGHT? Please message us before confirming your booking. We are not always able to accept one night reservations.  Regarding Check-in / Check-out:  we are flexible about it as long as it is possible.  You can check in and check out at any time if there are no guests before or after you.  You can also drop off your suitcases here at 11.30am and get the keys if you arrive before the apartment is ready.  The day you leave the apartment, you can leave your suitcases here and pick them up later. You will be allowed to check out as late as 11am if someone else is checking in on the same day.  You'd be allowed to check out later than 11am if there were no one checking in right after you at no extra cost.
transit: Public transport is great.  Whitechapel station is the nearest underground station and it is only 100metres away from the apartment.  there are also plenty of buses running on Whitechapel Rd, only 50 metres away from the building.
access: Exclusive use of the whole apartment. FULLY EQUIPPED APARTMENT: There are ALL the things that you need at home:  -Internet Wi-Fi  / TV  -Washing Machine / soap to wash clothes and conditioner / clothes airer / Iron and Iron Board -Microwave / Toaster / Kettle / Cutlery / sauce pans / frying pan / kitchen utensils  -Towels / shower gel / soap / hair dryer / toilet paper  -Bed clothes / Tissue  -Adapters for UK sockets  -Also, there are coffee, tea, sugar, powder milk, spices, oil, etc.  Regarding Check-in / Check-out:  I’m very flexible about it as long as it is possible.  You can check in and check out at any time if there are no guests before or after you.  If there is a guest checking out on the day you check in, you can drop off your suitcases here any time from 11am, and get the keys and come back any time from 2pm when the flat is ready. name: Convenient, Bright and Quiet Single Bedroom
summary: Conveniently Located Single Bedroom.  A bedroom in a well kept Victorian house near Tooting Broadway. The room is furnished with a single bed, a desk and stool, wardrobe with sock drawer. This room is perfect for Doctors wanting to be close to St Georges or visitors from out of town looking to be close to the vibrant and accessible Tooting Broadway area.  Quiet house and calm environment.
space: A large Victorian house with 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms , large living area, open plan kitchen and garden. All of the rooms are hosted via Air Bnb.
description: Conveniently Located Single Bedroom.  A bedroom in a well kept Victorian house near Tooting Broadway. The room is furnished with a single bed, a desk and stool, wardrobe with sock drawer. This room is perfect for Doctors wanting to be close to St Georges or visitors from out of town looking to be close to the vibrant and accessible Tooting Broadway area.  Quiet house and calm environment. A large Victorian house with 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms , large living area, open plan kitchen and garden. All of the rooms are hosted via Air Bnb. There is a shared bathroom on your floor which will be private if nobody else is staying in the other rooms, guests can also use the living room downstairs and the kitchen. Guests can also use the back garden. I am a live-out landlord. Occasionally when I am in town I use one of the bedrooms in the house, I will let you know upon booking if this will be the case. My mother manages the house and occasionally stays in one of the rooms, she helps guests check in
notes: We are looking for respectful guests and we pride ourselves on providing a safe and clean place to say. Latest check in is 10pm, we can accomodate check in between 10:00pm and 12:30 am for an additional £10 charge Most of the people who stay here are professionals or doctors, so we aim to offer a quiet and comfortable environment. Parties are not allowed. Smoking is permitted in the back garden but not inside the house. Couples are welcome however late night visitors are not permitted.
transit: On Street pay and display is available, if you are looking to stay for a bit longer we can try and get a visitors permit for you.
access: There is a shared bathroom on your floor which will be private if nobody else is staying in the other rooms, guests can also use the living room downstairs and the kitchen. Guests can also use the back garden.
interaction: I am a live-out landlord. Occasionally when I am in town I use one of the bedrooms in the house, I will let you know upon booking if this will be the case. My mother manages the house and occasionally stays in one of the rooms, she helps guests check in and sometimes even makes breakfast for guests! If either of us are in  we will respect your space and privacy but am glad to answer questions/help out if needed!
house_rules: This house is primarily occupied by young medical professionals and is a quiet respectful environment, if this is not what you are looking for then regrettably i must advise you to book elsewhere. Latest check in is 22:00, check in between 22:00 and 00:30 can be arranged for an additional £10 charge No unbooked additional guests. No late night guests. No extra guests. No smoking inside the property. You are welcome to smoke in the garden. Drug use strictly prohibited.
host_about:
Hello! 

My name is Shahbaz. I am an avid airbnb user, I host a place in london alongside my mother but I travel frequently for work and fun so am always using airbnb!

I love art, literature and adventure. I run a number of small businesses, my main work is as the founder and creative director of a clothing brand. 

My favourite places to travel are definitely the British countryside for peace, Europe for food and nightlife, the middle east for history and art. I would love to travel across asia a little bit more, i've always wanted to go to japan but have never found the time!

name: Lovely double and single rooms with cable TV
summary: This is a bright, spacious double room plus a small single room if needed. There is a shower room that is shared with one other guest room if it is booked but you will probably have it to yourself.
space: Our house is in a quiet and pretty Victorian street with no through traffic. The main bedrooms is a large double with plenty of wardrobe space and drawers and a TV with cable. The second is a small bedroom with a dingle bed and a wardrobe.  We have one other double room we also rent.  We  have a separate listing where both rooms can be booked together if needed.  Our bedding is all 200 thread count 100% cotton from John Lewis. There are loads of cafes and restaurants nearby. We have a small south facing courtyard garden you are welcome to use and also super fast broadband and wifi.
description: This is a bright, spacious double room plus a small single room if needed. There is a shower room that is shared with one other guest room if it is booked but you will probably have it to yourself. Our house is in a quiet and pretty Victorian street with no through traffic. The main bedrooms is a large double with plenty of wardrobe space and drawers and a TV with cable. The second is a small bedroom with a dingle bed and a wardrobe.  We have one other double room we also rent.  We  have a separate listing where both rooms can be booked together if needed.  Our bedding is all 200 thread count 100% cotton from John Lewis. There are loads of cafes and restaurants nearby. We have a small south facing courtyard garden you are welcome to use and also super fast broadband and wifi. You can make a cup of tea or keep something cold in the fridge. Also use the microwave and toaster.  If you need anything we will always try to help. Full English breakfasts and evening meals available on request.
neighborhood_overview: Dalston is safe, trendy, fun and exciting.  You can have a fantastic night out without going more that half a mile from the house and yet our location is very quiet.   The area is famous for being at the cutting edge of fashion and food.  There are dozens of bars and restaurants very near by, many of which will be unlike anything you have experienced before. I absolutely love living here and love giving people the chance to experience what that feels like. Within a 10 minutes walk are many fantastic restaurants selling Turkish, Caribbean, British, Spanish, vegetarian, Vietnamese, Japanese and American food as well as many bars, organic food shops, and clubs. Everything you need is just minutes away and yet our street is very quiet. In 20 minutes you can walk to London Fields with it's open air swimming pool, Broadway Market, Stoke Newington and Hackney Central which all have yet more bars, restaurants and interesting independent shops.  A little further and you can be on the banks of t
notes: We live in an area of residents parking.  Vouchers are available for guests at £4 per day as they are bought from Hackney council.  Please let me know in advance if you are driving so I can make sure I have enough .
transit: Dalston is in transport zone 2 and has 2 tube stations; Dalston Kingsland is a 6 or 7 minute walk and Dalston junction about 10.   There is also a bus that goes to both stations from a stop 50 meters away. Being in zone 2 means we are very central and will keep  your costs down as pretty much everywhere you will want to go is in zone 1 or 2. There are also many other busses including a couple that go right in to the West End and offer great views from the top deck. We are half an hour from the west end and 20 minutes from the City, Canary Wharf and Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre. The Emirates stadium, White Hart Lane and West Ham's London Stadium are all about half an hour away.
access: You can make a cup of tea or keep something cold in the fridge. Also use the microwave and toaster.  If you need anything we will always try to help. Full English breakfasts and evening meals available on request.
interaction: I know London very well and can help plan sightseeing trips, tell you about good local places to eat and visit and the best ways to get around.
house_rules: No hot food in bedrooms. There is a dining table in the living room or breakfast bar in the kitchen where you can eat. You can smoke in the garden if needed. Please respect my home.
host_about:
I am an extremely keen cook and a drummer. 
I love my local food shops and markets and restaurants

name: Bright spacious room with private bathroom
summary: Come and stay in this bright modern room in our recently renovated Victorian house in North London with sole use of adjacent bathroom. We are a short walk to Turnpike Lane Station on the Piccadilly Line and the High Road with a great variety of shops and restaurants.  Across the road there is a local park perfect for a walk, picnic or some exercise! Our room is perfect for holiday makers, students or professionals coming to London for some time. For longer stays please send me a message!
space: We live in an early 20th century house in the Noel Park Conservation Area, on a quiet tree-lined residential street. Within 10min walking distance you have all the shops, restaurants and cafes you might need, major transport links including the Piccadilly Line. In your room you will find a guide we have put together with more information about where to go, where to eat etc. Most of our house has been recently renovated, including the guest room and the private bathroom. name: Light-flooded apartment next to Flower Market
summary: Located in vibrant Shoreditch, just a 15 minute from Old Street station, and 5 min from Hoxton Overground. This light-flooded 1 bedroom apartment is located in the Columbia Road Flower market and close to the neighbourhood shops, art galleries and restaurants of Redchurch Street, Brick lane, Columbia Rd, Spitalfields & Broadway Markets.
description: Located in vibrant Shoreditch, just a 15 minute from Old Street station, and 5 min from Hoxton Overground. This light-flooded 1 bedroom apartment is located in the Columbia Road Flower market and close to the neighbourhood shops, art galleries and restaurants of Redchurch Street, Brick lane, Columbia Rd, Spitalfields & Broadway Markets. The apartment is literally located in one of London’s most visually appealing markets, Columbia Road Flower Market which overflows with bucketfuls of beautiful flowers every Sunday. There are bulbs, herbs, shrubs and bedding plants too. Alongside the Sunday market you’ll find a host of independent galleries and shops selling pottery, perfume and the like – many of them are only open at the weekends, and they often shut up shop with the market at 3pm. 15 min walk fom Old Street station 5 min walk from Hoxton Overground 15 min walk from Bethnal Green

neighborhood_overview: Stratford has the Olympic park (home of 2012 Olympics), Westfield shopping centre (the largest in Europe), the Theatre Royal, many pubs and restaurants and fantastic travel links all over London.
notes: We don't have a TV to maintain a sense of calm in the house. However if you want to watch you can use a computer as the house has a TV licence and broadband.
transit: Train, buses and underground The closest train station, Maryland, is five minutes walk away and from here you can be in Liverpool Street station, part of the financial centre of the city in eleven minutes. Stratford Station is about 15 minutes walk (or a short bus ride) and from here you can take trains, tubes and buses all over London. Tubes now run through the night on the central line to Stratford on friday and saturday nights. Parking You can park directly outside the house. It is free sundays. On monday to saturday I can provide you with a permit for all day (10 pounds) or you can stay for two hour blocks at 3 pounds per two hours. The two hour short stays are  suspended on event days in the Olympic stadium. These are one or two a month mostly on saturdays. Bicycles Or you can rent a bike and take advantage of the cycle routes around Stratford and throughout the city. For example you can cycle from my house to Tower Bridge in 40 minutes all along canals and quiet roads. Airports A
access: As well as your room you are welcome to use the kitchen diner, the garden and the two bathrooms. If you wish please join us for chats in the kitchen diner or garden.
interaction: Please feel free to ask if you have questions and join us if you want company. We love to meet new people and share experiences.
house_rules: Respect the house and the people in it by being clean and tidy, and quiet in the early morning before 8.00am and at night after 10pm
host_about: I live in the house with my partner Elsa and my daughter. Since I took up  cycling I've discovered a whole new side and love of London - now when friends come and stay with me and I take them on cycling tours they tell me how much they love it and why didn't I show them this before. The truth is I never knew it before. Anyway this has inspired me to offer cycling advice and tours as part of your experience so you too can discover this side to London.

name: Master bedroom in Shoreditch Zone 1
summary: - Master bedroom of the flat, super comfy memory foam Tempur Mattress.  - ZONE 1 - with excellent transport links.  - BUZZING AREA: perfect for exploring Hoxton, Shoreditch and Brick Lane.  - PRIVATE GARDEN: good sized private back garden and sizeable rooms throughout. normally listed as a whole property but for this weekend only two friends from Copenhagen staying in one room and this room is now available.
space: This spacious 861sq. ft. split level apartment with own street front door in the middle of Shoreditch.  The master bedroom has a comfy double bed, close to the master bathroom, downstairs toilet, kitchen and a bright reception space leading to a south facing private garden.  The entire apartment has been recently renovated, with new kitchen fittings and bathroom suite. It's all fully furnished, so you don't need to bring your own sofa. Bedroom 1 - king size double bed  All bedding is nice quality cotton.  We live here normally so there is everything you need.

neighborhood_overview: Shoreditch and Hoxton are London at its most cool – the heartland of the capital’s designer creativity, with cutting-edge galleries, great night-life and live music, slick restaurants and exuberant fashion and interiors stores. Old Street roundabout (now known as Silicon Roundabout) is at the centre of a technology start-up boom. Shoreditch and Hoxton is London at its most confident and expressive and is arguably the best area in the city for fashion, dining, lifestyle, nightlife and trend-spotting. https://www.airbnb.com/locations/london/shoreditch For cocktails  Nightjar on Old Street Roandabout  White Lyan on Hoxton Street.  100 hoxton street for happy hour cocktails until 7pm and nice nibbles.  Happiness forgets on hoxton square.  For going out later  The Glory (gay bar). Cheap, silly and often cabaret.  Rubys quite small and dalston crowd - kingsland road  Dalston Superstore on Kingsland road - quiet a young crowd and also A gay bar but open to anyone.  XOYO or Oval Space for club
notes: All we ask is that you treat our home and our elderly neighbours with respect and keep noise to a minimum. To avoid disturbing them we ask that:  No noise in the garden or outside after 10pm.  No guests are bought over without prior approval from us (simply to prevent parties but let us know if you do plan to have a friend or family over).  Any booking that breaks these rules will be asked to leave immediately.  Sorry for the strict rules, for most it will not be relevant and we are sure you will have a lovely stay! Please ask if you need any help on planning travel or what to do whilst here.
transit: You can easily walk everywhere from the apartment and it is very close to convenient tube and train stations: - 10min walk to Hoxton Station: this Overground train (east London line) will zoom you down to Brick Lane and beyond, or up to Highbury / Islington. -10min walk to Old Street Station which has National Rail and The Northern Line links - 8min walk from Hoxton Square, and 15/20min from Spitalfields, Brick Lane, Columbia Road flower market and Liverpool Street Station. (The City / The Square Mile). - There are many bus links to Central London and there are city cycle hire stations dotted around. - To get around London, we recommend you install the London Underground app (for the map). - CityMapper is an excellent app too, for very clear and detailed getting-about instruction.
access: I leave guests to enjoy the space privately but please feel free to contact us any time if you have any additional questions. Please note for this weekend (26th/27th October) there are two guests in the spare bedroom as well as this bedroom being available to rent.
house_rules: - Please do not make noise in the garden or outside the house after 10pm. -  **STRICTLY NO PARTIES** Please do not make the booking if you are planning to have a party. Our next door neighbours are elderly and will notify us immediately and ALL guests will be asked to leave the property even if it's in the middle of the night! Thank you for your understanding!  For this reason we ask that no guests to be bought over without prior approval from us And that no noise in the garden past 10pm
host_about:
Born in Bristol
Lived in London for the last 14 years and would love you to experience some of London like i do!

name: Luxury Room in the heart of London
summary: Elegant Victorian house near to Chelsea not far to Knightsbridge. Quiet safe neighbourhood. Tube/Subway 5 mins walk. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Chelsea FC 10 min walk. River Thames 15 min walk. Heathrow Airport 30 mins. Comfortable room with TV and own bathroom. An oasis in London.
space: My home is spacious and is spread over three floors. The ground floor comprises an open plan lounge/living room and the kitchen/dining area. At the end of the kitchen stands foldable glass doors which lead out onto the pretty garden patio. The south facing garden gives this part of the house plenty of warmth and light and is especially inviting on a sunny day to sip coffee or a chilled glass of wine. The first floor consists of a study, a bathroom and the master bedroom (my room). The second floor is dedicated to guests with their own large and luxurious bedroom as well as their own bathroom. The guest bedroom features a queen sized bed with top of the range linens, a flat screen TV and a comfy chair with a reading light. The bathroom has a new marble vanity top and a superb shower and bath depending on your mood.
