neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is very safe. It has all the amenities you could want. Lovely local parks, excellent restaurants and bars, cute shopping boutiques. For the exercise lovers, there are a couple of pilates and spinning studios nearby which you do not need to be a member to access. The house is a short distance to Chelsea and Knightsbridge.
notes: Any damages, breakables, spillages or missing items will be deducted from the security deposit.
transit: The nearest station is Parsons Green on the district line which is a ten minute walk from the house. There are also buses which will take you into the west end too.
access: Guests will obviously have their own bedroom and own bathroom. Guests are allowed to use the kitchen amenities such as the fridge, the kettle and the toaster. The stove is not accessible to guests and I do not have a microwave either. Guests may also sit at the breakfast bar or at the kitchen table to eat/drink, read or work. The outside patio is also available to guests too Guests may not be permitted to use the following areas: 1. Lounge 2. Study 3. Master Bedroom 4. Kitchen stove
interaction: I will be available during the day and early evening to answer any questions or to help in any way that I can to ensure you have a pleasant stay.
house_rules: No smoking  No pets  No guests apart from paying guests No food upstairs No drinks upstairs apart from clear liquids No shoes upstairs Any damage, breakables, spillages or missing items will be deducted from the security deposit

Travel-lover, cinephile and an occasional book-worm working in Data tech. I have visited 40+ countries in all shapes and forms and thus can see both sides of the coin: that of a guest and a host. 

While hosting I always try to accommodate the needs of my guests and value openness about it - whatever your requests, please express them to me and I will make everything to make it happen.

While travelling I don't make much fuss about small things, but do consider functioning WiFi to be an essential amenity :)

notes: From Stansted Airport: (Fastest & Easiest) tube & train journey takes under 1 hour from Monday to Saturday and costs about £10-30 per person each way, 30 days advanced online booking is cheapest. Take the "Stanstead Express" train to Tottenham Hale Station, then "tube" it to King's Cross St. Pancras Station. On Sunday the journey takes 1 hour and 15 minutes and costs about £10-30 per person each way. Take The "Stanstead Express" train to Liverpool Street Station, then "tube" it to King's Cross St. Pancras Station. (Cheapest) coach journey takes 1 Hours 40 Minutes, £5-10 per person each way, advanced online booking is cheapest. "National Express Coach" goes to Liverpool Street & "Easy Bus" goes to Baker Street. Then walk to the underground station and "tube" it to King's Cross St. Pancras Station From Gatwick Airport: (Fastest) train & tube journey takes 45 minutes and costs about £15-25 per person each way, online booking is cheapest. Take the "Gatwick Express" train to Victoria Statio

neighborhood_overview: Local to Canary Wharf, Central London, Stratford Olympic Park and Westfield Indoor Shopping Mall. Excel and O2.  We are located in Zone 2. Catch Thames clipper river bus from Canary Wharf to Greenwich or centre line. Note you can use your oyster card on the boat.
notes: This is a diverse neighbourhood. We welcome all nationalities. Food Stores: We have a local food store 20 seconds from the apartment that sells some groceries such as milk, bread, snacks and wine. Larger store is 5mins walk to Tesco express. From the house, turn left into Poplar high street (opposite direction from Poplar station) cross the road and walk for 5mins.  Medicine   There is a Pharmacy opposite Tesco's. If you or your child becomes unwell, you can seek advice from the pharmacy.  In an emergency call 999. Local nuisances call 101. Nearest hospital is 'The Royal London Hospital' in Whitechapel. Nearest metro is Whitechapel station.  Mini Cab / Taxi office next to All Saints Station. We recommend you use Uber. Restaurants Best restaurants and coffee shops are located in Canary Wharf where you will find every cuisine imaginable. Good for shopping also. Other Shopping Malls located in Stratford Westfield or Oxford Circus.
transit: Central London End of our road 2mins for bus services to central London, buses 15 and 115 to Aldgate near Liverpool Street. There is also a night bus service in operation. 4 minutes mins walk to Poplar DLR trains for connections to underground stations (the tube).  Food stores 30 seconds away from local food store and Tesco 4 minutes walk down Poplar high street. Crisp street market 4 mins away with Co-op and Iceland food stores. Leisure centre Tennis courts, kids playground, gym /indoor swimming pool facilities within 5 mins.  Sauna/steam/massage/manicure/pedicure 1 min from apartment at local boutique hotel. Extra cost and bookings in advance. 8 minutes walk to Canary Wharf jubilee line underground station  (3 mins by DLR from Poplar, plus short walk) . Where you will find Excellent connections to Waterloo and Westminster. Also fantastic choice of restaurants. 8 mins walk to Canary Wharf riverside to catch Thames Clipper (river bus) to Greenwich (East) or Westminster (West). You can

Also securely close the main white door shut and send us a quick message to say that you have vacated the property.    It is your liability if you fail to securely close the windows and main door when vacating the property, particularly during checking out.  We have recently suffered negligence and failure to reasonably secure our property will result in a FIXED PENALTY FEE OF £100.  Airbnb have been notified of this change and have agreed to our rules. Please also... - No parties or events - No use of incense - No jumping on the bed please including small children - Do not light the candles - Not suitable for pets - No illegal drugs or activities - No accessing illegal material from the wifi internet  Please report anything broken immediately. name: Luxury 2 bed 2 bath House in Clapham Common
summary: Make yourself at home in our bright two bedroom split level maisonette situated on Clapham high street a stones throw from a plethora of bars and restaurants. We are a 1 min walk from Clapham Common Tube & 2 mins from the beautiful Clapham Common. The house has recently been completely renovated to a very high standard with a high spec kitchen, 2 large bedrooms with built in wardrobes, modern bathrooms, comfy couches, a fully loaded TV, underfloor heating throughout and your own foosball table!
space: Our amazing unique maisonette flat has everything you would ever need to feel at home in London. Located in what was voted as the best place to live in the capital, Clapham is one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in London. You will have the flexibility of being in the heart of all the action Clapham High Street has to offer with the peace and quiet of a secluded location. Our home is a modern, huge, recently renovated, split level 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom maisonette with a large open plan living/dining/kitchen area. It's warm & quiet, with newly installed thermometer controlled underfloor heating throughout.  The flat is capable of accommodating 4 people. The master bedroom contains a huge Super King sized bed with pocket spring mattress with hotel quality linen & goose down duvet. You will have access to built in wardrobes and your own ensuite with bathtub, shower, heated towel racks and heated mirrors which wont fog after a shower. The second bedroom has a Queen size bed with memor

The house has recently been completely renovated to a very high standard with a high spec kitchen, 2 large bedrooms with built in wardrobes, modern bathrooms, comfy couches, a fully loaded TV, underfloor heating throughout and your own foosball table! Our amazing unique maisonette flat has everything you would ever need to feel at home in London. Located in what was voted as the best place to live in the capital, Clapham is one of the most beautiful neighbourhoods in London. You will have the flexibility of being in the heart of all the action Clapham High Street has to offer with the peace and quiet of a secluded location. Our home is a modern, huge, recently renovated, split level 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom maisonette with a large open plan livi
neighborhood_overview: It really is hard to convey in writing just how amazing the location of our flat is, Clapham Old Town is a really vibrant, buzzy area with incredible bars, restaurants, shops & green space all within a 2 minute walk. I will provide you with my detailed guide to the local area once you have booked. For example, Clapham Common is a huge open park just seconds away, and in the summer it's great for a picnic, live music, sunbathing, jogging & other sports. There are award winning restaurants just around the corner, as well as numerous supermarkets and shops.
notes: We respectfully ask that guests treat the property with the care and  respect they would as if it was their own. We also ask you to  respect the neighbours by keeping the noise down, especially  when it’s late.
transit: When it comes to public transport, you really are spoilt for choice.  There’s a bus stop right outside the apartment, and two tube  stations just minutes away - Clapham Common on the Northern Line  and Stockwell on the Victoria Line. That means you’re well- connected with pretty much anywhere in London you’d care to  visit, including the River Thames, Theatreland, Westminster and  The City. And if you’re planning on travelling further afield during your stay,  the main train terminals at Victoria, Waterloo and London Bridge  are all within easy reach. As is Clapham Junction, from where  trains will take you in all directions across southern England,  including Gatwick Airport, Brighton and Hastings. The apartment is also handily placed to help you explore new  London Overground routes from Clapham High Street station,  which connect you to places like the Olympic Park in Stratford as  well as Docklands, Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington.
access: You will have access to the entire place to yourself. The maisonette flat is on the first floor of a modern apartment block that is accessible directly from Clapham High Street. You can access the first floor by stairs or a lift.  When you leave the flat you can take the side fire-escape that will put you right in front of the Picturehouse theatre on Venn Street in 20 seconds!
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.
house_rules: ID must be shown to check in.
host_about: We are an Australian French couple who love to travel. We try to discover as may new places as possible and much prefer staying in local places rather than plush hotels. We love to ski spend most of our holidays doing so either in Chamonix or finding new places in Europe or abroad. When we are not skiing we try to spend as many weekends as possible discovering new cities in Europe. We have just listed our home in London on Air BnB and have started to make a few reservations ourselves. We look forward to introducing you to our home or discovering yours soon!

name: Elegant 3BR in Westminster by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the upscale decor, large windows letting in plenty of natural light, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in Westminster, you're within walking distance to the Victoria Palace Theatre and Buckingham Palace.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the upscale decor, large windows letting in plenty of natural light, and fully-equipped kitchen. Located in Westminster, you're within walking distance to the Victoria Palace Theatre and Buckingham Palace. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out About Thyme Restaurant or Kazan Restaurant for some of London's best dining. For shopping, head to Victoria Place or Nova Complex. To explore the rest of the city, head to Victoria Station and take the District, Circle, and Victoria Lines. In the bustling government neighbo
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out About Thyme Restaurant or Kazan Restaurant for some of London's best dining. For shopping, head to Victoria Place or Nova Complex. To explore the rest of the city, head to Victoria Station and take the District, Circle, and Victoria Lines. In the bustling government neighbourhood of Westminster, you can enjoy the greatest historic landmarks London has to offer, while also staying near Buckingham Palace. Along with the magnificent buildings and architecture, Westminster is known for its lush parks and vibrant shopping district. Be sure to head to Trafalgar Square, discover Whitehall’s authentic pubs, and admire the Palace of Westminster from the other side of the Thames.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder doesn't have a microwave, but there are tons of great restaurants nearby - check out your Neighborhood Guide to see some of our favorites!
transit: Drivers can find paid street parking nearby, but please be mindful of street signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef
host_about:
Sonder provides everything you need for an exceptional stay. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials. And every experience is one-of-a-kind, thanks to our unique spaces and Neighborhood Guides.

To provide a better Sonder guest experience, we're creating local Airbnb accounts. If you don't see a property you like here, there may be more on one of our new local profiles:

name: Beautiful 2 Bedroom Apartment in Heart of London
summary: The central London apartment has recently been upgraded and redecorated throughout. If you're looking for great connections and walking distance to major attractions like Hyde Park, Little Venice, and Paddington then this is the place to stay. There is easy access to 4 tube lines and many buses. It comes equipped with a fully furnished kitchen and living room with widescreen . Fresh towels & linen are provided for your comfort.
space: The apartment has been freshly upgraded to make it a true home from home. The bedrooms have been tastefully redecorated with relaxing themes to help you unwind after a day in the city.  The newly converted living room comes equipped with a corner sofa which converts to a double bed if required, and bean bag seat. Within this space we have a large 40 inch TV with over 140 channels for you to enjoy (from 21st Sept) and high speed internet is available with an unlimited data allowance all over the apartment (from 21st Sept). With 1 toiler and shower room, 1 WC, and 1 shower room you can be confident that you will never have to fight for the bathroom in the mornings! The kitchen diner is a great place to help you keep the costs of your trip down with a full range of self catered cooking options made available by the fully equipped kitchen. There is a supermarket across the main road selling a full range of high quality goods and various smaller produce shops available in the area.

name: 2-Bedroom Battersea Park Home with Balcony
summary: Amazing, beautiful and clean 2 bedroom flat in Battersea, right next to Battersea Park. My home is fully equipped with everything you'll need for a long or short stay in London, in addition to a lovely balcony! With Clapham Junction a short walk away, the flat would be perfect for couples, friends or families on their trip to London.
space: This amazing flat in Battersea is the perfect place to relax after exploring all that London has to offer. There are two bedrooms, one with a king bed and the other with a double. They both have hotel quality linens and towels, and plenty of storage space. The kitchen is fully equipped, including a hob/oven. The living area has comfortable sofas and an arm chair, there is also a TV with freeview. The flat is professionally cleaned and there is 24/7 check in due to the keys being collected from a lock box. You will have an amazing stay at this lovely flat.

neighborhood_overview: Few places bustle like Battersea these days, with top-notch restaurants, bars and boozers bringing 'em in from far and wide. The Battersea Arts Centre continues to showcase some of the best in the business, and the zoo and the park are great for kids (and kids within). The Pump House Gallery is as good as ever and then there's the heliport, with choppers taking you for some seriously impressive views across our fair city.  Battersea has plenty of shops and restaurants — close to Clapham Junction, up St John’s Road, continuing along Northcote Road and up the hill from the junction along Lavender Hill and Battersea Rise. There is a Debenhams department store on the corner of Lavender Hill and St John’s Road. Northcote Road is dominated by mid-market chains such as Jigsaw, Whistles and Phase Eight and youth brands White Stuff and Jack Wills. Two long-standing butchers, Dove & Son and Hennessy, along with sports shop Capstick and jewellers Asquiths have survived other local independents.
transit: Clapham Junction is a 15 minute walk away, from which you can take the train to London Waterloo or London Victoria leaving every 3/4 mins, taking less than 10 minutes.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: My support team or I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.

name: Luxury Ensuite Bedroom in Stunning Victorian House
summary: Welcome to our beautiful high spec luxury Victorian home in London!  Located less than 20mins to central London, Canary Wharf, O2, Excel Centre, we're in a beautiful area called Shooters Hill (south east london) with views of Canary Wharf skyscrapers from our front door!
space: Luxurious, high spec and spacious 4 bedroom / 4 bathroom / 3 floor Victorian townhouse (c. 2,500 sqft) built in the late 1800's with many of the original Victorian features (including fireplaces). Our home is the perfect place to relax after a busy day out in London.  We take pride in our home and have lovely things for you to enjoy. Our Living Room has a 55" LCD screen and Sonos surround sound - great for watching movies! It also has a chess board, games console which you're welcome to use. The Dining Room has a funky metal (zinc) table which is great for eating around, socialising and having fun. Our kitchen is HUGE and has another big LCD screen so you can be creative, cook and watch your favourite show on Netflix! All guests have space in the fridge and are welcome to use the kitchen anytime! Guest Room: Spacious and luxurious room with super king size bed, ensuite, television (with over 100 channels and Netflix for those rainy days at home!). A kettle, tea, coffee and treats are a
description: Welcome to our beautiful high spec luxury Victorian home in London!  Located less than 20mins to central London, Canary Wharf, O2, Excel Centre, we're in a beautiful area called Shooters Hill (south east london) with views of Canary Wharf skyscrapers from our front door! Luxurious, high spec and spacious 4 bedroom / 4 bathroom / 3 floor Victorian townhouse (c. 2,500 sqft) built in the late 1800's with many of the original Victorian features (including fireplaces). Our home is the perfect place to relax after a busy day out in London.  We take pride in our home and have lovely things for you to enjoy. Our Living Room has a 55" LCD screen and Sonos surround sound - great for watching movies! It also has a chess board, games console which you're welcome to use. The Dining Room has a funky metal (zinc) table which is great for eating around, socialising and having fun. Our kitchen is HUGE and has another big LCD screen so you can be creative, cook and watch your favourite show on Netflix!
neighborhood_overview: Shooters Hill is in the Royal Borough of Greenwich and is home to Severndroog Castle (10 minutes walk from our home), Shooter's Hill Golf Course (15 minute walk), and Royal Borough of Greenwich Equestrian Centre (26 minute walk).  Shooter's Hill is also one of the highest points in London and the views of London / Canary Wharf Skyscrapers from our front door are spectacular!
notes: We have a cute little cat called Michu. He is very sweet but mainly sleeps and eats. But he will never be in your room - unless you want to hug him - he's very cuddly! :) We also have a new born baby (Bradley) in the house. The house is large and the bedrooms are far from where he sleeps so you wont notice him!
transit: The closest transportation link into Central London is via the Woolwich Arsenal DLR (zone 4) or train station which is a 10-15 mins walk from our house (or 5 mins by bus). From Woolwich Arsenal DLR Station, you can travel to: - London City Airport - 6 mins  - Bank Station (Financial District / Centre) - 22 mins  - London Bridge - 23 mins - Charring Cross- 30 mins  By taxi, we are: 1. Greenwich, maritime museum, Cutty Sark - 15 mins 2. O2 arena - 10 mins 3. 10 mins to North Greenwich station (jubilee line) where you can travel to       A. Canary Wharf - 1 min      B. Westminster (Big Ben!) - 10 mins       C. Oxford Street (Shopping!) - 15 mins      D. Paddington Station (trips to Oxford?) - 24 mins One way ticket from our house to London using the Underground or DLR costs £3.90 (peak) or £2.80 (off peak). A day pass costs around £12.
access: Our motto is "Mi Casa Es Su Casa" "My house is your house" so when you arrive, please feel at home! You will be able to relax in our living room (with Sonos surround sound and 55" screens), eat in our funky dinning room (with large zinc table!), use our kitchen to cook and be creative. All guests have allocated fridge space - so feel at home! We also have a large garden at the back of the house that you are more than welcomed to use on a hot summer's day for BBQs, sun bathing or just playing around!
interaction: We are always here for our guests. We will say hello and have a drink with you, but we are very respectful of giving you space to have your own time to relax. My husband and I work Monday to Fridays and normally come home at 7pm to cook dinner and unwind with a glass of wine or two after a long day at the office. Weekends for us are pretty chilled, we stay in and from time to time head out. We are super relaxed and love hosting guests!
host_about:
Ecuadorian American from New York City living in London since 2009 :)  My husband is British and we love to travel! Our favourite and most memorable vacation destination was Japan. We loved the food, culture and advanced technology it had to offer! 

We also truly love Karaoke - I can't imagine a world without it.

summary: Breathtaking views over London's skyline! Comfortable room, desk, large wardrobe, smart TV, high speed wifi. Convenient central location, easy access to London Bridge, Canary Wharf, Westminster and Bond Street. City Airport is only a 25 min tube ride away.  Recently renovated to a high standard. Cosy kitchenette with microwave, fridge-freezer, washing machine and dryer. Luxurious bathroom with rainfall shower. Perfect for solo adventurers, couples, or business travellers.
space: The thing you'll notice most about the room is what's outside. London literally at your feet with panoramic views over the city. If you happen to be in during the evening you'll be treated to splendid sunsets. The kitchenette is cosy and contains built in microwave and fridge-freezer, a washing machine and separate dryer. There's no oven/hob, so its not really suitable for elaborate meals, but tea, coffee, milk and cereals are provided. The newly refurbished bathroom has a lovely rainfall shower over bath, as well as hand held shower.  Iron and hair-dryer available. I have another room available (see other listing), ideal for friends traveling together.

neighborhood_overview: You don't have to go far to enjoy some of London's best delights. Within a few minutes walk you can find Bermondsey street with its array of excellent cafes and restaurants, the famous White Cube gallery, the fashion and textile museum, design shops, and even a glass blowing workshop. Also a short walk away are Maltby Street Food Market (open on weekends), Bermondsey Antiques Market (on Fridays), Shad Thames with its many popular restaurants and bars on the river front, and the Design Museum. A bit further away but still within walking distance are Tower Bridge, the Shard and the world famous Borough Market..
notes: I have two rooms to let, which could be useful if you are friends looking for two rooms in the same flat.
transit: You are a few minutes walk from Bermondsey underground station, which is only one stop away from London Bridge and the Shard, two stops from Canary Wharf, four from Westminster, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, and 6 stops (11 mins ride) to Bond Street. Jubilee line now operates a 24h service on Fridays and Saturdays, and there is a good night bus service throughout the week. City Airport is very convenient being a 25 min away by underground.
access: There's unlimited fast wireless internet in the flat. There is no living room access, and the kitchenette and bathroom are shared with my other airbnb guest-room.
interaction: If you need anything just let me know and I'll do my best to make your stay as smooth and pleasant as possible!
house_rules: - No smoking - No high heals in flat to protect wooden floor, please remove before entry - As courtesy to the neighbours no loud noise after 11pm please - No candles or naked flame - No parties - Please leave kitchen and bathroom clean and tidy after use Thanks!
host_about: I'm an actor, originally from Israel, living in London :-)

name: Double room with private bathroom
summary: Enjoy a double room with your own private bathroom including power shower, and parking permits available. We are 5 minutes walk from Walthamstow Central station (Victoria Line and Overground), and equally close to a wonderful collection of restaurants, shops, cinema, supermarkets, pubs and cafes.  The house itself is in a quiet residential area, and has a quiet south-facing garden.  It's good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
description: Enjoy a double room with your own private bathroom including power shower, and parking permits available. We are 5 minutes walk from Walthamstow Central station (Victoria Line and Overground), and equally close to a wonderful collection of restaurants, shops, cinema, supermarkets, pubs and cafes.  The house itself is in a quiet residential area, and has a quiet south-facing garden.  It's good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. Feel free to make yourself at home and make use of the shared spaces, including our comfortable lounge and open plan kitchen. We want you to make the most of our house but would ask that kitchen use in the evening is by permission only. We both work during the day and are frequently out in the evenings. However, we will try to make your stay as pleasant and fulfilling as possible, so we have developed a welcome pack with lots of information about the area and the house. You'll also be able to contact us if you have any problems at all. Waltha
neighborhood_overview: Walthamstow has the benefit of having a real sense of community while being very close to central London.  It has its own cinema, several restaurants and coffee shops, pubs, a great Saturday market, and a variety of shops. The William Morris Gallery is worth a look is you have a spare hour. And Lloyd Park is a wonderful place to go for a walk, play tennis, or even take the kids to an adventure playground.
notes: We are happy to arrange visitor parking permits for you. It's easiest to do this in advance so do get in touch if you would like to drive. Permits cost 50p per hour and are required 8am-6.30pm Monday-Saturday.
transit: We are located 5 minutes walk from Walthamstow Central station. This is on the Victoria Line for London Underground (15 minutes from King's Cross St Pancras; 20 minutes from Oxford Circus and the West End). It is also on London Overground (20 minutes into Liverpool Street for the City of London). Walthamstow is also very well served by several bus routes. We are happy to arrange visitor parking permits for you. It's easiest to do this in advance so do get in touch if you would like to drive. Permits cost 50p per hour and are required 8am-6.30pm Monday-Saturday.
access: Feel free to make yourself at home and make use of the shared spaces, including our comfortable lounge and open plan kitchen. We want you to make the most of our house but would ask that kitchen use in the evening is by permission only.
interaction: We both work during the day and are frequently out in the evenings. However, we will try to make your stay as pleasant and fulfilling as possible, so we have developed a welcome pack with lots of information about the area and the house. You'll also be able to contact us if you have any problems at all.
house_rules: - Please make sure all windows and doors are shut and locked on leaving the house - In general, the kitchen may only be used in the morning or lunchtime. Evening use is by specific permission only.

name: Luxury Studio Guest House near Hampstead
summary: 'Woodcot' is a brand new self-contained modern and elegant garden apartment offering the peace of a countryside setting amongst trees at the bottom of a family garden within walking distance to a fantastic village with plenty to enjoy. The excitement of the West end and city are only a bus or tube ride away making this a perfect location for a relaxing vacation.
space: 'Woodcot' consists of a bedroom, kitchen and a separate bathroom containing a good sized, fully-tiled shower, WC and basin with three port hole windows (you will not have to share with anyone!).  The apartment has been beautifully designed and decorated, has lots of natural light and features an outside patio area (with table and chairs) where you are welcome to relax and enjoy the garden. It also features underfloor heating. The apartment is suitable for 1-2 adults and can accommodate up to 2 children (sleeping on an air bed please note there is a charge of £10 extra per child per night). 2 adult guests are maximum for this apartment.  The property backs onto the Coolhurst Lawn Tennis and Squash club (including club house which is like entering a British time warp!). There is a gate straight into the club from the back garden.

neighborhood_overview: Highgate village and the top of Hampstead Heath is a 15 minute walk with Queenswood very close by which are the oldest forested woods in London. These are a 10 minutes walk away.  Highgate village is an historic high street and has Highgate Cemetery famous for the burial place of Carl Marx and the birthplace of the story "Dracula" after the Highgate Vampire.  Kenwood House is located in Hampstead Heath just below Highgate village and The Spaniards Inn is close by to Kenwood House which is the oldest pub in a London and was owned by the infamous Highwayman Dick Turpin who is said murdered his brother and buried him in the pub gardens and it features on the TV programme "Most Haunted" as the most haunted pub in London! Avenue Road turns into Crescent Road which takes you into the top end of Crouch End which is a vibrant local village full of Artisan cafes, trendy bars, great restaurants and friendly shops offering a comprehensive selection of fares. The famous Town Hall is an outstanding
notes: Please note that there is a small dog (a very friendly Bichon) who runs in the garden.  Off street parking can be arranged on our private drive way for £15 per day.
transit: Avenue Road is located within an 8-10 minute walk to Highgate Tube (Northern Line) which is a lovely walk along Shepherds Hill.  The 91 bus which is 4 minutes walk away takes you via Archway Kings cross Euston and on down the Strand to Trafalgar Square.
access: Guests are able to access the full apartment through a private gated entrance to the side of the house. Access: Please note that there are 6 steps leading from the driveway at the side of the house into the garden - to access the apartment. There is also one step leading up into the apartment from the garden.
house_rules: Check in time is either between 2-3pm or 6-8pm. Please note that we do not accept bookings for film/photography shoots.
host_about:
I am a very outgoing person with a lively social house hold that loves art and every genre of music available to man kind.

 I believe in a friendly and happy environment and welcome the bohemian misfits of this beautiful and culturally diverse city.

name: Spacious fun room. Camden Town
summary: The room is large, bright, comfy and fun.  We are at the very heart of Camden Town. Excellent transport links to anywhere in London.  I work in I HATE TATTOOS Tattoo  Studio in Camden - I offer 20% off for my guests ;) be my guest :) check out @OLIVIERLDN insta gram
space: A nice and spacious room. There is a 40" tv, and a 93" plush bear that doubles up as a cozy sofa + a comfy two sitter. There is one double bed plus one double spare mattress.

There is a 40" tv, and a 93" plush bear that doubles up as a cozy sofa + a comfy two sitter. There is one double bed plus one double spare mattress. Guests have access to a shared kitchen and shared bathroom but own fridge. Guests are given a set of keys, clean bedding and towels at arrival. I am around and accessible through out the day.  I am more than happy to show guests to places if required. I will normally catch up with guests in the kitchen over a nice cup of tea or coffee. Camden Town is full of character and unique people. It is alternative and lively day and night.    The renowned Camden Market is just around the corner. There are several restaurants and bars all around too. If you would
neighborhood_overview: Camden Town is full of character and unique people. It is alternative and lively day and night.    The renowned Camden Market is just around the corner. There are several restaurants and bars all around too. If you would like some peace and quiet, there is Regent park or Primrose Hill a short stroll away. The flat (maisonette) is right on Camden Road. Although a plus in itself, it is constantly busy. Weekends can get loud. Be aware light sleepers!
notes: There is a spare double mattress in the room. The room could, therefore, accommodate up to 4/5 friends or a family. All ages are welcomed. Cot can be provided upon request in advance. We have a cat in the flat.
transit: Camden Town station is only 30secs away. There are buses links to everywhere in London too.
access: Guests have access to a shared kitchen and shared bathroom but own fridge. Guests are given a set of keys, clean bedding and towels at arrival.
interaction: I am around and accessible through out the day.  I am more than happy to show guests to places if required. I will normally catch up with guests in the kitchen over a nice cup of tea or coffee.
house_rules: Politely and mindful of others.
host_about:
I'm very upbeat and energetic, always on the go. I love food, and all forms of artistic expression. I am a tattooist and also run my own Street food business with my other half.

On my spare time (yes, there is always room for more) I enjoy chilling with my fiancee and son. Nothing like good food, music and nice company!

I would be more than happy to show you around Camden and give some nice tips and advice for places to go in London.

name: Entire flat - Zone 1 Bright & spacious
summary: Bright and spacious flat available to 4-5 guests for short stays, in lovely Islington (Zone 1, North-East London), well connected to central London - only 20 mins by bus / Underground. Quiet street in a vibrant neighbourhood.
space: Entire two-bedroom flat available for guests for short stays. 2 large double rooms with a double bed, plenty of space and storage, additional sitting sofa (can be used for a child), a large, west&east-facing windows. Great light, spacious, comfortable and very quiet. I will provide fresh linen and towels. THE FLAT has total 2 bedrooms, a very large kitchen with dining table, a clean bathroom and separate WC room. You will be close to the many trendy shops, markets, bars, restaurants, cinema and theatre that have made Angel - Islington a smart, vibrant and popular London Borough. There is 24/7 wifi with good connection throughout the flat, a Nespresso machine to start a relaxed morning... Both bedrooms have wardrobes for hanging your clothes and a shelf. You will be welcome to use the kitchen, it is spacious and comfortable, and has all needed equipment, and washing machine, a hairdryer and iron facilities. I will be happy to welcome you and to offer you a comfortable 'home' from which

neighborhood_overview: Angel - Islington has two markets, a regular London street market [Chapel Street] and the famous Camden Passage antiques market. All the major high-street stores are represented, together with many small independents that you will not find elsewhere. Islington is known for interiors stores, including many retro, vintage and architectural salvage places. There are many popular restaurants and bars within a short stroll and to suit all pockets. From the original Ottolenghi and Barrio North to the Vivo Cafe, from Planet Organic to Five Guys; You will find all the major chains and long-established locals. Best for brunch? Ottolenghi, Bill's or the famous Breakfast Club. Also nearby: Vue cinema, N1 shopping centre.
notes: The flat is dog friendly, please confirm with me before booking.
transit: Getting around is easy! The flat is located between Highbury and Islington station [Victoria Line and Overground], Angel Station [Northern Line], and Essex Road station [National railways].  There is a bus stop near the house, with easy and direct connections all over the city - bus 38, bus 56, bus 341, bus 476, bus 73 N38 and N73 [day and night buses, 24 hours]. It takes 10-20 minutes to reach the West End, the River, or the City. Shoreditch (East London) and Camden (North) are also only a 10 minutes bus or tube ride away. Airport and station connections will depend on where you arrive into London, usually about 1 hour ride from most airport. *** We can give you detailed directions if needed. Just ask!
interaction: I will be available on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) and have a friend nearby that can take care of everything needed.
host_about:
In my 30s, love traveling, enjoy good food. Always pleased to meet new people and to be exposed to different cultures.
Working in a startup company in central London, returning home late in the evenings. Always available for you, to help you with everything you ask and always will be happy to cook meals together and experience new culinary adventures.

Hello ....

We look forward meeting you soon ;)

Thankyou ;)

name: Colourful Apartment with Geometric Art near Brick Lane
summary: Soak up the trendy aesthetic of this colourful Brick Lane flat set in the heart of ultra hip Shoreditch. Explore London's most thriving quarter via this space with an intimate kitchen, built-in wardrobes for ample storage, and two flat screen TVs.
space: If you’re looking for a colourful and contemporary flat right in the heart of London’s hipster scene, then look no further! This two bedroom flat is right in the centre of the trendy Shoreditch area in East London and will comfortably accommodate four guests. Shoreditch has fast become one of the most popular places for creative souls; artists, designers or simply those who just like to admire the plentiful street art! The flat itself is fully equipped to ensure that you have a comfortable stay in our capital city. The flat will also always be professionally cleaned and will come with fresh luxury linens for the guests. The lounge is open plan and consists of a living area and dining area. Both areas have splashes of bright colours and feature geometric artwork, enhancing the apartment’s trendy vibe. The living space then opens up to a fully functioning kitchen which comes stocked with basic amenities and cooking condiments to get you started. There are all the mod cons such as dishwas
description: Soak up the trendy aesthetic of this colourful Brick Lane flat set in the heart of ultra hip Shoreditch. Explore London's most thriving quarter via this space with an intimate kitchen, built-in wardrobes for ample storage, and two flat screen TVs.
neighborhood_overview: Shoreditch is London’s hipster central, full of artisan coffee shops, contemporary bars, and cool pop-up food markets. Spitalfields market is on the doorstep, offering a plethora of food stalls which sit alongside designer shops and brands.
notes: I have only a few simple house rules. I love this house so please respect my space.  - no parties or loud noises - no smoking  - no pets (there is carpet in most of the flat) - no shoes - please lock all doors and windows when you leave the apartment
transit: The apartment itself is only a six minute walk from Shoreditch high street, and a ten minute walk from the closest tube station, Aldgate East. There are also plenty of buses in the area which are a good option if you prefer to look at your surroundings as you travel to new places.  Liverpool Street station is also only a ten minute walk from the apartment, and this station is on the Central line which will take you directly to all the popular shopping areas such as Oxford Circus and Bond Street, as well as sights such as Marble Arch.
access: The whole apartment is available for our guests.
interaction: Send me a message on Airbnb and I will ensure that you receive a prompt reply.
host_about:
Hello!!
My name is Pery, I love reading books, sports and travelling around the world.

I would like to be your host and help you discover this great city where I live.

Please get in touch if I can help :)

name: Beautiful maisonette in the heart of Hackney
summary: My home is a lovely Victorian maisonette in Stoke Newington. It is decorated to a high standard, with a spacious, open-plan living area, high ceilings, period features, original art work, secluded garden, balcony, and superb walk-in shower. There are excellent transport links to the rest of the city. The flat sleeps 2 in the bedroom, and if you require we can make up an extra sofa bed.
space: This is a lovely, clean and tidy home on a friendly street.  You can see many of my personal touches in the artwork and features in flat.  The high ceilings make it feel even more spacious and there is a lovely open-plan kitchen and dining area and modern bathroom.  LIVING ROOM  Comfortable huge sofa, artwork throughout, and an open plan into the dining and kitchen area DINING ROOM / KITCHEN Dining table that seats six and opens in a large kitchen area with ample countertop space and a big fridge and freezer.  The room opens out onto the lovely private garden. BEDROOM  Comfortable double room, with space for your clothes and a desk where you can work.  Feel free to help yourself to any of the books to read!   BATHROOM Lovely modern bathroom with a huge walk-in shower with rainfall showerhead.

neighborhood_overview: The cafes, shops, restaurants and bars of Dalston are a 5 minute walk away, and Stoke Newington Church Street, a haven for brunch goers, vintage clothes shoppers and designer homeware seekers, is 5 minutes in the opposite direction. The buzzing Shoreditch nightlife is a short bus ride away. Every Saturday the very popular Stoke Newington Farmer's Market, a lovely place to pick up local, organic produce, is at the end of the road. Check out Street Feast in Dalston Yard for an amazing and fun array of street food options on Friday or Saturday nights. I am lucky enough to live close to many of Hackney's popular parks - Clissold is a 7 minute walk, Hackney Downs 10 minutes away and London Fields a 20 minute walk. For theatregoers the Arcola Theatre in Dalston always has interesting productions as do the Almeida and Kings Head in Islington and Park at Finsbury Park or you can walk to both the Rio Cinema and Hackney Picturehouse. This area really provides you the opportunity to live like a l

Buses go from the end of the road every two or three minutes to many areas of London and mainline stations such Kings Cross and St Pancras International, London Bridge, Liverpool Street, Victoria and Waterloo. It is a 7 minute walk/3 minute bus ride to Dalston Kingsland or Dalston Junction London Overground stations which links to the Victoria line at Highbury & Islington (5mins) or Jubilee line and DLR. Using the Overground and Underground is very convenient and quick. You can be in the centre of London - Oxford Circus/Soho - in 15 minutes, Euston Station and Kings Cross in 10 minutes. It's an easy (and pleasant) walk to H
access: Guests have complete access to the entire flat and garden, aside from my bedroom which is just blocked off. Additionally, I’ve arranged for a concierge service to be available to you throughout your stay, providing you with free, on-demand support for booking restaurants, tickets to shows, transport… or anything else you might fancy. Hopefully this will help you get even more out of your stay.  Details will be provided at check-in.
interaction: When I’m not there, you will be hosted by a professional hospitality company who I’ve engaged to look after you in my absence. They are on call to attend to your every need, as I would be.

name: Cosy Double Room in Trendy Hoxton
summary: Bedroom in a recently renovated flat amazingly located in the vibrant area of Old Street/Hoxton in Central London; within easy walking distance of Angel, Shoreditch, and the City of London. Ideal for single guests or a couple.
space: This is a cosy bedroom in a well located flat in a vintage 1930s red brick estate.  The bedroom has a double bed, desk and large wardrobe with plenty of storage space, and a nice view out over the green and leafy courtyard. The living room is bright and comfortable, and has two sofas. The bathroom and kitchen have both been recently refurbished. The flat is situated on the first floor, which is only accessible by staircases secured by an electronic key fob.

Not too far either from Elephant and Castle and Oval stations.  5km to Covent Garden, 1.5 mile to Tower Bridge.  We are in zone 2. Lots of buses getting into town or city.

name: Single Room, 2F Duchy House, Central London
summary: A front facing single bedroom room with separate shower room on the first floor of Duchy House.  Duchy House is located on the junction of the Strand and Waterloo Bridge and within easy reach of major attractions such as: Somerset House, The Courtauld Gallery, South Bank London, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Oxford Street. Excellent travel links make Duchy House easy to get to, with 5 underground stations less than 800 meters from the property and several bus routes operating nearby.
space: Duchy House is a 19th century building and has both double and single occupancy bedrooms across four floors, with lift access. Our bedrooms range in size and guests have a choice of rooms with either ensuite or shared shower room facilities.  All guests have access to a communal kitchen located on each floor for basic self-catering, with common rooms and an onsite laundry is also available for use in the basement. Duchy House is located on the junction of the Strand and Waterloo Bridge (the buildings entrance is located between Pret-a-Manger and Café Nero on Waterloo Bridge (postcode WC2R 1HG) and across the road from the vibrant and bustling Covent Garden.   Thus, whilst road traffic and the night time economy in this part of London might pose a noise issue, windows in all bedrooms are fitted with secondary glazing.  Guests may also request rear facing rooms, and we will endeavour to accommodate such requests subject to room availability.

neighborhood_overview: There are a number of coffee shop outlets (Café Nero, Pret-a-Manger, Starbucks etc.) adjacent to and/or within a five minute walk of Duchy House where you can pick up a coffee and other light refreshments.  A small supermarket (Tesco's Express) and Boots the Chemist is also located across the road with a small Sainsbury's Local supermarket located a short-distance along the Strand towards Trafalgar Square .
notes: If you have any general enquiries prior to booking a room and or have pre-arrival queries please do not hesitate to contact us.  Meanwhile, we thank you for considering to stay at Duchy House and we look forward to hosting you. This room may be subject to change.
transit: Situated in central London along the bustling Strand, Duchy House is within easy reach of major attractions such as: Somerset House, The Courtauld Gallery, South Bank London, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Oxford Street.  Excellent travel links make Duchy House easy to get to, with 5 underground stations less than 800 meters from the property and several bus routes operating nearby.
access: Duchy House is secured by a card key entry system covering both the main entrance door and internal corridor doors.  All bedrooms have individual key locks and the property has 24 hour CCTV coverage, thereby making Duchy House a safe place to stay.
interaction: Duchy House is operated by The Courtauld Institute of Art,  (the world’s leading centre for the study of art history, conservation and curating), as a Halls of Residence during the academic year for Courtauld students, though rented privately throughout the summer period (July to September), to those looking for affordable central London accommodation whilst visiting, studying or on business.   There may be some limited availability during term time. A member of staff is on duty in Duchy House 24 hours a day (during the summer period) to welcome you on arrival and to provide any assistance and deal with any queries you may have during your stay.  We offer guests discounted entry to The Courtauld Gallery which is open from 10:00 to 18:00 Monday to Sunday inclusive.
house_rules: - Check in after 2pm - Check out before 10am
host_about:
This is the Airbnb account for the Duchy House accommodation team.  Situated in central London at the junction of the Strand and Waterloo Bridge, Duchy House is within easy reach of major attractions such as: Somerset House, The Courtauld Gallery, South Bank London, Covent Garden, Leicester Square and Oxford Street.  Excellent travel links make Duchy House easy to get to, with 5 underground stations less than 800 meters from the property and several bus routes operating nearby.

Duchy House is a 19th century building and has both double and single occupancy bedrooms across four floors, with lift access. Our bedrooms range in size and guests have a choice of rooms with either ensuite or shared shower room facilities.  All guests have access to a communal kitchen located on each floor for basic self-catering, with common rooms and an onsite laundry is also available for use in the basement.

Duchy House is located on the junction of the Strand and Waterloo Bridge (the buildings entrance is located between Pret-a-Manger and Café Nero on Waterloo Bridge (postcode WC2R 1HG) and across the road from the vibrant and bustling Covent Garden.   Thus, whilst road traffic and the night time economy in this part of London might pose a noise issue, windows in all bedrooms are fitted with secondary glazing.  Guests may also request rear facing rooms (these are rooms with the letters J, K, L, M, N and O on the 1st, 2nd and 3rd floors), and we will endeavour to accommodate requests for these rooms subject to availability. 

Duchy House is secured by a card key entry system covering both the main entrance door and internal corridor doors.  All bedrooms have individual key locks and the property has 24 hour CCTV coverage, thereby making Duchy House a safe place to stay.  

There are a number of coffee shop outlets (Café Nero, Pret-a-Manger, Starbucks etc.) adjacent to and/or within a five minute walk of Duchy House where you can pick up a coffee and other light refreshments.  A small supermarket (Tesco's Express) and Boots the Chemist is also located across the road with a small Sainsbury's Local supermarket located a short-distance along the Strand towards Trafalgar Square .  All our bedrooms are equipped with double or single beds, wardrobe with full length mirror, desk and chair and a small fridge.  We provide complimentary bottled water, hairdryer, towels and basic toiletries.

Duchy House is operated by The Courtauld Institute of Art,  (the world’s leading centre for the study of art history, conservation and curating), as a Hall of Residence during the academic year for Courtauld students, though rented privately throughout the summer period (July to September), to those looking for affordable central London accommodation whilst visiting, studying or on business.   There is no availability during term time.

A member of staff is on duty in Duchy House 24 hours a day (during the summer period) to welcome you on arrival and to provide any assistance and deal with any queries you may have during your stay.  We offer guests, discounted entry to The Courtauld Gallery which is open from 10:00 to 18:00 Monday to Sunday inclusive.

If you have any general enquiries prior to booking a room and or have pre-arrival queries please do not hesitate to contact us.   Depending on occupancy we may be able to accommodate both early check-in and late check-outs, please enquire at the time of booking.  We are also able to assist with storing luggage prior to check-in and on the day of departure.  

We would like to take this opportunity to thank you for considering to stay at Duchy House and we look forward to hosting you.

Room includes a lovely seating area with a double Futon which is perfect for unwinding in front of the TV after a day in the city. The living area is available for guests to use freely along with the kitchen and we have a very nice balcony, which you are welcome to enjoy.

The Angle, Islington is ten minutes walk up Copenhagen Street. The West end, The City and Shoreditch are close by (Via Public Transport)

transit: The easy way to travel around London Visitor Oyster cards are plastic smartcards you can use instead of paper tickets. PLEASE NOTE, YOU CAN NOT USE CASH ON ANY BUS IN LONDON. Put on pay as you go credit which you use when you travel. It is the cheapest way to pay for single journeys on bus, Tube, tram, DLR, London Overground, TFL Rail and most National Rail services in London. From January 2016 you can also use your Visitor Oyster card to pay for travel on train services to/from Gatwick Airport, including Gatwick Express. can be arranged for directly outside the property, but is extremely expensive, get in touch and i'll explain how it works.  we have Excellent transport links to the whole of london, nationally and internationally. Play with Eddie the cat as often as you can NEVER ANSWER THE DOOR OR LET ANYONE INTO MY HOME FOR ANY REASON    Please don't bring non guests into my home without permission  Absolutely NO  parties.
host_about:
Hello, I live and work in the Camden area. I have hosted international students for some time now and have decided to try hosting on Airbnb instead. 
have a grown up child who is currently living away from home at University, hence, the spare room. 
I tech children for a living and I absolutely love my job. I am quiet social and really enjoy meeting new people, like most people I love to travel. 
My five loves are Music, Wine, Food, Love and Family in varying order.
I treat my guests as I would wish to be treated and I'm very certain that no one would be disappointed to spend time here.
I love to travel myself and may not always be in the property, but whether i'm there or not, I would encourage you to make yourselves at home.

Right in the middle of the historical Bloomsbury and the authentic Fitzrovia, this location is simply perfect. In the surrounding streets you will find numerous restaurants and bars. A great and bustling activity has always reigned on these streets, which makes it feel like something big is happening every day. Our tips: Goodge Street is full of restaurant with specialities from around the world. Living in this apartment you will be conveniently located 2 minutes’ walk from Goodge Street Station. Oxford Circus is literally down the street and you can easily walk up to Kings Cross St Pancras as well. Business travellers, families and group of friends are welcome!
notes: Guests are required to show a valid (government issued) photo ID. Check-in after 20:00 is available upon prior request for an extra cost.  20-22: £20 22-24: £30 after 24: £50 Luggage can also be left at the office in case of early arrival.
transit: Goodge Street station is  just 2 minutes away. The northern line makes it very easy to travel everywhere in London.

name: Spacious loft house with roof garden on canal
summary: Very spacious house in a converted industrial space Loft style open plan lounge, kitchen and dining area Stunning penthouse with roof garden and great views over Regent's canal and City Architect renovated with modern art collection 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms All modern amenities, gym, private parking Very quiet in safe, gated area Opp. Shoreditch Park, lots restaurants around, walking distance to Hoxton/Shoreditch and Islington  Great for groups or families Entirely wheelchair friendly
space: The Boathouse is a former industrial space used to restore narrow boats and barges of the canal built in 1840.  It has been fully renovated by a renowned architect and now offers 3,000 sqft of modern, loft-style accomodation, with the latest technology and a great art collection. The house is located in a private, gated area that can only be accessed by the other inhabitants (7 houses in total). It is very safe and quiet. The house overlooks Sturt's lock on Regent's canal. It is opposite Shoreditch Park, and walking distance to trendy Shoreditch/Hoxton to the East and Angel/Islington to the North. There are lots of restaurants arounds, including a few on the canal (the house has direct access to the towpath).

neighborhood_overview: The house is located on Regent's canal and overlooks Sturt's lock. With direct access to the towpath, you are only a 10 min (beautiful) walk away along the canal to Angel tube station. The house is just opposite Shoreditch Park, and walking distance to Shoreditch/Hoxton to the East and Angel/Islington to the North. There are lots of bars and restaurants around: - on the canal (the house has direct access to the towpath) - in nearby Islington: Angel and Upper street area - in the trendy and lively Shoreditch and Hoxton neighbourhoods
notes: The house is fully wheelchair accessible (I am disabled myself).
transit: You are only a 10 min (beautiful) walk along the canal away from Angel tube station (Northern Line). This is one stop from King's Cross/St Pancras for the Eurostar. Bus lines: 76 to Covent Garden and Waterloo; 73 to Oxford Circus and Victoria Station; 38 to British Museum, Soho and Green Park, 141 to London Bridge, 271 to the City; 21 to Borough and Lewisham.
access: The whole house is yours:  - 1 large bedroom on the top floor "under the stars" with ensuite bathroom, Super King bed, air conditioning, and access to a large terrace with views over the Regent's canal and the London skyline - 1 double bedroom with King bed and ensuite wetroom - 1 bedroom with superking bed and ensuite bathroom - 1 bedroom with double bed - Very spacious loft-style open plan lounge/dining room and kitchen. Large sofa bed offers possibility to sleep an additional 2 people. - A gym bench to keep you fit even on holiday! - Use of private car parking (on request) - All modern amenities: washer and dryer, dishwasher, underfloor heating, air conditioning (top floor), 65 inch TV screen with surround system, Playstation, super fast Wifi with extenders on all floors
house_rules: Our gated compound of 7 houses is a very safe and friendly community so please respect the privacy and quietness of the other inhabitants.
host_about:
I am fortunate to be able to travel a lot, for work and leisure, and am a huge fan of Airbnb. 
I have always loved big cities: Paris, Berlin, New York. But London is clearly my favourite and I hope that you will enjoy it, and my house, as much as I do!

name: Cosy 1 bed flat in amazing location - Marylebone
summary: This 1 bedroom flat sleeps 4 people with Marylebone, Soho and Oxford Street on its doorstep.
space: KITCHEN The kitchen offers all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay, such as gas hobs, oven, fridge, freezer, kettle and dishwasher. The washing machine is also located here. LIVING ROOM With wooden floor and plenty of natural light, this room is fitted with a sofa, a coffee table and a TV. The dining table is also located here and sits up to 6 people. The sofa can extend to become a double sofa bed, sleeping extra 2 guests. FIRST BEDROOM This bedroom offers a comfortable double bed, bedside cabinets and a wardrobe. BATHROOM This innovative bathroom features a bath tub, a single wash basin and a WC. SHOWER ROOM Next to the kitchen is a shower room, featuring a WC, a single wash basin and a walk-in shower.

LIVING ROOM With wooden floor and plenty of natural light, this room is fitted with a sofa, a coffee table and a TV. The dining table is also located here and sits up to 6 people. The sofa can extend to become a double sofa bed, sleeping extra 2 guests. FIRST BEDROOM This bedroom offers a comfortable double bed, bedside cabinets and a wardrobe. BATHROOM This innovative bathroom features a bath tub, a single wash basin and a WC. SHOWER ROOM Next to the kitchen is a shower room, featuring a WC, a single wash basin and a walk-in shower. Our Front Desk team are available from 8am - 8pm, 7 days a week.  Choosing this property means that you will be surrounded by London’s best attractions, bars and restaurants. The
neighborhood_overview: Choosing this property means that you will be surrounded by London’s best attractions, bars and restaurants. The streets surrounding this home are filled with cafés, restaurants, bars and shops, offering international cuisine and fashionable clothes and items. Just 10 minutes away is Oxford Street, famous for its shopping experiences. Marble Arch is also 10 minutes away just on the corner of the vast and popular Hyde Park. Make sure you allow enough time to explore the beautiful Hyde Park and it’s green paths, boating lakes and the adjoining Kensington Gardens which offers stunning picturesque landscapes. For culture and entertainment just walk 15 minutes for the vibrant Soho and Mayfair, offering London’s best theatres, cinemas, live music venues and bars.
notes: No smoking, pets and parties! Please note, the flat is on the lower ground floor and you'll have to go a few stairs down from the street level in order to access the property.
transit: Travelling to other areas couldn’t be easier with Marylebone, Baker Street and Edgware Road stations just minutes away and with connections on the Circle, District, Hammersmith & City, Jubilee, Metropolitan and Bakerloo lines ready to whisk you away to any destination! You are also just two stops from Paddington Station which has the Heathrow Express going directly to all terminals.
interaction: Our Front Desk team are available from 8am - 8pm, 7 days a week.
house_rules: - - The lead guest will be required to sign an Occupation Agreement prior to arrival. This is for insurance purposes to say that the guests will look after the property and not smoke or have parties - Please note that the lead guest must be over 25 years old - Normal check in time is between 3pm and 9pm. Any time outside of this period may incur an additional fee - No pets, no parties or smoking, please
host_about:
Greetings from London and Paris! 
 
My name is Tom and I work for Veeve, the largest short term property rental in London, created in 2011. We manage this collection of hand-picked apartments and houses for their individual owners while they are away. Each property is carefully selected and offers a stylish living experience and excellent value. 

As a lifelong Londoner I love having the opportunity to share these spaces, my knowledge and personal recommendations about this great city with those visiting for both short and long term stays. 

All our guests will be greeted personally at the property by a member of our hospitality team, and guest assistance is also provided by our professional customer service team between 8am - 8pm 7 days a week, should any issues arise during your stay. Please note that once a booking is made, the customer service team will be the point of contact thereafter.

Please be aware that viewings are not possible for stays of less than 1 month.
  
If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me and I will be sure to answer them promptly.

name: Stunning self-contained apartment with rural views
summary: Stunning, bright, self-contained loft apartment with hi-spec bathroom, kitchen and picture windows overlooking a nature reserve. 7 mins from St Margaret's station, cafes and shops. 7 mins from the Thames. 15 mins from Twickenham stadium unless you're waylaid in the Turk's Head! (5 mins)
description: Stunning, bright, self-contained loft apartment with hi-spec bathroom, kitchen and picture windows overlooking a nature reserve. 7 mins from St Margaret's station, cafes and shops. 7 mins from the Thames. 15 mins from Twickenham stadium unless you're waylaid in the Turk's Head! (5 mins) The space, which is accessed through our house, is completely private and self-contained. St Margaret's is a lovely district that nestles on a curve of the Thames. It has a village-like feel with lots of independent shops and cafes. There are lots of green spaces including Marble Hill Park from where you can take a ferry to Petersham Meadows and Ham House. St Margaret's station, served by South Western Trains, is a 7 minute walk away. There are 4 trains an hour to Waterloo - a half hour journey. We are equi-distant from Richmond Station and Twickenham station - both about 15 minutes walk away. (As well as South Western Trains, Richmond is also served by the District Underground line and the Overground )

notes: The bathroom has both a bath and a separate walk-in shower
transit: St Margaret's station, served by South Western Trains, is a 7 minute walk away. There are 4 trains an hour to Waterloo - a half hour journey. We are equi-distant from Richmond Station and Twickenham station - both about 15 minutes walk away. (As well as South Western Trains, Richmond is also served by the District Underground line and the Overground ). The H37 bus which also goes to Richmond, stops right at the end of our road.
access: The space, which is accessed through our house, is completely private and self-contained.
host_about: Art ( painting, photography, theatre, film, books) ; Nature ( blue skies; fields, woods, mountains; deserts; the sea);  Good food; Travel ( by bike, by train, on skis; by canoe- at home and abroad ); and friends/family

name: Charming & Bright Private Room (BA-I)
summary: You are invited to stay in my beautiful house, close to Wembley Stadium, SEE Arena and London Designer Outlet, my place is ideal for those who are attending business conferences, concerts or mega events in Wembley. There are a wide variety of top restaurants, cafes, cinema screens as well as designer and high street shops within the new London Designer Outlet, which makes the area extremely attractive to new visitors and shopping lovers. 15 min to central London.
space: My home is beautiful and my visitors say it has a lovely tranquil feel to it. The kitchen is fully equipped, it’s bright and the garden is the perfect spot to relax, weather permitting. There is broadband wi-fi throughout the house. The bedroom is lovely and bright, and there are fresh towels and bed linen. I give my guests their own room key during their stay. Please be aware that you will be sharing the property with the owner or with other guests. The bedroom has lockable doors for security.

There are a wide variety of top restaurants, cafes, cinema screens as well as designer and high street shops within the new London Designer Outlet, which makes the area extremely attractive to new visitors and shopping lovers. 15 min to central London. My home is beautiful and my visitors say it has a lovely tranquil feel to it. The kitchen is fully equipped, it’s bright and the garden is the perfect spot to relax, weather permitting. There is broadband wi-fi throughout the house. The bedroom is lovely and bright, and there are fresh towels and bed linen. I give my guests their own room key during their stay. Please be aware that you will be sharing the property with the owner or with other guests. The bedroom has lockable doors for security. My guests have access to the bed
neighborhood_overview: London is a multicultural melting pot that has built up a reputation as the most cosmopolitan city on Earth. Time permitting, you can expect to come across more than 300 languages and more than 270 nationalities. From football events to the biggest music artists in the World, Wembley is an awe inspiring stadium and is just one stop away from the house by underground. The SSE Arena, Wembley (formerly known as Wembley Arena) is the UK’s most iconic entertainment venue. With a rich history that goes back to its days as the Empire Pool and Sports Arena, the building has played host to numerous events including the 1948 and 2012 Olympic Games. All that shopping does build up an appetite! Take a break and enjoy some of the best cafes and restaurants in Wembley at London Designer Outlet. Meet with friends for a light lunch, relax with a Frappuccino between browsing our outlet stores or enjoy an evening out at one of our top restaurants with a selection of world cuisines. In 1995 the far south
notes: The house is located in London’s zone 3 ( zone 6 being the furthest away from central London). If you are looking for a room under the Big Ben please keep looking. Please note that the zones do not apply to bus travel. You can travel by bus all over London (zones 1-6) with any Travelcard. You are staying in a friendly house, not a hotel. Please treat the house as you would treat your own home.
transit: Neasden underground station is a 4-minute walk away, it takes 15-20 min. to get to the city centre (5 min. to Wembley Stadium and the SSE Arena, Wembley in the opposite direction) The Jubilee line operates 24 hours throughout Friday and Saturday night. Bus routes run 24 hours 7 days a week.
access: My guests have access to the bedroom they are staying in, dining area, kitchen, bathroom and garden. I also provide free fiber optic internet access.
interaction: I love chatting with my guests over a cup of tea or coffee, although I’m also mindful of their privacy. Due to my very busy schedule, I don’t always have the chance to meet all my guests face to face. If you need to see me personally, please let me know. I have lived in London for the past 14 years and I thoroughly enjoy helping with first-hand advice about the city and suggesting itineraries.
house_rules: No unregistered guest are allowed. No Smoking. No dirty shoes in the house. No candles or incense. If you cook, please do clean up after yourself. Kindly keep the noise down after 10:00 pm. Please shut all windows when you leave the house. Please be considerate and aware of safety and security, but most of all enjoy your stay!
host_about:
My name is Julian and I’m an architect who loves to meet people and travel the world. Over the last few few years, my entrepreneurial spirit has led me to become an Airbnb Host and I’ve already hosted thousands of travellers from all over the world in my properties. I also run an online language school called Languages at Home where we help people of all backgrounds to learn and improve their language skills with live tuition with qualified native speakers.  
Before booking with me, please make sure you read the reviews of my previous guests and feel free to contact me if you have any questions about my listings.

It is a direct Tube ride from Heathrow Airport & St Pancras International Train Station via Piccadilly line, so no need to switch lines. It has great bus connections, the closest stop is only about 12 steps.
space: It is a medium sized bedroom, with great natural light and dimmable artifical lights too. The Terrace is accessable directly from your room for your enjoyment at any time.

An great selection of Pubs for a drink or a feed, and all within walking distance.  As well as being walking distance to some of the best museums in london and within a short tube ride to Buckingham Palace, Westminster and the heart of some of London's most famous tourist sights.

And within walking distance of  Kensington Palace (23 mins),  Royal Albert Hall (20 mins),  Kensington Gardens (22 mins),  Natural History Museum (18 mins),  Holland Park (14 mins),  High Street Kensington (13 mins),  Victoria and Albert Museum (22 mins).

name: Great location, bright flat, central London
summary: Hi there! Our home is a lovely, very sunny and comfortable flat. Location is certainly its major feature as it's 5 minutes walk from Angel tube station, 10 minutes in the bus from Kings Cross and 15 from Farringdon Station!
description: Hi there! Our home is a lovely, very sunny and comfortable flat. Location is certainly its major feature as it's 5 minutes walk from Angel tube station, 10 minutes in the bus from Kings Cross and 15 from Farringdon Station! You will be able to access the whole flat. The comfortable bedroom with a kingsize double bed with a tempur matress. The living room with a big sofa, desk and an interesting selection of books. The kitchen with all the amenities you need and a vintage table, washing-dryer maching, dishwasher, etc. Me or my husband will be able to help you in anything you need through out your stay. We live an hour away. What I love the most about living here is that I can get anywhere by foot. From 2 big supermarkets and a medium size 24 hs one, a farmers market every weekend, healthy shops, many famous clothes shops, restaurants for every taste and  from many nationalities, a big VUE cinema and a Cult Independent one, cool streets with vintage style market and shops, to a beautiful
neighborhood_overview: What I love the most about living here is that I can get anywhere by foot. From 2 big supermarkets and a medium size 24 hs one, a farmers market every weekend, healthy shops, many famous clothes shops, restaurants for every taste and  from many nationalities, a big VUE cinema and a Cult Independent one, cool streets with vintage style market and shops, to a beautiful canal where you can walk every morning to clear your mind. There are all so many coffee shops and resto bars, and obviously great pubs from the range of Organic food and ales to the most old fashion local pubs you can imagine. Great for a Pub Crawl! We are also near Old Street and Shorditch, if you fancy a night our or some dancing. Exmouth market is also 5 minutes walk away with lots of other options to eat and buy. If you are a the cultural type as me. You would love to know that the flat is 5 minutes walk from the Sadlers Wells and 10 from the Barbican Centre. And if you like Art galleries you can pop in the bus 4 for t
transit: The flat is so central and well connected that it's so easy to get everywhere fairly quickly. We are 5 minutes walk from Angel tube station Northern line, it takes 1 stop to be in Kings Cross St Pancras station. There you can combine with all the Northern, Circle, Hammersmith and City, Metropolitan, Piccadilly and Victoria underground lines, plus many trains and the Eurostar.  We are 10 minutes walk to Barbican Station and 15 to Farrigndon Station. We are also walking distance to central london, Sadlers Wells Theatre, Barbican Theatre, Museum of London, a Shopping mall, Cinemas, Lots of pubs and cafes, vintage markets, farmers market and the amazing Regents Canal that can take you until Greenwich.  We also have convenient buses 24/7 so no limitation to come home at any time!
access: You will be able to access the whole flat. The comfortable bedroom with a kingsize double bed with a tempur matress. The living room with a big sofa, desk and an interesting selection of books. The kitchen with all the amenities you need and a vintage table, washing-dryer maching, dishwasher, etc.
interaction: Me or my husband will be able to help you in anything you need through out your stay. We live an hour away.
