name: Four Bed Victorian House
summary: A beautiful, extremely spacious and bright 4 bedroom victorian house situated in a very peaceful residential street, ideally located in Zone 2. It is a short walk to Brockley station (Overground, train to London bridge in only 8 minutes!) and Nunhead station (direct trains to Victoria station, Blackfriars and King’s cross  stations) and is close to cafes, bars, restaurants & local shops. It is ideal for couples, business travellers, families (with or without kids)
space: The house is very comfortable and nearly all completely newly refurbished to an extremely high spec, with a top of the rate kitchen and bathroom. It is ideal for 6 people to enjoy central London and all its tourist attractions in beautiful surroundings. Ground floor: 1 lounge 1 bedroom 1 extremely spacious kitchen/dinner 1 garden 1 toilet 1st floor: 2 double bedrooms 1 extra large double bedroom 1 very large bathroom with walking shower and bath 1 toilet

It is very easy to park. The transp
neighborhood_overview: Situated on the door step of Telegraph Hill park, which offers magnificent views over London, our house is nested between Nunhead and Brockley. This residential and arty area offers plenty of restaurants and bars (The Gantry, The Orchard, The famous Rivoli ballroom, Masala Wala etc) and cafes (Noak, Hill station in the park, Brocca, Browns, Pistachios in Hilly Fields park) and incredible transport links (within a few minutes walk to 2 stations). The trendy New cross area is also few minutes walk down the Hill if you wish to experience great nights out (The Rose pub, The New Cross house, Curzon cinema in Goldsmith University, the London Particular…). Brockley is a hidden gem ideally situated in Zone 2, with a relaxed, family friendly and safe atmosphere. It has many beautiful parks, a good selection of shops to buy your groceries, as well as the funky Brockley market (Website hidden by Airbnb) and Telegraph hill farmers market.  ‘Nunhead, According to legend, takes its name from the nog
notes: 4 nights minimum stay in August. Thanks Free and very easy parking on our street
transit: There are two stations within a few minutes walk of the house: Brockley Station & Nunhead Station. Brockley station is on the National Rail and London Overground networks. It takes approx 8 min to get to London Bridge by National Rail; the London Overground links directly to the Tube at Canary Wharf. Brockley Station is also easily accessible from Gatwick Airport (1 change, 45 min). Nunhead Station is on the national Rail network, with direct links into Victoria Station and London Blackfriars. The 343 and the 484 busses go from a bus stop at the end of the road and take you to central town or to the vibrant arty scene of Peckham or foodie and trendy East Dulwich in 15 minutes. There is also a main bus stop in Brockley high street, where you can take a bus into the West End or the City (171, 172).
access: There is free parking on our street. It is very easy to park. The transport links are also very convenient with 2 stations 10 mins away. Access to Gatwick airport is only 45 mins by trains.  I or my partner will be here to welcome you. If we are away we will give you all the instructions to get the key form the coded master locker.
house_rules: No party allowed. Thanks
host_about:
My name is Maud. I am French but I have been living in London for 17 years with my British partner and our daughter.
I love Arts, literature, cinema, music and travelling. 
I am happy to share my knowledge of London with you if you have any questions.

name: Superb stylish flat in easy-to-reach Battersea
summary: My place is really close to the Battersea Power Station; to Vauxhall and 5 min drive to gorgeous Clapham Common.  It's literally on Wandsworth Road, and close to The Lost Angel, The Victoria, Priory Arms, and Capitan Corelli.  My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids).
space: The flat is superbly located for easy access to Central London, Battersea Power Station and Clapham.  It's literally on Wandsworth Road with its buzzing nature and conveniences.  All appliances are state of the art, including: - Double Oven (Grill and fan) NEFF - Microwave/Grill NEFF - Dishwasher - Toaster - Kettle and Cafetiere - Crokery and Cutlery - Garden with Cctv for your security and safety - Double glazed windows and French doors to the garden The bathroom has a rain-forest head shower and hand shower; it also includes a sensor activated heated mirror (with lighting and plug for shaving machine or electric toothbrush).
description: My place is really close to the Battersea Power Station; to Vauxhall and 5 min drive to gorgeous Clapham Common.  It's literally on Wandsworth Road, and close to The Lost Angel, The Victoria, Priory Arms, and Capitan Corelli.  My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, and families (with kids). The flat is superbly located for easy access to Central London, Battersea Power Station and Clapham.  It's literally on Wandsworth Road with its buzzing nature and conveniences.  All appliances are state of the art, including: - Double Oven (Grill and fan) NEFF - Microwave/Grill NEFF - Dishwasher - Toaster - Kettle and Cafetiere - Crokery and Cutlery - Garden with Cctv for your security and safety - Double glazed windows and French doors to the garden The bathroom has a rain-forest head shower and hand shower; it also includes a sensor activated heated mirror (with lighting and plug for shaving machine or electric toothbrush). I can definitely be of help when around to
neighborhood_overview: There are many shops nearby from small grocery stores, to barbers and hairdressers to drycleaners.  2 min down the road there are a couple of delis and coffee shops with great coffee. If you fancy a bite to eat outside, we have a bunch of really authentic Portuguese restaurants serving fresh and tasty food. Clapham Common is only a short trip away with the an ever increasing list of options to suit any palate. If you don't feel like staying in and do not want to cook, there are a few good takeaways that deliver to the flat, including options from Deliveroo and Just Eat. There is a gorgeous park across the street, called Larkhall Park.  It features fields, walking tracks, basketball, football courts, outdoor Gym and two newly refurbished and well-lit tennis courts. If you feel like venturing out or doing some exercise, go to Battersea Park for a jog or cycle.  If you have little ones (and not so little), they will love the GO APE experience or the ZOO there!
notes: The flat is in a building block with regulated parking.  If you drive, there will be parking permits upon request (at cost). The flat is next to Wandsworth Road, which is a buzzing main road in London.  It has double-glazed windows and French doors into the garden.  Outside the property there is a docking station for city bikes.  You can learn more about them on the Transport for London website.
transit: The nearest stations are Wandsworth Road, Stockwell (Northern and Victoria Line) and Vauxhall (Victoria Line). Outside the flat you can get buses 77 and 87 to Westminster (for Parliament, Big Ben and the Abbey);Trafalgar Square, Waterloo,  and the West End.  The other end goes to Clapham Junction.
interaction: I can definitely be of help when around to answer any questions and give suggestions about your visit to London
house_rules: I expect guests to behave with politeness and consideration towards the host and the flat.  I expect guests to be honest and upfront about the purpose of their visit and the number of people staying in the property. Should things change before arrival, I ask my guests to communicate these promptly and without delay. Any misleading statements would result in an immediate cancellation of the booking without notice. For couples it is assumed that only one bedroom is going to be used given financial and environmental costs of laundry.
host_about: I love travelling and meeting new places and new cultures whilst also going back to those I enjoying most.

name: Bright & airy DoubleBed with EnSuite in Zone 2!
summary: The aparment is very spacious and just refurbished! Served by 24h security, it is ideally located in a vibrant area, only a 8min walk from Finsbury park tube station (you can be in oxford circus in 20min& most airports have connections to the Victoria and Piccadily lines that pass through it). It is also very well served by 24h buses (Camden Town is 20 min away,Trafalgar sq. 35). It is great for families, friends, professionals and football fans as it is only 10min from the Emirates Stadium.
space: There are two double rooms one of which is equiped with a comfortably sized En Suite with a large shower. The main Bathroom is fitted with a large bath. Both rooms have lots of storage space and have been fitted with new beautiful timber floor! The Living room Kithcen have an open plan layout and are very airy and full of light in the mornings and afternoons.

neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbourhood! Our flat is located in one of London's most vibrant and multicultural areas, with people from different parts of the world living close to each other. The best thing about this? The numerous restaurants of different cuisines that you can find with just a 15 minute walk from here!
transit: Our flat couldn't be better connected. Finsbury park station is just a 8 minute walk away and is served by the very fast and well connected Victoria line (it goes to Victoria station which has trains to Gatwick airport and Tottenham Hale station which has trains to Stansted). Via Victoria you can also be to London's most central station, Oxford Circus, in just 9 minutes! Apart from the Victoria Line, Finsbury park is served by the Piccadily line which goes past some of the most popular locations in London (Covent Garden, Piccadily Circus, Holborn for the British museum and many more) and also goes all the way to Heathrow airport! If you prefer to stay above ground, we got you covered. The 91 bus stops just in front of our building and will take you directly to Trafalgar Sq in about 45 minutes while taking you through the most central parts of the town! Other buses nearby include 29 which will take you to the buzzing Camden Town in just 15 minutes and many more!
interaction: Although both me and my partner do not live in the area, we are always accessible via messages which we try to answer to asap. We will also be more than happy to help our visitors and give tips about where to go so they can get the best experience out of London!!

name: Cosy Room w/ Shared Kitchen in Bethnal Green!
summary: Based in high quality student accommodation, our property is located in the heart of Bethnal Green, known for its vibrant culture, diverse cuisine and bustling bars!  You'll benefit from a range of common areas, including a games room (with ping pong & pool), TV area and an incredible roof terrace. Just 3 minutes from Bethnal Green Station, you'll have access to Central London in moments.  Nearby, theres plenty of green space, with both Bethnal Green Gardens & Museum Gardens seconds away!
space: What To Expect: * Beautiful 12 sqm flat with modern furnishings and dedicated workspace * Ensuite bathroom * Spacious communal kitchen space, fully equipped with appliances and utensils (Kitchen spaces may vary) * Amazing communal areas: Common Room (with TV, ping pong, pool) work area and ample rooftop space. * A pay-to-use laundry room * 1 small double bed with hotel standard bedding * A 24 hour reception desk will check you in on arrival  * The apartment will be professionally cleaned before you arrive * An amazing location, within walking distance of Victoria Park! * Minutes from Bethnal Green Underground Station, served by the Central line. From here it’s only:   -22 mins to Notting Hill Gate  -5 mins to Westfield Shopping Centre, Stratford   -13 mins to Oxford Circus

neighborhood_overview: Bethnal Green is a true East End gem. While it has developed considerably in recent years, it still retains an authentic East End feel. You're sure to feel right at home here, with a plethora of trendy bars, high street shops and restaurants, along with nearby Shoreditch, Columbia Road Flower Market and the green open spaces of Victoria Park. Its no wonder people love Bethnal Green so much!
notes: • Do you have free WiFi? Yes we have super fast reliable WiFi ! We will give you WiFi instructions when you check in. • Do you provide linen and towels? Yes all fresh, pressed bed linen and double size towels are provided.  • Is there a private bathroom? You will have access to a private en suite bathroom.  • Are children able to stay at the property? No, unfortunately we are not able to accommodate anyone under 18 at this property!  • Is there washing and drying facilities? There is a paid laundry room in the building, once you download the Circuit app on your phone you can pay via card/ (Hidden by Airbnb) .  • Is smoking allowed? Strictly NO smoking in the apartments and all ancillary terraces and/or common parts. If you want to smoke, you must completely leave the building. You will automatically forfeit your deposit if you are found smoking on the premises.  • Is there parking? Unfortunately, there is no parking available for this apartment. • Please note we will check the passport
transit: Bethnal Green Underground Station provides  services on the Central Line. From here its only: -13 mins to Oxford Circus  -22 mins to Notting Hill Gate  -5 mins to Westfield Shopping Centre, Stratford  Nearby, Cambridge Heath Station provides services on the Overground. However, if you prefer the scenic route, theres a number of bus routes that can get you in and around central London!
access: You will enjoy your own private room with an en suite bathroom. However, you'll also have access to a shared kitchen within your apartment block and the rest of the communal areas in the building (Common Room, Laundry Room, Outdoor Rooftop Area).
interaction: There is a reception area that can help you with anything you need!

name: Large private room with a view in Stoke Newington
summary: Clean and spacious private room in a homely apartment, with a modern kitchen, warm living room and all with a great view.  Stoke Newington has a great atmosphere with restaurants, bars and shops all in walking distance.  Rectory Road train station is on the door step giving quick access to central London and the overground/underground network.
space: Our home is a purpose built split level flat on the second and third floor boasting 1000sqft all recently renovated with wooden floors, a modern kitchen and new gas central heating boiler. The large double glazed windows on the north and south side provide lots of natural light and keep the flat well insulated during the winter and can be opened nice and wide during the summer for a cool breeze. Your room is a good size with a soft double bed, chest of draws, closet to hang clothes a desk and chairs. There is high speed wi-fi available throughout the property.

We will be around to recommend the best places to go in the area from cafe's, parks, pu
transit: 10sec walk: is the train station, 2 convenient stores open late and an internet cafe selling homemade cakes and pretty good coffee.  5min walk: Stoke Newington high street is just at the end of our road with a choice of supermarkets, bars, restaurants, trendy internet cafe's and even a 24hour bakery. 10min walk: Super trendy Church street with furniture and clothing shops, Wholefoods and a great wealth of pubs and bars. 20min walk: or a short bus ride and you're in Dalston which is very at night with bars and underground clubs. We have 2 local markets just a 5min walk on the weekends.  Saturday 10-4 is the farmers market selling locally grown produce, fried breakfasts, foraged mushroom sandwiches, cakes, coffees and even unpasteurised milk and butter directly from the farmer.  Saturday 10.30-4.30 is the Hackney Downs Vegan Market selling delicious foods, beverages and arts and crafts.
interaction: We will be around to recommend the best places to go in the area from cafe's, parks, pubs, restaurants, vegan friendly and travel plans in and around London.
host_about:
Hi! I'm in my early thirties and from Norway. I have recently graduated as a yoga teacher and work as a freelancer in post-production photography. I love keeping fit, home cooking and brewing kombucha.
I miss Norway, though I love London and all the events and taster classes the sprawling capital has to offer. 

My boyfriend Ken is from Oxford. He’s lived in London now for around 10 years and loving it. He's an easy going sales professional working in the city and loves cycling, drinking coffee and soaking in the atmosphere of all the independent pubs and restaurants East London has in abundance. He also enjoys snowboarding, going to festivals and meeting new people. He's passionate about cars, wine and most movies from the 80s.

name: 20 minutes to central London with cycling option
summary: The room is in a beautiful Victorian house in Stratford, just five minutes from Maryland station. I love Stratford which has been transformed by hosting the 2012 Olympics. It has Westfield shopping centre (they say the largest shopping centre in Europe); restaurants, cinemas and theatre, the Olympic and Victoria parks, beautiful canals and walks, as well as all the bustle and excitement of East London. Stratford is a major travel centre and you can get to central london in under 20 minutes
space: The room is in a lovely, well-maintained and clean Victorian house. There are other rooms available so if you want to come as a group please let us know. Cycling around here is beautiful and often off-road (parks, canals, cycle paths, quiet roads) and for those interested we can provide any of advice (free), maps (free), bikes for adults and children (£10 per day) and a tour (£40 for trip in morning or afternoon including bike, helmet and gloves)
description: The room is in a beautiful Victorian house in Stratford, just five minutes from Maryland station. I love Stratford which has been transformed by hosting the 2012 Olympics. It has Westfield shopping centre (they say the largest shopping centre in Europe); restaurants, cinemas and theatre, the Olympic and Victoria parks, beautiful canals and walks, as well as all the bustle and excitement of East London. Stratford is a major travel centre and you can get to central london in under 20 minutes The room is in a lovely, well-maintained and clean Victorian house. There are other rooms available so if you want to come as a group please let us know. Cycling around here is beautiful and often off-road (parks, canals, cycle paths, quiet roads) and for those interested we can provide any of advice (free), maps (free), bikes for adults and children (£10 per day) and a tour (£40 for trip in morning or afternoon including bike, helmet and gloves) As well as your room you are welcome to use the kitche
neighborhood_overview: Stratford has the Olympic park (home of 2012 Olympics), Westfield shopping centre (the largest in Europe), the Theatre Royal, many pubs and restaurants and fantastic travel links all over London.
notes: We don't have a TV to maintain a sense of calm in the house. However if you want to watch you can use a computer as the house has a TV licence and broadband.
transit: Train, buses and underground The closest train station, Maryland, is five minutes walk away and from here you can be in Liverpool Street station, part of the financial centre of the city in eleven minutes. Stratford Station is about 15 minutes walk (or a short bus ride) and from here you can take trains, tubes and buses all over London. Tubes now run through the night on the central line to Stratford on friday and saturday nights. Parking You can park directly outside the house. It is free sundays. On monday to saturday I can provide you with a permit for all day (10 pounds) or you can stay for two hour blocks at 3 pounds per two hours. The two hour short stays are  suspended on event days in the Olympic stadium. These are one or two a month mostly on saturdays. Bicycles Or you can rent a bike and take advantage of the cycle routes around Stratford and throughout the city. For example you can cycle from my house to Tower Bridge in 40 minutes all along canals and quiet roads. Airports A
access: As well as your room you are welcome to use the kitchen diner, the garden and the two bathrooms. If you wish please join us for chats in the kitchen diner or garden.
interaction: Please feel free to ask if you have questions and join us if you want company. We love to meet new people and share experiences.
house_rules: Respect the house and the people in it by being clean and tidy, and quiet in the early morning before 8.00am and at night after 10pm
host_about: I live in the house with my partner Elsa and my daughter. Since I took up  cycling I've discovered a whole new side and love of London - now when friends come and stay with me and I take them on cycling tours they tell me how much they love it and why didn't I show them this before. The truth is I never knew it before. Anyway this has inspired me to offer cycling advice and tours as part of your experience so you too can discover this side to London.

name: Incredible 4bed 3bath house w/garden in Wimbledon
summary: Welcome to our home! Our 4 bedroom house, located in the beautiful area of Wimbledon, is perfect for those travelling with children. The neighbourhood is safe and family-friendly with plenty to do on your doorstep. With the nearest station just a 6 minute walk away, exploring further afield could hardly be easier.  Our home boasts a large green lawn and patio, with outdoor seating and a trampoline for the little ones to enjoy. We hope you enjoy your stay!

neighborhood_overview: Wimbledon is probably best known for its famous tennis club, however, there are so many other reasons to visit beautiful Wimbledon. This well-kept neighbourhood boasts a wide range of shops to discover; from high street brands to small boutiques. If shopping isn’t your idea of fun, why not take a trip to the New Wimbledon theatre to see a show perfect for a romantic evening or a day out with the family alike.  After a relaxing day spent on Wimbledon common you can stroll across to the beautiful Buddhist temple or visit the local history museum for an educational day out. Wimbledon boasts a wide array of fantastic eateries including The Ivy, Sticks ‘n’ Sushi and Holy Smoke where you can enjoy outstanding food whilst soaking up the laid-back ambience. Wimbledon is home to great pubs and bars so if you like having a drink with friends, you are not short of options. The list is endless but some of our favourites include the Dog & Fox, the Rose & Crown and the Crooked Billet.
transit: Wimbledon Broadway is the nearest station to the property, just a 6 minute walk away. This connects you to the London sites in no time at all. My property is only a 5 minute drive from the Wimbledon Tennis Championships so the location could not be better!
access: Guests have access to the entire property.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-lets management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.

name: Bright and clean double bedroom in Wandsworth Town
summary: Private double bedroom in a light, new 7th floor flat in Wandsworth Town near parks, shops, bars and restaurants. The room has a comfortable double bed, TV, desk, and a chest of drawers, with access to a shared bathroom, kitchen, lounge,  and balcony. Your hosts are a young professional couple and a cat who will be here to greet you and answer any questions you have. The River Thames is just meters away, train station less than 10 minute walk, frequent trains to Central London take 15 minutes.
space: This guest double guest bedroom is very clean and comfortable and we hope the whole apartment is modern whilst being homely and relaxed. You will have a desk with an extra screen, office chair and plenty of power sockets. The bedroom TV has it's own Amazon Firestick so you can watch a selection of TV and films. The kitchen has everything you might need including a coffee machine, microwave, dishwasher, oven and hobs and you are welcome to use all the cooking utensils, as well as the washing machine. You will be sharing the living areas and bathroom with us your hosts and our cat who is called Mufassa. For outside spaces we have a balcony off the living room which gets the sun from midday until sunset, a large communal garden accessed from the ground floor of the building, and Wandsworth Park is less than 5 minutes walk away. This area is great for it's community feel whilst being in Zone 2 (close to the center) of Central London.  Wandsworth Town itself has lots of places to explore in

neighborhood_overview: We are lucky to live minutes away from the Thames river for beautiful walks and scenery. Wandsworth Town itself has lots of places to explore including cafes, bars, restaurants, shops, a shopping centre, parks, and a cinema, all within 10 minutes walk of the apartment. We love this area and will be happy to recommend some places to go!  We have Hire Bikes on our road which you can take to explore nearby areas such as Putney, Richmond Park, Battersea, Clapham, Fulham or Chelsea, all within 20 minutes cycle from the apartment. Wandsworth Town station is only a 10 minute walk away with trains to Central London.
transit: Everything you may want locally is in walking distance. There is free parking on surrounding roads (but they get busy so cannot always guarantee a space!). It is easy to travel to Central London with trains from Wandsworth Town station every 6 minutes going to: - Clapham Junction (3 minutes, change for Overground tube line),  - Vauxhall (10 minutes, change for Victoria Line) - London Waterloo (15 minutes, change for Bakerloo, Northern, Jubilee and Waterloo & City lines)
access: You will have private use of the guest double bedroom and shared use of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. You will have your own key so can come and go at times that suit you. You will also be able to use the communal garden at any time. We both work full time and so you are likely to have the place to yourselves during weekdays.
interaction: We will generally be around in the evenings and weekends to help you out with anything you may need. We can recommend many different things to do and places to eat or drink in our area or anywhere in central London. We love meeting new people and are sometimes around to have a drink or hang out with if that's what you want.
house_rules: Although we try our best to be very flexible with check in times, there may be some times that we are unavailable to check you in (e.g. unsociable hours). Please message with roughly what time you are planning on arriving before confirming your booking so that we can make sure we can arrange to greet you. Thank you.

name: Fantastic four bedroom central house
summary: Spacious 4 bedroom duplex , set over 2 floors, with a large living space and outdoor area, fully equipped kitchen.  Excellent location, 5 mins from Kennington and Oval tube stations, 20 minutes walk from the river Thames, just opposite Parliament.
space: This is a fantastic, spacious property, ideal for a group.  It has 4 bedrooms, 2 double, 2 single, with 2 bathrooms, a large living area, and outdoor space.  The location is ideal for those who want to be close to central London.
description: Spacious 4 bedroom duplex , set over 2 floors, with a large living space and outdoor area, fully equipped kitchen.  Excellent location, 5 mins from Kennington and Oval tube stations, 20 minutes walk from the river Thames, just opposite Parliament. This is a fantastic, spacious property, ideal for a group.  It has 4 bedrooms, 2 double, 2 single, with 2 bathrooms, a large living area, and outdoor space.  The location is ideal for those who want to be close to central London. Guests can access the whole flat. Kennington is a neighbourhood who want to be close to the centre of London, as it is walking distance.  It is a mixture of modern and Victorian properties, with traditional pubs tucked away, some great restaurants on the main street, and easy access into central London. The house is 5 minutes walk from Kennington and Oval tube stations, which is 5-10 minutes journey into central London.  There are also direct buses into the centre of town.

name: Sun soaked designer 1 bed in Covent Garden
summary: With a job that has me on a plane more than half the year, my designer-decorated urban retreat can be your home away from home in the heart of the West End, on the border of Covent Garden and Soho, a short stroll to Piccadilly Circus, Oxford Street, Leicester Square, Theatre Land, Covent Garden Piazza and much, much more. Let's talk about how we can make your stay a great memory -- start with my reviews. I look forward to hearing from you.
space: My one bed is in a charming pre-war building, right smack dab in the heart of central London. Walk five mins in any direction and you’ll find yourself in Covent Garden, Soho, Theatre Town or Leicester Square; The British Museum, National Gallery and Oxford Circus are just three of the many attraction you can reach in minutes by foot. For the convenience, the ambience and the energy, I love living here and I’m confident you will too!

For the convenience, the ambience and the energy, I love living here and I’m confident you will too!
house_rules: - Please keep in mind that I live here - this is not a hotel or permanent vacation let. So, basically, I just ask that people are normal. You know, treat my home the way you'd like others to treat yours.   I want you to feel tranquil when you come from home for the day, so I do my best to keep it relatively clean and tidy. Please help me by doing the same.     I will send you a document with information about the apartment, building and neighborhood: please read that in full before arrival.    If you smoke, please enjoy your cigarettes on one the terraces and not in the house. If guests are found to be smoking in the house there will be a £500 fine.   Because the apartment is peaceful and tranquil in general, I don't allow parties, which I define as any gathering of more than four people.  Events, photo and film shoots are strictly prohibited without prior permission. If permission is granted, these will incur an additional fee (usually between £500 and £2000 per day, depending on the

summary: 1 Double bedroom with private en-suite in a contemporary 2 bedroom flat, located in East London area, close to Mile End and Bow Road tube stations ( both in walking distance). The flat is located in a nice residential area with plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants nearby Victoria Park.
space: The room is part of a 2 bed flat which will be shared with the hosts and their cat. The living and kitchen will be shared. There is coffee and tea available. The bedroom is very spacious and bright with a minimalist decor, has a modern private en-suite with shower, a good size comfortable double bed, plenty of storage.
description: 1 Double bedroom with private en-suite in a contemporary 2 bedroom flat, located in East London area, close to Mile End and Bow Road tube stations ( both in walking distance). The living and kitchen will be shared. There is coffee and tea available. The bedroom is very spacious and bright with a minimalist decor, has a modern private en-suite with shower, a good size comfortable double bed, plenty of storage. Guests have their own private bathroom and can access kitchen and living room for tea and coffee, relaxing and reading. We will be able to meet the guest on their arrival, explain house rules and give them tips and info about London and about the area. notes: We have a friendly cat called Lily

name: Beautiful flat in hipster East End
summary: Modern apartment with every amenity overlooking beautiful Regents canal. 5 minute walk from Victoria park and the center of hipster life in East London. Return home to a quiet and luxurious apartment with everything you could ever need and a huge outdoor area where you can enjoy your breakfast or just chill sipping a drink on a lazy afternoon.
space: Modern apartment - feel relaxed despite being in the middle of one of London's hippest neighborhoods, Bethnal Green. We are very lucky to call this place home and look forward to letting you experience the apartment and the local area which is full of so many hidden artsy gems, markets, parks, pubs and restaurants which East London is known for. The space Large living area and open plan kitchen.  Luxurious leather couch and 50 inch TV with surround sound. Kitchen has every utensil you could ask for if you decide to go to Broadway market to pick up some fresh produce and cook up a feast for dinner. Huge bedroom and cloud like bed with the finest Egyptian cotton bed linen. Hotel-like bathroom complete with Aesop soap. Living area opens up to our garden area where we have a table and chairs. You can enjoy your breakfast, dinner or drinks here, looking over the Regents canal bustling and full of life.
description: Modern apartment with every amenity overlooking beautiful Regents canal. 5 minute walk from Victoria park and the center of hipster life in East London. Return home to a quiet and luxurious apartment with everything you could ever need and a huge outdoor area where you can enjoy your breakfast or just chill sipping a drink on a lazy afternoon. Modern apartment - feel relaxed despite being in the middle of one of London's hippest neighborhoods, Bethnal Green. We are very lucky to call this place home and look forward to letting you experience the apartment and the local area which is full of so many hidden artsy gems, markets, parks, pubs and restaurants which East London is known for. The space Large living area and open plan kitchen.  Luxurious leather couch and 50 inch TV with surround sound. Kitchen has every utensil you could ask for if you decide to go to Broadway market to pick up some fresh produce and cook up a feast for dinner. Huge bedroom and cloud like bed with the finest E
neighborhood_overview: We love living on Regents Canal and we are sure you will too. It's an incredible place with so much natural beauty. More importantly the canal is home to a smorgasbord of canal boats where people live, party and enjoy their lives. So when you look out over the canal there is always something interesting going on. Last weekend there was a Morris dancing party that randomly popped up! We are a 5-minute walk from Victoria park. We are a 15-minute walk from Broadway market which is without doubt the best and hippest market in London at the moment. You simply have to spend the afternoon there, where you can shop for fresh produce, grab some delicious freshly cooked food and then have a beer at one of the many pubs along the road. From there it's another 5 minutes and you have hit Columbia Road where the famous flower market takes place every Sunday. Well worth a visit to meet the cockney men and women selling their finest. We are lucky to live only 2 minutes away from one of the best pubs i
transit: Lots of great must-see London spots are within walking distance from our place. There is the bus number 8, which takes you into the city if you don't feel like walking though. The tube is an 8 minute walk away at Mile End or Bethnal Green tube station. We are 1 stop on the tube from Liverpool Street station. We ride our bikes everywhere and there is bike hire station just outside our house which is perfect for exploring London with.
access: There is a concierge, Mark, who is a lovely guy and can help with any random queries you may have. The apartment has its own garden spot which joins a large communal area overlooking the canal. The outdoor area is shared by only 3 other apartments so it's practically your own space.
interaction: We will leave the keys with the concierge, Mark. But will be happy to speak over the phone should you have any questions about the apartment or the area. We can certainly provide you with tips for exploring this side of London, as well as other parts of this incredible city. We have also prepared a short booklet which outlines everything to do with the apartment and our tips for hidden gems around the area.
host_about: We are a Zurich-based couple who moved here from London not long ago but we totally have fallen in love with Zurich and beautiful Switzerland. We love discovering new places, cafes, restaurants, bars, and finding new things to do. More than anything however, we love the snow, the mountains, and adventure.

name: IV Brick Lane Shoreditch Apartment
summary: This third floor one bedroom apartment has a private balcony and has a very light, open feeling. Found just off Brick Lane, you are close to Brick Lane Market and Columbia Road Flower Market. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and families. It's walking distance to get bus and train links.
space: This apartment is located on the third floor of an apartment building just a few steps from Brick Lane and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street Station. Found right in the heart of Shoreditch, you will enjoy local cafes, design studios, galleries, cute shops and restaurants all at your doorstep. It can easily fit a small family. It comfortably sleeps 2 guests, but can sleep up to 4 guests using the sofa bed in the living room.
description: This third floor one bedroom apartment has a private balcony and has a very light, open feeling. Found just off Brick Lane, you are close to Brick Lane Market and Columbia Road Flower Market. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and families. It's walking distance to get bus and train links. This apartment is located on the third floor of an apartment building just a few steps from Brick Lane and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street Station. Found right in the heart of Shoreditch, you will enjoy local cafes, design studios, galleries, cute shops and restaurants all at your doorstep. It can easily fit a small family. It comfortably sleeps 2 guests, but can sleep up to 4 guests using the sofa bed in the living room. It has a double bedroom, a bathroom, a double fold out sofa bed and a full kitchen with a fridge, oven, plates, cups, utensils, toaster, kettle, TV and Free wifi  - We provide 1 Towel per guest  -  Bedding for the sofa beds will be provid
neighborhood_overview: Londoners and Tourists flock to Shoreditch for its Street Art, Street Food and Galleries. It has great night life, cafes and boutiques. Every Sunday is Brick Lane Market, and Columbia Road Flower Market. Box park is right at your door step, which has plenty shopping and food choices! Shoreditch High street overground station is just a 5 minute walk away.
notes: We consider infants to be guests, so please include them as 'children' when making a booking. *** FAQ's *** Q - Is the area safe? A - Yes, There are always lots of people around and it has a very 20s-40s vibe about it. Q - What Time is Check in?  A - 3:00pm - you will collect your key from Bell Boi coffee shop, 104 Sclater Street, E1 6HR Q - Will the apartment be ready to check in at 3pm? A - If you have not provided an approximate arrival time, we cannot guarantee that the apartment will be ready by 3pm. We will have it ready for the time you have specified that you are arriving. Q - Can I check in early? A - Unfortunately not. Often there is a guest the night before and we can't kick them out early. Q - Can I drop my bags there early?  A - No, but you can store your luggage at Bell Boi for £5 per locker, per day. Q - Do I have to walk up stairs A - Yes, your apartment is on the third floor. Q- Can I check in Late. A- Yes we have a self check in system after 10pm, however we may not b
transit: It is situated in ZONE 1 which is the centre of the city. Near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. This is the City Centre officially. However, we are in the East End, NOT the West End as most tourists think (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st). It is still zone 1 but you will have to catch a short train or bus ride to the West End. The Closest Transport is  OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Liverpool St Station OR Old St Station BUS #8 a few steps away, takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) PARKING I don't have a private car spot for you. There is a paid parking lot 1 minute away, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. Most Parking is free on Saturdays and Sundays. There are free and paid spots around you just may need to search a little.
access: It has a double bedroom, a bathroom, a double fold out sofa bed and a full kitchen with a fridge, oven, plates, cups, utensils, toaster, kettle, TV and Free wifi  - We provide 1 Towel per guest  -  Bedding for the sofa beds will be provided upon request or for bookings with 2+ guests.  - A hairdryer, Iron & Ironing Board are provided.
interaction: We do not live there, we live 10 minutes away and are always in the area. Check In: You will pick up the keys from a local cafe (30 seconds walk from the apartment).
house_rules: 1.STRICT NO PARTY RULE! UK Residents PLEASE NOTE. Our listings are intended for tourist and business travellers only! Whilst we allow our listings to be used by UK residents for the intention of getting ready and sleeping after a night out in London we do not allow parties or any gatherings more than the total amount of guests allowed on the listing. If you are not a genuine tourist or business traveller please do not book with us. Any bookings from UK citizens will be monitored.  If you are deemed to be a UK resident that we believe has the intention of breaking our no party rule then you will be required to meet with us to receive your keys between the hours of 3pm and 10 pm. You will be required to provide Photo ID that matches your profile and you will be required to leave a £500 cash deposit. The deposit will be returned only after we have checked the listing. 2. No more than the 4 people to reside 3. No more than 4 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use

name: Thoughtful Central London Apartment
summary: BEFORE BOOKING (IMPORTANT!): Please send me a short message introducing yourself by clicking the “Contact host” button located just after my reviews. Thank you! Hidden among the boutique stores of a cobbled street is this beautifully refurbished apartment. Furnished with quality mid-century pieces by British designers and has modern fittings throughout (including a dishwasher and washer/dryer). And, it’s only one minute’s walk from Covent Garden station - you can’t be better located!
space: The spacious one bedroom apartment has large sash windows throughout that let in plenty of light. The building is newly refurbished so there are brand new appliances and top-quality modern fittings including a dishwasher, washer/dryer and rainfall shower.  The apartment has four rooms and each is tastefully decorated - the furnishings are mostly designed by renowned British-Italian designer Ercol Ercolani. The bedroom has a comfortable king-size bed with four plump pillows and a hanging rail your clothes. The apartment comes with all necessary amenities such as an ironing board, iron, cooking utensils, many pans, knives, fluffy towels, a hairdryer etc. And, of course, there is the essential WIFI connection!

The apartment has four rooms and each is tastefully decorated - the furnishings are mostly designed by renowned British-Italian designer Ercol Ercolani. The bedroom has a comfortable king-size bed with four plump pillows and a hanging rail your clothes.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is positioned on a quieter than usual street in the heart of Central London, Covent Garden, neighbouring several luxury fashion boutiques. Being next to Covent Garden tube station, the apartment has unparalleled access to the rest of the city, but also is just moments walk from the best London has to offer.
transit: The apartment is next to Covent Garden tube station, which means you can be on the Piccadilly Line in less than three minutes. Getting around couldn't be easier.
access: The entire apartment is for your own private use.
interaction: I will personally be available via phone or text to cater to guest needs whether that might be recommending a restaurant or giving travel advice.

name: Unique atmosphere apartment near central London
summary: My place is close to Anywhere you would love to be in London, our apartment, with his unique atmosphere, can easily link you to it. London bridge, Westminster, Greenwich only 10 minutes away from our location. My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families with kids, and big groups.
description: My place is close to Anywhere you would love to be in London, our apartment, with his unique atmosphere, can easily link you to it. London bridge, Westminster, Greenwich only 10 minutes away from our location. My place is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers, families with kids, and big groups.
house_rules: - - Smoking is permitted outside the flat only. - - Please make sure A/C, water heater, lights, cooking appliances are switched off when not at home. - - Always close/lock behind you and at check-out leave the key on the table. - - As a courtesy to neighbours, please try and keep noise to a minimum. Especially hours: 22:00 and onwards - - Please use the bin in the bathroom to throw toilet paper or sanitary pads in. - - Please communicate damages or malfunctions as soon as they occur, so they can be fixed in time. - - Please No heavily drinking in the flat, No shouting on the street. -  - The books in the shelves are a small part of my personal lifetime collection. You can read from it if you wish, but please put any book back in the same place you took it from, and don't borrow anything.  - - Please close the windows in both bedrooms before you go out. Those are main requirements and guests must agree to this rules. Thank you
host_about:
Dear Guest and Dear Host my name is Federica, I come from Italy, exactly from the  beautiful island of Sardinia. I was born in Alghero, a touristic village overlooking the Mediterranean see. 
I arrived in London in 2011 for a University Project called Erasmus Placement, and after that I decided to stay permanently in UK to build my life and my career. 
Dealing with the last part of my studies, I realised how important the Art World is for me. Being educated from my early age to the love for artistic creation and also inspired by the poetic painting of my grandfather Giovanni Cadeddu, I am more and more close to the Art World and its endless possibilities. 
Theatre and art world in general are my passion. I love read, paint and listen to music. 
I'm graduated in Communication Sciences and Journalism and in 2013 I achieved my Master Degree in Performing Arts Science and Multimedia Video Production.
I have an outgoing, approachable, friendly and positive personality. 
Since January 2014 I am a mother of a beautiful baby boy and an adorable baby girl arrived in our family on September 2015. I got married in August 2014 with the father of my children, his name is Ken and he is my soul mate and inspiration for my life style and way to be.  
I am full of love and looking forward to welcome you in one of our rooms or apartments. 
With my husband I own a little family business which is called Carpe Diem Rooms ltd which is also our life motto (and tatoo) 
 Seize the day : CARPE DIEM

name: Stunning One Bedroom Flat in trendy Hackney
summary: You will love staying in this flat and relax in the trendy Hackney area.  Just a few Bus stops from Hackney Wick, Shoreditch or even Central London.  There is a lot of lovely bars, restaurants where you can hang out and discover East London.
space: It’s a bright, clean, modern, new, stylish and very comfortable one bedroom flat. Maintained to a high standard, perfect for a couple or a single traveller. The flat is equipped with a double bed, a kitchen and a lovely living space.  The bathroom has toilet, bath and shower facilities. The studio has brand new furniture and the kitchen is fully equipped with all the essentials required for your own catering needs be it a quick breakfast or a romantic dinner.

There is a lot of lovely bars, restaurants where you can hang out and discover East London. It’s a bright, clean, modern, new, stylish and very comfortable one bedroom flat. Maintained to a high standard, perfect for a couple or a single traveller. The flat is equipped with a double bed, a kitchen and a lovely living space.  The bathroom has toilet, bath and shower facilities. The studio has brand new furniture and the kitchen is fully equipped with all the essentials required for your own catering needs be it a quick breakfast or a romantic dinner. You will have access to the whole flat.  - You will be able to hang out some clothes in the wardrobe if you'd like.  - You will be able to use the kitchen and make delicious breakfasts and dinners! - Access to the washing machine if you'd like. - Clean linen and towels provided for each guests
neighborhood_overview: The flat is situated in the main road and you have few different bus stops around the corner to go anywhere you want.  Sainsbury's and Tesco are walking distance. Delis cafes accross the road (they make fantastic coffee) Restaurants, wine bars, tacos, Pizza... You will only have to pick!

name: Chiswick ensuite double room, near trains & buses.
summary: The bedroom and bathroom are on the top floor of our house & guests have exclusive use of that floor.  We provide high quality, luxurious bedding and towels, wifi, teas, coffee, water, fruit & biscuits.  Our house is close to central London, Kew Gardens, Chiswick House & tube, bus & train services. We are a short walk away from Chiswick Business Park.   Chiswick is a lovely area of West London with plenty of restaurants, pubs, cafes & shops. There are discounts for stays of 3 nights or more.
space: The bedroom is quiet, warm and has plenty of natural light.  The modern private bathroom has a powerful shower and we provide high quality bedding, towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner.  Coffee and tea-making facilities are available in the room along with water, biscuits and a selection of fruit.

Either myself or my wife, Fiona, will greet you upon arrival and we will be available to a
neighborhood_overview: Chiswick is a very popular part of West London and is fortunate to have a great range of shops, restaurants, pubs and cafes as well as attractive open spaces and good travel links.   We are close to many local attractions including Kew Gardens, the river Thames and Chiswick House.  Hampton Court Palace, Ham House and Richmond are nearby.  Central London is 25 minutes by underground, or a more leisurely bus ride via Shepherd's Bush and Notting Hill, and Heathrow is 25 minutes by cab (traffic dependent!) or 45 minutes by underground.
notes: Arrival time is fairly flexible but we prefer it to be before 9pm. Departure is by 10am unless by prior arrangement.  You may be able to leave bags for later pickup - please ask.
transit: We are a short walk from two tube stations (Turnham Green and Chiswick Park) and the North London Line overground.   Buses into central London are just a few minutes walk away. Parking is free at weekends, but there is a council charge for weekday parking between 9am and 6pm (80p an hr, £4.70 a day).  Please let us know if you require a permit and we will organise it for you.
access: You have exclusive use of the top floor of our house, which is where your bedroom and your bathroom are located.
interaction: Either myself or my wife, Fiona, will greet you upon arrival and we will be available to answer any queries.
house_rules: Arrival time is fairly flexible but we prefer it to be before 9pm. Departure is by 10am unless by prior arrangement.  You may be able to leave bags for later pickup - please ask.  We don't wear shoes upstairs, guests can leave their shoes in our hallway. No parties or guests other than those agreed in advance. No excessive noise after 10.30pm Please respect our quiet neighbourhood. Strictly no smoking.

summary: Comfortable single room within an apartment in the beautiful London Borough of Ealing.  A few hundred yards from the Grand Union canal, a 20 minute walk to Boston Manor Piccadilly line Tube station (only 20 minutes on tube to Heathrow), and 15 minute walk from Hanwell Station which goes directly into London Paddington Central London. A quiet and peaceful neighbourhood but within easy reach of central London.
space: Room is as shown in photo's.  Clean with a very comfortable bed with wardrobe and chest of drawers.    Situated in Olde Hanwell with canal walks, pubs and coffee shops nearby.  A quiet residential area of West London but within easy reach of central London.   It is 15 minute walk to Hanwell mainline station which goes directly into Paddington station, a 15 minute bus journey to Ealing Broadway station with District and Central Line tube lines into central London.  In addition, it is a 20 minute walk (or 5 minute bus journey) to Boston Manor tube station, on the Piccadilly line which is 20 minutes from Heathrow stations and 30 minutes the other direction into Leicester Square/Piccadilly Circus.

name: Studio Flat Clerkenwell Farringdon Holborn (210)
summary: - 2 minutes walk to Farringdon Station - 20sqm - Free wifi - Private bathroom pod - Full functional kitchen - Gym, laundry available on site
space: The apartment is a self-contained double room studio flat (20 sq. metres) fully equipped with all your desired needs!  There is small desk space with an office chair, and its own personal WiFi router is provided. A double wardrobe containing plenty of hanging and storage space. Fully functional kitchen complete with a hob, microwave, toaster and kettle; alongside all cookware and utensils and its own fridge freezer. Its own private bathroom (pod), small but has everything you need. * Fully supplied with all bedding and towels * Complementary tea and coffee, and travel sized toiletries * Hairdryer can be found inside wardrobe for use The building benefits from a day and night concierge (excluding Sundays), an onsite gym and a communal area with flat screen TV with full Virgin Media package, Wi-Fi, comfortable sofas and a pool table to relax and enjoy! There is a laundry room in the basement of the building complete with ironing facilities and a coin operated washing machine and dryer.

name: Bright Victorian Warehouse Room in Hackney Wick
summary: Great large warm warehouse flat next to the Overground Station in what used to be an industrial island sandwiched by Lea River canals and Victoria Park. Incredibly bright, luxuriously spacious and filled to the gills with interesting collectibles.  Pop to the large roof terraces for some mixed & confused views of the many Victorian warehouse buildings, Canary Wharf and even gaze towards the antiquity 2012 Olympic site. The room is very spacious with two desks, lots of storage and things to enjoy
space: We are an arts pace albeit we both live here. Occasionally we host events and exhibitions and workshops. Ordinarily the space is quiet in the evening.   Large room with proper double bed and lots of storage & shelving.  We have fast Wifi and  a homely communal kitchen and living area. My friend Paul and I both live here and have done for some years. The flat is a grand size so lots of space.   The room has access to a roof terrace via the window.  We are co-hosting as Paul also has a room on airbnb, same large size and similar decor - so do check out our other room too!  The bathroom is our smallest room and we keep it very clean and we have it looking good.  There is a shower and bath option.  There is x1 resident cat named Michio. He does not enter the room but please if you don't like cats then don't book, he is a character though. The building houses lots of creatives but also lawyers, fashionistas etc . This area is changing fast and soon to be one of Londons newest hotspots so co
description: Great large warm warehouse flat next to the Overground Station in what used to be an industrial island sandwiched by Lea River canals and Victoria Park. Incredibly bright, luxuriously spacious and filled to the gills with interesting collectibles.  Pop to the large roof terraces for some mixed & confused views of the many Victorian warehouse buildings, Canary Wharf and even gaze towards the antiquity 2012 Olympic site. The room is very spacious with two desks, lots of storage and things to enjoy We are an arts pace albeit we both live here. Occasionally we host events and exhibitions and workshops. Ordinarily the space is quiet in the evening.   Large room with proper double bed and lots of storage & shelving.  We have fast Wifi and  a homely communal kitchen and living area. My friend Paul and I both live here and have done for some years. The flat is a grand size so lots of space.   The room has access to a roof terrace via the window.  We are co-hosting as Paul also has a room on ai
neighborhood_overview: Hackney Wick  - once an area of industrial labour, canal imports & exports and Fish (check out our neighbourhood area Fish Island)  - then home too musicians/artists/circus performers/ writers/champion wrestlers etc. Now the Wick also houses lawyers, media labs, fashion houses and craft breweries and taxidermists. NOT forgetting the London Olympic site which is on our door step.
notes: The area is fast developing with independent bars and cafes. During the weekend the area is a hub of people activity as traditionally the streets are vacant of heavy traffic unlike the rest of London. It is an island after all!
transit: The nearest Station is Hackney Wick station and is on the Overground network. The nearest Underground station is Stratford which is a 10 min walk and is a major linked hub.  The central line leaves from here to central London (Oxford Str/Soho etc) and takes around 20 mins.
access: You have full access to the living room, kitchen and bathroom not forgetting the choice of two roof terraces.
interaction: I, your host,  will normally be the one who you meet upon your arrival  - I also live here so if you ever need anything I am here to help.  If not me, then my flatmate Paul will meet and greet you. One thing to note: as we have a variety of guests and that I live here, I will ask to see some identification upon your arrival.  Please take no offence to this as it is simply to verify you are who Airbnb says you are and I like to keep everyone safe and very much welcome.
house_rules: - Be cool, be nice ,be friendly.  We will respect your privacy but we are also available to be social. I would like you to have a relaxed stay and consider our home your home too during your stay.
host_about: Working in the arts, living amongst them all too.

name: Stunning house next to Richmond Park (double room)
summary: The house is a 2-minute walk to beautiful Richmond Park at Roehampton Gate. It has a 165ft private garden that is not overlooked and is very quiet. It's the perfect place to stay in London with Richmond, Barnes, Putney and Kew Gardens close-by. If you like walking, cycling and enjoying watching wild deer in the park, this is the perfect place for you. There are lots of great cafes and restaurants around the area and Heathrow Airport is only 30 minutes away by car. A truly great and unique place.
space: The house is light and spacious and has excellent, high-speed wi-fi. Although you are in London SW15, you feel like you are in the countryside and is an ideal place to relax and see London from. Also, please note other local amenities. We are: •	Less than a 5-minute walk to Richmond Park (Roehampton Gate entrance) •	2-minute walk to the Bank of England Sports club in Bank Lane where the Wimbledon Qualifying Tournaments take place in June each year before the Wimbledon Tennis Championships •	5-minute walk to the Lawn Tennis Association in Priory Lane •	10-minute walk to The Roehampton Club •	12 minutes by car to Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Club where the Wimbledon Championships take place Aside from the close-proximity above, the neighbourhood is great and has a very nice feel to it. Lots of things to do and places to see. Richmond town centre is close-by with great shops, restaurants and a cinema. You can walk to Barnes village, another very nice place to eat and shop. Barnes also has a grea
description: The house is a 2-minute walk to beautiful Richmond Park at Roehampton Gate. It has a 165ft private garden that is not overlooked and is very quiet. It's the perfect place to stay in London with Richmond, Barnes, Putney and Kew Gardens close-by. If you like walking, cycling and enjoying watching wild deer in the park, this is the perfect place for you. There are lots of great cafes and restaurants around the area and Heathrow Airport is only 30 minutes away by car. A truly great and unique place. The house is light and spacious and has excellent, high-speed wi-fi. Although you are in London SW15, you feel like you are in the countryside and is an ideal place to relax and see London from. Also, please note other local amenities. We are: •	Less than a 5-minute walk to Richmond Park (Roehampton Gate entrance) •	2-minute walk to the Bank of England Sports club in Bank Lane where the Wimbledon Qualifying Tournaments take place in June each year before the Wimbledon Tennis Championships •	5-m
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is great and has a very nice feel to it. Lots of things to do and places to see. Richmond town centre is close-by with great shops, restaurants and a cinema. You can walk to Barnes village, another very nice place to eat and shop. Barnes also has a great, new cinema. Putney High Street is in the other direction, also with lots of great amenities. Hammersmith is a bus ride away, as is Kingston, Chiswick and Kew. With Richmond Park on our doorstep, there is always something to see and do! You can escape to the great outdoors in Richmond Park with its wide open spaces, grasslands and deer herds, just a 2 minute walk from the house. The park is a top UK site for ancient trees and supports a range of rare species including fungi, birds, beetles, bats, grasses and wildflowers. Discover the Isabella Plantation woodland gardens, refuel at Pembrooke Lodge tea restaurant/tea rooms and enjoy distant views of St Paul’s Cathedral from King Henry’s Mound. Try your hand at power kit
notes: We have 3 rooms in total available, all listed separately here on Airbnb. That's 2 double rooms, sleeping 2 people in each, and 1 single room. We can accommodate a total of 5 people. Please get in touch if you need more than 1 room.
transit: It will work better if you have a car to get around, however, there are buses about a 10 minute walk away which will easily get you to Richmond, Putney, Barnes, Hammersmith and into central London in less than 20 minutes. If we are around (and one of us usually is), we are happy to give you a lift to the local Tube (underground) station/railway station/bus stop, all of which are a short 5-minute drive away. If you have an Uber account, it is very cheap to get a ride to Richmond, Barnes, Kew, Hammersmith, Chiswick, Kingston etc.
access: Guests have their own private bedroom and use of kitchen to make drinks.
interaction: We are likely to be available throughout your stay and can tell you all about the local area and what to see and do, however, you can be on your own as much as you want.
house_rules: We don't allow guests to do their own cooking and it's most definitely a non-smoking house!

name: Zone 2, beautiful 3 bed, garden flat with views
summary: A short walk to Archway zone 2, with a south facing balcony and garden, this beautiful, spacious (105m2), 3 double bedroom period property has everything you need plus fantastic views of London. The flat is close to the shops and cafes of artistic Crouch end and picturesque Highgate and in a quiet residential area with easy access to central London.
space: This flat really has a special atmosphere as the proportions are so light and airy and it is surprisingly spacious for a London flat. It also has great views of London and comes into its own at night when you can stand on the balcony and see 180 degree views. The 3 double bedrooms are very spacious and all have extensive built in storage.  In the summer the fact that the bedrooms are on the lower ground, level with the garden, is a huge bonus as it means that they stay nice and cool for comfortable sleeping. The open space kitchen-lounge area is the heart of the place where everyone gets together, either inside or on the balcony. The garden is perfect for drinks and food outside in the sunshine. We provide Wifi and a TV screen and cable so that you can plug in a laptop and watch films. Please note we don't have access to TV channels unless you go via the internet.
description: A short walk to Archway zone 2, with a south facing balcony and garden, this beautiful, spacious (105m2), 3 double bedroom period property has everything you need plus fantastic views of London. In the summer the fact that the bedrooms are on the lower ground, level with the garden, is a huge bonus as it means that they stay nice and cool for comfortable sleeping. The open space kitchen-lounge area is the heart of the place where everyone gets together, either inside or on the balcony. The garden
neighborhood_overview: Whitehall park is a gem placed right in the middle of Archway (zone 2, great for transport), Crouch end (a favourite with famous actors and creatives) and Highgate village (a beautiful area of London close to Hampstead heath with great shops and stunning parks). The street is lovely, very quiet and close to small shops, perfect for last minute food & drink shopping.
notes: There is parking available on the street. It is restricted between 10am and 2pm on weekdays only. At weekends parking is free. For 10-2 weekdays you will need vouchers which you can purchase from the host. These are charged at cost which is £1 hour.
transit: Walk to Crouch end, Highgate and Archway. Take the bus for a scenic route or the tube for speed from Archway into Oxford circus (18 mins), Tottenham court road (13 mins) and other central locations.
access: All of the garden Balcony Full use of flat
interaction: We live very close by so are available to answer any questions or help guests with local places to go.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house - We ask guests to be considerate of our neighbours and quiet after 11pm
host_about: We are a family living in the same area and we love it and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in London.  It is calm and peaceful but situated close to so many different and interesting areas. There are beautiful parks, great cafes and good nightlife just down the road.  I am an acupuncturist and my partner a project manager and we have looked after tenants in our flats for the last 14 years.  We have lived in this flat for 5 years and we and our friends absolutely love it, it's in a great location and is open plan but cosy and has fantastic views of London.

space: A beautiful historic Georgian house elegantly decorated right in the center of London. Situated in a wonderful vibrant area with lots of shops, restaurants, museums, theatres and on the doorstep of the major attractions.

notes: Easy check-in - we will leave our key in a key safe for you (and email you the code). We can leave you a king size inflatable mattress for an extra guest (at a small extra charge) which can be set up in the spacious sitting room or one of the bedrooms.
transit: The house is within a 10 min walk from Kings Cross and Angel tube stations from where you can be in Covent Garden or any part of central London within 10 minutes. There is a bus stop just outside the house which takes slightly longer to get into central London, but will give you a good view of the sights. It takes approximately 45 minutes to walk to Covent Garden, St Pauls or Oxford Circus from the house.

summary: Stunning Bond Street - Mayfair Apartment is a self-catering accommodation located in the heart of London. The property is a minute's walk from Oxford Street and Bond Street Tube station. Free WiFi access is available.
space: One bedroom apartment with a private bathroom. The apartment can sleep up to three guests.
description: Stunning Bond Street - Mayfair Apartment is a self-catering accommodation located in the heart of London. The property is a minute's walk from Oxford Street and Bond Street Tube station. Free WiFi access is available. One bedroom apartment with a private bathroom. The apartment can sleep up to three guests. You will have access to the whole property. Stunning Bond Street - Mayfair Apartment is a self-catering accommodation located in the heart of London. The property is a minute's walk from Oxford Street and Bond Street Tube station. Free WiFi access is available. The modern apartment will provide you with a flat-screen TV, a seating area and a sofa. There is a full kitchen with a dishwasher and a microwave. A modern walk-in shower is also provided. The famous department store of Selfridges is less than a 5-minute walk away, along with a variety of places to eat and drink. You can also take a stroll through the scenic green of Hyde Park, which is 10 minutes away on foot.  Westminster B
neighborhood_overview: The famous department store of Selfridges is less than a 5-minute walk away, along with a variety of places to eat and drink. name: Quiet room in the heart of Central London!
summary: A peaceful night's sleep in the heart of London!  Your room at the back of my flat is quiet, cheerful & comfy.  This bright, top-floor room with a charming sloped attic wall has a table, desk, double bed, TV and Wifi.  Kitchen and bathroom are shared (with just me), but they're kept fresh and clean.  Your location, the upscale Charlotte St area of Fitzrovia, has cafe's, pubs and restaurants, but your room is quiet.  You're literally minutes from Oxford Street, the British Museum, Soho, Mayfair.
space: Your room, clean and comfy, is fine for one person or two (one double bed) and is at the (quiet) back of the building.  The kitchen and my quarters are at the building's front.  The flat's style is simple and clean-lined, with bits of artwork and window-box gardens.  Your'll be up above the neighbourhood - it's is a joy, with light, breezes, sky and almost no noise.  It's serene up here!  Worth the climb - 3 flights of stairs - the exercise is free!

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood of Fitzrovia is a secret oasis in London’s centre that only Londoners seem to know about.  And you’ll be staying in the nicest part of Fitzrovia.  You won’t find the crowds or bustle of tourist spots, but you will find a huge variety of eating and drinking places - traditional English pubs, wine bars, craft beer pubs, tapas bars; numerous restaurants of all price ranges - French, Tai, Greek, Italian, Mexican, Hawaiian, Japanese, Chinese, Indian, gourmet burgers and German sausages; cafes - popular chains and individually owned places, each with unique character.  It’s a quiet and safe neighbourhood, historically listed (protected) with lots of narrow streets, mostly small 19th Century buildings.  Besides eating and drinking places you’ll find shops of all kinds, galleries - and we also have supermarkets minutes from the front door.   Oxford Street shopping and the exciting and off-beat neighbourhood of Soho are just a five minute walk away.  Also within walking distan
notes: Please acknowledge: The apartment is three flights up, 51 steps. Kitchen use is from 9am to 9pm for light cooking - no smelly sausage fry-ups. No pets, no parties, no groups.  Visitors with permission only. No smoking.
transit: You can get so many places walking that you may not even think about public transport, but if you need busses, the tube, or trains, many are close at hand.   There are lots of bus routes within an easy walk - they head all over London - take a bus to Notting Hill, or Camden Town.  There are 4 tube stations within and easy walks (4 min., 8, min., 10 min. and 12 min.) and the area is crisscrossed by tube lines in all directions.  Traditional London black cabs abound in the area, and Uber cars are just a few clicks on your phone away.  Most train stations, linking you to the rest of the UK are quite simple to get to, including the Eurostar station, St Pancreas International.  In a nutshell, getting around from my place couldn't be easier.
access: Access to the your room (and the bathroom) is 24/7 - you'll have keys to the flat and the building.  There's a table in your room which is fine for one or two people to eat at. And a desk, so workspace is good.  In your room you'll have access to a kettle, quality coffee, coffee maker, teas, mugs, milk and sugar.  You may use the kitchen between 9am and 9pm for preparing light meals - but almost no one does since there are dozens of places to eat just steps from the front door.  You'll have cable TV - 500 channels, but after 10pm please keep the volume down.  You'll also have books about the Fitzrovia neighbourhood, London, and the UK, and UK oriented fiction.  A few art books too.  The standard-size double bed has a new mattress, featherbed, down duvet and duvet-cover.  In the bathroom, you'll have towels, soap, shampoo conditioner and a hair dryer.
interaction: I'm pretty much available as needed, except at times when I'm at Central Saint Martins (art school) teaching, not far away, or at a client's who I do drawings for.   I'm happy to to tell you about neighbourhood attractions and London, provide directions, etc., but just as happy to leave you to yourself if that's what you prefer.   As my part of the flat (including the kitchen) will only be accessible from 9am to 9pm, we'll encounter each other in my section of the flat only when I'm up and about.  When I work at home, drawing or at my computer, it's almost  always just me.  An exception would be when I'm teaching a studio session to 3 or 4 art students.  But that's something pretty docile not involving your room, and would be for an occasional Saturday or Sunday afternoon. I'll let you know at if anything like that is planned.  Coffee, tea, etc, are available in your room any time.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10pm to 8am.
host_about: I'm originally from New York City, but now I live in Fitzrovia, a wonderful area in Central London.  I work on films and TV and teach drawing and illustration.  I like walking about London, enjoy eating out and meeting up with friends for a drink, urban sketching, design (I began as an architect), art gallery openings, enjoying my window box gardens, reading, keeping in touch with friends around the world and sidewalk cafes on sunny days!  I've stayed in great Airbnb places with wonderful hosts in several countries and hope to provide the same nice experience at my place for others!

name: Large 2 bed 2 bath apartment with access to garden
summary: My lovely flat is within walking distance to London Bridge & Bermondsey stations. It is in close proximity to shops and the famous bars and restaurants in Bermondsey street, Bermondsey Square and Shad Thames. An ideal location to enjoy this beautiful city for work or pleasure. There are 2 bedrooms with a double bed each. 2 bathrooms: Ensuite with master bedroom + another family bathroom. Living room has a sofa bed, glass dining table and 4 chairs. There is access to a beautiful communal garden!
space: I have lived in this apartment for 6 years, since they were first built!!  It has been looked after and tended with a lot of love :) It is a lovely, warm, south facing apartment, so you will get sun light throughout the day.  The development is quiet and peaceful, with a beautiful garden, which is accessible by all residents.  Additionally, there is a ramp for wheelchair access.   The kitchen is fitted out with a washer dryer, oven, electric hob, microwave, fridge freezer, kettle & toaster! There are 2 bathrooms:  Ensuite with the master bedroom and the main bathroom with a shower and a bath. The living room has a double sofa bed, glass dining table and 4 chairs.  There is also a password protected wifi in the flat.

neighborhood_overview: Bermondsey is one of the most exciting and hip neighbourhoods in London.  There are many boutiques, White Cube gallery, restaurants, bars, shops, food markets and a the lovely Southwark park in the area.  River is only a short walk away!  I totally love living in Bermondsey! About 3 mins walk from the apartment, in Spa Terminus, is a lovely food market every Saturday.  You will be able to buy organic fruit & veg, freshly baked bread and pastries, cheese, honey and Monmouth coffee! There are 2 supermarkets near the flat:  Sainsbury & Co-Op.  There is also a lovely family run corner shop.  So you will never be stranded without supplies!
transit: Bermondsey station, on Jubilee line, is about 10 mins walk from the apartment.   To the West is 1 stop to London Bridge, 7 mins to Westminster for sight seeing and 10 mins to Bond Street for all your shopping needs!!   To the East, Canary Wharf, Greenwich and Startford (Westfield shopping centre) are all within 15mins!
access: On your arrival, I will meet you to hand you the keys and show you around the apartment.  There is a secure entry system to the building.  You will have a fob for the building and a key to the flat.
interaction: I am just a phone call away, incase you require anything during your stay.
