notes: Late Check-in Fees  We understand that sometimes flights are sometimes late at night, early in the morning or sometimes delayed. However for very late or early check ins it is necessary to charge a fee: This is to cover the cost of sending someone to your property outside of normal working hours. London is a big city, travel at night or early morning is not always easy, and our greeters often come from quite far away to check you in.  Our charges are outlined below:  7 - 8 pm and 8 - 9 am: £25  8 - 10 pm and 7 - 8 am: £30  10 - 11:30 pm:£40  11:30  - 1 am and 6 am - 7 am: £50  1 am - 6 am: £60  If you’re having an early/late check in please have the correct money available in cash, and pay this directly to the greeter upon arrival/departure. Please allow at least 15 min for a check-in or check-out. The fee will be determined by the time at which your greeter departs the property after a check-in.
transit: You are 5 minutes walk from both Covent Garden and Leicester Square underground stations.
house_rules: 1. The property sleeps three people only. Three people is the maximum number of people allowed in the property at any one time. 2. Please respect the fact that this is a residential area. Noise must be kept to a respectable level at all times so not to disturb the neighbours.  3. Absolutely strictly no parties allowed whatsoever. Guests who violate this rule will be asked to leave the property immediately. 4. No pets/animals please in the flat or in the building. 5. Smoking is not allowed in this apartment whatsoever. 6. Valid Identification, in the form of a passport, photo driving licence or national identification card (with photo) will be required from all guests at check in. Please note that we will not be able to exchange keys without a valid for of identification. The check in cannot be completed by anyone other than the main guests checking in, whose names must be submitted to us prior to check in. To prevent fraud and to comply with our insurance, Keys cannot under any circums
host_about: I work in the City of London during the week and stay on the South Coast at the weekend. I rent out just this one flat in Covent Garden. I originally purchased it to stay in during the week but since then have bought another bigger flat. However I was always fond of the flat in Covent Garden and decided to rent it out rather than sell it.

name: Studio Flat, Hyde Park Bayswater London D Bas.
summary: This studio flat comes with 2 Single Beds and is located on the Lower Ground Floor in a well maintained Victorian Building. Flat does include the basic needs for someone to have a great short stay. It is situated in the heart of London, Bayswater area, about 5 minutes walk to either Queensway or Bayswater Stations, and less than 4 min. to the Hyde Park.
space: Ideal for Friends & young Couples on the lower Ground floor with one window and a little natural light to access the Flat. The Flat comes with an open-plan kitchen that contains an electric cooker, fridge, and microwave & other Kitchenware needed for a simple cooking. It also comes with a small TV. It has 2 single beds and a reasonable but not large 2-door wardrobe. The newly renovated bathroom contains a shower-room, towels, basic needs, such as shampoo and hand-wash.  Although we are hoping for the best service within your stay and for Hygienic purposes, Please Note that I do not supply food items such as; Sugar, Salt, Coffee, Oil, Milk.....etc ,this flat has got a large window, thus it is ambient and there is some natural light that comes in. It has central heating that keeps it on a warm temperature during the cold days of winter.

notes: In the guests comfort parties or loud music are not allowed in this apartment to eliminate noise. For the guests' comfort, smoking is not allowed in this apartment to eliminate air pollution.

We know our market and finding the right property is what we are best at. Our clients come mainly from recommendation or a word of mouth, as a result of customer satisfaction.

name: Room w/ View in Heart of Shoreditch(NoCleaningFee)
summary: Ideal spot to stay if you want to enjoy nights out in the heart of Shoreditch. We are a short walking distance from the High Street, Brick Lane, and Spitalfields Market with Hoxton Overground Station being a 2 minute walk.
space: The interior of our flat is newly refurbished. Out your window you'll be able to see all the way to the iconic Gherkin building in the heart of the financial district.
description: Ideal spot to stay if you want to enjoy nights out in the heart of Shoreditch. We are a short walking distance from the High Street, Brick Lane, and Spitalfields Market with Hoxton Overground Station being a 2 minute walk. The interior of our flat is newly refurbished. Out your window you'll be able to see all the way to the iconic Gherkin building in the heart of the financial district. Your room is located on the top floor (accessed by stairs), and while there is a shared bathroom right outside your door, there is also a toilet on the bottom floor. Feel free to use our kitchen. We rent out two of our three bedrooms so if you're traveling with friends and family, and are in need of two separate bedrooms, we can accommodate if you book both of our listings  (www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ). Guest bedrooms are on the top floor and we occupy a bedroom on the bottom floor. Note we do have a young baby, but since we stay on a different floor you won't be able to h
neighborhood_overview: Shoreditch is great for nightlife, arts and culture. Just outside our door are great restaurants with diverse cuisine options: English, Italian, Indian, tapas, bottomless brunch, craft brew houses or a good old fashion pub experience. If you'd like any recommendations feel free to ask.  In Shoreditch, street art is everywhere to be found and you can even book a tour guide to show you around and tell you about it all. There are art galleries, shopping, an independent cinema, and the famous Boxpark, plus several parks are nearby to run around in or simply lounge in with a bottle of wine.
transit: Hoxton Station is the closest Overground station, but we're also in close proximity to Shoreditch High Street, Old Street Station & Liverpool Street. It's pretty easy to get around anywhere you'd like to go. Central London is a 20 minute journey on the underground.
access: Your room is located on the top floor (accessed by stairs), and while there is a shared bathroom right outside your door, there is also a toilet on the bottom floor. Feel free to use our kitchen. We rent out two of our three bedrooms so if you're traveling with friends and family, and are in need of two separate bedrooms, we can accommodate if you book both of our listings  (www.airbnb.co.uk/rooms/ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ).
interaction: Guest bedrooms are on the top floor and we occupy a bedroom on the bottom floor. Note we do have a young baby, but since we stay on a different floor you won't be able to hear any noise once in your bedroom. We're quite friendly, so if you feel like a chat we'll be happy to oblige, but we understand that you're not renting our place just to visit us.
house_rules: - There's £20 fee for lost keys - No vaping - No excessive noise after 10 pm
host_about: We enjoy traveling and meeting new people. We often use Airbnb to stay in other people's homes so we know what it's like and will make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. We have just come back from living in Los Angeles for four years now and so have been exploring the area and can recommend lot's of great places!

name: Comfortable Spacious Room In NW8
summary: My newly refurbished room is comfortable clean and ideal for either city workers or travelers looking for location and value as I am central and my prices aren’t too high. Located 5 min walk to St John's Wood tube -24hr tube on weekends. Few meters away from a bicycle hire station and two blocks away from Regent's Park. Fresh towels, hair dryer, clothes iron and if you want to cook use the kitchen as you please only rule is to clean after.  - Self check in/out and luggage drop.
space: Comfortable and ample with clean sheets, carpet, lights for bed reading and two practical closets. Also the apartment main features are: - Kitchen  - Lounge  - Shower room - Toilet  This is a real living space, not a hotel so in the event I am at work and unable to wait for you and clean the room before your arrival, as per my working schedule, cleaning will be done upon my arrival from work, check in is available for you at flexible times as you can come in collecting keys from drop box then you have time to drop your bags and freshen up. Sometimes guests leave the room before I go to work and I clean and set up everything.  The apartment has shared shower room with no bath including Two toilets (main: toilet bowl+wash basin and shower room and a second toilet: toilet bowl+wash basin)  Again: Both toilets are SHARED the room does not have private toilet or en suite. I will provide 2 towels only during the whole length of you stay. Will wash and offer new ones if you're staying more th

neighborhood_overview: It's quiet, clean and with Starbucks, Tesco, Pret A Manger, and lots of lovely restaurants in the high street.
notes: Late or early check in provided.  For check in whilst I am I work I will set up bedroom upon my arrival. I will leave clean towels for you to freshen up and you can drop your suitcases and get the keys right away. Please note this is not a hotel. This is a living space and as such the standard preparation times for the room are different for a hotel.  Se habla español too.  Friendly disposition.
transit: Santander Bikes, 24 Hr Buses, Tube station 4 min walk Jubilee line with 24Hour service Friday and Saturday.
access: Don't let my check in times put you off. I can sort self check in with safe place keys pick up with a lock box should you need to check in before I leave or get home from work.  Regent's Park, Abbey Road studios, tube station with 24hr trains on Fridays and Saturday. Wellington hospital. Central London in under 8 min.
interaction: I interact whenever you want to have a chat and coffe or need me for any assistance.
house_rules: Cook whatever you want, use the kitchen and appliances. but wash up and tidy after you.  Leave the toilet/shower as clean as you found it. If you are eating whilst on bed please mind my sheets. I would leave not positive feedback if you don't observe this. Check out is at 11am. If you need longer or to leave your suitcases pelase ask the host or co-host. For sure something can be arranged.
host_about:
Hispanic living in the big smoke. Friendly and relaxed outlook in life kind of person. 

Fashion, music and the quirky things in life get me going whilst I stay down to earth and respectful of others and the environment. 

:-)

name: Split-Level Studio Flat in Central London
summary: Ascend the ladder to a cosy mezzanine sleeping area in this spacious self contained studio flat. The space showcases a classic loft-style with vaulted ceilings, warm wood effect tiles, under floor heating, muted tones, creating a cosy urban oasis.
space: The Studio is well equipped and cosy with under floor heating, it has an open plan kitchen living room with a mezzanine sleeping area accessed by a ladder, the bed is a big double.  The kitchen is well equipped Inc. dishwasher & washing machine.  There is also a private shower room with a large powerful shower and a double hanging cupboard. The studio has a 50” TV, DVD player, Apple TV and access to Netflix
description: Ascend the ladder to a cosy mezzanine sleeping area in this spacious self contained studio flat. The space showcases a classic loft-style with vaulted ceilings, warm wood effect tiles, under floor heating, muted tones, creating a cosy urban oasis.
neighborhood_overview: The studio is situated on London’s Balham, Streatham borders, near Brixton; and Tooting Common.  The closest underground station for central trips is Brixton's Victoria line, there are also easy bus links and overground trains serving London wide.
notes: The mezzanine sleeping area is accessed by ladder; please use with care for your own safety
transit: Closest bus stops Becmead Avenue (4-5 mins walk) Closest train stations: Streatham Hill station (10 mins walk) - trains to Clapham Junction (9 mins) Streatham station (10 mins walk) - trains run to Wimbledon station (9 mins)  Closest tube stations: Brixton station (15mins bus ride) - Victoria line: runs to Victoria (7 mins), Oxford Circus (11 mins), Kings X (16 mins) Balham station (10mins bus ride) - Northern line: runs to London bridge (17 mins), and Bank (18 mins)

name: Double room, close to sightseeing in London
summary: Welcome to our new home. We have recently moved in and so you'll find everything is new and functional.  The room is a comfortable, bright, newly decorated room with a double bed.  3 mins walk to Colliers Wood tube 25 mins underground tube ride to Central London  30 mins walk to Wimbledon Village  20 mins bus ride Wimbledon Tennis Courts.  We have Wifi throughout plus a private newly landscaped garden available (updated from since the picture was taken). Flexible check in.
space: The bedroom is bright with a comfortable double bed. The flat is away from the main road so it's nice and quiet. The apartment itself is modern, bright and airy. You are welcome to grab breakfast / tea / coffee in the kitchen, although it isn't available to be used for cooking dinner.
description: Welcome to our new home. We have recently moved in and so you'll find everything is new and functional.  The room is a comfortable, bright, newly decorated room with a double bed.  3 mins walk to Colliers Wood tube 25 mins underground tube ride to Central London  30 mins walk to Wimbledon Village  20 mins bus ride Wimbledon Tennis Courts.  We have Wifi throughout plus a private newly landscaped garden available (updated from since the picture was taken). Flexible check in. The bedroom is bright with a comfortable double bed. The flat is away from the main road so it's nice and quiet. The apartment itself is modern, bright and airy. You are welcome to grab breakfast / tea / coffee in the kitchen, although it isn't available to be used for cooking dinner. Check-in is usually anytime from 1pm (sometimes can be earlier by arrangement), if arriving via Central London we can also meet you there to give you the key. Arrivals late in the evening are also fine.  Check-out will be 10:30am, altho
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet and residential. There is a large Sainsbury's, Marks and Spencers and a Next Superstore nearby. Also a there's time for a 'cheeky' Nando's just 5-10 mins walk away, close to Wandle Park.   Colliers Wood and nearby Tooting Broadway, as featured in Time Out as:- 'Tooting has come pretty far since the time of Citizen Smith - From the budget-priced South Asian restaurants and ace independent pubs and bars to Tooting Bec lido and the leafy, lush common, SW17's never had it so good. The new Shoreditch? Maybe.' There's often interesting stuff going on with food markets and a new music venue 'The Sound Lounge' to arts and crafts at Merton Abbey Mills along the River Wandle.  We like the Chicken Shop, The Castle and Meze (a delightful Lebanese Restaurant near Tooting Broadway).  With Wimbledon Village and shopping just a 10 minute bus ride away, there's plenty to do and see.
notes: ***Please note there is more than one College Road in London. Make sure you go to Colliers Wood tube or if you are in a taxi tell the driver we are in SW19***
transit: Colliers Wood underground station is about 100 metres away with good connections to central London: London Bridge - 23 mins Green Park - 25 mins Old Street - 28 mins Westminster - 33 mins Tower of London - 25 mins Piccadilly Circus - 28 mins Kings Cross St Pancras - 30 Mins There's also plenty of buses nearby which go all around South West and into Central London.
access: Check-in is usually anytime from 1pm (sometimes can be earlier by arrangement), if arriving via Central London we can also meet you there to give you the key. Arrivals late in the evening are also fine.  Check-out will be 10:30am, although you are welcome to leave your bags and come back to collect them later in the day if need be. We also have a garden, which you are welcome to sit in and enjoy during the warmer months.  Parking is free on the road from 6.30pm until 8.00am Mon - Friday and all weekend. Pay and display is available outside of these times.
interaction: We'll be out quite a lot of the time, at work and in the evenings, but when I am around I'm very happy to chat and offer tips on what's good to do in London!
house_rules: - No shoes in flat (too loud for neighbours) - Please ensure the windows are locked (including bedroom window) and secure.  - Please ensure the front door is double locked on your departure, when you are last to leave.  - Please double bolt the front door on an evening when you are last in.  - Please turn off all lights (and electronics) after you.  - Please leave the flat clean and tidy as you find it. - Quiet after 10pm.
host_about:
Myself and Mike have just moved into our new flat and we really love the area.  We are both fulltime professionals, I work in healthcare and Mike in finance. We've lived in London for at least 8 years now so can provide you with lots of tips on where to visit during your stay. 
We keep fit at the local gym and at netball/basketball during the week, and enjoy going for dinner and drinks with friends on the weekend.  Having always lived in shared houses/flats we understand what it's like to rent a room and so we are really considerate of our guests and equally considerate to the hosts when we use Air BnB as guests whilst on holiday.

summary: This stunning apartment is perfectly located within close proximity to both Mansion House and Bank underground stations, London Cannon Street, Borough Market, The City, Tower Bridge, Tate Modern and Southbank. It is a great location with transport. The local restaurants, bars, free WI-FI and security services are just some of the reasons why you'll love this apartment. This place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers and families.

name: Modern Chelsea Bridge Studio
summary: Spacious studio apartment within the exclusive river-side Chelsea Bridge Wharf development, opposite to beautiful Battersea Park and the iconic Battersea Power Station. Walk 10 minutes or take a direct bus to Square in high end Chelsea and enjoy the cafes, shops and bars of the renowned Kings Road. There are also direct buses to Victoria Station (for Buckingham Palace and the Gatwick express), Oxford Circus and Knightsbridge.
space: Spacious open plan living area with a fully equipped kitchen and bathroom.
description: Spacious studio apartment within the exclusive river-side Chelsea Bridge Wharf development, opposite to beautiful Battersea Park and the iconic Battersea Power Station. Walk 10 minutes or take a direct bus to Square in high end Chelsea and enjoy the cafes, shops and bars of the renowned Kings Road. There are also direct buses to Victoria Station (for Buckingham Palace and the Gatwick express), Oxford Circus and Knightsbridge. Spacious open plan living area with a fully equipped kitchen and bathroom. Guest have full use of the entire apartment. Chelsea Bridge Wharf is one of London's most glamorous riverside development located just 0.75 miles from Sloane Square and adjacent to the wide open spaces of Battersea Park and the River Thames. Secure underground car parking is available at extra cost. It is also immediately next to the exciting Battersea Power Station project and the forthcoming Northern Line Underground extension. Sloane Square station is a 12-15 min walk or 10 mins by bus 1

name: 2 Bedroom Suite with Bathroom and Utility Room
summary: My place is close to the Maritime Museum, Greenwich Market, Cutty Sark, The Old Brewery, and the Observatory.  You’ll love my place because the location is in the heart of all the main attractions and a one minute walk from Greenwich Park and the Queens House.  My place is good for families (with kids). couples, and business travellers
space: This space is very private on the top floor of a town house.   There are two bedrooms comprising one double bed and two single beds.  There is a  bathroom  - for guest use only - you can access from the landing.  Rooms have a Smart TV and Freeview TV available.   The space includes a small utility room that has a washing machine, fridge and microwave for simple snacks.  Crockery and Cutlery are provided.  There is also a small hospitality tray for tea and coffee.
description: My place is close to the Maritime Museum, Greenwich Market, Cutty Sark, The Old Brewery, and the Observatory.  You’ll love my place because the location is in the heart of all the main attractions and a one minute walk from Greenwich Park and the Queens House.  My place is good for families (with kids). couples, and business travellers This space is very private on the top floor of a town house.   There are two bedrooms comprising one double bed and two single beds.  There is a  bathroom  - for guest use only - you can access from the landing.  Rooms have a Smart TV and Freeview TV available.   The space includes a small utility room that has a washing machine, fridge and microwave for simple snacks.  Crockery and Cutlery are provided.  There is also a small hospitality tray for tea and coffee. For parties of five or six guests, there is a third room on the second floor.  However, Please check the availability of the third room before booking, thank you. Someone will be available shoul
neighborhood_overview: Within easy walking distance you can reach, the Royal Observatory, the Queens House and the Maritime Museum, the Royal Naval College including the famous Painted hall and Chapel.  Greenwich market and the town centre is at most a 10 minute walk from the house and here also you will find the Cutty Sark and Greenwich Pier for boat trips to central London. For evening entertainment Olivers Jazz Club is always worth a visit - just a five minute walk from the house and open most evenings.  The UP THE CREEK comedy club is also nearby and is open Fridays and Saturdays.
notes: Free Parking for one car can be provided on a first come first served basis, but other than that, street parking can be very expensive from 9.00am to 6.30pm every day of the week.  Public transport is recommended in London generally if you're touring.
transit: This property is about as close as you'll get to the main attractions of Greenwich.   Rail links are very close too, Maze Hill is a 5 minute walk away on the Southern line, Curry Sark DLR is just 15 minutes walk and at the bottom of the road the bus networks run every 10 minutes normally and you are a 10 minute bus ride from North Greenwich Station on the Jubilee line  and here also you can visit the O2 Arena
access: For parties of five or six guests, there is a third room on the second floor.  However, Please check the availability of the third room before booking, thank you.
interaction: Someone will be available should you need assistance around the clock, however I would want to respect your space too and in this house you will definitely feel very private.   The rooms are very much away from the main thoroughfare of the house.
house_rules: - Shoes are left in the shoe rack on ground floor
host_about: Have lived in Greenwich London for the last 16 years and love the place

notes: Free Parking for one car can be provided on a first come first served basis, but other than that, street parking can be very expensive from 9.00am to 6.30pm every day of the week.  Public transport is recommended in London generally if you're touring.
transit: This property is about as close as you'll get to the main attractions of Greenwich.   Rail links are very close too, Maze Hill is a 5 minute walk away on the Southern line, Curry Sark DLR is just 15 minutes walk and at the bottom of the road the bus networks run every 10 minutes normally and you are a 10 minute bus ride from North Greenwich Station on the Jubilee line  and here also you can visit the O2 Arena
access: For parties of five or six guests, there is a third room on the second floor.  However, Please check the availability of the third room before booking, thank you.
interaction: Someone will be available should you need assistance around the clock, however I would want to respect your space too and in this house you will definitely feel very private.   The rooms are very much away from the main thoroughfare of the house.

The apartment is well decorated and conveniently located near London Bridge, Tower Bridge and Borough market. This is a fantastic place to stay if you want to explore London's most famous landmarks.
space: The apartment is fully equipped with everything you need for a short or long stay in London.  The apartment is modern, bright & comfortable with all amenities including TV, WiFi, dishwasher, washer, dryer & central heating. Both apartment offers a relaxing environment to 'de-stress' in after a busy day spent exploring the city.  With a fully equipped kitchen, you will have the utensils you need to cook up some tasty treats. That said, you're in one the best cities for eating out with cuisine from all over the world.

neighborhood_overview: Situated on the South Bank of the Thames, the area encompasses some of the best new build developments in London as well as the wonderful lateral warehouses of Shad Thames and the magnificent Georgian townhouses of Southwark. Combined with excellent transport links, world renowned cultural amenities and fantastic bars and eateries, the area is a truly outstanding place to live.  As a city with thousands of years of history, it’s understandable that certain London areas can give you the unnerving feeling of being in a time-warp. Strolling through the Victorian streets of Shad Thames next to the river, for example, and you’d be forgiven for expecting to find the likes of Sherlock Holmes or David Copperfield to suddenly leap out from behind a building. These narrow routes between former warehouses are frequently used as film sets due to their historic features, which provides plenty of amusement for the locals who often see actors in costume strolling along the unique iron walkways once u
notes: The lift is currently out of use, this is unfortunately something that the building management has not yet managed to resolve.
transit: The apartment is located between London Bridge and Bermondsey Stations which offer Northern Line Underground services and national Rail Services. There are plenty of bus routes surrounding the apartment that will get you to numerous places around London. There are also Santander Bike Stations surrounding the property if you feel like a cycle around the city. Check out the TFL Santander Cycles website for locations and information.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm - No parties - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply

neighborhood_overview: Elephant and Castle has a vibrant and metropolitan feel. There are lots of things to do, including going to the many international restaurants, fast food and pubs. There are many cheap shops in the area for buy food or others itens. You could go out a night in the Ministry of sound (the best electronic disc) or visit the Imperial War Museum. There are currently many new and iconic buildings being erected in this district which boarders touristic London. A thirty minute walk will get you to Westminster (Big Ben, London Eye, Westminster abbey, Aquarium, etc . .. .)
notes: Cleaning the house (bathroom and bedroom) everyday. We want to offer you a beautiful stay for a reasonable price, for that reason we ask a little cleaning fee.
transit: If you like walking, you can walk over to Westminster and visit all the major London attractions. There are also many buses going to the centre (and any night bus) goes very close to the house. You also have the choice of taking the underground (Elephant and Castle, Northern Line or Backerloo line). There is also a mainline train that runs to Elephant and Castle. You can walk to the underground station in about 5 minutes.
access: Guest will have their own set of keys and will be able to access all other parts of the apartment, including the kitchen where they will can heat food with the microwave. They can´t use the stove. The check in day we´re waiting in the house. You should send your time arrival when you confirm your book! or before day of the arrival.
interaction: We try to interact with guests as much as we can... we always tell to the guest where to go for sightseeing.
house_rules: In general this is a great place to live. (They can put the baggage in the flat after 8am) (ask me if you need a late check in (after 23h). CHECK-OUT: 11AM... (They can leave the baggage in the corridor and collect them before 9pm) BREAKFAST is available: 08:00AM - 10:00AM ******* NO SMOKING INSIDE THE HOUSE****** KITCHEN: Guest may use the kitchen on the following conditions: They wash up all dishes and cutlery. They clean all work surfaces and table. They return all utensils to their original place. It´s forbidden to cook. At lunch and dinner you'll only heat pre-cooked meals with the microwave and oven. You can use the kitchen until 22:
host_about:
We are a nice professional working, with a big house with spare rooms (shared ou private).

We love travelling and getting to know other cultures, good music and classic movies!.

I'd consider myself very friendly and welcoming, and I like to hang out with my family as much as possible, and i can advise on interesting things to do while you're in town.

We speak spanish, portuguese and a litle bit english ;)
 
Any questions, ask away!

Somos personas simpaticas y trabajadoras, con una casa grande con habitaciones de invitados (para compartir o privadas).

Nos encanta viajar y conocer otras culturas, somos amigables y siempre que podemos visitamos a nuestra familia.

Os puedo aconsejar lugares interesantes e increibles para visitar en Londres... También los turisticos!

Hablamos español, portugues y un poco de ingles :D

Sera un placer recibiros en nuestra casa!!

Portugues:
Somos pessoas simpaticas e trabalhadoras, com uma casa grande com quartos de convidados (Compartilhado ou privativo).

Adoramos viajar e conhecer outras culturas. Somos amigaveis e sempre que podemos visitamos nossa familia! 

Posso recomendar lugares apaixonantes e increiveis de Londres... Tambem os pontos turísticos!

Falamos portugues, espanhol e ingles :D

Será um prazer recebe-los em nossa casa!

neighborhood_overview: Situated in the upmarket residential and Tourist area of Bayswater in Central London the apartment is ideally located for all the amenities of Queensway, Westbourne Grove & Notting Hill. The apartment is served by 2 large local supermarkets within 5 minutes’ walk. There is also a huge range of tourist attractions, shopping hotspots, restaurants, fast food outlets, cafes & bars all within walking distance. There are also 2 tube stations a stone’s throw away to use as a base to explore everything that London has to offer. The convenient location of this apartment simply can’t be beat.   Some of the local attractions include:- Within Walking Distance Shopping & Entertainment on Queensway 1 minute walk Hyde Park & Kensington Gardens 2 minute walk Whiteleys Shopping Centre 3 minute walk Queensway Ice Rink & Bowling 3 minute walk Westbourne Grove Restaurants & Bars 5 minute walk Kensington Palace 8 minute walk Paddington 8 Minute Walk Serpentine Lake & Princess Diana Memorial 10 minute walk
transit: Getting around London couldn’t be easier. Bayswater Station is less than 3 minutes’ walk away & Queensway station is also less than 5 minutes’ walk away. Paddington Main line station with the Heathrow Express & National rail is only 8 minutes’ walk away or 3 minutes by taxi or tube. Almost everything you would ever want to do in London will be no more than 10-15 minutes’ journey time from this amazingly located apartment.

name: Charming flat in historic building by Oval tube
summary: A charming flat next to Oval tube station in a historic building offering a chic and comfortable stay. Next to the Oval cricket ground, between Brixton and Kennington making it perfect for families, small groups of friends. The flat is open plan with a double height living area, kitchen diner, 3 bedrooms, a bathroom and shower room. With an average 12mins tube ride to central London it is perfect situated for sightseeing, shopping and the West End!
space: The flat is located across the road from the tube station next to St Mark's Church and is ideal for visiting London. The setting is truly unique, in a historic building a conversion from an old children's hospital. The apartment is spacious and can sleep up to 6 people. It has an open plan living room and kitchen with a large balcony for relaxing after a day out. There is a 40' flatscreen TV for the evenings and superfast WiFi. There are three good size double bedrooms a bathroom and a shower room with luxury egyptian cotton towels.   Being a conversion flat with double height rooms and mezzanine floors, the headroom in some areas is limited: 198cm in the kitchen and two of the bedrooms and 190cm in the third bedroom. There is a washer & dryer for laundry.  The staircase is quite steep, but there is a handrail.

neighborhood_overview: It's super central just a short tube ride to Leicester Square for West End theatre, Piccadilly or Oxford Circus for shopping. With more than 10 bus stops on your doorstep you can go to the London Eye at Waterloo and the Southbank cultural centre with art galleries, concert hall and National Theatre. Locally there is a Saturday farmer's market at Oval church with fantastic organic food. Kennington and Oval has many cafe and local pubs as well as a wealth of restaurant choice (English, Japanese, Chinese, Eritrean, Columbian, Italian, Portuguese, Indian).
notes: cleaning / housekeeping company to make sure the flat is spotless for each and every single booking guest. For this reason we ask for a cleaning fee (per stay). We will be asking the company to clean the flat after every stay or every 7 days in case of a longer stay (prior to agreement).
access: Access from the city could not be easier. Apart from the tube (northern line), there are more than 10 bus stops around the flat and a public cycle station giving you every possible transport option. The flat is on the second floor - there is a lift - and a magnificent teak staircase.

HEATHROW AIRPORT - approx 60 mins (Picadilly Line) to Green Park. Then Jubilee Line to Canada Water. neighborhood_overview: This is a new neighbourhood which is still developing therefore you may see/hear some building work taking place in the area. There is a cafe called Lockside kitchen downstairs where you could grab breakfast, another one called Raw Labs and a pub/restaurant with a terrace outside called Gallions Bar&Kitcken. A Co-op supermarket is also conveniently available downstairs. The place is by the Thames so you could enjoy some time outside by the river.
notes: You would be responsible for the house keys and so if lost you would need to pay £20 for these to be replaced. I can only accept bookings for guess with a government-verified ID/passport etc
transit: Gallions Reach DLR station is a few minutes walk away. There are also a number of buses. It takes 6 minutes on the dlr train to excel, 12 minutes to Canning Town and 22 min to tower gateway. From Canning Town  on the Jubilee line it’s  6 min to Stratford, 14 min to London Bridge, 17 min to Waterloo. There is no parking available in this development.
access: You would have the use of the living room and would be sleeping on the sofa bed which can be extended. The kitchen and living room are open plan and although you may have cold & hot drinks or snacks the place is not suitable for regular cooking. There is a dish washer and a washer dryer as well as wi fi, sky tv and Netflix and a balcony with a table and chairs if you want to relax in the flat.
interaction: I am friendly and sociable and would be happy to chat as well as help with information about London. I will also be considerate of your need for rest and privacy. You will be able to contact me via message as needed.
house_rules: Guests would be expected to reasonably tidy up after themselves and place any used cups etc in the dishwasher. The guests would not have use of the bedroom but of the living room&kitchen bathroom and balcony only. You would need to be reasonably quiet and considerate of neighbours etc.

neighborhood_overview: Pimlico has excellent connections both day and night. It is also a quiet, safe and tranquil neighbourhood. This fantastic location is within walking distance of many of London’s attractions and landmarks to Buckingham Palace; Westminster Abbey; The Houses of Parliament; Tate Britain; Chelsea Flower Show; St James Park; Green Park & Hyde park! - There are a large variety of restaurants(Italian, Indian, Thai, Brazilian, Mexican Turkish and Chinese), cafes, and local English pubs close to us. - Few mins walk to supermarkets (Tesco, Sainsbury’s & Waitrose); smaller convenience stores; corner shops & pharmacies
notes: - This is a 3-bedroom flat without a living room. name: SC2 Two Bedroom Apt in the Heart of Shoreditch
summary: A bright two bedroom apartment in the heart of the action! Shoreditch boasts an array of flare with plenty of street art, interesting shops, restaurants, bars and the famous Sunday Brick Lane Market that attracts tourists from around the world.  You won’t be short of places to see and do in East London or jump on a train or bus into the centre to visit the West End, Oxford Circus, River Thames and Buckingham Palace.
space: This second floor apartment is situated just off Brick Lane close to transport, shops and restaurants. The apartment accommodates up to 8 guests with two bedrooms with a double bed in each, a living space with two double sofa beds, TV and free wifi, two bathrooms (1 is ensuite) and kitchen that comes ready to use with oven, stove top, fridge (freezer unavailable), microwave, kettle, toaster, pots and pans, crockery, glassware, cutlery and complimentary tea/coffee.  This apartment is centrally located so some street and surrounding noise is to be expected. Please note: We provide 1 double duvet per bed/sofa bed, 1 towel per guest and toilet paper is provided but not replenished.  This is our attempt to help save the planet, we hope you understand! IMPORTANT: Any infants travelling with you must be included as a guest (child).  We charge per human being and infants are included in this. For example: 6 adults, 1 child and 1 infant will be considered as 8 guests. * We require advance notic

Shoreditch boasts an array of flare with plenty of street art, interesting shops, restaurants, bars and the famous Sunday Brick Lane Market that attracts tourists from around the world.  You won’t be short of places to see and do in East London or jump on a train or bus into the centre to visit the West End, Oxford Circus, River Thames and Buckingham Palace. This second floor apartment is situated just off Brick Lane close to transport, shops and restaurants. This apartment is centrally located so some street and surrounding noise is to be expected. Please note: We pr
neighborhood_overview: East London is a lively and unique area with plenty to do and see!  Short walk to major tube stations (Zone 1), street markets, excellent restaurants and bars, independent boutique shops and cafes. You have everything you need in Shoreditch but if you wish to visit all the big attractions then you have easy access to central London. We are close to London Tower, St Pauls and Spitalfields market. For the West End, Buckingham Palace, Oxford Circus you just need to jump on the underground from Liverpool street which is a 12-15minute walk away!
notes: PARKINGUnfortunately we have NO car space available. Parking will need to be arranged on your own but you can find suggestions outlined below. CHECK-IN/OUT DETAILS CHECK-IN after 3pm. Your key will need to be collected from a local coffee shop called Bell Boi, 104 Sclater Street E1 6HR We are unable to receive EARLY CHECK-IN requests however Bell Boi has safe bag storage for only £5 per locker per day!  LATE SELF CHECK – IN is available and details for key collection and location will be sent to you.  CHECK -OUT is no later than 11am (a fine applies for any guests disregarding this time) ARRVAL TIME It is important that you let us know your approximate arrival time prior to staying with us. This is so we can arrange cleaners to prepare the room for you. If your arrival time changes please let us know as soon as possible otherwise you may risk the apartment not being ready.  WHO CAN PICK UP THE KEY? This must be the guest who booked the apartment and is required to show valid I.D and bo
transit: There are plenty of transport options from Shoreditch to anywhere in London.  The main closest underground station is Liverpool Street which connects you directly to Oxford Circus. Other stations include Aldgate East and Old Street which are a short walk away. There is also an overground train which takes you to other East London locations and connect to the DLR.  Bus #8 from Bethnal Green Rd runs to Tottenham Court passing Liverpool St, Bank and St Pauls. Unfortunately we can offer any car parking so you will need to either pre-book a car spot online or there are two car parks located off Brick Lane that offer all day parking, need to arrive very early before commuters or after 4pm. (not available on weekends) For after hours and weekend parking you can find free spots dotted around the area but you will just need to spend time searching.
access: Prior to arriving to the apartment you will need to collect the key from a local coffee shop called Bell Boi on Sclater Street.  Your key will be available from 3pm -10pm, if you arrive later than that you will be able to collect it from an after hours location near to the coffee shop. If you arrive before 3pm and would like to explore the area or go into central London then Bell Boi has bag storage available for only £5 per locker per day (open 8am -10pm) The apartment is located just 2 minutes from Bell Boi. You will access the building via a communal hallway and your entrance is on the 1st floor (NO lift access).  The apartment is private for your use only so you can make it your home and come and go as you like!
interaction: Feel free to message us on Airbnb (first preference), we live close by so are always around otherwise the staff at Bell Boi will endeavor to help you.  Inside your apartment we have provided a guest manual, which we highly recommend you read through it as soon as you arrive. It gives you important details about the apartment, contact numbers and useful information regarding the area.
house_rules: 1. We have a strict NO PARTY rule, if you have booked for a hen's, stag or birthday, you need to do all the celebrating outside the apartment. We will know if you are having a party and you will be instantly asked to leave. We will retain all the deposit if you have not been truthful about the purpose of your stay. 2. No more than the 8 people to reside 3. No more than 8 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use on the premises 5. People seen to be uncontrollably intoxicated may be asked to leave. 6. All breakages will be noted and may be withdrawn from your deposit. 7. Please do not give out our address to others. 8. Please do not get any mail sent to this address. 9. Please be considerate with our towels, linen and sofa. If you mark these with make-up, food or drinks, please endeavour to remove it when it occurs, as replacing these items drives up the cost of our service. 10. If a guest reduces the number of nights on the reservation; we consider it a cancellat
host_about:
Hi I am Hayley, I'm 32 years old originally from Melbourne, Australia.  I love travelling and our recent trips include India, Sri Lanka, Italy, Bulgaria, France.
I'm a hard worker, determined and excited to meet different people from all over the world which then gives me the inspiration to travel to those countries and immerse amongst the culture and food! I'm a huge foodie and love to cook and eat absolutely anything. 
I stopped dancing professionally 5 years ago as a contemporary performer due to a hip injury but it doesn't stop me from continuing to teach Yoga and Dance. 
I'm happy to share many more travelling stories and love hearing the adventures of others too!

neighborhood_overview: At the restless heart of West Kensington where you’re surrounded by busy shopping centres, transport hubs and office developments, it’s surprising to remember that within a few minutes’ stroll you’ll find attractive riverside walks, tranquil parks and village like enclaves to explore. And for many, the appeal of the area lies in this heady contrast of the convenient and the cultivated. Nearby Brackenbury Village has a thriving social scene and lots of lovely places to eat and drink. Walking distance to Kensington High Street, Holland Park, Fulham Broadway, Chelsea and the River Thames. 10-15 minutes from Notting Hill, Harrods at Knightsbridge; Hyde Park, Piccadilly Circus and Regent Street; the great museums of South Kensington; Kew Gardens and Richmond. There is fabulous local pub/theatre around the corner; as well as a real French café with the best coffee and croissants in town; amazing historic pubs along the river and restaurants including the Michelin-starred “River Café”. West K
transit: The London Eye: 30 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 40 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 25 minutes on the tube Kings Cross: 30 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 45 minutes by tube Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train

name: Beautiful large Stoke Newington house (Zone 2)
summary: Beautiful, large Victorian house on a quiet road in attractive Stoke Newington. 25 mins from Liverpool St and walking distance to Dalston and Clapton. PLEASE read our house rules/things to note below before requesting to book.
space: We live in a spacious Victorian house packed with original features, including Victorian coving, fireplaces, high ceilings, stained glass, large hallway and wooden floors.  Three (2 large and one smaller) light and spacious bedrooms (two with kingsize beds and one with superkingsize bed). Two bathrooms; the larger one has a bath & shower and the smaller one is a small room downstairs containing a loo and shower. Spacious sitting room with bay window, kitchen with french doors leading to garden, and a second sitting area with a picture window overlooking garden.   Mature garden with patio and mini pond which is home to Fishface (our goldfish). Please note that parking permit restrictions are in place on our road - please let us know if you require a parking space.
description: Beautiful, large Victorian house on a quiet road in attractive Stoke Newington. 25 mins from Liverpool St and walking distance to Dalston and Clapton. PLEASE read our house rules/things to note below before requesting to book. We live in a spacious Victorian house packed with original features, including Victorian coving, fireplaces, high ceilings, stained glass, large hallway and wooden floors.  Three (2 large and one smaller) light and spacious bedrooms (two with kingsize beds and one with superkingsize bed). Two bathrooms; the larger one has a bath & shower and the smaller one is a small room downstairs containing a loo and shower. Spacious sitting room with bay window, kitchen with french doors leading to garden, and a second sitting area with a picture window overlooking garden.   Mature garden with patio and mini pond which is home to Fishface (our goldfish). Please note that parking permit restrictions are in place on our road - please let us know if you require a parking space.
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Newington is well known for its large number of independent shops, pubs and great restaurants.  Time Out Guide notes that 'there are few places in London that offer the zest, charm and charisma of Stoke Newington...its restaurants are noteworthy for their diversity as well as their quality. Of course much of N16's success is down to the remarkably strong presence of independent business in the area, making it a truly distinctive part of the capital.' Dalston and Clapton are also within walking distance and contain yet more restaurants, cafes, shops and bars and lively Shoreditch is a bus ride away. Liverpool Street/the City is 25 minutes away by train; from Liverpool Street St Pauls, Barbican and Old Street are a few minutes/tube stops away. There is a well kept common with a children's play area at the end of our road. If you walk a bit further you'll find gorgeous Clissold Park, Springfield Park, the canal and marshland all within 20 minutes walk.  Additionally one of our favou
notes: NB: Guests must be over 30 and fully ID verified via Airbnb.   CHILDREN: Our house is not child-proofed/safe (eg no stair gates, cupboard locks etc).  - Please note that parking permit restrictions are in place on our road - please let us know if you require a parking space. These are currently £4.50 per car per day (Mon-Sat only) - If you are booking for 1-4 people but require all three bedrooms you'll need to book for 5 people. - If you would like to check in on a week day we're afraid we may not be able to check you in until 5.30pm although we will do our best to meet your requirements - message us for further info. - Please provide the full names of everyone who will be staying in the house when you make your initial request to book. Thank you!
transit: There are plenty of transport options. Train/Overground We are an 8-10 minute walk from Rectory Road train station and Stoke Newington train station. Dalston stations are nearby too. Tube Sevens Sisters tube is a short bus ride away or two stops from Stoke Newington station (zone 2). Liverpool Street tube station is 15 minutes away by train from Rectory Road station (also zone 2). Bus Buses go from near the end of our road to Clapton, all over Hackney, the City, St Pauls, the river, Angel, Oxford Street/Bond Street, Kings Cross and Victoria. Car Parking is free on our street and the streets around us. Parking space gets more limited Monday-Friday.  There are more spaces available at weekends. Taxi There are mini cabs in the local area. The Hailo and Uber apps are usually good value here too.
access: The house and its garden.
interaction: We will be immediately contactable by phone or email.
house_rules: - Strictly no smoking or pets. - No additional guests over the number booked or parties.  - Please ensure you are fully Air BnB ID verified.  Passport/driving license ID required. -  Guests must be at least 30 years old. - CHILDREN:  Our house is not child-proofed (eg no stair gates, cupboard locks etc) and so not suitable or fully safe for children.  - Please note that on weekdays we may only be able to offer check-in at around 5.30pm. Please message me for further info. - Please note that although parking is currently free on our road, from summer 2018 parking permit restrictions will be in place on our road - please let us know if you require a parking space.
host_about: We have lived in North East London for over 8 years, and we settled in Stoke Newington a few years ago.  We love living in such an attractive and vibrant part of London.  We're non-smokers, friendly, clean and considerate.

name: Take A Break 2
summary: Want 2 stay in a popular area close to the wonderful Croydon Town Centre buzzing with many places of interests including cinema, pubs,  places to shop/eat&with public transport of tram, train, buses to the City, West End , Stanstead&Main Airports?Thornton Heath in Croydon, is a splendid  location, local shops 2 minutes away, local train 10 minutes drive. Share a cozy single room with a single bunk bed or stay on your own in a welcoming, friendly yet quiet, well vented atmosphere.
space: As there are 2 "homes" it's possible for 2 adult family members of different sexes, ie mother/son to book their own space each. The bunk bed/rooms may host 2 related guests/family/friends  in total at any 1 time. A Wardrobe and bedside cabinets is available for use, also a desk &  folding chairs.  In the interests of health and safety, guests are asked not to burn candles anywhere in the house, for any reason. Meals inc takeaway meals like McDonalds, Kentucky and hot beverages must not be consumed in bedrooms - kindly use the dining room & table provided.  Dine in the dining room please on the dining table, watch TV in the dining room if you so wish.

neighborhood_overview: Popular with some local shops/grocer - 2 minutes away, supermarkets, facilities like opticians, hospital, dry cleaners, barbers, chemists, newsagents, cafe where breakfast/lunch may be purchased, good public transport & transport link routes to Central London/West End, Gatwick - 40 mins from Gatwick. As a resident I feel privileged to be able to access so many local  shops of different cultures, supermarkets,  choice of chemists & of course Surrey Street Market for a variety of fresh produce.
notes: Bath tub with shower available. Laundry may be arranged to be done on premises at a cost of £2 for 1 wash cycle, £0.90p for 10 minutes of drying, 20p per capful of soap. All paid for in cash & preferably with Sterling.  At local laundry its £3.60 for cheapest wash cycle & £1.00 per 10 minutes of drying. Guests are not permitted to dry wet/damp clothing/towelling in the rooms nor on radiators. All drying to be done via dryer or hung outside, however flannels/towels may be hung  in the barhroom. During cold weather around 5th October the heating comes on around 6pm & is turned off around 10.00pm; comes on from around/between 6am to about 9am & guests may take advantage of this. However if guests choose to be at home during the day in cold weather, the host will not have the heating on all day. Shoes worn outdoors are to be wiped on door mats, left in the porch area, please, which is safe. Thank you.
transit: Choice of buses, trains, tram line & connection to tube as public transport to and from the City/West End, airports, available nearby, as are mini cabs. Quick train ride to Gatwick Airport.
access: In addition to the bedroom,  bathrooms, kitchen; ie for breakfast preparation & meals. Dining room where all meals& hot beverages must be consumed on the dining table please. Laundry room under supervision of host. If a parent/adult wants to book a space for an unaccompanied minor, i.e age under 18 years, instead of booking a reservation/confirmation, kindly pls put in a "request" for the "host" to "consider" as for example if I intend to be out v.late, I wouldn't want to leave a "minor" in my house alone, even if the parent/supervising adult approves of the minor being left alone for a long time. Thanks.
interaction: If guests need help, just ask me & I'll do the best that I may.
house_rules: - Shoes worn outside to be left in porch area & not allowed inside house. Smoking in back garden only - Coats to be hung behind bedroom door on hanger. No use of wardrobe/chest of drawers for clothes, guests normally live out of their  suitcases.  - Heating is on all day only @ w/K ends, not weekdays & so facility does not suit persons who stay in the house all day weekdays. Guests not allowed to use any form of alternative heating without permission. Although guests are allowed to use the lounge, kitchen, laundry area,  etc pls be polite & ask first. Friends of guests staying elsewhere are not allowed  to visit guest at my facility. - Laundry done at additional cost. Please see above. Smoking allowed in garden only.
host_about: I've also worked as a medical secretary.

house_rules: Please also make sure all dishes and crockery that you use are washed and put away in cupboards. We will need to charge a £10 fee for the cost of washing dirty dishes (including dishes that have been left clean or unclean in the dishwasher) as this is not included in the cleaning charges.
host_about: Hi, my name is Celia. I'm a dancer and gymnast who loves art and travel. I run White Rabbit Property Management, which is a small property management company that helps real people to rent their homes on the short term property market (just like Airbnb). We are a small team of dancers and artists that specialises in the creative industries, working with amazing people and unique individual homes. Our mission is to make sure that both guests and hosts have the best possible experience of sharing their homes. All the properties we list here are cleaned and prepared by our team before arrival with fresh linen and towels provided during each stay.  We do our best to always have someone to meet you at the apartment to hand over the keys and and offer advice and guidance about the local area. We like to keep the lines of communication open so my team and I are always a message or call away. When I'm not busy with White Rabbit Property Management, I love to take some time out to enjoy this lovely city. My favourite places are the Royal Opera House and the Serpentine Lido in Hyde Park. I love to dance and seeing shows in the west end is one of the highlights for me of being in London. I like to travel in style but am equally happy up a mountain as I am in the city. I love to get lost and explore new places by simply soaking up the atmosphere.

name: Beautiful 5 bedroom victorian house in N-London
summary: Beautiful 5-bedroom Victorian house with a large sunny garden. It's located in Crouch End, north London, with numerous pubs, boutique cafes and restaurants. The house is perfectly located to explore central London: 12 minutes to Kings Cross and 18 minutes to Moorgate from the local train station. Two of the bedrooms have king size beds, one bedroom has a bunkbed suitable for children. One bedroom has a single bed, and one bedroom is set-up as a home office but a kingsize aero-bed could be setup.

The house is perfectly located to explore central London: 12 minutes to Kings Cross and 18 minutes to Moorgate from the local train station. Two of the bedrooms have king size beds, one bedroom has a bunkbed suitable for children. One bedroom has a single bed, and one bedroom is set-up as a home office but a kingsize aero-bed could be setup. Although this is our home, we holiday away regularly and enjoy sharing our home so that others can enjoy London. Crouch End is one of the trendiest and most sought after neighbourhoods in North London with a real artsy vibe, great pubs and a huge range of independent cafes and restaurants.  We love the village feel of it and the beautiful Broadway and high street.  A local and UK renowned comedy club in the King's Head.  A local lido and indoor swimming pool and two cinemas.  The house is locat
neighborhood_overview: Crouch End is one of the trendiest and most sought after neighbourhoods in North London with a real artsy vibe, great pubs and a huge range of independent cafes and restaurants.  We love the village feel of it and the beautiful Broadway and high street.  A local and UK renowned comedy club in the King's Head.  A local lido and indoor swimming pool and two cinemas.  The house is located opposite Stationer's Park which has a great playground, and Priory Park, Finsbury Park and Alexandra Palace are all walking distance. It is a friendly area with a lot of young people and families. Just a great place to chill whether you are staying locally or travelling into downtown London.
interaction: Although this is our home, we holiday away regularly and enjoy sharing our home so that others can enjoy London.
house_rules: No hen do's, stag do's or late parties and loud music or noise ... it's not that sort of area.
host_about: I am a school teacher and my partner works in IT. We are an international family and proud parents to 3 wonderful little girls. We love to travel and we’re always up for adventure. We are easy going and friendly.

neighborhood_overview: Streatham Common is conveniently positioned 18 minutes by train from Victoria, 7 minutes from Balham, 10 minutes to Clapham Junction, 12 minutes to East Croydon Station and 31 minutes to London Bridge.  The flat is a short bus journey from Tooting Broadway (333 or 57) (7 mins), Brixton (333) (23 mins) and Streatham Hill (12 mins).
notes: The flat is a short bus ride or less than 30 minute walk to Tooting, recently named by Lonely Planet as one of the "coolest" neighbourhoods to visit! Tooting captivating - revelling in multiculturalism and originality. Its high street, which stretches between two Tube stations, is one of the best ‘curry corridors’ in the country. The Tooting Commons with acres of green space is only ten minutes from the Flat.  It is home to Tooting Bec Lido – the largest swimming pool in the United Kingdom.
transit: There is free car parking on the streets next to the flat.  Otherwise, Streatham Common station is 4 minutes walk from the Flat or Streatham is only 10 minutes away.

I am happy to answer questions by text or in person on transport and sights in London to help make your stay more enjoyable.  I hope you will treat my little home with love and care while you are here.  I look forward to meeting and sharing the space with you.
host_about:
I am a young professional living and working in London.  I am originally from Northern Ireland.  I love travelling, exploring and getting an authentic experience on my adventures. I am clean and considerate, and I treat any home as though it is my own. I look forward to staying with you on my next trip! 

After many successful AirBnB experiences in Croatia, Italy, Berlin (to name a few) I have decided to open my home up to fellow like minded AirBnB guests.  I do hope you will enjoy your stay with me in London.  I also hope you will treat my home with the love and respect you do your own.  Can't wait to meet you!

This is a beautifully renovated contemporary 1 bedroom apartment with an additional sofa-bed which is comfortably sleeps two. The apartment has an open plan living and dining area. There is a comfy sofa for guests to use where you can put your feet up in the evenings and relax. There is also a TV here for guests, although I have a sneaking suspicion that you might not even have time to watch the TV given all the amazing things there are to see and do in London! The dining area has seating space for 4 people and is the perfect spot to enjoy some local delicacies. The living space then extends to the sty
neighborhood_overview: Live like a local while in London! Stay in zone 1, central London, with the Barbican Arts Centre on the doorstep, perfect for classical music, and modern art. My flat is situated in a quiet residential area so that you can get a good night's rest, yet you are still only minutes away from the bustling city. The flat is ideally located to enable you to get to many of London's best attractions: - 15 minutes walk from St Paul's Cathedral where you can access Tate Modern and the South Bank - Many buses in the local area with direct buses to Oxford Street which stop close to Covent Garden (can also easily walk down to Leicester Square from there) - Easy access to  Northern line (5 mins walk from Old Street, 12 mins walk from Moorgate)  Circle and Hammersmith lines (5 mins walk to Barbican) Central line (Liverpool street 12 mins walk) It is within easy reach of Stanstead, Luton, City, Heathrow, and Gatwick airports, as well as the Eurostar. The area includes: - lots of trendy bars and restaur
notes: The flat contains all the basic things that you need for your stay - hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel.
transit: The apartment is only 5 minutes away from Old Street tube station. This station is serviced by the Northern Line. This line will take you directly to points of interest in London such as Leicester Square and Embankment (alight here to walk to the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, and the London Eye). You are also only 2 stops away on the tube from Kings Cross station. This station is very well connected with national and international train services departing from here. There are also plenty of buses in the area, which are a great way of travelling if you like to have a peek at your surroundings as you travel. A great local tip is to download the Citymapper app. This free app will plan your journey for you efficiently and quickly. It gives you a variety of different transport options such as bike, rail, tube and Uber taxi. It will also take you step by step through your journey as you travel and notify you when you are nearing your destination. Directions: When walking from Old Street Sta

name: Cozy mezzanine double bedroom in a converted pub
summary: Perfectly located within 15 minutes walk of the green open spaces of Hampstead Heath to the North and the vibrant Camden markets and lock to the South. Our apartment is on the ground floor of the historic Carlton Tavern.  This well converted pub is full of character with heigh ceiling, cozy mezzanine bedrooms and open plan living. Homely, unique and fun.
space: It's a bright and airy apartment with plenty of character and charm. There are two double bedrooms with memory foam mattresses.  The bunk room has the bed on a mezzanine level.  The apartment boasts a large reception room and kitchen with a space for alfresco dining on the terrace.  Fully stocked Kitchen with Nutribullet for smoothies and Aeropress for coffee. If you like craft beer you can also borrow our growler and get it filled with the finest local beers at Clapton Craft on Kentish Town high street.

It's located very close to central London and within 7 minute walking distance to both Camden Town and Hampstead Heath.   This area is perfect for anybody wanting to explore London or simply to have a relaxed break in the capital.

To Eat: Pizza East (16 mins), Franco Manca (9 mins), The Bull & Last (18 mins) To Do: Swim in the Heath ponds (25 mins walk) or Parliament Hill Lido (15 mins walk), Walk across the Heath to Kenwood House (45 mins walk). Camden Stable Market (13 mins walk) For Kids: Kentish Town City Farm (3 mins walk)

house_rules: Please keep noise at a reduced level after 10:30pm to respect the neighbours.  Please double lock the front door (both keys) when you leave the house empty.  The security bars on the windows in the living room must also be locked at night and when you leave the house unattended. Enjoy your stay!
host_about:
My girlfriend and I are professionals in our mid-thirties. We are online entreprenuers meshing our professions (engineering and veterinary). Flexible lifestyles and giving back are our thing.

We love to travel, meet new people and explore new places. We also love to do amateur gymnastics, climb mountains and fundraise for charities in our space time!

I own an old converted pub in Camden, which I take great care of and love introducing to guests (it's delightfully quirky!).

One of the things I love about using Airbnb is the opportunity to explore other people's lovely homes and pick up unexpected ideas that I can use to inspire decoration of my own pad. 

"If your dreams don't scare you they're not big enough!"

neighborhood_overview: If you want to experience London at it's best then come to Earls Court. This area of London is central, safe, and packed full of cafes, bars, famous nightclubs, music venues and is close to world famous museums and galleries  along with beautiful parks. Home to the Earls Court Exhibition Centre where many well known television, music and cultural shows and events take place, Earls Court has become a top attraction for visitors and travellers. Earls Court has numerous additional landmarks which appeal to visitors, such as The Empress State Building, Finborough Theatre and also the Troubadour, a cafe which hosted up and coming artists like Jimi Hendrix, Elvis Costello and Bob Dylan. You'll also find traditional English pubs amongst the rows of shops along Fulham Road. You'll know them when you see them–they tend to fly their flags with pride. All in all this is an amazing and very safe area to stay in.
notes: • Do you have free WiFi?  Yes we have super fast reliable WiFi !  We will give you the wifi code when you check-in. • Do you provide linen and towels?  Yes all fresh, pressed bed linen and double size towels are provided.  • How many bathrooms are there?  There is one bathroom with a walk-in ceiling shower.  • Are infants able to stay at the property?  No. Unfortunately we are not able to accommodate children under 2 years at this time.  • Is smoking allowed?  Strictly NO smoking in the apartments and all ancillary terraces and/or common parts. If you want to smoke, you must completely leave the building. You will automatically forfeit your deposit if you are found smoking on the premises.  • Is there parking?  There is an abundance of Pay & Display parking in the Street and local vicinity as well as short-term parking in Sainsburys (2 mins walk), and a secure underground car park at Millenium Gloucester Hotel (6 mins walk) where you can pay to park for up to 24hrs at one time.  • Is t
transit: Earl's Court is a tranquil and picturesque area that is home to many young professionals, students and families. There are plenty of great restaurants & bars, including Evans and Peel detective bar and The Troubadour as well as many more to be found a 10 minute walk away in South Kensington You are Earls Court Station is just a 2 minute walk away from the property. Just 10 minutes walk to The Natural History Museum, Victoria and Albert Museum and the Science museum which all have free admission. There is also a host of green spaces and squares surrounding the property and Hyde Park is just a 20 minute walk away
access: The whole property is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay.
interaction: The management is done by a lovely local team - once a booking is accepted they will be in touch with the arrival time details and answer any queries you might have during your stay
house_rules: - - We expect all guests to treat the flat with respect like their own home. No parties or loud music are aloud during the stay. We expect guests to show respect to other guests at all times and noise to be kept to a minimum after 10pm.  Smoking is not permitted at all in the building.
host_about:
Hey Airbnb'ers!

I'm James, I work for The Air Agents! We are a group of Londoners who absolutely love our city and have decided to dedicate our time to helping hosts create the best experience for visitors! We have so much history and amazing new things to share with the world, whether you're into fantastic restaurants, local markets, sightseeing or nightlife London has it all!

I'm super passionate about sharing some of what we have to offer with people from around the world, love travelling and having adventures in new places!

Hoping to welcome you soon :)

James

name: 1 bed sleeps 4, West Kensington, 2 mins from tube
summary: Welcome to my home! My beautiful 1 bedroom apartment, in the vibrant area of West Kensington, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re just a 2 minute walk away from the nearest tube station. As well as the fantastic location of this property, it boasts large windows which allow lots of natural light to spill into the space making the space light and airy.  Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: My stylish 1 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of West Kensington and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the sofa, turn on the Freeview TV, hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. The sofa unfolds into a comfortable bed which sleeps 2. If cooking is your thing, enjoy cooking with family or friends in the kitchenette - ideal for mustering up a quick meal! All the appliances easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones.  The master bedroom has a super comfortable king size bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you need for a good night’s sleep? You d

neighborhood_overview: The desirable area of Kensington is popular for a reason. Actually, lots of reasons! There really is so much to do and see and this property could not be better placed for exploring! High Street Kensington is the famous shopping street and also where you’ll find the tube station. Let’s start with food. This area is heaving with great restaurants. For a chic and reliable option, The Ivy Kensington Brasserie is a good place to start! The food is good and their secluded garden terrace is a lovely place to enjoy a long lunch. Aubaine is another chic choice, a French restaurant with an expansive menu and vibrant atmosphere. Head here for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner! For a more local bistro feel, Ffiona’s is a favourite. This cosy restaurant is great for British food in a relaxed environment.  The Shed, just a short walk away, is a modern British restaurant where the plates are small but delicious. All the food is seasonal and the dishes creative; it has become a local favourite. Dir
transit: West Kensington is the nearest station to the property, just a 2 minute walk away. This connects you to the District line, meaning you can get to iconic London sites in no time at all, such as Buckingham Palace, Hyde Park and the Natural History museum. Exploring London could hardly be easier!
access: Guests have access to the entire property.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-lets management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.

If  you  are  visiting  London  for  your  rst time me  and are  not  quite sure on  how  to  get  around,  I  would  recommend  you  buying  an  Oyster  Card  at  any  of  the  various  TFL  machines  (i.e.  in  Kings  Cross  St pancras, Euston, at airports etc. ).   The  card  is  only  £5 (Non refundable),  and  you  can  ask  for  an  ALL  day  bus  travel  for  an  extra  £4.50.  Alternatively,  use  the  underground  for  fare  subject  to  each  zone:  In  King  Cross  (where  you  more  likely  to  have  arrived)  you  have  the  option  of  a  range  of  underground  lines. transit: If  you  are  not  sure  where  things  are,  use  the  Transport For London (TFL), Maps  apps  on  your  phone/website  or  drop  me  down  a  text and I will be more than glad to help you.

In order to make your arrival process go more smoothly, once the booking is confirmed, I am going to send you an email  (In the week of your arrival) with some info/tips pack about my flat/London/Transport links etc. Things such as how to get to my place from various airports, Map showing our location, house rules, equipment we have etc.
house_rules: We  want  you  to  stay  in  our  friendly  atmosphere  to  give  the  best  experience,  so  we  politely  ask  yo  u  to  try  as  much  as  possible  to  be  accommodating  of  the  folks  staying  in  the  flat: - Please  Keep  the  noise down  while  others  are  at  rest (Especially after 9PM). - Try  and  keep  your  belongings  organised  around  your  bed or in the locker. - Organise the space after you use it. - Don't forget switching off the lights in the bedroom when going out.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Karla and I have lived in London for over 10 years now. London is a spectacular city and this is why I decided to call it "Home" - To those of you who read this and have been here, you'll know exactly what I mean! It's just great!

I love travellers and that's why I am a travel agent here in London. I am originally from Brazil and have travelled quite a lot around the globe.  I do enjoy the travelling experience of knowing what's "out there". My first travelling experience was travelling from coast to coast in South America, we encompass a great diversity of landscapes and also time zones so not quite easy feat to do.

 I have been to most countries in Europe and some in Asia! I just love meeting new people and knowing more about their culture, life, experiences etc. I feel quite privileged to be a Travel Agent and have this contact with people, being able to direct them to some amazing locations around the globe and also welcome them to London - taking away all the hustle of travelling and providing fantastic experiences. It makes me feel good to see people enjoying themselves and also notice that, in most part, they are grateful for the service.  My motto in life is: " You always get what you give".

Karla

name: ★ Modern 3-bedroom HOTEL-APARTMENT ★ 7 guests
space: This three-bedroom flat is newly refurbished and located in Central-East London, ZONE 2. The area is safe and close to Stepney Green station and Whitechapel station. There are also plenty of buses nearby that take you anywhere in London in less than 30 minutes. The flat is split on three levels and consists of three large and bright bedrooms that can accommodate up to seven guests. There is a bathroom with bath/shower and a toilet. The living room has a table and two couches and it’s open space with the kitchen. Each room has a wardrobe, a mirror, and a hairdryer.
