name: London amazing view - new flat
summary: Our comfortable one bedroom flat right outside Canada Water station on the Jubilee line with easy access to most landmarks (London Bridge, Westminster, London Eye, Canary Wharf, ect) has a true city feeling with its amazing view.  This is the perfect pied a terre for new comers in London.  It Comes with a king size bed, a sofa bed, access to the rooftop garden and a gym. There are a 41'' flat screen tv and IPAD contolled Sonos hifi system. We accept more than 90 days booking only.
space: This flat can be booked for more than 90 days only. We provide a cleaning lady twice a week, but it can be adapted based on requirements. We also provide towels, bathrobes, bedsheets, etc...  One bedroom flat with amazing views of the Thames, Tower bridge, the Shard and The City. Fully furnished to high standards, fitted with a 41'' smart flat tv to binge watch Netflix, a coffee machine for your morning fix and a winter garden for yoga/wine sessions. There are IPAD controlled Sonos Hi-Fi systems in the living-room and bedroom, and Siemens appliances in the kitchen (Microwave, oven, dishwasher, washing machine, etc...). The flat comes with access to the rooftop terrace on the 25th floor, where you can have a 360 view to London and enjoy an undisturbed picnic on the sunny days.  There is also a meeting room with capacity for 6ppl on this rooftop terrace. In case you would like to use it, please let us know in advance, as it needs to be booked with the concierge. name: (B) Brick Lane Shoreditch Sanctuary
summary: My One Bedroom Apartment is close to Dishoom, Pizza East, Beigel Bake, Boundary Restaurant, Rooms & Rooftop, and Rich Mix. My First floor apartment has a nice and light. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and small families.
space: This apartment is located on the first floor of an apartment building just a few steps from Brick Lane and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street Station. Found right in the heart of Shoreditch, you will enjoy local cafes, design studios, galleries, cute shops and restaurants all at your doorstep. It comfortably sleeps 2 guests, but can sleep up to 4 guests using the sofa bed in the living room.

neighborhood_overview: Londoners and Tourists flock to Shoreditch for its Street Art, Street Food and Galleries. It has great night life, cafes and boutiques. Every Sunday is Brick Lane Market, and Columbia Road Flower Market. Box park is right at your door step, which has plenty shopping and food choices! Shoreditch High street overground station is just a 5 minute walk away.
notes: All Guests, including Children and Infants must be included in the reservation. *** FAQ's *** Q - Is the area safe? A - Yes, There are always lots of people around and it has a very 20s-40s vibe about it. Q - What Time is Check in?  A - 3:00pm - you will collect your key from Bell Boi coffee shop, 104 Sclater Street, E1 6HR  Q - Can I check in early?  A - Unfortunately not. Often there is a guest the night before and we can't kick them out early.  Q - Can I drop my bags there early?  A - No, but you can store your luggage at Bell Boi for £5 per locker, per day. Q - Do I have to walk up stairs A - Yes, your apartment is on the first floor. Q- Can I check in Late. A- Yes we have a self check in system after 10pm, however we may not be able to assist you after 12am midnight. Q - What Time is Check Out? A - 11:00 am Q - Can I Check out late? A - No, Sorry Q- Is it completely Private A- Yes Q - Do I have the whole apartment? A - Yes Q - Can I have 4 single beds, i don't wont to share. A - N
transit: It is situated in ZONE 1 which is the centre of the city. Near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. This is the City Centre officially. However, we are in the East End, NOT the West End as most tourists think (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st). It is still zone 1 but you will have to catch a short train or bus ride to the West End.  The Closest Transport is  OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Liverpool St Station OR Old St Station BUS #8 a few steps away, takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) PARKING I don't have a private car spot for you. There is a paid parking lot 1 minute away, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. Most Parking is free on Saturdays and Sundays. There are free and paid spots around you just may need to search a little.
access: You have access to the whole apartment - It has a double bedroom, a bathroom, a double fold out sofa bed and a full kitchen with a fridge, oven, plates, cups, utensils, toaster, kettle, TV and Free wifi * We provide 1 Towel per guest * Bedding for the sofa beds will be provided upon request or for bookings with 2+ guests. * A hairdryer, Iron & Ironing Board are provided.
house_rules: 1. We have a strict NO PARTY rule, if you have booked for a hen's, stag or birthday, you need to do all the celebrating outside the apartment. We will know if you are having a party and you will be instantly asked to leave. We will retain all the deposit if you have not been truthful about the purpose of your stay. 2. No more than the 4 people to reside 3. No more than 4 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use on the premises 5. People seen to be uncontrollably intoxicated may be asked to leave. 6. All breakages will be noted and may be withdrawn from your deposit. 7. Please do not give out our address to others. 8. Please do not get any mail sent to this address. 9. Please be considerate with our towels, linen and sofa. If you mark these with make-up, food or drinks, please endeavour to remove it when it occurs, as replacing these items drives up the cost of our service. 10. If a guest reduces the number of nights on the reservation; we consider it a cancellat

name: Clarkson 2
summary: Clarkson street is located short walk from Bethnal Green tube station. Less than 5 mins walk from famous Brick Lane and Shoreditch. The property is a new decorated to a high standard giving comfort for the guest to enjoy their stay either for business and as a tourist.

host_about:
I am a Londoner born and bred. A kind hearted guy with a love for life. I love my City and despite my travels I always hang my hat in London Town. 
Nonetheless I have a huge passion for travel and have had many affairs with other great places in the World. 
I have been in the rental property market seen 1997.  With my team of 11 professionals and my sister company further team member of 15 professionals we have been managing tenants seen 1997 and guests seen 2009. All together we hold decays of expertise and always make sure our guests are comfortable as possible. 
Airbnb allows me and others like me to enjoy "the reality" of a place. I have used Airbnb to visit all the continents in our World (Except Antartica) mixing with the locals and seeing the sights. 
My team and I will have all your answer in regards to the places you want to visits and things to do locally and nationally.

name: Chic, peaceful, central (with vinyl!)
summary: Enjoy this minimalist, calm apartment in one of central London's most creative areas. Perfect to retreat to after a day of sightseeing or business. Settle in with some vinyl or enjoy the local guidebooks. Get creative in the kitchen with the chalkboard walls. Surrounded by London's tech and design communities, the City minutes away and all of Central London's attractions are easy to reach.
space: Whether you are here for a few days or a few weeks, you have plenty of space to spread out, work, play and sleep. With a second bedroom, you can share the space with friends or colleagues. Although you might not want to share... Live with London's tech community on one side and Central London on the other. . Packed with all you need for work and play: Wifi Fully-equipped kitchen Washing machine  Aeropress Coffee Maker (well, it *is* Shoreditch...) With beautiful wooden floors with underfloor heating throughout; two distinctive and stylish bathrooms; a fully-equipped kitchen and a living room that you'll want to live in...

notes: Five Good Things About Kith & Kine: 1. Location. This is pretty central. Twenty-five minutes from the door to Oxford Street, Angel Tube station is 5 minutes away on foot.  2. The main bathroom. It's pretty lush. 3. The service. Enda lives a few minutes away and we both sincerely want to make you feel welcome.  4. The linens and towels. You'll get luxury hotel grade linens and towels. We use a great company called Best4Guest to provide these (as well as fab toiletries and other goodies). 5. Peace of mind. We recently got the Plum Guide diploma for excellence. They checked the place (and me!) out thoroughly and they reckon we're pretty good! Two Less Good Things About Kith & Kine: 1. The second bedroom. While it has a lovely double bed, the second room would be a bit of a squeeze for two people for more than a few days. If four of you wanted to stay for a few days, that's probably fine, but for an extended stay, the room is better just for one person. 2. Street level. The apartment is at
access: Included during your stay is use of: * 4G WiFi * Lots of hotel-quality, fresh, fluffy towels and crisp sheets (we'll refresh these when you stay longer than a week). Shampoo and shower gel too! * Welcome pack with juice, milk, Pact coffee, bread, teas etc * USB wall sockets throughout the property (you may not need adaptors, but we have those too) * Printed guide with advice about London, restaurant recommendations and local tips * Washing machine, iron/ironing board * Fully equipped kitchen if you feel like doing some dining back home * Essential household supplies: washing up liquid, laundry detergents, shampoo, soap, toilet paper, etc * Books and guides about the less obvious London and the local area * Hairdryer  * Turntable, kick-ass speakers and a selection of vinyl, old and new. * A little private space outdoors (still a work in progress, but nice to have it!)
interaction: We have been making Airbnb guests feel at home in our own home just around the corner in London since 2013. When you arrive, my trusted host Enda will be there to welcome you and help you settle in. We'll have plenty of local info ready to send to you in advance to help you plan your trip, and if you need anything while you're here, just ask!
house_rules: - Please remove shoes inside the house. - Smoking permitted in the outside space at the back. - We try to flexible about check in and check out. - Generally, check in is after 3pm (unless we agree otherwise). Late check in (after 10pm) is available for a £50 charge. - Check out is 11am (unless we agree otherwise).
host_about:
Hi there!

I work in legal (no, don't stop reading!) in London and I have the travel bug.

I lived with an Airbnb host for a couple of years and really enjoyed the experience of meeting new people and making them feel welcome. Now it's my turn to be a guest. 

Apart from travel, I enjoy ancient history, particularly Rome, Egypt and Greece. I am currently learning Sign Language (challenging!). And I love all the great things that a big city has to offer - restaurants, bars, museums and galleries. To counterbalance all that, I enjoy working out and yoga.

Airbnb opened a new world to me - I'd like to explore more!

name: MODERN, CLEAN & COMFY APARTMENT IN GREAT LOCATION
summary: A superb modern, clean and comfortable apartment located in Kennington London SE11. A great location for visitors and close to central London. Iconic attractions within walking distance include the London Eye, Houses of Parliament, London Aquarium and Imperial War Museum. The apartment has excellent transport links with Kennington, Lambeth North and Vauxhall underground stations all nearby. My place is great for couples, small groups and solo adventurers. I look forward to welcoming you soon!
space: This is a delightful one-bedroom apartment located in the heart of Kennington London SE11: a lovely village-like neighbourhood close to central London. Inside the apartment there is a spacious open plan kitchen/living room area, with large patio windows and door, that overlooks a large communal courtyard. There is one large double bedroom with one double bed. If you are travelling with a friend and don’t want to share a bed, then there is an air bed mattress available with an electric air pump that can be inflated so that guests can sleep in the living room. If you plan on cooking or preparing meals while you are here then you'll find a fully equipped kitchen, along with a dishwasher to make life easier.  A Tesco Express supermarket is conveniently located right next door to the apartment building which comes in handy for all your essential daily needs. In terms of transport links, there is a bus stop located directly outside the apartment building which will take you into central Lond

neighborhood_overview: Kennington village is located south of the River Thames in the London Borough of Lambeth and is classed as being part of 'inner London'. Kennington itself is the location of three significant London landmarks: the Oval cricket ground, the Imperial War Museum, and Kennington Park. In recent years, Kennington has experienced gentrification, principally because of its location and good transport links to the West End and the City of London.
transit: The apartment block entrance door is located right next to a bus stop which will take you to central London in about 15 - 20 minutes, or in the other direction Brixton in about 15 minutes.
access: You will be able to access all areas of the apartment. I'm happy to offer flexible check in and check out times that are convenient to you and your travel plans. By pre-arrangement you can usually check out up to 6pm on the day of departure, so that you can make full use of the apartment on that day too. And if you're coming in on an early morning flight, then usually I allow an early morning check-in so that you can relax after your journey.
interaction: I'm available on my mobile phone in case you have any questions during your stay.
house_rules: Guests are kindly asked to show respect and consideration for others living in the apartment block, including ensuring they keep noise levels to a minimum and do not disturb the neighbours.

name: 2 bedroom flat in historic Twickenham house
summary: A light-filled, self-contained basement flat with own front door in a beautiful Georgian house 5 mins from the River Thames, 10 mins to Richmond, 20mins walk to Twickenham stadium and 30 minutes to central London by train/tube. The flat has one double bedroom, one twin bedroom-cum-study, a living room with period fireplace, large kitchen with fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washer-dryer and bathroom. Beautifully decorated with with complimentary wifi and parking. Non-smoking.
space: A self-contained basement flat with its own front door, one large double bedroom with wardrobe, one single bedroom with trundle second bed and desk, large equipped kitchen with fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washer-dryer, comfortable sitting room with period fireplace and dining area, a bathroom with shower and tub. The flat benefits from gas central heating, constant hot water, its own hi-speed wifi network and textiles and pictures we have collected from travels around the world. Travel cot, high chair and other children's equipment available on request
description: A light-filled, self-contained basement flat with own front door in a beautiful Georgian house 5 mins from the River Thames, 10 mins to Richmond, 20mins walk to Twickenham stadium and 30 minutes to central London by train/tube. The flat has one double bedroom, one twin bedroom-cum-study, a living room with period fireplace, large kitchen with fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washer-dryer and bathroom. A self-contained basement flat with its own front door, one large double bedroom with wardrobe, one single bedroom with trundle second bed and desk, large equipped kitchen with fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washer-dryer, comfortable sitting room with period fireplace and dining area, a bathroom with shower and tub. The flat benefits from gas central heating, constant hot water, its own hi-speed wifi network and textiles and pictures we have collected from travels around the world. Travel cot, high chair and other
neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in a beautiful early eighteenth townhouse on one of the most prestigious streets in the Twickenham/St Margarets / Richmond area; We are opposite Marble Hill park entrance, 5 mins walk from the river Thames, 20 mins walk to Twickenham stadium, and surrounded by stunning Georgian architecture, with two houses with blue plaques.
notes: Please note the front door to the flat is accessed down a short flight of stairs. Please note that the twin beds are more suitable to kids than adults.
transit: The flat is located a short 2 min walk from St. Margaret's for local shops, restaurants, pubs, with trains to London Waterloo; it is a 10 minute walk to Richmond which has great shops, theatres, cinemas, riverside restaurants and bars, as well as the underground, trains to Central London, Ascot, Windsor and Eton and boats down the Thames to central London. There is bus stop a few yards from the house with buses to Richmond, Twickenham, Kew, Heathrow and Hampton Court. Ferry service across the Thames during the summer months to Ham House, Petersham Polo Ground and Richmond Park or walk along the tow-path to both Richmond and Twickenham. Also, nearby are Kew Gardens, Twickenham Rugby Ground, Syon House, Bushey Park and Hampton Court Palace.
access: Guests will be able to access the whole flat: including private front door accessed down a short flight of stairs, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, oven, washer-dryer and fridge freezer all at the disposal of guests.
interaction: We live in the house above the flat. We are available for any local information needed or help with the flat itself but otherwise will leave you free to settle into your home away from home.
house_rules: Security deposit is taken as a deposit against keys. If lost we change the lock,  so please take care of them.
host_about: A passionate traveller who spent the past 15 years living around the world from Paris to Brazil and has finally come home with my family to the wonderful neighbourhood of Richmond. Lover of textiles, design and interior whose latest interest is the beautiful architecture and parks in this corner of London. As a host who has lived abroad, I love creating a home away from home for people on their travels.

name: Cosmopolitan Rooms London Whitechapel - Room 3
summary: A twin room, situated within heart of London's Central East End conveniently positioned for the Canary Wharf, London City Centre, West-End, Olympic Village and all the great things London has to offer. The room comes with wardrobe, chest of drawers; desk, flat screen TV, shared bathrooms/kitchen with cooking facilities, a washing machine, fridge, iron and comes with complimentary tea/coffee and basic breakfast. We provide fresh bed linen and towels, free WI-FI and is centrally heated.
space: The London tube stations of Stepney Green, Whitechapel and Bethnal Green is only 5 minutes (500 m) walk away. The bed and breakfast is very close to the Spitalfields, Brick lane and Columbia road markets. You can find there unique presents and souvenirs, art, vintage and hand made clothes and jewellery, try excellent food and absorb the urban atmosphere of East London. You can easily get any part of London by Underground, Overground, Buses, River boat (Thames Clipper) or on street rental bikes. Oxford Street, Soho, Piccadilly, Westminster, Covent Garden, Greenwich are only 15-20 minutes away. A lovely walk on the canal, passing the oldest riverside pub 'Prospect of Whitby' dating back to 1520, will bring you to the beautiful St Kathrine's Dock and Tower Bridge in just 15 minutes. In the night time you are very close to the centre of London's night life Shoreditch and Hoxton areas with their unusual and quirky bars and pubs, one of the popular places for young people. transit: If  you  are  visiting  London  for  your  rst time me  and are  not  quite sure on  how  to  get  around,  I  would  recommend  you  buying  an  Oyster  Card  at  any  of  the  various  TFL  machines  (i.e.  in  Kings  Cross  St Pancras, Chancery Lane, Euston, at airports etc. ).   The  card  is  only  £5 (Non-refundable),  and  you  can  ask  for  an  ALL  day  bus  travel  for  an  extra  £4.50.  Alternatively,  use  the  underground  for  fare  subject  to  each  zone:  In  King  Cross  (where  you  more  likely  to  have  arrived)  you  have  the  option  of  a  range  of  underground  lines.  The  important  ones  are:   In Chancery Lane/Farringdon underground: CENTRAL LINE to Oxford street, Piccadilly circus, Notting Hill. Thameslink train to: Kings Cross where you can take the following: Victoria  line  in  Kings  Cross  Station  (Blue  line)  towards  SOUTH  to  visit  Oxford  Street,  Hyde  Park,  Green  Park  or  Buckingham  Palace.  Down  the  road  in  Euston  Station,  ta
access: Guests will be given a pair of keys so they will be free to come and go at anytime as they please.
interaction: I don't live in the flat , but my father Jose  is there most of times and he is the one , who will greet  you,  show  you  our  place,  hand  you  the  keys  to  your  bedroom  and  provide  with  freshly  washed  and  ironed  towels.   In order to make your arrival process go more smoothly, once the booking is confirmed, I am going to send you an email (In the week of your arrival) with some info/tips pack about my flat/London/Transport links etc. Things such as how to get to my place from various airports, Map showing our location, house rules, equipment we have etc.
house_rules: We  want  you  to  stay  in  our  friendly  atmosphere  to  give  the  best  experience,  so  we  politely  ask  you  to  try  as  much  as  possible  to  be  accommodating  of  the  folks  staying  in  the  flat: - Please  Keep  the  noise down  while  others  are  at  rest (Especially after 9PM). - Try  and  keep  your  belongings  organised  around  your  bed or in the locker. - Organise the space after you use it. - Don't forget switching off the lights in the bedroom when going out. - Use washing machine between 10am-8pm only.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Karla and I have lived in London for over 10 years now. London is a spectacular city and this is why I decided to call it "Home" - To those of you who read this and have been here, you'll know exactly what I mean! It's just great!

I love travellers and that's why I am a travel agent here in London. I am originally from Brazil and have travelled quite a lot around the globe.  I do enjoy the travelling experience of knowing what's "out there". My first travelling experience was travelling from coast to coast in South America, we encompass a great diversity of landscapes and also time zones so not quite easy feat to do.

 I have been to most countries in Europe and some in Asia! I just love meeting new people and knowing more about their culture, life, experiences etc. I feel quite privileged to be a Travel Agent and have this contact with people, being able to direct them to some amazing locations around the globe and also welcome them to London - taking away all the hustle of travelling and providing fantastic experiences. It makes me feel good to see people enjoying themselves and also notice that, in most part, they are grateful for the service.  My motto in life is: " You always get what you give".

Karla

name: 1 Bed Apartment in Baker Street f7
summary: A clean, modern and bright one bedroom apartment close to lots of great attractions! This flat is just 5 mins walk from both Marylebone and Baker Street station. Walk out from the flat and you will hit Sherlock Holmes museum, Madame Tussaud's, Regent's Park all within 8 mins walk. Take a quick bus ride to Bond Street in 10 mins.  The flat is cosy but fully equipped with all that you need for a comfortable stay! Sheets, towels all included.
space: Welcome to my home! This top floor one bed apartment is snug but what it lacks in size it makes up in its terrific location. And lets admit it - it is also cute to look at.  Located about 5 mins walk from both Marylebone station and Baker Street station, this is your dream flat is you are a tourist or a businessman or a poet in this city. If you are here for tourism and shopping, you can get to Oxford Circus and Bond Street in 10 mins. For businessmen, trains from Baker Street will take you to the City in 20 mins. And for poets - well there is the lovely Regent's Park on your doorstep! The flat has a double bed and sofa bed both of which come with linens. In the bathroom you will find white towels. The flat is professionally cleaned for each guest.  The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need for a quick meal - not that you would want to eat in when there are so many options all around you.There is a toaster, kettle, etc. in the flat. There is also an iron and ironing board

The flat is cosy but fully equipped with all that you need for a comfortable stay! Sheets, towels all included. Welcome to my home! This top floor one bed apartment is snug but what it lacks in size it makes up in its terrific location. And lets admit it - it is also cute to look at.  Located about 5 mins walk from both Marylebone station and Baker Street station, this is your dream flat is you are a tourist or a businessman or a poet in this city. If you are here for tourism and shopping, you can get to Oxford Circus and Bond Street in 10 mins. For businessmen, trains from Baker Street will take you to the City in 20 mins. And for poets - well there is the lo
neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in Marylebone - one of London's chic and trendy areas where beautifully dressed men and women sip coffee or the latest health juice on the High Street. That said, Marylebone is certainly not snooty, in fact it has a very relaxed vibe. I love the great transport links at Baker Street station which is only 5 mins away. There are also numerous buses that one can catch from Baker Street that will take you to all parts of town.  Tourists rejoice - you can get up early and quickly stroll down to the Sherlock Holmes Museum or Madame Tussaud's to join the queue. Alternatively, buy one of those London passes that allow you to jump the long queues.  Regent's Park which is one of the most delightful parks in London (its the home of London zoo) is also a 10 minute walk away. Some of my favourite things to do in the area is to stroll down Marylebone High Street all the way to Bond Street. There are many lovely interior design stores and fashion stores. You can find brands such a
notes: The flat is on the 3rd floor and no elevator so there is a bit if stair claiming to do - it keeps you fit our mom always says!  The flat is in the bang middle of the city so for light sleepers who are not used to being a big city this may not be an idea spot. Please also note that there is scaffolding outside the building.
transit: Closest station is Baker Street and Marylebone. At Baker Street, you can get Jubilee, Bakerloo, Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan lines. Main lines trains are available at Marylebone if you are going towards Amersham or the Chiltern Downs.  There are lots of buses in the area. Baker street area is also where you can find buses going to various airports such as Stanstead and Luton. You can grab the buses from the stop which is literally 2 mins from the flat.  If you are coming from Heathrow, I would advice you to take the tube (cheapest) to Green Park and change to Jubilee line there to get to Baker Street.

We are real local hosts and we are excited to share our city with you!

name: Large, spacious airy room in Knightsbridge house
summary: Beautiful spacious, airy room with views of garden & street in historic Georgian townhouse. Located in central Knightsbride, 1 minute walk from Harrods, 2 minute walk from Hyde park & the luxury shops, cafes, bars  & world class restaurants that make Knightsbridge renowned the world over. The house has a fully equipped kitchen & a lovely, private, secluded garden. There are modern bathrooms & cloakrooms throughout the house.
space: This old Georgian house is quite unique in that, while it boasts the modern amenities befitting of a property of it's type & neighborhood, it hasn't suffered the extensive remodelling that so many old houses have undergone. This means you can still sense within the house, the old grandeur of the period. As to to room itself, it is very spacious, has has high celings & modern, polished, wooden floors & is fully equipped with brand new furniture.

neighborhood_overview: When you stay with us, you will be spoilt for choice with the number of attractions on your doorstep. At one end of our street is Harrods, at the other is Hyde Park, with its numerous walks, trails & attractions. Buckingham Palace, the Victoria & Albert Museum & the London Natural History Museum are all a short walk away. Knightsbridge is world famous for its luxury stores selling everything from Lamborghini's to Cartier jewelry, but off the main streets, & around our house, you will find delightful, leafy neighbourhoods to explore. Here you will find one of the last places you can experience 'old London': A place that hasn't changed significantly in hundreds of years. There are meandering streets, secluded private parks, bars, cafes, restaurants & all manner of unique shops tucked away.
transit: The house is centrally located in Knightsbridge, which is in the middle of central London (It's only a short walk to Buckingham Palace!). We are a 5 minute walk away for Knightsbridge tube station which is on the Piccadilly line & connects with places like Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square, Covent Garden & Kings Cross. All other stops in central London can easily by reached with a tube journey of no more than 10-20 minutes & we will be happy to provide advice on travel if needed. There are numerous bus stops located no more than a minute's walk from the property by the Queen's Household Cavalry barracks & in Brompton Road by Harrods. These buses will take you anywhere in Central London. And I will be happy to give advice or direction if required.
access: Guests will have access to two modern, well appointed bathrooms (not en suite) & a mezzanine washroom.  They will also have full access to the kitchen (where there is complimentary tea & coffee) as well as the dining room.  Guests also have access to a beautiful, secluded, private garden at the back of the property.
interaction: I will be happy to help if needed. I will be away in the day, but can be contacted by phone or email at any point & will be available most evenings. I will be on hand through out your stay to provide help & support with anything from giving travel advice to recommending attractions & events that are currently on in London. I will also try to assist if you have any problems or issues during your stay with us.
house_rules: - Check in time is till 9PM only. Please do not book if you do not think you will be able to honour this time. If you do wish to have a later Check In (or Check Out) please contact us prior to booking to discuss. - The house is set in a prestigious & quiet neighbourhood, so we would ask all guests to be respectful of our neighbours when entering & leaving the property. This includes: - Please do Not slam the front door when entering or leaving the premises. It really isn't necessary. - We would ask that you don't wear outside shoes in carpeted areas. There is a shoe rack in the hall. - Absolutely no smoking or naked flames (candles etc) within the property at any time. - No parties whatsoever. No additional guests within the premises without clear, prior consent. Please leave kitchen & bathroom areas as you found them. neighborhood_overview: This central London neighborhood’s inner beauty matches its fashionable exterior. Reputed as one of the city’s must-go gastronomic destinations, Clerkenwell’s Michelin starred restaurants, historic pubs, and all-night bars attract healthy crowds who enter hungry and leave happy. This neighbourhood is more than foodie-friendly—theatre and design are hot commodities in Clerkenwell. Known for its great entertainment options and stylish thinkers, Clerkenwell strikes a candid balance between opulently hip and decidedly professional.
transit: Farringdon Station is less than 1 minutes walk from the apartment and it offers both London underground services (Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) as well as National Rail services. There are also plenty of bus services in the area and Santander bikes for you to hire. The London Eye: 40 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 21 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 85 minutes on the tube Gatwick Airport: 45 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 22 minute walk National Gallery: 30 minutes on the tube

description: Very central, beautiful, comfortable, modern and spacious basement studio flat with lovely patio just 6 minutes walking from King’s Cross St Pancras Station - famous for its busy Eurostar Station with lots of restaurants around. No better location in London! With 6 metro lines at King's Cross you go everywhere in London in just few minutes! My spacious flat is perfect for a couple or group up to 3 people looking for a fun stay in the central area of London with great transport links in a very quiet street. This big studio flat is furnished with everything you might need for a short or long term stay including wash machine, iron and ironing board, fast WiFi, extra blankets and books. For a really good sleeping night it has Venetian blinds that allow for accurate shading. Patio Everybody will love the spacious and charming patio with a table where you can have a glass of wine or a tea relaxing outdoors..    Kitchen  The kitchen is fully equipped with cookery and cutlery, microwave, kettl
neighborhood_overview: Just 15 minutes walking is Granary Square on the banks of Regent’s Canal. This square has over 1,000 fountains, look spectacular at night when lit. You can have lunch at one of the many restaurants. There is also a famous art school – Central Saint Martins. During day time, kids of all ages dash through the fountains, trying to dodge the jets.  There are wide, south-facing steps going down to the canal from the square. It is carpeted in green and makes it an ideal spot to relax and watch the boats slip by. On these steps, stage performances, Halloween shows, Flower show, Yoga classes etc are done. A very good spot to spend the day with family.
notes: Note that this is basement flat and there are six steps downstairs. Please read carefully the rules
transit: The King’s Cross St Pancras transport hub links six London Underground lines with two national mainline rail stations and international high speed rail. And with Euston Station just five minutes walk away, the UK’s major cities are within easy reach. Plus more than 14 bus lines to reach all London! So any tourist attraction in London will be reached in just few minutes.
access: Guests will have access to the full property.
interaction: You will meet me or a member of my family - Fabiana or Stela - who will greet you and give you the key and information about the flat and surrounding area. You always can contact us by phone, txt msg or email.
house_rules: Be aware of check in and check out times, please. Only people named on the booking are permitted in the flat, no external visitors and no extra guests overnight are permitted. No parties at the apartment and no music or noise between 10 pm - 8 am as many of my neighbours get up early for work. Take this very seriously, please No smoking in the flat, please. If you do want to smoke, please go outside the apartment. Sorry to be so strict but it might put off the next set of guests and cause me issues. Leave all dishes washed Report any breaks or accidents as soon as possible.  Lock the door when leaving the apartment and close all the indows
host_about:
Thinking about my passion for travelling and how nice it is being in a handy and homey place is why I decided put all my efforts to make you having the same feeling when staying in my flat. So, every detail has my care along the care of my family specially Fabiana and Stela who put their magical touch in this place as well.
Thanks for checking out my place and I hope to talk with you soon.

name: Luxury, Regency Style Apartment in London
summary: Experience true Central London living in this newly refurbished apartment. Classic high ceilings create a bright and airy space that is accented by luxurious and modern furnishings.
space: A ground floor apartment in a typical Regency style block in the Pimlico area in Westminster. Newly refurbished , the kitchen is fully equipped if you prefer to dine in. The bathroom has bath and shower. There is a double bed and two sofa beds accommodating up to 6 guests; there is an additional charge for more than 4 guests. Each sofa bed has been chosen for comfort.
description: Experience true Central London living in this newly refurbished apartment. Classic high ceilings create a bright and airy space that is accented by luxurious and modern furnishings.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the heart of Pimlico, a fantastically central location marked by garden squares, classic architecture, cafes and excellent transportation links.  The Houses of Parliament, the Thames River and Chelsea are all an easy stroll.
notes: The other flats in the building are residential so please consider our neighbours. This is a ground floor flat but there are a few steps within the flat to access rooms.
transit: Located in Central London, we are a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station, 6 minutes from Pimlico tube station and a 25 minute stroll to get to either Buckingham Palace or Big Ben. The Tate Britain is close we are on the doorstep of Chelsea. If you are arriving into Gatwick, the express train comes directly into Victoria and takes 30 minutes. Pimlico is characterised by its Regency architecture and garden squares. Although close to the amenities of the  city, Pimilico has its own personality characterised by delicatessens and boutiques. You are close to the river where you can take a relaxing walk or take a boat trip. Or hire a bicycle from one of the many pick and drop off points nearby. Located This  a residential Regency style  ground floor apartment will make you feel like you have truly arrived in London.
access: The entire flat is for the use of our guests. We will arrange a meet and greet time with our guests to welcome them or if they prefer, a local key collection point.
interaction: We will provide a welcome pack with access details and additional details to help our guests plan their trip.
house_rules: Not suitable for young children.  Please consider our neighbours, and we ask you to respect quiet time after 10pm at night. No loud music and strictly no parties, events or social gatherings
host_about: Father of three teenaged children, professional living and working in London...

name: Spacious 3 bedroomed family home
summary: This is a beautifully homely 3 bedroomed family home a ten minute walk from Forest Hill London Underground station. This line will take you directly to Shoreditch and connect you to central London via Canada Water station. There are close bus routes to Peckham Rye, Brixton and leafy Dulwich. The area of Forest Hill has many shops, pubs, bars and cafes. The house has a comfortable private garden which is available for use. The area has many attractions such as the nearby Horniman museum, which is within a 15 minute walk. The museum boasts an aquarium, gardens and farm animals. The area is also ideal for families with several parks nearby such as Dulwich Park and Crystal Palace Park with its famous dinosaurs. The house is equipped with all the things you will need for your stay such as washing machine, ironing board, flat screen TVs and many games, books and DVDs. Rooms: Double Bedroom: x 1 king size bed Double Bedroom: bunk beds (sleeps 2) Single Bedroom: x 1 single bed  An air mattress
space: Guests have full use of the property.

Rooms: Double Bedroom: x 1 king size bed Double Bedroom: bunk beds (sleeps 2) Single Bedroom: x 1 single bed  An air mattress
neighborhood_overview: Crystal Palace Park and Dulwich park are within walking distance or a short bus ride. The Horniman museum, which boasts a wonderful collection and special exhibitions is also within easy walking distance. Peckham, East Dulwich and Crystal Palace boast a wealth of restaurants, bars and cafes. Forest Hill has its own collection of independent pubs, shops and cafes. The neighbourhood is lively, yet peaceful with great amenities nearby.  It is also within easy access ( 15-20 minutes) to central London by train.
notes: We have a lovely cat who may not be at the property. She is often looked after by our lovely neighbours. Please note the the top bunk of the bunk beds is only suitable for children up to 13 years old. It is not suitable for large adults. The lower bunk is fine for older children and teenagers.  The property will comfortably sleep a maximum of four adults.
transit: The area is served by many bus routes and is a ten minute walk from Forest Hill or Sydenham tube stations. Forest Hill station will take you central London via London Bridge. Penge East and West Dulwich are within easy access to take you to central London via Victoria mainline Station.  There is free parking on the road and a spacious driveway in front of the house for you to park your car.
access: Guests will have access to the whole house and garden. The loft room at the top of the house is used for storage and cannot be accessed.
interaction: I will be nearby to answer any guests questions, or assist them in planning their stay.
house_rules: Please do not wear shoes inside the house. This is a residential area so please respect the neighbours and keep noise to a minimum.

space: A medium sized room in a 3 bedroom house with myself and my housemate/business partner. The room is equipped with the basic necessities including a queen size bed, WIFI, study table, a large cupboard and a ‘shared bathroom – which we clean regularly for all guests. Guests are welcome to use our kitchen too (but not for cooking), as well as our back garden and front patio. Finally, we have a parking space in front of our house for guests who drive.

Two key locations our guests may be interested in is the EXCEL - events centre but also London City Airport. We have a range of local stores, within close proximity including 'Gallions Reach Shopping Park', New Beckton Park, Asda, Lidl, Tesco and Sainsbury's. I am more than happy to direct you to these places.
notes: The room is perfect for 2 or 3 people and I prefere rent to 2 or 3 guests. Please, before booking, send me a message to verify the room's availability. Finally, we have a parking space in front of our house for guests who drive. Our living room is our work-office, at non-busy times we would be happy for you to join us for a chat. Thanks.
interaction: I am more than happy to interact with you throughout your stay to discuss any assistance you need e.g. in terms of directions to any general topic of interest. Feel free to get in touch with me during your stay.

host_about:
I am a cheerful guy and I would like to meet new people. I love Spain and Spanish people. I have discovered the beauty of London and its fantastic culture.

Graduated as an engineer, I moved to London to improve my English and to seize new business opportunities.

My know-how is based on Copywriting, Digital Marketing and Lead Generation Strategies.

I am keen on personal growth and I love inspiring challenges.

I often use Airbnb for my trips and, after my experience as a guest, I decided to become a host to offer the same special service that I did receive.

name: Charming 1 Bed Flat in Stunning Converted Vicarage
summary: Housed in a magnificent converted vicarage, this recently refurbished home is comfortable, characterful and located a stone's throw from London Fields. Walking distance from Broadway Market, Hackney Central, Wilton Way and London Fields station, and surrounded by green space, bars, cafes, galleries and nightlife.  Trains from London Fields run to Liverpool St in under nine minutes. Buses run from nearby Mare Street into central London, Dalston and Stratford.
space: Our flat is housed in a beautiful converted Victorian vicarage, designed by Edward Charles Hakewill in the 1860s. The building retains many of its period features including double and tripartite sash windows with stone dressings. The vicarage is set back from the street behind two sets of gates, meaning it is peaceful, secluded and secure. The street itself is a cul-de-sac leading down to a pedestrian/cycle entrance to London Fields and there's very little traffic. The flat is comprised of a cosy double bedroom, large living area with sofa bed, dine-in tiled kitchen and a modern bathroom. The decor is clean and elegant with vintage touches and in keeping with the atmosphere of the building. The property is surrounded by a peaceful private garden which guests are welcome to enjoy. There is also a larger adjoining flat with space for 6 people which can be booked together with this property. Please see my other listings. Strictly no parties!
description: Housed in a magnificent converted vicarage, this recently refurbished home is comfortable, characterful and located a stone's throw from London Fields. Walking distance from Broadway Market, Hackney Central, Wilton Way and London Fields station, and surrounded by green space, bars, cafes, galleries and nightlife.  Trains from London Fields run to Liverpool St in under nine minutes. Buses run from nearby Mare Street into central London, Dalston and Stratford. Our flat is housed in a beautiful converted Victorian vicarage, designed by Edward Charles Hakewill in the 1860s. The building retains many of its period features including double and tripartite sash windows with stone dressings. The vicarage is set back from the street behind two sets of gates, meaning it is peaceful, secluded and secure. The street itself is a cul-de-sac leading down to a pedestrian/cycle entrance to London Fields and there's very little traffic. The flat is comprised of a cosy double bedroom, large living area w
neighborhood_overview: London Fields is a lovely and well-designed public park teeming with life, with BBQ areas, a wildflower meadow and open-air heated lido. Our flat is walking distance to Broadway Market, lined with independent cafes, bookshops, bars and grocers throughout the week, and totally taken over by its famous street market every Saturday. This is the place to sample and buy artisan foods of all kinds, plus discover independent designers, craftspeople, vintage clothes and furniture. There's a carnival atmosphere whatever the weather. On the north side of London Fields is Wilton Way, known for its independent shops, popular pubs, award-winning restaurants and the legendary Violet Bakery. Hackney's main thoroughfare Mare Street is a few minutes to the east, and this is where you'll find larger grocers, high street stores, the Picturehouse cinema and Hackney Central overground station.  Also within walking distance is Columbia Road's iconic Sunday flower market, the V&A Museum of Childhood, the Reg
transit: The area is really well served by buses and two Overground network stations. The nearest Underground tube station is Bethnal Green, around a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus journey away. Oxford Circus: 25 minutes on the tube Trafalgar Square / National Gallery: 35 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 40 minutes on the bus Heathrow Airport: 80 minutes on the tube and train Gatwick Airport: 75 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 30 minutes on the tube and bus
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: Stefano is my co-host that lives locally and will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay. He lived in the area for years and is always happy to provide food and drink recommendations or tell you about his favourite local shops, markets and galleries.
house_rules: -  Please treat the home as you would your own.   - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - We charge £50 to replace lost keys
host_about: A northerner in London working in arts and publishing.

name: Large & Comfortable Private Room in SW London
summary: A private room in two bedroom character home (ground floor) in the SW London. Zone 2! Close to: -Public transport - Northern & Victoria line! Easy access to Central London London Bridge in 10mins Ox.Circus in 11mins Victoria St in 7 mins! -Supermarkets & Restaurants -Clapham Common and other parks Fully equipped open plan kitchen (tea & coffee provided), combined dining & living space with balcony & steps to our lovely courtyard where you can relax at the table and chairs, under the fig tree!
space: Super comfortable double bed, with great quality linen and towels.  Huge room - Plenty of room for your bags/suitcases!  We also have a sofa bed (L190 x W110) available for if you have more than two people in your group. The sofa bed is comfortable for one adult, or two children. We do allow 4 adults, however keep in mind that this is quite cosy! :) If you have only two people in your group, but would like the second bed made up, please let us know in advance. There is an additional charge for this.  Hair dryer provided in room & USB charging points on request. There is a travel cot for a little one if required.  Please advise if you need either the sofa or the cot made up when booking.   Kitchen is fully equipped and we are more than happy if you cook your meals here. Just make sure you clean up after yourselves, put away your dishes and leave things as you found them!  :) Please help yourself to milk, tea and coffee. Huge supply of herbal teas! neighborhood_overview: Hub of the South West, halfway between Stockwell (5-7 mins walk) and North Clapham (8-10 mins walk). There is a gorgeous little park at the end of the road, a great pub with a nice beer garden. Only 5 minutes walk to Sainsbury's or Lidl, great restaurants, bars & pubs. Excellent transport links (bus, tube & rail) or walk to Brixton, Battersea, Clapham high street and the common in 10-15 minutes.
notes: Whilst we do a thorough professional clean between each guest stay, we kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used. It helps us get through our cleaning process quicker and allows us to keep cleaning costs down for you and future guests. Bag storage is generally not available however we will accommodate when possible. If this is not possible, we always recommend the large train stations (such as Victoria, Kings Cross, Liverpool St etc.) or "City Stasher". We always do our best to accommodate early and/or late check in and out but this is not always possible. Standard check out is 10:00am and check in is from 3:00pm.  This is a private room in a two bedroom apartment. (We live in the other room!)
transit: ZONE 2!      0.2 miles/5-7 minutes from Stockwell tube (Northern & Victoria lines) 0.5 miles from North Clapham and the Clapham shopping & restaurant district.  Buses at the end of our street to Kensington, Westminster, Clapham, Wimbledon, Camden, Waterloo, Battersea, Balham, Peckham & many more.  City bikes only 100m up the road!
access: This is a private bedroom and a two bedroom apartment.  You will have access to all of the house, except for our bedroom.  Bathroom, kitchen & dining areas are shared with us. Cleaned daily.  -Kitchen  -Dining  -Living   -Bathroom (Bath, Shower and Toilet)   -Wifi -Balcony  -Courtyard with outdoor table and chairs - Relax under the fig tree! -Iron & Ironing Board -Hairdryer in room -Washing Machine available & Laundromat nearby (for dryer) We keep a small supply of London maps, tube maps, lonely planets and other information of what is on currently in London. There is a small welcome guide in the room of our favourite locals. Pubs, Restaurants, Places & Spaces.
interaction: We both work Monday-Friday & some weekends. We will be both available mornings and evenings should you have any questions. We are a friendly Australian couple and enjoy having guests in our home and meeting people from all over the world! We love to socialise but will be happy to give you your own space also.
host_about: We are an Australian couple loving life in London. Libby is a hairdresser and ceramic artist and Jordan is an architect. We're both 30yo, love travel, socialising, meeting new people and having fun. Our interests are travel, music, culture & cuisine and surf & snow.

summary: Luxury Two Bedroom Two Bathroom. Benefits from fully equipped kitchen, Nicely Renovated Bathrooms, Free Wifi, T.V. Shops, Supermarket and restaurants nearby. Its One minute from Bus stop and  Only 3 minute away from Bayswater , Queensway You will not find a better location

Its One minute from Bus stop and  Only 3 minute away from Bayswater , Queensway You will not find a better location Maintenance available when needed. name: SH7 Stunning Shoreditch High Street Studio
summary: A newly renovated studio apartment located on Shoreditch High Street in vibrant Shoreditch filled with colourful bars and restaurants amongst art spaces and active graffiti scene. Free wifi, 1 towel per guest and linen are included. Shoreditch is lively at night so street noise is to be expected but you are situated in the heart of the action with plenty to offer right on your doorstep!
space: The apartment is completely private a bed, a bathroom, TV, free wifi and fully functional kitchen that comes complete with oven, stove top, fridge kettle, toaster, pots & pans, glassware, crockery and  cutlery.  This apartment is comfortable for a couple, but can sleep a small family or groups of 4 using the double sofa bed. Being amongst the heart of Shoreditch please expect some street or pedestrian noise.  Please note: Infants must be included as a child when you are searching/booking as we charge per person regardless of age.  In an attempt to limit our carbon footprint we provide:  - 1 towel per guest  - 1 Toilet paper provided but not replenished   - 1 Double duvet per bed/sofa bed only
description: A newly renovated studio apartment located on Shoreditch High Street in vibrant Shoreditch filled with colourful bars and restaurants amongst art spaces and active graffiti scene. Free wifi, 1 towel per guest and linen are included. Being amongst the heart of Shoreditch please expect some street or pedestrian noise.  Please note: Infants must be included as a child when you are searching/booking as we charge per person regardless of age.  In an attempt to limit our carbon footprint we provide:  - 1 towel per gu
neighborhood_overview: You are right in the heart of one of the most colourful, vibrant and eclectic areas of London. Famous for the Brick Lane Sunday market and interesting shops, bars and restaurants are spread across the neighbourhood for you to explore everyday.  Columbia Road Flower market is only a short walk away held on Sundays.  Liverpool Street is a 14 minute walk which connects you directly to the centre of London.  Broadway Market is close by and runs every Saturday, it is worthwhile checking it out!   On the way you will pass Spitafields market which is a great way to spend a few hours. It offers clothes, jewellery, vintage stalls, pop-up food vans and cafes.   We are situated in ZONE 1 which is central London but we are in the east side near Tower of London, St Pauls etc. We are not located near the West End (Covent Garden, Soho, Oxford st) but you will just have to catch a short train or bus ride there. London is very accessible and easy to get around. Always allow a little extra time getting
notes: - Children and Infants Infants are considered as paying guests so they must be included as a Child when you book.  - Parking We do not have a car space. Parking is limited with restrictions and timed bays which become expensive. There are car parks dotted around the area but during the week they are booked up quite quickly (after 4/5pm will be easier to arrive and park)  On weekends: Parking is free  Otherwise perhaps booking somewhere in advance will save the hassle or expect it to take time to find free or available street parking.  OTHER FAQ’S  Check- in time?  - 3pm or later You will collect your key from Bell Boi Café – 104 Sclater Street E16HR  Arrival time?  - Please let us know your approximate arrival time. We base our cleaning schedule on this time and if you happen to arrive earlier than we had expected we cannot guarantee it will be ready but will do our best.  Early Check-in?  - No unfortunately early check-in is not possible; see bag drop-off below  Late Check-in?  - Yes
transit: The closest train stations are:  OVERGROUND Train - Shoreditch High Street Station (5 minute walk) UNDERGROUND/TUBE Train - Old St Station (10 minute walk)  Which takes you into Central London via circle and central lines.  OR BUS #55 it takes you into Oxford Circus, (stops passed Liverpool St, Bank, St Pauls, Tottenham Crt Road.) We do not have any parking spaces available. There are paid parking lots 1 near Brick Lane for weekdays, but these are not usable on weekends due to the market. You can find free street parking on Saturdays and Sundays but you will need to be patient and spend time searching.
access: You will collect your key after 3pm from a local café located just a 9 minute walk away.   The apartment is located on Shoreditch High st on the 2nd Floor with lift access. During your stay you will have access to the entire apartment and you can come and go as you please.
interaction: We live nearby so you can message us on Airbnb if you require assistance. However it is recommended to thoroughly read your guest manual when arrive which may answer all your questions.
house_rules: 1. We have a strict NO PARTY rule, if you have booked for a hen's, stag or birthday, you need to do all the celebrating outside the apartment. We will know if you are having a party and you will be instantly asked to leave. We will retain all the deposit if you have not been truthful about the purpose of your stay. 2. No more than the 4 people to reside 3. No more than 4 people to be in the apartment at one time 4. No Illicit drug use on the premises 5. People seen to be uncontrollably intoxicated may be asked to leave. 6. All breakages will be noted and may be withdrawn from your deposit. 7. Please do not give out our address to others. 8. Please do not get any mail sent to this address. 9. Please be considerate with our towels, linen and sofa. If you mark these with make-up, food or drinks, please endeavour to remove it when it occurs, as replacing these items drives up the cost of our service. 10. If a guest reduces the number of nights on the reservation; we consider it a cancellat

name: Duplex 2bed, 2bath converted school flat in Angel
summary: Welcome to our home! Our beautiful, open-plan 2 bedroom duplex apartment, in the vibrant area of Islington, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re under a 5 minute walk away from Angel tube station.  The property is a converted schoolhouse and has incredible high ceilings and a mezzanine balcony.  Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: Our stylish 2 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches and dark wooden floors. The high ceilings and large windows make the room feel spacious and bright. Relax on the sofa, hang out, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. The artwork adds splashes of colour and character to the room. If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the sleek, open-plan kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones. The ground floor bedroom has two single beds. Freshen up in the lovely bathroom - enjoy a soak in the larg

You’re under a 5 minute walk away from Angel tube station.  The property is a converted schoolhouse and has incredible high ceilings and a mezzanine balcony.  Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay! Our stylish 2 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches and dark wooden floors. The high ceilings and large windows make the room feel spacious and bright. Relax on the sofa, hang out, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. The artwork adds spla
neighborhood_overview: Islington is such a lively and varied part of London with tons to see and do - here are some suggestions! You definitely won’t be short of delicious places to eat - Islington has become something of a destination for foodies with tons of new restaurants opening all the time and lots of long-standing institutions. Trullo has been a local favourite for a while now - incredible Italian food with a laidback atmosphere, this place gets consistently glowing reviews. You will need to book. Bellanger is another popular choice. This place is modelled on a French Brasserie and you can head there for breakfast, lunch, or dinner for classic French dishes and a terrace looking out over Islington Green. Yida Sushi is a family-run Japanese restaurant - small and unassuming from the outside, this place is worth trying if sushi is your thing. For pubs, start with The Lamb. This cosy local specialises in craft beers and proper ale. They don’t serve food but they do allow delivery from a nearby pizza pla
transit: Angel Station is just a few minutes walk away and connects you to the rest of London with ease. It is on the Northern Line so you can get to Leicester Square in 12 minutes, London Bridge in 9 minutes and King's Cross in just 6!
access: Guests will have access to the entire property.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are an Airbnb management service team who know London and Airbnb like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the Airbnb platform.

neighborhood_overview: Shoreditch and Hoxton are London at its most cool – the heartland of the capital’s designer creativity, with cutting-edge galleries, great clubbing and live music, slick restaurants and exuberant fashion and interiors stores. Even unlovely Old Street roundabout has become known as Silicon Roundabout, at the center of (URL HIDDEN) boom that at the moment shows no sign of busting. Some may find the area’s fashionista scene a little over the top, but if you want to see London at its most confident and expressive, it’s the place to be, no question.

You will see a parking lot and the pub to the left from the flat and to right from the Tube.  There are lots of restaurant options in the O2 (near the tube station, the funny round dome building), along with a Tesco (grocery store), and bowling alley.  The Emirates airlines takes you on a scenic ride across the river. Once there you are a short walk from the Excel centre and a floating bar on a boat.  Greenwich village is a short bus ride or scenic clipper boat ride away that has many attractions including the Greenwich markets, maritime museum, the Cutty Sark and Greenwich maritime park. Canary Wharf is only 1 stop away and London Bridge is 3 stops on the jubilee line....There is lots of shopping at Canary Wharf and food options and the iconic tourist spots at London Bridge!
notes: Please no smoking at all not even on terrace and no shoes inside the house :)
transit: Your legs and public transportation is all you need. Your in London mate!
access: You are welcome to use the kitchen, dinning room and terrace in the morning (please no smoking on the terrace).  Lunch and dinner is expected to be enjoyed out as there are tons of great restaurant options close by (feel free to ask for recommendations). Throughout the day you have access to fridge if you want to leave food/ drinks in it. I usually always have tea / coffee available and milk in the fridge.
interaction: I'm available by phone, text or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) me anytime within reasonable hours.
house_rules: No shoes in the house.  Quiet hours are between 11pm -7am. No unconfirmed guest allowed.
host_about:
I'm American, lived in SF (before the techies took over) for 7 years. Since then I've lived in Amsterdam, then Bermuda, Yes as in the Bermuda triangle... and now I live in London!!

I love to travel and I do tons of it.

name: New Renovated & Spacious 4-Bed Apartment
summary: Comfortably sleeping 4 people, this newly-renovated apartment is both smart and spacious. Natural light floods the apartment and thus creates a peaceful and warming atmosphere, ideal to come back to after a long day of exploring! Plenty of sunlight isn't the only perk of this upper-floor flat which also has a balcony area leading from the living room, ideal for fresh air and views of London. Families and groups will find this apartment both appealing and ideal when staying in London!
space: After a long day exploring the hustle and bustle of London, my flat is ideal to come back and relax in. With a large living and dining area, fully-equipped kitchen and plenty of spacious bedrooms, staying here whilst in London is perfect! Our cleaners place fresh, hotel quality linen on the bed just before your arrival. The bathroom is brand new and thus clean, smart and sleek. With Stockwell Station a mere 5 minutes walk away, various overground stations nearby and plenty of bus routes, this well-situated apartment makes getting into central London an easy and stress-free journey. Sightsee, eat, drink, truly enjoy and experience London and then return to my apartment as the ideal base.

neighborhood_overview: Clues to Battersea’s past remain strewn along the banks of the Thames. The neighbourhood evolved from farmland to waste land, and then into its current incarnation—an adult’s playground complete with awe-inspiring parks, converted industrial warehouses, pubs and restaurants, and its very own heliport. Battersea’s location on the river is attracting the affections of developers, too. Even Battersea’s iconic power station is slated for a facelift more fitted to the neighborhood’s increasingly discerning tastes.
transit: Stockwell Station (Victoria and Northern Line) is just a 5 minute walk away and the P5 bus brings you directly to Patmore Estate. Queenstown Road and Battersea Park Stations are within easy walking distance and provide numerous Overground routes.  The London Eye: 30 minutes on the bus The Tower of London: 40 minutes on the tube and bus Heathrow Airport: 60 minutes on the tube and train Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by train Kings Cross: 40 minutes by tube and train
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.

Walk down new road till the end and turn left from opposite the pheasant inn pub. Walk to the end and turn right into field close and we are the last house on the left nearer to the hedges which is number 8. Feel free to call at anytime.
notes: Iron can be provided on request Tea coffee and kettle provided in room Small fridge with complimentary water and milk provided Breakfast bars Shampoo Shower gel Handwash Towels Bedsheets Duvet cover Pillow case Exta blanket in draw  Fan can be requested if too hot. Excellent field view through window. Nice walk in fields if you fancy taking stroll Desk and chair provided Hot Breakfast on request will be extra charge of £6 per person Which can be Boiled eggs or scrambled eggs or fried eggs With buttery toast and beans plus cereal. The pheasant pub with gran restaurant situated 3 minute walk from the house. McDonald's is 5 minute walk away Local shops 10 minute walk

host_about:
My name is yasmin and I manage  a sheltered housing scheme  and work very closely with the elderly. I am very much a people's person and find it very rewarding  to help people and like to make a difference in people's lives.I worked for a charity organisation prior to this job helping children with special needs which was very rewarding on a daily basis. 
I believe if you are kind  to people than people will always remember you.  In my spare time I like to read and enjoy yoga swimming and walking. I absoloutley love to travel and explore different countries and learn about different cultures.

Hi my name is Freddie and I work as a  hgv driver. I am very passionate about politics and history, love reading and researching on history  and philosophy . I have done  research and studied  most religions and cultures  and love to have a healthy debate.
In my spare time I like going to the gym and also like to travel and explore different countries.

We both are very warm kind and welcoming and love meeting new people from different parts of the world.

name: Cosy apartment in Bow
summary: The flat is located within a short walking distance of many lovely cafes, bars, restaurants and Victoria Park.  There is a nearby bus stop with buses to Shoreditch, Liverpool Street, St Paul Cathedral and Oxford Street.  Tube access is from nearby Bow Road Station.  The property is family (including baby) friendly, and there is free parking.
space: This space is ideal for visitors coming to London looking for a convenient, local and comfortable place to stay. The apartment is baby friendly and I can provide a cot, a high chair, and toys.  The bedroom has one double bed which sleeps two, and the living room is equipped with two comfortable sofas.  I can provide an air mattress to put in the living room for a 3rd person.  The kitchen is fully equipped with all the essentials, kettle, toaster and fridge. The living room has plenty space to sit around and relax after a day of sightseeing.  Bed-sheets, duvet and towels are provided. The bathroom has both shower and bath. There is no washing machine.

neighborhood_overview: The area is a perfect blend of London's many tastes and characters. The flat is located off Roman Road, a real gem of a high street with a good mix of independent shops and a palpable community spirit. Victoria Park, one of the most beautiful parks in London, is a stone's throw away.  There are several supermarkets nearby to suit any budget as well as lots of local eateries and pubs.
notes: Late check-in fees:  - For check-ins between 21:30 and 23:30 and 07:00 and 09:00 there is a £20 fee  - For check-ins between 23:30 and 01:00 there is a £50 fee - For check-ins between 01:00 and 07:00 there will a fee. Please contact us and we will agree to a fee depending on your arrival time  -There will be £20 extra charge for check-ins on Boxing Day and New Year's Eve (in addition to any other fees if the check-in is late).  - There will be a £20 extra charge for check-outs on Christmas day and New Years Day. For security reasons:  - We may ask you to upload a photo of yourself on your profile if you do not have one.  - We don't accept 3rd party check-ins. If you can not be present for the check-in you will need to add the person checking in to the booking and present additional information.
transit: The flat can be easily accessed by train from all London airports, major bus stations, and train stations.  There is free paid parking. If you need to park your car, please let me know when you book so I can organize if for you. You will need to park the car in the bays marked with V (visitors bay) and display a voucher I will give you - each voucher lasts for 24 hours. Distance to Attractive places by Public Transport : Tower of London: 27 min Westminster Abbey: 38 Mins London Eye: 39 Mins The British Museum: 40 Mins Hyde Park: 53 Mins St. Paul Cathedral: 38 Mins Piccadilly Circus: 38 Mins Oxford Street: 37 Mins Buckingham Palace: 45 Mins Churchill’s War Cabinet bunker: 40 Mins The House of Parliament: 35 Mins St. Martin In The Fields: 38 Mins Trafalgar Square: 40 Mins Nelson's Column: 37 Mins St. James Park: 37 Mins 10 Downing St.:  39 Mins	 Horseguards: 43 Mins Big Ben: 37 Mins
interaction: While I am away my place is managed by a professional company who will communicate with you from throughout the booking process and during your stay. Their super friendly team is available 24/7 to help you with anything you need.
house_rules: - The guests must present their passport/ID upon check-in.  - No extra guests (unless previously agreed with us) -For check-ins after 9:30 pm there will be a fee, ask before you book or read the full listing  - No third part check-ins
host_about: Hello. Home is East London and Somerset. I have lived in London, mostly as a Photographer for nearly 20 years but I am originally from Somerset from a little place called Frome. My travelling days are less frequent now that I am a new mum to a beautiful boy, however as my partner is from Spain we will be spending a lot of time there. Spain has to be one of my favourite countries for it's diverse landscape, culture, food and people. Favourite trip would have to be the Trans-Mongolian Express East to West...Photographed so many interesting characters and places. Can't live without good food, music and coffee..and my 50mm. Currently reading anything by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie. We have just started to rent out our flat a stone's throw from the vibrant Victoria Park. We hope you will relax and enjoy your time here in this awesome part of East London.

name: Comfortable Double Bedroom in Central London aptmt
summary: The 3-bedroom 90 square metre flat is on the fifth floor of Chaucer House in Churchill Gardens, a spacious quiet ex-public housing estate from the 1950s which is flanked by the Thames and the neo-classical terraced rows of Pimlico. It is a great base for everything in Central London, much of which is in walking distance: Buckingham Palace, Tate Britain, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey & The Houses of Parliament, London Eye and Piccadilly.
space: You will have views of The Shard and The London Eye from your bedroom. There's a built-in wardrobe and a TV. The flat is well-heated in winter and has plenty of light. The walls are thick, ceilings high. There's unlimited hot water in the bathroom.
description: The 3-bedroom 90 square metre flat is on the fifth floor of Chaucer House in Churchill Gardens, a spacious quiet ex-public housing estate from the 1950s which is flanked by the Thames and the neo-classical terraced rows of Pimlico. It is a great base for everything in Central London, much of which is in walking distance: Buckingham Palace, Tate Britain, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey & The Houses of Parliament, London Eye and Piccadilly. You will have views of The Shard and The London Eye from your bedroom. There's a built-in wardrobe and a TV. The flat is well-heated in winter and has plenty of light. The walls are thick, ceilings high. There's unlimited hot water in the bathroom. As well as your bedroom you have access to the communal bathroom and the kitchen in the mornings until 11am. For breakfast I invite you to help yourself to cereal, toast, and eggs if you feel like cooking, and to tea and coffee at any time.  If you wish to use the kitchen at any other time, please ask. I am usua
neighborhood_overview: Very central but also quiet and residential.
notes: Fresh bedding, towels, soap and shampoo and toothpaste will all be provided. I do not levy a cleaning fee.
transit: Pimlico is nearest tube station, a 7 minute walk (or 10 with luggage).  Victoria Station and Victoria Bus Station are a 13 minute walk away (15 with luggage).  The very useful No 24 bus route passes Churchill Gardens and goes to Victoria/Parliament Sq/Trafalgar Sq/Leicester Sq/Tottenham Court Road/Camden Market.
access: As well as your bedroom you have access to the communal bathroom and the kitchen in the mornings until 11am. For breakfast I invite you to help yourself to cereal, toast, and eggs if you feel like cooking, and to tea and coffee at any time.  If you wish to use the kitchen at any other time, please ask. I am usually accommodating.  *Please note*: The apartment is three-bedroom. I live here full time. The remaining single bedroom may also let to an Airbnb guest. **Please note further** : the lift serving my landing has just been closed for replacement (Mar to May expected). There are other lifts serving the building all going up to an open landing on the 8th floor, the most convenient one being to the immediate right (short end of building) of the closed lift. From there one can descend by staircase to my landing as an alternative to walking up the steps. Apologies for this inconvenience. I will be happy to help carry luggage on arrival and departure.
interaction: I will be only too happy to answer any questions and help where we can
host_about: After a banking career in London and Hong Kong I took an MA in creative writing and now write, also hosting great airbnb guests.

name: Urban Stay - Modern 2bed 2bath Duplex Apartment LC
summary: The apartment is located in the heart of the City of London, across the street from Liverpool Street Station. The apartment has two bedrooms and two bathrooms as well as a loft style living room and open plan kitchen. Everything is at your door step: from the best nightlife in town in Shoreditch, to great pubs, world class cuisine, amazing street food, shopping at Spitalfields Market and Brick Lane, and great sights (London Bridge, Tower Bridge, the Gherkin, the Shard, the Tower of London)...
