neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on a residential street directly off the bustling Bishopsgate in front of Liverpool Street Station, one of the capital’s most central and connected train & tube stations.  There are excellent restaurants, cafes, and pubs literally at your doorstep as well as conveniences such as a dry cleaners and Tesco supermarket within 2 minutes walk away.  On Sunday’s there is a local market that has all of the charm and character one would expect from an East London shopping trek – right in the centre of the city!  This renovated building sits quietly in the heart of one of the most vibrant and beautiful areas in one of the most exciting cities in the world.
notes: Urban Stay is a professional London serviced apartment provider. If you are travelling for work you may be able to benefit from our preferred corporate rates. In this case please just drop us a note.
transit: Liverpool Street Station is just across the street (1min walk). This area is an infrastructure hub for the underground, local busses, taxis, trains and airport shuttles.  If you are arriving at Stansted Airport, you can take the airport shuttle right to the doorstep of the apartment (Liverpool Street Station).
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment exclusively for the duration of their stay! Included in the apartments is free high speed WiFi, fresh towels, toiletries, a TV, DVD player, ipod docking station, cooling fan, hair dryer, washing dryer, ironing board, iron, fridge/freezer, oven and hobs, microwave, dishwasher kettle, toaster and all kitchen supplies (cutlery, plates).
interaction: Check-in will either be personal meet & greet or self-check-in. Either way we're available via phone for any questions guests may have.
house_rules: - We have a very strict no-smoking and no-parties/gatherings policy. Please note that charges also apply for breaking the house rules. - We can provide a baby cots and/or high chair for £5/night + VAT each if needed. - Pets may be allowed upon request and only with prior approval. Please note that a pet fee of £50 + VAT applies per stay for a deep clean at the end of the stay.
host_about:
Hi,

My name is James and my partner and I are directors of Urban Stay, a London serviced apartment company serving Liverpool Street, Notting Hill, Monument and Victoria. We would love to have you stay in one of our gorgeous fully serviced apartments in the heart of London! We take pride in our properties and we are responsive to any of our renters needs. Since we are local, we deal with all guests directly – from key exchanges, personal greetings and local recommendations to ensuring that cleaning, repairs, and anything in between is done in a timely manner to your complete satisfaction. All of our properties are fully furnished and have all the amenities of home!
If you have any further questions, I'm happy to help out!

neighborhood_overview: Surbiton is a beautiful suburban area of south-west London within the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames. This property is located in the most affluent area of Surbiton. Surrounded by period properties from many eras and new builds. There are many beautiful parks surrounding the area - Victoria recractional ground, Long Ditton recreational ground, The fish ponds (off Hollyfield Road) Alexandra Park - this park includes tennis courts, basketball courts, open air gym facilities, larger playgrounds for children of all ages plus huge open space areas for running, cycling, walking etc All the parks are within 10-20 minutes walk from the apartment.  Two of the famous Royal Richmond Park and Bushy Park is located a short drive or bus ride away. You can also walk to the River Thames in about 10/15 minutes where you can rent boats, paddle boards, bicycles, visit the Islands, have a cold drink or delicious food at one of the many restaurants and bars or just take in the breathtaking views on
notes: The property is located 1/2 minutes walking distance to Surbiton train station which provides direct transportation links to Central London in under 15 minutes! Also other great locations such as - Wimbledon, Clapham Junction, Walton on Thames, Guildford and Hampton Court Palace.  10 minutes walk to Kingston University. Kingston Upon Thames shopping central, it is 15 minutes walk away and has a choice of restaurants, bars, clubs, lots of shopping areas & malls and a beautiful riverside walk. The nearest airport is Heathrow Airport, which is less than 30 minutes drive, and Gatwick Airport, which is less than 45 minutes drive away - can also can be accessed by public transport. Also other great locations such as - Wimbledon, Clapham Junction, Walton on Thames, Guildford and Hampton Court Palace.  10 minutes walk to Kingston University. Kingston Upon Thames shopping central, it is 15 minutes walk away and has a choice of restaurants, bars, clubs, lots of shopping areas & malls and a beautiful riverside walk. The nearest airport is Heathrow Airport, which is less than 30 minutes drive, and Gatwick Airport, which is less than 45 minutes drive away - can also can be accessed by public transport.
access: Host will personally welcome you on your arrival to show guests around the apartment, help with any questions about the property and area plus hand over keys. The check in time is between 3-6pm but the host can be reasonable flexible. If guests are unable to make this time a key can be left for self check in. There is a coded gate from the High Street and secure lit back entrance with CCTV coverage.
interaction: Host is available via mobile or email 24/7 for help and advice but appreciates privacy and wants guests to enjoy their time during their stay and will not be disturbed.
house_rules: 1 - No Parties or events allowed  2 - No smoking inside the property  3 - No additional guests unless agreed with the host prior to arrival. Please provide first and last names of all guests staying at the property. Please confirm if the paying guests is staying or booking on behalf of friends, family or colleagues. Any child over the age of 4 will be classed as an extra guest.  4 - Inform the host of the nature of your stay before booking or as you are booking your stay when using the instant book option - business or pleasure? Do you have any special requirements? Are you a regular Airbnb user or are you new to Airbnb?   5 - No pets allowed  6 - No unsociable noise at any time. Quiet time between 10pm-7am - please respect the neighbours 7 - Check out is 10am. Check in is between 3-6pm. Please be sure to let us know at least one week in advance when you are arriving so we may greet you at check in. If the check in time can be met the host will personally welcome you into the property,

name: Whitechapel 1B flat, 5* transport
summary: Modern, comfortable, perfect for two. Be anywhere in Central London within 30-40 mins, so cool for exploring London like a local with a home here. Great for couples, solo adventurers and business travellers. Please note that there is currently some construction work going on for the tube station nearby and there can be some noise.
space: I have lived here for 7 years and it's a perfectly sized flat for 2 people. It's very modern and has all the stuff you are likely to need. My friends describe the space as a very zen! It's in a secure gated building and there is a courtyard with quite pleasant lawn space you can use. Neighbours are quiet and friendly, but there are times you can hear some sounds from the flats next door and some street sounds when the doors and windows are open. Although it's not intrusive but am letting you know to manager expectations. It's double glazed and quite warm.  Overall, it's a quiet, lovely, airy place.

neighborhood_overview: If it's your first visit to (Website hidden by Airbnb) looks gritty when you come out of the tube station, but trust me it's safe and once you come into the building you will see it's lovely. There is lots to see and do around here. East London is the place to be these days.
notes: Check in is strictly before 4 pm and available for check-in only on weekdays. The flat is on the 2nd floor and there is no lift. Check out is 11 am. If you have late flights, please let me know as I usually do my best to make it possible to leave your bags and collect them later. When you send in a booking enquiry, please let me know the purpose of your visit and a little bit about yourself. In your enquiry, please provide this code KC22 to tell me that you have read through the full listing details. Also, confirm that you have read the full description, you are happy with the rules around no smoking, no additional guests and no parties/noise. Also, I usually expect guests to have a few reviews. If you don't have any reviews, I may ask for additional information before taking a decision to accept the booking request.
transit: Whitechapel tube station is literally less than 5 mins from my door and has direct tube lines to pretty much most of London's most interesting places with the District line, Hammersmith & City line as well as the Overground. There are also buses to Oxford Circus and Paddington. I would recommend that you check the (Website hidden by Airbnb) site to make sure that tube lines and stations are working at the time of your visit. They do line works over weekends and close a few stations sometimes to allow for the works to be done. It's not a big problem though, as you can use rail replacement buses or the normal buses if the tube is closed.
access: You can use the full flat including the kitchen, washer and also the dish washer if you need. You can buy food and keep in the fridge. I will keep some closet space free that you can use along with clean towels, some basic toiletries. Basically, treat as your own home. As it's my primary home, you may find some medicines. Please do not use any medicines even if it's just paracetamol. There is a pharmacy in the nearby supermarket where you can buy any medications you require. Although, I hope you won't need any! Finally, I am south indian and eat very spicy food. You can use the basic condiments in the kitchen, i.e. salt, pepper, oil...but please do not use any other spices as it may be too much for you!
interaction: If I am in town when you arrive, I will greet you and then leave you. If not, you will be collecting keys from my caretaker. I expect to be available on phone, email or through airbnb. More than happy to chat before you arrive to help you make your London plans and feel free to contact me anytime during your stay if you need any help or advise.
house_rules: - It's a nice, clean space and I would request that guests make themselves comfortable but please keep it clean and tidy. Take care as you would do at home - so close balcony doors when you are out, no loud music or noise after say 10 pm so my neighbours are not disturbed.   - Keys - If I am around, I will hand you keys and show you around. If not, I will communicate with you before you arrive to give you details of my building caretaker who will meet you and hand you the keys. When you check out you can either hand keys back to caretaker/me or I may ask you to pop them in the mail box. - Sorry, no check in on 24th and 25th Dec as I won't be able to arrange for keys to be handed to guests on these days. - No additional guests please. - Please go through the listing description and also the House Manual for more details.
host_about: Avid traveller and nature (Website hidden by Airbnb) favourites include watching the aurora borealis at the foot of a glacier in remote Alaska and immersing myself in the warmth of Cuban culture and hospitality. Born in India but made in Britain having lived in the UK for 13 years. London has been my home for 6 years now and I love this city...each time I walk by the Thames and come upon the Tower Bridge, I fall in love with London all over again. I have been an AirBnB guest only a couple of times...once in Cuba which I had to book through a friend in the US and hence why there is only one review for me. Am a new host and looking forward to having my first guests soon I hope. Where ever you are travelling from, I hope staying at my place will play a role in making you fall in love with London too.

name: Joyful Notting Hill Studio
summary: This newly decorated studio is in a beautiful house, on the first floor, in the heart of Notting Hill. This studio has just been redecorated throughout, it has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in a temporary style. It has a TV and wifi. A travel cot can be added to the room if you require it at an additional cost.
space: Space The studio is self-contained, you have your own bathroom and kitchen. The bed is of double size and all linen and towels are provided. If you are looking for a pied-a-terre, an overnight stop off or a London hide-away, this is the place for you!
description: This newly decorated studio is in a beautiful house, on the first floor, in the heart of Notting Hill. This studio has just been redecorated throughout, it has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in a temporary style. It has a TV and wifi. A travel cot can be added to the room if you require it at an additional cost. Space The studio is self-contained, you have your own bathroom and kitchen. The bed is of double size and all linen and towels are provided. If you are looking for a pied-a-terre, an overnight stop off or a London hide-away, this is the place for you! During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you. Please note that there is no elevator in the building. We both live and work locally which helps when it come
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is perfectly sandwiched between Westbourne Grove, Notting Hill Gate, with Holland Park and Kensington a short walk away. You can reach all the local beautiful open spaces on foot; Kensington Palace, Hyde Park and Holland Park. Notting Hill Gate, Portobello Road, Westbourne Grove and Kensington Church Street are full to bursting point with cool bars, traditional pubs and fantastic restaurants.
notes: You should always check your Airbnb messenger thread as this is how we communicate with our guests. The keys are to be collected from a lockbox by the front door of the building. The washer/dryer is communal and situated in the basement of the building. There are hours within which it cannot be used, these are clearly signed on the door.
transit: You have a choice of buses that link you to Central London in just a few minutes. Notting Hill Gate tube station is a 3-4 minute walk or you can stroll down to High Street Kensington station in 10-12 minutes. Black cabs and Ubers are very easy to find and much of the local shopping and sightseeing is easily done on foot.
access: During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you. Please note that there is no elevator in the building.
interaction: We both live and work locally which helps when it comes to advice and recommendations! :-)
host_about:
My wife and I decided to start using Airbnb to rent out our serviced apartments, it's a much nicer community than the usual holiday booking sites!  We have 21 studios in our building and we encourage a family vibe with communal break-out spaces, on site cleaner and handyman whom you'll no doubt meet when you check-in.

Billie and I are based locally and are on hand if you have questions, and can always be reached by phone or e-mail.   We also have two amazing team members called Joanna and Anna (funny enough) who helps us organise the building. 

We look forward to welcoming you to London!

There is a newly built conservatory which floods the flat with light. It features bi-folding doors which open fully onto the garden. The kitchen is fully equipped for all you need to cook your home comforts. That being said, you are in London where there is such a vast number of restaurants on your doorstep! There is a new king sized bed with a Vi-Spring mattress in the bedroom, where hotel-quality linen and towels are provided for you. The house is professionally cleaned before your stay. Although the bathroom is small, it has been newly refurbished to high specifications and boasts a bidet, Italian marble tiles and iconic Burlington fixtures and fittings. neighborhood_overview: Kennington is excellently placed for some of the best cultural experiences in the Capital. It’s a mere 15 minute walk to the South Bank, the heartland of The Thames, and its theatres, galleries and concert venues, while the Tate Britain and Tate Modern are within walking distance, too. Trafalgar Square is also a short journey, only a 15 minute bus ride away, and you can walk from there to Soho and Covent Garden.  Closer to home, The Riverside offers locals the chance to indulge on the river front, whilst a riverside walk showcases the current development taking place in Nine Elms.  The 159 bus journey is a perfect way to start, as it crosses Westminster bridge over the Thames, where you can see the Houses of Parliament, Big Ben, the London Eye, Westminster Cathedral, continue through the Horse Guards and into Trafalgar Square...or continue through Piccadilly Circus to Hyde Park and Marble Arch where the journey ends. Or by cycling. There is a bike hire rack around the corner at Cleaver
notes: Charlie Chaplin used to live next door!  He wrote in his autobiography of a night he was locked out of the family room and listened all night to music from the newly opened White Hart pub, now The Tommyfield, around the corner. From Captain William Bligh, to Vincent Van Gogh, to Bob Marley, Kennington has been home to an array of notable people. It boasts landmarks such as The Oval cricket ground and the Imperial War Museum. For those who are interested in a few other facts...Kennington’s rich and varied history dates as far back as 1041, when Harthacnut, King of Denmark and King of England died here. Edward III gave the manor of Kennington to his eldest son Edward the Black Prince in 1337 (Black Prince Road runs from Kennington Road to the Embankment) and the Prince built a royal palace, called Kennington Palace, at Kennington Cross. At the beginning of the 18th century the area was essentially a village with a Common (now Kennington Park) on which public executions took place. Kennin
transit: Tube: Kennington locals have the choice of three Tube stations. On the Northern Line, Kennington and Oval stations are both in Zone 2. Nearby Lambeth North is on the Bakerloo Line and is in Zone 1.  Kennington is easily reached from Waterloo station and Charing Cross, both on the Northern Line. King’s Cross and Euston stations are also on the Northern Line as well as central London’s Leicester Square.  Road: Once you’re out of the traffic on the busy A3, it takes under an hour to reach the M25, or 40 minutes to get to the M1 if you’re heading north. Bus: The area is extremely well connected. Buses from Kennington Oval and Kennington Cross serve several areas in south London including Brixton, Crystal Palace, Streatham and Tooting. Travel north via the 133 (to Liverpool Street), 59 (to King’s Cross) and the 159 (to Marble Arch) or 3 goes through Westminster, Trafalgar Square (15 minutes) and Piccadilly Circus. Cycle: For many locals, cycling is their main mode of transport. It only take

Especially when the conservatory doors are open (it is a residential area with young children and elderly who may be sleeping during the day)  - No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply. - Please do not use the sofa as a bed. You will be charged for the cleaning of the sofa if it has been used in this way. - Please absolutely no smoking inside or outside.

notes: You are renting a room in my home and there may be other guests staying during your stay however guests are asked not to treat it as a B&B or Hotel but as they would if they  are staying at a friends house.  Please leave the bathroom as clean and tidy as you find it and try not to get too much water on the floor to make it wet and slippery for other people. PLEASE DO NOT INVITE FRIENDS INTO THE APARTMENT AT ANY TIME. Please enter and leave quietly and respect the neighbours. transit: Paddington a 5 minute walk from the apartment is one of London's transport hubs. With multiple rail, London Underground, bus, cycle hire options you can get across London fast. name: Zone 1 Apartment by the Canal 5 mins to Eurostar
summary: St Pancras Private 1 bedroom Penthouse overlooking nature reserve & the canal in exclusive, private gated mews. The bedroom has a memory foam king size bed, TV, USB charging points & private shower room/toilet with power shower. The apartment also has kitchenette & lounge with large TV (HDMI cable), panoramic patio doors opening onto the south facing sun terrace - home to Kings Cross's only grapevine! It is 6 mins walk to Eurostar/Kings Cross. The Penthouse is our home when we're in London.
space: To quote one of our guests, " The place is centrally located just at the edge of Westminster area. So if you are here for a holiday this is the place to be. Also Kings Cross St Pancras is the station to connect you to all the airports on a direct route without train changes and is about 5 min walk",  Sumeet Mahajan, 22nd March (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The Penthouse Suite is totally unique in this neighbourhood.  You see the WoW factor the second you enter the lounge.  3 large sliding patio doors can open fully to bring the outside in.  It is truly lovely on a pleasant evening to sit and watch the world go by or spot the various birds in the nature reserve after a long day sightseeing or working.  The lounge also has a huge TV.  The house has fast Virgin broadband WiFi. The bedroom has a king size bed with a luxury memory foam mattress.  A glass sliding door leads to the private shower wet room and toilet.  The shower is powerful with overhead and a hose.  There is also a cool bi

neighborhood_overview: Kings Cross is the most happening, trendy part of London and we are a buzzing community. Since the Eurostar was relocated here a few years ago, the whole area and the canal has had millions of £'s worth of investment.  New theaters, bars, restaurants, shops and homes. Locally, there is lots to do.  Camden (20 minutes walk by canal) and Angel (Chapel Market – 5 minutes walk) are very close by with great bars and restaurants too, swimming pool (200m walk along the road), The Canal Museum, St Martins Art College and Kings Place (a concert hall complex with music, comedy, art and drama performances) and Granary Square. The British Library and Francis Crick Institute are 7 minutes walk
notes: If you are flying into Gatwick or Luton, the 'Bedford' train line runs from Brighton to Bedford and back stopping at Gatwick, St Pancras (Kings Cross), and Luton.  Unlike the Gatwick Express which goes to Victoria,  this train from Gatwick direct to St Pancras is cheaper.  If you have an Oyster card or 'contact less' debit card it is even more cheap.  From Heathrow, you can take the tube Piccadilly line direct to Kings Cross (about 1.25 hour).  You can also take the Heathrow express or a bus to Paddington and then take the Circle Line to Kings Cross
transit: You can get everywhere easily from Kings Cross.  Numerous tubes, trains, buses, City bikes stand (30 seconds away).
access: Guests have access to the main reception kitchen/dining area/lounge on the ground floor, the hall, stairs and sole access to the Penthouse Suite which is the entire top floor.   The house is in a gated mews and also has a communal garden which guests can use.
interaction: We mainly give our guests space as most guests just want to get going to explore London. We are also very happy to give help advice to guests before, during and after they stay with us. We can be contacted in person, via Phone, text, email and Air BnB app.  The best reward for being a Airbb host is when we do have social time with guests. That makes being a host really worth it.  We have had the pleasure of being in company of some really lovely interesting people from all over the world staying in our home. We say to guests and guests say to us too. It would have been so nice to have spent more with you.   Its so fantastic when we get repeat bookings from guests staying with us once again in our home. Either myself (Christina), Leslie (my partner) or one of our co hosts/housekeepers (Fay, Angie, Aysha & Tracey)  will be available throughout your stay if you need us and to offer advice on places to go along with practical help such as Oyster cards.
house_rules: No BBQ's, Smoking, naked flames or candles in or around the house including roof terrace/balcony and gardens. Only our own trusted laundry products to be used in the washing machine and we are grateful for donations to cover the costs replacing the washing liquid, machine maintenance etc.  Please wipe dry the rubber door seal with the cloth on the sink and leave the door open to dry.  The program is 'Mixed 30'. Other check in times may be possible.  Please ask for your requirements and where ever possible we will accommodate them. No high heeled shoes inside the house - they damage the wooden floors Please wash up, clean microwave, oven, hob and leave the kitchen clean and tidy. Dispose of all take way packaging and wrap up unwanted food streight after consumption and place into the correct outside trash bins. Use extraction fan whilst cooking including microwave and if possible leave extractor on for one extra hour after cooking  to clear the air. Thanks this keeps things nice for eve
host_about:
I am Christina and my partner is called Leslie and we have 6 listings, all in our large Central London home.  We are true Londoners born and bred.  We know our City very well and are happy to offer advice and suggestions on places to go, or best avoided and things to do.  Our style of hosting is... we are available if you need us but offer you privacy and space too.

We have a self contained penthouse overlooking the canal.  The other room over looking the Canal is our en-suite  Canal Room. Three of the listings have their own private bathrooms. The back of the house overlooks a nature reserve leading to the canal.  One of our rooms is our spacious Rock & Roll Music Room and has access to a cute walled garden complete with a grape vine! We believe it is the only one in Central London of this magnitude We also have the Long Room and the Square Room which are both doubles and share the main bathroom with the Gold Room. The Gold room (Harry Potter theme) a little room that thinks big!  Although it is compact and great value it has French doors leading to the walled garden, TV, USB and all the same facilities as our other larger rooms.  In fact just like our other rooms, it has all a traveller needs!

We love London and all it has to offer!  Our interests are music, going to gym, salsa dancing, long walks, running and cycling…to name a few  I am  sound engineer and percussionist.  Leslie is a sports massage therapist and he is a musician.

Our favourite place when not in London is Busanna Vecchia – the artists’ village near San Remo in Italy.  We also love the quiet unspoiled North of the island of Tenerife.

This house has been a house share for over 10 years and now Airbnb so we are very used to having a variety of people staying here. Many of our past sharers still stay in touch from all parts of the World. People tell us it's a chilled-out house and they like  that we are by the canal.  Many of our Air BnB guests returnto us many times, which we feel is a great compliment!

When we are away, our fantastic Co hosts to look after our guests. We are always at the end of a phone for our guests too. 

Our life's motto:-   Always get something good out of every day because once that day is gone, you can never get it back.

neighborhood_overview: It's the most fun place to be in London. Brick Lane has a party atmosphere every evening and this flat is just far enough away that you don't get the noise. Shoreditch is 10 minutes walk away. It has a great night life at the weekend. The most exciting restaurants, cafés and bars in London open in this neighbourhood. The area has a rich and fascinating history, which can be enjoyed through one of the walking tours available. The Jack the Ripper tour is very popular. There are many artists, galleries and artist studios nearby. One can even go on a tour of the artist Banksy's work in the area. You are also 15 minutes walk to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. These are very popular for a first time visitor to London. You can actually get a boat from there to anywhere else on the river for £6. You can also get on a historic routemaster bus from there to Trafalgar Square. The Gherkin is 15 minutes walk away. It's probably London's most iconic skyscraper. There's a lot to see and do in t

name: Amazing View of London; BOOK 10 Nov Fireworks Show
summary: Welcome to my retro style flat on the 7th floor, complete with stunning views of famous landmarks, including Big Ben and the London Eye!  ......................................................................................................................... The property is perfect for a couple, for families, or a small group of friends. The location is fantastic, just a short walk or bus ride from Westminster, the South Bank and central London. Book for Lord Mayor's Fireworks spectacular view
space: The main bedroom is bright and spacious, with a large and comfortable bed with memory foam mattress, and plenty of storage space if you are staying for a while. The living room is large with sit-up seating and a TV and slouch area, and the L-shape sofa also transforms easily into a sturdy sofa bed for two more guests. The second bedroom I open only for groups over 4 people or on special request (twin beds).  ................................................................................................................................ The property is intended to be super-relaxing for when you aren’t out and about. It’s equipped with Virgin 100mbps Optical Fibre wi-fi, two TVs, Sky Cinema, Sky Sports, and a blue-tooth speaker plus games, DVDs, books and CDs - everything you could need for your stay. Both rooms have TVs; the living room has an X-box and a DVD player. Stored away you’ll find Monopoly, Mastermind, Taboo, Buccaneer and Pictionary. ...........................................
description: Welcome to my retro style flat on the 7th floor, complete with stunning views of famous landmarks, including Big Ben and the London Eye!  ......................................................................................................................... The property is perfect for a couple, for families, or a small group of friends. The location is fantastic, just a short walk or bus ride from Westminster, the South Bank and central London. Book for Lord Mayor's Fireworks spectacular view The main bedroom is bright and spacious, with a large and comfortable bed with memory foam mattress, and plenty of storage space if you are staying for a while. The living room is large with sit-up seating and a TV and slouch area, and the L-shape sofa also transforms easily into a sturdy sofa bed for two more guests. The second bedroom I open only for groups over 4 people or on special request (twin beds).  ........................................................................................
neighborhood_overview: A lot of my guests want to know about transport. Adults should usually be able to use a bank card as a touch-in touch-out - this is easy for UK cards and check here for non-UK (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Children under 11  are free if travelling with their parents. My recommendation for older families (as children don't have bank cards) is to buy oyster cards from any station  (including Heathrow and Gatwick) or some newsagents, and give them back when you leave (they cost £5 for the card and you put credit on them) and you get the £5 refunded after 48 hours). See (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You can also get bus passes for £5 a day from the garage (gas station) or newsagent locally - you don't need the oyster card for these they are just paper cards. ....................................................................................................................... Kennington is excellently placed for some of the best cultural experiences in the Capital. It’s a mere 15 minute walk o
transit: The flat is located between Lambeth North tube station, on the Bakerloo line, and Kennington station for the Northern line. There are also plenty of bus routes close by which can take you all over the city. ........................................................................................................................ Buses: To get to Westminster Bridge and the London Eye, hop on the 159 outside the flat on Kennington Road and it’s just five stops. It will take you on to Whitehall, Trafalgar Square and the West End. To go to Waterloo (for the National Theatre, Globe Theatre and Tate Modern) get on the 59 and again – it’s five stops. The number 3 bus from the same stop takes you to Millbank, a short walk from Tate Britain. You can get to Brixton in just 15 minutes in the other direction. All the buses run very frequently and also run at night two or three times an hour. ..............................................................................................................
access: Guests in larger groups will have access to the entire property during their stay. For smaller groups the small bedroom is used by us for storage and so is locked. I will never book more than one party at a time. If you use the small bedroom please note that there is no storage except a couple of drawers. There is a large cupboard in the hall where you can keep suitcases out of the way.
interaction: I try to meet you to hand over keys, but if I can't I will be contactable via phone and email during your stay. I also have a great concierge that you can pick up the keys from so there is no delay in you getting access to the property. If there is any delay with the front desk (the concierge will sometimes do rounds or be on lunch) or for out of hours 10pm to 6am, there is also a key safe (small lock box) in a nearby location where you can pick them up.
house_rules: - No stilettos or kitten heels, there is new oak flooring throughout! - If you have children check with me to make sure you understand the window rules - there should be no keys left in the windows this means they are child safe - Please only smoke in the kitchen with the window open, not in the rest of the flat (no smoking with children in the flat). - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 11pm.   - No parties except Christmas and New Year or with special permission and fixed number (max is 25)
host_about: I work on the government's website, love all things digital, and have enjoyed hosting people from the UK and around the world at my old house in Streatham. I think my new flat will be another AirBNB hit!

name: FREE healthy breakfast/E1 beside tube/Quiet home
summary: I have a simple, cosy, 3 bedroom apartment in Mile End, London. I live in the property!  I am a Michelin trained head chef. I provide a FREE artisan breakfast for guests every day! The tube stop right beside me is 3 stops from Bank Station, 2 stops from Liverpool St (6 minutes by tube), so my place is very central! You’ll love my place because I have a clean/calm/safe home; minutes from the city sights, but right beside the best foodie hotspots & hidden gems of London's East End!
space: I love hosting people in my home!! My home is unique because it is a foodie haven! I am a Michelin trained, award winning, head chef. In my job, I cook for the rich & famous. But I get more excited to have people stay with me who appreciate good food! For free, I provide an artisan breakfast for my guests every day of their trip. No dietary requirement is an issue. The breakfast varies daily, but can include yogurt, local sourdough, homemade preserves/granola, unpasteurised local cheeses and meats, along with homemade dips. Also I mixit up with my own baked loafs and cakes. For my guests, I also provide organic refreshments of juices, loose leaf tea, artisan coffee and unsweetened almond milk. On entering the house you walk into an open hallway where there is a downstairs toilet, entrance to the kitchen/dining area, my bedroom and stairs to the upper floor. The upper floor has a communal bathroom and the other bedrooms. Your bedroom is upstairs!
description: I have a simple, cosy, 3 bedroom apartment in Mile End, London. I live in the property!  I am a Michelin trained head chef. I provide a FREE artisan breakfast for guests every day! The tube stop right beside me is 3 stops from Bank Station, 2 stops from Liverpool St (6 minutes by tube), so my place is very central! You’ll love my place because I have a clean/calm/safe home; minutes from the city sights, but right beside the best foodie hotspots & hidden gems of London's East End! I love hosting people in my home!! My home is unique because it is a foodie haven! I am a Michelin trained, award winning, head chef. In my job, I cook for the rich & famous. But I get more excited to have people stay with me who appreciate good food! For free, I provide an artisan breakfast for my guests every day of their trip. No dietary requirement is an issue. The breakfast varies daily, but can include yogurt, local sourdough, homemade preserves/granola, unpasteurised local cheeses and meats, along with
neighborhood_overview: Mile End is one of the best places to be located in London as it is so central to the city, with so many public transport routes going through it. Making it very convenient to get to all the central hubs for further travel in the UK or London airports. It has access to the best parks and canals close by, and all of the hipster foodie hotspots of the East End (Shoreditch/Dalston/Bethnal Green). Although located only 1mile from the Tower of London & the exact city centre, the house is located in between 3 green areas so the air is some of the cleanest & pure in the city! The calm, pretty canal runs along by the house & is lovely for a walk in the early evening. We have a bus stop right outside the door that has 3 different routes taking you all over the city, and Mile End Tube station is 4 minutes walk from my front door! The tube stop is on the Central, Hammersmith, District and Circle lines. You can get to Picadilly Circus in 12minutes. It is the best location for sightseeing around th
notes: CHECK IN is not opened to arrive at any time. You must arrange a time in advance of your arrival, that suits both you and the host, in between the hours of 2pm and 10pm. During these hours of the day is strictly the only time for bag drops and check in as of November 1st 2017. CHECK OUT is strictly 11am. That includes vacating the bedroom and common areas. Meaning you must leave the property at this time. Leaving any bags/luggage after this time is not possible. Politely mentioning the above is for clarity/transparency, to manage guest expectations, and to make sure you have a great trip. Thank you for your understanding!
transit: Electric car parking and standard (safe) street parking is available right behind my apartment block on a quiet, tree lined street. There is FREE parking 50 metres from my front door - if you park up before 5pm you will have no problem getting a FREE spot. PUBLIC TRANSPORT: Zone 1 (most central area) tube station is a 4 minute walk from my door, along a very safe main road. This station has 4 tube lines so it is easy to get to anywhere in the city, fast! Travelling with bags to my house (from the station) is easy as it is level ground - not up or down hill. There are 4 bus lines beside the tube station to take you to a variety of places Paddington/KingsCross/Soho/London Bridge/Westfield Stratford Shopping Centre. There are another 3 bus numbers right beside my apartment that take you to Shoreditch/Canary Wharf/Dalston/Islington/Broadway Market. I am in the best location for getting around the city conveniently by public transport!
access: My home is your home! Your bedroom has a brand new big double bed fit for 2 people. The bedroom has ample storage space & a big closet. Towels and fresh bed linen are provided on arrival. We have organic shampoo & fresh flowers. The apartment is tiled in the bathrooms and downstairs, but has carpet upstairs. All the carpets in the house are new! So fluffy spotlessly clean carpet below your feet in the bedroom :) There is fast wireless internet for you to tap into when you arrive. You have access to a clean, well kept communal bathroom & a separate 2nd toilet. You have storage allocated for you in kitchen cupboards & the fridge if you want to buy food & cook. There is a lovely wooden table & chairs in the kitchen for dining, with a built in booth. You can use whatever utensils you need in my well equipped kitchen! I just ask that you clean the utensils and crockery after you use them, to keep the communal area respectfully tidy for all guests. Homemade breakfast is left packed & labelle
interaction: I am here to help if you need any guidance getting around London to specific sites, as I know the city very well. I can advise on the cheapest way to travel, where to eat and how best to use your time in the city, based on your interests! I have great budget recommendations - for restaurants, markets, cafes and shops! There are so many fantastic things to do within 10 minutes of my apartment, I can guide you in all of these things so you have a fantastic trip! I am a well educated, respectful person who likes to keep a tidy, welcoming home for my guests. I am friendly, but do not socialise with my guests. I enjoy my own space and like to give guests their own space also, to settle into the accommodation & their surroundings. It is important that I, and my guests, feel safe in their surroundings, so I ask all guests to be sure they lock the front door when entering and exiting the property. It is a well kept home where we don't have social gathering, so we ask our guests to do the same
house_rules: Strictly no smoking in the house (communal areas & private bedroom).  Guests are free to come & go in the house at any time, but must be quiet between 11pm and 7am. For respect of guests & the host in the other 2 rooms, it is important not to make noise late at night when people are sleeping.  We ask guests to remove their shoes when entering. There is a shoe rack for all shoes beside the front door. We have extra house shoes or you can bring your own slippers/shoes.  Each bedroom accommodates a maximum of 2 guests. If the booking is for 1 person & 2 show up expecting to stay without prior arrangement, the 2nd guest must be paid for on arrival. If more than 2 people show up attempting to stay in the room, the booking will be cancelled immediately. Only people paying to stay in the house are allowed. This is not a house for social gatherings. If you plan to bring strangers over to visit during the day, this must be arranged with the host in advance. All items in the house are the proper
host_about:
I am a friendly, warm & sociable person.
I originally come from a small village on the west coast of Ireland. My family go back 5 generations in the hospitality industry & I was raised working in our award-winning family kitchen. I now have my own internationally recognized, award-winning restaurant in Ireland. I am based in London 80% of the time & have worked in some of the best Michelin starred restaurants in the world.

When staying in a new place, I like to immerse myself in the local culture. The local food, drinks, traditions & national heritage are all of interest to me. I find learning about other cultures intriguing. I like travelling to places with an interesting history. What the local people recommend always turns out to be a more memorable experience!

I love polite, respectful people. My friends would describe me as witty, relaxed, respectful & conscientious, with a perpetually positive outlook on life.

Marylebone is a celebrity hang out and prime location of London, boosting charming shops, some of the best restaurants in London, gastro pubs, cafes and bars while also having a very 'safe village feel' -For healthy eaters there are great healthy food cafes around like "Natural kitchen" and "The Good life".  -Regent's park is across the road (One of the most beautiful parks in London) with its: Zoo, Open Air Theatre, boating, jogging trails, tennis courts and cycle paths.  - it is also close (25 min walk) to Primrose hill where you have famous views of London skyline and can enjoy the boutique shops and cafes of Primrose hill village   -Top Bars/ Restaurants and Shops in the Area -Trendy, lively area with eclectic mix of shops, cafes, Michelin-starred restaurants and beautiful period architec

The train reaches Heathrow Airport in about 15 minutes - 5 min direct lines from Kings Cross station  -15 min by the underground to Victoria station or bus N 82

name: Cosy, colourful double room in Central London
summary: Bright, sunny double room with character in family, cosy and friendly house in quiet residential area, minutes away from the City and central London. Walking distance to train station, 24/7 buses, local amenities, bars, cafes, restaurants, shops and lovely parks and green areas. Perfect chilled out and comfortable spot for the most pleasant stay in London.
space: Guests love staying here not only because of the beautiful home but for many other reasons such as 5 min walk to Canada Water station from which you can get to the City Centre in 8 min, the 2 min walk to the local park perfect for relaxing, easy access to the City, West End and East and North London as well as the area is full of local restaurants ranging from all different kinds of cuisines. Walking distance to train station, buses, local amenities, bars, cafes, restaurants, shops and lovely parks and green areas. Perfect chilled out and comfortable spot for the most pleasant stay in London. The neighbourhood is very friendly and has a real sense of community. Possible airport drop off (cheaper than taxi and minicabs).

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is very friendly and has a real sense of community. 2 min walk to the local park perfect for relaxing, easy access to the City, West End and East and North London as well as the area is full of local restaurants ranging from all different kinds of cuisines. Nearest stations are New Cross Gate and New Cross within 10 minute walk with an excellent link to City, West End and East and North London. A large Sainsbury's supermarket, various pubs and take aways are also in 10 mins walk. Close to popular touristic Greenwich and Canary Wharf.
notes: Please note the room is located on the first floor that can be reached by stairs.
transit: There are lots of public transport options and excellent access to central London. Loads of bus routes to various parts of London pass the main road (5min away) and there are also frequent Network Rail and Overground trains to all over London from New Cross Gate with good connections to the Underground. 225 bus stops right around the corner of the house and takes you to Canada Water. 343 bus stops right in front of the house and takes you to City Hall. New Cross Gate and New Cross stations are within 10min walk. Direct trains to London Bridge - 1 stop (7-10 mins), lively Shoreditch with loads of bars and night life in East London (15 mins) on the Overground, St. Pancras - handy for Eurostar and Kings Cross (30 mins) and trains to Victoria (30 mins) - good access to get to West London easily. Highbury&Islington (25 mins), direct trains to Gatwick Airport. Direct buses to Hyde Park, the city (Moorgate, St. Paul's), Oxford Circus and Holborn where British Museum is. Popular touristic Gree
access: Fully equipped kitchen, bathroom and toilet shared with 3 of us. There is also a lovely back garden perfect for relaxing outside. The guest room enjoys access to the bathroom without going through any of the living areas. This room is on the first floor facing a quiet street. Double size bed is very comfortable and the bath has a shower fitted. There are 3 of us living in the house, very friendly and quiet people. It's a quiet place to give you a full rest at the end of a busy day in London. Guests will be given their own key and access to the full equipment kitchen, bathroom and garden.
interaction: I’ll be here to welcome you and show you around. If not, I'll make sure someone will greet you on your arrival. You'll have your own key, so you can come and go as you wish. I'll be contactable any time during your stay for your questions. I've used Airbnb and couch surfing for many years, I know what it means to be a good host.
house_rules: - - 1. No guests/visitors are permitted to enter the apartment other than those on the original Airbnb reservation. - 2. No restrictions on what time you can come and go, but please be considerate of others in the house if coming in late and keep the noise down after 10pm. - 3. No loud music. - 4. Please be considerate of others in the house and keep the house clean and tidy. - 5. Please put all rubbish into the bins. - 6. Please take off shoes in the house. - 7. Please remember it's someone's house not a hotel.

name: Stylish Notting Hill Apartment with Garden
summary: Set in the heart of London’s Notting Hill, this freshly designed apartment is the epitome of effortless luxury living. The apartment has recently been refurbished entirely with solid wooden flooring and underfloor heating throughout. Despite it's tranquil setting, you are only a few minutes walk from Portobello Road Market and Golborne Road. Ladbroke Grove tube station is only round the corner with the Hammersmith and City line running directly to the city.
space: This bedroom has its own private bathroom, as well as doors that open out on the garden.  The living room and kitchen is newly designed with everything you might need from cooking to cable TV.  The flat itself has it's own entrance as well as a spacious private garden equipped with a fantastic barbeque at your disposal. Please also feel free to cook with our fresh herbs that are currently growing nicely in the garden :)

neighborhood_overview: Notting Hill is an incredibly friendly neighbourhood.  There are lots of restaurants to choose from and bars.  The markets that run on Friday and Saturday (Portobello and Golborne) are a must!
transit: We are a couple of minutes walk from Ladbroke Grove tube.  We also have a bus station on our road.
interaction: Should you need anything please always feel free to ask - we can also provide you with some tips on the surrounding area!  We have great restaurants, bars, shops and markets.

name: Maisonette on residential road in Camden Town
summary: Tucked away just a 5 minute walk from the main  camden high street, near a big supermarket, you can enjoy the neighbourhood of Camden Town on a residential street . It is on the top two floors and is naturally well lit.The flat is located opposite a friendly calm and local neighbourhood pub renowned for its food and closes early in the evenings meaning there is no unpleasant noise. If you are looking to be in the heart of camden but in a more peaceful location this is the place for you !
space: the space is a very comfortable open plan arrangement on the first floor with lovely large windows and nice height ceilings and then you have the privacy of two bedroom spaces above. The building is a house that has been seperated Into two maisonette apartments - it it not a characterless new build. As you are on the top two floors there is no noise travelling from an apartment above making for a really pleasant environment
description: Tucked away just a 5 minute walk from the main  camden high street, near a big supermarket, you can enjoy the neighbourhood of Camden Town on a residential street . It is on the top two floors and is naturally well lit.The flat is located opposite a friendly calm and local neighbourhood pub renowned for its food and closes early in the evenings meaning there is no unpleasant noise. If you are looking to be in the heart of camden but in a more peaceful location this is the place for you ! the space is a very comfortable open plan arrangement on the first floor with lovely large windows and nice height ceilings and then you have the privacy of two bedroom spaces above. The building is a house that has been seperated Into two maisonette apartments - it it not a characterless new build. As you are on the top two floors there is no noise travelling from an apartment above making for a really pleasant environment You have access to the whole two floors of the maisonette If there is a problem
neighborhood_overview: Camden Town is known for its eccentric subculture and music . It is an area filled with music venues and pubs where famous musicians like Amy winehouse frequented. The famous camden market has been updated - there are still the amazing vintage and alternative stalls but now there is also a large food stall area where there has been a particular attention of adding london's best independent vegan food. It is a vibrant community and Regent's Park and primrose hill are walking distance away
notes: I want you to have a good time in my home and make yourself relaxed. However, aLthough you will be staying in a fun area Please do not have gatherings with strangers in the apartment and just be mindful as to how loud you play your music and the noise made generally - especially as the apartment below would be able to hear if the noise levels get too loud. Sound travels easily through the original wooden floors of the building even with the carpet in the main communal area. I live in a nice community where everyone respects each other and I would like to keep it that way - Thank you !
transit: You would be in a perfect location for public transport- the flat is one minute away from camden road over ground tube station, 4 minutes away from Camden Town on the northern line and there are several bus stops taking you into the heart of central london round the corner from the maisonette
access: You have access to the whole two floors of the maisonette
interaction: If there is a problem during your stay I will not be far away and would be available to be of assistance
house_rules: - Please no shoes in living room area because of carpet
host_about:
Hi :) 
I'm a 27 year old young architect to be looking to rent out my apartment from time to time.
I'm a friendly girl who loves music, good food and art and I speak a few other languages so feel free to see if I speak yours ! 
I'm half Brazilian and half Australian in heritage and therefore naturally I lovetravelling and having new experiences. Therefore I hope that I can provide you with a comfortable base and environment to be able to enjoy london which I believe to be the best city in the world. If you would like any advice on places to go please feel free to ask it would be my pleasure

name: Beautiful three-story maisonette in Covent Garden
summary: Spacious and comfortable three floor maisonette located in the heart of Covent Garden, just by the Royal Opera House and within walking distance of Soho, China Town, the South Bank and London's Theatreland. Full of character and charm.
space: This is characterful 1920s property is 1165 sq ft/108.4 sq m in size. Two double bedrooms plus a rooftop studio with a double sofa bed. Two bathrooms (one en-suite). Power showers. Separate w.c. Large living room. Fully equipped kitchen. Roof garden on two levels. Wooden floors throughout. High ceilings. Plenty of natural light. Double glazed so little street noise. Very private - no neighbours. For larger groups the sofas in the living room can be converted into three single beds.

transit: You are less than a minute from Covent Garden Underground! Close to Mainline Rail (Kings Cross, St Pancras, Waterloo, Charing Cross) and many local bus routes.

I am happy to answer any questions you have about staying in our home. Thanks for looking.

name: Lovely large and peaceful one bedroom flat
summary: My flat is a wonderfully spacious, third floor flat. It's in a peaceful neighbourhood, with the sound of the river Wandle trickling past outside. There is one bedroom with a kingsize bed plus an additional room which is a study / dressing room. Free parking is available. The location is ideal for visiting Wallington, Carshalton, Croydon or Sutton. The nearest stations are Waddon National Rail or Wandle Park Tram Stop and it takes around one hour to get into central London.
space: This flat has a surprisingly large, open plan lounge / kitchen / diner and being in the loft of the building it has some sloping walls that give it a lovely character.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet, with no traffic noise. It is a short walk along the river to Beddington Park or Waddon Ponds. It is a short car journey to Ikea and Purley Way retail stores, or into Croydon city centre.
notes: Please note that my flat is on the third floor and there is no lift. The shower is over the bath and under a sloping roof with limited head height. Guests over around 5'8" will need to sit in the bath to use the shower, or just take a bath!
transit: My flat is 15 minutes walk from Waddon station (trains go to London Bridge in 27 minutes and to Victoria in around 37 minutes) or Wandle Park tram stop (trams go to Wimbledon in 20 minutes, or East Croydon in 10 minutes). There are also buses within 5 minutes walk of my flat that go to East Croydon Station (410), Wallington Station or Therapy Lane tram stop (463)
access: Guests have access to the whole flat (Kitchen/lounge/diner, bedroom, bathroom, hall).  The kitchen is well equipped with all the essentials including oven, hob, microwave, washing machine, fridge and freezer. It also has an attractive breakfast bar.
interaction: I live around 40 minutes drive away.
host_about: I'm an accountant for an International NGO and often travel for work. I rent out my lovely flat when I'm away. My hobbies include singing, hockey and running.

summary: Trendy one bedroom flat in the heart of Peckham. The flat is 1 of 4 flats in a beautiful period Georgian House, with a large shared garden, for which we have direct access to.  Peckham is a vibrant, arty, multi-cultural hub with a great food scene and nightlife. Peckham has just been voted the best place to live in London by Time-out, Guardian and Metro. The SE15 postcode area is regarded as one of the most exciting and diverse urban locales in the capital.
space: We are 2minutes walk from the famous Peckham Levels and Copeland Park, which houses local businesses, eateries, yoga studios, bars, art exhibition and a great place to explore.  The flat is really well connected and it is easy to get to anywhere in London. We are a 7mins walk from Peckham Rye and 10 mins walk from Queens Road Peckham.

name: Comfy and Modern Putney 1 Bed Flat with Balcony
summary: Bright and spacious one bedroom flat, on a quiet street in the heart of Putney, with easy access to train and tube links to Central London. We welcome people from all backgrounds and are happy to give recommendations for attractions to visit, things to do and our personal favourite - places to eat!
space: The bedroom has a comfy double bed, is spacious and bright, with a south facing view. There are built in wardrobes, two bedside tables with lights, a chair and a chest of drawers, along with a selection of London guidebooks for trip inspiration. We have a black out blind to help you get the best night sleep possible. There is also a desk, desk light and chair (these can be removed if you would prefer the space, please let us know). A hairdryer and full length mirror are also provided. Clothes washing, drying and ironing facilities are available. There's a shower room with sink plus a separate toilet. The kitchen is well equipped, including a dish washer and coffee machine. Spacious living room with TV and DVD player plus dining table. There's a sunny balcony where you can enjoy breakfast in the summer.
description: Bright and spacious one bedroom flat, on a quiet street in the heart of Putney, with easy access to train and tube links to Central London. We welcome people from all backgrounds and are happy to give recommendations for attractions to visit, things to do and our personal favourite - places to eat! The bedroom has a comfy double bed, is spacious and bright, with a south facing view. There are built in wardrobes, two bedside tables with lights, a chair and a chest of drawers, along with a selection of London guidebooks for trip inspiration. We have a black out blind to help you get the best night sleep possible. There is also a desk, desk light and chair (these can be removed if you would prefer the space, please let us know). A hairdryer and full length mirror are also provided. Clothes washing, drying and ironing facilities are available. There's a shower room with sink plus a separate toilet. The kitchen is well equipped, including a dish washer and coffee machine. Spacious living ro
neighborhood_overview: Putney is the perfect distance from central London for it to be green, leafy and peaceful, whilst providing plenty of great restaurants, pubs and entertainment options. Putney Heath and Wimbledon Common are 10 minutes up the hill from us, for those looking to stretch their legs or a morning run! French, Goan and Mexican restaurants are just round the corner plus a Waitrose and Co-Op supermarket, East Putney tube station (Zone 2), Putney railway station and several excellent pubs including The Prince of Wales and The Jolly Gardeners which has a fun pub quiz every Tuesday.
notes: We use the second bedroom for storage. There will be room for you to hang clothes, and the bedside tables provide further storage, but there will be minimal other space to put your belongings away.
transit: The flat is a 5 minute walk to Putney mainline railway station (into Waterloo) and a 7 minute walk to East Putney tube station (District line), both allow fast access into Central London. River boats can be accessed from Putney embankment (the starting part of the annual Oxford-Cambridge Boat Race) and provide a more leisurely route into town!
access: You'll have access to the whole flat apart from our own bedroom.
house_rules: Respect the neighbours by keeping noise to a minimum after 10pm
host_about: Hello, I'm Blae and I've been living in Putney along with my boyfriend Nick for the last 3 years, originally heralding from the Isle of Man. I enjoy the rich cultural and culinary opportunities London has to offer, and enjoy keeping active with runs, gym classes and ballroom dancing. Cooking dinner with friends and enjoying a good bottle of wine always puts a big smile on my face, along with pottering amongst the flowers on my balcony in the summer.

name: Double Bed in Historic London Apartment
summary: Charming historic property in the famous Docklands, located between Canary Wharf and Bank. Newly decorated double room on the 2nd floor of a beautifully converted Grade II listed Victorian building. You will also have access to the living room, walk in wet room and kitchen. There is a lift in the building.
space: My apartment is well connected, providing easy access to all major attractions and landmarks in London. Westferry DLR station is a 5 minute walk from the apartment. There are also plenty of buses and Santander bicycles nearby too. Canary Wharf is a 15 minute walk and using the DLR and tube, the iconic London Bridge and Tower Bridge are 15 minutes away. My place is an ideal base for solo adventurers, 1-2 friends, a couple and business travellers. You will love my place because of its history, the views, and the location. The flat is fully equipped with all you need from: · High speed Wi-Fi, television with Netflix · Washing machine, clothes airier, iron, iron board, vacuum cleaner · Microwave, kettle, cutlery, sauce pans, frying pan, kitchen utensils · Towels, shower gel, soap, toilet paper and bed linen. · Tea and Coffee is also provided.

neighborhood_overview: History meets the future in this up-and-coming neighborhood where William Shakespeare himself performed Romeo and Juliet in the 1500s. Take a mural tour; sample eclectic offerings of ethnic, pub or street food; shop for vintage treasures on Brick Lane; explore the colorful Sunday flower and plant market on Columbia Road; haunt bars and clubs 'til the wee hours; view work by leading contemporary artists like Damien Hirst in the Hoxton Square galleries; browse the market stalls on Ezra Street; and explore Boxpark, a pop-up mall made of shipping containers. Shoreditch is 90 minutes by Tube from Heathrow, 70 minutes by Tube and train from Gatwick and 30 minutes or less by Tube to the Tower of London, National Gallery, London Eye and other popular destinations.
notes: Kindly drop me a note before booking my place, and let me know a bit about yourself/other guests with you - if you do not have some details in your profile text, and if you do not have reviews/references on your profile. Much appreciated I am a very friendly and approachable person and have had great experience in meeting great people, and would love to host users new to Airbnb - so please do tell me a bit about yourself
transit: The flat is location in Zone 1 (central London zone) - so will save you in travel costs inside London as most attractions and offices are in this zone. Please see the map in one of the pictures Approximate times to various places: London Eye - 25 mins Covent Garden/Soho/Piccadilly Circus - 25 mins away Kings Cross Station - 20 mins away Victoria Station - 35 mins away Nearest stations: Liverpool Street station(for metro/tube/trains to airports) - 5-7 mins Shoreditch high street station - 5 mins Old St station - 7 mins Nearest bus stop - right next to the building Nearest supermarket - right next to the building Airports - Liverpool st station is connected to all the airports via bus/train links, and to rest of UK
access: You will have your own private bedroom and your ensuite bedroom and that is entirely yours. I live in the flat as well and I have my own bedroom and my own bathroom I usually work from home so I use the living room as my office, so you will not have access to the living room mostly, but you are welcome to come sit on the sofa and we can have a chat as I love networking with guests and have made great connections because of my Airbnb hosting experience. There is a nice kitchen with a fridge, microwave, and there is a supermarket in the building as well, so feel free to use the fridge to store stuff and use the kitchen if you want to heat up meals etc There are some days when I work from outside London - and in that case you might use the living room, but it does not happen always, so do ask me beforehand if you want to use the living room and I can inform you about my calendar during your stay
interaction: I have been living in London for over six years and I speak English, French, Russian and bit of Chinese and have travelled a lot around the world. I would be able to help guests with tips on how to get the best of London - be it bars, music venues, restaurants or nightclubs. I will give you the good first hand advice/tips on the Shoreditch area - and point out its best things - the bars/pubs all around the flat, or the Box Park (the first popup mall in the UK), SpitalFields Market with centuries of tradition and history - let you know where the best events are going on and make any introductions necessary to help you hit the ground running.
house_rules: - Only guests that have booked via Airbnb and whose names are specified clearly before checkin are allowed in the flat at any time. No other person is allowed at any time. Kindly also make sure to have a clear profile picture of yourself, as per Airbnb rules. - We reserve the right to ask all guests about their full names, date of birth, nationality, email and phone numbers, social media profiles ( (Hidden by Airbnb) or linkedin) for verification and insurance purposes after booking and before arrival, and also ask for passport or national ID upon arrival - No smoking, no vaping, and no drugs whatsoever - No parties or loud music at all. this is a residential block with other residents - Kindly take off your shoes every time you enter the flat. - Please leave the flat in the same condition you found it - please wipe surfaces in kitchen and bathroom and put all litter in the trash bin - The person who booked the place needs to be present at checkin. If you are booking on someone else's
host_about:
About Sam - Finance professional turned tech-entrepreneur. I have lived in Hong Kong, Paris and been in London for over six years. An avid-traveller myself. I love food, dancing a bit of salsa every now and then and playing my guitar. Have an engineering major and an economics minor - studied in University of Michigan, Ann Arbor.

I love exploring London - and still feel like so many areas in London, so many nice restaurants, bars and cafes are left unexplored. Would not mind giving my advice to explore the best bits of London to my guests

About Chris - Grew up in Germany, studied in Texas, Austin and then in in Oxford, UK. Currently moving between London and US for work. Living in the UK since 2008

We know each other for over 6 years and are great friends. While we are housemates, one or more of us are always on the go for work or vacations, so we have one bedroom free from time to time and are happy to host and meet new people in this way.

neighborhood_overview: Ideally located to enjoy the green spaces of St. Martins Gardens, which sits directly behind the building, with Camden Lock Market, Regents Park and the unique Regent’s Canal also within walking distance. The location is great, it is also a convenient location with many shops, supermarkets, bars around (but all very quiet and no noise).
notes: We provide: Linen, 2 towels for each person, 2 rolls of toilet paper, toiletries basic set, 1 kitchen cloth. You are more than welcome to use food, drinks, detergent and any other item in the apartment. If you do, a good idea is to pick up some more to replace what you have used as a form of courtesy.
transit: The flat is located within 5 minutes from Camden Town station. The area offers shops, clubs, pubs. Camden is well known for its markets: Camden Lock market, Buck Street market, Stables market, Camden Lock village, and an indoor market in the Electric Ballroom. The markets are a major tourist attraction at weekends, selling goods of all types including fashion, lifestyle, books, food, junk/antiques and more bizarre items; they and the surrounding shops are popular with young people, in particular those searching for "alternative" clothing.  A few blocks away from Camden market, the world famous market which has become London's third most popular tourist attraction. Furthermore just stops away by underground to the West End in the very center of London with a journey time of 9 minutes from Camden Town to Leicester Square.
access: The apartment is on the second floor without lift. Please be aware that In British English, the floor of a building which is level with the ground is called the ground floor. The floor above it is called the first floor, the floor above that is the second floor, and so on. I could arrange a pick up from the Airport for you, send me a message to check the availability. Prices as following: Heathrow £48 Luton £58 Stansted £58 Gatwick £68 SERVICE NOT AVAILABLE IN AUGUST

name: Double Room - Newly Renovated Flat Central London
summary: A newly refurbished flat; it's a period conversion with beautiful high ceilings & big windows, an open plan living room/kitchen, one shared bathroom with bath, a balcony & shared garden. Great public transport links (overground, Bakerloo & Jubilee lines, & multiple bus routes). Less than a 10-minute drive to Baker Street. Little Venice, Regent's Park, London Zoo, Primrose Hill & Hyde Park are all nearby. The bedroom has a double bed with a wardrobe, shelves & space under the bed for storage.
space: The two-bedroom flat is in a Victorian period conversion. I live in the other bedroom, and when I bought the flat almost three years ago I renovated it entirely so everything is new. I fell in love with the flat for its beautiful high ceilings and big windows, as well as the balcony overlooking a large shared garden; it is so nice in central London to be able to step outside straight from your own home. I hope you will appreciate this too!

name: Double room in bright, stylish 2 bed flat (Zone 2)
summary: Less than ten minutes by bus or tube from Kings Cross St Pancras International station, this Zone 2 contemporary two bedroom apartment is just a short walk from Caledonian Road station and ten mins by bus from trendy Angel and Camden. The modern flat is furnished throughout and your double bedroom includes exclusive use of the main bathroom. You’ll share the bright communal areas just with myself, including the vibrant and welcoming lounge, dining area, balcony and well appointed kitchen.
space: An ideal location for easy access to the hustle and bustle of Covent Garden (less than ten minutes on the Underground), the entertainment of Leicester Square or less than a ten minute bus ride to the Eurostar terminal at St Pancras International.  If you’re a foodie, you must check out Caravan, German Gymnasium, the Brasserie and Dishoom - all a five minute bus journey to Granary Square, the heart of the new development at Kings Cross. Award winning chef Ottolenghi’s Islington is short journey away, as is Carluccio’s and Masala Zone at Angel.   Into Football? The Emirates stadium is within walking distance.

neighborhood_overview: Situated at the end of the road, Caledonian Park is ideal for a picnic or a brief walk.  Islington Tennis Centre and Football Court and a Better Gym are a few minutes stroll away.  Fancy a pint or pub grub? Local favourite 'The Depot' is just a few mins walk away on North Road - you can also catch a local play here too, upstairs in the Pleasance Theatre! With easy access to transport links to Central London, Camden, Finsbury Park, Kings Cross and Angel, the nearest tube station is Caledonian Road on the Piccadilly Line (seven minute walk). The nearest London Overground station - Caledonian Road & Barnsbury - is less than a fifteen minute walk or a few stops on the bus.  Many of London’s beautiful parks including Regents Park, Hampstead Heath, Finsbury Park and Hyde Park are easy to travel to from this fantastic location.
transit: The flat is served well by tube, bus and train. Kings Cross is approx 5 minutes by bus or a 20 minute walk. Paid for parking is available during working hours on North Road (M-F) and free outside those times.

neighborhood_overview: Fantastic location! There is Tesco mini supermarket just around the corner, and many places for food and drink. The Famous IVORY house and the Yacht Club located just opposite side of my house. Tower of London, Palace  and Tower Bridge are about 1 to 5  minute walk. St. Paul's Cathedral and the Tate Modern museum also not far away. Enjoy London's best view from nearby Sky Garden or The Shard.
notes: Please check the calendar for availability. It's available from 2 pm on the day you arrive until 10 am on the day you depart.  Any one want to check in after 6 pm please let us know prior to one day before so we can arrange the check in, Other wise we do extra charge for late check in. It's perfect for meeting up for sightseeing, shopping, dining, theatre or shows; or for a family exploring all the attractions London has to offer.
transit: Tower Bridge Exhibition is fascinating (you can walk right across the top and go down and see the engines that lift the bascules). A 5 minute walk south over Tower Bridge and along the south bank past the Scoop amphitheatre and HMS Belfast will find you in Borough Market, London’s most renowned food market with exceptional British and international produce. Continue a bit further and you'll pass a replica of Sir Francis Drakes' Golden Hinde, The Clink - England's first prison, the Globe Theatre, Tate Modern and then the footbridge back over the Thames towards St Paul’s cathedral. Going east, Greenwich is a 15 minute ride on the River Taxi which stops right in front of the Tower of London or an easy trip on the DLR through Canary Wharf. The Royal Observatory, home of Greenwich Mean Time and the Prime Meridian line was founded by Charles II in 1675 and is, by international decree, the official starting point for each new day, year and millennium (at the stroke of midnight GMT is measured

interaction: Please feel free to call, email, text me at anytime if you need anything. And please let me know your arrival time on the property. Special dedicated team always available upon request for guest. Any issue please contact us and we will be there to solve it.

I am working in London. Friendly and always keen to meet new people and make friends.
I love music, traveling and good food.

name: Incredible 1 bed apartment right by Russell Square
summary: This stunning, one bedroom basement apartment is perfect for couples or families looking for a short or long stay in London.  The red brick walls and unique artwork give the space so much character. The bedroom is equipped with a in-house entertainment projector, and there is a sauna round back for guest enjoyment. Located minutes walk away from Bloomsbury and Russell Square, the apartment is truly in the heart of London, within walking distance from Euston, Covent Garden and Trafalgar Square.

neighborhood_overview: Bloomsbury exudes high culture without pretenses. Known for its array of specialised institutions, Bloomsbury remains mild-mannered despite its cultural bragging rights. We’ll brag for it—the neighbourhood gave its name to an influential group of English intellectuals, including Virginia Woolf. Garden squares and Victorian era hotels contribute to the streetscape’s nonchalant beauty, while dairy markets and butchers still populate Bloomsbury’s street corners, lending it a distinctly village feel in the midst of central London.
