name: Bright, modern & spacious flat
summary: This new, light & spacious flat is perfectly located for the sights of Richmond & easy access to London, 10 min walk to Richmond high street & Richmond station (trains to Waterloo in 20 min). Kew Gardens is a 10 minute walk, Twickenham stadium is 45 min walk or a short bus/train & Richmond Park an easy 5 min drive/25 min walk. This listing is for a private room plus full use of kitchen, bathroom, large lounge & balcony. Please note Airbnb distinguishes been private room & entire place listings.
space: This is a very spacious and airy flat within easy distance of London and perfect for solo travellers, couples, friends and business travellers who are looking to be close to the city. Richmond has plenty of good quality restaurants, bars and cafes, including many along the River Thames. This flat is 5 minutes walk from a large supermarket for any last minute essentials. On - street parking is free overnight (4.30pm-10am Monday to Saturday) and all day Sunday. Max stay 2 hours during charging hours (please check with me as it may be possible to use my space whilst I'm at work if Mon-Fri). Please note that as with most other residences in London, there is some background noise due to transport links, but these stop overnight.

neighborhood_overview: Richmond has a very lively atmosphere at all times of the year - from the coffee culture and dining out during winter to long lazy weekends by the river in summer...there is always something to do. If you fancy being more active you could go to Kew Gardens, Richmond Park or Twickenham for the rugby. Hampton Court Palace and Kempton Park racecourse are also a short drive. Or if shopping is more your thing, head to Oxford Street in central London or Kingston on Thames more locally. The apartment is a 5 minute walk from a large supermarket, perfect for picking up any essentials or a relaxed dinner. Please note that as with most other residences in London, there is some background noise due to transport links, but these stop overnight.
notes: Please note that as with most other residences in London, there is some background noise due to transport links, but these stop overnight.
transit: The apartment is close to many public transport links, including Richmond station with access to National Rail, London Overground and London Underground services. There is also a bus stop at the end of the road (2 mins walk) which is served by 5 bus routes. The apartment has immediate access to the A316 which becomes the M3 (15-20 mins to the M25) and is 5-10 mins drive from the M4.
access: Guests have full access to the kitchen, lounge, bathroom and balcony as well as their bedroom and the flat is in a secure block requiring an access code (provided to guests).  On street parking is also available, which is free from 4.30pm on Saturdays through to 10am on Mondays, as well as free overnight every night from 4.30pm-10am. Please note that it is charged between 10am-4.30pm Mon-Sat  with a stay of two hours. If I am due to be out then guests may use my personal space as mutually agreed - please enquire to check availability. There is also plenty of parking near Richmond town centre.
interaction: Please contact me through Airbnb in the first instance. Thank you. This flat is also my home but guests have full use of the facilities. I am often out, either at work during the week or away at weekends so guests frequently have the whole flat to themselves.
house_rules: Please respect my home as you would wish yours to be treated if I came to stay.
host_about:
Hi, I'm a young professional living in Richmond and working just outside London. I love spending my free time travelling and am always looking for new recommendations. But there's also nothing better than after a long day enjoying the sights getting back to a homely and comfortable place to stay.

Living so close to London and to the home of English rugby in Twickenham is great, and I love being able to walk to Richmond Park and Kew Gardens on a sunny day.

I give my guests their own room key during their stay. Please be aware that you will be sharing the property with the owner or with other guests. The bedroom has lockable doors for security.
description: You are invited to stay in my beautiful house, close to Wembley Stadium, SEE Arena and London Designer Outlet, my place is ideal for those who are attending business conferences, concerts or mega events in Wembley. There are a wide variety of top restaurants, cafes, cinema screens as well as designer and high street shops within the new London Designer Outlet, which makes the area extremely attractive to new visitors and shopping lovers. 15 min to central London. My home is beautiful and my visitors say it has a lovely tranquil feel to it. The kitchen is fully equipped, it’s bright and the garden is the perfect spot to relax, weather permitting. There is broadband wi-fi throughout the house. The bedroom is lovely and bright with a private WC and shower, there are fresh towels and bed linen. I give my guests their own room key during their stay. Please be aware that you will be sharing the property with the owner or with other guests. The bedroom has lockable doors for security. My gues
neighborhood_overview: London is a multicultural melting pot that has built up a reputation as the most cosmopolitan city on Earth. Time permitting, you can expect to come across more than 300 languages and more than 270 nationalities. From football events to the biggest music artists in the World, Wembley is an awe inspiring stadium and is just one stop away from the house by underground. The SSE Arena, Wembley (formerly known as Wembley Arena) is the UK’s most iconic entertainment venue. With a rich history that goes back to its days as the Empire Pool and Sports Arena, the building has played host to numerous events including the 1948 and 2012 Olympic Games. All that shopping does build up an appetite! Take a break and enjoy some of the best cafes and restaurants in Wembley at London Designer Outlet. Meet with friends for a light lunch, relax with a Frappuccino between browsing our outlet stores or enjoy an evening out at one of our top restaurants with a selection of world cuisines. In 1995 the far south
notes: The house is located in London’s zone 3 ( zone 6 being the furthest away from central London). If you are looking for a room under the Big Ben please keep looking. Please note that the zones do not apply to bus travel. You can travel by bus all over London (zones 1-6) with any Travelcard. You are staying in a friendly house, not a hotel. Please treat the house as you would treat your own home.
transit: Neasden underground station is a 4-minute walk away, it takes 15-20 min. to get to the city centre (5 min. to Wembley Stadium and the SSE Arena, Wembley in the opposite direction) The Jubilee line operates 24 hours throughout Friday and Saturday night. Bus routes run 24 hours 7 days a week.
access: My guests have access to the bedroom they are staying in, dining area, kitchen, bathroom and garden. I also provide free fiber optic internet access.
interaction: I love chatting with my guests over a cup of tea or coffee, although I’m also mindful of their privacy. Due to my very busy schedule, I don’t always have the chance to meet all my guests face to face. If you need to see me personally, please let me know. I have lived in London for the past 14 years and I thoroughly enjoy helping with first-hand advice about the city and suggesting itineraries.
house_rules: No unregistered guest are allowed. No Smoking. No dirty shoes in the house. No candles or incense. If you cook, please do clean up after yourself. Kindly keep the noise down after 10:00 pm. Please shut all windows when you leave the house. Please be considerate and aware of safety and security, but most of all enjoy your stay!
host_about:
My name is Julian and I’m an architect who loves to meet people and travel the world. Over the last few few years, my entrepreneurial spirit has led me to become an Airbnb Host and I’ve already hosted thousands of travellers from all over the world in my properties. I also run an online language school called Languages at Home where we help people of all backgrounds to learn and improve their language skills with live tuition with qualified native speakers.  
Before booking with me, please make sure you read the reviews of my previous guests and feel free to contact me if you have any questions about my listings.

name: Beautiful 2Bed Apartment Close to Clapham Junction
summary: A Newly refurbished 2 bed apartment with a private patio located just off of St John's Hill, where you can enjoy a meal or grab a drink in some of London's best restaurants, cafes and bars. Wandsworth Common is also just around the corner and if you're a Tennis fan Wimbledon is only a 7 minute drive. There are great transport links with Clapham Junction a 10 minute walk, making it easy to enjoy all the city has to offer. I
space: Set on a quiet one-way residential road just across from Wandsworth Common, this 2bed flat is a great spot to relax when your not out exploring the city. Based on the lower ground floor with 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom and an open plan living area. The living area feels bright with double doors leading out to the private patio, a perfect spot to sit and enjoy a glass of wine after a long day. The kitchen is modern with all essential amenities and a dinning table suitable for 4, so if you don't feel like trying out one of the many local restaurants, you can enjoy a home cooked meal. The master bedroom is bright and spacious, with built in wardrobes, a king sized bed and a dressing table with a vanity mirror (for when you wanted to get dolled up for an evening out in the city). The second bedroom has a double bed and plenty of wardrobe space. The cleaners place fresh, hotel-quality linen on the bed before your arrival. The 2 bedrooms share a large modern bathroom, where basic toiletries are s

Wandsworth Common is also just around the corner and if you're a Tennis fan Wimbledon is only a 7 minute drive. There are great transport links with Clapham Junction a 10 minute walk, making it easy to enjoy all the city has to offer. I Set on a quiet one-way residential road just across from Wandsworth Common, this 2bed flat is a great spot to relax when your not out exploring the city. Based on the lower ground floor with 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom and an open plan living area. The living area feels bright with double doors leading out to the private patio, a perfect spot to sit and enjoy a glass of wine after a long day. The kitchen is modern with all essential amenities and a dinning table suitable for 4, so if you don't feel like trying out one of the many local restaurants, you can enjoy a home co
neighborhood_overview: Based just a 10 minute walk from the central hub that is Clapham Junction, you are spoilt for choice whether you want to sit with a paper and a hot drink in an independent coffee shop, have a pint in a traditional english pub or a sophisticated meal in one of London's best eateries.  If the sun is shinning Wandsworth Common is just across the road, perfect to sit out on the grass and enjoy the good weather. Battersea Park is also just 20 minutes on the bus, a beautiful park set right on the River Thames. 10 minutes on the train from Clapham junction is Southbank, here you can board the London eye to enjoy some of the best views of the city or take a stroll along the Thames and stop off and have a drink or bite to eat at one of the many bars and restaurants overlooking the river. Clapham Junction connects to major underground stations such as Waterloo and Victoria making it quick and easy to get around the city.
notes: There is one flight of stairs required to access the main entrance.
transit: The flat is perfectly located to explore London with great transport connections, Clapham junction is just a 10 minute walk and a major transport hub in the city, allowing you to get to some of London's best loved areas in no time: - 20 minutes to Waterloo and Southbank, with attractions such as the London eye and London Dungeons  - 18 minutes to London Victoria which is the best train station for access to Buckingham Palace - 30 minutes to Westminster, where you can see Big Ben, Westminster Abbey and the Houses of parliament An alternate method of transport is to get a Santander bike from the docking station at the end of the road, a fun way to explore the city.
access: Guest will have access to entire apartment including private patio.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own   - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm   - No parties   - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply - we cannot guarantee the suitability of the apartment for children below 6 years of age

name: quintessential english experience in cute barnes
summary: Welcome to Norma Jean's house!  My home is cosy and perfect for someone looking for a quintessential english village experience while visiting London- or anyone looking for a short term let in the SouthWest London area.  The house has quite a chilled out hippie vibe- I like to burn incense, I have a very friendly and lovable Bengal/Tabby cat named Arthur, my decorations are vibrant and colourful- and I have an endless supply of herbal tea.
space: There is one room: it's a small room with a single bed, and shelving and hanger space for your clothes during your stay. There is a desk in the room as well. The house has a kitchen (I've got all the pots/pans/silverware/china etc), a back garden with a grill, table, and freshly grown vegetables, yoga mats, a cosy living room with TV, record player, small table for eating meals, loungey couch, and a full bathroom.  This is not a party house, and I treat it like a HOME. I am tidy, and like to keep things neat, but besides that I'm pretty relaxed and chilled out. I do ask that you clean up after yourself, i.e. if you use something in the kitchen, that you wash it etc.

This is not a party house, and I treat it like a HOME. I am tidy, and like to keep things neat, but besides that I'm pretty relaxed and c
neighborhood_overview: This is a very family oriented area. I have young children living on either side of my terraced house, which is why we have a noise curfew of 9pm.
notes: I do have a cat named Arthur. He is very cute, loves cuddles, and stays outside a lot of the time. i. e. you can't smell him! All I ask is that you make an effort to keep him in at night :)
transit: I live 10 minutes walk from either Barnes or Barnes Bridge station. These stations have trains directly to Waterloo in 18 minutes. Both walks are really nice, one is along the river Thames, and the other is through Barnes common. The house is also a 5 minute walk to the bus-stop where you can get busses directly to Clapham, Putney, Richmond, Hammersmith etc. If you don't have a contactless credit card to use on the train and bus, you will need to get an oyster card.
access: Guests have access to their rooms, the bathroom, kitchen, back garden, and living room. The only off limits areas are my room and my housemates rooms.
interaction: My roommates and I live here full time, so you would see us every day most likely. There is a lot to do in London and in the nearby areas, so I'm more than happy to help give ideas of things to do while you are in town.
house_rules: - no shoes in the house  - 9pm curfew  - do not go into my room, or my roommates rooms - try to keep my cat in at night :)  - make sure the doors are bolt locked before leaving the house
host_about: I'm originally from upstate New York. I'm a singer/songwriter/recording artist and live in London. I love to travel ... !

name: 3rd of 4 rooms in Georgian house by Greenwich Park
summary: The house is Georgian, Grade 2 listed, backs onto Greenwich Park and is within the Greenwich World Heritage Site. The historic buildings of Greenwich including the National Maritime Museum and The Cutty Sark are just a short walk away. Several overground stations and the Docklands Light Railway give good access to Canary Wharf, the City and Central London. Pubs, restaurants, shops and cafés are close by as is an excellent cinema and a theatre. We let four bedrooms so groups can be accommodated.
space: Guests are warmly welcome and have use of their bedroom and 2 bathrooms which may be shared with other guests depending on occupancy. They are also welcome to use the kitchen and diner for preparing hot drinks, light meals and have access to the fridge and shelving for storage. They may also use the washing machine and tumbler dryer.

We are happy to help guests with suggestions of things to do i
neighborhood_overview: Overlooking Greenwich Park, this historic house once owned by the Astronomer Royal, has a spectacular position. Greenwich boasts The National Maritime Museum, The Royal Naval College, The Cutty Sark and The Old Royal Observatory all of which are splendid for children and adults alike. It is on the Thames and The Thames Clipper and other boats can transport you to the Thames Barrier in one direction and up to Canary Wharf and Central London in the other. Greenwich itself and neighbouring Blackheath have shops, cafés and restaurants and Greenwich has an excellent cinema and a theatre. There are some attractive pubs within walking distance.
transit: There is parking for one or two cars outside the house and further parking a very short distance away. The Docklands Light Railway (8 minutes walk) connects you to the Underground system. The overground train stations of Greenwich, Lewisham and Blackheath are between 10 and 15 minutes walk away.
interaction: While we lead busy lives and so are in and out, we will be resident in the house during guests' stay. We are happy to help guests with suggestions of things to do in the locality but also respect their privacy if they prefer to keep themselves to themselves.
house_rules: Guests will be given a key and shown how to use the burglar alarm. They will have access to the kitchen with fridge and shelf space so they can make light meals and store small quantities of groceries.
host_about: We are a retired lawyer and web site designer with four children and 8 grandchildren. We love the arts, mountain walking and travelling. We are delighted to welcome you into our homes and to tell you about all the wonderful things you can do in our area of London and in the Eastern Pyrenees. In London we give you access to the kitchen to make tea and coffee and simple meals while, in Fuilla, you of course have sole use of the whole house. We are enormously enjoying meeting so many people from different  countries while they stay with us in London and are happy to welcome everyone.

name: Bright Double Room in Cosy Warehouse
summary: Split levels room available in a small and cosy converted warehouse. You will be sharing with a couple, and Lillo the cat. Occasionally we have dinner with the neighbours, we like to hang out together but we are also respectful of other's personal space. Constable Crescent is a small warehouse community full of lovely creative people. Ideal for artists, musicians, film makers etc. We have excellent transport links on the bus, tube, and rail.
space: The warehouse is fully equipped with internet, a gas cooker, large fridge freezer, washing machine and a decent size bath room. The unit is set at the back of an old factory and is relatively quiet with only a few friendly neighbours. Your bedroom is the lightest and airiest of all the rooms, with a bed located in a mezzanine above the main space, this will give you plenty of room to unpack your things.
description: Split levels room available in a small and cosy converted warehouse. You will be sharing with a couple, and Lillo the cat. Occasionally we have dinner with the neighbours, we like to hang out together but we are also respectful of other's personal space. Constable Crescent is a small warehouse community full of lovely creative people. Ideal for artists, musicians, film makers etc. We have excellent transport links on the bus, tube, and rail. The warehouse is fully equipped with internet, a gas cooker, large fridge freezer, washing machine and a decent size bath room. The unit is set at the back of an old factory and is relatively quiet with only a few friendly neighbours. Your bedroom is the lightest and airiest of all the rooms, with a bed located in a mezzanine above the main space, this will give you plenty of room to unpack your things. You can make yourself at home in the apartment and have access to any room and utility other than our own bedroom. We love having guests! Being nat
neighborhood_overview: Seven Sisters is an emerging creative hub in North London with new venues and restaurants popping up all the time. One of the best things about this area is the excellent transport links.  We are a few minutes away from Seven Sisters station, where there are many shops , buzzing restaurants, and a huge Tesco supermarket. An equal distance away is Tottenham Hale station, which is next to a massive retail park with fashion stores and cafes and has regular trains taking you to Central London and Stansted Airport in less than 30 minutes.  A 1 minute walk away is Markfield park and the beautiful canalside where you can go for a serene walk or a picnic.
notes: Sorry but we are not offering long-term arrangements.
access: You can make yourself at home in the apartment and have access to any room and utility other than our own bedroom.
interaction: We love having guests! Being native to London, we will be able to share with you the absolute best places to spend your time here.

name: Entire 4 bed home in zone 2 East Dulwich
summary: Beautiful Victoria 4 bed, 2 bathroom house on a quiet street in leafy East Dulwich (zone 2). Great base for a family or group of friends visiting London.
space: Local shops and cafes within five minutes' walk. London easily accessible either by train (15 minutes walk from house) direct to London Bridge or number 176 bus (24 hours) to Tottenham Court Road for Oxford Street shopping.  Free parking.
description: Beautiful Victoria 4 bed, 2 bathroom house on a quiet street in leafy East Dulwich (zone 2). Great base for a family or group of friends visiting London. Local shops and cafes within five minutes' walk. London easily accessible either by train (15 minutes walk from house) direct to London Bridge or number 176 bus (24 hours) to Tottenham Court Road for Oxford Street shopping.  Free parking.
host_about:
I love travelling and discovering real life in the place where I'm staying. That's why it's great to have people staying in our home in East Dulwich. We love East Dulwich because it gives you all the benefits of a village/ small town yet is in Zone 2 and only fifteen minutes train ride away from central London (train journey 12 minutes to London Bridge).  
I like discovering independent restaurants, cafes and pubs which is another reason why living in East Dulwich is great. There are always new places to try appearing in nearby areas such as Brixton and Dulwich. If you like good coffee, I'll certainly be able to recommend which cafes to try and which to avoid. I love the cinema particularly small budget and foreign language films which don't hit the mainstream cinemas. The East Dulwich Picturehouse is just 10 minutes walk away and  always has a great mix of mainstream and independent films.

name: COSY SINGLE ROOM in the Heart of London | SOHO
summary: This listing is for BEDROOM 2 - An affordable place to stay right in the HEART of London. Don't waste time and money on public transport, be in the middle of all happenings. PERFECT for adventurous travellers! Feel free to have a look at the pictures provided and read the captions to get an idea of what's around. For food and drinks + points of interests, check-out my Airbnb Guidebook. I'd always advise guests to read the whole description and some reviews to make sure the place is suitable. :-)
space: Having holidays in Central London for money far below the Hotel prices is now possible. I have a medium spacious bedroom to offer in a 2 bed flat located right in the centre of the centre of this great city. Have your own space to relax and rest after a hard day of sightseeing and be back in the middle of the action the next day. The room is a good size for 1 person and has a single bed, hair dryer, iron + board, shampoo, and universal adapters. The layout of the flat can be a bit weird because when you open the door, you are facing the communal staircase. Access to the rest of the flat is just next door, one step away. Some people prefer it because it separates them from the next door guests.  The kitchen is basic equipped with kettle, fridge and microwave only. Works just fine for heating some food and making a tea/coffee. The kitchen and WC is shared with another Airbnb guest who will be briefed to respect your space and privacy. There will be max 2 neighbours as next door is a doub

neighborhood_overview: Staying here will affect you in terms of having no public transport cost at all. You are located right in the middle of the most vibrant and liveliest area in London, the West End. Almost everything is within minutes walking distance. Mayfair and Soho for clubbing and going out, Covent Garden, Regent Street and Oxford Street for shopping, linked to the usual sights: Leicester Square, Piccadilly Circus, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben and the London Eye. For museum lovers: The British Museum, The National Gallery, Somerset house are all just nearby. There are also countless restaurants, musicals, and theatres surrounding us!
notes: London is the most visited city in the world and Central London is full of people. So expect noise. Ear plugs recommended if you are a light-sleeper.  Also, the flat is on the 3rd floor of a walk-up building and the flat itself isn't that big. So if you are looking for 5-star luxury and space, you have come to the wrong listing.  But if all this doesn't really bother you and you mainly want the convenience to stay in the middle of everything, you are more than welcome. The location is perfect for out-and-about travellers. PLEASE NOTE - Make sure you are ok with the check-in/out time (same as most hotels in London). I'm not available for check-ins on Fridays and Saturdays between 21:00 - 02:00 because I will be at work.  If you want the location and want a double bed, please consider my other listing. Hope to see you soon in London, feel free to contact and book at all times!
transit: The closest tube stations are Leicester Square and Piccadilly Circus. Both are about 7mins walk away as we are squeezed right in the middle. There are also various bus lines and an unlimited flow of taxis going to any other part of the city to which you desire. Public transport in this area is very convenient.
interaction: You can reach me during the day via the Airbnb app or (Hidden by Airbnb) .
house_rules: You are not charged for cleaning to keep the price down, so please look after the flat during your stay. It doesn't mean that you have to do the cleaning yourself. Oh no... Just don't be too messy. Like staying at a friends place. I'm sure you get the idea. Unfortunately, you will be charged for extra cleaning if the flat hasn't been loved. :( Please do not stand/jump on the bed. There were a few broken like this. Nobody must stay in the flat except those people who booked on Airbnb. Guests must not introduce strangers to the building. Please respect other residents in the building by limiting noise whenever you use the communal staircase. Please do not smoke in the flat. Please do not play loud music or otherwise make loud noise. Please report any breakages before you leave. Please do not bring animals to the flat. Please have a great time staying in my wonderful city! Oh, ONE more:  Please make yourself at home!
host_about: Always busy at work. Love quiet nights in and enjoy travelling whenever I get the chance. If not, a trip down the local coffee shop will do.

name: Central London Penthouse Room + Rooftop Terrace!
summary: Our penthouse flat is 5 minutes walk to both Farringdon Station and Chancery Lane, with popular nightclub Fabric, and The British Museum also close by. A perfect location for business travelers commuting into The City or regular travelers wanting a great jumping off point from central London. Couples or solo travelers welcome! The other room of this 2-room flat is occupied by a lovely, professional couple (both 27) who work in the area and are happy to be personable, or leave you to yourself.
space: The flat is located on the top floor of a corner building. The livingroom and kitchen are combined into a large bright room with wood flooring, a super comfy couch, and big TV. The bedroom is cozy yet spacious with carpeted floors and plenty of closet space. Walking up the stairs you will find the rooftop terrace which is perfect for morning coffee (on warm days) and having a glass of wine at the end of the day.

neighborhood_overview: We live right in the middle of Hatton Garden, which is famous for it's heritage of jewelry stores and film appearances.  Everything you need is close by, and by close by we mean super close: Grocery stores: Sainsburys Cafes: Pret, Eat Pubs: Bounce, Bleeding heart, Ya Old Mitre Street Market: Leather Lane weekday food market - great inexpensive food! Bank/ATM: Barclays and Santander
notes: We are on the 3rd floor and there is no elevator. While the stairs are wide and easy to move around on, it is something to be aware of.
transit: We are very close to Farringdon and Chancery Lane Tube stations. In fact we are between them! It is extremely easy to get around the city from this location. And of course, there is always a multitude of buses, Black Cabs and city bikes you can access.
access: You will have access to all of the house except for our (Hidden by Airbnb) bedroom. That means the bedroom, main room, bath room, and balcony are yours to enjoy.
interaction: We will usually be out traveling during your visit but one of us will be in the other bedroom. We love to meet new people and are happy to point out fun things to do in London.

name: A  cosy double room in Zone 6. B and B. Free Wifi
summary: The house is in a quiet tree-lined residential road. Ideal weekend place as well as convenient for business commuters . Convenient for travel  to London as within the London Zone 6 but also close to many National Trust locations and lovely countryside.
space: My home is comfortable and semi-detached with large light rooms, which have superb views over Caterham Valley. Please note there are several steps to reach the front door, but they are safe and there is a handrail. The guest room is at the back of the house overlooking Kenley Woods, so it is very quiet and rural. A breakfast of cereals, juice, yoghurts and fruit is provided, if required. There are also free drinks in the bedroom. There are many walks in this area which is of Special Scientific interest. Paths nearby lead up to Kenley Aerodrome, which is a famous Battle of Britain airfield. This area has many footpaths including London Loop, so it is a wonderful place for walkers to enjoy the countryside. There are many leaflets and books with information on local walks in the bedroom.  During the summer the famous Mayfield lavender fields in Banstead are a popular place to visit, which is a short drive from the house. In August (weather dependant) there is also a flypast over Kenley Ae
description: The house is in a quiet tree-lined residential road. Ideal weekend place as well as convenient for business commuters . Convenient for travel  to London as within the London Zone 6 but also close to many National Trust locations and lovely countryside. My home is comfortable and semi-detached with large light rooms, which have superb views over Caterham Valley. Please note there are several steps to reach the front door, but they are safe and there is a handrail. The guest room is at the back of the house overlooking Kenley Woods, so it is very quiet and rural. A breakfast of cereals, juice, yoghurts and fruit is provided, if required. Paths nearby lead up to Kenley Aerodrome, which is a famous Battle of Britain airfield. This area has many footpaths including London Loop, so it is a wonderful place for walkers to enjoy the countryside. There are many leaflets and books
neighborhood_overview: There are many restaurants and shops in easy reach of the house, which I am happy to tell you about. I have provided a folder to give you information about the locality. Croydon is in close proximity where you are able to find entertainment of different kinds.
notes: There are free parking spaces along the road where the house is located. It is a reasonably quiet road, especially outside peak hours. Please I would be very grateful if guests who arrive by car NOT park in front of house No 102 and park with consideration to house owners nearby. Please make sure that you read ALL the details in the listing to prevent embarrassing misunderstandings during your visit!!! Please bear in mind how long it may take you to travel from an airport or station, as my sign in time is by 10pm at the latest.  Please do not use any open flames in the house ie matches candles etc.
transit: There are free parking spaces along the road where the house is located. It is a reasonably quiet road, especially outside peak hours. Please use TFL Transport for London's website, which is very helpful in planning your transport to anywhere in the London area.  The walk from Kenley railway station is mostly flat with only one slight incline on the way. If it is convenient, I am happy to give you a lift from the station. 14 minutes to walk to Kenley station 14 minutes to Purley station by bus Approx 36 minutes from Kenley station to London Bridge Approx 41 minutes from Kenley station to London Victoria By car 15 minutes to M25 Junction 6 By car 30 minutes to Gatwick airport There are taxis available at Purley and Upper Warlingham stations There are one day travel cards for any transport in the London area (use after 9.30am) Oyster cards allow travel with a discount for longer periods of time.
access: You are more than welcome to use the garden, as well as the microwave in the kitchen. There is space in the fridge and cupboards to store food if needed. Please don't hesitate to ask to use any other facilities. Guests are welcome to order takeaways to be delivered  - a pack of local takeaway menus is available to you in the folder in the bedroom.
interaction: I'm a friendly person with many interests such as music and travelling(just been to India). I am interested in culture and love visiting historical sites in the area, which I can tell you about if interested. I will be around most of the time and look forward to getting to know you.
house_rules: - Please be quiet after 10.30 pm -Please  recycle rubbish Use of microwave and hob only unless permission is asked Use of lounge is not allowed. There is a TV in the room. Please be aware that if you are travelling from Stansted airport that the minimum of time it takes to reach my house is 2 hours .
host_about:
Hi. My name is Pamela and I have 2 daughters who don't live withe me. It won't be a surprise that they are the top 2 things I can't live without out. It is hard to describe the top 3 other things on my list, as it changes as the years go by! At the moment I am very keen on travelling to unusual places I have dreamed of visiting for many years ie I have been to Japan, Morocco Uzbekistan India and Nepal. When I am at home, I enjoy ceroc dancing very much, a good way to combine exercise and my pleasure in contemporary music. 
I enjoy Airbnb hosting which I have not done for long because I like taking care of people and helping them to make the most of their visit. I love meeting different people from all over the world and finding connections with them. 
My life motto is you're never too old to try something different.

neighborhood_overview: Parks The London Borough of Redbridge is reputed to have more green space than any other London Borough The largest park is Valentines Park which is just a short five minute walk, it stretches to different corners of Redbridge with a lake, mansion house and onsite cafes  Restaurants  There is an abundance of restaurants in the area and lots to choose from. I've listed my favourites: 1) JRC Global Buffet, Ilford (All you can eat of several cuisines, Chinese, Japanese, Indian, Italian) 2) Sahan, Ilford (Turkish) 3) Sahara Grill, Gants Hill (Middle Eastern) 4) Tinseltown, Gants Hill (American Diner) 5) Luigi's Italian, Gants Hill There are several bars, cafes and restaurants in the immediate area or take a short trip into central London.  The flat is easily accessible using Gants Hill Underground Station (Central Line), with direct trains to Stratford and the West End For drivers, the M11 motorway connects to the M25 and nearby 'A Roads'  include the A406, A12 and A13 Convenience stores a
notes: The sofa bed is located in the master bedroom and can be made up on request  Family amenities such as moses basket, cot, highchair, pushchair and even some books & toys can be made available at no extra charge, our only request is that you tell us as soon as possible so we can provide in time Both TV's in the apartment give access to freeview UK channels, I can give you devices for TV Streaming such as Roku TV with Netflix, Now TV & Gooogle_Chromecast for sharing your browser content with either of the TV's in the apartment (please ask in advance to confirm availability)
transit: Lots of travel options! - Travel by train from Heathrow Airport, Luton, Gatwick or Stansted - Travel by car from Luton, Heathrow, Gatwick or Stansted Airports - Use London Underground, Gants Hill central line is a short walk  For sightseeing there are direct central line trains to Stratford (Olympics 2012 Venue), Bank, St Paul's (Cathedral), Tottenham Court Road (Theatres), Oxford Circus (Designer Shopping), Marble Arch (Hyde Park)

This smell will also travel to neighbouring properties too This is an apartment in a house with a young family living in the other apartment, please respect their privacy Kindly ensure that the apartment is left in good order.  Rubbish should be disposed of using Black Bins on the Drive.  For your convenience, use the black bin bags located in the kitchen and dispose of with black rubbish bags using the Black Bin with the White Cross Unused towels should be left in the wardrobe - used towels to be left in the bathroom Please do not block the next door neighbours car as it will cause an inconvenience

name: Large Room in student flatshare with balcony.
summary: 17.5m2 space with desk and office chair. Own 2m balcony overlooking small park. Eco recycled student/creative flat in a gritty and for some intimidating urban location.  The flat has an unfinished warehouse feel to it, which is part of the recycled style. It is cleaned for every guest yet still will not be clean enough for some in appearance, If you don't like reused and repurposed decor and changes in progress PLEASE find a suitable alternative ELSEWHERE.
space: It's a cheap room for the size and location. Flat is uncarpeted bare wood with a few rugs throughout so the dust is minimal but it can sometimes feel less insulated and quite rustic (noise from footsteps, flaked faded floor paint that can look grimy even after cleaning - this will confuse some guests - but is a core part of the shabby eco look ). The flat has a work in progress feel about it which some find inspiring and others offputting.

neighborhood_overview: Local housing project block, some deprived areas around - Cctv throughout the estate so very safe.
notes: This place divides opinion. Some think it's cool, others not. Use of non biodegradable products plastic bags etc is strongly discouraged, aswell as harmful air freshness, it's an organic environment as much as possible. There are 4 bins in the kitchen. Do not book just because of the low price, you may feel disappointed if you have bourgeoisie taste and are therefore better off finding elsewhere to stay. Just don't book if unsure. The location and the general area also strongly divides opinion, tourists usually have a bad time here. Not so people with purpose.
transit: Rental bikes 1 min away, night buses overground rail underground, and best of all walking/cycling the canal. 18 mins to tube into west end, too far for some so not suited to west London tourists.
interaction: Always someone around to help with your cooking /and eating :)
host_about:
Easygoing and chilled out, always obeying house rules, unless it's my own place where they are always broken :)

Piano, cooker, coffee, vinyl, concrete.

neighborhood_overview: As one of London’s fastest growing and most stylish locations, recent developments in Shoreditch has made it an area that is firmly in demand. From the Elizabethan playwrights William Shakespeare and Christopher Marlowe to leading modern British artists such as Damien Hirst and Tracy Emin, Shoreditch has long attracted the brightest and best thanks to its thriving cultural scene, which contains a mix of boutiques, galleries, bars and restaurants. It can now safely be said that Shoreditch is one of London’s trendiest spots, having been transformed into a eclectic district of young artists, fashionistas and young professionals. Firmly routed in Underground Zone 1, there are fantastic transport links; as well as Liverpool Street Station and Old Street Station extensive travel routes are available via bus, Overground DLR or even the River Bus.  Shoreditch is home to some of the most exciting night life in the city with clubs and bars catering to all tastes and attitudes. Bars such as the B
transit: Old street tube station is a 5 minute walk and Liverpool Street tube station is a 10 minute walk.

name: CHELSEA BOUTIQUE APARTMENT
summary: In the heart of Chelsea only a few minutes walk to the museums, the V&A; the Royal Albert Hall and Hyde Park; the restaurants, bars and cafes, Harrods in Knightsbridge and the legendary Kings Road on your doorstep, there is absolutely something for everyone. A beautiful boutique studio apartment for 2 with private entrance only 5 mins walk to the tube.  Unlimited WIFI, full sky tv packageseparate kitchen + outside space. It is close to the Royal Marsden and the Brompton Hospital.
space: This boutique private studio apartment has everything you need for a luxury stay for two in central London.  Chelsea is one of the most exclusive areas of London and the apartment is competitively priced for this location.  The bed is a luxury pocket sprung full size double bed. A travel cot can also be provided (no additional charge for babies).  Newly built to the highest specification it combines quiet contemporary living with the advantage of being in the centre of the City with everything within easy reach.  There is a fully fitted contemporary  kitchen with electric hob, microwave/oven and washing machine.  There is a hairdryer and iron. Toiletries are provided. Full Sky TV package; unlimited Sky wifi.  The floors are antique oak and basalt.  The shower room is fully tiled with Chinese basalt and a power shower with underfloor heating.  There is plenty of storage behind wall to wall mirrored doors.  There is a private bijou patio area outside.
description: In the heart of Chelsea only a few minutes walk to the museums, the V&A; the Royal Albert Hall and Hyde Park; the restaurants, bars and cafes, Harrods in Knightsbridge and the legendary Kings Road on your doorstep, there is absolutely something for everyone. A beautiful boutique studio apartment for 2 with private entrance only 5 mins walk to the tube.  Unlimited WIFI, full sky tv packageseparate kitchen + outside space. It is close to the Royal Marsden and the Brompton Hospital. This boutique private studio apartment has everything you need for a luxury stay for two in central London.  Chelsea is one of the most exclusive areas of London and the apartment is competitively priced for this location.  The bed is a luxury pocket sprung full size double bed. A travel cot can also be provided (no additional charge for babies).  Newly built to the highest specification it combines quiet contemporary living with the advantage of being in the centre of the City with everything within easy reac
neighborhood_overview: The area is considered to be one of the most exclusive in London. With the charm of a smaller community, Chelsea is in the centre of all that London has to offer. Only a few minutes walk to the museums such as the V&A; the Royal Albert Hall and Kensington and Buckingham Palace; with the wide open parks of Kensington Palace Gardens and Hyde Park;  the restaurants, bars and cafes and the designer shops  in Knightsbridge, including Harrods of course, and the legendary Kings Road on your doorstep, there is absolutely something for everyone. For those guests who may need to be near the hospitals it is close to the Royal Marsden and the Brompton Hospital.
notes: This apartment is perfect for both couples wanting to experience all that London has to offer in a private luxurious space and equally for those travelling on business with very good wifi connection in a quiet private space situated in a central location with very good transport links.
transit: The apartment is only a 5 minutes walk to South Kensington underground with both District and Circle and Piccadilly lines taking you all over London.  There are also many buses and taxis readily available and Barclays Bikes in the next street for those who like to take the fresh air.  The Piccadilly line brings you to South Kensington straight from Heathrow airport and if you arrive at Gatwick you can take the Gatwick express to Victoria which is only 2 tube stops away.
access: Guests have their own private entrance with stairs leading to a self contained apartment with a separate fully equipped kitchen and beautifully appointed shower room.
interaction: I live close by to the apartment and am always available to answer any questions and help if I can. I will meet all guests and run through all you need to know if possible or leave detailed instructions and am always on the mobile. I know the area well and am happy to advise on places to go, restaurants etc. whilst respect the privacy of the guests.
host_about:
artist,
mother of 4 children,

summary: Large modern bright room with European double bed (140x200) and private bathroom. King's Cross. Shared terrace overlooking Regent's Canal. Central location, Quiet. 5 mins walk to the Eurostar and King's Cross metro (Zone 1) with six tube lines, as well as St Pancras International. Free parking.
space: Three bedroom canal side maisonette located in modern development.  A mere 5 minute walk will take you through to King's Cross & St. Pancras International. Overground and underground trains serve day and night, guaranteeing an effortless commute to your destination. In simpler words, you'll be at the centre of the centre... The property offers a fully-fitted kitchen (large fridge, dishwasher etc.) with adjacent generous reception and dining area, private balcony and access to a shared communal terrace overlooking Regents Canal. As a guest, you will have your own private shower and private toilet (two separate rooms). The apartment duplex provides allocated parking for one car.

name: **WALK EVERYWHERE! | CENTRAL LONDON, KENSINGTON!**
summary: Your own private bedroom and bathroom in affluent South Kensington / Chelsea - right in the heart of London! Walk to plenty of tourist attractions such as V&A Museum, Natural History Museum, Science Museum, Hyde Park, Harrods etc. Also just a quick cab ride to Victoria, West End clubs and Mayfair bars.  You will have a spacious private room with a king size bed and plenty of wardrobe space, as well as a private bathroom and even your own washing machine that you can use anytime you wish!
space: You will have a room with a comfortable double bed (orthopedic mattress), your own private bathroom with a washing machine so you can do your laundry whenever you need. I will also provide Oyster (travel) cards and UK/EU adapters.  You will be staying in one of the nicest and safest neighborhoods in Central London favoured by the rich & the famous with Harrods, Natural History Museum, V&A Museum etc. and plenty of great restaurants and coffee shops all within walking distance! Other perks: 1. NEVER waste time washing up! Just chuck the dishes in the dishwasher! 2. Pay-as-you-go gym 5 min walk from the flat with no lengthy contracts! Pay per visit, perfect for travelers who want to stick to their gym habits.   3. Grocery store and Starbucks opposite the apartment. 4. You will share the apartment with only 1 person - the host.  BOOK NOW AND ENJOY ALL THAT LONDON HAS TO OFFER!

neighborhood_overview: Easy walk to Old Street, Liverpool Street, and Hoxton tube stations. What I love about Shoreditch, Hoxton and Bethnal Green is the great range of cafes and restaurants If you're working in the City it's an easy walk, or a short cycle on a hire bike. If you're heading into the West End you've got the choice of tube, bus, or cycle. On weekends it's an easy stroll to the Columbia Road flower market and the Brick Lane precinct. This area is blessed with some great bars - I like to start my Saturday night with a Vietnamese on Kingsland Road and then head to George & Dragon or the Builders' Arms. Shoreditch is a great place to live - I hope you enjoy your stay here.

name: Amazing Knightsbridge £8 million 3 Bedroom
summary: This bright and elegant 3 Bedroom Apartment is amazingly located in Knightsbridge on exclusive Cadogan Square, 5 minutes’ walk from Harrod’s store and 8 minutes’ walk from Sloane Square and King’s Road, Chelsea.  The world’s top brands have shops in Sloane Street, moments away. Both Knightsbridge and Sloane Square tube stations are an easy walk from here.  Spacious and very comfortable for up to 7 guests, this apartment is superbly located for all the best shopping, sightseeing, theatres & more.
space: Your bright, spacious and elegant 3 Bedroom Apartment 2 Bathroom Apartment is superbly located in Cadogan Square, Knightsbridge – overlooking the elegant garden square from the Lounge and from the balcony right outside the Lounge.  Superb high-end shopping on Sloane Street is just moments away along Pont Street in Sloane Street – home to Louis Viton, Prada, Gucci, Versace, Tiffany and many more top names.  Your apartment is just 5 minutes’ walk from Harrod’s store, from Harvey Nichols and from other exclusive shopping in London’s Knightsbridge.  Close to some of London’s top hotels, including the Jumeirah Carlton Tower and Mandarin Oriental London, 6 minutes’ walk from this apartment put you in Hyde Park, the largest open space in central London.  Two minutes’ or less from your apartment is Cadogan Place NCP car park for secure parking of your car overnight or throughout your stay.  This car park is noted for the super cars which can be seen there, many the property of celebrities. You

Spacious and very comfortable for up to 7 guests, this apartment is superbly located for all the best shopping, sightseeing, theatres & more. Superb high-end shopping on Sloane Street is just moments away along Pont Street in Sloane Street – home to Louis Viton, Prada, Gucci, Versace, Tiffany and many more top names.  Your apartment is just 5 minutes’ walk from Harrod’s store, from Harvey Nichols and from
neighborhood_overview: Knightsbridge is one of the most exclusive residential areas of central London and it's really not hard to see why.  Some of the best shops and stores in London are on your doorstep and Knightsbridge is also a very central spot for getting around the rest of this great city. If you enjoy museums, there are some of London's best in this area - just a short walk down Brompton Road for the Natural History Museum, Science Museum and Victoria & Albert Museum. London is famous for its parks and Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park (essentially one park) are in easy walking distance. However, Knightsbridge was once just a village outside London and it still retains some of the atmosphere from those earlier days in side streets of mews houses, garden squares and some lovely, very individual shops and restaurants.  They can be a bit pricey but they are a unique experience.
notes: Check-In is from 3.00 p.m. Check Out is up to 11.00 a.m. We provide a full Meet and Greet Service - a member of the team will meet you on arrival at your apartment.  after you make your reservation, we will liaise with you over your arrival time and to arrange an airport transfer quotation for you, if needed. Please note that there is a flat Late Check In Fee of GBP 50.00 payable on arrival, if you are arriving after 9.00 p.m. A security deposit of GBP 500.00 is secured by AirBnB and will only be claimed against if there are any damages in the apartment during your stay.
transit: Knightsbridge underground station 8 minutes’ in the other direction from your apartment and has has the Piccadilly Line for direct to and from London Heathrow Airport as well as direct King’s Cross/St. Pancras for trains to Luton as well as trains to Paris, Brussels and elsewhere.  Liverpool Street for the Stansted Express is just one change.  Sloane Square underground station is also 8 minutes' walk from your apartment and has the Circle and District Lines - so you can take the train here direct to Victoria for the Gatwick Express.  There are direct routes to most of London's main sights, shopping areas and theatres with many just a few minutes' away from the station.
access: Everything you need for your stay is provided: - Bright, spacious Lounge with high ceilings - New, elegant Lounge furniture - Balcony overlooking the garden square - Dining Table and chairs (6) - Large Flat screen TV in the Lounge - Freeview channels - Free WiFi - Egyptian cotton linen and duvet covers - Ample wardrobe and drawer space - Fully equipped kitchen with:     - Oven     - 4-ring electric Hob     - Microwave     - Large fridge/freezer     - Toaster     - Kettle     - Washer/dryer     - Dishwasher     - Cutlery     - Crockery     - Glasses     - Cooking Utensils     - Saucepans - Ensuite bathroom to the Master Bedroom - Second Bathroom adjacent to the Second and Third Bedrooms - Additional toilet - Iron and Ironing Board Do you need a transfer from the airport?  Just let us know in good time and we will arrange it for you (cost, depending on airport and type of vehicle needed).
interaction: London Lifestyle Apartments take pride in ensuring that your whole experience matches the luxury of your apartment and the importance your visit to London has to you.  So, we will liaise closely with you very shortly after receiving your reservation to  arrange a transfer from the airport (if you need it) and ensure that a member of our team is on hand to welcome you to your apartment, show you around and answer any question you may have, as well as to share any tips on how to get the best out of your stay in London.  Once we have checked you in, you will have a 24 hour contact for any concerns you may have, which we will respond to promptly. We want you to think of your apartment as your London 'home from home' and for you to keep coming back and recommending us to your friends and family.  So, we will pull out all the stops to make sure that your stay in London is as special as we can make it.
house_rules: - On check in, we require the photo ID of the person who paid for the reservation and sight of the card used for the stay.  If this person is not a guest, their photo ID must be e-mailed to us ahead of arrival and the photo ID of the lead guest must also be shown. - Your apartment is in a building shared with other tenants and guests.  Please be very considerate of them. - No Parties permitted. - The whole building is strictly Non-Smoking. - No pets allowed under any circumstances. - Refuse may not be placed outside the apartment.  Our Housekeeper as needed to remove this properly.
host_about: My whole life has been built around travel, so it's a real pleasure to be able to share some of those opportunities with you.  I have had a long career in hotels and serviced apartments in the UK but now I just enjoy what I have always loved: travel.  Favourite destinations include Koh Samui, Thailand; Palawan, Philippines; Luang Prabang, Laos; Dambulla, Sri Lanka and many, many more.  My favourite food choices pretty much reflect where I love to go.  As I am not always in London, I have some friends from the industry who look after my guests and my properties for me.  Coming from the hospitality industry, quality of service is very, very important - especially with my luxury apartments - so we will take excellent care of you from the moment you first come into contact with us to the moment you leave London.

summary: A double bedroom with shared bathroom in an ideal location, 3 minutes walk to Camden Town station, 20 walk min to Kings Cross Station and St Pancras station, 5 walk minutes to Camden market. 5 min to London Zoo and Regents park.
space: You will have access to the Bedroom & Bathroom only, sorry no access to the kitchen but there are plenty of cafes & restaurants on this street. The way the flat is laid out means it will be very private, there is only me living here & the hallway leads to the guest bedroom, bathroom & my area, all with there own doors. The kitchen is in the same room as my bedroom/ studio & i work different hours, hence no kitchen access. The room is at the front of the flat & sometimes there is noise from traffic. There can also be noise from the pub a few doors down especially on weekends. (it's not ideal for light sleepers) There is a good stereo/digital radio with sleep timer & alarm, There is also an old 60's radio gram if you want to play any records or listen to films on your laptop. The Bathroom has been recently renovated. Towels Provided.

name: Clapham House - Spacious and Bright flat
summary: Stay in our spacious and bright two bedroom apartment near the heart of vibrant Clapham nightlife. It is very well located: 10min from park, 5min walk from to tube and 15 min from Central London and lots of restaurant near by in Clapham high street or Brixton. The beautifully decorated apartment  has two cozy double bedrooms, an extra sofa bed and a fully equipped kitchen. The flat has a 24 hour access.
space: Very bright apartment at ground level, no stair walking required. Spacious double bedroom with 2 wardrobes and one chest drawer. Bathroom with Bathtub.  Charming second bedroom with one wardrobe and chest drawer overlooking the inner patio. Spacious kitchen fully equipped. Lounge with sofa bed, opening to tiny terrace.
description: Stay in our spacious and bright two bedroom apartment near the heart of vibrant Clapham nightlife. It is very well located: 10min from park, 5min walk from to tube and 15 min from Central London and lots of restaurant near by in Clapham high street or Brixton. The beautifully decorated apartment  has two cozy double bedrooms, an extra sofa bed and a fully equipped kitchen. The flat has a 24 hour access. Very bright apartment at ground level, no stair walking required. Spacious double bedroom with 2 wardrobes and one chest drawer. Bathroom with Bathtub.  Charming second bedroom with one wardrobe and chest drawer overlooking the inner patio. Spacious kitchen fully equipped. Lounge with sofa bed, opening to tiny terrace. The key will be located in a key safe by the door side, the code will be given to you 4 hours before your arrival. I won't be at the flat as it will be all yours but you will be able to get in touch by phone or email if necessary. Residential area with nice little shops i
neighborhood_overview: Residential area with nice little shops in the street: garden pub, wine bar, a backer at 50m from the flat ideal if you want warm bred for breakfast, a stunning barber shop which would make me want to grow a beard if I could just to go there and also a cute colorful fabric shop. A bit further, 5min walk around Clapham north station there are a couple of picturesque restaurants and pubs, as well as the supermarket, very useful.  Then in Clapham high street , you can find all sort of restaurants and a lively nightlife, with various styles. You may even end up dancing on the table, some of the restaurant turn to dancing place later on. You can dance R&B, Latin dance or Crock all in the same evening. In you are sporty you can run in the common or just chill and enjoy a relaxing walk. A bit further you can jump on a bus to get to the near by Battersea park, go to the little zoo or go Ape ( the later is expensive ~ £27 for kids and £35 for adults)
transit: Explore London: Clapham is ideal place if you want to listen to a concert in O2 Brixton, or go for lunch at colorful Brixton market, note it is closed on Sunday. On the Northern line you can get off in Waterloo and enjoy a scroll on the amazing south bank, go to Tate modern, go to watch a play in rebuild original Shakespeare theatre, go up to the London bridge and tower of London. If you decide to walk west you can get in the London eye and enjoy the amazing view of London. On the way the kids might enjoy the aquarium and then if you cross the Thames you will be at the feet of the big Ben, parliament and ready to visit Westminster cathedral. Clapham is also a easy access to Leicester square and its west end theatre, Soho and its Chinese district and Piccadilly from which start the famous shopping street Regents avenue

Kitchen Guests are welcome to use the kitchen with the following conditions in mind: •  All utensils (plates, dishes, cutlery, pots and pans) are washed after use and returned to their original place so that they are available for others. • Work surfaces, cooker, hob and any other surfaces are cleane
host_about:
I am an easy-going Brit who enjoys meeting all types of new people. I consider myself fortunate to have been living in London for 10 years – a historical, culturally rich and diverse place to experience - if only for a little while!

I have travelled around a little of North & South America in my time, as well as parts of Europe which I believe has widened my periphery of life in order to better connect with those around me.

I am friendly, accommodating, sociable with a positive outlook, helpful, courteous and respectful with a sharp sense of humour (I am told).

I like to socialise, eat well, laugh hard, cite poetry, write comedy, create music, watch films, snowboard, play sports, express myself, explore new places and sleep soundly.

As a guest – I am quiet, clean, considerate, respectful and tidy up after myself.

My motto is: you cannot defeat he who doesn't give in

neighborhood_overview: Look out the bedroom window to see the London City skyline including The Shard tower or step out the front door and take in the breathtaking views of the ever growing Canary Wharf site. The East End is one of the fastest growing areas in London and you can see why, with bus and tube links that take you into the city within 15 mins. On the other side you have the DLR that can take you to Canary Wharf and the O2 Arena within ten minutes or Stratford in 15. Maybe you prefer to see the history of the East End? Take a Jack the Ripper tour and walk the streets and alleyways made famous by Britain's most famous serial killer. Cultures from all different parts of the world can be found at Whitechapel with a bustling market open 6 days of the week. Needless to say there is an abundance of restaurants in the area, take a fifteen minute walk and you will find the famous 'Curry Mile' in Brick Lane or some of London's trendiest bars in Shoreditch.
notes: Please note that it is a shared apartment and there may be other guests also staying
transit: The closest Tube station is Whitechapel station which runs the District, Hammersmith & City and Overground lines. You can also get the DLR at nearby Shadwell station There are also a number of local buses that stop within minutes of the apartment. If you are using public transport I would recommend that you purchase an Oyster card which is accepted on public transport in London. The cards can be topped up and is cheaper then using cash

neighborhood_overview: Shadwell links up well to many of London’s more popular areas thanks to the DLR line to Bank. The Docklands Light Railway station at Shadwell means that it’s easy to link up with some of London’s popular visitor attractions. The next stop along the line is Limehouse, home to a gem of a pub. Part-owned by Sir Ian McKellen, The Grapes (old haunt of Charles Dickens) is steeped in tradition and well worth a visit if you’re a fan of pubs and London’s history and culture. Check out the Jamboree too for a lively evening!
transit: Shadwell station is just a 3 minute walk away, providing both DLR and Overground services. The DLR can take you to Bank in just 3 minutes, and to Canary Wharf in 8 minutes. The Overground has great links to Shoreditch, Dalston and Highbury and Islington, as well as Canada Water and Whitechapel, which both have great links into central London. There are also plenty of buses nearby.

house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own. - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. - No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.
host_about: A wonderful host who will go the extra mile to make your stay happy and memorable! :)

neighborhood_overview: One of the world's most visited cities, London has something for everyone: from history and culture to fine food and good times. Art & Culture A tireless innovator of art and culture, London is a city of ideas and the imagination. Londoners have always been fiercely independent thinkers (and critics), but until not so long ago people were inherently suspicious of anything they considered avant-garde. That’s all in the past now, and the city’s creative milieu is streaked with left-field attitude, from theatrical innovation to contemporary art, pioneering music, writing and design. Food in all its permutations has become almost an obsession in certain circles. Time Travel London is immersed in history, with more than its share of mind-blowing antiquity and historic splendour. London’s buildings are eye-catching milestones in the city’s unique and compelling biography, and a great many of them – the Tower of London, Westminster Abbey, Big Ben – are familiar landmarks. host_about:
I grow up in London and I am working in property development for almost 10 years now. I love traveling and my passion is meeting different people all over the world and experiencing varied cultures from different countries. My favorite places are somewhere relaxing, but quite fun where you can enjoy a holiday getaway with not too much crowd. I have had visited a villa in Seminyak Bali and it was a very wonderful and memorable overall experience to me. I get inspiration on that lovely accommodation.

I also have a taste on classical music - Beethoven! I also like Jazz, it’s comforting and stress reliever haha! On my vacations, I don’t miss to play my favorite sport - football! I enjoy watching Super Bowl especially with my loved ones and few close friends. Yeah, I’m a family guy!

I’m also a big fan of National Geographic! Aside from being educational or informative, it’s fun to read and watch documentaries with brilliant photos and videos. It’s more fun to learn when you’re entertained as well. They are just amazing.

As an Airbnb host for quite long time, the thing that I enjoyed most about is meeting people from different parts of the world. It’s such a joy to finally meet the guests you’ve virtually once communicated. 

I am always looking forward to connecting with you as a host and I will do my best to make your stay in my apartment as comfortable as possible.

name: Stylish Whole Apartment - Parkside w/ Roof Terrace
summary: Come and stay in this stylish two bedroom apartment. Enjoy your own private roof terrace, with views of the River Thames & Wandsworth Park. Located in the heart of bustling Putney (Zone 2). A living & dining room, kitchen, private roof terrace, two double bedrooms and two bathrooms, split over two floors, offers you plenty of space to relax after exploring London. A 10 minute walk to Underground and Rail transport, a 15 minute journey into London's main attractions.
space: Welcome to our stylish apartment with views of Wandsworth Park and the River Thames. You can find a little peace and quiet whilst also being close to London's main attractions. The property is light and airy, relax in our cosy living space, next to our open plan kitchen. As keen cooks we can offer you everything you need to cook up your favourite dish, with a private roof terrace to enjoy your meal. Sleep soundly across two floors, in good size double bedrooms.

The apartment has 2 double bedrooms that will be available for
neighborhood_overview: Putney is a popular London neighbourhood located right on the River Thames. Famous for the Oxford x Cambridge Boat Race you will find traditional London pubs mixed with modern restaurants dotted along the River Thames. Couples and young families enjoy the beautiful parks and open space in this area.  On our road you will find 3 excellent cafes/restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner. A short 10 minute walk to bustling shops and restaurants of Putney High Street.
transit: The apartment is centrally located to many transport options. 10 minute walk to: - East Putney (London Underground Station - District Line): 15 mins to Central London (Direct line to Kensington, Chelsea, Victoria, Westminster) - Putney Bridge (London Underground Station - District Line): 20 mins to Central London (Direct line to Kensington, Chelsea, Victoria, Westminster) - Putney Rail Station (London Overground Station): 15 mins to Waterloo and Central London
access: The apartment has 2 double bedrooms that will be available for your use. A cosy living room, kitchen and a beautiful roof terrace is on the ground floor, with one double bedroom overlooking the park. There is also a small bathroom on this floor. Upstairs you will find another double bedroom, and a bathroom with a shower, bath and toilet. The building has 3 apartments in total. There is a shared entrance on the ground floor, the apartment is on the top floor and has a private door. Both the main door and apartment door have double locks. There is a third bedroom in the flat, which will be inaccessible. Leaving two double bedrooms split over 2 levels, the living/dining room, roof terrace, and 1.5 bathrooms for your use.
interaction: We will be happy to meet you upon arrival. If we're not available, for added flexibility, there is a key safe to allow for self check-in. We offer personalised, local recommendations of places to eat, things to see, and fun to be had.
house_rules: - The flat is our home, please treat it as your own.  - Please leave the house as you found it. - Flat 3 is on the top floor up two brief flights of stairs.  - The main entrance door and the flat door must be double locked when entering and leaving.
host_about: I’m based in London with my partner Will. We love getting outdoors, staying healthy and creating dishes in our kitchen. We host guests in our flat when we’re away with work or exploring new places.

name: Comfortable room, garden view and free breakfast
summary: You can enjoy a lovely breakfast (included in the price) or try one of the restaurants located within 2 min walk. The city centre is 10 min away from the local tube station (in zone 2). I am already a very experienced host for another property.  I can guarantee you a very comfortable experience at a fair price.
space: The flat has the advantage of being both in a very quiet street but also very near to public transport. The local underground station is Manor House, on the Piccadilly line. It is only 15 min walk or 5 min by bus from the flat. Your room includes:  - a double bed (144 cm x 190 cm) with a medium firm orthopaedic mattress.  - a lockable door  - lots of storage space  - Wifi  - a hairdryer.  And for the bathroom you have:  - Towels  - Shampoo.

neighborhood_overview: Manor House is the name of the area. It is famous for its numerous Turkish restaurants where the food is both very affordable and tasty. There are also a number of pubs and bars to choose from, so there is no need to travel to central London to spend a lovely evening.
notes: The property has an additional room where I can host two more guests
transit: Take the Piccadilly line and get off at manor house station (zone 2). Take the EXIT NUMBER SIX and, once outside, you will notice a bus stop immediately on your left. You can take any bus until Mattison Road, which is the fourth stop. The flat is located 2 min walk from there. If you are arriving from Heathrow airport, Luton airport or Stansted airport, it will take you slightly over an hour to reach my flat.
access: You are more than welcome to use the kitchen as a self-service breakfast is offered. It includes: - a toaster. - a kettle. - a selection of teas. - a microwave. - a fridge and your own cupboard space. Your breakfast includes fresh milk, fresh fruits, a choice of tea or coffee and selection of cereals. If you have any dietary requirements (gluten free, lactose intolerant, etc...) , please let me know before you arrive.
interaction: I really respect the space and privacy of my guests. Since you have your own keys, you can come and go as if you were in your own home. However, I work from home so I am happy to help at any time. Free free to ask anything or to tell me about your needs and plans when you book or arrive. After you check-out, you are welcome to leave your luggage in the flat to collect them later the same the day, except on weekends. If you already know London, then I will let do your own things. You can come and go as and when you want.
house_rules: - On the day of the check-in, please arrive BEFORE 10.00 PM.  - Leave the kitchen and bathroom as you find them. - Keep the noise to a minimum after 10.00 pm (i'll probably work the next day).  - No cooking after 10.00 pm.  - Please take off your shoes - I only host tourists and guests coming to London for pleasure (not business)
host_about:
I am originally from France, where I spent most of my life, before studying in Germany for a year and, finally, settling down in London in 1998.

Donc bien sûr je parle français puisque j'ai grandi en région parisienne ! 

Ich habe ein Jahr in Rheinland-Pflaz studiert und kann auch auf Deutsch reden.

I gave up a legal career, to work as a professional translator. Foreign languages, yoga, piano playing, sports and travels abroad represent a big part of my life. I am really happy to be an Airbnb host. The most exciting part is for me to meet people from a totally different cultural background. 

My flat is located in haringey. It is a very multicultural area of London. If you love Turkish food, then you will be heaven ! The local restaurants are not expensive and serve truly delicious food !

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask at any time. I'll happily give you all sorts of tips and info to make your stay an enjoyable one.

See you, à bientôt j'espère, tschüss !

name: Large, bright loft room with private bathroom
summary: Lovely large bedroom with private bathroom in a converted loft space. King size bed and private bathroom with a shower. We live as a family (1 baby and one 3-year-old at the time of writing (2018) on the floor below.  To access your bedroom and bathroom there is a flight of stairs up from the street into our flat and then another flight of stairs up from our sitting room (see pictures). So you have your own top floor. We do use the tumble drier in the bathroom but nothing else!
space: Our house is a short 5 minutes bus ride (they go every couple of minutes) or an 18-minute walk from Brixton tube. Brixton is very close to the centre of London. 7 minutes on the tube to Victoria and 16 minutes on the tube to Kings Cross. We are on a great bus route that takes you all over London too.  We have been hosting on Airbnb for many years now and have recently completed this loft conversion so the room is brand new and really bright and beautiful.  Brixton is a great place to be based. It is a real food and drink destination in London itself and is also a great spot to be based to be close to all the London attractions.

notes: We are a family of four. We have one-three-year old (at time of writing! June 2018) and a 2-month-old. Generally, we are a quiet family but do have the occasional bad night.  I have been told by friends and family the loft room is very sound insulated but if you are a light sleeper and this may be an issue for you, our house may not be ideal.
access: You will have your own bedroom and bathroom. We do use the tumble drier in the bathroom but will not use this late at night or early in the morning!  You are welcome to sit in our sitting room and use the basic facilities in our kitchen (fridge and microwave) but we ask that you don't cook big meals in the oven/on the stove.  We have a garden out the back of the flat too that you are welcome to use too.  We have two other bedrooms that we use on the main floor of the house.
house_rules: No shoes in the house! You are welcome to use our toaster, microwave and fridge to prepare simple food but we ask you don’t cook any big meals in the kitchen
host_about: Hello, we are Rebecca and Ross, a friendly couple in London with two kids (at the time of writing, August 2018, they are 3-years-old and 2-months-old). Ross is from Australia and Rebecca grew up in Hong Kong but we call London home now. Ross is a school teacher here and Rebecca teaches yoga and freelances in brand consultancy. We love Brixton and have been here now for 6 years so have lots of advice for guests!
