neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the heart of Angel, a lively area with great restaurants, pubs, parks, cinemas, pharmacies, shopping centers, supermarkets and everything you need to enjoy the most of your stay in London. - Chapel Market, 5 mins away from the apartment, offers fresh fruits, vegetables, flowers, delicatessens and clothing.  - Camdem passage, only 2 mins away, is world famous for antique and contemporary shops, as well as restaurants, cafes, traditional pubs and a great daily free comedy club.  - Upper street, 2 mins from your room, is full of international restaurants (Italian, Turkish, Mexican, Japanese, etc.), night clubs and pubs  - Angel Central, 5 mins away, is a shopping center offering dining, entertainment, events and brands like H&M, MUJI, Tiger, Oasis, Calzedonia, and GAP among many others.
notes: Internet WIFI unlimited connection is provided. The room has plenty of power socket adapters, so you don't have to worry about how to plug your devices no matter where you come from.
transit: The apartment is very well connected:  - 7 min walking from Angel subway station (Northern line), 10 min walking from Highbury and Islington (Victoria line & overground)  - 13 min away from King's Cross and St Pancras Station by bus.  - 30 min walking from St. Paul Cathedral, 40 from the British Museum.  - Convenient bus stop right in front of our door, with connections to Victoria, Waterloo, Liverpool St, etc.
access: Guest are welcomed to use the bathroom and toilet, as well as the kitchen, fully equipped with washing machine, toaster, blender, kettle, juicer, etc. The kitchen includes a breakfast table with two stools.

name: Lovely double room with en-suite close to tube
summary: The double room has an en-suite shower and is situated on its own floor. The house is close to Wimbledon (on the borders of Merton Park) 10 minute walk from Morden Northern Line Tube, 15 minute drive from Kingston.  Just 30 minutes into Central London. You’ll love my place because of the surprising views across London, friendly family atmosphere, public transport links, proximity to the A3, Gatwick Airport, Surrey & Sussex. My place is good for solo adventurers, couples & business travellers.
space: The room is very private as it is situated on its own floor at the top of the house. There is exclusive use of a newly refurbished private bathroom. There are views across London taking in the London Eye, The Shard and Canary Wharf in the distance. The house backs onto a vineyard and is very quiet.

The garden is also accessible. We like to speak to guests and catch up on
neighborhood_overview: Notable details about the area includes fabulous parks, close proximity to Wimbledon & Wimbledon Village as well as Kingston and even the coast is only 1 hour 15 mins away.  Considering how close we are to Central London it is great to also have access to so many gorgeous villages, shopping centres and rural areas.  The 24 hour Northern Line has to be the most attractive feature of this area however, making commuting, partying and sight seeing hassle free!
notes: There are lots of fun things to do in this vicinity without even venturing further into London - Trampoline Parks, swimming, yoga, Cube Escape games, lots of theatres, cinemas, bowling, soft play, tennis, rugby & football clubs, farms, horse riding, wetlands, nature trails, art galleries, restaurants, great shopping, beautiful parks, outdoor film screenings & theatre productions, live music, bars and even a couple of nightclubs!
transit: 24 hour Northern line enables smooth and efficient journeys into London. We are also a 10 minute bus journey or one train stop from Wimbledon Town Centre which provides access to the district line and overground trains. Trans run from Morden to London areas further south. The bus service is great in this area, often providing superior service to local trains.
access: The top floor of the house. Some access to the kitchen for residents who are staying for longer periods to store and eat meals. The garden is also accessible.
interaction: We like to speak to guests and catch up on their movements and experiences.
house_rules: - Single occupancy is preferred, especially for longer stays (over a week).  We ask for a £7 supplement for double occupancy - We have a travel cot for toddlers and a sofa bed should you require guests to visit - Breakfast is available upon request and availability at a cost of £7 per person -Please ensure minimum noise after 8pm as there will be children sleeping -No entertaining is permitted in the room -The rate is for the room and shower room only. There is no recreational space available for your use. -Please leave shoes in the hall in the basket provided. No shoes are to be worn in the house.  -Eating is permitted in the room at the table provided. Please do not leave dirty plates in the room overnight. Please put them in the dishwasher in the kitchen.  -The kitchen is available for you to eat breakfast, make drinks and heat food in the microwave. -Landline calls can be received by prior arrangement only  -Smoking is permitted in the rear garden only where an ashtray is provided
host_about: We are a family of four.  Our 13 year old son is currently at secondary school and our daughter started Reception at a local school this year. We have a cockerpoo, Winston, who is very friendly and chilled. I run my own business providing entertainment to the events industry and my husband works in Canary Wharf, taking advantage of the fast routes into London from our home.  We very much enjoy living in Merton, it is a great borough with a lot to offer families.  We have a flat in central London that we rent out and now we are offering our loft space in our family home on a B'nB basis to students, travellers or young professionals.  Life's too short to stay in one place - we love to travel and so enjoy welcoming other travellers to our home.

name: Comfy Cozy Room in Kennington London for 1 Person
summary: A private bedroom in a light & bright flat in central London, Kennington SE17 3HT. The apartment is very quiet and private on the top (4th) floor of a 1969 built building. Its conveniently located within 8 mins walk of Kennington Tube (Northern Line) which goes to both Charing Cross (West End) & London Bridge (East End).  Hopefully this will be the ideal place for you to stay while exploring London.  Thanks for browsing!
space: This apartment has great sunsets in the evening from the small balcony.  Just a note, this listing is only for one (1) room, I live in the second (2nd) room. I will NEVER have other guests or friends to visit while hosting my guests, both for your peace of mind and your privacy. So your luggage/belongings will always be safe and you won't need to worry about other people in the flat during your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This is a very quiet neighbourhood (mostly young families), with easy access to both the West End (Oxford Street, Leicester Square, Theatre District) and the East End. Also Kennington has all the benefits of great pubs nearby, all the major UK supermarkets in walking distance and is very close to Waterloo and Southbank (London Eye, The Tate Modern, Royal Festival Hall) as well as London Bridge (The Shard, Borough Market, Maltby Street Market).
notes: Sometimes I can help with an early or late checkin/checkout and storing bags. Please ask ahead if you will require that so we can work something out. When travelling from overseas, especially long distance, please let me know your arrival time and flight, this lets me check if your flight is delayed and not be home waiting unnecessarily for you :)
transit: My flat is an 8 minute walk to Kennington Tube (Underground) station. There are also buses available on Walworth Road (which go to and from the city) and Camberwell New Road  (which go to and from Victoria Train, Bus and Tube station) Some smartphone apps to help you when visiting London to download ahead: Tube Map - London Underground by Mapway Limited (For Tube map, times and help) Bus Times London by Mapway Limited (For Bus times and help) myTrains train times and tickets by Mapway Limited (For Train times and help) Trainline UK by thetrainline (To purchase train tickets) redspottedhanky by Atos Origin (Cheap deals on train tickets)
access: You will have access to your Airbnb room, the open-plan living room and kitchen, the bathroom and (seperate) toilet and the balcony. There is a kettle, toaster, microwave, oven, stove-top, washer/dryer, and a hairdryer is stored in your room next the bed. If you need any extra linen (towels/sheets/pillowcases) during your visit there is a linen cupboard and you may take what you need.
interaction: I am always available via the Airbnb app.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house - No guests please - No smoking/smokers - No drugs - No parties
host_about:
Hi, I'm Matt. I've lived in London for 15 years and I'm originally from Australia. 
I love everything about the Airbnb community and especially hosting Airbnb guests visiting London and making sure they always have a great stay. I also love travel myself, and try to always create a comfortable base for my guests to use staying in London and enjoying the sights and everything this great city has to offer. I'm easy going, and I like my guests to feel at home and to feel relaxed when they stay. When they have questions, I'm also always available via the app to help. I hope you will consider staying with me when you visit London too. Please read the reviews to get an idea of what people thought when they stayed. Thanks for browsing my Airbnb home!

name: Sunny, modern flat in Notting Hill
summary: Located on a quiet, leafy street overlooking a pretty little park, this bright and sunny first floor flat is just 100m from vibrant, bustling Portobello Road, with its famous market and dozens of great restaurants and pubs. Westbourne Park and Ladbroke Grove underground stations are both just 300m away for access to the whole of London.
space: This 1 bedroom flat is located on the first floor, up one flight of stairs in a Victorian terraced house. I believe its uniqueness lies in the fact that it is so close to 'the action' of Portobello Road, but is actually very quiet with no disturbance from crowds or late night carousing. It has high ceilings and is bright and airy, with a dual aspect, and the main rooms have original polished wooden floors. The living room has a big bay window that overlooks a little park which gives a lovely green leafy outlook in summer, and also views of Portobello Road - great for people watching! In addition to a comfy sofa and coffee table, there is a small dining table with two chairs (there are 2 spare chairs for additional guests in the hall cupboard) TV, and a sofa bed which pulls out to make an additional small double bed. The bedroom has a comfy double bed, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space, and USB charging points by the bedside table to charge your phone overnight. The kitchen is fully e
description: Located on a quiet, leafy street overlooking a pretty little park, this bright and sunny first floor flat is just 100m from vibrant, bustling Portobello Road, with its famous market and dozens of great restaurants and pubs. Westbourne Park and Ladbroke Grove underground stations are both just 300m away for access to the whole of London. This 1 bedroom flat is located on the first floor, up one flight of stairs in a Victorian terraced house. I believe its uniqueness lies in the fact that it is so close to 'the action' of Portobello Road, but is actually very quiet with no disturbance from crowds or late night carousing. It has high ceilings and is bright and airy, with a dual aspect, and the main rooms have original polished wooden floors. The living room has a big bay window that overlooks a little park which gives a lovely green leafy outlook in summer, and also views of Portobello Road - great for people watching! In addition to a comfy sofa and coffee table, there is a small dining
neighborhood_overview: "Great neighbourhood. The Portobello Rd area is a lively area of shops, the famous outdoor market, restaurants, music & people from all over the world, yet the apartment is quiet and peaceful." Groceries and Restaurants There is a Tesco Metro supermarket just around the corner, 3 minutes, and the neighbourhood is full of delis, restaurants and cafes. The Portobello Road fruit and veg market runs every day except Sunday, also 3 minutes away. There is a list of recommendations in the flat within the flat handbook. The area is full of noteworthy sites to see - the closest being some of the places made famous by the film 'Notting Hill' - the Travel Bookshop in Blenheim Crescent, and the famous front door which is actually opposite NuLine hardware store on Westbourne Park Road.
notes: We have let via Airbnb previously, here is what our guests have said: Ben is a very nice host, very accessible and very kind. The apartment is perfect, perfectly clean, located in a fascinating neighbourhood. We had a perfect stay. Thank you Ben. Highly recommended. Nicolas Gachon - November 2017 Great host & great location. Would definitely visit again Wayne Griggs – October 2017 It was excellent, very comfortable, well located and clean place. Highly recommended! Jamie Muñoz – October 2017 The flat is in a great location. Literally around the corner from Portobello market. Lots of places to eat. A five to 10 minute walk to two tube lines. Annette was there to check us in, very friendly and helpful. Tiffany Nicolau – October 2017 Terrific spot for exploring London. Ben is a wonderful host. Fraser Nelson – September 2017 What a lovely flat and perfect location, not only for the shops and restaurants but also transport into most of London. Ben was helpful and easy to deal with before we
transit: Public transport: there are excellent public transport links. Tube/Underground stations: 5 minutes walk: Westbourne Park and Ladbroke Grove tube stations, both on the Circle line, Hammersmith & City lines. 20 minutes walk: Notting Hill Gate (Central line) - an enjoyable stroll down the length of Portobello Road to get there. Buses: There are innumerable bus routes that run up and down Ladbroke Grove and also Great Western Road. Parking: this is both difficult and expensive, at pay and display bays only. It is not recommended to bring a car - in fact, it is a hindrance! Cycling: there is a 'Boris Bike' bike hire rack 10m from the front door, near the little park. Getting there from Heathrow airport: Heathrow Express to Paddington Station, then either tube to Westbourne Park, or a taxi. The tube can be paid for with an Oyster card or any contactless credit or debit card (beware overseas transaction charges if you are using a non-UK card - an Oyster card, purchased in advance or at the ti
access: The flat is self-contained and is let as a whole unit.
interaction: We have lived and worked in this area for over 30 years, and know it very well. There are guidebooks in the flat and a list of local cafes, bars and restaurants. We are regular users of AirBnB from Manhattan to Bejing, so we are very aware of what makes a happy comfortable experience, and we will try to aim a little higher than that. So please let us know if we can make any improvements. We will normally meet you on arrival to hand over keys, give you a tour of the flat and answer any queries you might have.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.
host_about: I'm a  doctor who travels a lot for work - India, Africa, Russia and central Asia. I have a cat and a boyfriend and love good food and wine, cycling and warm firesides.

neighborhood_overview: TimeOut "Some say Shoreditch has had its day, that London’s trendy brigade have moved on. If you go to Brick Lane Market, though, it doesn’t look that way. The weird and wonderfully dressed hordes keep coming to the rough triangle made up by Old Street, Great Eastern Street and Shoreditch High Street, packing into ramshackle bars and independent shops. Despite the spread of affluence, much of the area maintains its original gritty, urban edge; many of the walls and shop fronts are plastered with graffiti"

name: Double room in leafy Brockley
summary: Homely, bright and spacious 2 bedroom maisonette in a lovely leafy neighbourhood close to the centre of London. Located in Brockley, South of the river in London (Zone 2) with close access to London underground and mainline rail (7 minutes to London Bridge, 17 minutes to Shoreditch).  You would have your own private double room in the house with access to bathroom, kitchen and living area.  The neighbourhood has several cafes, restaurants, supermarkets and a large park within walking distance.
space: The space is a double room with a double bed, bed side table, wardrobe, chest of draws and plenty of coat racks on the wall in the room.  The bedroom is overlooking the garden and is very quite.
description: Homely, bright and spacious 2 bedroom maisonette in a lovely leafy neighbourhood close to the centre of London. Located in Brockley, South of the river in London (Zone 2) with close access to London underground and mainline rail (7 minutes to London Bridge, 17 minutes to Shoreditch).  You would have your own private double room in the house with access to bathroom, kitchen and living area.  The neighbourhood has several cafes, restaurants, supermarkets and a large park within walking distance. The space is a double room with a double bed, bed side table, wardrobe, chest of draws and plenty of coat racks on the wall in the room.  The bedroom is overlooking the garden and is very quite. Fully functional kitchen with gas stove and oven, microwave, washing maching and fridge/freezer. The kitchen has a table and chairs with planty of space to eat on.  Fell free to use the kitchen table to work from when not in use. You can use a shelf in the fridge/freezer and cook on our stove if you wish
neighborhood_overview: There are plany of cafes and places to eat, with cocktal bars on hand if you want to enjoy and stay in the area. We also have a local brewery and an award winning fish and chip take away/restaurant as well as Asian, Caribbean and European cuisines on offer.  A 5 minute walk from the house you will find the vast Hilly Fields, our local park, with a cafe offering a selection of hot and cold food and beverages. I will be more than happy to advice on which are my favourites and where to go.
notes: Ideal for solo or couple travelers or those in London for work commitments.
transit: There are two main train stations within walking distance of my home, both going towards Central London and The City. There are two main train stations within walking distance of my home: Brockley (8 minute walk) and Crofton park (5 minute walk). Destinations from Brockley include: London Bridge, Gatwick Airport, Canada Water, Shoreditch High Street and Highbury and Islington. Destinations form Crofton Park include: Blackfriars, Kings Cross and Luton Airport (plus many more inbetween and beyond). There are also frequent busses that pass through Brockley, connecting it to other interesting neighbourhood towards and away from Central London (Peckham, Brixton, Dulwich, Covent Garden)
access: Fully functional kitchen with gas stove and oven, microwave, washing maching and fridge/freezer. The kitchen has a table and chairs with planty of space to eat on.  Fell free to use the kitchen table to work from when not in use. You can use a shelf in the fridge/freezer and cook on our stove if you wish to eat in.
interaction: I live in the appartment and will be on hand to offer questions and advice about where to go in and around the area.
host_about:
I am a professional dancer, teacher and choreographer. Movement is my passion. Expression is what drives me. Meeting new people excites me. Traveling is in my heart. Love is in my soul.
My life motto is: Peace, Love and Movement.

description: Spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom apartment. Minutes walk from Maida Vale underground station Comfortable home with three bedrooms and three bathrooms, two of which are en-suite. Two bedrooms has a double bed and a single bed and ensuite bathroom, the 3rd bedroom has 2 double beds, wardrobes plus lots of space. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located between Little Venice and Maida Vale. There are many lovely restaurants, bars, pubs and shops nearby. The canals of Little Venice are just a 5 minute walk from here. This leafy part of London is very well connected and very close to the city itself. Buses and Bakerloo line tubes take you into central London / West End within about 15-20 minutes. Paddington station is about 10 minutes away.
notes: Parties are strictly not allow at this property
transit: Maida Vale underground station, the exact distance is 0.5 miles
access: The whole apartment
interaction: 24/7 available for any questions on airbnb app
house_rules: - Please respect the flat and the neighbours. There are a number of books and other such items in the apartment for you to enjoy during your stay, please ensure that they are respected and maintained so that other visitors after your stay may also enjoy them in the same manner you have. Please leave the flat as clean and tidy as you found it and free from personal belongings. Please note that the price paid for the check out cleaning is intended for standard cleaning and launderette (3 hours), this doesn't include washing plates, throwing leftovers of food, etc. or any other issue which would require extra time. Any additional hour will be charged to the guests at standard rate of £15/hour. CHECK IN/OUT Check-ins from 7pm to  11pm will incur an extra £25 fee. Check in from 11pm onwards will incur an extra £40. It is your responsibility to inform us of any delay as soon as possible. Without this I will wait 45 minutes past your agreed arrival time. Past 45 minutes you will be charged £3
host_about: I'm originally from Spain, but I have been living in London half of my life. I love this city! and I love traveling. I think through airbnb you get to know places in a different way.

name: Stylish Self Contained Garden Room Studio.
summary: Tottenham/Turnpike Lane-Stylish,  contemporary and  minimalist but very comfortable. This is a quiet location for those needing a peaceful night's sleep. Enjoy the trees in the morning and stars at night through the skylight windows, but please do note that this is a light room for those who prefer dark rooms in the morning. Blinds to front for privacy. Why not enjoy breakfast al fresco in the summer months in the garden terrace. Extra guests incur a £10 a night supplement. A maximum of 2 guests only.
space: A  private self contained garden room with en -suite shower and WC. There is also a kitchenette with small fridge, toaster and kettle. Coffe, tea and milk availble. Bread,  butter and jam for first morning. Private access to summer house is via own side entrance. Very comfortable and a quite space to relax. Heated by very effective electric radiator. Wide screen TV in situ.
description: Tottenham/Turnpike Lane-Stylish,  contemporary and  minimalist but very comfortable. This is a quiet location for those needing a peaceful night's sleep. Enjoy the trees in the morning and stars at night through the skylight windows, but please do note that this is a light room for those who prefer dark rooms in the morning. A  private self contained garden room with en -suite shower and WC. There is also a kitchenette with small fridge, toaster and kettle. Coffe, tea and milk availble. Bread,  butter and jam for first morning. Private access to summer house is via own side entrance. Very comfortable and a quite space to relax. Heated by very effective electric radiator. Wide screen TV in situ. Own side entrance through garden to the studio. You can leave messages by email via air bnb or if we are home, pleas
neighborhood_overview: Family neighbourhood. There are 2 lovely parks approx. 2 minutes from the house.  Both have cafes: Downhills Café opens at 9 and serves breakfast and lunch.  The Hub Café in Lordship Rec Park  opens at 11 and serves light snacks and lunches. Both serve good coffee.  There is also the very pleasant Forks and Green  Cafe at the West Green Rd side of Downhills Park. (Opens 8am) Wood Green is the nearest shopping centre and the W4 bus runs approx.  every 15 mins . There is also Café Lemon on the way to Seven Sisters which is 15 minutes to Oxford Circus on the Victoria Line.
notes: Please note: sorry no smokers. Thank you. Light room in summer months due to skylight.
transit: Access to Turnpike Lane tube station (Picadilly Line) on foot is 10 minutes or by W4 bus 5 minutes- less than 1 minute from the house;  or a 15 minute walk to Seven Sisters tube station on the very speedy Victoria line. 15 mins to Oxford Circus.That's 30 minutes into central London!   25-30  mins to Holborn on Piccadilly line from Turnpike Lane. We are in a suburban area. If you have a car, parking permits are supplied on request for restriction  beteen 2-4 pm.
access: Own side entrance through garden to the studio.
interaction: You can leave messages by email via air bnb or if we are home, please  knock on the kitchen door if you need anything: parking permits,  hair dryer, iron etc..
house_rules: Please remove shoes. It would be helpful if you could wash up cups.
host_about: I am friendly and interested in people.  I live with my partner and two children. I enjoy music, art and the theatre, although often there is little time to fit this in!  Professionally I am a teacher but family comes first.

name: Contemporary Kensington Home with Garden
summary: Contemporary in style and feel throughout, this 4 bedroom Kensington home with garden on Lexham Gardens is ideal for groups of business travellers, families and friends.
space: With hardwood floors throughout, you’ll find an airy, spacious living room with high ceilings and a stylish living room and dining area Contemporary in style, connecting perfectly with a wonderfully fully equipped kitchen, this home is the perfect base for a visit to the capital. Nip downstairs, and you’ll find four delightful double bedrooms, similarly calm, light and homely with gentle soft décor, there are two luxurious bathrooms, one ensuite with a breathtaking bathtub to die for, and the other with a gorgeous power shower.  Please note that access to the fourth bedroom is through the garden. If you are travelling with small children, please let us know and we will be happy to provide a cot and a highchair.
description: Contemporary in style and feel throughout, this 4 bedroom Kensington home with garden on Lexham Gardens is ideal for groups of business travellers, families and friends. Please note that access to the fourth bedroom is through the garden. If you are travelling with small children, please let us know and we will be happy to provide a cot and a highchair. Our guests have access to the entire apartment. Choosing a luxurious apartment comes with royal treatment - w
neighborhood_overview: If you can tear yourself away, wander the nearby streets and feast your eyes, as you are located in the middle of one of the highest concentrations of high-end restaurants and boutiques in London. This royal area is simply breathtaking - visit Victoria and Albert Museum, the Science Museum and the Natural History Museum, or even Kensington Palace. For a touch of nature, and peaceful morning walks, choose Kensington Gardens - home to the Serpentine Lake, the Serpentine Gallery and the Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial playground. If you desire to explore further, the nearest tube station is just a seven minute walk away.
notes: Our usual check in time is until 19:00.  However if you need to check in later, please let us know and we can make arrangements for a late check in for you.  This may incur an extra fee.
transit: Gloucester Road Tube Station is less than a 10 minute walk away (Circle, District and Piccadilly lines)
access: Our guests have access to the entire apartment.
interaction: Choosing a luxurious apartment comes with royal treatment - we are at your service to assist with anything you might need at any time of the day - just get in touch with us to let us know what you need and we will be more than happy to help.
house_rules: 1. Check-in schedule: From 01/01 to 31/12: everyday from 14:00h to 19:00h. 2. Check-out schedule: 10:00.

name: Heart of Highbury
summary: Highbury Hill is one of the loveliest streets in North London sloping down from leafy Highbury Fields, which connects it to bustling Upper Street, the heart of Islington.  Within the garden maisonette of a large Victorian terraced house.  Easy connections via Arsenal tube straight into central London.  We are conveniently situated for all airports & Eurostar.  Room spacious, clean & quiet.  Space for child's bed.
space: Lovely large double room in family home in leafy Highbury.  Eclectic mix of retro & antique furniture, ethnic fabrics & original artwork.  Comfy sofa & desk.  Kettle (tea, coffee).  Sole use of bathroom.   We are 5 mins from Arsenal Underground, Highbury Fields & Emirates Stadium.  15 mins from Central London.  Local shops, restaurants & parks to enjoy.  10 mins walk from Upper Street, Islington.  Flexible check in.  We are on hand to help with any queries.
description: Highbury Hill is one of the loveliest streets in North London sloping down from leafy Highbury Fields, which connects it to bustling Upper Street, the heart of Islington. Local shops, restaurants & parks to enjoy.  10 mins walk from Upper Street, Islington.  Flexible check in.  We are on hand to help with any queries. Guest have private room & sole use of bathroom.  Wifi.  You can have light breakfast (cereal, toast etc) in the kitchen.
transit: Arsenal tube station is a 5 minute walk from our house. Arsenal to Heathrow (direct) is 60 mins.   Arsenal to Kings Cross/St Pancras - 3 stops is 10 mins.  Arsenal to Covent Garden, Leicester Square & Picadilly Circus 15 mins.   No 4 bus direct for Tate Modern, St Pauls, The Globe. No 19 bus direct to West End. Easy transfers from all airports.  I can advise.
access: Guest have private room & sole use of bathroom.  Wifi.  You can have light breakfast (cereal, toast etc) in the kitchen.
interaction: We are on hand to help with all queries.  We can't accommodate pets because we have a cat.
house_rules: - No shoes in house please - Can put up single bed to accommodate child
host_about: Originally from Edinburgh, I have lived in London for over 30 years & still think it's a great city to visit.   I love travel - so the best thing about Airbnb is meeting guests from all over the world.  I'm a freelance TV producer and live with my artist husband, teenage son & cat.  The cat seems to be a big hit with all our guests!

host_about:
Hello, folks.

Thank you for visiting my profile.
I am sure when you book my apartment you won't be disappointed.
I have many different flats around Europe since 2014.
My motto is the customer is always right.
When you stay in my apartment you will always feel at home and we will always make you very welcome.
You will leave with the best memories and we are sure that you will want to return.
I have apartments in Prague, and from 2017 I have acquired apartments in London.
For my customers in Prague, I will not be there personally, however, if you need anything do not hesitate to ask.
I have the best team around to help you.
Please contact me first, however, if any problems arise.
In London, I will be there to meet you personally.

If you have any additional queries or questions please do not hesitate to contact me.

name: Double bedroom with private bath and smart t.v.
summary: Welcome to our beautiful place just under 10 min walk from the Clapham Junction station, close to bars, restaurants and 24h shops. Our apartment is located on the second floor with no lift. Your room and bathroom are located on the entrance level, ours is across the hall. Common areas, including a rooftop terrace, are on the second level up a short flight of stairs. Since the kitchen, dining and living room are open plan, we politely ask you not to use it in the evenings when we're around.
space: The bedroom is spacious with a double bed and additional single sofa bed, allowing up to 3 guests.  There is a smart TV with Netflix, Amazon, YouTube apps etc for your convenience. Towels and bedding are included.
description: Welcome to our beautiful place just under 10 min walk from the Clapham Junction station, close to bars, restaurants and 24h shops. Our apartment is located on the second floor with no lift. Your room and bathroom are located on the entrance level, ours is across the hall. Common areas, including a rooftop terrace, are on the second level up a short flight of stairs. Since the kitchen, dining and living room are open plan, we politely ask you not to use it in the evenings when we're around. The bedroom is spacious with a double bed and additional single sofa bed, allowing up to 3 guests.  There is a smart TV with Netflix, Amazon, YouTube apps etc for your convenience. Towels and bedding are included. The kitchen, dining and living room are open plan. We politely ask you not to use this area in the evenings when we're around. Clapham Junction is a vibrant neighbourhood full of pubs, bars, restaurants and shops. Everything is within walking distance however our flat is on a quiet resident
neighborhood_overview: Clapham Junction is a vibrant neighbourhood full of pubs, bars, restaurants and shops. Everything is within walking distance however our flat is on a quiet residential street and perfect for chilling out after a day's urban exploring!
notes: Being in central London means that you might hear airplanes on their way to Heathrow airport. Please contact us if you want to check in after 10pm, additional late check in fee is £30. No use of the kitchen in the evenings.
transit: We are very conviently located, less than 30 minutes by public transport from Central London, Chelsea, Twickenham rugby stadium and Richmond riverside. Buses, London Underground, mainline trains and for the more adventurous, Boris Bikes, are all within easy walking distance.
access: The kitchen, dining and living room are open plan. We politely ask you not to use this area in the evenings when we're around.
house_rules: Check-in depends on the day of arrival. During the week it will probably be after 6 pm. On weekends we can arrange individually.  Late check in after 10pm possible only with additional fee of £30 per booking. Please contact us before making a reservation.  Please check-out before 10 am. You can check out late for additional fee of £10 per every additional hour. The maximum added time will depend on the availability.  We do not recommend our flat for small babies as it's split level with wooden stairs. If your child is used to stairs and you can guarantee their safety, then you are more than welcome to stay.  Smoking only outside on the terrace.  If you stay for longer we can provide small fridge in the kitchen. Please don't use the kitchen area for cooking before 7am and in the evenings when we're around.
host_about:
I am professional host managing multiple listing across London. If you are looking to stay at our double room in Clapham Junction we can offer great company and nice cultural exchange. My partner and I can recommend great places in London, have a look at our guidebook to get to know our neighborhood better. As an experienced hosts we make sure that you feel welcome and relaxed at our home.  In summer feel free to join us on our roof top terrace for a BBQ and few drinks. 

 I am also hosting entire apartments in other parts of London. All properties that I am managing are guest ready, clean and in great locations. I will make sure that you check-in is easy and hassle free.

name: Lovely double in period house 30 mins to centre
summary: Stay in a lovely spacious and sunny room in my newly renovated house in east London. It's perfect for couples, friends, professionals and solo travellers wanting an authentic London experience, in an area with quick and easy access to central London (30 mins to Kings Cross).  You will have access to all the usual amenities in the house and although the road is quiet, loads of brilliant pubs, restaurants and cafes are on your doorstep, along with the Olympic Park and Hackney Marshes.
space: My lovely Victorian terraced house is in a quiet, tree-lined street in a residential area. It's great for solo travellers, couples, friends or professionals. Leyton is very well connected for travel to central London, with buses to Islington, Hackney, Shoreditch, the City, and the West End close by. Leyton and Walthamstow Underground stations are both walkable, or a short bus ride, and Leyton Midland Road Overground station is the closest and is only 8 minutes from the house on foot, getting you to Kings Cross station in only 30 minutes.
description: Stay in a lovely spacious and sunny room in my newly renovated house in east London. It's perfect for couples, friends, professionals and solo travellers wanting an authentic London experience, in an area with quick and easy access to central London (30 mins to Kings Cross).  You will have access to all the usual amenities in the house and although the road is quiet, loads of brilliant pubs, restaurants and cafes are on your doorstep, along with the Olympic Park and Hackney Marshes. My lovely Victorian terraced house is in a quiet, tree-lined street in a residential area. It's great for solo travellers, couples, friends or professionals. Leyton is very well connected for travel to central London, with buses to Islington, Hackney, Shoreditch, the City, and the West End close by. Leyton and Walthamstow Underground stations are both walkable, or a short bus ride, and Leyton Midland Road Overground station is the closest and is only 8 minutes from the house on foot, getting you to Kings Cr
neighborhood_overview: Read my local guide for neighbourhood tips on where to go. Visit nearby Francis Road, Walthamstow Village or Clapton to experience London social life. Why not have a drink in the Northcote pub garden, or a coffee at Perky Blenders? Or take a tube, train or bus to quickly get to the City, Canary Wharf, Hackney, Islington or the West End. And with marshes and canals very close by, it's perfect for walks, runs or cycles on sunny days!  For groceries, there's a large Tesco supermarket and a small Sainsbury's 5 minutes from the house and, for more serious shopping, Westfield shopping centre is a 10 minute bus ride away on the Olympic Park in Stratford , with loads of shops, a cinema, bars and restaurants.
notes: I can accommodate up to two extra people on a comfortable double sofabed in a small bedroom upon request (see pictures). Due to the size of the smaller room I'd only recommend it for couples or very good friends!  Please also note that I sometimes have the second room separately listed for one person so if you're not using it you may be sharing the house's communal areas with another guest as well as with me. Bedding and towels are provided.  Please be careful not to lose the house keys. There is a £100 charge for any lost keys due to the cost of changing locks on the front door of the house. Over the winter period, please be aware that the heating is set to 19 degrees Centigrade so bear this in mind if you plan to book and you're used to warmer temperatures in the home.
transit: The house is very well connected in terms of transport links and you can be in Kings Cross in 30 minutes! The nearest station, Leyton Midland Rd (Overground) is only 8 minutes from the house on foot.  There are also many buses (the 55, 56, and 48 all go through Hackney into central London). Leyton (Central Line) and Walthamstow (Victoria Line) Underground stations are also very easy to reach on foot or with a quick bus ride.  The night tube runs at the weekend to both Leyton and Walthamstow tube stations and there's a useful night bus (N26) that runs daily from Trafalgar Square and stops near the house. The house can be reached from any London airport by train with Stansted and City Airport especially easy to access. I recommend downloading the Citymapper app for real-time public transport routes.
access: You can use the kitchen which is fully equipped and all communal areas including the garden which has a table and chairs. Basics and condiments (oil, salt, pepper, sugar etc.) and tea bags are available for guests to use.
interaction: I'm living in the house so you'll probably see me around though I sometimes go away at weekends. I'm open to chatting or happy to leave you alone depending on what you prefer! I grew up in London so am always happy to share my knowledge of the city with visitors. I can help with directions and tips on what to do in central London and the local area if you want to explore the trendy east London.
house_rules: - You'll be staying in my home so please treat it as well as you would your own place. - No guests are allowed in the house. - For security reasons keep all doors and windows locked when leaving the house. - No smoking in the house. Smoking is fine outside in the garden. - Please do not keep or eat any food in the bedroom. There's a table in the dining room and another outside in the garden which you're welcome to use for your meals. - Please avoid wearing shoes in the house.
host_about:
I'm a professional from London and like to keep busy reading, learning languages, watching films, and enjoying food, wine, and the outdoors! I'm easygoing and love meeting new people.

I've lived in France and Germany and travelled widely in Europe, Latin America and Asia. I'm always happy to host people in my lovely home and also like to use Airbnb for my travels.

Please note that I will only host guests who have uploaded a photo to their profile and verified their identity.

neighborhood_overview: Local area A glistening showcase of modern convenience, designer shopping, fine cuisine, entertainment and style, Canary Wharf far exceeds its reputation as the financial centre of London. Encompassing over 97 acres of sky-high architecture, global headquarters and an advanced infrastructure to match, it is no wonder that the district has amassed one of the most prestigious lists of banks and financial institutions seen anywhere in the world. With over 93,000 people working in and commuting to Canary Wharf daily, the area remains an ideal investment opportunity.
transit: Transport Residents of Lincoln Plaza will be just two minutes' walk away from South Quay DLR station for speedy journeys into the City, or 10 minutes from Canary Wharf for Jubilee line services towards Westminster and the West end. Key destinations from Canary Wharf via Crossrail (estimated completion 2018): Bond Stree(URL HIDDEN)15 minutes Tottenham Court Road     22 minutes Kings Cross/St Pancras    24 minutes Heathrow Airpor(URL HIDDEN) 48 minutes
house_rules: Dear much valued guests , please see the fallowing additional rules, which may sounds strict but I cant allow parties of any kind. Thanks for your understanding!   -No parties or gatherings of any type! -Noises must kept down after midnight! -Only mature, reliable people , no youngsters, please!  -Check in flexible , check out by 11am  latest by midday. If you may need to check out later, please do get in touch with me.  -If any questions please contact me directly, as the concierge wont answer. - Max 2 adults and 1 child can stay!  Million of thanks for your understanding.  Kind regards, N
host_about:
Hi AIRBNB Friends! 

I am Nicole! I am here to share the wonder of travel! You ca be anywhere in this world, and you will be always home with AIRBNB! 

I am offering you my Sweet home Sweet`s in LoNDoN! My wish is to make you feel special, every second during your stay. MY AIRBNB`s homes, may be temporary but certainly it will be yours!  A real home away from the middling crowd a real escape island where you will be free to feel home !

I want you to have feel stress-less experience during the booking procedure, as well as during your stay. In fact, I will always look after your needs, and I can assure that you will be finding the greatest understanding while communicating with me. I want to propose not only services, but a friendship with trust. 

I want to treat all of my AIRBNB FRIENDS with the greatest care and attention. Whether you are a business, tourist, Londoner AIRBNB Friend, I will be more than happy to have you and provide you one of my HOME! 

I am willing to go out of my way to create the perfect experience for all of you. Please, if you have a question ask, if you have anything in mind do not hesitate to ask. I believe in mankind and I know we have loads to share. So please just share :)

Travel UP! Be up always and travel the world and share your experiences with people whom are like minded.    

My place is your place, I will always treat you right. Welcome one and all! :)

Hope to host you soon.
Loves,
Nicole

name: Comfortable room near Tower Hill
summary: Comfortable room in a two-bedroom duplex apartment in Wapping, close to Tower Hill and St Katherine's Docks. The available room has a double bed and wardrobe, beside tables and lamps and there is a private bathroom just outside. The shared kitchen and lounge are all fully equipped. The apartment is within walking distance to restaurants, cafes, a supermarket and several transport options.
space: The room is mid-sized, light and cosy, with a bed, wardrobe and bedside tables. The bathroom is next to the bedroom, so easily accessible, and there are stairs down to the lounge room and kitchen. The bathroom is for guest use, so private.
description: Comfortable room in a two-bedroom duplex apartment in Wapping, close to Tower Hill and St Katherine's Docks. The available room has a double bed and wardrobe, beside tables and lamps and there is a private bathroom just outside. The shared kitchen and lounge are all fully equipped. The apartment is within walking distance to restaurants, cafes, a supermarket and several transport options. The room is mid-sized, light and cosy, with a bed, wardrobe and bedside tables. The bathroom is next to the bedroom, so easily accessible, and there are stairs down to the lounge room and kitchen. The bathroom is for guest use, so private. There is a shared open-plan living/dining room and a fully equipped kitchen, as well as a small private garden area. As I travel often for work, I am not always around, but I am always happy to answer questions and provide information and happy to socialise as much or as little as my guests like. The apartment is in a pleasant, quiet area. There are a number of rest
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a pleasant, quiet area. There are a number of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, a large Waitrose supermarket, dry cleaner, cafes, pubs and more. St Katherine's Dock, The Tower of London and Tower Bridge are all 10-15 minutes walk. I'm also very close to the Thames and the canal, so plenty of places to walk/jog.
notes: If you need parking let me know when you book - I have an allocated parking space. Guests are welcome to share use of the kitchen and lounge, and as I have an ensuite, the second bathroom is for guest. If your check in and out times are outside the times specified, please let me know and we may be able to make alternative arrangements.
transit: There are numerous transport links - Tower Hill on the district and circle line is 10-15 minutes walk, Wapping on the overground is 6 minutes walk, Tower Gateway on the DLR is a 10-15 minute walk, Shadwell is about 15 minutes walk and bus number 100 is 3 minutes away which takes you to Moorgate, Aldgate, Liverpool Street, etc.
access: There is a shared open-plan living/dining room and a fully equipped kitchen, as well as a small private garden area.
interaction: As I travel often for work, I am not always around, but I am always happy to answer questions and provide information and happy to socialise as much or as little as my guests like.
house_rules: I don't have any set rules apart from no smoking inside, but I expect guests to behave considerately (as they tend to do anyway) and will do everything I can to ensure they enjoy their visit.
host_about:
I am an avid traveller and have spent most of my working life living overseas - in Japan, Korea, Dubai, Vietnam and now London. I love dancing - ceroc mostly, but also a bit of swing and salsa, and tend to hang out near water.  I enjoy swimming, wakeboarding, scuba diving and pretty much anything water related.  Also snowboarding. Snow is just frozen water after all. That's not to say that I'm good at any of these things.  I don't sit still very often - there are too many other things I'd rather be doing.

I've been using Airbnb for a while as a traveller and have been hosting regularly in London. I enjoy meeting new people and I'm happy to give advice and travel tips about London and the region.

name: Peaceful zone 2 Flat
summary: LOCATION 15 mins walk to subway, (Oval), 20 mins on bus to Waterloo, (National Theatre, BFI, Southbank centre, London Eye) BEDROOMS:  1 large double bedroom with a brand new double kingsize bed 1 large twin with 2 brand new zip link beds (can be 2 x singles or 1 double) 1 double with a brand double bed KITCHEN: 1 large kitchen with brand new electric oven, gas hob, storage and plentiful work surfaces BATHROOM: Brand new toilet, washbasin, taps This place is great for families and groups of 4-6.
space: **** We are now open for long term bookings - from 3 weeks onwards. If you don't see the availability you need, just contact me to discuss dates, requirement... and discounts! This is not just a vacation rental flat, it's a lovingly refurbished home; a home away from home. You can travel light, we will provide you with Egyptian cotton sheets and big fluffy towels. We also provide kitchen essentials e.g. tea and fresh coffee, milk... Would suit a professional party, a family staying in London for longer, or friends travelling to London for a weekend; we will tailor our hosting to the nature of your stay. If staying for 10 days or longer the cleaner can come weekly to do a full clean, leaving it like the day you checked in, including fresh bed sheets towels etc. It is toddler and baby friendly - we can provide a range of baby/toddler, e.g travel cot if asked. Buses go from the end of the road and the area has one of the best bus networks in London with lots of the routes being some of th

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is split level which makes it feel very homely, more like a little house, and is located on the ground and first floor at the back of an apartment block, overlooking communal gardens. There is also a charming park (Burgess Park) - great for kids and adults just a 5 minute stroll away you can take in Chumleigh gardens with the delightful cafe next door, or take a walk to the neighbouring Peckham area. You will be a stones throw from the amenities of the high street: Iceland supermarket, and I can recommend 'La Luna Pizza' a family owned restaurant for many years, 'Bayroot' authentic Lebanese street food, (excellent) and handy for pharmacies, convenience stores for late night shopping etc. everything is truly on your door step. Camberwell is a gem for gourmet restaurants, organic cafes, hidden spots (check out my guide) art galleries, delicious gourmet food stores and unique shops.  Camberwell is artsy - lots of students, artists and creative entrepreneurs choose it as thei
notes: Parking vouchers available for on street parking outside the block for £10 per day, you'll just need to text me your car registration and I can book the dates you need.
transit: Camberwell is off the tourist track yet has great transport links into town, as it's quite central (zone 2). Major bus stop is a 5 min walk. From here there are buses into central London every few minutes.  •   For Waterloo and the Southbank, Old Vic Theatre, National theatre, Southbank Centre, BFI Imax, strolls along the river, get bus number 171, These go every 3 minutes. Travel time 20 - 30 mins. •   For Westminster, (Big Ben,Houses of Parliment, London Eye, Aquarium) get bus number 12, 148, strolls along the river. Every few minutes. Travel time 20 - 30 mins. •  Buckingham Palace & St James's Park, Hyde Park, Winterwonderland etc. Turn west on bethwin road, (come out of the flat and turn right) then turn right onto Camberwell New Road and catch a 36 bus. Travel time 15 - 25 mins. Directions by car or taxi:  You will be driving East as it's a one way street. You will see Boundary house numbers 17 to 34 on your left. Keep driving East until you see Boundary house no's 1 - 16 and then
access: The whole place is yours. I live in East London, so am on the phone or available if you want to ask me anything :)
interaction: I live in East London, and so I am on the phone if there are any issues at all. Directions by car or taxi:  You will be driving East as it's a one way street. You will see Boundary house numbers 17 to 34 on your left. Keep driving East until you see Boundary house no's 1 - 16 and then when you see this you've reached your destination. There will also be a bicycle storage facility in the road, when you see this you have arrived. Turn left and go through the double blue doors. My flat is noticeable from the ivy plant on the front. When you get to a bright yellow door then you arrived.  By public transport via Camberwell Road from North. Bethwin road is on your right. Walk down until you see Boundary house no's 1 - 16 on your left. There will also be a bicycle storage facility in the road, when you see this you have arrived. Turn right and go through the double blue doors. My flat is noticeable from the ivy plant on the front. When you get to a bright yellow door then you have arrived.
house_rules: *** Check in is after 3pm Check out is by 11am *** Please be considerate to neighbours and keep noise to a minimum, especially if checking in/out late.  *** New carpets throughout, please remove shoes. *** For the safety of your belongings, please lock all doors and close the windows before leaving the house. ***
host_about: I enjoy meeting meeting from different cultures. I've lived in London for nearly 20 years and I love it.

name: Spacious double room w private bathroom in Brixton
summary: Come and stay at our lovely place! We offer you a spacious room with a private bathroom and shower on a quiet street less than 15-min walk (or a short ride on one of the many buses) from Brixton tube station. All the amenities, restaurants and nightlife of Brixton on your doorsteps and the Victoria Line brings you anywhere in London. Fully flexible check-in with key in lockbox outside the house. We speak English, French, Italian!
space: - Spacious double room with private bathroom (and shower) in a split level three-bedroom flat - All living spaces have been recently refurbished - Bedsheets, towels and provided - Wi-Fi internet  - Cosy living room with FreeSat TV and BT Sports   - Fully equipped kitchen, help yourself with coffee, tea and cereals and feel free to cook your meals!

The room is in a three-bedroom flat. We sleep in one of the rooms, the second is dedicated to Airbnb guests and the third is permanently unoccupied. You will have a private room with a good-sized wardrobe and a priva
neighborhood_overview: - Plenty of shops (including a large Sainsbury's supermarket), services, restaurants and cafes at walking distance - Beautiful Brockwell Park at your doorstep - Central Brixton less than 15-min away; Clapham and Herne Hill also a stroll or a short bus ride away - Ask us for local tips for restaurants, bars, clubs, etc.
transit: - Brixton tube station (Victoria Line, 24-hours on Satuday) is less than 15-min walk away; it can also be reached with various buses  - Many buses connecting directly to Central London (recommended if you want to enjoy the cityscape!), nearest bus stops: Blenheim Gardens, Brixton Water Lane, Morval Road; there are also 24-hour bus links - Santander bike docking station on the way to Brixton tube station; rental bikes (MoBike, Ofo) increasingly common in the area
access: The room is in a three-bedroom flat. We sleep in one of the rooms, the second is dedicated to Airbnb guests and the third is permanently unoccupied. You will have a private room with a good-sized wardrobe and a private bathroom with shower.  You will share the kitchen, bathroom and living room with us. There will be no other paying guests in the house during your stay.
interaction: We are Linda and Andrea, an Italian couple in our early 30s. We have lived in several countries before settling down in London five years ago. We love travelling, good wine and good company. Enjoy a cup of coffee or some drinks with us!
host_about:
Hi, 

My name is Andrea and live in South London with my girlfriend Linda. We are both in our early 30s and come from Italy. We are very sociable, enjoy talking, travelling, eating and drinking well (ask us for local tips on bars & restaurants!). We also love theatre and the arts and can share with you our local knowledge! 

Linda and I have both lived in several countries before moving to London. We speak English, Italian and French and love to host people from all over the world.

name: ★ Newly Renovated 2-BR Flat  In Hyde Park ★
summary: In the amazing and central neighborhood of Hyde Park lies this eco newly renovated 2-bedroom flat that comfortably accommodates 4 guests and provides complete amenities for your stay. About 3 mins from the flat is Talbot Square where you can have your pick of restaurants, bars, and cafes from the establishments that surround it. And for quick and easy transit in and around the city, the trains at Lancaster Gate Station (Central Line-Red) are only 5 minutes on foot.
space: I am a frequent traveller myself so I believe I understand what a visitor needs to feel comfortable. You will be staying in my home while I am away for work, and you will have at your disposal all the amenities to ensure you a lovely stay. My flat lies in the beautiful neighborhood of Hyde Park, and it's been newly renovated. It has eco bamboo flooring throughout, and the walls are painted with eco paints free from all Solvents, VOCs, pesticides, herbicides and toxins. The property is perfect for 4 people: it's composed by 2 bedrooms with a double bed in each. Additional amenities include washing machine, a large flat screen with HDMi cable - no TV but you can hook the screen up to your laptop, good quality speakers with phono jack to plug into your laptop, and Iphone and Android chargers, as well as high speed internet. There is no oven in the kitchen, just a double hob and toaster. There is also a sauna in the flat, which would be the ideal way to relax after a day out exploring this

notes: I will provide you with comprehensive directions to reach us once you book. Anything you need to know about the area, just ask. Check-in time is after 3pm and check-out time is before 11am.  Please note that you will be charged £100 for lost keys, so please be careful with them. The linen for the sofa bed/air mattress will be provided, and left next to the respective item.
transit: Nearest tube Lancaster Gate, about 10 minutes on foot from my place. Hire a bike, there are really good bike lanes here with dedicated traffic lights for cyclists! There is no parking.
access: We are in the basement. You have use of the entire space. There is a small patio out the back and the front.
interaction: My property management team and I will be available 24/7 via Airbnb, email, or phone to provide any assistance you may need.

name: Beautiful 2-Bedroom London House with Garden
summary: The house is beautifully decorated with lots of stylish features, offering an excellent base for exploring the city. You have a choice of two great sized bedrooms, a living room, dining room, kitchen, two bathrooms, one with bath/shower, one with shower, and garden in a nice terraced house not far from the Tube and Overground rail transport and buses, with easy access to central London. The open spaces of Wandsworth Common, shopping and restaurants of Balham, are approximately 10 minutes walk.
space: Beautiful terraced house on Balham/Tooting/Wandsworth Common borders, just a 5 minute walk to Tooting Bec underground station, which is on the Northern Line. The decor is amazing with its colourful furniture and stylish 26-foot kitchen, and it has a lovely garden to relax in at the end of a fun day's sightseeing in London.  You have access to the house’s communal areas, with 2 of the 4 bedrooms available to guests. There is a king sized bed and a double bed in two bedrooms in the property, and both are made up with hotel quality bed linen and towels by my cleaners before your arrival. The kitchen is fully equipped, so you can cook up a delicious meal for you and your friends and family. The whole apartment is professionally cleaned, and you may check in 24/7 as there is a lockbox.

neighborhood_overview: Simple Victorian townhomes and casual taverns compose Balham, a southwest London neighbourhood with a friendly atmosphere and suburban amenities. Getting to Balham’s town centre is easy—the neighbourhood has its own tube station. Away from Balham’s commercial core and its mix of independent bookstores, boutiques, and big-name chains, the neighbourhood leads a quiet life punctuated by brief interjections of music and comedy from landmark venues like The Bedford.
notes: There is sometimes a dog living in the property, so to those allergic to dogs I'm sorry but there may be some traces of dog hair.
transit: The London Eye: 26 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 35 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 100 minutes on the tube Gatwick Airport: 45 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 35 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 35 minutes on the tube
access: Guests will have access to the entire property apart from the host's bedroom and office, during their stay.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.

If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, an £80 fee will apply.  - No shoes upstairs. - Please don't use the fireplaces
host_about: Simon is a writer and musician. Sarah works in health. Together we run an apps business.  We hope you'll enjoy our London home as much as we do!

name: 4.3 Cute Double Room In Piccadilly Circus
summary: Fantastic double room in the heart of London’s West End. Book this modern, clean and comfortable double bedroom with shared bathroom - you will fall in love with the location. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a mansion block with no lift.
space: NEW DOUBLE ROOM AVAILABLE IN SOHO - LOCATED OPPOSITE PICCADILLY CIRCUS UNDERGROUND STATION Due to the amazing central location, the area is very busy and therefore street noise is inevitable. Please consider this before you book. We provide earplugs in case anyone is a light sleeper. If you are very sensitive to noise then it may be best to stay outside of the city centre, although that doesn’t sound like much fun to us :) Warm and comfortable double room located at the rear of this prestigious Georgian town house with views in to a central courtyard. neighborhood_overview: What we love about being located opposite Piccadilly Circus is the fact that you are sandwiched between 6 fantastic 'must see' areas of central London - Soho, Westminster, The West End, Covent Garden, Mayfair, and St James's The majority of London’s most popular tourist attractions and all the major theatres are within an easy 10-minute walk – Our place is super central and you shouldn't need to take a tube or bus once you have checked in. Don't just take our word for it, here is what Airbnb has to say about the surrounding area. SOHO Like Britain’s famous agent, James Bond, this neighbourhood leads a double life: Soho’s streets are home to clean-cut record shops and fashionable galleries. Crowds flock to this edgy epicentre to experience its sultry past and trendy present. Soho’s red-light roots and beatnik bastions have steadily transformed into hip public houses, all-night coffee shops, and vintage boutiques that welcome the 24-hour clamour of this cobblestoned neighbourhood.  https
notes: INFORMATION REGARDING THE CHECK IN We will request your arrival and departure times which must be provided in advance of your stay so we can make arrangements for your check in. If we do not have this information then your check in might be delayed. CHECK IN IS FROM 3PM We are unable to organise early check ins. We operate a key box self check in service. LUGGAGE DROP BEFORE CHECK IN We have the option to drop luggage from 10:30am which will be stored in our office on site.  CHECK OUT IS BEFORE 10:30AM We are unable to arrange late check outs. We do offer a left luggage service at our on-site office for £10, this is a flat fee, no matter how much luggage you leave with us. Luggage can be dropped from 10:30am and can be collected anytime.
transit: Piccadilly Circus underground station is around a 1 minute walk from the accommodation. Local buses stop on the street outside. There are a number of underground stations that are also within a 10-minute walk of the accommodation: Leicester Square, Oxford Circus and Tottenham Court Road.  We do not recommend bringing a car into central London as the parking is very limited street parking which is also very expensive. If you are coming by car it would be best to research car parks where you can leave the car and then commute into the centre.
access: The hallway was also renovated in 2016 and we have provided an umbrella stand with complimentary umbrellas should you get caught out in the rain. In the hallway there is also a cupboard that houses the mop, dustpan, brush, etc. There is also an iron and ironing board should you need to use them. There is a newly renovated shared bathroom with top of the range bathroom suite and power shower combination. Our bathroom is kept very clean and tidy with a cleaner coming in on a regular basis to keep everything top notch.
interaction: We will be available via the phone number we provide you for any questions or queries you may have between the hours of 10:30am and 4:30pm. If you need to reach us outside of these hours you can message via Airbnb and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Luggage can be dropped from 10:30am and can be collected anytime. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- OTHER RULES TO NOTE - Guests must be respectful of neighbours during unsociable hours and if returning home late please be considerate with noise levels NO G
host_about:
A BIG HELLO FROM THE SOHO TEAM!! We are Lee, Laiyan, Tina & Glenn :)

We are a small team of people who have been working together for several years providing accommodation in the heart of central London. We mainly provide accommodation for workers in the film and theatre industry, but with the growing popularity of Airbnb we have been able to offer out our places to people from all over the world. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service and over time we have come to feel like part of a family.

As hosts we prefer to allow guests to have their privacy and enjoy their time staying with us so for the most part we tend to leave them to it, but we have several means of contact if they need anything and the team will do their upmost to help out so that you can get on with the main thing which is having a fabulous time in this great city.

From collective experiences of the team we have a few favourite things to do in London. For theatre goers we have experienced some great musicals such as Wicked and Hamilton, and for those with a brave sense of humour the Book of Mormon is a must watch. We have also sampled some great places to eat such as the award winning Barrafina on Dean Street, and being so close to Chinatown we couldn't help but recommend Beijing Dumpling for some amazing culinary delights.

We hope that you will choose to stay with us here in London and we look forward to sharing our wonderful accommodation in the best location you could possibly be in.

See you soon :) The Soho Team

house_rules: HOUSE RULES Welcome to our home.  We are happy to have you as our guests.  Please always take your shoes off inside the flat.  Always make sure the front doors are closed well.  Carefully close doors quietly at late or early ours as it might disturb neighbours.  What you break you replace.  What you turn on, you switch off.  (The living room table lamp switches on and off by itself automatically at set hours.)  No frying of fish or other foods in the kitchen as smells settle in furniture.  No smokers.  Noise in late hours would disturb our neighbours. No parties. No extra guests.   Please respect our home and personal things.  We hope you enjoy your stay with us.  Robin & Dolly-Ann
host_about:
Hi, I am from Hamburg, Germany and I love traveling around the world.
Traveling is for me the most beautiful thing I can do. There is so much to learn, so much to discover in culture, nature, food, art, architecture and language.

neighborhood_overview: Elephant and Castle has a vibrant and metropolitan feel. There are lots of things to do, including going to the many international restaurants, fast food and pubs. There are many cheap shops in the area for buy food or others itens. You could go out a night in the Ministry of sound (the best electronic disc) or visit the Imperial War Museum? . There are currently many new and iconic buildings being erected in this district which boarders touristic London. A thirty minute walk will get you to Westminster (Big Ben, London Eye, Westminster abbey, Trafalgar Square, Aquarium, etc . .. .)
notes: Cleaning the house (bathroom and bedroom) everyday. We want to offer you a beautiful stay for a reasonable price, for that reason we ask a little cleaning fee.
transit: If you like walking, you can walk over to Westminster and visit all the major London attractions. There are also many buses going to the centre... (and others night bus) goes very close to the apartment. You also have the choice of taking the underground (Elephant and Castle, Northern Line or Backerloo line). There is also a mainline train that runs to Elephant and Castle. You can walk to the underground station in about 5 minutes.
access: Guest will have their own set of keys and will be able to access all other parts of the apartment, including the kitchen.
interaction: We try to interact with guests as much as we can... we always tell to the guest where to go for sightseeing. Ask me about the guide!
host_about:
We are a nice professional working, with a big house with spare rooms (shared ou private).

We love travelling and getting to know other cultures, good music and classic movies!.

I'd consider myself very friendly and welcoming, and I like to hang out with my family as much as possible, and i can advise on interesting things to do while you're in town.

We speak spanish, portuguese and a litle bit english ;)
 
Any questions, ask away!

Español:
Somos personas simpaticas y trabajadoras, con una casa grande con habitaciones de invitados (para compartir o privadas).

Nos encanta viajar y conocer otras culturas, somos amigables y siempre que podemos visitamos a nuestra familia.

Os puedo aconsejar lugares interesantes e increibles para visitar en Londres... También los turisticos!

Hablamos español, portugues y un poco de ingles :D

Sera un placer recibiros en nuestra casa!!

Portugues:
Somos pessoas simpaticas e trabalhadoras, com uma casa grande com quartos de convidados (Compartilhado ou privativo).

Adoramos viajar e conhecer outras culturas. Somos amigaveis e sempre que podemos visitamos nossa familia! 

Posso recomendar lugares apaixonantes e increiveis de Londres... Tambem os pontos turísticos!

Falamos portugues, espanhol e ingles :D

Será um prazer recebe-los em nossa casa!

name: Fantastic naturally skylit room on Roman Road
summary: Welcome to London! I'm renting my room during the times I'm away. There are only two rooms in the house, so you won't find a better deal! It's a walking distance to the trendy East and a tube ride away from the shopping and sights in the West End. A tube stop is in proximity, and buses and NIGHT TUBE are running 24/7. Nearby, explore craft breweries or order a curry from plentiful Indian takeaways. I'm also happy to help with your itinerary by sharing local tips.
space: My bed is very comfortable to sleep on, and I have two different pillows (one medium and one hard) – you'll get a great sleep, guaranteed! The roof window is the source of all good: natural skylight during the day, natural darkness at night, and the sound of raindrops on a grey day. Also, it won't be noisy even if you leave a window open for some fresh air. Whether you're coming for work or leisure, you won't regret staying here!
description: Welcome to London! I'm renting my room during the times I'm away. There are only two rooms in the house, so you won't find a better deal! It's a walking distance to the trendy East and a tube ride away from the shopping and sights in the West End. A tube stop is in proximity, and buses and NIGHT TUBE are running 24/7. My bed is very comfortable to sleep on, and I have two different pillows (one medium and one hard) – you'll get a great sleep, guaranteed! The roof window is the source of all good: natural skylight during the day, natural darkness at night, and the sound of raindrops on a grey day. Also, it won't be noisy even if you leave a window open for some fresh air. Whether you're coming for work or leisure, you won't regret staying here! The bathroom features a shower and a toilet. The kitchen is large, and it has all amenities: fridg
neighborhood_overview: Roman Road is situated on the oldest known trade route in Britain, the road to Colchester famously taken by Boudicea on her way to burn the Romans in London. The road is in the heart of the East End. It's a friendly, funky place to shop for some real bargains. The market takes place on Tuesdays and Thursdays but it's busiest on Saturdays.  Bouillabaisse and other fancy dishes at Palmers Restaurant. Given that most of its nearby competitors are chicken shops, this family-run place is surely the road’s best-kept secret. You’re in east London, so go traditional and pick up pickled herrings and rollmops at George’s Plaice, a bona fide purveyor of all things brined and aquatic that’s been going strong for more than 40 years.  There’s nowhere better for proper East End food than G Kelly. Nothing to do with the ‘Singin’ in the Rain’ star, but we can assure you that the bargain pie and mash here is stellar.
notes: Just to reiterate that this is my room where I live when I don't travel, so there will be my stuff in the cabinet and the drawers. Please respect my privacy and that of my housemate. If you are unsure about anything at all, write me a message, and I'll get back to you quickly. If you're staying several days, don't hesitate to ask for a discount.
transit: Getting around is extremely easy. Tube runs every few minutes (walk to the Mile End station in 15 min or take a 5-8 min bus to Bethnal Green or Mile End). There are night buses, so it's easy to get back even late at night. Now, also NIGHT TUBE is available (search for TfL Night Tube for more info), it runs every 10 minutes throughout the whole night and takes only 15 minutes from Soho/Holborn!!! If you fancy an Uber ride, it won't break your budget either, as the location is easily accessible for driving.
access: The bathroom features a shower and a toilet. The kitchen is large, and it has all amenities: fridge, microwave, stove, kettle. There is also a shared back yard where you could go for a smoke or park a car. For a picnic, it's better to go to a beautiful park nearby.
interaction: Throughout your stay I'll be away, but available online. My housemate can help you sort any issues that might arise. I'm happy to help you with your itinerary in advance of your stay – I can give you tips on best places to see, secret bars to drink in, easiest hacks to the city.
house_rules: - It's a residential house, so you have to be mindful of my housemate. - Additional guests/visitors are not permitted at any time. - You can smoke in the outer yard. - Please leave it as you'd like to find it.
host_about: I'm 27 and I work in climate finance (it's a nonprofit that rates investors on managing financial risks of climate change). I'm originally from Lithuania, but I also lived in Norway and the Philippines. In London, I like exploring new places,  going for walks in the nature, or going out for a musical or an evening in a cabaret. I like technology and the way it shapes our lives. I like various hip things like craft beers and freshly roasted coffee. I like learning from people and being introduced to new experiences.

name: Amazing, Beautiful Flat in Kensingnton
summary: This is a modern flat on the ground floor of a Victorian Mews House. There is underfloor heating throughout, hot water on demand and high ceilings. This is an ideal place for a single person or a couple. It is 400 metres to High Street Kensington and 10 minutes walk to Holland Park. It is in a very quiet and peaceful area.
space: one bedroom and bathroom with kitchen/dining and living room as one.
description: This is a modern flat on the ground floor of a Victorian Mews House. There is underfloor heating throughout, hot water on demand and high ceilings. My support team or I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay. The property is in a lovely, quiet Mews, close to everything you will need to enjoy your stay in London. neighborhood_overview: The property is in a lovely, quiet Mews, close to everything you will need to enjoy your stay in London.  Located in beautiful Kensington, the area is a home to amazing restaurants and shops, beautiful architecture and a rich cultural history. Enjoy the museums nearby including the Design Museum, wander through Holland Park and visit the peacocks in the Kyoto Garden and go window shopping along Kensington High Street, home to a variety of amazing shops, cafes and restaurants. The property is a 5 minute walk to Kensington Olympia Exhibition Centre and a short walk to the Westfields shopping centre. South Kensington is only a bus ride away and you will have access to many more amazing museums including The Science Museum and The Natural History Museum. Kensington is the place to be if you want a beautiful and classic setting for your stay!
transit: The closest Underground Station is Kensington Olympia (5 minutes walk) and Shepherd's Bush is also only 10 minutes walk away. There are also plenty of bus routes in the area as well as Santander Cycle hire if you feel like a cycle around the city. Check out the TFL Santander Cycles website for locations and information.
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: My support team or I will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
