name: Lovely 2Bed Chelsea bet famous Kings Road &Thames!
summary: Lovely two bedroom flat sandwiched between the famous Kings Road with its shops, cafés and restaurants, and the River Thames on Chelsea Embankment, In an area rich in history (conservation area)  The property is spacious and well-kept, and has a very warm feel to it. There are two bedrooms, that sleeps 4, a bright and airy living room and a spacious kitchen.  The Cadogan Pier is 300m walk to catch ferries to Tate, Canary Warf, Tower Bridge etc. Alternatively walk, taxi or bus to Sloan Sq
space: Spacious two-bed flat on the ground floor in Kings Mansions. The property has a bright living room with loads of natural light. There is an open plan kitchen, equipped with modern appliances. The flat boasts of two bedrooms with extra comfy beds, ensuring a good night's sleep. Linen on notice can be supplied for a double sofa bed in the living room, subject to the flat sleeping max 4. My cleaners place fresh, hotel quality linen on your bed prior to arrival.

neighborhood_overview: Smirking along the banks of the Thames, pomp and circumstance precedes Chelsea’s bohemian-turned-businessman reputation. Influential bands like The Beatles and The Rolling Stones lent their stardom to Chelsea during the 60s. The neighborhood’s Swinging London era fame has abated, and its cadre of punks and hippies has grown into sleek-suited business people stepping out of chic townhomes. Chelsea isn’t always polite—its residents root ferociously for their home team, Chelsea FC.
transit: The apartment is located twenty minutes walk from Sloane Square tube station (Circle and District lines).  Victoria station is also twenty minutes by bus.  The London Eye: 35 minutes by tube and bus  The Tower of London: 45 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train  Gatwick Airport: 50 minutes by bus and train Kings Cross: 35 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 30 minutes by tube
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay. A patio area is also available throughout the summer in daylight hours.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own.  - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm.  - No parties

summary: Stylish 2 bed, 2 bathroom flat in the heart of South Kensington. A short walk to Gloucester Rd tube and some of London's most popular museums incl. The V&A and Natural History Museum. The sophisticated furnishing and gorgeous art add to the charm of this beautiful lower ground flat, with its own private entrance through a pretty mews, just a few steps down from street level. neighborhood_overview: South Kensington has held its place on the map as an area of cultural and scientific importance since the Great Exhibition of 1851, and some of the world’s prestigious museums and universities grandly line up along Exhibition Road. With the natural history museum, Royal Albert Hall and V&A attracting such vibrant mix of people, it's easy to forget that this is a residential area as well. The jewel in South Ken’s dazzling crown is surely its proximity to the historic and beautiful Hyde Park. South Kensington is location to the west of central London, Chelsea to the south, Hyde park directly north and Hammersmith to the west.  South Kensington has branches of almost every supermarket chain, and locals enjoy an unprecedented range of independent organic shops and several weekly farmers’ markets. On Saturdays the market takes place in the Bute Street and on the Tuesdays its on the Queens lawn at Imperial College. The Whole Foods Market on Kensington High Street offers free parking for shop

Please treat the home with the respect that you would treat your own, we dedicate a lot of time and care to it, so please respect the rules, the space and the neighbours.  We would really appreciate if you tell us about any damage or breakages so that we can deal with these issues as soon as they arise. name: Bright Airy Convenient / Belsize Park High Street
summary: Welcome to our bright and airy London apartment, located on the buzzing Belsize Park high street with the conveniences of the tube, cafes, bakery, restaurants, cinema, local supermarkets right on your doorstep. We hope our home provides you with a comfortable and convenient base for exploring the joyful diversity of London!
space: Our bright, airy, comfortable home is located on the second floor of a terrace building overlooking Belsize Park high street (please note there is no lift). As such, you will hear plenty life going on outside our apartment, and from time to time ambulances heading to/from the local hospital. However the elevation provides a lovely cross breeze on a warm Summer's day, and even in more typical British weather natural daylight floods the windows on three sides of our property! The bedroom is located at the back of the house away from the high street and is quite large by London standards. It features a very comfortable UK size super king bed (Australian/Canadian King) and feather pillows. Please be aware that our bed doesn't sit on a frame as we take a Montessori approach to floor beds for our young son.  Stepping past the entry way you will find the bathroom with basin, toilet and shower over the bath tub.  Our long narrow kitchen includes a toaster, kettle, electric oven, gas hotplates
description: Welcome to our bright and airy London apartment, located on the buzzing Belsize Park high street with the conveniences of the tube, cafes, bakery, restaurants, cinema, local supermarkets right on your doorstep. We hope our home provides you with a comfortable and convenient base for exploring the joyful diversity of London! Our bright, airy, comfortable home is located on the second floor of a terrace building overlooking Belsize Park high street (please note there is no lift). As such, you will hear plenty life going on outside our apartment, and from time to time ambulances heading to/from the local hospital. However the elevation provides a lovely cross breeze on a warm Summer's day, and even in more typical British weather natural daylight floods the windows on three sides of our property! The bedroom is located at the back of the house away from the high street and is quite large by London standards. It features a very comfortable UK size super king bed (Australian/Canadian King)
neighborhood_overview: Belsize Park is a popular destination with many expats living in London - taking our son to the local playground we hear more French, Russian and Spanish spoke than English! :) The leafy green suburb is full of restaurants and cafes, and is nestled between the prestigious neighbourhood of Hampstead to the north and alternative Camden to the south. We are spoilt with two of the best parks in London located 10-15 minutes walk from our home - the wilds of Hampstead Heath with the bathing ponds, Parliament Hill and Kenwood House to the north of us, and gorgeous Primrose Hill (leading onto London Zoo and Regent's Park) to the south with views over the city. Both are wonderful places to relax with a book for a few hours, brisk run or leisurely walk.
notes: Please remember that this is our home and treat it as you would wish your own home treated. Our home is strictly non-smoking and no pets allowed.
transit: Our home is very convenient for walking, tube and local busses. We recommend that you download the City Mapper app for the best route planning (it's particularly good for public transport combinations). UNDERGROUND/TUBE: We are located opposite Belsize Park station (Zone 2) on the Edgware branch of the Northern line. From a time/distance perspective it takes 10 minutes to reach Oxford Street (Tottenham Court Road station) in Central London. The Jubilee and Metropolitan lines can also be accessed from Swiss Cottage and Finchley Rd (C11 bus or 13 min walk).  OVERGROUND TRAIN: Hampstead Heath station (10 min walk) BUSSES: C11 towards Archway (East) and Brent Cross Shopping Centre (North-West), 168 towards Royal Free Hospital (North) and Old Kent Road (South). Additional major bus routes accessed from Hampstead Heath, Camden and Swiss Cottage.
access: Our whole apartment will be available to your exclusive use, except the study which is locked.
interaction: Depending on the dates of arrival and departure as to whether you will be met by us or our co-host. Either way we are very happy to keep up regular communication via email or (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) to assist you with any problems or questions during your stay in our home.  We would love to give you recommendations on London's best coffee and our favourite restaurants, cafes and brunch locations - please let us know what you like and we'll make suggestions!
house_rules: - No shoes in the house - Be considerate of our neighbours and manage noise levels - No external guests to be brought home
host_about: Hi, we are Aussies living in London since 2008. We love to travel and experience different cultures and places. Recently our pace of travel slowed down but our pace of life picked up with the arrival of our young son! We love beaches, time outdoors, sunny days in parks, sailing and quality coffee.

name: Amazing Central Shoreditch 2-Bed & 2-Bath
summary: Stay right by Old Street Station - Where Shoreditch Begins. The nearest bar is the world famous Nightjar. Great location for those who want to be in the very heart of the buzzing action.   This is my personal home, meaning it's a comfortable home away from home, ideal for tourists, couples and friends wishing to stay in the heart of Central London. Please note my reviews on my other listings - it's for the same property - but when I rented it out before.
space: Under a minute's walk from Old Street station, my flat gives you an amazingly central location from which to enjoy London. The quirky layout and comfortable furnishings make for cosy flat where you'll feel instantly at home. The living room is spacious, with a dining table that folds away to the side to create more space in which to relax. The kitchen is just across the hall from here, with a small balcony and all the appliances and utensils you'd need to whip up a meal during your stay - although check out my guidebook for recommendations of great restaurants in the area! At the end of the flat are the two bedrooms, with comfortable double beds ensuring a good night's sleep, and my cleaners place fresh, hotel-quality linen on the bed before your arrival. One bedroom has an ensuite with shower, while there's another bathroom with shower over the bath at the other end of the flat. There's everything you need to feel at home, right in the heart of vibrant Shoreditch.

neighborhood_overview: In Shoreditch, empty walls are future murals. The neighbourhood’s industrial warehouses and dingy side streets offer plenty of potential space waiting to be reimagined. Old brick warehouses have transformed into interactive art galleries, and countless buildings have served as Banksy’s canvases. Shoreditch’s appeal as a creative playground stems (at least, in part) from an urban, gritty underbelly, but clean-cut treasures aren’t in short supply—Shoreditch’s design sensibilities also influence its trendy pubs and cafes.

notes: This Studio is rear facing on the 1st floor and slightly smaller than the other studios.  It has a brand new 32" WiFi enabled HD LED TV. Many thanks for considering staying at this Studio. name: Stylish Room & Modern Flat in central London
summary: My place is located in a building which is three years old. We are situated in Zone 1 close to the city of London, Shoreditch and Aldgate. The nearest tube is a minutes walk away and we are five minutes walk from two more tube stations - so everywhere is accessible. Shoreditch is a great area - lots of independent coffee shops, restaurants, cinemas, markets and street art. We are also a ten minute walk away from the Tower of London and Tower Bridge.
space: We live in a well connected area of London. It is very simple to get everywhere. You can reach our flat very easily from all the major London airports and the Eurostar. We provide breakfast in our living room in the mornings (set up so you can help yourself at whatever time you choose) and you are free to come and go as you like.

neighborhood_overview: Shorditch is one of the most vibrant and exciting areas of London. Spittlefields market offers many shops, restaurants and market stalls and the area has become the place where new restaurants set up before expanding into the rest of London. The area has a diverse mix of people. There is a strong arts contingent, with some world famous artists living in the neighbourhood (Tracy Enim, Gilbert and George) and I have spotted Bjork and Martin Freeman shopping in the areas. The neighbourhood is also well know for fashion and had a fashion university. There is a strong Bangladeshi community and you have some of the best and cheapest curry houses in London.
notes: Whatever time you arrive, you can drop off luggage in the flat and we you can pick up the keys, if we are at work an unable to be home to meet you.
transit: We are close to all forms of public transport. We have three tube stations very close to the flat (Aldgate, Aldgate East and Liverpool st). The overground is a 10 minute walk away and the DLR  is 12 minutes away. You can also take a number of buses that stop at Trafalgar Sq and Oxford st. We send all guest a guide explaining how to reach our flat from the major airports.
access: Guests usually have breakfast in the living room and we you are more than welcome to make tea or coffee when you want - or take a cold drink from the fridge.
interaction: We live in the flat and will happily help out with any sightseeing advice or information about eating out or getting around London.
host_about:
Hi,
I work in Education and am easy going. I love living in London and sharing tips about the city. If you enjoy eating out, let me know - I have a lot of tips for for restaurants. I love music too, and London is an excellent place to see concerts. Recently, I have been to see Belly, Sun Kil Moon, and a lot of opera.

summary: A two bedroom flat situated in the loft of a family home. The accommodation has two good size double bedrooms (although one is a small double bed), a small kitchen and a lounge area with a sofa and table and chairs. The accommodation is accessed via the main family home but is completely private and has its own locking door. Just 2 minutes walk to Southfields tube station (District line) and all the amenities Southfields has to offer. I also have free parking available for those bringing a car.
space: Please see the many 5 star reviews against my profile which are for this space which was previously listed differently. Although the accommodation is situated in a family home (please note we do have three small children including a very young baby), its on the top floor and is very private and even has its own locking door so no need to worry about security and privacy. You will have private access to the entire loft which has a small but well equipped kitchen, a table and chairs for up to four people and a small sofa. It also has a bathroom with both a bath and shower over the bath. Both double bedrooms are a good size with comfortable beds. The space is ideal for families, of which i have had many stay in the past. There is also free parking available on the drive in front of the house.

Although the accommodation is situated in a family home (please note we do have three small children including a very young baby), its on the top floor and is very private and even has its own locking door so no need to worry about security and privacy. You will have private access to the entire loft which has a small but well equipped kitchen, a table and chairs for up to four
neighborhood_overview: Southfields is a quiet neighbourhood in South West London. It has a village feeling with plenty of places to eat and a selection of shops. It's a few minutes walking distance from Wimbledon Park which is ideal for a stroll or run by the lake and great for the kids to play in the playground or in the fountains in summer. Wimbledon Park also offers volleyball, tennis courts, crazy golf and water sport facilities. Southfields is also just 12 minutes walk from Wimbledon tennis courts and a 25 minutes walk to Wimbledon village.
notes: The kitchen is small, it has a mini oven and hob although does have a full size fridge and a microwave. Its ideal for having breakfast and lunch but not for cooking big meals. Please also beware we do have a small baby in the house and although the flat is private and quiet you may sometimes hear noise from the children.
transit: The flat is just 2 minutes walk from Southfields tube station which is on the District line and provides easy access to Central and west London.
access: You will have private access to the entire loft which has a small but well equipped kitchen, a table chairs for up to four people and a small sofa. It also has a bathroom with both a bath and shower over the bath. Both double bedrooms are a good size with comfortable beds.
interaction: I am generally in and out the main house all day so give me a call or just pop down and see me, i am happy to help with anything.
house_rules: Guests to take off shoes at front door of the main house. The area might not be suitable if your children are very young as the stairs lead into the lounge area, and there isn't a stair gate.
host_about: I'm a mum of two small children, who lives in London. I'm kept busy at the gym, looking after the kids and preparing for my Airbnb guests

name: London Fields: Bright, airy 2 mid-terrace flat
summary: Come and stay in our 2 bedroom garden flat in leafy London Fields! Our flat is set across 2 floors of a Georgian terrace on a quiet road: plenty of light and space, and a private garden with a BBQ. Kid friendly, our 3 year old has reluctantly promised use of his toys. We're also pet friendly. We're 1 minute and you're in the park, surrounded by hipsters with their barbecues - 2 minutes more and you're in Broadway Market with it's bars, restaurants and gourmet food shops.
space: We have 2 bedrooms, one single and one double. We have a double airbed if needed, which fits comfortably in the single room, or in the living room. There are stairs down to the flat, and an internal staircase. Full use of the kitchen, cookware, and oils/spices etc. We'll also leave milk eggs bread etc.

neighborhood_overview: Perfect area to see London at it's best. We're 15-20 minutes cycle into the centre, and a short walk to Broadway Market, Columbia Road, Shoreditch, Dalston, Victoria Park, Regents Canal - all the best bits of East London.

neighborhood_overview: Kensington is a district of west London, England, within the border of Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea and Hammersmith & Fulham Borough. Its commercial heart is Kensington High Street. This affluent and densely populated area contains the well-known museum district of South Kensington. West Kensington is about 5 min by bus (20min walk) and is a district of west London within  Hammersmith and Fulham Borough. To the north, Kensington is bordered by Notting Hill; to the east by Brompton and Knightsbridge; to the south by Chelsea and Earl's Court; and to the west by Hammersmith and Shepherd's Bush.
notes: Double room with huge triple glazed windows. situated 1min from West Kensington tube station in a CCTVsecure place. High Street Kensington, Earls Court, Fulham, Barons Court, Hammersmith walking distance. Four elevators in the building, hot water; laminated floor; central heating, internet, intercom. Shops: Sainsbury; Tesco; Waitrose; open market mins away. DETAILS- The flat 40 minutes to Heathrow Airport via tube  20 minutes to Heathrow Airport via taxi 20 min to Piccadilly Circus via tube - this is very much in the centre  15 min to Piccadilly Circus via taxi
transit: Notable attractions and institutions in High Street Kensington (or South Kensington) include: Kensington Palace in Kensington Gardens, the Royal Albert Hall opposite the Albert Memorial in Hyde Park, the Royal College of Music, the Natural History Museum, the Science Museum, the Victoria and Albert Museum, Heythrop College, Imperial College, London, the Royal College of Art and Kensington and Chelsea College. Two exhibition centers nearby- walking distance: Kensington Olympia(8min) and Earl's Court(15min) as well as Barons Court(12min), Hammersmith(20min); High Street Kensington(25min); West Brompton(17min); Fulham Broadway(20min). The nearest shop is behind the building-Sainsbury(1min); Earl's Court Tesco(5min); open market with fresh fruits and vegetables(13min). You may choose of course public transport if not kin to walk. It's been easy commuting to different places by tube(District;Piccadilly), overground(from Kensington Olympia) or buses. Or other possibility are Barclays bicycle

name: Beautiful King Sized Bedroom in Islington, London
summary: A bright and airy bedroom in two bedroom flat in beautiful home in Islington (zone 1).  Excellent transport links to central London: 20mins to Oxford Circus and a 10 mins walk to the vibrant restaurants, bars and theatres of Islington’s Upper Street and hip Dalston.  Flat has a spacious feel, wooden flooring throughout, an open plan kitchen - dining room. Airbnb has selected flat for their exclusive 'Plus' program, where they inspect in-person for comfort and style.
space: Space Spacious and full of natural light, the apartment is located on the second floor of an attractive period London Victorian house. King sized, fresh linen and towels provided plus free WiFi, hairdryer and storage.  The flat is a two minute walk from the Overground train station and is situated in the picturesque Canonbury Conservation area.

Excellent transport links to central London: 20mins to Oxford Circus and a 10 mins walk to the vibrant restaurants, bars and theatres of Islington’s Upper Street and hip Dalston.  Flat has a spacious feel, wooden flooring throughout, an open plan kitchen - dining room. Airbnb has selected flat for their exclusive 'Plus' program, where they inspect in-person for comfort and style. I try to organise my diary to meet guests if I can, but if I am not there when you arrive, I’ll make suitable arrange
neighborhood_overview: Flat is super close to central London via nearby Overground and tube stations. For those that prefer to stay local, there's culture on the doorstep with renowned theatres, The Almedia and The Arcola, plus oodles of  independent boutiques, buzzy bars and restaurants, my favourites being Trullo’s and the renowned Ottolenghi’s. Further up the road, Perilla’s gets also amazing reviews.  Situated in the picturesque Canonbury Conservation area, the apartment overlooks the entrance to New River Walk Park - a pretty little haven for a riverside stroll. There is also a grocery store handily across the road and a bus stop opposite. Other nearby parks include Highbury Fields as well as a local pool. If swimming lengths isn't your thing, there’s a nearby yoga and pilates studio plus a Buddhist centre for the ultimate escape!
notes: Please Read This Bit Carefully Before Booking: As this is a home, we do like the flat very quiet, calm and peaceful so if you are after a party house, this may not be the room for you.  Please help us avoid causing disturbance to the neighbours:  - by keeping noise down to a minimum in communal hallway outside flat - be mindful of dragging luggage upstairs - remove your shoes when inside apartment - ensure all windows and doors are locked when leaving apartment.  Do not smoke inside the property and no surprise visitors!
transit: The public transport is fantastic for exploring London. The train is a two min walk and there are lots of buses that will take you almost anywhere.  - 20 mins to Central London (Oxford Circus - non peak hours).  - Attractions such as the British Museum, British Library, West End theatres, Covent Garden, Buckingham Palace are easily accessible both by bus and the train station located moments from my door.
interaction: I work part time - sometimes from home - and travel quite a bit. I try to organise my diary to meet guests if I can, but if I am not there when you arrive, I’ll make suitable arrangements for you to collect keys. It's a wonderful neighbourhood and I love to share local tips and recommendations in person or by mail.
host_about: I am an Irish communications consultant who juggles a practice in art and design on the side. I have lived in London for over ten years and have traveled a lot with work in the past  - love learning languages, meeting people and sharing tips on all that London has to offer. Feel free to get in touch or hear what others have said about my apartment here: https://www.airbnb.co.uk/users/show/19128854

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a superb location situated in between the two highly popular locations of Brixton and Dulwich. Just 3 minutes walk will take you to a bus that can lead you to central London or Brixton. Within just 10 minute you will land directly in the vibrant, multi-cultural Brixton filled with a diverse range of bars, pubs and shops. The renovated Victorian Ritzy cinema is highly worth a visit featuring a bar with live music as well as showing a range of movies in its iconic screens.  Brixton Market offers delicious street food and vintage finds, plus clothes and produce that reflect the area’s Caribbean roots..Late-night revellers hit celebrated bars and live-music venues such as the O2 Academy Brixton for rock gigs, and Hootananny for cutting-edge sounds. A 5 minute bus ride in the other direction brings you to the highly affluent Dulwich, featuring a superb park, and bustling line of restaurants and world renown Dulwich Picture Gallery.   Nearby West Norwood hosts a “Norwood
notes: Wifi and 100% cotton linen provided

Trains from this station run to London Bridge in under 20 minutes and there is a direct train to St Pancras International in 25mins. name: Designer 1bed in Fulham 3mins to tube w/ balcony
summary: Welcome to my home! My beautiful 1-bed apartment, in the fantastic area of Fulham, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re just a 3-minute walk away from the nearest tube. The place is bright and has been recently renovated with an interior designer. My home has lots of personal design touches and everything needed to feel at home straight away. Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this lovely part of London. I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: My stylish 1-bed apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Fulham and with great transport links, meaning my home is a great base for exploring London. The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the sofa, hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back.  If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the stylish kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones.  The master bedroom has a super comfortable double bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you need for a good night’s sleep? You don’t have to live out of your suitcase; plenty of storage room means you can get unpacking and start feeling at home right away. Freshen up in t

My stylish 1-bed apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Fulham and with great transport links, meaning my home is a great base for exploring London. The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the sofa, hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back.  If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the stylish kitch
neighborhood_overview: One thing is for sure; you will never go hungry in Fulham Broadway! There are so many great restaurants to choose from here. As well as recognisable brands such as Wagamama, Gourmet Burger Kitchen and Byron, there are hidden gems here too. The Harwood Arms is a pub with a Michelin Star but it hasn’t lost it’s friendly, local feeling. For authentic Vietnamese food, head to MeMe. Our favourite pub is The Butcher's Hook just next door. You are close to all the major events and attractions in London such as Hyde Park, Buckingham Palace, Green Park, Wimbledon, etc.  Also the home of Premier League Champions, Chelsea FC is just a few minutes walk away should you want to experience the glamour and emotions of a live Premier League or Champions League night. The famous Kings Road in Chelsea is just a fifteen-minute walk and has plenty of fantastic shops and restaurants. Particularly good restaurants near and on the Kings Road include La Familiga, Eight over Eight who do amazing Fusion cuisine
transit: You are just a 3-minute walk from Fulham Broadway underground so my home is a great base for exploring London.
access: You will have access to the entire place to yourself!
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-term management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.

name: Shard View Apartment with friendly & healthy hosts
summary: Our apartment is perfectly located in the trendy, vibrant London district of Bermondsey. Just a mile from the City itself and minutes’ walk from London Bridge station and the iconic attractions of Tower Bridge, The Shard, gourmet food Borough Market and the South Bank. What setting could be better? The flat enjoys 3 balconies, one with fantastic view of the Shard, perfect for an alfresco breakfast on a warm day. This really is a lovely place to call home even if you are here just for a day!
space: The apartment is quiet, cosy, and very specious, situated on the 4th (top) floor of an apartment building. The double room has a high ceiling, two double-glazing windows, a private balcony, and internet. Double-glazing windows reduce the traffic noise to a minimum level, yet do not cut out the noise completely (if one prefers sleeping with the windows open, or is a very sensitive sleeper, then ear plugs might/should be considered). Our guests can enjoy the breakfast in the living room which opens onto a sunny balcony. We offer freshly ground coffee or tea with healthy breakfast of your choice (fruit, berries, porridge, gluten free cereal, toasts with butter, jam or marmalade, yoghurts and much more). The view from the balcony is amazing (The Shard and the City, Canary Wharf). There is fully equipped kitchen if you prefer cooking at home. We do not eat meat and highly appreciate if meat is not cooked in the kitchen, yet you can enjoy ham on toast or pre-prepared meals (meat) brought fro
description: Our apartment is perfectly located in the trendy, vibrant London district of Bermondsey. Just a mile from the City itself and minutes’ walk from London Bridge station and the iconic attractions of Tower Bridge, The Shard, gourmet food Borough Market and the South Bank. What setting could be better? The flat enjoys 3 balconies, one with fantastic view of the Shard, perfect for an alfresco breakfast on a warm day. This really is a lovely place to call home even if you are here just for a day! The apartment is quiet, cosy, and very specious, situated on the 4th (top) floor of an apartment building. The double room has a high ceiling, two double-glazing windows, a private balcony, and internet. Double-glazing windows reduce the traffic noise to a minimum level, yet do not cut out the noise completely (if one prefers sleeping with the windows open, or is a very sensitive sleeper, then ear plugs might/should be considered). Our guests can enjoy the breakfast in the living room which opens on
neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located just a few minutes (15 min) walk from the Shard, London Bridge Underground station, Bermondsey Station, Borough Market and the Southbank. The bus stop is just on our doorstep. N78 takes you to the City of London (Liverpool St Station) via Tower Bridge and N1 to Holborn (Covent Garden). There are bikes for rent on the main road. There is a Sainsbury's Local for essentials and food and Kagyu Samye Dzong London Tibetan Buddhist community/meditation centre just behind our apartment. Trendy, über-cool and modern Bermondsey Street and the Square are just 5-7 minutes walk from our apartment. On Saturdays the Square hosts a farmer’s market, where locals and foodies can buy all types of organic produce (sourdough spelt bread, goat’s cheese, blue salad potatoes, brownies and much much more). The Bermondsey street is full of fantastic restaurants, bars and cafés.
notes: I and Alex are sharing this flat. We have been best friends for ages. We are keen on healthy, active life style. Alex is a massage and reiki therapist. I am a nutritionist and we are happy to help people to achieve their personal goals. We love travelling, jogging, good music, yoga retreats and our lazy Saturday breakfast on Borough Market.
access: Double room, sitting room, kitchen, balconies, bathroom
interaction: We are very friendly and if our guests want to get off the tourist trail and enjoy London like a local, we are happy to share tips, advice and recommendations. We are usually busy during the week but you are welcome to join us for a dinner or a drink out. We can also arrange free tickets to the Tower of London, the Royal Academy of Arts and the spectacular Sky Garden which offers 360 degree views across the City of London (please request in advance).
house_rules: This is a private apartment!  Please take your shoes off at the door  Be kind to leave your room as you have found it - nice and tidy. Thank you.
host_about: Welcome to my profile! I am Erica. I am a Londoner and I love this city. I have been living in London for 18 years, yet I am originally from Estonia. I came to London to study Science (Nutrition) and stayed indefinitely. As a nutritionist I am committed to helping people be and love themselves, try their best in anything they put their mind to whether it is food, exercise, mind and I try to lead by example instead of preaching! I love travelling and I am in love with Barcelona, Bath and New York! I am very active and I need to always be on the go (whether jogging  along the Thames, visiting the best art galleries in London, exploring new places and cities). I love local and seasonal fruit and veg and my diet is mainly vegan. I count myself as a pescaterian as I eat seafood now and then.

Historic Surrey Quays was once a thriving network of waterways on the south bank of the River Thames receiving cargo from around the world. Nowadays, the area, along with neighbouring Canada Water, is popular due to its close proximity to Central London, Canary Wharf and Royal Greenwich. Surrey Quays has a shopping centre offering a wide range of shopping and leisure facilities. Nearby Southwark Park offers 63 acres of green space. name: Fabulous 3BD in the heart of Highbury
summary: Welcome to our lovely three bed house in Highbury. Bright, modern and fresh, the whole property is filled with natural light thanks to the large windows throughout. The living room is lovely and large and there is a modern kitchen that will be perfect for those who enjoy cooking! The house is in a great location, just ten mins stroll to Highbury Barn with plenty of great restaurants and cafes to choose from.
space: This gorgeous house has no shortage of charm. Once inside you will find high ceilings throughout, a large living room, separate fully fitted kitchen and three bedrooms -two  doubles and a single. In the living/dining room there is a comfortable 'L' shape sofa and arm chairs and a dining table perfect for getting everyone together for brunch before you head out for a day exploring the city. Five guests are accommodated in the three bedrooms with space for an additional two guests on the new sofa bed. This property is perfect for a group or family and there is even a travel cot and highchair if you have a little one.

Five guests are accommodated in the three bedrooms with space for an additional two guests on the new sofa bed. This property is perfect for a group or family and there is even a travel cot and h
neighborhood_overview: Affluent, relaxing and leafy, Highbury and Islington manage to provide both a friendly, village atmosphere complimented by some lovely local bars and restaurants. Coupled with great transport connections to the hussle and bussle of central London, the location of this property is excellent. Within a short walk from the house you will find Arsenal Stadium. The Stadium museum offers multiple tours available daily. The local area has a lovely residential charm and across the street you will find the pretty and green Gillespie Park and Eco Reserve. The ducks are always happy to be fed and there is a community run cafe open at the weekend, their profits are ploughed back into local environmental projects.
notes: *** LATE CHECK-IN FEE: PLEASE NOTE THERE IS A LATE CHECK-IN FEE OF £25 AS WE NEED TO ARRANGE TO MEET YOU AFTER HOURS. IF YOU PLAN TO ARRIVE AFTER 7PM, KINDLY LET US KNOW SO WE CAN SCHEDULE*** NOTE: We will send you a request for the late check-in fee within Airbnb after you complete your booking. Thank you. FAQ • Can you be flexible with check in and check out times? Yes. Our usual check in time is 2pm and check out is 10am but we can be flexible with both as long as we do not have check in and out on the same day. • Do you have free wifi? Yes. We will tell you the wifi code when you check-in • Do you provide linen and towels? Yes all pressed bed linen and double size towels are provided • Can you help to arrange airport transfers? Yes we'd be happy to help, just let us know the details and we will find out prices for you and then book it if you wish to proceed • Is a washing machine and dryer provided? Yes • What are your bed sizes? Two standard UK size doubles One single One sofa bed
transit: Super convenient location with Arsenal underground station just 2 minutes away! The station gives access to the Piccadilly line - 11min to Leicester square - (Many of Londons biggest theatres!) 13 min to Oxford Circus (Central London for shopping) 20min to Westminster (The Houses of Parliament and Big Ben)
access: The entire property will be yours to enjoy
interaction: I will be there to give you a warm welcome to London and show you around the apartment. As a lifelong Londoner I'd be more than happy to pass on any advice you need about making the most of your time in our fantastic city Luxury pressed linen and double size towels are provided to all guests as standard I'll also meet you at the end of your stay to say goodbye. If you are interested in airport transfers, city tours or Arsenal football tickets, I may also be able to help arrange these so just ask! Finally, any Pokemon Go players out there? The house is on a poke stop meaning you can generate lots of poke balls and play the game by just sitting in the house!
house_rules: This is our home so we expect guests to treat it like their own with respect. No parties or loud music are allowed during the stay and smoking is not permitted at all in the house.
host_about:
We love Airbnb, but we know that it can be very time consuming for property owners to organise, so we do all the hard work for them by managing their place whilst they are away

This means that for guests staying in one of our Airbnb properties, they will get very professional, local service from genuine Londoners. We have a roster of reliable cleaners, we'll personally meet you at the property and we'll be on call for any local advice or help. We also only accept properties into our portfolio which hit a certain standard, so I'm sure you'll be happy with your stay!

Francis and Mark both love travelling and understand the importance of a nice property and welcoming smile when visiting, so we'll do everything possible to make sure you enjoy the property and our city.

We can even organise airport transfers, football match or theatre tickets and city tours if you want.

We only take bookings through Airbnb, so get in touch and book into one of our fantastic London properties!

name: 2 Bed Ground Floor Flat with Large Sunny Garden
summary: Spacious, newly refurbished ground floor flat in East London with two double rooms. This is our home although we have regular Air BnB guests in our spare room so we are well equipped.  Light breakfast provided with stay including, cereal, toast, jam tea and proper coffee! Happy to cater for any special dietary requirements, just let us know in advance!
space: Modern ground floor flat with step free access however, there are stairs to the basement if you would like to use washing facilities. Full use of kitchen and appliances. Use of living room / dining which has TV and sky. The living room opens up into the garden where you can enjoy a drink in the sun (british weather dependent!).

Light breakfast provided with stay including, cereal, toast, jam tea and proper coffee! Happy to cater for any special dietary requirements, just let us know in advance! Modern ground floor flat with step free access however, there are stairs to the basement if you would like to use washing facilities. Full use of kitchen and appliances. Use of living room / dining which has TV and sky. The living room opens up into the garden where you can enjoy a drink in the sun (british weather dependent!). You will have full access to a well equipped kitchen, open plan living/dining room and washing facilities (washer/dryer). You will also have use of the BBQ in our lovely, sunny garden with bifold doors from the living area. We will be letting our whole house out while we are on holiday so it is unlikely we will me
neighborhood_overview: A short walk to Leytonstone (birth place of Alfred Hitchcock) which has a variety of traditional british pubs, variety of cultural foods and cafes. The other direction there is Stratford where you can find Westfeild shopping centre and the 2012 Olympic park. Epping forest is a short journey away where you can get in touch with nature if the big city becomes overwhelming.
notes: Street parking available at an additional cost, free parking available between 6.30pm and 7am and all day Sunday. Please let us know in advance if you require parking tickets. Our regular cleaner can be booked for a whole house clean mid stay if requested, at an extra cost.
transit: We are very close to many transport links as we sit right between two Central line tube stations, Leyton and Leytonstone. Both are a short bus ride or 20 min walk away. From Leyton tube it is exactly 13 mins to Bank in central London. From Bank it is easy to get anywhere; from the West End for the theatre, to South bank for tourist attractions (London Eye, Borough Market etc) and Oxford Street for a spot of shopping!  The London Overground is also a 10 minute walk away, taking you to the Victoria Line which is easily the best tube line! The Victoria line takes you to Kings Cross (St Pancras), Oxford Circus (more shopping), Green Park (Buckingham Palace), Victoria (national trains and buses) and Brixton for some culture and food. A short bus ride from Stratford for a day of shopping or transport links into central London and beyond.
access: You will have full access to a well equipped kitchen, open plan living/dining room and washing facilities (washer/dryer). You will also have use of the BBQ in our lovely, sunny garden with bifold doors from the living area.
interaction: We will be letting our whole house out while we are on holiday so it is unlikely we will meet in person however we will be readily contactable by phone and email. We also have a cleaner who will be available to help in person if needed.
house_rules: - Relaxed household however must consider neighbours. During the week we ask noise be kept down after 10.30pm and weekends midnight. - No shoes in the house. - No smoking in the house, however happy for smoking in the garden.  - Clean kitchen after use and respect shared living areas.

House rules in brief: •	Check out time is by 11am. (Please drop me a message when you leave the flat). •	In case you would like to keep your cases longer, message me the day before. In case the flat is available the cost will be 5£ per person. •	Remember, in case I need to take a quick shower I can use your bathroom. (Obviously, I won’t bother you when you are in).  •	When you use the shower make sure to not drop any water on the floor, use the mats provided. •	When you flush the WC, pull down the handle twice. •	When you leave during the day make sure to shut all the windows as they can swing and slam due to the wind. •	I do provide oyster cards.

My motto is: Never give up! 
I love travel around the world, very passionate to general studies. Civil engineering is my all.

name: Beautiful and Light Chelsea 1-Bed Apartment
summary: This incredible flat is located in the heart of SW London, with Earl's Court and West Brompton stations just minutes away. There is an artistic feel to the apartment with beautiful paintings and decorations throughout. A large balcony which looks over a leafy paradise, where it's hard to believe you're in central London. The elegant furnishings and ideal central location make this place perfect for couples and business travellers. Our cleaners place fresh hotel quality linen on your bed.
space: This beautiful first floor apartment is filled with light which flows through the whole flat. There is a large double room for guests to relax and feel at home in, which is tastefully decorated. There is plenty of storage and a modern, accompanying bathroom for your convenience. The living area is very spacious and contains many beautiful artworks, leading to a well-equipped kitchen which will have you creating culinary masterpieces in no time. One of the best parts of the flat is the balcony area which looks over a number of leafy gardens and is the perfect place to enjoy the sun in the evening.

neighborhood_overview: Smirking along the banks of the Thames, pomp and circumstance precedes Chelsea’s bohemian-turned-businessman reputation. Influential bands like The Beatles and The Rolling Stones lent their stardom to Chelsea during the 60s. The neighborhood’s Swinging London era fame has abated, and its cadre of punks and hippies has grown into sleek-suited business people stepping out of chic townhomes. Chelsea isn’t always polite—its residents root ferociously for their home team, Chelsea FC.
notes: There is a TV at the property, but it is only for DVD purposes.
transit: The apartment is located six minutes walk from Earl's Court tube station. The London Eye: 30 minutes by tube  The Tower of London: 40 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 50 minutes by train and tube Gatwick Airport: 60 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 40 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 25 minutes by tube

name: Cosy hideaway in leafy suburb
summary: This neighbourhood is within easy reach of central London.   Only a 5 minute walk to the station, shops, restaurants and bars.  Fully equipped kitchen;  Bathroom with bath and shower;  Comfortable living room/bedroom with flat screen TV and spare bed for third person if needed.  Garden at rear.  Parking available in the driveway (first come, first served) or neighbouring streets.  Station: 300mtrs  nearest supermarket: 120mtrs  30-35 mins journey time to central London on the train or tube.
space: Cosy hideaway in leafy Forest Hill, South East London.  Ground floor. Excellent transport links to central London on tube or train, with loads of buses to central London and surrounding areas. It is approximately 300 metres to the station. Shops, supermarkets, restaurants and cafés are all within an easy 5 minute walk. The apartment has a fully-fitted kitchen/diner, oven, hob, microwave and all the utensils, saucepans and crockery you might need.  The bathroom has a shower over a full-sized bathtub.  Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and towels provided.  The living/bedroom is spacious and comfortable with double bed, sofa, spare bed and 42" flat screen TV.  There is storage space for clothes in the wardrobe and different options for romantic lighting for a peaceful evening after a day on your feet exploring London. The flat is on a busy road, but the  secondary glazing makes it quiet.  There is a large and well-cared-for garden to the rear in which you are welcome to relax.

Please appreciate that London is a huge city, so 'quick' here can mean 30 minutes! There is a good selection of pubs, bars and cafes nearby, along with the famous Horniman Museum with its beautiful gardens and views over central London.  Dulwich Park too and Greenwich are within easy reach.

name: Pretty double room in Victorian house near tube
summary: A pretty double room in a charming Victorian house, only a 5 minute walk from the underground station with fast transport to central London and its sights. The room has been decorated with love, and has an amazing pitched ceiling, four poster bed, chandelier, antique furniture and lots of storage. You are free to use the shared spaces, such as the large kitchen/diner, living room, garden, roof terrace and three bathrooms with great water pressure. Stay with a Superhost to ensure a warm welcome!
space: A pretty double room in a beautiful and large early Victorian house full of character. You are welcome to use the shared spaces such as a big kitchen/diner equipped with all mod cons, living room, roof terrace and garden as well as three lovely bathrooms.  Please note that this room is at the top of the house, i.e. on the third floor (fourth floor for American visitors), so there are quite a few stairs!

The room has been decorated with love, and has an amazing pitched ceiling, four poster bed, chandelier, antique furniture and lots of storage. You are free to use the shared spaces, such as the large kitchen/diner, living room, garden, roof terrace and three bathrooms with great water pressure. Stay with a Superhost to ensure a warm welcome! A pretty double room in a beautiful and large early Victorian house full of character. You are welcome to use the shared spaces such as a big kitchen/diner equipped with all mod cons, living room, roof terrace and garden as well as three lovely bathrooms.  Please note that this room is at the top of the house, i.e. on the third floor (fourth floor for American visitors), so there are quite a few stairs! A big kitchen/diner with all mod cons, leading to a pretty walled garden. A large living room
neighborhood_overview: Stockwell is known as 'Little Portugal' for its Portuguese restaurants and bars. We also have some lovely pubs in the area. It is also walking distance to the pubs, bars and restaurants of Clapham, Brixton and Kennington and has easy and quick transport to central London. There are a number of grocery shops and supermarkets nearby including Sainsbury's, Tesco and Lidl, as well as a 24 hour shop. It is an urban, multi-cultural neighbourhood, with a wide range of income groups and housing, which is very typical of London. Please do not book if you are uncomfortable with this!
notes: We have three very cute cats, and some of us do smoke (in communal areas), so please do not book if this bothers you. The guest bedrooms are strictly non-smoking.  This particular room is at the top of the house (3rd floor, or 4th floor for American visitors!), so may not be suitable for guests who have difficulties with stairs. The bedroom door does not lock, but there is a lockable desk to store valuables if needed. The room faces a busy road and there is some traffic noise, especially when the windows are open. It is probably not suitable for light sleepers or those sensitive to noise. Please take a look at my listing for "Large & Lovely Room" if you would prefer a room facing the garden. Check in is from 3-9pm and check out by 11 am. Please respect these times and do not try to check in earlier. If you need to store luggage before check in/after check out, I can send you some options for very cheap left luggage services, starting at just 1 Euro per hour or £6 for the whole day. Che
transit: Stockwell underground station is a five-minute walk from the house and, from there, it is only a few minutes to central London. It is served by the Victoria and Northern Lines, which both run an all-night service on Friday and Saturdays. There are also plenty of buses, including 24-hour services. The bars, restaurants and shops of Brixton and Clapham are both within walking distance or a short tube/bus ride away. Example tube journey times from Stockwell station are approximately: Victoria – 5 minutes Waterloo – 7 minutes Oxford Circus – 9 minutes Leicester Square – 11 minutes Kings Cross St Pancras – 14 minutes Old Street (for Shoreditch & Hoxton) – 15 minutes Camden – 26 minutes To/from the airports: London City – 35 minutes (tube) Heathrow –  43 minutes (tube + Heathrow Express) or 62 minutes (tube) Gatwick – 45 minutes (tube + Gatwick Express) or 84 minutes (tube + regular train) Stansted – 69 minutes (tube + Stansted Express). The journey planner tool on the Transport for London w
access: A big kitchen/diner with all mod cons, leading to a pretty walled garden. A large living room with high ceilings and French doors leading onto a sunny roof terrace. Three bathrooms, including one with a big roll top bath and walk in shower and two shower rooms, plus an additional WC.
interaction: I am a Superhost, which means I have met Airbnb's highest standards and have received 5 star reviews from most of my guests. I work from home so am usually around to answer any questions, but can be reached on my mobile otherwise. Please do not feel like you need to confine yourself to the room. Do feel free to use communal areas such as the living room, kitchen/diner, bathrooms, garden and roof terrace.  If you need anything during your stay, including recommendations for local places to eat/drink, information about transport etc. please do ask. I'm always happy to help. Please note that there are other guest rooms in the house so there will most likely be other guests staying at the same time as you.
house_rules: Please confirm that you have read and agree to the following rules when you send a booking request or enquiry, or in a message if you have Instant Booked. I cannot host guests who do not confirm this and failure or do so will result in the cancellation of your booking. • Please provide full names of any guests included in your reservation before booking. Only guests named and paid for will be permitted on the premises. Please respect that this is my private home and do not bring visitors, including friends and family, without asking permission IN ADVANCE. Please note, I don't take bookings for under 18s under any circumstances.  Guests may be asked to provide official photo ID on arrival.  • Guests must communicate their arrival time prior to or at the time of booking. Please respect my check in time of 3-9pm.  I do not provide luggage storage at the house prior to check in/after check out. If you are arriving in London earlier, I can send links to inexpensive left luggage services. La
host_about:
Hi, my name's Huma and I'm an Airbnb 'Superhost', which means I've received five star reviews from the majority of my guests and have met Airbnb's highest standards for hosting.

I work as a magazine editor and I'm a genuine Londoner. I grew up here and have lived here most of my life. I'm very happy to help guests with information on the city.

I live in a big, beautiful and characterful early Victorian house which I have been renovating and filling with interesting things! I share it with my housemate and three very cute cats. 

The location is very convenient with excellent transport links, including an underground station only five minutes' walk away. You can be in central London in less than 20 minutes. The bars, restaurants and shops of Brixton, Clapham and Kennington are all close by.

It is a big, old house, so please bear in mind when booking that, to stay in a place with lots of character and period details, there are also often small repairs to be done and it gets a bit chilly in winter. However, I always try my best to make sure guests are as comfortable as possible and try to provide everything they need to enjoy their stay.

I speak English and a bit of (broken) schoolgirl French.

name: (JUB-D)PRIVATE ROOM FOR 4 NEAR RIVERSIDE
summary: Nice private room available for up to 4 people in a 4 Bedroom apartment . Great location, only 7 Mins walk from Shadwell Station, 10 mins walk to Whitechapel station. We provide fresh bed linen and towels Please note you will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom with other guests. Feel free to book.
space: Room comes with comfortable double bed, Double sofa bed , bedside table with lamp, wardrobe, big windows with lots of light, laminated floor. Kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need (fridge-freezer, cooker with 4 burners, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, cutlery, plates, glasses, mugs, pots, pans etc.…) We provide tea, coffee and sugar  There is a bathroom and separate toilet
description: Nice private room available for up to 4 people in a 4 Bedroom apartment . Great location, only 7 Mins walk from Shadwell Station, 10 mins walk to Whitechapel station. We provide fresh bed linen and towels Please note you will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom with other guests. Feel free to book. Room comes with comfortable double bed, Double sofa bed , bedside table with lamp, wardrobe, big windows with lots of light, laminated floor. Kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need (fridge-freezer, cooker with 4 burners, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, cutlery, plates, glasses, mugs, pots, pans etc.…) We provide tea, coffee and sugar  There is a bathroom and separate toilet There is key box set up next to the apartment entrance. All plates, cutlery and cooking essentials provided. Clean towels are included along with b
neighborhood_overview: Room is located close to Whitechapel station (only 10 min walk) and Shadwell station. ( 7 mins walk) It is a fairly quiet family neighbourhood with easy access to all the major attractions that visitors enjoy - it has plenty of things to do that are free and lovely walks. The house located in zone 2, in a culturally diverse area within easy reach of Tower Bridge, Shoreditch area, Brick Lane, London Bridge... A supermarket, bakeries, butcher and lots of diverse shops. Everything is on your doorstep.
notes: House Rules:  We have a no smoking and No party policy in all our properties. Please obey the rules! Please let us know if you arrive after midnight!  LATE CHECK OUT is unfortunately not possible.  If we find out you checked out later than 11am we will have to charge you:  (Rooms) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £10, between 1pm - 4pm is £20.00  (Whole flat) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £30, between 1pm - 4pm is £50.00 EARLY CHECK IN is unfortunately not possible. If we find out you checked out earlier than 4pm we will have to charge you:  Early check in fee (for rooms) £10.00 Early check in fee (for flats) £30.
transit: Located in the east of central London, the flat is well located to access not only the best nightlife London has to offer, but also the art galleries, museums and parks of central London. Flat is located in the area of Whitechapel/ Aldgate East Area (zone 1/2) The apartment is close to Brick Lane which is famous from Indian restaurants , art galleries, coffee shops, clothes and antique stores and also good place to visit on Saturday or Sunday where you can buy lot of interesting goods. Brick Lane has a party atmosphere every evening and this flat is just far enough away that you don't get the noise. Shoreditch is 15 minutes walk away. It has a great night life at the weekend. The most exciting restaurants, cafés and bars in London open in this neighbourhood. The area has a rich and fascinating history, which can be enjoyed through one of the walking tours available. The Jack the Ripper tour is very popular. There are many artists, galleries and artist studios nearby. One can even go on

name: Charming 1bed sleeps 4 - 6min to Greenwich station
summary: Welcome to my home! My beautiful 1 bedroom apartment, in the charming area of Greenwich, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re just a 6 minute walk away from Greenwich station - you can also travel from here by riverboat down the Thames!  This is a Grade II-listed property, built in 1770, and the sofa bed means you can sleep 4 people in total. Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: My charming 1 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Greenwich and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! With views overlooking Greenwich Park, you could hardly be better placed. The living area is light and airy with a beautiful design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the sofa and make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the open-plan kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones.  The master bedroom has an incredibly comfortable double bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you need for a good night’s sleep? You don’t have to live out of your suitcase; plenty of storage roo

neighborhood_overview: Taking international trendsetting to new extremes, the world sets its watch to Greenwich Mean Time. Greenwich not only establishes the benchmark for global time keeping, it’s also home to architectural splendour, forested parks, rich maritime history, and popular antiques markets. Victorian and Georgian buildings lend the neighbourhood a rustic opulence, while the ships docked along its southeast London banks serve as an ever-present reminder of Greenwich’s nautical inclinations.
transit: Greenwich Station is just a 6 minute walk away from the apartment. From here, you can get the DLR into Central London in only 20 minutes - straight to Bank Station! With so much to explore on your doorstep you might not need to, but exploring further afield could hardly be easier!
access: Guests will have access to the entire property.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-lets management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.
house_rules: - Please observe quiet hours between 11.30pm to 7am - ID must be shown upon entry.

name: Great transport links to West End and City
summary: A comfortable double room with private bathroom (it is next door to the bedroom) on a quiet residential street. Our place is close to both Oval (zone 2) and Vauxhall (zone 1) stations and is ideal for reaching both the West End and City.  The kitchen/living area is spacious and there's also a south-facing garden for relaxing in. There are some great pubs nearby - the Fentiman Arms and the Canton Arms - and we are also close to Borough Market and Brixton Village.
space: The bedroom has a large walk-in cupboard for hanging clothes. The private bathroom (for your use only) is right next door to the bedroom.  The living space/kitchen are generously sized (for London!) and great for relaxing in.
description: A comfortable double room with private bathroom (it is next door to the bedroom) on a quiet residential street. Our place is close to both Oval (zone 2) and Vauxhall (zone 1) stations and is ideal for reaching both the West End and City.  The kitchen/living area is spacious and there's also a south-facing garden for relaxing in. There are some great pubs nearby - the Fentiman Arms and the Canton Arms - and we are also close to Borough Market and Brixton Village. The bedroom has a large walk-in cupboard for hanging clothes. The private bathroom (for your use only) is right next door to the bedroom.  The living space/kitchen are generously sized (for London!) and great for relaxing in. The main living/kitchen/dining room and garden are available at all times.  There is also garage space for bicycles. We are out at work on weekdays, but available to help in the evenings for trip planning, or by phone during the day for emergencies.  We have a key safe so are flexible about check-in times.
neighborhood_overview: We are within easy reach of many of London's best attractions, including Big Ben, the museums of South Kensington and shopping on Regent Street, Oxford Street and Covent Garden.  For food and market-lovers, we are a short bus ride away from Brixton Village and PopBrixton, as well as Borough Market and Mercato Metropolitano. Access into the City is also quick, with Bank under 10 minutes from Oval on the Northern line.
notes: We occasionally have guests staying in another room, who will also be using the kitchen/living areas. My husband and I also live here!
transit: Oval tube station (Northern line, zone 2) and Vauxhall (Victoria line, zone 1) are within easy walking distance.  There are also numerous bus routes nearby. Citymapper is a great app for helping you to plan your journeys.  We are easily accessible from both Gatwick and Heathrow Airports.
access: The main living/kitchen/dining room and garden are available at all times.  There is also garage space for bicycles.
interaction: We are out at work on weekdays, but available to help in the evenings for trip planning, or by phone during the day for emergencies.  We have a key safe so are flexible about check-in times.  Please just ask if I can help you with any trip planning.
house_rules: Please take shoes off indoors Please make sure bedroom windows are closed when you leave the house If you are the last to leave the house, please lock the front door (bottom key)
host_about: My husband and I have lived in our home since 2010.

name: Perfectly situated COVENT GARDEN apartment. 4P
summary: Very light and quiet apartment on the 3rd floor. It features one decent size bedroom and a big living room with kitchen. The sofa in the living room can be converted into a queen size bed. The kitchen is completely new with dishwasher and modern appliances. Also includes a washing machine that can be used by guests. The bathroom is small but practical and has a bath.

host_about:
We are a newlywed couple enjoying our life in London. Our interests are art, music and travel. You will usually find us either strolling through a museum and go to a classical concert in the evening finishing in a jazzclub, or hiking in nature with nothing but silence around us. 
We moved to London 1,5 years ago and truly fell in love with all that London has to offer and hope our guests feel the same way after visiting the city.

name: In heart of London: Marylebone-Baker Street
summary: This is a bright, airy and fully self-contained spacious apartment on the first floor (18 steps) of a quiet building located on one of central London's prime Georgian streets. Inside, everything is on the same level (no steps). The property is suitable for short and medium-length stays. There is adequate space for one or two guests to unpack, store and hang clothes. Suitable for solo holiday / business travellers and couples.  Not hosting full-time students at this time.

summary: My apartment is close to Victoria Park, the Roman Road market, Mile End tube (Central Line - 20 minutes to the centre of London) and Stratford Olympic Park.  It has quirkiness, comfort and space.  It's a good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers alike.
space: The apartment has a spacious living room that on to which there is a small backyard.  The kitchen is big enough for you to sit down at a table and enjoy your breakfast.
description: My apartment is close to Victoria Park, the Roman Road market, Mile End tube (Central Line - 20 minutes to the centre of London) and Stratford Olympic Park. The kitchen is big enough for you to sit down at a table and enjoy your breakfast. Visitors can use the main living room space plus the kitchen. Most of the time I am living here so am very happy to answer any local area or London questions that you might have.  I'm a native! neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood has excellent connections to both central London and the east side of London and beyond.  It's a quiet residential area with the beautiful and award winning Victoria Park less than 5 minutes away.  All amenities are very close too - several small supermarkets and local grocery shops, many interesting coffee shops, a specialist wine shop, and a fantastic local library.
notes: If you wish to use the free parking space please let me know beforehand.
transit: Getting around London and beyond is very easy when you are staying at Saxon Lea Court.  Mile End tube in Zone 2 is less than 10 walk away.  Buses that will take you to Central London or towards Stratford are only 5 minutes away.

name: Our Brixton home,  5min from tube
summary: Situated in the heart of Brixton, our top floor terraced apartment offers you a cosy home and excellent place to start exploring Brixton and London from. Just 5 minutes away from Brixton tube station (15-20min from Victoria station) and the vibrant Brixton village with it's market stalls from all over the world and at walking distance from Herne Hill with a beautiful park and luscious Sunday farmer's market.
space: The house is fully equipped with all you might need for some time away from home. We love cooking, so our kitchen is excellently equipped for this. Our sofa can be pulled out which is ideal for some relaxing in the evening, watching Netflix, or it can be used as an extra bed.

description: AMAZING LOCATION IN CENTRAL LONDON! The room is small but very comfortable. Conveniently located in central London near Kings Cross/St Pancras station with Eurostar and direct access to all London Airports! You will have your own bedroom ideal for up to 2adults. Ideal for a short break in Town whether it is for business, leisure or commuting! Please note NO ACCESS TO KICHEN OR LOUNGE. Tiny but Comfortable Double bedroom in a 1 beroom flat.  Ideal for commuters, tourists or professional on a short break in town. Located in Central London Zone1 Bathroom is shared with a the host.  Lovely Power Shower, always hot water Please note there is No access to kitchen or Lounge as it is our living area.  Room is suitable for Up to 2 adults Free high speed Wifi  Free Tea/Coffee in the room (kettle) Located 1 minutes away from King's Cross/St. Pancras Station.  10min to most tourist attractions 1min walk King's Cross St Pancras Station 2min walk to Eurostar terminal 5min walk to the British Library
neighborhood_overview: There are always people around at all time it is very safe. Buses are running 24/7 so whatever time it is you can always get home! There is everything nearby restaurants, bank, gym, canal for nice walks, bars, cinemas you name it we have it !
transit: Kings cross St Pancras is the number 1 transport Hub in London with 7 underground Lines, 2 trains stations and many day and night buses. Trains with destinations all over the UK but also the Eurostar to Paris Easy access to anywhere in London Direct trains to Gatwick and Luton airports in less than an hour. Direct underground to Heathrow airport in 45min Direct bus from St Pancras to Stansted airport 1hour15min Near Euston Station
access: Most of the time there will be someone to welcome you in person. If not self check-in instructions will be provided. You will be given your own key on arrival and you can come and go as you wish Free Powerful Wifi Laundry Service may be available for an extra charge. Shared Bathroom (we are very clean people and we ask our guests to leave the bathroom as they found it please :) Quiet room Confortable Bed Desk&Chair
interaction: I am a very quiet person but I am always available via airbnb or text or call and in person if I am around!

name: Stylish 2bed 2bath w/ Tasteful Decor & Canal Views
summary: Wonderful and modern flat with quirky artworks and plenty of books to devour and CD to listen to. With its sun-facing windows walls and balcony, you can enjoy plenty of light and views over the lovely canal. It is located in a bustling area of London with plenty of things to explore and conveniently situated next to transport links. Come in and enjoy!
space: The flat is situated on the 2nd floor of a modern building with lift. The building is built along the canal and the flat balcony is south facing to enjoy lots of light and warmth.  The master bedroom offers an en-suite shower room and a comfortable double bed with bay windows over the canal and communicates to the living-room through the balcony where you will find sofas and dining area. The kitchen is fully equipped with appliances, crockery, spices, Nespresso machine, etc. The second bedroom has a single bed and chest of drawers and the main bathroom offers bathtub and toilet. A 4th extra guest can be accommodated on the sofa bed. You will enjoy the decoration and the feel throughout the flat. If you are into books, you will definitely find something for you in there! A projector can be used as TV through an HDMI plug on your laptop.  We provide clean towels and fresh linen, with high speed WiFi!

neighborhood_overview: Very cool hip areas where you can enjoy London life in all its diversity, with Hoxton, Shoreditch, Islington and De Beauvoir Town as close neighbours, the City within easy reach, and excellent new transport links from Haggerston station.
notes: If there is a check out in the morning, you will only be able to check in between 2pm and 3pm. No microwave
transit: You are in the buzzing De Beauvoir Town area. Few minutes away from Shoreditch and Liverpool Street. Plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, Broadway Market, cafe's terraces along the canal, etc. A Tesco to buy some food is only 3 min walking distance. You can enjoy a walk by the canal and discover this amazing area full of small hidden gems.
access: You will have access to the whole flat except from one room which will be locked and not listed above.
interaction: You can call or email us anytime if you have questions.
house_rules: Please respect our neighbours by keeping noise to a minimum, this also means that we don't allow parties. Also, smoking and pets are forbidden in our home.  A fine of £100 will be taking out of the deposit if guests are not considerate enough and we receive some noise complaints. We ask you to please take off your shoes when you are in the flat as there are wooden floors.
host_about:
We all love Airbnb! But being a host can be a full time job if you want to do it properly, so we are here to help you!

Our services are aimed at landlords who don't have the time to list and manage their property and those who don't live in London and have properties they want to rent out but can't physically manage them… We take care of the checkin, checkout (24/7, anytime during day and night time), of the emergency calls, cleaning, laundry and we answer all the guests' requests very quickly.

We also provide many services to the guests such as booking a cab or a restaurant, helping them with directions, reassuring the ones who never booked through Airbnb, … We also provide services to our clients (we can send your mail, collect your deliveries, ...). Visit our website GuestReady to know more about us!

We would love to help you, please contact us if you have any questions!

Guest Ready Team

name: Spacious 2Bed in Clapham 8mins to tube w/ Terrace
summary: Welcome to my home! My beautiful 2 bedroom apartment, in the vibrant area of Clapham, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re just a 8-minute walk away from Clapham North tube. My home has a fantastic terrace which is the ideal place to hang out during summer.  You’re also within walking distance of two gorgeous parks, Clapham Common and Battersea Park.  Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: My stylish 2 bedroom apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Clapham and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and airy with a beautiful, modern design and lovely finishing touches. There are two comfy sofas and and an amazing armchair to relax on. Hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. The larger sofa also opens up into a double bed. If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the stylish kitchen. All the appliances are modern and easy to use - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! Pull out the folding dining table and enjoy a meal. There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones.  The master bedroom has a super comfortable double bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you

You’re also within walking distance of two gorgeous parks, Clapham Common and Battersea Park.  Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London.  I hope you enjoy your stay!
