Hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can k
neighborhood_overview: You are in between two great neighbourhoods! Clapham Old Town to the West is a small pocket of nearby Clapham Common - itself only about a 20 minute walk away - it has a lovely village feel to it with a treasure trove of pubs and restaurants to try! The Sun is a popular pub; enjoy the garden in the summer with a jug of Pimms, and even in the colder months, when they have heaters outside. The Prince of Wales is an unpretentious British pub which fills up quickly after work. The restaurants around here won’t disappoint either. Trinity is a Michelin-starred restaurant without sky-high prices. You’ll need to book, but it is definitely worth checking out if you can.  Mama Lan is a no-frills Chinese cafe where they only take cash and the dumplings are delicious. You are only a 10 minute walk from Stockwell tube and it’s an area worth exploring.  The Crown and Anchor is a bustling pub in between Stockwell and Brixton.  Mommi is a 12 minute walk from Stockwell tube station and is an interestin
transit: Clapham North station is the nearest station to the property, just a 9 minute walk away. This connects you to the Northern line, meaning you can get to iconic London sites in no time at all, such as Leicester Square, Trafalgar Square, and other vibrant areas such as Old Street and Kings Cross. There are also plenty of buses that will take you all over the city. They stop on Wandsworth Road, a 1 minute walk away. Exploring London could hardly be easier!
access: Guests have access to the entire place!
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-lets management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.
house_rules: Guests must show ID upon check-in
host_about: Originally from India but now a long time resident of London for many years. Worked in finance and now working on my own business. Love Airbnb!

About 10mins walk to the train station. 15mins by train from the station into the city (London Bridge). Buses to Lewisham from bus station less than 5mins walk. Buses to North Greenwich and the O2 in about 10mins There are loads of Take aways, caffes, post office, pure gym, and  cooperative store at walking distance from the house.

name: A nice place in the heart of Wembley
summary: Imperial Court - Empire Way  is a premium place at the heart of Wembley. No more than 5 minutes walking to the iconic Wembley Stadium and SSE Arena (former Wembley Arena) and 3 minutes walking to the LDO - London Desing Outlet where you find more than 20 restaurants, more than 30 branded shops, a cinema, many bars and cafes. As been so close to the iconic Wembley Stadium, and also by the Empire Way some noising is likely during night time.
space: My wife and I are a mature couple living in a 2 bedroom apartament. name: Private outdoors, conservatory, easy London links!
summary: Enjoy your stay in the guest bedroom of our charming flat. It is perfectly located next to the Fulham Broadway tube stop w/ easy links to central London. Surrounding neighborhoods of Parsons Green, Chelsea, and Fulham are lively with many restaurants, cafes, bars and parks to enjoy.  The flat itself is on a quiet & safe, tree lined street away from the noise. Our conservatory is bright and private garden is perfect to relax or work in. Please make yourself at home in our lovely flat =)
space: Conveniently located next to the Fulham Broadway tube station on the District Line as well as multiple bus stops, going in and out of central London is quick and easy. Our guest bedroom is cozy and perfect for couples. It is connected to the conservatory and garden.  Provided with your stay is towels, shampoo, conditioner and soap, as well as coffee and tea in the kitchen.

You will have shared full access of the whole flat - kitchen, dining area, living room, TV (including Netflix & Amazon Prime), conser
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood of Fulham is situated in southwest London and has a great local feel of London. It is full of nice restaurants, shops, pubs and parks and not too many tourists.  It takes about 30 minutes on the tube or on the bus to get to the London city centre. Also, our flat is just minutes away from Stamford Bridge Stadium, home of the Chelsea Football Club.
notes: Check-in time is flexible and check-out is at 12pm. Also, this is a garden level flat so the entrance is down at the basement level. You will have to walk down a set of steep stairs to enter the flat.
transit: Located a few minutes walk to the Fulham Broadway tube station on the District Line as well as numerous bus stops. Going in and out of central London usually takes only 30 minutes.
access: You will have shared full access of the whole flat - kitchen, dining area, living room, TV (including Netflix & Amazon Prime), conservatory, and garden - basically everything but our bedroom.  You will also have your own private bathroom (shower room with sink), however the toilet room is shared. We have our own shower in our bedroom.
interaction: My husband and I both have flexible schedules for work so we will be in and out of the flat at random. We’re usually not home, but when we are we will be in the other bedroom, in the living room or occasionally using the kitchen. We are always open to socialising or giving you your own space! Also, we’ll gladly help you with recommendations should you have any.
house_rules: -Please keep noise level down at 11pm especially if outside in garden as it is city ordinance -Please smoke outside in the garden only -No additional guests please -Please clean up after yourselves :)
host_about: In 2015, my husband Ryan and I moved from Chicago to the UK and are currently loving life in London.

name: Bright + Sunny Top Floor Loft Warehouse Conversion
summary: The top floor of a converted warehouse, our open and bright flat is full of views, mid-century modern furnishings, and 2 mezzanine bedrooms.  In the heart of lively and thriving Hackney, it's only steps from London Fields, Broadway Market, Regent’s Canal, and Victoria Park. With excellent transport across London withing walking and many things to do and see on your doorstep - our home is the perfect place for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers looking for an adventure in London!
space: Our building was formerly a 1920's clothing factory that has been converted into dramatic living spaces. A double height window dominates the flat, flooding all rooms with morning light, with views all the way to Canary Wharf and the Olympic Stadium. The main living space is open plan, with a trendy dining room and comfortable seating area, and kitchen tucked neatly under the bedrooms. Upstairs the bedrooms look over the living space, and our cleaners place fresh, hotel-quality linen on the beds before your arrival. The bathroom, like the rest of the flat, has been beautifully finished to an impeccable standard - with luxury touches throughout, we love living here and hope you enjoy your stay here!
description: The top floor of a converted warehouse, our open and bright flat is full of views, mid-century modern furnishings, and 2 mezzanine bedrooms.  In the heart of lively and thriving Hackney, it's only steps from London Fields, Broadway Market, Regent’s Canal, and Victoria Park. With excellent transport across London withing walking and many things to do and see on your doorstep - our home is the perfect place for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers looking for an adventure in London! Our building was formerly a 1920's clothing factory that has been converted into dramatic living spaces. A double height window dominates the flat, flooding all rooms with morning light, with views all the way to Canary Wharf and the Olympic Stadium. The main living space is open plan, with a trendy dining room and comfortable seating area, and kitchen tucked neatly under the bedrooms. Upstairs the bedrooms look over the living space, and our cleaners place fresh, hotel-quality linen on the beds
neighborhood_overview: Hackney is also known as 'Hipster Hackney' - along with Shoreditch it has been one of THE up and coming neighborhoods in the East of the city for the last few years. It was for many years one of London's poorest boroughs and has a diverse range of people from all over the world living within its borders. In the last few years, house prices have rocketed and it's now the home of writers, pop stars, artists, photographers, stylists and florists and any other creative niche you can think of. Food, drink, and bars, are great here, as is nightlife and special interest evenings of all sorts. Cycling to and from the city is popular and an edgy community spirit remains. Nearby attractions include the Broadway Market the music hall Hackney Empire, and the London Fields Brewery, as well as green spaces like London Fields park, and Victoria Park. Attractions like the Southbank (London eye/London Aquarium), Houses of Parliament, Tower Bridge, The London Dungeons, and the West End are also very eas
notes: Check-in time is usually after 3pm and check-out time is usually before 11am. If you would like to arrive or leave at a different time, please let us know and we will try our best to accommodate. Please note that you will be charged £100 for lost keys, so please be careful with them. Sofa bed/Air mattress will not be made up on your arrival unless specified in advance.
transit: You can take trains from London Fields station (Overground line - Orange) or take one of the many well-connected bus routes serving the area, many of which run 24hours. The London Eye: 40 minutes by bus and tube The Tower of London: 40 minutes by bus and tube National Gallery: 40 minutes by bus and tube Kings Cross: 30 minutes by overground and bus/tube Heathrow Airport: 70 minutes by tube and train Gatwick Airport: 80 minutes by tube and train
access: Guests will have access to the entire property during their stay.
interaction: Myself and my property management team will be available 24/7 via Airbnb, email, or phone to provide any assistance you may need.
house_rules: - No smoking - No parties - No extra guests - Please respect the neighbours and keep the noise down - No noise after 10pm  - Indoor shoes/slippers preferred - Treat the flat as if it were your own
host_about:
I have called Boston, Scotland, Botswana, New York, Portland and plenty of other places home over the last 10 years and loved every stop off in between. Exploring and living life all over the world is a passion and one I am lucky enough to also be able to do for work. Whether on the road or at home with friends and family, I love amazing food, good company, running to get lost, and simply exploring the unexplored.  

Just incase your looking for a little more info:

I love food, dancing a bit of salsa every now and then and playing my guitar. Have an engineering major and an economics minor - studied in University of Michigan, Ann Arbor.

We know each other for over 6 years and are great friends. While we are housemates, one or more of us are always on the go for work or vacations, so we have one bedroom free from time to time and are happy to host and meet new people in this way.

name: Brixton! I Only 40 seconds from Tube!
summary: Brixton is undoubtedly one of the most vibrant parts of London these days. It is also (which is also why I wanted to live here) one of the best connected. With Victoria line  literally 40 secs from my house I have 11 mins to Victoria station, 14 to Oxford circus, and with northern line 20 mins to Shoreditch. You can't beat that. I am also lucky to have the sunniest, brightest, highest ceiling apartment you can imagine! So if you are into street life, culture, food and music - this is the place !
space: A generous three bedroom "loft" apartment, with the large living room having three huge southern exposure windows. The lightest and brightest London will ever get! A very cozy hidden, quiet bedroom in the back with a few stairs down. A second bedroom to the right as you come in and a possible third in the main room with a large modern convertible double bed couch. Perfect if you for instance are two couples with kids and you all need some privacy from each other.  Electric Avenue is a day market, mostly fruit, clothes, spices and some meat/fish shops. Never gets loud but very cozy to wake up to (no cars, just the market stalls setting up)
description: Brixton is undoubtedly one of the most vibrant parts of London these days. It is also (which is also why I wanted to live here) one of the best connected. With Victoria line  literally 40 secs from my house I have 11 mins to Victoria station, 14 to Oxford circus, and with northern line 20 mins to Shoreditch. You can't beat that. I am also lucky to have the sunniest, brightest, highest ceiling apartment you can imagine! So if you are into street life, culture, food and music - this is the place ! A generous three bedroom "loft" apartment, with the large living room having three huge southern exposure windows. The lightest and brightest London will ever get! A very cozy hidden, quiet bedroom in the back with a few stairs down. A second bedroom to the right as you come in and a possible third in the main room with a large modern convertible double bed couch. Perfect if you for instance are two couples with kids and you all need some privacy from each other.  Electric Avenue is a day marke
neighborhood_overview: Brixton kind of speaks for itself these days. The food, the music and the street life is like nowhere else. The recent daily sing-a-longs for our local hero David Bowie in front of the mural is only the latest addition to an ever more exciting part of the city.
notes: It's important to know that the apartment is in a market area that is being set up early in the morning. There is completely silence in the back of the apartment and in the small bedroom too,  but if you are the person sleeping towards Electric avenue and perhaps normally sleep in a completely silent environment this may bother you. The apartment is also located above a meat shop that also sells frozen fish. If you are over sensitive to the smell of fish and other market related stuff, you may not enjoy this apartment.  I have had very few guests, out of many many happy ones, complain about this during the three years I have rented my Brixton home  - but think it should be said anyway. I have a good, organic system for air purification in the apartment that works very well.
transit: The apartment is literally around the corner of the Brixton tube station (best line- Victoria) with 11 minutes to Victoria station (which is great if you go/come from Gatwick for instance.  15 mins max to Oxford Circus. But also a hundred or so (it seems) buses right across the street from tube, to where you can go, well almost anywhere.
access: The entire apartment is for your use.
interaction: Welcome to instant book but make sure you read everything in the listing including other things to note and house rules as well ! I am available most of the 24 hours to take your call, sms or messenger. If you see my reviews you hopefully can see that I am attentive to any of your needs, give tips on where to go eat or drink or anything at all!
host_about: Hi, I am a filmmaker living in London and Bangkok. i work mostly with feature films as director and documentaries. Right now I have also started production on a feature film to be shot in Thailand, called "The Letting Go". Aside form that I do mostly documentaries.

name: Irresistable Notting Hill Studio
summary: This beautiful and bright studio is on the first floor of a classic townhouse, in the heart of Notting Hill, which is split in to self contained studios. This studio has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in an immaculate and temporary style with white walls, and a wooden floor. It has a stunning bay window which lets the light flood in. It has a TV and wifi.
space: The studio is self-contained, you have your own bathroom and kitchen.  The bed is of double sized and all linen and towels are provided. If you are looking for a pied-a-terre, an overnight stop off or a London hide-away, this is the place for you! To the rear of the building there is communal courtyard.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is perfectly sandwiched between Westbourne Grove, Notting Hill Gate, with Holland Park and Kensington a short walk away.  You can reach all the local beautiful open spaces on foot; Kensington Palace, Hyde Park and Holland Park.  Notting Hill Gate, Portobello Road, Westbourne Grove and Kensington Church Street are full to bursting point with cool bars, traditional pubs and fantastic restaurants.
notes: The keys are to be collected from a lockbox by the front door of the building. The washer/dryer is communal and situated in the basement of the building.  There are hours within which it cannot be used, these are clearly signed on the door.
transit: You have a choice of buses that link you to Central  London in just a few minutes.  Notting Hill Gate tube station is a 4-5 minute walk or you can stroll down to High Street Kensington station in 10-12 minutes.  Black cabs and Ubers are very easy to find and much of the local shopping and sightseeing is easily done on foot.
access: During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you.
interaction: We all live and work locally which helps when it comes to advice and recommendations! :-)
host_about:
My wife and I decided to start using Airbnb to rent out our serviced apartments, it's a much nicer community than the usual holiday booking sites!  We have 21 studios in our building and we encourage a family vibe with communal break-out spaces, on site cleaner and handyman whom you'll no doubt meet when you check-in.

Billie and I are based locally and are on hand if you have questions, and can always be reached by phone or e-mail.   We also have two amazing team members called Joanna and Anna (funny enough) who helps us organise the building. 

We look forward to welcoming you to London!

name: Live like a Londoner! Cosy FamilyHouse with Garden
summary: Semi detached house in a residential area. 10 minutes walk to train station New Eltham, with regular trains to London Bridge & Charing Cross for sightseeing. House is fully refurbished, kitchen fitted with all necessary equipment. Large terrace, with garden, outdoor space and BBQ grill. Hot tub nestled in the corner of the garden. Supermarket (Sainsbury’s) and Eltham High Street with lots of shops & restaurants is just 3 minutes drive, or 15 minuets walk away. Close to ElthamPalace&BrandsHatch.
space: Guests can use the entire house except the small office room in the first floor, which is locked. Parking space for 2 cars in front of the house, 2 folding parking posts secure your cars. Please ask our co host for the keys if you wish to use the parking posts (most guests don’t use them). Ground floor: Porch, entrance hall, living room, dining room, kitchen, garden. First floor: main bath room with walk-in shower, whirl bath, and toilet. Master bedroom with water bed and second bedroom with air mattress. Second floor: Loft, large room with French doors and modern bathroom with walk-in shower. Pull out sofa bed sleeps 2 (1,40m wide). Garden: a wooden floor terrace leading to the lawn. Hot Tub: Pre-bookings only. In the left corner of the garden is a not (!) heated HotTub tub for 6 people available. If you like us to heat the HotTub before you arrive, please let us know. There is a charge of £10 per day for the HotTub heating. Linen and towels will be provided, cleaning can be arranged

neighborhood_overview: It is a very nice Residential area. The house is located opposite a huge park, and football pitches. We are very close to our neighbor, a lovely old lady living on her own. Her name is Hazel. If you see her, say hello. We feel very sad  ‘leaving’ her for a few month.
notes: We have been living in this house for 11 years and thoroughly enjoyed it. We are now semi retired and spend the summer in Southern Europe. We have decided renting out our home to nice people, who would like to enjoy and discover one of the greatest cities in the world: London.  We have a small dog, a “West Highland Terrier” who is living with us. You won’t find any dog hair or dirt, but his favourite place is on the top of the sofa in the living room. He loves starring out of the window, and barks at all dogs walking along. You’ll find that the top part of the sofa looks more used then the other side, and that’s why.
transit: New Eltham is a residential area in south east London, borough of Greenwich. Closest train station is New Eltham (NEH) which is travel zone 4. Regular trains going to London Bridge (for Tower Bridge) and Charing Cross (for the Westend Oxford Street). 2 car parking spaces are in front of the house.  A bus stop is opposite, towards Eltham High Street or New Eltham Train Station. BUS STOPS AND TIMETABLES Opposite the house.  (Website hidden by Airbnb)      CAB / TAXI Taxi All Day Cars, located at New Eltham train station Ph (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)    TRAIN STATIONS AND TIMETABLES New Eltham Train Station South Eastern Trains  (Website hidden by Airbnb)  AIRPORT Nearest Airport London City Airport  (Website hidden by Airbnb)    London Gatwick (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Stansted (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Heathrow (Website hidden by Airbnb)
access: Guests use the entire house and garden.
interaction: A co-host is looking after the guests and is available.
house_rules: Check-in is at 3pm, and check-out is by 11am. Arriving earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? Should be fine, but please check with us first. Whilst we do a thorough professional clean between each guest stay, we kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used and put any dirty towels in the hamper. It helps us get through our cleaning process quicker and allows us to keep cleaning costs down for you and future guests. We understand that accidents happen. But we do ask that you please let us know when they do. Chances are we can fix them as effortlessly as possible which also means better chances of having your full security deposit returned too. Being a family home, we also have a no smoking policy (although you are welcome to smoke in the garden). If you’re coming to London to party you’ve picked a great city to do so. Unfortunately, just not at our place. Though we’re sure it won’t come to it, serious complaints of unruly behavior will unf
host_about:
I am soon turning 50, having worked in Marketing Communication for almost 30 years (yes, it has changed a lot!) and aiming now to take time off and travel. I have been a world traveller all my life. I always enjoyed exploring foreign countries, and meeting different people. To help me pay for my adventures, I have listed my London house on AirBnB. 
Born and raised in Germany, I have been living and enjoying London since 2003. Please feel free to contact me in English or German, happy to answer all your questions. 
Thank you very much for checking out my place, and I hope to talk to you very soon.

name: Simple room with Double bed and desk
summary: The room is a very simple and small double room-if you are looking for a cheap place to stay in central London, this is it!  It is small and simple, and great for just sleeping. This is NOT a luxury flat but the location is great, within a 2 minute walk from both the DLR and Overground. It is important to know this is my own personal bedroom, which I use every day, and only Airbnb for when I'm away.  This is a house shared with housemates, so people will be in and out but won't bother you.
space: The bedroom has just a double bed and desk. There is a closet but it will be locked since I keep my personal items in there (since this is my actual regular bedroom, not a room used only for Airbnb guests), so there will not be access to the closet. However, you will have access to a set of clothes hangers at the back of the bedroom door.

neighborhood_overview: Neatly tucked away between the wealth of Marylebone, the edgy energy of Soho and the grandeur of Bloomsbury, Fitzrovia is peaceful and attractive, home to small media organisations, small pubs and small restaurants and a smattering of decent hotels.  Wide streets lined with tall buildings in Victorian brick mingle with cosy side alleys, with a variety of architectural styles from the eighteenth century to the present day, all of it dominated by the BT Tower, one of London's tallest and most iconic buildings. Tottenham Court Road is the major shopping street and the best place in London to look for home furnishings and electronic goods. The area around Oxford Street mixes well high street shops with pubs and bars catching the overflow from Soho's nightlife. Charlotte Street is a street in Fitzrovia. host_about:
Here some basic information about your host.
I have been dedicating myself as an Airbnb host  for the last 4 years, and from being an hobby it became a profession but with the same passion of the beginning: The passion to deliver an experience that would guests feel like they have the comfort of their  own home while on holiday or away from it  . 

I have hosted all type of guest, professional in London for business  purposes, single travellers, whole family with kids, couple on romantic escapes.
Reading through my reviews I believe guests describe me mainly as attentive and very responsive.
I like to make my guests comfortable to ask me any question or anything they might need during their stay. I also like make that extra mile in order  to meeting their expectations.

I like to live in a tidy, clean and comfy space and I get along better with people that Likes the same.

I also believe in treating people like I would like to be treated.

There are some beautiful parks in the area, such as Queen's Park and Paddington Recreation Ground, where there are sports facilities. In the Queen's Park area there are Pubs and Coffee shops and an artisan bakery. Between Queen's Park Tube station and Malvern Road, is a lovely, new M&S Food store open until late. host_about: I am an enthusiastic, mature woman. I currently live at home on my own as my daughter has flown the nest. I love to meet adventurous people and this is why Airbnb is so ideal. I am interested in the latest music trends, mainly Latin and Salsa. I used to sing in a pop group in my younger days. I recently went to Salvador in Brazil, where I made some great friends. I love to watch football too. I am also interested in psychology and physical well-being. I love films such as Rocky. I enjoy playing Scrabble I love to sample different styles of cooking, particularly with vegetables. I enjoy learning and listening to people, which enriches my life. I enjoy hosting very much.

host_about:
I moved to London to follow my love who is a Londoner, I have a 4 years old daughter and two cats. we live in a beautiful house surrounded by parks and trees in Muswell Hill.

The Airbnb experience has been very positive and from that experience I set up a company called HelloGuest to provide excellent hassle-free Airbnb management services for short stay rental properties in London advertised on Airbnb.

Our services cover everything from full property management (guest communication, check-in & out, cleaning & laundry, manage the listing, 24/7 support service, etc) to partly managed or individual services depending on your needs.

Our aim is to provide professional services for high quality properties to deliver an excellent guest experience.

We are here to help, so please get in touch with any questions you have.

name: Beautiful apartment close to everything!!
summary: Our flat is spacey and well laid out. It has two double bedrooms both providing access to a private patio and benefiting from fitted wardrobes. The master bedroom boasts a lovely modern shower room. There is a second modern bathroom. The living room is also very spacious and features a wall hung flat screen tv. The kitchen is modern and well equipped with fridge freezer, electric hob and oven and dishwasher. There is a useful utility area with washing machine and dryer.
space: The flat is in lovely condition, well equipped and modern.
description: Our flat is spacey and well laid out. It has two double bedrooms both providing access to a private patio and benefiting from fitted wardrobes. The master bedroom boasts a lovely modern shower room. There is a second modern bathroom. The living room is also very spacious and features a wall hung flat screen tv. The kitchen is modern and well equipped with fridge freezer, electric hob and oven and dishwasher. There is a useful utility area with washing machine and dryer. The flat is in lovely condition, well equipped and modern. The entire flat and private patio. Guests will be left alone but I live within half an hour and will always make myself available to help. The location is one of extreme convenience. A 3 minute walk to Paddington Station, Lancaster Gate tube and Hyde Park. There are plenty of super markets and convenience stores close by. Various tube and train lines are minutes away plus bus rides also.

name: Modern, Luxurious 1BR Flat- Heart of Covent Garden
summary: This fantastic flat is located just off The Strand in Covent Garden. It has an open plan living area with modern appliances, a stylish bedroom, and a spacious bathroom.  There is brand new furniture throughout, including a very comfortable sofa bed.  The central location means you are within walking distance of major tourist attractions. This flat is perfect for a couple or small group of friends looking to be in a prime London location to enjoy everything this city has to offer!
space: This modern flat is located in an attractive building just off The Strand in Covent Garden. It is a short walk from Charing Cross station and Covent Garden tube station. It is beautifully decorated and fitted with modern appliances and fixtures throughout.  All the furniture is brand new. The apartments in this building have recently been fully refurbished and as such you will be getting an incredibly luxurious experience while being able to stay in the heart of London!  Please note: if you are a group of 4 the space will be a bit tight as there is 1 bedroom and 1 double-sized (but extremely comfortable) sofa bed in the living room.  There is only wardrobe space in the bedroom. BEDROOM AND BATHROOM The bedroom contains a comfortable double bed and one medium sized empty wardrobe with hangers for your things.  The bed will be made up for every guest using hotel quality linen.  The beautiful modern bathroom is brand new and has a large walk-in shower with rainfall showerhead. Large fluff

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is hugely popular with both locals and tourists. There are so many things to see and do right on your doorstep that you will be spoiled for choice!  For example, the flat is a stone’s throw away from numerous theatres to go and watch a show or the ballet at the Royal Opera House. You’re also within walking distance to the famous Savoy Hotel, which is known as one of the best places to have traditional English Afternoon Tea.  The flat is also within walking distance to a number of London’s major tourist attractions. This includes around a 15 minute walk to the London Eye, the Houses of Parliament and Westminster Bridge. The fantastic transport links close by also makes it very easy to get to different parts of London in a short period of time.  So if you are looking for a central flat with easy access to major tourist attractions this is the place for you!  Being located in Covent Garden also means you are spoilt for choice regarding bars, restaurants and cafes to choo
notes: Please note that last-minute reservations being made within 24 hours from the arrival date are subject to a change in check-in time of 6 P.M instead of 3 P.M.  The property will only accept the number of adults booked as per the booking confirmation. Any additional guests not confirmed on the booking will not be accepted. Each guest will be asked to present a form of identification once the reservation has been created and upon check-in.  This property will not accommodate hen, stag or similar parties. This property is located in a residential area and guests are asked to refrain from excessive noise. Guests must leave the property in the same state as when they checked-in. Should the above policies are not respected, a penalty fee would therefore apply to the guest(s) for any damages caused to the property.  House Rules: We hope you enjoy the apartment as much as possible. Please keep the place clean and do not break anything. The property will only accept the number of adults booked
transit: This flat is in a fantastic location for transport links. It is located within a 5 minute walk from both Covent Garden tube station and Charing Cross Station. Covent Garden is on the Piccadilly line and Charing Cross is on the Northern line and has national rail service if you fancy heading out of London for the day. The flat is also a 7 minute walk to Embankment, which is located on the River Thames, where you can also catch a river boat to see London from a different vantage point.
access: You will have access to the whole property.  Linen, bed sheets, body lotion and shampoo will be provided.
interaction: My friends at City Relay are looking after my home while I am away. They're a management service team of Londoners who are hosts themselves. I trust them to give you a warm welcome! City Relay will look after you.  We would like to mention the 3 methods for check-in:  1. You can meet us at our Central London Reception Desk in Earl's Court - next to Earl's Court Underground Station where we will provide a folder with all flat instructions, how to get there, tube maps, etc. and the keys to your apartment (The reception desk is open every day from 9am until 9pm).  2. You can book a Car Service through us. In this case, the driver will have the keys to your booked apartment and will take you there directly  3. We can arrange a check-in in-person at the flat. For a check-in after 8pm, a fee of £50 is applicable. Please let us know the most convenient way for you to do your check-in, so we can make your first day in London a good start!
house_rules: Please note our house rules:  -All guests are required to present their passport or drivers license in person as part of the check in process -There must be at least one adult over the age of 21 in your group -You may not have the majority of people in your group under the age of 21 As you may be aware, London has a 90 day policy on Short Term Holiday Lets.  In order to allow me to continue sharing my home with guests like yourself, sometimes I allow people to rent my property for longer periods at certain times of the year.  This means that from time to time, people ask to view the property in advance.  Although this is rare, if you do make a booking with me (and I’d love for you to stay!), please bear in mind that a viewing may take place, but I promise to let you know and it will be very short!

name: Lovely 3 Bed Flat in Clapton With Secret Garden
summary: My Clapton flat is a spacious and relaxing base from which to discover London and the local area. There are beautiful wooden floors throughout, comfortable and clean furnishings, and a well-equipped kitchen. Clapton is a fantastic and vibrant area, very hip, and with lots of places to eat and drink. The flat is in an enviable position overlooking Clapton Pond. Guests from all backgrounds are welcome in this lovely home.
space: The apartment is on the first floor and has high ceilings and big windows, making the flat light and very spacious. The apartment is equipped with everything you need for a great stay in London, including wifi, television, dishwasher and heating. Gorgeous wooden flooring has been fitted throughout. The rooms are on two levels with the kitchen and bathroom and main bedroom at the back, overlooking the lovely gardens, and the living room and second bedroom at the front, overlooking Clapton Pond park. A short flight of stairs separates the two levels but these aren't particularly steep and there is a hand rail. The main bedroom is spacious and has a roomy double bed. In the second smaller bedroom, the bed is a petite double, cosy for two, roomy for one. The sofa bed in the living room is also a good-sized and comfortable double.  There is a sunny balcony directly out of the back door with steps down to the garden - a nice, private space with table and chairs. These steps aren't very steep

There are beautiful wooden floors throughout, comfortable and clean furnishings, and a well-equipped kitchen. Clapton is a fantastic and vibrant area, very hip, and with lots of places to eat and drink. The flat is in an enviable position overlooking Clapton Pond. Guests from all backgrounds are welcome in this lovely home. The apartment is on the first floor and has high ceilings and big windows, making the flat light and very spacious. The apartment is equipped with everything you need for a great stay in London, including wifi, television, dishwasher and heating. Gorgeous wooden flooring has been fitted throughout. The rooms are on two levels with the kitchen and bathroom and main bedroom at the back, overlooking the lovely gardens, and the living room and second bedroom at the front, overlooking Clapton Pond park. A short flight of stairs separates the two levels but these aren't parti
neighborhood_overview: Clapton is now considered one of the best places to live in London. Within one minute of the flat you will find The Clapton Hart and The Mermaid, two great bars that serve fantastic food. The Mermaid has a wide selection of craft beers and outside space. The Clapton Hart has a beer garden, good food and DJ nights. It's worth also visiting the other hotspots along Lower Clapton Road including My Neighbours the Dumplings, with its basement Sake bar, and Bonneville's restaurant, which serves delicious French food. Close at hand in Hackney you'll find Tonkotsu and Lardo, both excellent restaurants. For tasty and imaginative breakfasts, try the very special Café Miami on Lower Clapton Road. You can stroll along the River Lea and visit Springfield Park, or head down to London Fields or Victoria Park, or walk along the canal from Broadway Market all the way to Islington and the Angel. Stoke Newington is a 20-minute walk away, and it's worth visiting for lovely bars, coffee shops and restauran
notes: This is a fantastic and beautiful flat in one of the most desirable areas of modern London. The front of the house overlooks Clapton Pond and guests will be within easy reach of all the hippest bars and restaurants in Hackney, Hoxton and Shoreditch, as well as close to transport links for central London.
transit: Clapton Overground Station is just a 5 minute walk away, making it easy to get to all the best parts of London! Best way into central London is to hop on the 56 bus to Dalston Junction, take the overground (two stops) to Highbury and Islington and then get the Victoria Line direct into town. On a good day, I've done this journey in 30 minutes, though at busy times it can take longer. The most scenic route into town is to take the 38 or 55 bus both of which will take you through some lovely parts of London and it's well worth the extra time to do this if you're visiting. Remember to sit upstairs at the front if possible! Stoke Newington, Hackney, London Fields, Broadway Market and Old Street are all walkable from the flat. If you have a car, I'd advise you to park it somewhere and grab public transport: in London, this is a much better way to get about.
access: You can use all areas of my home, including the garden. The only shared area of the house is the communal hall which is used by the other two owners in the building but they are very quiet and rarely seen! Please be aware that the apartment has wooden flooring and we have neighbours living below. I'd be grateful if you could remove your shoes indoors to avoid causing too much noise. Also, be aware that the balcony and metal staircase at the back of the building are close to the neighbours' bedroom and loud conversations out there after 10pm might disturb their sleep. Thank you.
interaction: We will be contactable by email or telephone during your stay to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: - Please treat the home as you would your own - Please respect the neighbours, and so not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm - No parties - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, a £50 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a £80 fee will apply.  - Please leave the spare key in the specified location, otherwise you will be charged. - Please make sure you close all windows and lock outside doors when leaving the property for any significant amount of time.
host_about: I'm Jane. I work in the publishing industry and, luckily, I love reading. I'm also a big fan of cinema and long-form TV drama. I can't live without my iPad, laptop, books, and notebooks. Interior design is also a love of mine and I'm always looking for quirky vintage things to add to my collection of furniture. I tend to share my time between my homes in Hastings and London and so am able to rent out my flat in Clapton when I'm not around. My life's motto is: if there is no wind, row - and I tend to do a lot of rowing!

name: Double Room, ensuite overlooking river
summary: My place overlooks the River Thames. You’ll love my place because its in a wonderful part of London with easy access to Central by train or tube.  The leafy borough of Richmond has many historic places to visit and wonderful shops and restaurants.  Its a great place to base yourself when visiting London.    Although we don't provide breakfast there are many lovely places close by and you're welcome to a cup of tea or coffee in the morning either from the kitchen or kettle in the room on request.

name: Sunny, spacious room in beautiful family house
summary: 'Bed and breakfast' in a family home in an exceptionally quiet street just a 5 min walk from Finsbury Park train & underground station (Victoria & Piccadilly line) & 20 mins to the very centre of town.  (The Victoria line stops at Oxford Circus & the British Library & the Piccadilly line at Covent Garden & the British Museum.)  We provide breakfast every morning, tea, coffee & biscuits in your room &, for your other meals, there are umpteen places to eat just around the corner.
space: The room A beautiful sunny room with a large, comfortable double bed, a chest of drawers, lots of hanging space, a desk and an armchair. An extra single guest bed can be made up for a child (or for friends who’d rather not share the double). There’s also a kettle, capsule coffee machine, a selection of teas,  hot chocolate and biscuits. Fresh milk is available from the kitchen. Wi-fi is free of charge – the code is on a card in the room.  Bathrooms Both bathrooms are shared with other guests. Towels, soap, shampoo etc are provided; should you have forgotten any necessities, feel free to ask – plus there are plenty of shops nearby (several with late night opening). Breakfast We provide breakfast in our kitchen/dining room from 7.30 - 9.30am. It comes with your room booking & includes toast, crumpets, home-made jam, marmalade & honey together with home-made granola (plus a selection of other cereals) and fruit – as well as coffee, tea etc.
description: 'Bed and breakfast' in a family home in an exceptionally quiet street just a 5 min walk from Finsbury Park train & underground station (Victoria & Piccadilly line) & 20 mins to the very centre of town.  (The Victoria line stops at Oxford Circus & the British Library & the Piccadilly line at Covent Garden & the British Museum.)  We provide breakfast every morning, tea, coffee & biscuits in your room &, for your other meals, there are umpteen places to eat just around the corner. The room A beautiful sunny room with a large, comfortable double bed, a chest of drawers, lots of hanging space, a desk and an armchair. An extra single guest bed can be made up for a child (or for friends who’d rather not share the double). There’s also a kettle, capsule coffee machine, a selection of teas,  hot chocolate and biscuits. Fresh milk is available from the kitchen. Wi-fi is free of charge – the code is on a card in the room.  Bathrooms Both bathrooms are shared with other guests. Towels, soap, shamp
neighborhood_overview: It's just a 5 min walk to the Victoria & Piccadilly underground lines at Finsbury Park station and a 3 min walk to the nearest bus stop. Bus number 19 goes to the West End, the number 4 to the Barbican Centre, St Paul’s Cathedral & Tate Modern and the number 253 to Camden and London Zoo.  Closer to home, Arsenal’s famous football stadium - and its underground station - are roughly a 10 min walk away (in the opposite direction to Finsbury Park station) while a short stroll takes you through Highbury Fields to Islington’s fashionable Upper Street & onwards to the antique & vintage shops of Camden Passage. Head eastwards across Clissold Park and you reach buzzing Stoke Newington with its vintage (and new) fashion & furniture shops; further east, you enter the hipster territory of Broadway Market, London Fields, Shoreditch and Spitalfields.
notes: Arrival time It makes life simpler for us if you can arrive between 3.00pm and 11.00pm but we understand that flight times etc don’t always make that easy. Should you arrive earlier in the day, you’re very welcome to drop off bags; should you arrive late at night, it's unlikely to cause a problem but please give us as much warning as possible. Departure time We ask guests to leave by 11.00am on the day of their departure. Other things to note There’s plenty of parking on the street outside the house & we can provide you with the necessary permits.  We ask guests to be respectful of others in the house and to keep noise to a minimum – especially before 7.00am and after 11.00pm.
transit: We're very close to a wide range of transport options - underground, rail, bus etc.  There's parking on the street outside the house - we can provide visitor permits.
access: Guest areas Guests are welcome downstairs from 7.30-9.30am (ie during breakfast hours).  Once breakfast is over, we like to keep the downstairs area for family use – although guests are welcome to enjoy the garden (weather permitting).
interaction: We’ll do our best to answer any questions you have about the local area or about London in general and we also have a small library of guidebooks that you’re welcome to consult. We're very happy to point you towards our favourite galleries, yoga classes, restaurants, cinemas, book shops etc, though if you'd rather  eat your breakfast in peace and quiet we're perfectly happy with that too.    We enjoy meeting guests and chatting with them over breakfast but sometimes other commitments mean we can't be there for the full two hours.
house_rules: - Please be quiet after 11pm and before 7am. - Guests are welcome downstairs during breakfast hours (7.30-9.30am).  Other than that we prefer to keep the downstairs area to ourselves.
host_about:
I’m a writer & researcher with three adult children who come & go and a small, friendly dog who likes chasing balls and scrounging food.
I’ve lived in this part of London for more than thirty years and love it: central enough to be in Oxford Street in twenty minutes; quiet enough to be woken by birdsong rather than traffic.  Other than home, I love travelling, hiking & tracking down interesting art & fabrics.

name: The Peaceful Penthouse (with private bathroom)
summary: Above the trees, our newly renovated penthouse sits on top of a beautiful Victorian building situated in Notting Hill Gate, just a 2 minute walk from the tube station, and on a very quiet road.  You’ll love our place because it feels so spacious, is flooded with natural light, and the general feel and character of it is extremely cosy, plus there's the added bonus of your own private bathroom! This building is very special, the film director Ken Russell made a film about it in 1960!
description: Above the trees, our newly renovated penthouse sits on top of a beautiful Victorian building situated in Notting Hill Gate, just a 2 minute walk from the tube station, and on a very quiet road.  You’ll love our place because it feels so spacious, is flooded with natural light, and the general feel and character of it is extremely cosy, plus there's the added bonus of your own private bathroom! This building is very special, the film director Ken Russell made a film about it in 1960! You're welcome to use the whole flat, it is around 100 sq meters in total, so there's plenty of room for all to use the kitchen, sit at the large dining table or chill out on the mezzanine or roof terrace.

host_about:
Both myself and my partner (Lou) live in the flat. We are both entertainers. Lou is a singer songwriter (she goes under the artist name 'Dear Joy') and i am a comic/adventurer. 
When we are not writing or performing, we both spend our time practicing yoga, watering the plants and concocting new healthy recipes. We'll make you something when you come round.
We love meeting people, making new connections and hearing other people's stories... but equally, we completely respect that some people like to keep themselves to themselves, so there's no pressure to talk with us if you don't want to! All we really insist is that when you stay, you feel at home.

name: Stunning 3BR in West End by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the fully-equipped kitchen, modern decor, and beautifully designed open-concept layout. Located in London's West End neighborhood, you're less than a mile from the entertainment district around Leicester Square.
space: Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay.
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the fully-equipped kitchen, modern decor, and beautifully designed open-concept layout. Located in London's West End neighborhood, you're less than a mile from the entertainment district around Leicester Square. Every booking is instantly confirmed. Every call or message is answered within minutes. Every home is equipped with crisp linens, high-speed Wi-Fi, and kitchen and bath essentials—everything you need for an exceptional stay. Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay. There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Jar Kitchen or Govinda's Pure Vegetarian Restaurant for some of London's best dining. neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out Jar Kitchen or Govinda's Pure Vegetarian Restaurant for some of London's best dining. For shopping, head to Fulham Broadway Shopping Centre. To explore the rest of the city, grab the nearest bus just 2-3 blocks away. London’s West End is a vibrant neighbourhood with crowds bustling from landmark to landmark in the city’s famous plazas. Find some treasures in department stores and designer boutiques, attend fun events hosted by the active LGBT+/ LGBTQIA+ community, or experience culinary delights on Dean Street. Whether you’re looking to wander the halls of the National Gallery, eat a meal at a world-class restaurant, or catch a show at one of Soho's famous theatres, the West End has everything you need to experience London’s finest.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder does not have air conditioning, but we'll provide fans for each of the rooms that you can use during your stay.
transit: There are paid street and parking lot options nearby, but please be mindful of street signs.
interaction: Our concierge is available by phone, email, or Messenger 24/7. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef

neighborhood_overview: King's Road runs for just under 2 miles through Chelsea, in the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea, from Sloane Square in the east and on the border of Chelsea and Fulham opposite Stamford Bridge.  The exclusivity of Chelsea as a result of its high property prices has historically resulted in the term Sloane Ranger being used to describe its residents. Since 2011, Channel 4 has broadcast a reality television show called Made in Chelsea, documenting the "glitzy" lives of young people living there. Moreover, Chelsea is home to one of the largest communities of Americans living outside the United States, with 6.53% of Chelsea residents being born in the U.S. Harrods is an upmarket department store located on Brompton Road in Knightsbridge, London. The Harrods brand also applies to other enterprises undertaken by the Harrods group of companies including Harrods Bank, Harrods Estates, Harrods Aviation and Air Harrods, and to Harrods Buenos Aires, sold by Harrods in 1922 and closed as o

host_about:
Hi everyone :)

Myself any my fiancé currently manage a few apartments in London that I love to share :)

We live in London, and so we are never too far away, as well as having our office in Covent Garden in case you want to pop by! 

I aim to make everyone as welcome as possible and cater to every guests needs, so please feel free to get in touch with any questions.  

Elliot & Lara

name: Contemporary Double Private Room, Free Parking
summary: A contemporary, sleek private room within our personal flat. My partner and I are offering a spacious and clean room with small hotel touches for anyone looking for a cheap and cheerful London get away. We are flexible and friendly and look forward to the hosting experience.  40/50 Minutes to Central London. 20/30 minutes to Heathrow.
space: There is no lift available in the flat and it is on the 2nd floor. The room is spacious for two people and we offer a TV, kettle and tea and coffee facilities and the room also has a mini fridge. The bathroom will be shared with myself, but I am at work most days (including weekends) so hopefully this should not be a hindrance. Will provide fresh, clean towels for all guests.  There is a car parking space which we offer free of charge, but please note there is a £15 fee to replace the parking permit if it is lost, damaged or you forget to return it.

Though we are offering a private room with no access to the remainder of the flat, if you require laundry t
neighborhood_overview: There are some lovely local pubs, including a microbrewery (The Dodo). Hanwell is the home of Marshall Amps and in the summer it hosts a large street festival called the Hanwell Hootie.  Lots of local cafes and restaurants open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Local supermarket within 5 minute walking distance.  There is a beautiful park only a 5 minute walk away (Boston Manor Park).  We would be happy to advise on locations!
notes: No smoking room, no pets
transit: We are located a 10 minute bus ride (or 5 minute Uber) from Boston Manor Station on the Piccadilly Line, which is a mere half an hour to forty minutes to central London. We are a 20 minute bus ride from Ealing Broadway Station which is has well connected tube and train links into central London. We are only 20/30 minutes from Heathrow by tube or Uber.
access: Though we are offering a private room with no access to the remainder of the flat, if you require laundry to be washed I am happy to allow you access when I am on site or you can ask me and I can let you know when I will be available.  Your room can be locked for your privacy.
interaction: Though I do wish for you to ask any questions during your stay with us, I may not always be on site due to work hours! Please do drop me a text and I will offer help any way I can.

name: Small Cosy Single Room North Greenwich Nr O2 Arena
summary: Single room available in this nice and peaceful house. Plenty of natural light and in a lovely quiet area. Close to very good transport links, shops & restaurants and perfectly located for the O2 & Excel London.  We have parking available if you have a car. Bus station is conveniently located within 5 mins walking distance.
space: This room is a small single. There is a single bed, double wardrobe and storage space above the bed. Also there is a big window that lets the sunlight through first thing in the morning. You will be sharing the bathroom and kitchen areas and there is a reception room for chilling out.  The room itself is lovely, clean and comfortable. I provide clean bed linen, fresh towels and tea and coffee.  I am open for bookings most nights and I am flexible on timing to check in. There is a desk in the reception room if you want to work on your laptop or study. Also there is a dining table for meals.  You're in the heart of Greenwich. 15 mins away from Greenwich village and the O2 arena.  There is a lot of history within Greenwich including the Maritime Museum, The Queens House, The Painted Room, Greenwich Mean Time, Observatory , Shops, fabulous indoor market. Restaurants, pubs and supermarkets. Walks in Greenwich Park and along the Thames are very popular and not forgetting Greenwich University

transit: There is free parking on the driveway for up to two cars.  Buses  10 min North: North Greenwich + the O2 arena which has surrounding parks, restaurants and cinema. 10 min West: Greenwich town centre for its very large well maintained park, Observatory, Museum, University and town centre.  10 Min walk East: Large new Sainsbury, M&S and B&Q, a bit futher and you will get Boots, Maplin, H&M, Asda, TK Max among others. Tube The North Greenwich Tube station for the Jubilee line, or Cutty Sark/Greenwich DRL stations are short bus rides away. Train  Westcombe Park train station is a 5 minute walk away for quick services to London Cannon Street.
access: You will have your own single bedroom and shared use of the bathroom. Feel free to also use the kitchen for cooking light meals and there is a table to work on your laptop or tablet.
interaction: I work Monday to Friday, but I’m happy to sit down and chat over a nice coffee. I can also offer advice on local places to go.
house_rules: Smoking is strictly forbidden.  Please leave your shoes at the door. Please be responsible, the house is kept clean please keep it clean. Unregistered guests are not allowed in the property. You can use the kitchen to cook light meals, just leave everything clean and organized as you found it. The cost of replacing lost keys is £30.  Please respect the property.

name: Master Bedroom in Euston Square (5)
summary: A spacious private bedroom with a shared fully fitted kitchen, wood flooring, double glazing. Situated in the ever popular Drummond Street & within walking distance to transport links of Euston & Warren St, all amenities of Tottenham Court Road & University College of London ( UCL ).  Euston is both a train station and a Tube station and just 4 minutes away from our apartment. Euston Square Underground Station is just 2 mins away. London Euston is directly connected to several major UK cities.
space: Drummond Street is the perfect place for you: it is home to some of the best curry houses in London. Nearby, you’ll find the Wellcome Collection, UCL, British Library and British Museum. Please be advised there is a security camera just behind the front door recording 24/7.
description: A spacious private bedroom with a shared fully fitted kitchen, wood flooring, double glazing. Fully Fitted Kitchen and two shared bathroom. Euston station is located in Camden in Euston Road where it's situated amongst offices, municipal buildings, hotels and shops. On Euston Road, you'll also find the Wellcome Collect
neighborhood_overview: Euston station is located in Camden in Euston Road where it's situated amongst offices, municipal buildings, hotels and shops. On Euston Road, you'll also find the Wellcome Collection and the British Library, both of which are free to visit and always worth a look.From Euston station, it's a short walk, tube or bus ride east to Kings Cross St Pancras station and the exciting array of cultural and leisure venues nearby. Not far in the other direction you'll discover Marylebone High Street, which has a range of unique boutiques, restaurants and bars. If you cross Euston Road and head south, you'll find a vast range of things to do, including:       Bloomsbury Theatre     The Place Dance School and Theatre     Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology     British Museum.     Foundling Museum     Charles Dickens Museum Camden is one of London's liveliest boroughs and the centre of the capital's underground music scene with a plethora of seductively scuzzy venues. The locks along Regent's Canal
notes: Take a stroll through Camley Street Natural Park and feel a million miles away from the hustle and bustle.  St Pancras Church is home to the Crypt Gallery, an underground gem housed in, you guessed it, an old crypt. Here you can see contemporary art between ancient burial tombs. Keep an eye on their ever-evolving programme of exhibitions and events! Check out the newly opened Francis Crick Institute behind St Pancras station. Explore the gallery inside or simply marvel at the architecture of the biggest biomedical research facility under a single roof in Europe. For the casual magician, did you know the Magic Circle resides in Euston? They also have a museum, open to the public via appointment. You can find them on Stevenson’s Way, just around the corner from the station. It is free to Magic Circle members. Pop over to UCL’s Grant Museum of Zoology and witness their weird and wonderful collection, including the infamous jar of moles! Gordon Square Gardens, where you can let the kids ru
transit: Euston Square Tube Station Euston Road, London, Camden, NW1 2ND 2 mins from the apartment.   Euston Tube Station Eversholt Street, London, King's Cross, NW1 2DU 4 mins from the apartment.   Warren Street Tube Station Tottenham Court Road, London, Fitzrovia, NW1 3AA 4 mins from the apartment.   Mainline Stations Euston Railway Station Euston Road, London, King's Cross, NW1 2RT ,  Underground lines: Northern, Victoria 3 mins from the apartment.   Eurostar St Pancras International, Pancras Road, London, King's Cross, NW1 2QP 10 mins from the apartment. St Pancras International Station Euston Road, London, King's Cross, NW1 2QP 10 mins from the apartment.

name: Gorgeous Penthouse | Sleeps 6 | @WildRoses
summary: Newly refurbished penthouse apartment set just minutes from Canada Water station, giving easy access to all parts of London. Enjoy quiet evenings and sunny days in this triple aspect top floor apartment.
space: This top floor penthouse has Windows on all four sides.  It benefits from two spacious bedrooms, one with an ensuite bathroom and a second master bathroom. Each room has a full size double bed.  The living room has double height Windows and a south facing unobstructed view. The sun shines into this apartment from different angles all day, creating a lovely airy feel.  The living room has a sofa bed which turns into a full size double bed so the apartment can comfortably sleep 3 couples or 6 individuals that don't mind sharing beds. :)  The balcony wraps around the whole apartment and is a lovely place to enjoy days or evenings. The area is very quiet, and at night all you hear is the sound of running water from the gardens waterfall. There is also a private, communal garden that has a man made stream with waterfalls.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is peaceful and quiet, great for strolls by the riverside, the whole of the riverfront is covered in mellow walkways. Walking along the numerous quays, you can witness some of the area’s history of shipyards and working docks. Southwark Park is close by, home to London's least common trees, the Walnut and Silver Maple:)
transit: Canada Water station is a few minutes walk from the station which gets you into central london in 15 minutes.
access: Guests will have private use of the whole apartment.
interaction: I meet guests to check them in and am available if they need anything during the stay
house_rules: Strictly no parties or functions.  Strictly no extra guests to be brought into the apartment without permission.  Noise to be kept down after 11pm.  Please do not speak to the building management or concierge, i can be reached at any time to deal with any issues. Check-ins between 8PM and 12AM incur an additional charge of £30 Check-ins after 12AM incur an additional charge of £60 Check-out is at 11am unless previously arranged with us.  Unauthorised late check-outs will incur a fee of £20 per hour for a maximum of 3 hours. After 2pm the full day rate will be charged.
host_about:
Hello everyone!

@StayWildRoses
Love comics, movies and games. I haven't grown out of my 10 year old self just yet. When I adult, I love great conversations, inspirational lives and courageous people pushing the boundaries in doing better in love, life and laughter. 
Chai tea in the morning. Usually pick the chicken option on menus. All desserts. My partner never gives up trying to get me into yoga. She's a warrior, and I love her more than comics. The best time to sail the world is now.

Founder of Wild Roses. Passionate about hospitality and creating memorable experiences.

name: Bright and cozy ensuite in the heart of London!
summary: Hello! Welcome to our light and airy apartment! Its cozy and comfy and has all you might need. There’s lots of natural light coming through and a spacious common area that we’ll share. We’re a friendly couple from Singapore and Indonesia who loves travelling and meeting new people. We hope you’ll love the place as much as we do!  Fresh linen, towels and luxury soap are provided. We serve a simple breakfast as well. Looking forward to meeting you (:
space: You will have your own private room with bathroom in the heart of London. It’s central but quiet and away from street noise. Our place is cozy and comfy and you’ll have an amazing time here, promise!  Explore the city and relax in our quiet little apartment. We are located in a building with an elevator, so no more huffing and puffing up the stairs!

The Holborn tube station is also a stone’s throw away... by the end of the stay, you’ll be a good stone thrower!

host_about: Hello there! I’m a scuba instructor living in London with my partner. I’m from Indonesia and would be happy to share my experiences with you. I love travelling and meeting new people.

name: Double bedroom in trendy Dalston sleeps 3 .
summary: My place is close to The Shacklewell Arms, and Ruby's Dalston. You’ll love my place because of the people who are super friendly, the neighbourhood is quiet, and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and furry friends (pets).
space: I have a double and single bed in the front double bedroom upstairs, with a TV.  Whilst it's not connected to sky it is a smart TV so can watch analogue TV and dvds should you wish.    Wifi is available and this is found in the information provided in the room.  If you are coming with children let me know and I will put a selection of children's DVDs in the room for you.  Should you forget your travel adapter there are plugs in the small bedside drawer for your use whilst you're with us.
description: My place is close to The Shacklewell Arms, and Ruby's Dalston. You’ll love my place because of the people who are super friendly, the neighbourhood is quiet, and the ambiance. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and furry friends (pets). I have a double and single bed in the front double bedroom upstairs, with a TV.  Whilst it's not connected to sky it is a smart TV so can watch analogue TV and dvds should you wish.    Wifi is available and this is found in the information provided in the room.  If you are coming with children let me know and I will put a selection of children's DVDs in the room for you.  Should you forget your travel adapter there are plugs in the small bedside drawer for your use whilst you're with us. My guests are able to access all rooms with the exception of mine, my daughter's and son's bedrooms. I work Monday to Friday (til 2pm most days), so am not always home to welcome you. However my son is home to do this should you arrive whilst I'm at work.
neighborhood_overview: Dalston is up and coming and many changes are taking place, with 4 Overground stations within a 5/10min walk you can be in Stratford, West End, or Central within 30mins.  Dalston  is one of the ‘coolest places in Britain’, cool young creative types flocked to Dalston to enjoy the buzzing nightlife, vintage shops and quirky cafes. Check out our guide for the lowdown on eating, drinking, and generally enjoying the best of this East End hotspot.  Stoke Newington is a stones throw away and there are few places in London that offer the zest, charm and charisma of Stoke Newington. Church Street is the area's lively epicentre, with packed-out bars and pubs never too far away. Stokie's shops overflow with indie labels and vintage goods and its restaurants are noteworthy for their diversity as well as their quality.
notes: We have a happy friendly outlook so feel free to have a chat with us.  We love hearing your reasons for travelling and plans for your stay. We like to share our love of London and some cool places to visit. I do have pets as stated, but should you miss this please don't be alarmed, they're pretty friendly.  They live here too and are used to a quiet space. I am easy going and laid back but through hosting for some people i have to insist that check in and out times are strictly adhered to. I have had to cancel nights out due to guests imforming me last minute that they are checking in after my specified time. Therefore please ask if it is possible to check in later at the enquiry stage as i may have made plans for the evening.
transit: We are close to  4 Overground stations which are  within a 5/10min walk  once there you can be in Stratford, West End, or Central London within 30mins.  There are also a number of buses the closest is a short 3mins walk which if you fancy the scenic route will take you to Stratford. Then there's those that are around 10mins away that will take you to Central and the West End of London.
access: My guests are able to access all rooms with the exception of mine, my daughter's and son's bedrooms.
interaction: I work Monday to Friday (til 2pm most days), so am not always home to welcome you. However my son is home to do this should you arrive whilst I'm at work.  I make a point of introducing myself as soon as I am home, and answer any questions my son was unable to if any.  Please note no shoes are allowed upstairs. There is tea and coffee provisions  in the room for you and toiletries should you forget or run out, but please feel free to use the kitchen should you wish to cook of course tidying up after yourself.  There is a small selection of books for you to read should you finish the one you are reading.  Feel free to swap any, I do love a good book.  The dvds are not for swapping I'm afraid.
house_rules: This is a working household so should you come home late be mindful that we are probably asleep.
host_about:
I'm am easy going, laid back kind of girl. I'm a bit shy but never stop talking once I'm comfortable.  My friends describe me as loyal, honest, funny and somewhat crazy (in a nice way I hope lol)
I love to read, watch movies, go to theatre, sometimes nights out, meals out.  My favourite place to travel is Spain Costa Del Sol, and would go back time and time again.  My favourite movies are Sound of Music, The Wizard of Oz and Chitty Chitty Bang Bang I love Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory too oh and any vampire movie.  Books way too many to mention but I like Dorothy Koomson, thrillers, horror I will read any vampire book though as I so love them.  
As a guest I would be very quite because I'm shy but would be polite. I'm new to this but would like to be able drive and park but have no problems taking the train should that be an issue.

name: Large spacious flat in popular Shoreditch area
summary: My place is close to Brick Lane (best curries in London), Shoreditch (cool bars and great restaurants), Colombia Rd ( must-see Sunday flower market). Also not far to Tower Bridge, Borough Market, & the Thames. You’ll love my place because it's a historical building & you'll see such a variety of London. From here you will walk by all sorts of different communities, and get to see a different and vibrant part of London. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: Very large spacious one bed apartment, ideal for a couple or friends coming to visit London. Bright and open living area perfect for relaxing in for a cup of tea after a long day pounding the streets of London! Location couldn't be better too, whether interested in going out in shoreditch, great restaurants, or relaxing nights in one of the many great pubs in the area.
description: My place is close to Brick Lane (best curries in London), Shoreditch (cool bars and great restaurants), Colombia Rd ( must-see Sunday flower market). Very large spacious one bed apartment, ideal for a couple or friends coming to visit London. Bright and open living area perfect for relaxing in for a cup of tea after a long day pounding the streets of London! Location couldn't be better too, whether interested in going out in shoreditch, great restaurants, or relaxing nights in one of the many great pubs in the area. There's a small terrace out the front for any smokers, and the flat is next door to a park for those keen enough for a morning jog!
neighborhood_overview: So much to recommend, we're spoilt for choice in this area - I'll leave a list for your stay but a few on here. Restaurants: (too many to list here!) Dishoom - Shoreditch High St - amazing indian food, bar, and great decor Morito (Hackney Rd) - delicious lebanese food Brawn - Mediterranean small plates Bistroteque - modern european in converted warehouse Andina - Peruvian, ceviche Berber & Q (Hoxton) - fall of the bone bbq meats, totally delicious & fun atmos Pubs & bars The Marksman - michellin recommended food, great pub The Royal Oak - delicious pub food, fun atmos & next to flower market Soho house (for those members) Kansas Smitty's - cool little downstairs cocktails & jazz NT's Bar - lively cocktail bar
transit: Great transport links from here 8 min walk to Bethnal Green tube (central line) 15 min walk (through Spitalfields market, a must see) to Liverpool St station (central line, and Hammersmith & City/ Circle line) 5 min bus to to Old street tube station (northern and piccadilly lines) 15 min walk to Whitechapel tube station (district line) 5 min walk to Bethnal Green overland station
access: There's a small terrace out the front for any smokers, and the flat is next door to a park for those keen enough for a morning jog!
host_about: Born and bred Londoner and very keen traveller

Use of the kitchen, fridge/freezer, and washing machine. Light and spacious flat. South facing balcony. 10 minute walk to Catford and Catford Bridge stations. 35 minutes to London Bridge. 35 minutes to the City. Sharing flat with me (33, male, professional). You are welcome to use the fridge, all kitchen appliances and utensils, as well as the washing machine (free of charge). You also have a TV with catch up and Netflix.

You will be renting 1 room in a 2 bedroom flat, NOT THE WHOLE FLAT. I will be in the other room. Breaking of the house rules will result in cancellation of the guest stay. I look forward to hearing from you. Rob
host_about: I am clean and tidy, polite, and an all round nice guy! I love tennis. The highlight of my life was when I played tennis with Roger Federer (we had one rally... he won). I am a lawyer, but don't hold that against me.

name: Spacious Family Garden Flat, Near tube, 3BD 2BA
summary: Our flat is close to Swiss Cottage and Belsize Park with great transport links to Central London via the Jubilee line and many bus routes. Belsize Village is a short walk away where you'll find cafes like Roni's and Belsize Kitchen and great dining at XO and Hazara. Finchley Road provides all of the basics. You’ll love our place because of the neighbourhood and ease of getting around. Our flat is perfect for families with 1-2 kids - we have a cot and high chair as well as toys for tots.
space: Experience living the NW London life on a quiet street with easy access to the city.  We have everything you need to make a family stay in London comfortable: toys, crib, high-chair and plenty of books.
description: Our flat is close to Swiss Cottage and Belsize Park with great transport links to Central London via the Jubilee line and many bus routes.
