You’ll love our place because of the neighbourhood and ease of getting around. Our flat is perfect for families with 1-2 kids - we have a cot and high chair as well as toys for tots. Experience living the NW London life on a quiet street with easy access to the city.  We have everything you need to make a family stay in London comfortable: toys, crib, high-chair and plenty of books. You have access to the entire flat, which has its own entrance, and private access to garden space. I will be here to welcome guests, answers questions you may have at check in, as well as before your stay (I know that local tips are always welcome in such a big town).  If anything is needed during the t
neighborhood_overview: Upmarket quiet residential area, situated in North London within walking distance to Primrose Hill, Belsize Park as well as Hampstead village. 15 minute walk to amazing parks and open spaces: Primrose Hill, Regent's Park, Hampstead Heath. The Swiss Cottage Leisure Centre is nearby, and on a rainy day with kids, their Rascals soft play area is perfect to burn off a little energy (sessions run on the hour). Local Markets: Swiss Cottage Market is Wednesdays 10am-3pm; Primrose Hill & Hampstead Markets are Saturday 10am - 3pm (Hampstead  may close at 2)
transit: Flat is located a moment away from Swiss Cottage tube station and there are plenty of busses available to go around town. We aren't able to provide parking, but there is a public parking structure right across from Swiss Cottage Leisure Centre.
access: You have access to the entire flat, which has its own entrance, and private access to garden space.
interaction: I will be here to welcome guests, answers questions you may have at check in, as well as before your stay (I know that local tips are always welcome in such a big town).  If anything is needed during the trip, I can also deal with questions or anything unexpected. If I am travelling, my co-host will look after you.
house_rules: - Quiet hours 10pm - 8am. Please keep noise down levels down so as not to disturb the neighbours.  Please leave the flat as clean and tidy as you found it. - Please enquire about late check-in. We will try to accommodate as much as possible. 50% of the daily rate to account for blocking out the morning/evening for you. Outside of sociable hours a £30 fee will also apply (e.g., midnight).

name: Light single or twin bedroom in Southfields
summary: Our home is a 20 minute walk from Wimbledon tennis and a 7 minute walk to Southfields tube station on the District line, so just 30 minutes from central London. There are good local shops and a variety of places to get coffee or eat.  The room is at the top of the house for privacy, with French windows onto the garden to bring in lots of light. You have a private shower room. We're happy for you to use the kitchen for breakfast, tea or coffee.  We welcome couples, solo  and business travelers.
space: Light and airy with views over a large garden which you're welcome to enjoy, you can enjoy privacy in your room or use the kitchen for making tea, coffee and breakfast as part of our home.  Just 30 minutes from central London, our home is minutes' walk from Wimbledon Common, Wimbledon Park and  the world famous Wimbledon Tennis.  It's easy to walk to various local pubs which include the Telegraph on Putney Heath, the Park Tavern and Earl Spencer, or instead hang out in Southfields village at a pavement cafe or restaurant.

host_about: I'm a full time working mother of 3 who likes clean simple lines and lots of light in home decoration. We hope you'll appreciate this about the private room in our London home.  We've made sure that our Italian house is  spacious and simple . I work in publishing so love books and you'll discover a bureau full of them, along with board games and cards.  Make pizzas in the wood burning oven or drive into the valley for a campari in the medieval piazza of Fivizzano.  Our housekeeper and gardener will have ensured the villa and its pool are immaculate for your arrival.

name: Cosy modern room in Excel London area!
summary: Hello everybody!!  :) Well I am Thanos and my girlfriend Maria we finally agreed to list one room we have empty in our lovely house!  We are both Greeks from Thessaloniki (if you never been there..you should ;) living in London for about six years now.. (time flies!)  We are both proffesionals in different sectors! Maria is working in H&M retail (she can get you 25% discount!! ;) lol) and me a close protection operative amongst other activities.. Feel free to ask us whatever you might need! :)
space: Well our place will give you the home feeling and certainly feel free to treat it like this! We want you to have a lovely time even if its only for a short period. We provide all the essentials you might need plus if you need printer services we can help you on that also plus that we provide an optic fiber internet connection to get going with your work. We can have ready for you an Oyster transport card if you need or anything else so you will save some time ;) Our house is located next to the Excel London convention center and to the City Airport at Docklands area. So its very suitable for quests at Excel from City airport!

We provide all the essentials you might need plus if you need printer services we can help you on that also plus that we provide an optic fiber internet connection to get going with your work. We can have ready for you an Oyster transport card if you need or anything else so you will save some time ;) Our house is located next to the E
notes: Also along with me and Maria we have François from France that he is staying with us! Amazing guy :)
transit: The Prince Regent Dlr station is 3 min walking distance and from there you can go to canning town station(3 min) and change with the jubilee line and head towards the center of London (20 min). Otherwise you can go to Stratford station (12 min) where you can find the Olympic stadium and the famous worldwide Westfield shopping center that provides everything! Its a must lol If you dont want to travel with the Dlr you can also use the red buses that run infront of the main street 24 hours.
access: We have a nice living room with a 40 inch Samsung smart 3D TV! (You can watch a 3D movie if you want!) a nice big kitchen and a lovely garden space and of course our bathroom that is located upstairs! :) Also we provide iron, ironing board and all the electric appliances that you might need!

name: Bright & Homely 2 Bed House in Hoxton w/ Garden
summary: Welcome to my newly decorated, spacious and bright home! Enjoy my entire 2 bed East London house nestled by the scenic canal. Haggerston and Hoxton tube are only a 12 minute walk from the door, meaning you can be at Kings Cross in 20 minutes, and Shoreditch in 15 by bus! The comfy and cosy interior of the house ensures you will feel right at home here. Enjoy!
space: Downstairs is my large light living area. There is a big comfy sofa perfect for relaxing on after a long day enjoying everything this amazing city has to offer and there is even a flat screen tv!  The kitchen area has all the mod-cons you could want if you fancy a home cooked meal. As an added bonus I will always provide coffee, sugar and tea so you can enjoy a traditional British cuppa in the morning! There is also plenty of seating with a lovely breakfast bar area and a table.  Large glass doors provide lots of natural light downstairs opening out into the fantastic, secluded, private garden. My garden is a rare large space of green in a London property.  Upstairs are my two spacious bright bedrooms. Both of these rooms have huge king size beds which will always be made up with fresh high-quality linen. neighborhood_overview: My house is in the heart of fashionable East London! You will find loads of great places to eat and shop nearby. My home offers a base for those who want to experience everything East London has to offer. If you want to visit a traditional British market, there are two very cool ones less than 10 minutes walk away. The hugely popular Broadway Market is a must for food and shopping lovers. The street market is on Saturdays but there are loads of interesting shops cafes and restaurants open all week! The Columbian Road Flower Market on Sundays is visually stunning.  Regents Canal which is one the best places for a scenic walk in London is right on your doorstep. London Fields, Victoria Park and Haggerston Park are amazing parks all only a stone's throw away.   It will take you less than 30 minutes to get to the City of London (London's financial district) and just 15 minutes to get to the cool hipster area of Shoreditch. Shoreditch has loads of great bars, pubs and restaurants. There are

name: CS01 Double Ensuite Room heart of Brick Lane
summary: Lovely, excellently-located maisonette house within famous Brick Lane around the corner and short walk to Eclectic Shoreditch and busy Liverpool Street. Nearest tube station is Aldgate East (5min walk).  The house is located in a residential street and it is spread over 5 floors on a traditional London brick style. There is a fully equipped kitchen with unlimited tea and coffee also complies dining & lounge area with a pool table!  The room has comfy bed, work space and private bathroom
space: In the basement there is a well planned fully equipped kitchen and breakfast bar leading into a cosy lounge area with a pool table!  It's perfect if you prefer to cook (although there are many excellent choices for dining out in the local area) or simple to sit and relax after a long day! The space was designed and inspired by the traditional English pubs! TV is also provided, as well as WiFi. The kitchen also provides laundry facilities such as washing machine, dryer , iron and iron board as well as detergent. We also offer unlimited tea, coffee and crackers! The bedroom is good sized double room with a comfy bed, work space and cosy and warm environment.  Bathroom is private just for you and we provide shower gel & shampoo. There are also fresh towels and toilet paper. You will share the other facilities with other guests.

There is a fully equipped kitchen with unlimited tea and coffee also complies dining & lounge area with a pool table! It's perfect if you prefer to cook (although there are many excellent choices for dining out in the local area) or simple to sit and relax after a long day! The space was designed and inspired by the traditional English pubs! TV is also provided, as well as WiFi. The kitchen also provides laundry facilities such as washing machine, dryer , iron and iron board as well as de
neighborhood_overview: Our place is situated in Brick Lane and Shoreditch, the coolest, most vibrant and exciting places to be in London!!! Famous for its street art and curry famous restaurants! The most exciting restaurants, cafés and bars in London are located in this neighbourhood. The area has a rich and fascinating history, which can be enjoyed through one of the walking tours available, The Jack the Ripper tour which is very popular. There is a flower market called Columbia Road Flower Market a short walk away every Sunday as well as food markets at weekends such as famous The Old Truman Brewery where you can find excellent food and vintage clothes and decor! The Spitalfields Market is 5min away and is one of the nicest markets in London and there are also nine other markets in the area, which are fascinating! You are also 20 minutes walk to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge, these are very popular for a first time London visitor. You can actually get a boat from there to anywhere else on the river
notes: We prefer to correspond with our guests through Airbnb app instead of cellphone, this way if some of us are not available immediately and can't help you in that moment, someone else or our assistant will get in touch, this is just to make sure you will have assistance as soon as possible :)
transit: Nearest tube station is Aldgate East (District and Hammersmith and City line) - 5min walk.  We are also close to  Liverpool Street (Circle, Metropolitan and Hammersmith and City Line) - 13min walk Shoreditch High Street (Overground) - 11min walk Whitechapel (Overground, District and Hammersmith and City line) - 11 min walk There are also a great bus routes to the City and West End, perfect for sightseeing and shopping (No 25 or 205 bus).  There is also a bike stand close by which is part of the self service cycle net work across London.
access: You can use the whole house except other bedrooms, so please make yourself comfy. We wish you can feel comfortable for the short time you're here.
interaction: We won’t be available in person but can offer loads of tips for the area depending on what you would like to do. There are plenty of restaurants, shops and bars around. We live close by and have lived in this area for a few years and we are always around making sure the house is in good shape and that you are enjoying your stay.

Please inform the right number of guests prior to book.  * Rooms with single bed only accommodates 1 guest. * Check-in time is from 2pm until any time, we give our guests the option to check in late using our self check in system which is very easy! If you need to arrive earlier than check in time is also possible with additional charge of just £5 you can use the common areas to drop you luggage. Early check in is available from 1pm with additional cost of £10. Please contact us for more information.   * Check-out is at 11 am. Late check-out can be confirmed upon availability with additional charge of £10. Contact us for more information. summary: My place is close to Greenwich Park, Royal Observatory, North Greenwich station, the O2 Centre, the Excel Centre, Canary Wharf, Blackheath and Charlton Village.  This is a Grade 2 listed detached Georgian house. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and families (with kids). Although the listing is for six, it is best suited for up to five adults or families of six given the beds (see notes). No pets or parties are allowed.

We are 10 minutes walk from Charlton Station (overground train) which takes 15 minutes to Cannon Street (city centre) and London Bridge or 15 minutes by bus from North Greenwich underground station (metro, Jubilee line) which takes 15-20 minutes to Bond Street. There are lots of restaurants in beautiful and historic Blackheath Village (5 minutes by bus) and the clubs are in the city centre. Two minutes walk is Charlton Village where there is a library in a mansion, a couple of restaurants, pubs and a supermarket. The house has a double
notes: We are 10 minutes walk from Charlton Station (overground train) which takes 15 minutes to Cannon Street (city centre) and London Bridge or 15 minutes by bus from North Greenwich underground station (metro, Jubilee line) which takes 15-20 minutes to Bond Street. There are lots of restaurants in beautiful and historic Blackheath Village (5 minutes by bus) and the clubs are in the city centre. Two minutes walk is Charlton Village where there is a library in a mansion, a couple of restaurants, pubs and a supermarket. The house has a double bed in one bedroom (suitable for two people), two single beds in another bedroom and a double sofa bed in the living room (suitable for two people at a stretch). However five adults would sleep more comfortably, and a family of six (with children) would be fine.

Late check-in needs to be pre-arranged and confirmed with us at least 3 days before arrival and they are subject to the following charges for arrival between these times: From 19:00 to 22:00 - £40 From 22:00 to 00:00 - £65 From 00:00 to 7:00 - £100 *These prices may differ during public holidays (e.g. Christmas time) These fees need to be paid in advance and cannot be paid at the property. If your arrival time is delayed beyond 1 hour then please let us know and we will do our best to accommodate the delay however we may need to re-arrange the check-in time or for you to collect the keys from us if we have other pre-arranged commitments. host_about:
I moved to London to follow my love who is a Londoner, I have a 4 years old daughter and two cats. we live in a beautiful house surrounded by parks and trees in Muswell Hill.

The Airbnb experience has been very positive and from that experience I set up a company called HelloGuest to provide excellent hassle-free Airbnb management services for short stay rental properties in London advertised on Airbnb.

Our services cover everything from full property management (guest communication, check-in & out, cleaning & laundry, manage the listing, 24/7 support service, etc) to partly managed or individual services depending on your needs.

Our aim is to provide professional services for high quality properties to deliver an excellent guest experience.

We are here to help, so please get in touch with any questions you have.

name: The Brixton Penthouse - Master Bedroom  En-Suite
summary: Welcome to the Master En-Suite Bedroom of this amazing 400 square meter Penthouse a top Brixton Hill.  Being the highest point for miles around, this view can't be justified by pictures, as from some stand points it is 270 degrees with everything falling away from this point.
space: This is a truly jaw dropping and commanding view, to be enjoyed from the 70 foot roof terrace and 35 foot living room.  I've been told so many times "This is the best view of London" but please be my guest, and come and judge for yourself!

Cosmopolitan with friendly local Pubs with live music, parade of local shops opposite including Cafes, Butchers, three Off Licence/Convenience, Printers, Barbers, Hardware.  A picturesque backstreet walk, of Edwardian houses leads you to the fully functioning Brixton Windmill. Brixton centre is only five minutes away by bus or an easy 15 minutes walk.  Bustling with it's open and covered markets, and new Bo
neighborhood_overview: Cosmopolitan with friendly local Pubs with live music, parade of local shops opposite including Cafes, Butchers, three Off Licence/Convenience, Printers, Barbers, Hardware.  A picturesque backstreet walk, of Edwardian houses leads you to the fully functioning Brixton Windmill. Brixton centre is only five minutes away by bus or an easy 15 minutes walk.  Bustling with it's open and covered markets, and new Box Park, exploring this legendary part of London is truly an adventure! If you like Nature, take off to Brockwell Park, it's hilly and has great views to the city also, with historic buildings, water and walled Victorian garden.
notes: No parties allowed.
transit: There is a bus stop within 10 meters at the back entrance on Brixton Hill.  It is serviced by a great selection of buses -  (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)  Streatham hill is technically the nearest Underground  station, however, I tend to come via Brixton.
access: Communal spaces for guests are the kitchen/living room and roof terrace.
house_rules: Smoking only out side on the roof terrace.  Please use ashtray, especially as the grass is synthetic. No parties allowed.

name: Vauxhall/Oval: double bedroom with private bath
summary: My flat is close to both Vauxhall and Oval Tube stations, making it extremely convenient for travel around London. The Thames path is a short walk away, from where you can reach the London Eye and Tate museums. The vibrant nightlife of Brixton is just down the road, but the street itself is quiet and leafy. Aside from the great location, the flat also has a garden, and large, airy rooms. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and young families (a second room has bunk beds). Pets OK.
space: The room is warm, quiet and comfortable, the house is very well-located for visiting London, and the street is nice and quiet.

name: Bright & Modern 2-Bed Apartment
summary: Bright and modern two-bed Notting Hill apartment conveniently located within the Portobello Market area with many bars, restaurants, cafes, boutique & antique shops. The area also benefits with well connected bus services and 3 nearby London Underground Stations. The area is also in close proximity to Hyde Park, Kensington Palace, Westfield Shopping Centre, Oxford Street, Museums in South Kensington. And don't forget to visit Winter Wonderland, Hyde Park 22nd November 2018 to 6th January 2019.
space: The building recently underwent a full renovation with double-glazed windows in each room. Here are the key components for each room: Bedroom 1: - Fitted wardrobe (internal drawers, shelves, clothes hanging rail, full length mirror) - Guest towels and clothes hangers (inside fitted wardrobe) - Bed linens, pillows, duvets all provided - Carpeted - Double Bed with 4 drawers - Bedside Tables x2 with Bedside Lamps x2 - USB plug sockets Bedroom 2: - Fitted wardrobe (internal drawers, shelves, clothes hanging rail, full length mirror) - Guest towels and clothes hangers (inside fitted wardrobe) - Bed linens, pillows, duvets all provided - Carpeted - Double Bed with 4 drawers - Bedside Table with Bedside Lamp - Armchair and Floor Lamp - USB plug sockets (*Please note inside the fitted wardrobe (in bedroom 2) includes the iron & iron board, vacuum cleaner, hair dryer, and board game.)   Bathroom: - Shower & Bath Tub - Underfloor Heating - Shower Cream, Shampoo & Conditioner, Soap, Toothpaste -

neighborhood_overview: You are ideally located In the Heart of Notting Hill, where you will find the World-famous Portobello Market on your doorstep just 5 minutes’ walk down the road. Also The Notting Hill Bookshop, made famous by the film Notting Hill, is on the same street as the apartment. Portobello market stretches for over two miles and is best known for its antique vendors selling anything from furniture, clothing to collectibles. The apartment itself is located next to the Antiques and Fruit & Veg sections of the Market. Expect to see a variety of antiques and collectibles from all around the world and dating from Roman times to the 1960s. With hundreds of market stalls, shops, arcades, cafés and restaurants. The market is at its busiest on a Saturday with its Secondhand Flea Market where you’ll find vintage clothing, jewellery, books, and music – and Acklam Village Market with its international food stalls, bar and free live music (also family friendly).  At the northern end of the market is Golbor
notes: I have produced my very own Guidebook which you can use in the apartment. This will provide you with useful tips and information about the apartment such as how to operate certain items, the waste & recycle collection dates, and check-out instructions.  Nevertheless the Guidebook will mainly provide you with information about the local area such as the nearest Supermarkets/Grocery Stores, ATMs, Banks, Currency Exchange, Pharmacy, local trains stations. This will also include detailed information about the local area (with supported photos) such as my recommended local restaurants, pubs/bars, coffee shops, parks, leisure & activities etc.
transit: There are many great transportation links in the area.  The 3 nearby London Underground Stations are: Westbourne Park (8 mins) Ladbroke Grove (11 mins) Notting Hill Gate (13 mins) There are also a number of local bus services that can take you to many popular attractions such as: Bus No. 7 & 23 (to Oxford Street, for the shopping district) Bus No. 70 (to South Kensington, for the museums) Bus No. 27 & 31 (to Camden Town, for Camden Market) Bus No. 31 (to Shepherd's Bush, for Westfield London, Europe's Largest Shopping Centre) Bus No. 52 and 452 (to Royal Albert Hall and Knightsbridge) Also, whilst you're visiting London, don't forget to install a very useful app called Citymapper. This is one of the best travelling apps to get you in and around the city and its free to download on your phone (Apple & Android Users). It shows the quickest routes to get to your destination via the best modes of transport whether you want to travel by bus, train or other means.
interaction: I can be contacted throughout the duration of your stay via phone, email, or the Airbnb Messenger App, whether it be an urgent or non-urgent matter.

name: KingSize Room with OWN Bathroom in CentraL LondoN!
summary: Ideal location in Central London for those who are coming for a holiday or a business trip.  Large En-Suite Room for your own use with LCD with SKY TV, unlimited superfast broadband, dishwashing & washing machines, microwave, large fridge, great balcony for bbqs or breakfasts & friendly atmosphere!
space: Comfortable room with king size bed and 2 person sofa bed, lots of storage space and windows to the garden. Please let me know in case if you are coming in a group, we may be able to accommodate your friends in a room on the same floor, should it be available on those days. Additional note (September 2018) to clarify a past review we received:  We have a strictly non-smoking policy in the house and we also recently finished to repaint in whole the walls and wardrobes of the room.  Please bear in mind that smoking inside the room or the house is in breach of our house rules. Still, for our guests who are smokers we do have a nice balcony just outside the living room (which can be seen from the pictures) and you can smoke in there.

transit: Our place is just: * 1 min. walk from Euston station * 2 min. walk from British Library * 5 min. walk from King´s Cross/St. Pancras with connecting trains to Heathrow/Stansted/Gatwick/  Luton Airports & EUROSTAR  * 5 min. walk to UCL, St.Martins & SOAS Universities * 5 min. away by tube from Oxford Street, Camden Town & Baker Street Station with Madame Tusseauds & Sherlock Holmes Museums! Beautiful Regent`s Park is just round the corner! Overal 5 * :)
access: You will have a king size room with your own bathroom & your own key to enter leave the place whenever you`d like. We normally check in after 6pm but in case if there will be availability we would try to check you in earlier just ask.
interaction: We are city professionals and very often are be busy with work etc. Nevertheless we would be happy to help with advice on London and places to see/visit. Just ask!

name: Luxury 1 BedRoom  - Concierge, Gated- Cent. Lond
summary: A beautifully furnished bedroom apartment  with large second double bedroom available in an attractive mediterranean courtyard with balcony and  24/7 concierge.   The apartment is 1 minute from Battersea Park and walking distance to Kings Road/Sloan Square in Chelsea. A 15 minute bus ride to Victoria/South Kensington stations. The flat is beautifully presented, the room has tasteful furniture and its own private shower/bathroom. The flat has been fully refreshed recently. Gated parking included
space: The apartment is attractive and is cleaned regularly. The bedroom is comfortable with high quality furnishings and fitted carpets, and has a comfortable queen size bed. Its spacious wardrobe offers ample storage. The room is cosy, peaceful and looks onto a private internal courtyard. A central corridor connects the dining room, kitchen/lounge area and private bathroom. The apartment has been refurbished to a high standard and the kitchen has been recently fitted with high-end appliances which the guest is welcome to use as desired.

The apartment has been refurbished to a high standard and the kitchen has been recently fitted with high-end appliances which th
neighborhood_overview: Battersea Park is one of the most beautiful recreational parks in London and a really convenient option for exercise, Boris bike-riding and walks. There are a number of cafes dotted across it and it also has its own botanical gardens and zoo. The road on which the apartment is situated has local Italian coffee shops and restaurants that have been in the neighbourhood for many years. Slightly further afield is a walk to King's Road just across the Thames, which has a farmers market in the main square on weekends.
notes: We prefer to take bookings from Female guests and couples.  Key areas of interest that are in walking distance include: Close to Battersea Park, Kings Road, South Kensington, Knightsbridge, Buckingham Palace, Harrods, Big Ben, cinemas, restaurants. Iconic London is on your doorstep.
transit: We are close to major bus routes and 5 minutes walk from Battersea Park Station, one stop from Victoria mainline and underground stations. From Heathrow and Gatwick we can be reached by Heathrow Express and Gatwick Express, coming into Victoria Station. Underground secure parking is also available at the apartment. A remote controlled gate access dongle will be provided.
access: All areas of the apartment except the owners private room. The  room is accessed from a central area linking the master bedroom and kitchen/lounge area. There is a balcony veranda with an outdoor coffee table and chairs available for use. The bed room is secure with its own lock for peace of mind. Access to the building is by electric dongle used to access the development and the apartment block. The apartment is very secure and a concierge is also available 24/7.
interaction: This is a very private let. You will have as much contact - or as little - as you like. We are always here when you need us though.
house_rules: House rules are very simple: no party's if you come home late just be respectful .  We prefer to take bookings from female guests and/or couples. If you intend to be two guests, please be the same 2 guests who made the original booking.  We welcome clean and tidy people staying here. If you need to use the kitchen just tidy up what you use.   To ensure we keep the floorboards squeaky clean for our guests’ enjoyment, we have a no shoes policy inside our home.  We also prefer to take bookings from female guests and/or couples.If you intend to be two guests, please be the same 2 guests who made the original booking.  Apart from the master bedroom, the whole apartment and amenities are included for use.
host_about:
Hi there,
We have enjoyed renting out our second bed room to people from all walks of life and enjoy people visiting here in London. Whether it is for business or pleasure, the apartment is well suited to both and placed conveniently near some of London's finest amenities and  1 minute away from Battersea Park. We are pretty easy going, keep the place very clean and respect people's space. 

Additional details below:
-Spacious apartment building with underground parking in Battersea/Chelsea SW11. 

-Great transport links- Regular buses to Sloane Square, Victoria, Vauxhall  (approx 5-10 minutes away) and Liverpool Street Station. Battersea Park station is a 5 minute walk and is one stop to Victoria Station.

-Excellent shopping/amenities on the Kings Road and South Kensington and Clapham Junction. 

-The apartment is part of a beautiful Avant-Garde complex; it is gated, has underground parking for cars,motorbikes,bikes and it has a 24 hour concierge. Ideal for a both professional and leisure experiences with easy access to London and the City.

summary: This is a 2 bedroom shared flat with large living and  kitchen area.  The flat has been recently refurbished and all furnitures are brand new. The room is on first floor and has a twin bed and a three door wardrobe. There is another room that I live however I am out most of the time therefore its always quiet and tidy.

The flat is in one of the best part of Pimlico as Victoria and Pimlico stations are very close also there is an excellent bus link to all touristic areas. Hyde Park, Big Ben and London Eye are just 10-15 min walking distance. Tesco, Waitrose, Sainsburys and many pubs and restaurants just a minute distance.  Prior to your visit you can get in touch and ask for any arrangements as I will be welcoming you and guide for all your needs. During your stay you can enjoy shared large living and kitchen area plus a bathroom with a large bath.

host_about:
Hi Everyone, 

I have been living in London over 13 years now and have an architectural office in the City. As I am running my own practise, I am flexible most of the time and therefore I like managing my property and show some hospitality to people from all over the world. As I am sociable person I know every inch of the City and would be grateful to share some hidden places that may make your visit more enjoyable. 

Looking forward to meeting you in person.

Dogan

name: Bright 1bed apt, Shepherd's Bush 2min to tube
summary: Welcome to my home! My beautiful 1 bed apartment, in the vibrant area of Shepherd’s Bush, is a stylish and comfortable place to stay and has terrific transport links. You’re just a 2 minute walk away from Goldhawk Road tube station With luxury fresh linen, a comfortable King bed and skylight windows, you are guaranteed ultimate relaxation. Explore the neighbourhood and enjoy this bustling part of London. I hope you enjoy your stay!
space: My stylish 1 bed apartment is the perfect base when visiting London. Conveniently located in the exciting area of Shepherd’s Bush and with great transport links, you’ll be right in the hub of the city but able to escape the hustle and bustle! The living area is light and cosy with sophisticated and modern design and lovely finishing touches. Relax on the large inviting sofa, hang out with your friends, make yourself at home! It’s a welcoming and inviting space where you can kick back. If cooking is your thing, you’re going to love spending time in the bright and airy open plan kitchen. With a beautiful large glass dining table and modern and easy to use appliances - you’ll enjoy showing off your culinary skills here! There’s even a welcome pack stuffed full of coffee, tea (of course!), and proper English scones.  The master bedroom has a super comfortable King bed and, with fresh luxury linens, what more do you need for a good night’s sleep? You don’t have to live out of your suitcase;

neighborhood_overview: Shepherd’s Bush is a really exciting area of London - it has so much character with plenty to explore.Bush Theatre (at the north end of Pennard Road) - Great local plays and dramas Bush Hall (Uxbridge Road) - Up and coming musicians, comedy and cabaret shows. Great restaurant next door as well (Bush Hall Dining) Pergola On The Roof - Rooftop bar terrace with a variety of food options Shepherds Bush Market - Good for knick knacks, fabrics and fresh food Ravenscourt Park - Good for a run or to get away from the hustle and bustle QPR football stadium - Watch a football match if a home game is on as the stadium is within walking distance Westfield Putt Shack - A fun activity recently opened at Westfield. Independent restaurants The area is known for its vibrant and diverse restaurants. Just a few minutes from the apartment are a number of great places to eat. Killer Tomato - highlight rated Mexican restaurant around the corner from the apartment. Cashless service only so very convenient fo
transit: Shepherd's Bush Station has the Central line which takes you to the heart of the West End in ten minutes including Bond Street and Oxford Circus. Goldhawk Road is a 2 minute walk away and has the Circle and Hammersmith & City line which connect to Paddington, Euston and King’s Cross areas. Overground - For places slightly off the beaten track the overground can take you to Clapham in the south and Hackney/Dalston in the east. Buses - There is a big bus station in Shepherd's Bush with many routes to places all over town.
access: You will have the whole place for yourself.
interaction: My friends at Hostmaker are looking after my home while I am away; they are a short-lets management service team who know London like the back of their hand! I trust them to look after you and give you a warm welcome! If you have any questions about your stay, please get in touch through the channel platform.
house_rules: - Please use mats and coasters - Quiet hours from 10pm until 8am - Please take off shoes outside flat door.

name: Studio - Heart of Primrose Hill
summary: A self contained small studio in heart Primrose Hill, London. The Studio is just a stones throw from Primrose Hill, Regents Park, London Zoo and Camden. From here you can enjoy the quiet of the numerous cafes in the village, go for a run around the park, have a night out in Camden or easily explore Central London.
space: Our newly refurbished, light and airy small studio on the upper ground of a handsome and well maintained Victorian building off Primrose Hill Road. Not only are we a short stroll from Primrose Hill, with the fantastic views of the city, we are also 8 minutes to Bond St. There is a village atmosphere with an amazing selection of cafes, pubs and restaurants that are right on our doorstep and the beautiful Regents Park. The studio has coffee/tea making facilities and a fridge, but no cooking facilities. ROOMSERVICE Delivery from lovely restaurants to the Studio - order online from the following: 1) Deliveroo 2) Jinn 3) UberEATS
description: A self contained small studio in heart Primrose Hill, London. The Studio is just a stones throw from Primrose Hill, Regents Park, London Zoo and Camden. From here you can enjoy the quiet of the numerous cafes in the village, go for a run around the park, have a night out in Camden or easily explore Central London. Our newly refurbished, light and airy small studio on the upper ground of a handsome and well maintained Victorian building off Primrose Hill Road. The studio has coffee/tea making facilities and a fridge, but no cooking facilities. ROOMSERVICE Delivery from lovely restaurants to the Studio - order online from the following: 1) Deliveroo 2) Jinn 3) UberEATS Small studio with bathroom (bath with shower).  ROO
neighborhood_overview: There is a wonderful village atmosphere with an amazing selection of cafes, pubs and restaurants that are right on the doorstep and beautiful Regents Park and Hampstead Heath. A prime location in one of the prettiest, most vibrant areas in London. Primrose Hill is a leafy village with boutique shops and historic pubs. In its beautiful park you'll see spectacular views of the whole of London and maybe even celebrity locals like David Beckham, Jude Law and Jonny Depp. Walk across Primrose to visit London Zoo. Camden Stables Market bustles with vintage clothes stalls, antiques and world-famous street food. Its name comes from the still-standing buildings that once housed horses that shunted steam trains on a giant turntable in the nearby heritage-listed Camden Roundhouse, itself now a famous theatre that's seen performances from the likes of The Beatles, Bob Dylan, Lady Gaga and Ed Sheeran. (Be sure to check the schedule while you're here). Shopping, restaurants and Camden nightlife are j
transit: We are a 5 minute walk from the Jubilee line (Swiss Cottage - 8 mins to Bond St) and two Northern Line Underground Stations (Chalk Farm, Belsize Park). There are good bus links direct to the West End, plus close to the overground station (Finchley and Frognal). Hampstead Heath is a 20 minute stroll away if you are feeling energetic. Major London stations: Kings Cross, St Pancras, Euston and Waterloo Station are also on the tube lines. Hampstead, with its famous village and wilderness heath, is two tube stops away. Regular buses stop outside Chalk Farm station and Swiss Cottage (it really has a 170-year old swiss cottage!), Camden Town and Central London. There is also a taxi stand. Black cabs frequently pass. SUPERMARKETS We are surrounded by lots of supermarkets all within 5 minutes walking distance. (Tescos, M&S, Co-Op and Budgens) 3 minutes walk to England's Lane - amazing gastro pubs, cafés, deli's, supermarket and chemists.  5 minute's walk to Primrose Hill high street. 10 minutes
access: Small studio with bathroom (bath with shower).  ROOMSERVICE Delivery from lovely restaurants to the Studio - order online from the following: 1) Deliveroo 2) Jinn 3) UberEATS
interaction: Will meet you at the studio to hand over keys, show you how things work and offer assistance or advice, or tips for places to go or things to do!  Will leave my number and am happy for you to call or text should you need to know anything more. Aside from that, we'll leave you in peace!
house_rules: Please treat the Studio as if it were your own. Also please be respectful to our neighbours between 11pm and 7am and no smoking.

name: Lovely Bright Flat Euston Sleeps 4
summary: Lovely one bedroom flat in Euston with en-suite bathroom and high ceilings. Open plan living area with a fully equipped kitchen with washer/dryer and dishwasher All towels linen + wifi included. Great transport links. 3 mins Euston, 5 mins Kings Cross, 10 mins Camden.
space: This lovely one double bedroom flat is in the heart of Euston, just a stone’s throw away from all of the fun in London. With an open plan kitchen + living area complete with a sofa-bed for two more people, this flat can comfortably sleep 4.  Situated on the second floor, this light and modern flat is just a few minutes walk to Euston station and 20 minutes walk to Oxford Street. Newly refurbished [November 2014] this flat was designed to feel bright and spacious with the fully equipped open plan kitchen + living area.  The double bedroom faces to the back of the building and has an en-suite bathroom with a shower, toilet and sink. If there is anything we can do to make your stay extra special please do let us know. Guests have sole use of the flat which has a fully equipped kitchen, complete with a washer/dryer fridge/freezer oven/hob and all pots pans and utensils for home cooking. Soft cotton towels provided and bed linen is made up for your arrival Wi-Fi and Freeview TV included wit

neighborhood_overview: Amazing transport links! Easy access to shops, museums, theatres and all the fun in London. A stones throw away from Euston tube and train station. Walking distance to Camden and a few minutes on the tube to the west end.
notes: We can provide a baby cot/highchair so please do let us know when booking. Please bring bedding for the cot. Please ensure you have adequate travel insurance prior to the commencement of your holiday and you have read and understood the cancellation policy.
transit: It doesn't get better than this! Euston station is a 2 minute walk, Camden station is a 10 minute walk, and Kings Cross a 5 minute walk. Euston station runs the Victoria line tube which runs to many landmarks in the capital. Euston also has a huge variety of buses that go all over London, including the West End and Covent Garden, which are also 20 mins walk away.

host_about:
Hi I'm Jenny, and we look forward to welcoming you soon!

From rentals to estate agency to management of my own houses, as a property developer I refurbish and build new homes in central London and East Sussex.  The homes will have everything you need for a short or longer stay. From my love of travel, I know how important it is to stay in a 'home from home'  so we want all of our guests to be happy and comfortable. 

My team and I are there to help you, so please do ask if you have any particular requirements and we will try our best to make it happen.

We hope to welcome you soon!

name: Upscale Mayfair Flat with a Balcony Overlooking Green Park
summary: Open the blinds to reveal stunning views of the leafy park that is adjacent to Buckingham Palace. This sophisticated flat is in a listed building in one of the city’s most sought-after postcodes, with stylish furnishings and artwork throughout.
space: Newly refurbished two double bedroom apartment in a listed period Mayfair block, moments from Piccadilly and the open spaces of Green Park and the tube. The property is situated on the second floor with a lift and benefits from large windows which offer excellent light throughout . The apartment has been subject to a refurbishment (November 2017) and comprises entrance hall, large living/dining room overlooking Green Park with wall mounted Smart TV, two double bedrooms, full fitted kitchen with all appliances and a limestone bathroom.
description: Open the blinds to reveal stunning views of the leafy park that is adjacent to Buckingham Palace. This sophisticated flat is in a listed building in one of the city’s most sought-after postcodes, with stylish furnishings and artwork throughout.
neighborhood_overview: Mayfair is London's most fashionable destination. With London's finest buildings, the highest concentration of luxury hotels, top restaurants, bars, shopping, open spaces, and hidden treasures all nestled together in a beautiful village setting.
notes: Traffic noise free - The apartment has triple glazing windows installed to all rooms to make sure you enjoy a relaxing and noise free stay. There is one double and one twin bedrooms in the house. Both bedrooms are spacious with colourful homely touches. There is also plenty of storage space for guests to store all their belongings. The main bathroom is bright and contemporary in style and has a bath. The bathroom will always come stocked with plenty of fluffy towels and all the essential toiletries such as shampoo, shower gel and hand soap that you need to ensure that you have a comfortable stay in London. The apartment comes with a washing machine, a clothes rack for drying your laundry, an iron and ironing board.
transit: The nearest tube station is Green Park Station which is about 2 minutes walk. Green Park station is served by the Jubilee line, between Bond Street and Westminster, the Piccadilly line, between Piccadilly Circus and Hyde Park Corner, and the Victoria line, between Victoria and Oxford Circus.
access: The apartment is your own. Cleaned professionally with fresh luxury linens, it's prepared for each new visitor.
interaction: For your queries, please send me a text or message me via the platform and I will respond to you as soon as possible.
house_rules: Quiet time after 9pm No shoes allowed in the flat

name: Luxury en-suite in Fulham
summary: Light, comfortable and brilliant for buses/tubes. If weather permits breakfast outside in south facing garden
space: When friends stay they say it is rather like staying in a country house.
description: Light, comfortable and brilliant for buses/tubes. If weather permits breakfast outside in south facing garden When friends stay they say it is rather like staying in a country house. Guests will be able to access all of our house Nicholas has taken private tours around London.  We can advise on best times to attend current Exhibitions pre-book and avoid crowds Fulham has a very old history.  Eel Brook Common was originally calledHell Brook with an underground stream.  The old Bishop of London's Palace is down the road with a wonderful walled kitchen garden.  There was the largest womens prison there. The men were housed in what is now Tate Britain and and taken under a tunnel to the boats on the Thames which would transport them to Australia. Hurlingham Club (where I play tennis) is set in 42 acres of garden on the Thames which I can take you to.  Capability Brown & Repton designed the gardens No 11,  211 and 22 buses go down King's Road & to Peter Jones No 414, & 14 go down Fulham Roa
neighborhood_overview: Fulham has a very old history.  Eel Brook Common was originally calledHell Brook with an underground stream.  The old Bishop of London's Palace is down the road with a wonderful walled kitchen garden.  There was the largest womens prison there. The men were housed in what is now Tate Britain and and taken under a tunnel to the boats on the Thames which would transport them to Australia. Hurlingham Club (where I play tennis) is set in 42 acres of garden on the Thames which I can take you to.  Capability Brown & Repton designed the gardens
notes: Our street is very short and at the end is Eel Brook Common.  We are 5 minutes away from Fulham Broadway Underground Station (District Line) There is Boots,  Chemist, Sainsbury's and amazing cinema with 9 screens among other shops and also 5 minutes from Marks & Spencer's & Waitrose and North End Road Market  We are 5 minutes away from Waitrose & Marks & Spencers Please note off street parking not available. Parking on street pay as you go
transit: No 11,  211 and 22 buses go down King's Road & to Peter Jones No 414, & 14 go down Fulham Road to South Kensington  (all 5 mins walk)
access: Guests will be able to access all of our house
interaction: Nicholas has taken private tours around London.  We can advise on best times to attend current Exhibitions pre-book and avoid crowds
host_about:
Married.  Worked at BBC for years and then went freelance and worked on Michael Palin's travel series.  My husband, Nicholas is an author. Live in Central London, Fulham.  Great position for transport.  Fulham Broadway (District Line) is 8 minutes away.  No 11 bus is in Harwood Road next door which goes to King's Road. No 211 (King's Road) and No. 14 (to the West End) Piccadilly, Royal Academy and all the theatres are at the bus stop outside Fulham Broadway Station.
Very good local restaurants.  We have two Cotes (a French chain amazing good value and great food) and Megan's and a very popular with the young and the White Horse Pub (know as the Sloaney Pony) on Parsons Green again all less than 10 minutes walk away.
I play tennis at Hurlingham (5 minutes down the road by car).  It is a beautiful club set in 42 acres on the banks of the River Thames by Putney Bridge.  I can take you there as my guests

house_rules: 1. Shoes-off policy. You may wear your indoor flip flops but please leave your shoes in the hallway. 2. Vegetarian only. The microwave can be used to heat up vegetarian food only. If you wish to cook during your stay, please speak to the host.  3. No smoking. No alcohol. No recreational drugs. 4. Enjoy your music...but keep the volume at reasonable levels. 5. Clean up after yourself...everyday, every time you leave the apartment.  6. Keep the noise to the minimum in the common areas of the building. It is "Quiet Time" after 10 pm.
host_about: I have a lifelong dream: to travel the world full-time! Someday, when I am financially secure, I hope to do it. Until such time, I will continue in my well-paying job as an independent finance consultant and travel when I get an opportunity. My love for travelling is what introduced me to Airbnb. I started as a sceptical user, and I am now a host.  I love meeting people from different cultures; I readily embrace diversity, and most people find me warm and welcoming.  I am a stickler for cleanliness (OCD!!) which makes me both a gracious host and a perfect guest (depending on the role I play).

There are many local Cypriot restaurants and Five Guys for those that like burgers.  There is also a large Vue Cinema showing the latest films.
notes: We are a child friendly home. Please note we have a young baby in the property but he will not disturb your stay.
transit: We are a 10-15 min walk to Wood Green station which takes you on the Piccadilly line into Kings Cross / St Pancras Stations in 20mins or Leicester Square in 25. You can also get directly to Heathrow Airport, all terminals in 1hr 15mins direct.  Other local stations include Bowes Park overground which takes you to Moorgate Station in the City in 22mins. You can park outside the house but there are parking restrictions Monday to Friday between 11-1pm. At these times you would need to move your car to a local location where you can pay for parking. £1.40 per hr.

name: Chiswick, West London, attractive flat.
summary: A pleasant, well-decorated, nicely furnished, roomy 2nd floor flat on a quiet street in Chiswick, an attractive West London "village." A nine minute walk from two District Line underground stations (Turnham Green and Chiswick Park) and from a high street of attractive shops, bars and restaurants. There is also a local bus stop two minutes away, and the 94 bus into town is just five minutes walk away. By tube or bus, you are less than half an hour from the West End, the centre of London.

name: Modern room + private bathroom in large apartment
summary: Hello, Thank you for visiting my listing and hope to welcome you to my home. I have beautiful well decorated spare bedroom and bathroom in an oversized apartment located in Zone 1, right outside one of London’s buzzing weekend food markets and walking distance to transport links and some of the key London attractions. If you are looking to experience what it is like to live in London while visiting, trendy Bermondsey is the perfect location to call home away from home.
space: Your private bedroom has a comfortable standard king size bed and built in wardrobes. You will have fresh clean linen, and access to other amenities including hair dryer, ironing board and iron. The bedroom faces an internal courtyard which is quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of London. You will have access to your own private bathroom which is located right next to your bedroom. The bathroom comes with a shower with tub and comes with essential (toiletries and towels)  There is a large open plan kitchen & living space available for getting your day started or unwinding in the evenings. You will have access to the fridge, microwave, toaster and tea & coffee facilities. The kitchen is supplied with essentials to get your day started (tea, coffee, cereal, porridge, milk) You have the living area and balcony which you can use to relax and unwind at the end of the day. I am usually around in the evenings and available to catch up then.

It is a short walk from all the restaurants located on Bermondsey Street, micro brewers on Druid Street and a stones throw away from the river Thames where you can walk along the SouthBank and enjoy some great London attractions including Tower Bridge, Tower of London and The Shard.
transit: There is easy access to the Underground, Bus and National Rail. London Bridge station is a short walk away via Bermondsey Street London Bridge Station - Jubilee Line: Easy and quick access to Central London (e.g. Waterloo, Westminster, Green Park, Paddington) - Northern Line: Easy and quick access to North London (e.g. Old Street, Angel, Kings Cross) - National Rail: Direct Access to Waterloo East and Charing Cross  Tower Bridge Road - If you want easy access to East London, there are direct buses to Liverpool Street and Shoreditch - Bus Stop E: 78 to Shoreditch, 42 to Liverpool Street
interaction: I am available and more than happy to help with your stay, but also understand sometimes you need your own space to unwind at the end of the day. I do work full time during the week and I am typically out of the apartment during the working week. More than happy to catch up in person early morning or in the evening. There may be the odd day where I am lucky enough to work from home. You will probably see me more often during the weekend. I am also available on email/phone if you have any problems.
house_rules: I am looking forward to welcoming you into my home which I treat as a calm and peaceful oasis to unwind and relax. In order for both of us to enjoy the time spent sharing the apartment, I have set out a few ways of living together which should help make your stay a great experience for everyone Using the kitchen - An open plan kitchen is available, including dining space. Use of kitchen is limited to light meal prep (breakfast, salad, sandwich, etc) and use of the microwave oven, fridge, kettle, toaster and coffee machine. Quiet time - As I get older I need my sleep. So it's quiet time between 11:00 pm and 6am. This is probably more important during the working week. - I love a good party night out in London, however please respect my neighbours and enter the apartment with minimal noise Additional guests - No additional unregistered overnight guests are allowed other than those named on the Airbnb booking Entertaining - Happy for friends dropping by to pick up guests, but the shared l
host_about: Originally from Australia and have called London home since 2009. During working hours, I am a management consultant, working for one of the Big 4 accounting/consulting firms in Canary Wharf. Outside of working hours, my interests range from traveling for pleasure, museums, food, friends, shopping and generally relaxing.

name: Discover Shoreditch & Hackney "Apple"
summary: **** Instagram @host.tay **** The Old Nags Head Pub, recently renovated for the comfort of Airbnb guests. Located in the heart of east London within close proximity to, Shoreditch, Colombia Rd, Broadway Market and the rest of London. Tastefully decorated with Anatolian rugs & Moroccan mosaics.
space: The apartment has recently been renovated so everything in is brand new and tastefully decorated. This apartment was formerly the Nags Head Pub which opened in 1706 & ran as a drinking establishment until its closure in 1991. It has now been converted into a residential apartment, with four rooms sharing two bathrooms and kitchen. The apartment is shared by a maximum of 10 people, who all are fellow Airbnb guests. A self contained apartment, it's a warm and welcoming atmosphere and a lovely place to make friends with fellow travellers. The Apple room is located on the second floor & looks out on to the front of the property. At the front is hackney farm.
description: **** Instagram @host.tay **** The Old Nags Head Pub, recently renovated for the comfort of Airbnb guests. Located in the heart of east London within close proximity to, Shoreditch, Colombia Rd, Broadway Market and the rest of London. Tastefully decorated with Anatolian rugs & Moroccan mosaics. The apartment has recently been renovated so everything in is brand new and tastefully decorated. This apartment was formerly the Nags Head Pub which opened in 1706 & ran as a drinking establishment until its closure in 1991. It has now been converted into a residential apartment, with four rooms sharing two bathrooms and kitchen. The apartment is shared by a maximum of 10 people, who all are fellow Airbnb guests. A self contained apartment, it's a warm and welcoming atmosphere and a lovely place to make friends with fellow travellers. The Apple room is located on the second floor & looks out on to the front of the property. At the front is hackney farm. Guests can check in anytime after 2pm.  At
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Bethnal Green a vibrant and energetic part of London. Bethnal Green is in zone 2 of the tube map and on the central Line gaining easy access across the capital. With Bethnal Green and east London you get a true sense of London away from the tourist hubs. It also has the advantage of being very close to the attractions so if that's what you fancy you can have the best of both. I would definitely recommend strolling down to the famous Colombia market (get there early or the crowd can be a bit too much), or pop off to Brick lane market and the Old Truman Brewery (catch a walking tour). Broadway Market is very popular & a five minute walk from the apartment.
transit: The room is in the perfect location for public transport. Hoxton Overground station is a 8 minute walk & central line (Bethnal Green Station) is located within a 15 minute walk Cambridge Heath Station is a 9 minute walk. . Bus stop is right outside the door with 4 routes running. The overground is a five minute walk away. Or you can take the various bus routes into Liverpool street. Personally i would recommend hiring a bike which is the fastest way round London. You could drive but I don't recommend it, it's expensive and a nightmare to park.
access: Guests can check in anytime after 2pm.  At 2pm the keys will be placed in a lockbox and the guests can collect them with the code that is provided.  If guests have an early arrival then they have the option to leave their luggage between 11am and 11:30am.
interaction: I'll be at the apartment most days from 11am to 4pm outside of this time guests can contact me through the app, on whatts app or via phone. Please try and refrain from calling me after 10pm unless it's an emergency (I do like my sleep) and please consider the time difference.

name: 2x Double rooms and sofa bed in heart of Fulham
summary: Recently refurbished, warm and cosy, studio flat with roof terrace.  Located at the rear of the Queens Tennis Club and within 10mins walk from Barons Court and West Kensington Underground Stations.  Flat is arranged over two floors and provides a very well lit, clean kitchen area. There are 2x double beds, 1x very good sofa bed (and sofa) and 1x bathroom.  The flat will be yours for the duration of your stay.  Let me know if you need anything.

name: Page Street · 2BR Westminster flat close to Buckingham Palace
summary: My flat is within walking distance (5-12 minutes) of 4 tube stations: Pimlico, St James’s Park, Victoria, Westminster, also landmarks such as Big Ben and Buckingham Palace. It suits business travellers, families, couples and has cooking facilities.
space: This bright, spacious flat is flooded with natural light. It is accessed via a lift and has step free access. Boasting a king size bed, double bed and double sofa bed, this flat has space enough to comfortably sleep up to 5 people. The kitchen is fully equipped with toaster, kettle and full size oven. Evening entertainment is ready and waiting with a flat screen TV and Wi-Fi. The modern bathroom is fully fitted with a shower and complimentary towels and shampoo so you can feel at home right away. There is WiFi throughout the whole flat. A hairdryer is provided. This home is managed by The London Residents Club. From affordable 1-bed flats to grand family homes, The London Residents Club is proud to offer our guests a wide selection of top-quality properties across London, all underpinned with hotel-standard hospitality services. The London Residents Club is pleased to provide: • Hotel-quality linen and towels • Bathroom essentials • Professional cleaning services

neighborhood_overview: STATIONS (WALKING) 5 minutes to Pimlico (Victoria line) 7 minutes to St Jame’s Park (Circle and District line) 12 minutes to Victoria (Circle, District and Victoria line and National Rail) 12 minutes to Westminster (Circle, District and Jubilee line and Boats) AIRPORTS Gatwick in 30 minutes from Victoria Heathrow in 40 minutes from St James's Park
notes: Linen, towels and bathroom essentials are all provided, as is a hairdryer. There is WiFi throughout the whole flat. If there is anything I have missed out or if you have any questions at all please don't hesitate to get in touch!
transit: SIGHTS River Thames (5 minutes walk) Tate Britian (5 minutes walk) MI6 (15 minutes walk) Buckingham Palace (10 minutes walk) Westminster Abbey (10 minutes walk) Tower Bridge (20 minutes by tube) SHOPPING Oxford street (3 stops on Victoria Line or 25 minutes walk) Regent street (20 minutes walk or 10 minutes by bus) Harrods (4 stop by tube or 15 minutes by bus) Selfridges (3 stops by tube or 15 minutes by bus)
access: Guests will have access to the whole flat. One of the London Residents Club team will always be on hand to check you in personally, provide you with at least one set of keys and give you a tour of the property.
interaction: A member of the London Residents Club team will be at the flat on your arrival to welcome you, give you keys and help settle you in. The London Residents Club is always on hand to make your visit as enjoyable as possible and pride ourselves on going the extra mile so please don't hesitate to drop us a line or an email. Whether you need help with the flat, a recommendation or somewhere to leave your suitcase, The London Residents Club is here to help!
house_rules: The London Residents Club wants you to have a fantastic stay, so encourage you to see the space as a home away from home - treating it as though it is yours! There are, of course, a few things we politely ask guests to note before their arrival and throughout their stay: • Maximum group size: 5 • Strictly no smoking, no pets, no parties • No candles • Dispose of rubbish appropriately • Keep the property clean and tidy • Whilst washing up and stripping the beds at check out would be appreciated, it is by no means expected • Please keep the noise down and respect other neighbours in the building • Please remember to close all windows and doors when leaving the space • Ensure the heating is maintained at an appropriate temperature throughout the stay. If the heating is excessive, i.e. over £100 per month, you will be expected to cover this cost *Please note that once the booking is confirmed we will arrange a check-in time. If you arrive 2 hours after the agreed time you will be subject t
host_about:
Hi there! We are The London Residents Club, a short-term rental management provider servicing a quality selection of homes in London. 

We take pride in helping busy hosts across London rent out their homes. Our service to our guests includes:

-Fast response time and support 24/7
-Personal Check In service
-Professional cleaning before your stay
-Quality linen, towels and essentials provided

Our phone line (+ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ) is available 24/7 for your feedback, questions and maintenance support. If you need anything, just call us and we’ll be happy to help.

name: Lovely private room for 1 in great location
summary: My place is close to all the attractions of Central London - 30 mins away. You’ll love my place because of the location, it's comfortable, newly refurbished, modern and clean. It is is good for solo adventurers and close to the areas of Camberwell, Vauxhall, London Bridge and Greenwich. Bus is the best way to travel from my place. The nearest bus stop is 5 minutes away and takes you into Central London in 30 mins. There is also an overland train station 7 mins walk away.
description: My place is close to all the attractions of Central London - 30 mins away. You’ll love my place because of the location, it's comfortable, newly refurbished, modern and clean. It is is good for solo adventurers and close to the areas of Camberwell, Vauxhall, London Bridge and Greenwich. Bus is the best way to travel from my place. The nearest bus stop is 5 minutes away and takes you into Central London in 30 mins. There is also an overland train station 7 mins walk away. You will have access to all areas of the apartment; bathroom, lounge and kitchen areas. I've lived in London for 20 years and will be happy to advise on the best places to eat, drink and visit during your stay in London. I live in the cool and upcoming Peckham. The area is vibrant and bustling with great bars and restaurants within walking distance. The area is well connected by bus and overland train. The 453 takes you straight into the West End of London in 30 mins - Westminster Abbey, Whitehall, Trafalgar Square, So
neighborhood_overview: I live in the cool and upcoming Peckham. The area is vibrant and bustling with great bars and restaurants within walking distance.
transit: The area is well connected by bus and overland train. The 453 takes you straight into the West End of London in 30 mins - Westminster Abbey, Whitehall, Trafalgar Square, Soho, Covent Garden. The 436/36 takes you to Vauxhall in 15-20 mins. The overland train takes you to London Bridge in 10 mins.
access: You will have access to all areas of the apartment; bathroom, lounge and kitchen areas.
interaction: I've lived in London for 20 years and will be happy to advise on the best places to eat, drink and visit during your stay in London.
host_about:
I originate in the North-West of England, but have lived in London for 20 years - I'm an honourary Londoner now!! 
I love travel, cooking, football, live music, meeting new people and enjoying all that London has to offer.  My favourite places in the world are Ibiza, Berlin and Provence.
I really look forward to meeting you!

name: (26MOR-B)PRIVATE ROOM FOR 4 PPL NEAR RIVERSIDE
summary: Nice private room available for up to 4 people in a 4 Bedroom apartment. Great location, only 1 Min walk from Shadwell DLR Station. We provide fresh bed linen and towels Please note you will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom with other guests. Feel free to book.
space: Room comes with comfortable double bed , double sofa bed , bedside table with lamp, wardrobe, big windows with lots of light, laminated floor. Kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need (fridge-freezer, cooker with 4 burners, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, cutlery, plates, glasses, mugs, pots, pans etc.…) We provide tea, coffee and sugar  There is a bathroom and separate toilet.
description: Nice private room available for up to 4 people in a 4 Bedroom apartment. Great location, only 1 Min walk from Shadwell DLR Station. We provide fresh bed linen and towels Please note you will be sharing the kitchen and bathroom with other guests. Feel free to book. Room comes with comfortable double bed , double sofa bed , bedside table with lamp, wardrobe, big windows with lots of light, laminated floor. Kitchen is fully fitted with everything you need (fridge-freezer, cooker with 4 burners, oven, microwave, kettle, toaster, cutlery, plates, glasses, mugs, pots, pans etc.…) We provide tea, coffee and sugar  There is a bathroom and separate toilet. There is key box set up next to the apartment entrance. Once the booking is confirmed, we will provide you with the full check in information. Access to kitchen including fridge / freezer, washing machine, hob and oven. All plates, cutlery and cooking essentials provided. Clean towels are included along with bedding. I correspond with all my
neighborhood_overview: It's the most fun place to be in London. Brick Lane has a party atmosphere every evening and this flat is just far enough away that you don't get the noise. Shoreditch is 15 minutes walk away. It has a great night life at the weekend. The most exciting restaurants, cafés and bars in London open in this neighbourhood. The area has a rich and fascinating history, which can be enjoyed through one of the walking tours available. The Jack the Ripper tour is very popular. There are many artists, galleries and artist studios nearby. One can even go on a tour of the artist Banksy's work in the area. You are also 15 minutes walk to the Tower of London and Tower Bridge. These are very popular for a first time visitor to London. You can actually get a boat from there to anywhere else on the river for £6. You can also get on a historic routemaster bus from there to Trafalgar Square. The Gherkin is 15 minutes walk away. It's probably London's most iconic skyscraper. There's a lot to see and do in t
notes: House Rules:  We have a no smoking and No party policy in all our properties. Please obey the rules! See below a list of fees:  Smoking Fee -  £200.00  Party Fee - up to £500.00  Lost key fee – £50.00 You are welcome to check in from 4pm until 10pm free of charge, after 10pm it counts as Late check in, please see the prices below: Late check in (for rooms) £10.00 from 10pm  Late check in (for whole flat) £40.00 from 10pm  IMPORTANT! Please let us know if you arrive after midnight!  LATE CHECK OUT is unfortunately not possible.  If we find out you checked out later than 11am we will have to charge you:  (Rooms) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £10, between 1pm - 4pm is £20.00  (Whole flat) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £30, between 1pm - 4pm is £50.00 EARLY CHECK IN is unfortunately not possible. If we find out you checked out earlier than 4pm we will have to charge you:  Early check in fee (for rooms) £10.00 Early check in fee (for flats) £30.
transit: Whitechapel station 10 minutes away,. Shadwell DLR 1 minute away . Bethnal Green tube station 15 minutes away . Aldgate East station is 5 mins away. The bus stop is a 1 minute walk away and the N25 bus from there goes to Soho and Oxford St and runs 24 hours a day. Within 5-15 minutes walk you can get to these stations: Aldgate East, Aldgate, Liverpool St, Tower Hill, Whitechapel, Shoreditch High St.
access: There is key box set up next to the apartment entrance. Once the booking is confirmed, we will provide you with the full check in information. Access to kitchen including fridge / freezer, washing machine, hob and oven. All plates, cutlery and cooking essentials provided. Clean towels are included along with bedding.
interaction: I correspond with all my guests on Airbnb. My assistant or I will help you to check you in and get you situated. If you have any issues or questions you can contact us at any time. We have our Letting office 20 minutes away from property and can assist you anytime.

Please let us know if you arrive after midnight!  LATE CHECK OUT is unfortunately not possible.  If we find out you checked out later than 11am we will have to charge you:  (Rooms) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £10, between 1pm - 4pm is £20.00  (Whole flat) – Late check out fee if checking out at 12 or 1pm is £30, between 1pm - 4pm is £50.00 EARLY CHECK IN is unfortunately not possible. If we find out you checked out earlier than 4pm we will have to charge you:  Early check in fee (for rooms) £10.00 Early check in fee (for flats) £30.00 SHOULD YOU B
host_about:
Hi my name is Emran and I am very happy to be Host on Air Bnb.
I  managing properties in East and Central London in for few years and that gave me a lot of experience and knowledge to be a Good Host on this amazing website . 
Properties are my passion so whenever you are looking for short or long term stay in London ill be able to help you . 
Ill advise you if you looking even to buy properties Here . 

I love meeting people from all over the world and introducing them to my wonderful city. 
I hope you will find my apartments both comfortable and stimulating. 
You will find a warm welcome and a ready smile.

name: Large 6 bedroom family home Pinner. Sleeps 10
summary: My place is close to Pinner tube station, Wembley Stadium, Warner Bros HarryPotter Experience and parks. 25 mins to Baker Street. You’ll love my place because of the quiet location. My place is good for business travellers, and family groups (with kids). It has a very large garden that gets the sun for most of the day. Off street parking for 2 or 3 cars. All the rooms are generous sizes and all the beds are full size. A cot is available.
space: Spacious house in quiet and secluded area of West London. Great transport links to M1, M40, Pinner Tube and Mainline stations at Headstone Lane and Harrow. 100% five star rating by all guests. 25mins to Baker Street on Metropolitan Tube line. Short taxi ride, bus or tube journey from London Heathrow Airport. Close to high speed coach service to Oxford and only 20 miles to Windsor Castle.

name: Cosy double room in a flat next to Hampstead Heath
summary: Maisonette flat over too two floors with roof terrace. 7 minutes away from Belsize Park tube station, 5 minutes from Gospel oak train station and the 24, 46 and C11 bus leave from the corner of the road, all in zone 2. Hampstead Heath and lovely restaurants and pubs are just a 5 minute walk away, Camden market is a 20 minute walk away. We have 3 cats, 1 small dog and 2 guinea pigs so guests must be animal lovers.

Keats House is also there and is open daily. A little further walk up and you reach Hampstead Village with it many boutiques and cafes and busy high street. 20 minutes walk from the flat or 5 minute bus ride gets you to the famous Camden Market. On the tube you can easily get to the west end, soho and south bank or east to the Barbican or Angel, all in about 20 minutes. Gospel Oak train station is on the same road and the 46, C11 and 24 buses all go from around the corner, the 24 bus also goes through the west end to Victoria and is 24 hours. name: Fantastic 1 Bedroom Apartment in Whitechapel
summary: Lovely 1 bedroom apartment in Whitechapel. The flat is bright, with large windows, and a balcony overlooking the London skyline. Less than a 10 minute walk from Brick Lane, the flat offers quick access to many local restaurants, pop up galleries, a local cinema, as well as famous areas such as theTruman Brewery,  and the Old Spitalfields Market. Perfect for couples, friends or even business visitors to the city - everyone is welcome!

neighborhood_overview: Whitechapel is a really vibrant area which is constantly evolving. You can walk to some of the best parts of East London - Victoria Park, Columbia Road Market and Shoreditch are all so close. There are some beautiful old buildings, great pubs and it's only a short tube ride into the centre of town which make it a really great place to stay. The surrounding areas and Aldgate itself are fantastic for shopping. Aldgate High Street has a range of well-known eateries and traditional pubs. Meanwhile, just around the corner is the entrance to Brick Lane, where you can find a plethora of bohemian and vintage clothing shops. There are two popular markets in the area. The first of which, Spitalfields, London’s oldest market is now a 7 day shopping destination with style, arts and traders markets. Conversely, Petticoat Lane Market is only open on a Sunday, but it is worth the wait. It is a world famous market and you really could find anything here. Supporting an alternative scene within the hear
transit: The London Eye: 35 minutes on the tube The Tower of London: 12 minutes on the tube Heathrow Airport: 90 minutes on the tube Gatwick Airport: 70 minutes by tube and train Kings Cross: 23 minutes on the tube National Gallery: 32 minutes on the tube
