name: Yellow Door Studio London
summary: Walk to the famous Kings Road from this stylish and unique little studio apartment with private entrance within Victorian building in London . A cosy, self-contained space with kitchenette and modern shower room. Perfect for solo travellers looking for a private spot. An ideal base from which to enjoy all London has to offer.
space: A cosy and tranquil studio apartment in the centre of Parsons Green, Fulham.  This cute little apartment is accessed via its own front door, has a super comfortable bed, beautiful shower room and kitchenette with light cooking facilities. Guests will enjoy complete privacy and a comfortable, relaxing stay with fast fibre optic WiFi. Tea and coffee, continental breakfast, freshly-laundered Egyptian cotton linens, towels, bath robe, slippers and Molton Brown toiletries are provided to ensure your stay is a pleasurable experience.
description: Walk to the famous Kings Road from this stylish and unique little studio apartment with private entrance within Victorian building in London . A cosy, self-contained space with kitchenette and modern shower room. Perfect for solo travellers looking for a private spot. An ideal base from which to enjoy all London has to offer. A cosy and tranquil studio apartment in the centre of Parsons Green, Fulham.  This cute little apartment is accessed via its own front door, has a super comfortable bed, beautiful shower room and kitchenette with light cooking facilities. Guests will enjoy complete privacy and a comfortable, relaxing stay with fast fibre optic WiFi. Tea and coffee, continental breakfast, freshly-laundered Egyptian cotton linens, towels, bath robe, slippers and Molton Brown toiletries are provided to ensure your stay is a pleasurable experience. Keys are usually collected from a secure code-accessed Lock Box outside the property. The access code will be sent on the day of arrival.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in a convenient and safe location on Chesilton Road, one of Fulham's most idyllic streets, moments from Parsons Green Station (District Line, Zone 2) and in-between the large open spaces of the Riverside Bishops Park with its urban beach and Parsons Green. There is a Waitrose supermarket nearby as is the famous White Horse Pub, The Brown Cow Restaurant, Amuse Bouche Champagne Bar and numerous interesting independent shops, cafes and restaurants located on the Fulham Road, New Kings Road and Parsons Green are very close by. The studio is conveniently located for sports enthusiasts with Fulham FC, Chelsea FC and The Hurlingham Club all within 10 mins walk. Fulham Broadway is a short stroll away where there is a Wholefoods Supermarket, a Vue cinema, David Lloyd gym and a plethora of other amenities. There is a friendly and well- stocked convenience store a mere 30 seconds away from the property.
notes: The property is not suitable for people with mobility issues due to the higher than average doorstep. The exterior of the building is protected by 24 hour CCTV. This is a small space - please check the floor plan in the listing photos for dimensions.
transit: The studio is moments (3 min walk) from Fulham Road which is serviced by numerous bus routes taking you to all parts of London. Parsons Green (District Line zone 2) is the closest Tube station and is 5-7 mins walk, from there you can be in central London within 15-20mins. The A3 and the M4 are approximately 10 minutes away.
access: Keys are usually collected from a secure code-accessed Lock Box outside the property. The access code will be sent on the day of arrival. Check in is from 4:00pm. Due to the cleaners schedule early check-ins and late check-outs are not possible. We are unable to hold luggage prior to check in. Guests have sole use and access to the property during their stay.
interaction: As your host I am always on hand via telephone to help with any enquiries. I have also created a guidebook full of great recommendations of my favourite places to eat, drink, shop and relax locally.
house_rules: Guests are invited to enjoy the apartment as a home from home and respect the neighbouring residents right to the quiet enjoyment of their homes. No smoking in or around the building. Smokers are required to walk at least 100m from the building if they wish to smoke.  No additional/overnight guests. No third party bookings. Guests found to have additional/overnight guests who were not declared at the point of booking, and photo I.D. supplied, will be charged an additional nightly rate equivalent to that paid by the named guest for each night spent at the property.  Guests must keep the property secure during their stay and properly secure the property on departure by way of securing all windows and locking the door with the key.  The apartment is not to be used for filming, photography or recording with the intention of broadcast or publishing in a public arena.

name: Wonderful Chelsea
summary: Available twin/double/triple private rooms in a beautiful light and airy apartment to be shared with my family (mum, dad and 3 kids) in the heart of Chelsea. Use of large kitchen, living room and bathrooms. Close to many museums and galleries (science, V&A, natural history, war, Saatchi), Harrods, shops, bars, cafe', Chelsea stadium. Parks are just a stroll away (Hyde Park, Kensington Park). Buses, night bus and South Kensington tube station near by.

summary: My place is close to Kensal Green (7 minutes walk), Kensal Rise (6 minutes walk), Graceland's, The Island Pub, Minkies Deli, Tesco Express, a local grocer, Italian deli & many other places for shopping & eating! There are also local parks near & is only one stop on the tube from Queen's Park. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the location, it's only 20 minutes on the tube into central London & it is very quiet. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

neighborhood_overview: I love this neighborhood. It is full of young families and couples making it a very quiet but extremely up and coming part of London. Kensal Green Tube is only a 7 minute walk and from there you can get to any place in London you desire. Across the street from the apartment is a great local shop carrying all of the essentials, a wonderful little shop for gifts, one of my favorite cafe's and places for coffee and an Italian grocer and deli. Up the road, about 5-7 minutes is Chamberlayne Road where you will find Kensal Rise overground, more shops, restaurants, pubs and bars.
notes: The bed is a double/queen. IKEA considers it a queen, I consider it a double :-). There is an option to check in late (after 5pm) but there will be an additional fee charged.
transit: Uber is everywhere around this area. If you don't have the uber app, I suggest downloading it and use code 'jessicac51' to get a free ride up to £10. With the tube only a short walk down the road, you shouldn't have any problems getting around. Purchase a pay as you go Oyster Card at the station to make your traveling that much easier.
access: All areas of the apartment and the shared rooftop patio upstairs one floor.
interaction: I live in the States most of the time but will have a liaison available to help with any issues.
house_rules: - Please respect my place and treat it as if it were your own home. Be mindful of the people in the apartment below you when walking around. Absolutely no smoking or parties.

summary: My place is close to The Sherlock Holmes Museum, Alfies Antique Market, and The Truscott Arms. You’ll love my place because of the location. My place is good for couples, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups.
space: Living & Eating The first floor comprises a large, very light and comfortable living room, dining room (seating six) and adjoining fully fitted kitchen for convivial living and entertaining. A small study nook is located in the turn of the entrance staircase, for peaceful work and writing. Bedrooms & Bathrooms The top floor has two bedrooms - the master with kingsize (5ft wide) bed and en suite bathroom with bath. The second bedroom has twin beds, and up a short flight of stairs is the third, small single bedroom. These two are served by the family bathroom, with shower stall. Access & Layout The maisonette principally occupies two floors. This excludes the top staircase to the third bedroom and the entrance staircase from the apartment door. There are two flights of stairs to this door from the street level entrance.

neighborhood_overview: The maisonette is located on a quiet residential road, a few minutes’ walk to the famous and beautiful canals and boat life of Little Venice, a wonderful peaceful contrast to the hustle and bustle of London, which itself is easily found - Warwick Avenue tube is a mere 300m walk from the flat, which whisks you into Oxford St in 10 mins, direct along the Bakerloo Line.
notes: Please note:  - lead guest must be 30 or older  - strictly no smoking or pets

host_about:
My name is Guy and I, along with my small dedicated team based in Chelsea, London, manage a collection of handpicked London homes. 

We've been doing this since 2009 and have accommodated many thousands of happy guests in my portfolio of 120+ central London houses and apartments.

We love using AirBNB but this is the tip of the iceberg of the professional service we offer to all our guests, which includes:

- super-fast enquiry response time, 7 days a week
- personal check in during business hours
- professional cleaning and home preparation by our team of dedicated housekeepers
- 5* hotel standard linen and towels and sundries
- 7 day/week maintenance support

I hope you enjoy browsing our selection of properties and we look forward to hearing from you!

neighborhood_overview: Pinner is a quiet, leafy suburb of London. The high street is a mixture of new and historic builings and offers shops and restaurants to suit all tastes.
transit: You will be ideally located to access Central London, Heathrow Airport and Wembley Stadium. The local Underground Station, Rayners Lane is a 7 minute walk away. From here you can access the Metropolitan & Piccadilly lines into London.  From Rayners Lane you are 25 mins to Baker Street, 11 Minutes to Wembley, 35 mins to Bond Street. There are excellent road links with easy access to M40, M25, M1, A1 and Heathrow airport.  The local town centres of Harrow and Uxbridge have large shopping centres with many restaurants and cinemas. neighborhood_overview: Leytonstone is a neighbourhood on the up! The film director Alfred Hitchcock was born here and the underground station features mosaics of scenes from some of his most famous films such as 'The Birds', 'Vertigo' and 'North by Northwest'.  If you want somewhere lovely to eat nearby I would recommend  The Red Lion.  (URL HIDDEN) It is just a 10 minute walk away. Also there is a great Dim Sum restaurant called Panda. It is unassuming but the food is lovely.  (URL HIDDEN) This is about 12 minutes walk from the flat. You can also check out what else is going on locally on this blog. (URL HIDDEN) Traditional East London food is 'Pie and Mash' or 'Jellied Eels' !  I have been told that this is the best you can get in East London. (URL HIDDEN) and it is in Leytonstone. It is about a 2o minute walk from the flat. I havn't tried it yet. Locally I love Wanstead Park and Wanstead High Street. The quickest way to get to both is just one stop on the underground heading east!  (URL HIDDEN) The park ,
notes: The photos were professionally taken by an Airbnb photographer. Please note that he used a wide-angle lens so I have added details below of the  exact room dimensions. The flat is in Victorian terraced house so there are lovely high ceilings and the rooms are average sized by London standards! The shower room is bijoux and although it has all you need, spacious it is not!  The Living Room is 4m x 4.5m Decorated with ordinance survey maps of London and the surrounding area. It has a  3 seater sofa and a sofabed, dining table and 8 dining chairs ( 1 of these is in the back bedroom), TV with built in DVD player and a selection of dvds, books and games.  Front Bedroom is 3.7m x 3.2m The black and Floral wallpaper is by Christian Lacroix and there is a dark grey upholstered 'sleigh' style double bed, drum bedside tables with table lamps, a mirrored wardrobe with hanging space and pull out drawers. transit: The flat is just 5 minutes walk from Leytonstone underground station on the central line.  Liverpool street is just 5 stops, approximately 10 minutes away. Tottenham Court Rd and Oxford Circus are 25/30 minutes away. This is also just 2 stops form Stratford if you want to visit The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, or the massive Westfield shopping centre with plenty of shops, restaurants and a cinema. There is also a picture house cinema in Stratford and the famous  Theatre Royal Stratford East.
access: You will have access to living room, kitchen and bathroom. The flat has a newly fitted kitchen with ceramic electric hob and oven, dishwasher, fridge with freezer compartment and washer/dryer. The worktop is white quartz and there is an under mounted copper sink and mixer tap and plenty of cupboard space. The kitchen is fully equipped with glasses, cutlery, crockery, saucepans and cookware. There is a Bosch kettle and toaster and cafetiere. There is a shower room with walk in shower, sink and toilet . NB. there is no bath. Because there is NO BATH,  I have said it is not suitable for infants 0-2 but if this does not bother you then I am ok with you bringing your babies! There is an iron and ironing board located in the back bedroom with the foxglove wallpaper. The iron is in the wardrobe. The ironing board is tucked behind the wardrobe. please DO NOT use the iron on the carpet.
interaction: I work as a freelance director of Tv commercials and music video. This means I travel abroad but am also often available. I hope to get to meet every guest and I can recommend places to visit and restaurants to try , both locally and in other areas of the city.
house_rules: This is a residential neighbourhood so please be respectful and considerate of the neighbours particularly in the evenings; with no loud music after 10pm. NB.If you use hair straighteners/curling tongs PLEASE  DO NOT place them directly on any surface that is not heat proof. eg. The Carpet! Also DO NOT use the iron on the carpet!  A  cleaning fee has been charged to cover basic cleaning. Please leave the flat as you find it or an additional cleaning charge will be required.  It is ok to leave clean dishes  in the dishwasher, and used towels in the bathroom but please do not leave any dirty dishes for me to wash up.  The kitchen worktop is made from white quartz, so to avoid staining wipe up any spills of strong coloured liquids ( eg. red wine or tomato sauce) straight away! Washing up liquid and cloths/brushes are in the cupboard underneath the kitchen sink.  The copper sink should only be cleaned with washing-up liquid and water ( no harsh or abrasive cleaning products.)  Rubbish disp

name: Stylish and Spacious One-Bed Victorian Apartment
summary: A comfy and stylish one-bedroom Victorian apartment located in a trendy, quiet and creative neighbourhood in South East London.  Local cafes, restaurants, bars and pubs offer some great food and drink, and with numerous transport links for easy travel into central London, the apartment is a great base from which to explore the city.
space: The flat has all of the original features expected of a Victorian building. With huge sash windows, high ceilings and exposed floorboards, the space is bright and airy throughout the day.

Local cafes, restaurants, bars and pubs offer some great food and drink, and with numerous transport links for easy travel into central London, the apartment is a great base from which to explore the city. As the apartment is our home, we will be vacating the property for the duration of your stay. We will of course be available throughout your stay on phone or email. The apartment is located 2 minutes walk from Crofton Park high street that offers a vast array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants to satisfy any needs. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located 2 minutes walk from Crofton Park high street that offers a vast array of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants to satisfy any needs. Delicious breakfasts, spectacular cocktails, locally-brewed craft beers, artisan produce and some of the best coffee you'll find in London - you name it, Crofton Park has it.
transit: Crofton Park station is located directly opposite the apartment and has direct trains to London Blackfriars from where you can explore central London by tube or foot. This line passes through many great places in South East London, such as Peckham and Denmark Hill, and you can connect to the underground network at either Elephant & Castle or London Blackfriars.  Brockley station is about 10 minute walk away and has direct routes to London Bridge and places like Shoreditch High Street and Hoxton in East London. These services also connect to the underground network at Canada Water.  Ladywell station is a 15 minute walk away and has direct services into London Charing Cross, the ideal destination for exploring Covent Garden, Trafalgar Square and the rest of central London.

name: Elegant Central London apartment overlooking park
summary: Stunning newly refurbished two floored garden apartment in a Georgian terraced house opposite a park and a lake. Situated between Bermondsey and the newly fashionable Peckham and with easy transport links in to central London.
space: This is an apartment situated over two floors. The light and peaceful sitting room has views back and front of the park and the private garden. The smaller bedroom is also on this floor and down the stairs is the double bedroom, the bathroom and fully equipped kitchen where french doors open out into the garden.
description: Stunning newly refurbished two floored garden apartment in a Georgian terraced house opposite a park and a lake. Situated between Bermondsey and the newly fashionable Peckham and with easy transport links in to central London. This is an apartment situated over two floors. The light and peaceful sitting room has views back and front of the park and the private garden. The smaller bedroom is also on this floor and down the stairs is the double bedroom, the bathroom and fully equipped kitchen where french doors open out into the garden. You will have access to the entire apartment during your stay. I live upstairs and work from home so I am available for help, advice or anything else you may need. Only a 15/20 minute walk to Bermondsey and Maltby street food market. In the other direction is the increasingly popular Peckham brimming with independent restaurants, coffee shops and bars including Frank's Campari rooftop bar with it's stunning views of London and the neighbouring Bussey buil
neighborhood_overview: Only a 15/20 minute walk to Bermondsey and Maltby street food market. In the other direction is the increasingly popular Peckham brimming with independent restaurants, coffee shops and bars including Frank's Campari rooftop bar with it's stunning views of London and the neighbouring Bussey building which also has a rooftop bar during the summer months.
notes: We will have a welcome pack with more details of local amenities upon your arrival.
transit: Although the street is exceptionally quiet, it is within 5 minutes walk of a bus stop where you have the option of buses that will take you directly into central London and all the major attractions: Big Ben, Parliament Square, Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly Circus, Theatreland, Soho etc. Also a 5 minute bus journey to the nearest tube station. Travelling in the other direction you can visit the Maritime museum and the Cutty Sark in historic Greenwich, take a walk in beautiful Greenwich park and visit the famous Observatory.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment during your stay.

Beckenham is a town in south east London within the London Borough of Bromley. It boarders the London Borough of Lewisham. It lies north west of Bromley an
neighborhood_overview: Beckenham is a town in south east London within the London Borough of Bromley. It boarders the London Borough of Lewisham. It lies north west of Bromley and is located 8.4 miles (13.5 km) south east of Charing Cross. Until the coming of the railway in 1857, Beckenham was a small village in the county of Kent with almost completely rural surroundings; once a family of entrepreneurs began the building of villas here, its population soared from 2000 to 26,000 during and throughout the rest of the twentieth century. Beckenham makes an ideal business location. The area boasts a busy high street containing many restaurants, upmarket chains as well as family run independents, and has a good selection of well performing schools.
transit: It lies north west of Bromley and is located 8.4 miles (13.5 km) south east of Charing Cross. Its close proximity to Central London and the fact that it is served by nine railway stations (Beckenham Junction, Clock House, Birkberk, New Beckenham, Ravensbourne, Kent House, Elmers End, Eden Park and Beckenham Hill) Busy high street containing many restaurants upmarket chains.
access: We  have a lockbox at the property which allows us to offer guests late check-ins at no extra costs. You will be provided a 4 digit code on the day of your check-in and you can release the keys to check yourself in. You will have access to your studio apartment which is self contained and the utility room where you will find a washing machine and dryer if required.

name: Brilliant large modern studio with gym
summary: Modern, bright and spacious studio in Islington with all modern conveniences. The studio sleeps two and has a double bed, modern kitchen and a spacious bathroom with a walk in shower. There is wifi and a TV. The area is well situated with excellent travel connections, Holloway Rd station being a five minute walk from the studio where you can catch the underground tube or bus. The local area has restaurants, bars and cafes and Finsbury Park is a stones throw away, as is Arsenal football stadium.

name: (h4) Arty 1 bed Shoreditch Apartment City view
summary: Buzzy, trendy and oh so cool. Welcome to Shoreditch! London's most thriving quarter these days. Everyone is here partying, eating, drinking and admiring the street art. This 2 bedroom flat is located bang in the middle of the action - only 5 mins walk from Shoreditch High Street station and 10 mins walk to Aldgate East Station. Explore the Boxpark, get some curry at Dishoom and shop on Redchurch Street! Its all here! The flat is professionally cleaned and comes with all basic amenities.
space: Welcome to my apartment! This arty one bedroom flat is very conveniently located in Shoreditch, London’s coolest and most hipster quarter. Beautifully decorated by an interior designer, this quirky and luxurious flat has everything you need for a comfortable stay in this amazing city.  The apartment will always be professionally cleaned and come with fresh luxury linens.  The open plan lounge encompasses a spacious living space, and a dining area. This dining area then leads on to a modern kitchen which is stocked with all the basic amenities such as a toaster, kettle, basic food condiments and a combi washer/dryer that we believe are needed to start you off. The living area has nice views across London’s vibrant East end and large glass sliding doors lead out onto a large private balcony, which has a cute dining area and sitting area. There is also a large sofabed in the inside living space which will comfortably sleep guest number three and four. The bedroom has deep mahogany hues ac

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in trendy East London, in Shoreditch. Shoreditch is London’s hipster central and is filled with lots of trendy artisan coffee shops, contemporary bars and cool pop up food markets. An area popular with free spirits, young professionals, artists and designers.  We are very lucky to have the upmarket Spitalfields market on our doorstep. This indoor market has a plethora of different shops and food stalls which sit alongside designer shops and brands. Brick lane market is also only a two minute walk away and is a must-see in London! We highly recommend visiting this vibrant area which is famous for its delicious bagels and also for its variety of unique vintage stores and busy fruit and vegetable stalls.  Feel free to take a look at this area guide from Airbnb which might give you a little more information about the area: https://www.airbnb.co.uk/locations/london/shoreditch Once you've done the booking we will provide you with a full list of things to do in the ar
notes: I have only a few simple house rules. I love this house so please respect my space.  - no parties or loud noises - no smoking  - no pets (there is carpet in most of the flat) - no shoes - please lock all doors and windows when you leave the apartment
transit: The apartment itself is only a six minute walk from Shoreditch high street, and a ten minute walk from the closest tube station, Aldgate East. There are also plenty of buses in the area which are a good option if you prefer to look at your surroundings as you travel to new places.  Liverpool Street station is also only a ten minute walk from the apartment, and this station is on the Central line which will take you directly to all the popular shopping areas such as Oxford Circus and Bond Street, as well as sights such as Marble Arch.
access: The whole apartment is available for our guests.
interaction: Send me a message on Airbnb and I will ensure that you receive a prompt reply.
host_about:
Hello!!
My name is Pery, I love reading books, sports and travelling around the world.

I would like to be your host and help you discover this great city where I live.

Please get in touch if I can help :)

name: 20min to central London & Heathrow 1min to station
summary: A warm welcome to stay with us in London 1 minute walk (200 metres) - Northfields tube station on the Piccadilly Line; 20 minutes by tube - London Heathrow or Central London; FREE high speed Wi-Fi; car parking; FREE SHUTTLE BUS to GSK Brentford (5 minutes ride); short (10 minutes) bus ride to SKY in Grant Way Isleworth/ Osterley/ Brentford; Cozy, clean and quiet private room with real bed (120x200); ideal for business travel, stays for London Heathrow airport departure or London tourist visitors
space: This lovely loft room is situated in the second floor's flat in a house that is divided into three flats.  It has a Small Double Bed (120cm x 200cm), large wardrobe, desk and a chair, armchair, 2 reading lamps and few electricity sockets. You are going to have available shower gel, shampoo, fresh towels, ironing board, (iron and hair dryer will be available on request anytime) and EU/ UK - European electricity plug/ converter plus Brita filtered water. And high speed Wi-Fi internet of course :-)
description: A warm welcome to stay with us in London 1 minute walk (200 metres) - Northfields tube station on the Piccadilly Line; 20 minutes by tube - London Heathrow or Central London; FREE high speed Wi-Fi; car parking; FREE SHUTTLE BUS to GSK Brentford (5 minutes ride); short (10 minutes) bus ride to SKY in Grant Way Isleworth/ Osterley/ Brentford; Cozy, clean and quiet private room with real bed (120x200); ideal for business travel, stays for London Heathrow airport departure or London tourist visitors This lovely loft room is situated in the second floor's flat in a house that is divided into three flats. And high speed Wi-Fi internet of course :-
neighborhood_overview: Northfields is part of leafy, residential and family oriented area called Ealing in West London. There are nice parks within short walking distance. London's Ealing is great for local events, shopping, pubs, good food and coffee. Please see our own guide book for recommendations. Our place is ideal for London Heathrow airport departure stays as well as London tourist visitors because Piccadilly Line takes 20 minutes to both destinations and our tube station Northfields is just 1 minute walk from our house. Our place is equally great for GSK and SKY business travel or UWL's (University of West London) students.
notes: A small, friendly and curious rabbit is part of our family therefore please make sure you are not allergic to fur. Parking is available for a small fee (£1.30 for a day). When you advise us about your parking need beforehand, we will sort out the permit for you at cost. If you're going to stay with us for more than a week, towels will be changed once a week for you.
transit: Welcome to London. We are right next to the Northfields tube station on the Piccadilly Line. It takes 20 minutes to/ from London Heathrow Airport or equally to/ from Central London. FREE SHUTTLE BUS to GSK Brentford (5 minutes ride) and short bus ride to SKY in Grant Way Isleworth/ Osterley/ Brentford (10 minutes ride). UWL is only 10 minutes walk from our house.
access: You will get privacy of your own room and an access to a shared bathroom. It is shared only by ourselves and we are not there very often so no hassle for you. Early check in is available if arranged with us beforehand and if no one else is checking out on that day. Similarly with later check out.
interaction: We will happily provide you with information on London's events, shopping, restaurants, pubs and coffee houses, parks, night outs or anything that is in our ability to help you with. Please do not hesitate to take a look at our own guide book for recommendations.
house_rules: We are very friendly and welcoming couple plus the rabbit and these are our extra rules: - please read our advert fully as well as our house rules so you know what you can expect and what not to so we can avoid confusion or disappointment - NO SMOKING – as our insurance does not allow it unfortunately. - Quiet hours are 10pm – 8am and in case you return late we insist on the quietest return possible because of our quiet neighbourhood. - Our rabbit is very friendly and curious but we must insist on STRICTLY NO FEEDING her as she has a special diet as well as no cage opening or closing. - As only Booked Guests can stay with us but you'd like to meet your friends, there are many great possibilities locally. Also, no parties or events are possible. - We ask you to kindly not wear shoes inside the house. - Use of the kitchen for preparation of light snacks is possible if agreed by us beforehand. Please note - we do not have a microwave. - Our check in is up to midnight therefore please make
host_about:
Delighted to be Superhosts; we are a friendly couple who love to meet nice people, love to travel, love good food, love good coffee and we are on a journey to change our lives to as healthy ones as possible. We've been living in London for many years and we can recommend you many great places to visit if you like or feel free to take a look at our guide book. We have to say that we very much appreciate every single feedback we receive and here we offer you some of them:

"Martin and Petra are not only excellent hosts but really great people. We had a really great experience staying at their Airbnb. The location is great, it is very close to the tube with quick and VERY easy access into central London and direct from the airport. I cannot tell you how perfect this is after a long day of travelling on a plane. The place is on a quaint and quiet street within close proximity to great restaurants and shops. The room was lovely with a beautiful skylight and I loved the little details of having fresh flowers in the room, fresh towels, menus and recommendations of things to do in the area all laid out. My flight landed a bit early and Martin and Petra so graciously accommodated us to check in a bit early which helped immensely since we didn't have to be carrying our bags around London. Fresh (delicious) coffee with biscuits were also provided to us in the morning. Alot of great conversations were had also. Thank you Martin and Petra for such a great experience for my first time in London and making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable. I highly recommend staying here."

"I had a wonderful stay at Martin and Petra's place, they are an absolutely lovely couple and I felt very relaxed there. Their place is perfect for a comfortable rest, the extra little touches exceeded my expectations. The room is exactly as pictured and the level of cleanliness was one of the highest I have experienced with Airbnb. Extremely comfortable and clean bed, I would definately want to stay again. Thanks Martin and Petra for making me feel so welcome :)"

"A fantastic find, excellent value and literally a 30 second walk to Northfields Station with a direct train into the city in 25 minutes!! Lovely clean room, with nice touches including toiletries! Martin and Petra were attentive and welcoming hosts throughout. Quiet location with parking sorted for by Martin! Thank you both!"

"Martin and Petra are truly wonderful. They helped me with my bags and in the morning they made me a delicious coffee! They also recommended a wonderful Indian restaurant near them and made sure that I was comfortable and had everything I needed. Their place is very close to the tube station and 30 minutes to the airport door to door. This was super convenient for heading to the airport the next day!"

"Not to mention this place is super close to the tube station which takes you to airport and central London, Martin and Petra are great hosts that made me feel home during my stay. They provided everything needed for the trip, also gave great recommendations on the restaurant and travel spots. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay and oh don't forget to try St. Maria pizza near the apartment:)"

"Very nice hosts and more than willing to help you out wth recommendations on places to eat nearby and make you feel at home. Nice and convenient location near the Northfields underground station that can take you directly to Heathrow in 20 mins on the Piccadilly line. Bed was comfy and the room and bathroom were nice and clean."

"My boyfriend and I needed to stay in London for one night before moving on to Gatwick the following day, and Martin & Petra's apartment was perfect! Not only is it an easy four minute walk from the nearest tube station, you'll also find a cozy and comfortable room waiting for you when you arrive, which is great after a long day of traveling. Even though our stay was short, I think any solo traveler or couple will find Martin & Petra's flat perfect for their London stay. Thanks for everything! Hoping to be back soon."

"Martin and Petra were great hosts. The room was clean, organized, and provided all toiletries possibly needed. It was very close to the tube station and easy to get to and from Heathrow airport. Would definitely recommend to all guests looking for a lovely, warm, and comfortable room."

"Everything was excellent. Thank you for the wonderful time."

"Martin & Petra were two wonderfully friendly and warm people. We arrived feeling exhausted and overwhelmed from our flight and they made us feel so welcome and rejuvinated. We would absolutely love to stay again. Absolutely great!"

"Martin & Petra were absolutely the best. Very friendly and loads of fun to talk with. So much so that we spoke until 5:30am in the morning! They didn't seem like typical hosts but more like friends. The space is just what we needed for our 17hr hour layover from Iceland back to New York. They also gave us some great recommendations on where to go and places to eat around London. They even gave us really insightful life tips :). It was the perfect end to our awesome trip! By far the best hosts we ever had. You won't be disappointed."

"Martin and Petra were awesome hosts and the place was great! Close to the train station to get into central London. Private comfy room and shared bathroom. They have an adorable rabbit named Abbie. We had some great conversations and and they were a lot of fun to sit and chat with. They also suggested so many great places to eat locally, especially an Indian restaurant named Papaya within walking distance to their place. We enjoyed getting to know them and would recommend this place to any traveler wanting to get to know London."

"Martin and Petra are a lovely couple and very easy going. The room is clean and comfortable and sharing the flat with the two of them (and their cute rabbit) is entirely uncomplicated. They are well prepared to have some extra toothbrushes at hand because some forgetful guest, like myself, would pack everything except her toothbrush! (still, you should bring your own toothbrush ;)) The apartment is located within half a minute walking distance away from the tube station of Piccadilly line. It is very convenient especially if you are flying in from Heathrow. Piccadilly line runs along major attractions of London and I could do all my planned sightseeing over the weekend without changing lines."

"There is so much to say, but I have to leave some for you to find out! Martin and Petra were amazing to stay with, such gracious hosts and such a great room to stay in. Location is amazing, its literally around the corner from The Tube but you don't hear it, awesome shops within walking distance, and its on the Picadilly line which services Heathrow, straight into downtown London and to the St Pancras station for that quick jaunt to France! If you want an amazing place to stay, great hosts, and easy access to a lot to do, Martin & Petra are the best to stay with. We cannot plan our next trip back to the UK soon enough, and definitely going to stay here again!"

"Martin and Petra are very friendly people. My girlfriend and I very much enjoyed talking with them. I was visiting from the US and I had several questions before my trip. I got responses from them so quickly--thank you so much. The room and bathroom were very clean. It was a fantastic stay with them and I would definitely go back when I visit London again. Thank you Martin and Petra."

"Petra and Martin are two lovely people whose home has been our home for seven days. As hosts, they are everything you could desire, and beyond. Always helpful, full of good advices, always smiling and at your service. The acomodation itself is really great. As written, it's one minute of walk from the tube station, in a safe and quiet neighbourhood. The bedroom is clean, rather spacious and warm. There are a couple of packages of coffee and a tea selection waiting for You on the table, with cups and everything necessary to make you feel even more "at home" and cozy. The privacy is guaranteed, as well as a warm "hello, how was your day?", "good morning, do you need anything?" or a simple "would you like some tea?" :o) Petra offered us to use the kitchen if needed, in every single way, as well as some bathroom necessities in case we have forgotten our own (such as toothpaste, shower gel or even a makeup remover, which comes handy!) The flat in general is very clean, comfortable, warm and cozy, which is no surprise since there are two welcoming, kind and lovely people living there. Would come back anytime! :o)"

"Martin and Petra were amazing. When I landed in London the airlines misplaced my luggage. When I got to Martin and Petra's place I told them what happened. They were so kind in offering me anything I needed. The place was sooooo easy to find. One simple train ride from the airport about 20 min. The directions given were easy to follow. Martin stayed in constant communication with me leading up to my arrival. The room was very clean and exactly as pictured. They made me feel at home. They were very helpful in offering suggestions on places to visit. I was there only a night, so Martin helped me book a tour bus of London. They also invited me to lunch at a yummy Thai restaurant. I can't forget adorable Abby, their pet rabbit. She was even welcoming. I could go on and on. I will definitely be back in my next visit. Thank you again Martin and Petra for your wonderful hospitality."

"Super clean, cozy and kind stay. Both of the hosts are incredibly friendly and supportive, the place is in a really good spot of London, easy to reach and to navigate around. Thank you, guys, for an amazing stay."

"I would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in the West London area. Martin and Petra are very nice and from the last time I stayed they even had improvements such as available keys both for the room and the house and an easy wi fi password. It was a pleasure to know I would be comfortable after a long working day! Great place!"

"Martín and Petra where great hosts with a great flat, ideally located for early flights from Heathrow. Martin and Petra where even kind enough to drop me off at their amazing local pizzeria. #win"

"Thank you so much for a wonderful stay. I had the best nights sleep and found the room comfortable, quiet, clean and cosy. It was lovely to meet and chat to you both and I think you have a lovely home. Thanks for making me feel so welcome."

"Absolutely the nicest, most interesting hosts you could possibly stay with. Martin and Petra's place gets a lot of bookings and deservedly so as their flat is a warm, happy, friendly and comfortable environment and atmosphere."

"As a 21yr old this was my first time flying/traveling solo, the love and hospitality Martin and Petra showed me not only warmed my heart but made my stay 1000x better. Whilst my home is 25 hours away in Australia, I felt right at home, like I was apart of their family, which is a special quality not to be taken lightly. I 100% recommend Martin and Petra's room to anyone in need of a home away from home. Thank you so much, J."

neighborhood_overview: Woolwich Riverside is one of South East London's most exciting riverside addresses, occupying a prime location along the River Thames with a forthcoming on-site Crossrail Station and buzzing retail hub. Enjoy stunning views of the River Thames and Canary Wharf from our luxurious Apartment. 0.4 mile walk to the local high street. Boasting many high street and local shops and fresh fruit and vegetable markets. Purchase everything from food to clothes and shoes.  A vibrant beautiful part of London with many different things to do.  Many lovely restaurants and vibrant bars. Woolwich Arsenal train station and Docklands Light Railway also on the high street- high speed trains taking you direct into the City and West End of London. Woolwich Dockyard train station 0.4 mile walk from apartment. 472 bus taking you straight to North Greenwich Tube station.
notes: Please note we have strict policies No parties  No events  No gatherings
transit: Directly adjacent to the Woolwich Ferry. 0.4 mile walk to Woolwich Arsenal train station and Docklands Light Railway also on the high street- high speed trains taking you direct into the City and West End of London (London Bridge, Waterloo East and Charing Cross).  Woolwich Dockyard train station 0.4 mile walk from apartment. 472 bus directly outside apartment taking you straight to North Greenwich underground Tube station- Jubilee Line.  We have a secure allocated parking space. 0.7 mile walk to Royal Arsenal Woolwich Pier MBNA Thames Clipper boat.  A fantastic scenic way to travel to central London.  Get to see London at its absolute best- all of the London Bridges and landmarks while sitting comfortably on board.  You can go on the deck while travelling and also take advantage of the bar. Whether it's the view of Tower Bridge from the South Bank or the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben from Westminster Bridge, the backdrops along the River Thames are some of the most instantly recogn

Hello,

All our properties are selected carefully in order to offer the best stay to our guests.

Warm regards,

Alex

name: Charming 1 bed flat in heart of Notting Hill
summary: This gorgeous apartment is the perfect place for you to feel at home in the heart of Notting Hill. Tastefully decorated, it is set in a stunning white stucco fronted Regency building, bathed in light, overlooking beautiful communal gardens. Excellent location within 5 minutes walk to Ladbroke Grove tube, 15 minutes to Notting Hill Gate (3 mins by bus which is in front of the house.  On your doorstep is the eclectic mix of Portobello, boutique shops, restaurants and leafy walks in Holland Park.
space: The flat is set over the top floor of a beautiful Regency building in Notting Hill.  It is clean and light and benefits from a roof terrace.  The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you might need for a gourmet meal and the sitting room with its comfy sofa and workspace is the perfect place to relax after a day at Portobello Market - which is literally on the doorstep!

The lock on the bedroom cupboard door is not strong and if either door is found open or tampered with after your stay you will risk your security deposit.
interaction: Molly will be on hand to answer any questions you may have!
house_rules: - No music or loud noise after 11pm. - Please use mats if having red wine or things that may stain the white countertops. If marked, please clean asap with cream cleaner. -Unlocking locked cupboards/doors or broken tamper tape will result in -automatic forfeiture of security deposit. -Care shall be taken with the keys and should keys be lost, guests may incur a charge up to the cost of replacing locks -Please be mindful that is a private home and not a hotel.  Guests are asked to please tidy their own dishes and run dishwasher prior to departure. -Guests risk forfeiture of security deposit if house rules broken
host_about:
I have lived in Notting Hill for the past 7 years and would not want to live anywhere else!   I lived here when I was single, just married and now mother to a little bub, and each step of the way it has been the best place to be.  I still have a spring in my step every time I walk out of the house and cross the road to Kensington Park Road and Portobello.  From the magical market, the allure of film sets,  michelin starred restaurants, hip boutiques, curious antique and fruit stalls, to the people themselves, the colourful and vibrant mix never fails to inspire me! I hope that you enjoy it as much as we do.  

We are heading to South America for an adventure and hope you can look after our home whilst we are away.  As a globe trotter, I have stayed in homes and hotels all over the world and appreciate how special a warm welcome is when arriving somewhere new. Whilst we are gone, my lovely friend Molly is taking on the project of making your stay wonderful.  She is at your disposal should you need anything at all and is a first-class host.  No request is too big or too small! We will make every effort to ensure that you have a special and memorable stay in London, and that you feel at home in our little apartment.

name: Noteworthy Notting Hill Gate Studio
summary: This bright second floor studio is in a beautiful house, in the heart of Notting Hill, which is split in to self contained studios. This studio has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in an immaculate and temporary style with white walls, and a wooden floor. It has a TV and wifi.
space: The studio is self-contained, you have your own bathroom and kitchen.  The bed is of double sized and all linen and towels are provided. If you are look for a pied-a-terre, an overnight stop off or a London hide-away, this is the place for you! To the rear of the building there is a small communal terrace.
description: This bright second floor studio is in a beautiful house, in the heart of Notting Hill, which is split in to self contained studios. This studio has an open plan kitchen with hob, oven, refrigerator and a separate shower room with slate flooring, white tiled walls and a power shower. It is decorated in an immaculate and temporary style with white walls, and a wooden floor. It has a TV and wifi. The studio is self-contained, you have your own bathroom and kitchen.  The bed is of double sized and all linen and towels are provided. If you are look for a pied-a-terre, an overnight stop off or a London hide-away, this is the place for you! To the rear of the building there is a small communal terrace. During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you. Please note that there is no elevator in the building. We live and work locally which helps
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is perfectly sandwiched between Westbourne Grove, Notting Hill Gate, with Holland Park and Kensington a short walk away.  You can reach all the local beautiful open spaces on foot; Kensington Palace, Hyde Park and Holland Park.  Notting Hill Gate, Portobello Road, Westbourne Grove and Kensington Church Street are full to bursting point with cool bars, traditional pubs and fantastic restaurants.
notes: The keys are to be collected from a lockbox by the front door of the building. The washer/dryer is communal and situated in the basement of the building.  There are hours within which it cannot be used, these are clearly signed on the door.
transit: You have a choice of buses that link you to Central  London in just a few minutes.  Notting Hill Gate tube station is a 4-5 minute walk or you can stroll down to High Street Kensington station in 10-12 minutes.  Black cabs and Ubers are very easy to find and much of the local shopping and sightseeing is easily done on foot.
access: During your stay, you will have access to your studio and the communal outside spaces.  Depending on your arrival time we will either meet you there or we will leave the keys in a secure key box for you. Please note that there is no elevator in the building.
interaction: We live and work locally which helps when it comes to advice and recommendations! :-)
host_about:
My wife and I decided to start using Airbnb to rent out our serviced apartments, it's a much nicer community than the usual holiday booking sites!  We have 21 studios in our building and we encourage a family vibe with communal break-out spaces, on site cleaner and handyman whom you'll no doubt meet when you check-in.

Billie and I are based locally and are on hand if you have questions, and can always be reached by phone or e-mail.   We also have two amazing team members called Joanna and Anna (funny enough) who helps us organise the building. 

We look forward to welcoming you to London!

We want you to feel like you are home; There is fruit, cereal and freshly baked cakes on the kitchen counter to help yourself to, bread and several teas, coffee, etc available whenever you want, just pop the kettle on. You have fridge space and cupboard space so you can cater for yourself, and you have full use of the fully-fitted kitchen, which is equipped with all mod cons, so you can rustle up a meal or snack for yourself. You are welcome to use the herbs, spices, oils and condiments if you cook. You are welcome to enjoy the living room, which has a comfortable leather sofa and chairs, flat screen TV and dining room table. There is a strict no smoking policy or vaping in the house for the comfort of all guests. There is an English cottage garden at the back, with a  social area to sit out in for your pleasure. In the local area you will find everything you need for a great stay; there are cafes, restau
interaction: We interact as much or as little as the guests feel comfortable. I do work outside the house and freelance but, we have a wealth of local knowledge to tap into that we can support your stay with and I make an effort find out what you might need when we welcome you to make your stay work for you. I am always contactable if needed. We respect many people wish to have the opportunity to take some time out in their room, work, read, or while away the night in your own space.
house_rules: - Smokers can use the garden - Late check-out can be arranged between 10.30 am and 11 am on Sunday (please contact host for further details)
host_about:
I am proud to be an AirBnB Superhost, I love hosting and it's a passion to make you feel welcome and comfortable. Many of my guests return, or have gone on to become friends.

My intention is to hold a space that is whatever people need it to be. I am easy going, on hand and always happy to help with local knowledge;  I hope to give you the welcome I have enjoyed while travelling for business and leisure, and support your trip to London.


“Life is a brief shot at something incredible”


I love what I do everyday and call work, otherwise the usual: Films, Dancing, Great Food - preferably in great restaurants, Travel (lots of it).

name: Stylish, courtyard garden house. Notting Hill
summary: My stylish comfortable house is in a desirable area of Notting Hill and a perfect base when visiting London. It is conveniently located in this exciting area of Notting Hill in Kensington and with good transport links to all the major sights. The house has a private entrance with a secured front gate. It is a light and airy home with a sunny courtyard garden.
space: My home is great for couples or a single person wanting to explore London and colourful Notting Hill. There is a fully equipped kitchen for those who wish to cook in. Laundry facilities are available also. The integral Sonus music system is available for use plus two Smart TV's one downstairs and one in the bedroom.  WIFI throughout the property.

It is a light and airy home with a sunny courtyard garden. My home is great for couples or a single person wanting to explore London and colourful Notting Hill. There is a fully equipped kitchen for those who wish to cook in. Laundry facilities are available also. The integral Sonus music system is available for use plus two Smart TV's one downstairs and one in the bedroom.  WIFI throughout the property. Guests will have the use of the entire house and courtyard garden with its own front entrance. I will greet guests on arrival and will be contactable by phone during your stay. There is a wide variety of restaurants, entertainment venues and shopping facilities within the local area.  Por
neighborhood_overview: There is a wide variety of restaurants, entertainment venues and shopping facilities within the local area.  Portobello Market is within easy walking distance with its cafes, restaurants and live street music.  There are good transport links, the nearest tube is a 5 minute walk.  If shopping is your desire Westfield Shopping Centre is one stop away on the tube or easy walking distance.  There you will find John Lewis and all the famous Brands from designer names to high street brands. Plus 'state of the art' cinemas and a wide variety of restaurants.  There is a local Independent Theatre very close to my home with great theatre productions and a little café which opens for breakfast and light lunches.  4 minutes away is a family run Thai restaurant with authentic Thai food, excellent take away! For grocery shopping there is a supermarket just 4 minutes away.
notes: I would like guests to enjoy my home and be respectful to the house rules.
transit: There are a variety of good transport links close by linking central London and surrounding areas. Nearest tube is 5 minutes walk away. There is also a very good bus service from Ladbroke Grove which is a 7 minute walk.  If you are coming by car, parking permits can be provided, however parking is free from Saturday 1pm through to Monday 8.30am.
access: Guests will have the use of the entire house and courtyard garden with its own front entrance.
interaction: I will greet guests on arrival and will be contactable by phone during your stay.
house_rules: - No extra guests overnight. Please be considerate to my neighbours, no loud noise after 10.30pm.
host_about: I've lived in Notting Hill for many years and love living here and enjoy exploring other countries.

name: Rooftop terrace Pimlico paradise
summary: Modern Luxury split level apartment  in Westminster with private terrace benefiting of stunning views.  Perfect for families with up to 4 children or 2 couples or 4 friends. Apartment is stocked with everything one would have at home.
space: This luxury apartment with private roof terrace is situated in a prime London location, in an award winning building in the heart of Pimlico within walking distance from major London landmarks, such as Buckingham Palace, Parliament, Westminster Abbey and London Eye.
description: Modern Luxury split level apartment  in Westminster with private terrace benefiting of stunning views.  Perfect for families with up to 4 children or 2 couples or 4 friends. Apartment is stocked with everything one would have at home. This luxury apartment with private roof terrace is situated in a prime London location, in an award winning building in the heart of Pimlico within walking distance from major London landmarks, such as Buckingham Palace, Parliament, Westminster Abbey and London Eye. Apartment offers 2 very good sized bedrooms with king and super-king beds with luxurious 15inch hand made mattresses and highest quality Egyptian cotton (1000 thred)bed linen, goose down pillows, 4 inch mattress toppers  and luxurious towels. Each room has spacious wardrobe, with slippers and bathrobes provided. Both bedroom are equipped with bespoke made curtains and blinds Each bedroom is equipped with internet TV where you can enjoy free Netflix, services, Amazon Prime Videos, and UK TV Cha
neighborhood_overview: Neighbourhood is called Pimlico.  Most of the residents are professionals, families and some older generations.  Quiet, safe and tranquil neighbourhood will allow you to have good rest after strolling around the great city of London.  We are in the southwest (SW) part of the Central London and border on North to Victoria, East to St. James/Westminster, South to river Themes, and West to Chelsea. From our neighbourhood you can easily walk to Buckingham Palace, London Eye, Trafalgar Square, St. James Park, Westminster Abbey, Parliament, Tate Britain. Across the river or approximately 900 m you will find Vauxhall where late night life happens.  In the vicinity of the apartment you will find some really good restaurants, pubs and cafes (details in our Guidebook). The whole neighbourhood is a conservation area of historic value and you can see many typical architectural styles from the past 200 years. In the vicinity of the apartment you will find many buildings where famous people once liv
notes: Flat is equipped with fire, smoke and CO2 detectors. You will find 2 fire extinguishers clearly marked int the flat. First aid boxes are located in the kitchen and in the bathroom. We have a small dog, however Jack the dog is not left in the apartment when you are there. Great Parks for Joggers and walkers nearby: Battersea Park 15 min walk away St. James Park 15 min walk away Green Park 20 min walk away Hyde Park 25 min walk away We can also arrange boot camp throughout the year on Mon, Wed and Thur for those fancy keeping fit when on holidays for only £10 a session)- more details when you arrive and can be arrange on ad hoc basis.
transit: We have great transport links to and from our apartment. Airports Heathrow- 15 min train ride with Heathrow Express to Paddington and 10 min ride from Paddington to Pimlico Tube station, or 50 min ride with Piccadilly Lines and Victoria Lines to Pimlico. Gatwick- 30 min train ride with Gatwick Express to Victoria Station, than 10 min walk to the apartment Stansted- 45 min train ride to Liverpool Street station then 20 min tube ride with Central and Victoria Lines to Pimlico. Or 1.5h coach ride to Victoria Coach Station then 10 min walk to the apartment. Luton- 1.5 h coach ride to Victoria coach station then 10 min walk to the apartment London City Airport- 30 min ride with DLR and tube to Pimlico tube station Public transport: 10 min tube ride from St. Pancrass international to Pimlico Serviced by 10 bus routes to all parts of London from immediate vicinity. 3 tube lines from immediate vicinity (Victoria, Circle and District Lines) Main Land train routes from Victoria Train Stations. C
access: Apartment offers 2 very good sized bedrooms with king and super-king beds with luxurious 15inch hand made mattresses and highest quality Egyptian cotton (1000 thred)bed linen, goose down pillows, 4 inch mattress toppers  and luxurious towels. Each room has spacious wardrobe, with slippers and bathrobes provided. Both bedroom are equipped with bespoke made curtains and blinds Each bedroom is equipped with internet TV where you can enjoy free Netflix, services, Amazon Prime Videos, and UK TV Channels on demand. Additionally there is sofa bed (double bed size with proper mattress) which is located in the lounge and can sleep two people ideal  for teenagers or children. 2017 refurbushed designer bathroom with spa lights offers the comfort of a walk in shower, modern basin and all necessities one needs when traveling. You will find a washer, tumble dryer, hair dryer, hair straightener, hair curlers, brushes, artisanal toiletries and cosmetics, female sanitary conveniences, hair products and
interaction: We will meet you at your arrival or on special occasions our housekeeper will.  You will have a smartphone available for you with unlimited calls (UK only) and "all you can eat" data, so you are free of worry to find your way around the town and  to contact me or carer. Also there is a landline phone for you to use to contact us. We are available 24/7  Additionally, you have a  printer available, so you can check in and print your boarding cards or tickets.
house_rules: We would ask you to take care of the flat as it would be your own.  Please respect our neighbors and other residents and keep noise to the minimum.  You are solely and fully responsible for any material, emotional and criminal damage. The list of the strict restrictions apply at all times: No SHOES  anywhere in the apartment apart from the entrance landing! No Smoking INDOORS OR PUBLIC CORRIDORS Keep Doors and Windows closed and locked when leaving the flat NO DRUG USE ANYWHERE IN THE BUILDING OR IN FRONT OF IT NO LOITERING OR ANTISOCIAL BEHAVIOR IN THE FLAT OR ANYWHERE IN THE BUILDING. No unauthorized VISITORS allowed! No open fire BBQ! NO unauthorized parties or events! NO any illegal activities . No use of towels for removing make-up No Disposing Nappies, hygiene pads or towels into toilet. Misuse of the equipment resulting in damage, failure to contact us before use if not sure, or deliberate damage to any part or anything in the apartment will result of additional charges and/or l
host_about:
I and my husband Jimmy  are Londoners for the past 14 years. I work in hospitality (right on the pic) and Jimmy in finance (left on the pic).  I run my own catering business and enjoy everything what London has to offer.
We live with  our cuttie-pattutie dog Jack. 
We love to travel and Jack usually comes with us, of course transport permitting.
Food, making it and eating it, is big part of our lives. We love our guests to join us either for simple pasta bowl or for elaborate dinner or party. We both come from families where cooking comes naturally so you are up for a treat.
We also love socializing and meet new people an keep in touch with everybody we know. Theater, opera or shows are our THE nights out and occasionally night club or bar.
We both see life through rose tinted glasses  and live it to full potential.
Cannot wait meeting you! :-)
See ya' in London

name: Bright maisonette w. roof terrace 3mins Southbank
summary: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Our bright, quirky, spacious two bedroom flat with roof terrace is in an amazing location with many major London sites (Tate Modern, Southbank, Borough Market, London Eye, St Paul's) within a short walk. For those who want to be in the middle of everything with easy access to the airports. Two bedrooms with a comfy corner sofa bed in the living room (**warning: our living room has a large atrium in ceiling so prepare to wake with the sun!).  V. suitable for families.
space: Our home is an awesome, spacious, airy, bright friendly London flat, with private roof terrace, WIFI, TV (100s of channels), dishwasher, washer, dryer and amenities. This is a perfect home-from-home. As you can see from the pictures, it's a large, beautiful 2-bedroom apartment very close to the Tate Modern. In the midst of all the arts and culture of the Southbank. You will not find anywhere closer to the middle of the Culture Mile than this flat! 2 Double beds, plus 1 corner sofa bed, Bath, shower, washing machine, tumble dryer, oven, hobs, dishwasher, microwave, fridge, freezer. Secure entry. Fitted Wardrobe in bedroom. Set over three floors.  Maximum of six persons. Our home is for those who like being in the middle of things - this isn't a quiet country lane, this is the centre of London with people, culture, excitement, noises, and bright lights. It can be busy outside but the windows are sound insulated and most guests are surprised by how quiet the apartment is. If you're not us
description: LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Our bright, quirky, spacious two bedroom flat with roof terrace is in an amazing location with many major London sites (Tate Modern, Southbank, Borough Market, London Eye, St Paul's) within a short walk. For those who want to be in the middle of everything with easy access to the airports. Two bedrooms with a comfy corner sofa bed in the living room (**warning: our living room has a large atrium in ceiling so prepare to wake with the sun!).  V. suitable for families. Our home is an awesome, spacious, airy, bright friendly London flat, with private roof terrace, WIFI, TV (100s of channels), dishwasher, washer, dryer and amenities. This is a perfect home-from-home. As you can see from the pictures, it's a large, beautiful 2-bedroom apartment very close to the Tate Modern. In the midst of all the arts and culture of the Southbank. You will not find anywhere closer to the middle of the Culture Mile than this flat! 2 Double beds, plus 1 corner sofa bed, Bath, sho
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful lively neighbourhood, right near the river and all the culture. There are food markets, shops, restaurants, art galleries and museums only a very short walk away. We love Southwark and this is right in the middle! Our Apartment is in Zone 1 in Central London. On your doorstep you can WALK to: Tate Modern - 3 minute River Thames - 3 minutes Globe Theatre - 5 minutes Millennium Bridge - 5 minutes St Paul's Cathedral - 15 minutes Borough Market - 10 minutes The Shard - 10 mins London Bridge - 10 minutes London Eye - 20 minutes Houses of Parliament - 25 minutes Tower Bridge - 25 minutes AMENITIES (walking) Supermarket - 1 minute Bars - 1 minute Restaurants - 1 minute Cafes - 1 minute Children's playground (Nelsons Square) - 2 minutes
notes: Please take your shoes off inside. No parties or large gatherings. No smoking anywhere in the building. Please let us know if you break anything - we know accidents happen - so we can replace it for the next guests. The cleaning fee is for the bedding and towels; we provide them and you do not need to clean them at the end of your stay.   You may use the towels that have been left out. Please - if possible - do not use towels and linen stored in the cupboards.  We do ask that you leave the apartment tidy. As you get the entire apartment, we do our best to stay out of the way and give you your privacy. Take care on the roof terrace stairs (especially if you have been enjoying a few drinks on the terrace!) as they are quite steep.  Please replace roof terrace chairs in the kitchen before you leave as they are not weather resistant.
transit: Use the app Citymapper! London Underground (walking) Southwark Tube - 2 minutes Waterloo - 10 minutes London Bridge - 10 minutes BUSES! Buses are great! We highly recommend the RV1, which goes from outside the front door. One way goes to London Eye, Houses of Parliament, and Covent Garden, the other way goes to Borough Market, London Bridge, Tower Bridge and Tower of London. It's a cheap bus too! You'll need an Oyster card to travel around London, or a credit or debit card with contactless payment. Or maybe even mobile phone payments. Either way, buses don't take cash anymore.
access: You get the entire place to yourselves including our roof terrace (table and chairs for your morning coffee or outdoor dining if weather permits - but do be careful on the stairs !) with views of skyline and passing trains! There's secure access to the building.
interaction: We will mostly arrange for you to check yourselves in. If you need an early check-in or late check-out then please contact us before booking. If we really can't help then the Tate Modern (very close) has a free luggage store which opens at 10am. We are able to provide two set of keys.
house_rules: - Please respect our neighbours and don't play loud music after 10pm. No smoking in the property. Please take shoes off inside the house. No parties or gatherings. Please treat the apartment like you would your own home.

name: Victorian modernised house in Greenwich
summary: A modernised showroom house that has been re-styled and planned to suit modern living.
space: The property is a brand-new showroom house and never been habited.  For this reason it is partly furnished, as indicated in the photos.  Use of the kitchen is fridge/freezer, microwave oven and dishwasher only. Quick mandatory inspections may be taking place on weekly basis.  Ground Floor:  Entrance hallway leads to front reception through to the extended kitchen/diner and beyond the bi-fold doors to the landscaped garden. A WC is positioned adjacent to the kitchen.   First floor: it comprises three double bedrooms, a contemporary fitted bathroom, benefitting from a shower over the bath.  Loft room: with breathtaking panoramic views across London and the Docklands from the bespoke windows, this bright space offers a generous double bedroom, en suite with a high spec shower suite.

All areas of the house are accessible by guests. The hosts are available for information on email and phone. Victoria Way
neighborhood_overview: Victoria Way is a sought after residential street located in the heart of Charlton, neighbouring the famed Charlton Slopes, well placed for access to transport links into London and local amenities at The Village. For local shopping, The Village has a supermarket, pubs and convenience stores whilst the nearby Blackheath Royal Standard has a wide range of shops including banks and Marks & Spencer. The lower road (Woolwich Road) is home to a retail park including Frankie & Benny's restaurant, a Sainsbury's, large scale Marks & Spencer and many existing fashion and retail outlets. Charlton is within the Royal Borough of Greenwich, renowned for its green open spaces. Within close proximity to Victoria Way is Charlton House, a Jacobean Mansion house with its grounds forming Charlton Park. Charlton sits to the east of Greenwich and Blackheath, also famed for their open parkland and popular night spots with both offering a vast range of restaurants and bars, only a short walk or cab ride away
notes: The property is a showroom and not habited, and thus needs to be kept clean and tidy at all times; no shoes indoors, frequent ventilation and use of the kitchen is fridge/freezer microwave and dishwasher only. A quick mandatory inspection should be allowed for weekly or longer stays.  Scheduled viewing is likely to take place upon notice and with agreement and arrangement with the guests. Toiletries, towels, sheets will be provided and any kitchenware upon your request. transit: Charlton Rail Station is the nearest, taking advantage of fast trains into town with connections via Greenwich, London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross. Greenwich and Woolwich Arsenal also have the DLR whilst the nearby North Greenwich Underground station is only a short bus ride away (one stop into Canary Wharf).

host_about:
Hi there. 
I am a kinda of young (32) Italian Doctor, I currently live and work in London. I have previously worked in Italy, then Spain. 
I love traveling, meeting new people, sharing my little experiences and spending time listening amazing  stories of people who love to tell their life to others. 
I have always thought that one life is not enough to discover the world. 
But there is a solution: we need to share! 
That's the best way we have to be everyday a different person, in a different country, walking a different path.
I love running, jumping, I love the sun, my boyfriend and the sound of the sea..I love my family and my patients. 
That's briefly me ;)

name: Room in friendly house
summary: This is a friendly place and visitors from all places and backgrounds are welcome.  It is very central (10 min walk from the Piccadilly line + 10 minutes tube ride to Kings cross station). It is also an end of terrace house with only trees next to it, no street noise to be heard. Please read the additional information regarding works going on in the house. I'm looking forward to meeting you if this sounds like the kind of place you'd feel welcome in.
space: As you may have noticed, the price is extremely affordable and there is a reason for it that is important to keep in mind. I bought the place recently and am doing it up. This means that there will be works going on in  the house during daytime. The house provides the basics but is not looking its bets yet. If you are looking for a friendly place to stay with a garden and centrally located and you are happy to trade in some not quite finished decor for an affordable price, than this is the place for you.
description: This is a friendly place and visitors from all places and backgrounds are welcome.  It is very central (10 min walk from the Piccadilly line + 10 minutes tube ride to Kings cross station). It is also an end of terrace house with only trees next to it, no street noise to be heard. Please read the additional information regarding works going on in the house. I'm looking forward to meeting you if this sounds like the kind of place you'd feel welcome in. As you may have noticed, the price is extremely affordable and there is a reason for it that is important to keep in mind. I bought the place recently and am doing it up. This means that there will be works going on in  the house during daytime. The house provides the basics but is not looking its bets yet. interaction: I'm a friendly person and will be happy to make you feel welcome in the way that suits you (by socializing or giving you space)
host_about:
Hi, My name is Jessica and I tend to travel frequently for work and pleasure. I've recently discovered airbnb and think it's a brilliant idea as beside the good value for money, you get the chance to meet some locals and house owners can make use of their otherwise unused rooms.
I'm 32 years old, work as a product manager for (Hidden by Airbnb) and enjoy meeting new people and discovering new places. Feel free to ask me any questions you might have about me.
